Name: Gabin
ProfileText:
ÔªøHi!
This is a dating doc, I‚Äôm a 25 year old Swiss man, my native language is French, and‚Ä¶


Beauty, art, weirdness


There are a lot of things that make me feel intense emotions.


There is this feeling of awe, like when you‚Äôre walking at night in a snowy mountain, the sun still highlighting the horizon from below, and the sky is full of dark clouds, everything is so visually intense and so quiet at the same time. Or more commonly, just laying on the grass, watching this miniature world, with miniature rules, thinking about the life of each strand of grass. Or at a cafe, observing all the elegant patterns of the light going through the glass. Or lizards on a wall, absolutely immobile, and then disappearing in a tiny crack in an instant.


But I think that I mostly feel intense emotions through art. Books, movies, series, video games, sometimes paintings, music, check out my list! If I had one choice for each section, I would say:
Book: Alice‚Äôs Adventures in Wonderland
Movie: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Series: Over the Garden Wall
Video game: Journey
Melancholia works great on me, and generally weird, mysterious, whimsical universes.


If it‚Äôs weird, it‚Äôs better. I‚Äôm very much attracted to surprising people, crazy art, and unusual experiences. I hope to experience a large part of the spectrum of non-painful qualias, like eating in complete darkness, drawing with my feet, exploring a cave, standing in an anechoic chamber. But I also like normal stuff, like sunsets and snow.


Rationality, knowledge


I‚Äôm very attached to thinking and saying true things, and I get annoyed when people don‚Äôt seem to put a lot of value in truth. I aspire to be rational and to not let emotions lead me astray. I also value honesty a lot in relationships. That doesn‚Äôt mean I will say things that will harm people just for the sake of it, but I will need a good reason to lie to them when they ask me something. I don‚Äôt use honesty as an excuse to not care about the impact of words on the people around me, I understand why people lie sometimes, radical honesty is not always the way.


Knowledge rules. The world is fascinating, and I want to know everything. But in practice I‚Äôm mostly interested in art, mathematics, sexuality, cognition, and most sciences really. It‚Äôs often the case that I get very interested in a topic and I really really want to share it with other people. Sometimes intellectual insights make me jump up and down in excitement (it can also happen with art). I‚Äôll probably try to explain abstract math theorems at some point to you, I cannot help it, if I‚Äôm too annoying you can hit me with a broomstick until I flee with the white board.


Humans, people, anxiety, connections


I often fear that people dislike me and think bad things about me. That‚Äôs why I love moments of transcendence of my own head and limitations. When I stop believing that I‚Äôm essentially alone and disconnected from other people. When I dance randomly in a room full of other people, and for a moment every thought has disappeared. When I participate in a cuddle puddle. When we‚Äôre laying down and watching the stars. When for a moment there‚Äôs no ego anymore, and I feel like finally I‚Äôm really living a moment with other human beings. I yearn for vulnerable, deep connections. Videos like these make me tear up.


It is hard for me to be socially vulnerable, to express what I feel for other people, if they don‚Äôt do it first. I have a fear of rejection. I‚Äôm working on it. At the same time, it is easy for me to talk about my emotions as long as they don‚Äôt really concern the person I‚Äôm talking to. I don‚Äôt see emotions as shameful. I‚Äôm very attuned to my emotions and know most of the time where my emotions come from.


My gender is male, but I‚Äôm not particularly afraid of trying activities or things usually associated with femininity (currently trying pole dance, it‚Äôs hard). I get along well with queer people.


Ethics, positive impact, being a good person


I want to have a positive impact on the world. I try to be a good person and a lot of my thoughts are about ethics. I‚Äôm deeply concerned about all the suffering happening right now, and at the end of my life, I hope to be proud of all the pain I‚Äôve prevented. I feel a strong duty to help as much as I can.


I feel a lot of empathy for all animals and I am vegan, and the fact that most of the human population doesn‚Äôt care makes me often sad. I have friends who are not vegetarian, but it is hard for me to get really close to someone who still eats other animals.


Hobbies, activities


* ü™® Sport
I do bouldering each week, and I‚Äôm trying other sports (these days, it‚Äôs yoga, taekwondo, slackline). I‚Äôm also starting to do contemporary dance and pole dance, I want to dance more!
* üé≠ Theater
I‚Äôve been part of multiple theater groups, I really enjoy acting.
* üõ∑ Games
Playing is great, be it board games, theater-like activities, sledding.
* ü§ì Nerd stuff
Coding, playing hard puzzle games, reading Wikipedia pages, solving 4D rubik‚Äôs cubes, thinking about mathematical or philosophical questions, juggling.
* ‚úçÔ∏è Writing
I enjoy writing small stories and journaling, mostly in french.
* ü•ò Cooking
I like to try new recipes. Doesn‚Äôt always pan out.


I drink very little alcohol, I‚Äôve never been drunk and I hope it stays that way. I don‚Äôt drink coffee or tea. I could almost say that I haven‚Äôt tried any drugs, and I‚Äôm definitely not the risk seeking type, but I am interested in trying some psychedelic drugs and seeing weird fractals.


Romantic relationship


How am I in a romantic relationship? I‚Äôm not entirely sure, I had only one serious romantic relationship in my life. But I am considerate and caring, I enjoy doing small things to make the other person feel loved. I‚Äôm very cuddly. I enjoy holding hands. I really dislike fights, and an ‚Äúintense‚Äù relationship with a lot of disputes and reconciliations is not for me. I think I‚Äôm good at recognising my mistakes and I haven‚Äôt received many complaints of the contrary in my life. Lots of talking about emotions. I hope to do a lot of activities with you, and that we share our hobbies.


In a relationship, I would prefer not to spend all our free time together, but other than that I‚Äôm flexible, especially for a polyamorous relationship. For a monogamous relationship, it would be great to see each other on average at least once a week. I could move to another country if we are a really great fit.


Polyamory or closed relationship? I agree with polyamory on principle and find it compelling, but I‚Äôve never been in a polyamorous relationship before, so I‚Äôm open to both types of relationships.


Previous romantic relationships and why they stopped


As I said, I only had one serious romantic relationship in my life, from when I was 16 to 24 years old. We broke up mainly because our values changed, our vision of life was too different. She didn‚Äôt want to become vegetarian, and it was very important for her to travel a lot, something I don‚Äôt enjoy much. Also probably just the general chemistry diminished with time. We didn‚Äôt have a big fight or anything, we still had a lot of affection for each other, and we cooked some pasta together after breaking up. We are still on good terms.


Complaints from my previous partner:


* Too cold, rational, not particularly in the relationship, but in my vision of the world, of other people, of how the world works
* Sometimes I didn‚Äôt give enough attention to her, missed mood signals, because I was too focused on something (that‚Äôs fair, when I‚Äôm thinking about an abstract problem, it can be hard for me to get back to the real world. It‚Äôs hard for me to switch from deep focus to something else quickly)
* I didn‚Äôt seem to project myself in the future with her


Sexuality


In my whole life, I had only 3 different sexual partners, so I would not say that I‚Äôm very experienced and I‚Äôm still exploring my preferences. I have a medium high sex drive, I‚Äôm not very kinky, though I‚Äôm open to try new stuff and I‚Äôd be happy to discover your kinks. I‚Äôm fascinated by human sexuality. If you are asexual, that‚Äôs fine as long as you are okay with me having sex with other people.


Career


I just  finished my Master‚Äôs degree in mathematics in February. I‚Äôm not very ambitious when it comes to my career, I‚Äôm not particularly interested in climbing up the golden ladder of power in a firm, or founding my own company and getting insanely rich. Most of what makes my life valuable is found outside of a job for me. If there were no pressing problems that need some fixing in the world, I would just aim for an interesting job that would give me enough money to be comfortable and allow me to pursue my little hobbies and side activities in my free time. But the world, as you know, is a mess, so I guess I‚Äôll see what I can do. I‚Äôm actively working on what to do career-wise and there are a lot of options, but I also want to put this doc online so I don‚Äôt have more information to give you right now.


What I look like


I‚Äôm very thin at 56 kg and 176 cm in height, but I got some muscles from bouldering.


Me saying hi to a tree:


  



Me with a wet butt after sledding:


  



Rehearsing the Mousetrap:


  



Cool bouldering event with black lights and fluorescent paint:


  



I sound very serious in this document, but in real life I look more like this:


  



What I find attractive


I‚Äôm very attracted to bright, curious, bubbly, passionate personalities. Intelligence is hot. I had crushes on people with a lot of different body types in my life, so not an important criterion. I‚Äôm mostly attracted to people who present femininely or between feminine and non-binary. I‚Äôm at 0.5 on the Kinsey scale. Your age doesn't really matter, as long as you are an adult.


Don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out!


Deal breakers for me


I‚Äôll just list things that are possible for someone who would read my description above and still be interested.


* You are not almost vegetarian.
Except if you steal the meat you eat, of course. Also, maybe it‚Äôs ok for mussels, because they have a low probability of being sentient? I don‚Äôt have a strong opinion on that.
* You have low compassion.
* You want to have kids with me.
It‚Äôs not a problem if you want/have kids with other people. I thought a lot about if I wanted to have kids or not, and I decided to give meaning to my life in other ways.


Testimonies from friends


Asked some friends if they wanted to write something, they had complete freedom, I left everything as it was written.


This guy is a magician when it comes down to curry, he can transform any basic ingredients into the most delicious curry!! - Antoine
(I think Antoine just really likes curry.)


Gabou, The Gabs, Gabin,
Before seeing him I always know it will be great because spending time with him doesn‚Äôt require any energy, it‚Äôs fun, easy, interesting and with lots of hugs haha (I also love hugs oups). It‚Äôs a person who I never felt bad asking any questions because even on subjects he knows much better than you (e.g. mathematics) he doesn‚Äôt judge (you know there isn‚Äôt that small corner smile some people do which make you feel like shit(I hate it)) it feels super natural, and the answer is often helpful (thanks again Gabin for that machine learning class).
Even if he is quite stubborn on some subjects, he (at least from my experience) listens to other people's points of view and tries to understand it (especially if it‚Äôs well sourced with rational arguments x)). However, we agree on most things so that must help. Also it‚Äôs quite easy to have deep and interesting conversations with him.
I feel like it‚Äôs important for Gabin to try to be a better person, and that he can realize his mistakes when he makes some.
There are plenty of other things but Gabin describes himself better than I do so I will stop here.
Have a nice day/evening/night - Ariane <3


A cool kid, faster than light,
Surrender now or face the fight!
A cool kid, shining like a star,
Give it up or taste the war! - Louis

Name: Callum
ProfileText:
ÔªøIn as many words


To love and be loved.


What I'm looking for


A deeper understanding and a genuine human connection. 


A relationship which should last a lifetime, and children, who I would like to see grow old.


A bit about me


I've probably done all of my imbibing, but when I do, I tend to have a cigarette. I don't do drugs. I like walking and running, and I'm thankful for my health. I can drive, but don't. I'll be moving into a home I'll actually own sometime in the future.


I'm learning to play the piano and hope to become quite proficient at it. I cook a lot, and don't mind vegetables in the slightest. I'm fascinated by physics, yet barely understand. I believe consciousness is a lot like a colour - entirely subjective.


Can't survive without music: Floating Points, R√≥is√≠n Murphy, Daniel Avery, HAIM, Kelly Lee Owens, HAAi, Ezra Collective, Lee Bong Geun, Mozart.


Reading: Tom Robbins, David Mitchell, Iain Reid, Phillip K. Dick, Cixin Liu, Haruki Murakami.


Film: Wes Anderson. And his complementary polar, Roy Andersson. Luc Besson, Guillermo del Toro, Coen brothers.


TV: Mad Men, The Office (only seen American), The Good Place, Gogglebox, Big Brother.


What I'm looking for


A woman of the world. Who has a real flair - instruments, languages, knowledge, conversation. Who blossoms rather shies away. An assuredness in herself - and I certainly don't want to be in competition! I'd prefer it if we talked with one another, and that we did this more than we talked about one another.


A lot more important than all of that, is a load of love and care.


I haven't exactly had an easy time in this world. I wouldn't want to dwell, but I've missed a lot of the joy and happiness. So to be reminded of such is a real treasure for me.


A bit more about me


I find it difficult to do some of the social aspects - which everyone else seems to be able to do - such as, to keep on top/point with the collective discussion; or find the relative clause with the fulcrum in a conversation. I'd probably be a bit better at it if there weren't the games, though. I haven't been diagnosed with autism.


I'm a bit of a realist, swaying towards the negative, but idealistic. ‚Äî An empire is only in a mind! ‚Äî A pensive deliberator, holistic narrator, where the only aim is to make sense and better understand. Physics is literally everything‚Ä¶


The funniest part about physics is that it's not magic.


I'm not that serious! I flunk every test, simply because I can‚Ä¶ If I'm being told, I need to ask‚Ä¶ I'm about as competitive as a wet sock... 


I hate conflict, but, even still, I could argue until the end of time - I just don't see the point! I don't hold any deep-seated beliefs - about this, or that. I think it's healthy to formulate an opinion, and especially, to care. I'm tired by the general discourse. Politics is literally everything‚Ä¶


Only when humankind brings to an end the endeavour for prosperity, and instead works for the good of humanity, shall we truly prosper and realise wealth.


Or, as I see it, today...


When everyone is fooling everyone, everyone is a fool.


Dreams and aspirations


A job is a job for me. When I dream about my ideal home, it'd be supportive and positive. Lots of time for one another.


A relationship needs to be tender. I have endless patience, care and concern for the right woman.


A side note


We are no more intelligent than, even our earliest ancestors, we simply know more. Our evolution benefits from cooperation, as much as competition, if not more so by cooperation.


I feel, if you spend enough time with a person, you get to know one another, becoming forgiving, inclined, adaptable, agreeable, aligned and assured by them. You grow around one another, in any relationship, community, team, job and life. I'd only hope that we grow together.

breakup and living in the Bay, which means it‚Äôs time to write a Date Me Doc. My goal for this document is to help my friends matchmake for me, or to give you the information to decide whether you‚Äôre interested.
I Am‚Ä¶
#
A 27-year old man.
Heteroflexible.
My fuzzy attraction cluster in person-space centers on cis women and AFAB enbies, but doesn't rule out trans men or women. It doesn't contain cis men; I hope to bi-hack eventually but I'm not currently trying.
Polyamorous, and it‚Äôs important to me.
Based in Vallejo, CA (north of Berkeley).
An old-school rationalist ‚Äì I do most of my socializing with the rationalist community in Berkeley.
5'9" and 235 lbs
at the time of writing.
I'm rapidly losing weight thanks to tirzepatide. Last updated: 2025-02-16

Interesting conversation and fun outings.

for you.

nerdy

to

I‚Äôm open-minded and novelty-seeking in general.
I‚Äôve traveled to 18 countries.
I‚Äôve eaten some weird food ‚Äì I think rooster testicles top the list.
I‚Äôve tried many drugs and intend to try more.
I give great advice, according to my friends.
You Shouldn‚Äôt Date Me Because‚Ä¶
#
I‚Äôm still
in love with my ex.
She's my best friend and has been since well before we started dating. I've done enough emotional processing since the breakup to stop fixating on getting back together with her as a romantic partner, but I expect she'll always have a piece of my heart.
I‚Äôm unemployed and live with my dad, although I‚Äôm working on remedying that.
My job search is keeping me busy so I have limited free time.
I‚Äôll Probably Be Into You If‚Ä¶

We‚Äôre already friends.
You love to cuddle.
You enjoy strategy games, especically Magic.
Your hair is short and/or unnaturally colored.
Cool tattoos are also a good sign.
You one-box in Newcomb‚Äôs Problem.
You like hallucinogens.

Name: Mike
ProfileText:
ÔªøMike‚Äôs Date-Me Doc




Hi, thanks for checking out my date-me doc! My name's Mike, and I'm trying to meet the right person to settle down with. If you think we might be a good match, please send me an email at mikest@udel.edu.






Basic Info
* Age: 31
* Height: 6'0 (183 cm)
* Looking for: Monogamous relationship, interested in women.
* Location: Philadelphia, PA. Open to moving anywhere within the US, but probably not internationally. Open to a long-distance relationship in the short-term, as long as the plan is to eventually settle down in the same location.
* GIANT RED FLAG: I was previously married and it didn‚Äôt work out, so we ended it on good terms. Completely understand if this is a dealbreaker for some people.






Career / Hobbies / Interests
* I currently work as a computational biologist at a research lab at UPenn. Basically get paid to work on interesting problems all day, so it's pretty cool. But part of me kinda wants to be building something rather than doing purely academic research, so I may eventually try to switch over to biotech.
* Outside of work, one of my favorite hobbies is teaching. For example:
   * I have an educational Youtube channel with tutorial videos about computational biology and programming.
   * I sometimes teach in-person classes at Fractal University, a cool community-based proto-university in NYC. (I‚Äôm also trying to start something similar in the Philly area.) 
   * Also, sometimes people ask me to teach Python-for-Biologists workshops, and I'm happy to do this for free. For example, I recently taught a 6-hour virtual workshop for a university in Pakistan that invited me. 
   * I‚Äôm partly doing this just for fun, but it‚Äôs also part of a broader interest in alternative, non-traditional education. I basically agree with all the usual criticisms of the current education system, but I also have this Chesterton‚Äôs-fence-esque belief that you shouldn't knock down an institution until you‚Äôve successfully built something better to replace it (which might be harder than it sounds).
* Besides teaching for fun, I also like learning for fun. I especially like to learn how things work from scratch (like neural nets, statistical tests, market economies, compilers, or computers).
* I like a lot of the usual ACX / LessWrong / rationalist stuff, for example:
   * Some public thinkers I find interesting (though don't 100% agree with all the time): Scott Alexander, Eliezer Yudkowsky, Julia Galef, Aella, Dwarkesh Patel, Bryan Caplan, Tyler Cowen, Robin Hanson, Sam Harris
   * Some topics I find interesting: prediction markets, forecasting, machine learning, decision theory, probability brain teasers, meta-science
* Other hobbies: 
   * running / fitness
   * watching movies (especially horror / thrillers / mysteries)
   * walking around (could be a hike or exploring a city)
   * weekend roadtrips
   * playing guitar. I used to play saxophone too, and kinda want to get back into that.






Beliefs and Values
* Political views: Center-right. Classical liberalism, markets, civil liberties, freedom of speech, science, secularism, entrepreneurship, techno-optimism, etc. libertarian-ish, but closer to Tyler Cowen than Ron Paul. 
* Religious views: agnostic/atheist, but not hardcore about it. somewhat "culturally Christian." open to raising kids in a religious tradition if it means a lot to you.
* Vegetarian (it's fine if you're not though)
* Things I agree with effective altruists about: malaria prevention, effective giving, animal welfare, etc.
* Things I disagree with effective altruists about: AI risk/benefit
* ^ I try not to be too preachy or argumentative about any of these things, and am certainly open to dating people who don't share these views.






About You (Hopefully)
* Someone who‚Äôs interested in a serious, monogamous relationship and eventually settling down together. I‚Äôm not really looking for casual dating or hookups.
* Someone who‚Äôs interested in having kids. Ideally I‚Äôd like to have at least 2 kids (because it‚Äôs nice to have a sibling), and am open to having more if you‚Äôd like.
* Someone who‚Äôs kind, gentle, caring, honest.
* ^ I almost wrote ‚Äúintelligent‚Äù here but that‚Äôs actually not the right word. Maybe ‚Äúthoughtful‚Äù or ‚Äúcurious about the world.‚Äù I don‚Äôt really care how you score on an IQ test, but I‚Äôm looking for someone who enjoys learning new things, exploring new ideas, and engaging with different viewpoints in good faith. 
* Other than that, I‚Äôm not sure what else to write here. Part of me thinks it would be cool to find someone who shares the same interests as me so that we could nerd out together, maybe teach classes together, learn together, work on projects together. But another part of me thinks it would be cool to meet someone completely different from me, like an artist or poet, so that we could share our different worlds with each other.
* If you think we might be a good match, please send me an email at mikest@udel.edu!








Some Pics


  





  





  







  

Disclaimer: this pic is kinda old (2019?). It‚Äôs from back when I used to be in the Coast Guard.






If you want to see more of what I look like, there are a bunch of videos of me on Youtube

Name: Brad Levin
ProfileText:
ÔªøBrad Levin‚Äôs Dating Profile[1]
Last updated: Feb 2025
About Me
Basics
I‚Äôm a straight man, poly, 41, living in Sunnyvale, California, half the time with my 7 and 8 year-old children and the other half solo.
Work
I‚Äôm a product manager at Google in HR information systems, been there for 8 years; Yahoo and Silicon Valley Bank before that (check out LinkedIn for my deets).
  
  
  
  
  
  

A few selections from recent years; more on Facebook. 
Why date me?
-Friends describe me as caring, a good listener, energetic, creative, fun, supportive, and reliable 
-Romantic partners have mentioned touch and my proactive communication about tough/vulnerable issues
-Values alignment if effective altruism, fitness, family, and lifelong learning are important to you
-We could go to musicals, concerts, performances, conferences, and travel together
Dating partner must haves
-Bay area-local
-Female
-------------------------------------- Nice-to-haves section -------------------------------------- 
If basics are enough for you, stop reading now and skip to the Connect with Me section below. If not, feel free to peruse these nice-to-haves: I‚Äôm sharing so the particularly curious have a more informed idea of me as a potential dating partner.
What I‚Äôm looking for
I‚Äôm mostly looking for a primary partner, but am open to other structures.  You can find more detail on my OKC and Plura profiles; including excerpts below. 
Also: what I want may change! I‚Äôm open to the possibility of meeting someone great who has in mind a different type of relationship. I also recognize people often don‚Äôt know exactly what they want in a relationship, including me. 
Children
I don‚Äôt want to father additional children, but am open to dating a woman who already has them. 
I‚Äôm open to a long-term romantic partner taking an active role in my children‚Äôs lives, but I‚Äôm not seeking that involvement (I‚Äôve been divorced several years and my parenting status quo is working well). 
Dating radius
It's so juicy when the two people dating are proximal! Since I'm not willing to drive farther, I try hard to date folks who live within 20 or so minutes from me in Sunnyvale (or have an unusual situation, e.g. work nearby or don't mind driving to my place disproportionately).
Age
28‚Äì49 years old (though this isn‚Äôt a strict range)
Living together
I‚Äôm open to and interested in cohabitating with a primary partner, but that‚Äôs not a dealbreaker. 
Outdoors
My favorite outdoor activity is tennis, though I also love swimming and frisbee and basketball and frequently run, walk, kayak, and hike outdoors.
Books
Currently reading:
-Untamed by Glennon Doyle
-Polysecure by Jessica Fern
-What we owe the future, by William MacAskill
More Details
People close to me have recognized that I‚Äôm especially: (i) curious‚Äîabout the big picture and systems and ideas, (ii) highly organized, (iii) trustworthy, and (iv) sensitive. Myers-Briggs from years ago): ENTJ. Top 5 CliftonStrengths: Harmony, Discipline, Learner, Consistency, Achiever.
üö©Red flags for primary partners üö©:
1. Pseudoscientific beliefs, e.g. in astrology, manifesting, crystals, non-physics ‚Äúenergy‚Äù
2. Criticize often 
3. Perennially late and forgetful
What‚Äôs most important to me; unlikely to change:
* My commitment to parenting
* Involvement in effective altruism (since 2011)
* Staying healthy, e.g. through regular exercise, decent diet, and taking mental health seriously
* Social involvement , e.g. hosting events with friends and community
* Non-religious
* Intellectual pursuits: consuming and discussing podcasts, books, articles, and news
Ideal partner
I completed a relationship workshop that resulted in clarity about what I'm curious/interested (but not in any way expecting) to experience in an anchor romantic partnership. I'll list below some of that clarity; however, due to some feedback I received from a couple female friends, I've now updated this intro paragraph to make sure nobody reads the below as a list of requirements or expectations of a potential partner (which it is definitely not). Please consider the below as predilections and preferences, rather than a checklist of must-haves!
A) Acceptance of my non-monogamy.
For me to feel like I fully belong in the relationship, I've learned it's critical that my partner openly accepts me having multiple simultaneous romantic relationships, and that I retain the autonomy to pursue new ones.
B) Attraction/chemistry.
I am huge into touch, value sleeping together (in the literal sense), and love doing erotic stuff.
C) Perception that we're close peers.
This one took a lot of work to develop/unwind/discover in the workshop, and though I've learned it's important for me I'm still not yet sure why. In any case, what does "close peers" mean for me? Here's my best articulation, in five points; many of the examples derive from experiences in my own life and illustrate similar life experiences or attributes I seek in a partner.
"Close peer" #1: Overachiever. Doesn't much matter in what domain - maybe you're an elite gamer, or excel in fitness classes, or a director where you work, or finished your doctorate while founding a company, or pioneered a popular new form of tarot card therapy (yes I've encountered that latter ü§£).
"Close peer" #2: Leader. This might look like you teaching the class, running the workshop, organizing the campaign, driving the process change. Or that you lead by following, e.g. influencing others to put a full effort into the workout, modeling an innovative collaborative learning approach in the classroom that other students adopt, taking the meditation lesson to heart, signing the Giving Pledge and posting it in your house for others to follow.
"Close peer" #3: Wild. The freedom and power that comes from intentionally breaking a significant social rule, then thriving afterward. Perhaps you left a religion, risked your education by standing up for something unpopular, exited monogamy, or something comparably high-stakes that risked enduring family or social rejection or job loss.
"Close peer" #4: Seasoned. The maturity that comes from enduring a few hard knocks. Maybe you grew up in a household that lacked food security, or your baby died, or you weathered a disability you found difficult, or a parent neglected you.
"Close peer" #5: Mentally healthy. You regularly have more spoons than you need to make it through the day, and are more often than not positive and open and emotionally available.
-Someone recently asked me to describe "my tribe." I haven't found mine yet: but an overachieving altruist that wants to overachievingly altruist a bit harder as a result of their primary relationship, sounds like a kindred spirit to me.
Expectations
-I've learned that I expect roughly equal participation when it comes to the work of initiating, planning, and organizing. That means voicing the time and place and activity of proposed dates, initiating touch, proposing dinner plans, etc. should be shared roughly equally (rather than the male doing the disproportionate labor in these areas, as is the norm in heterosexual dating). This also applies to the vulnerable work of initiating the relationship conversations that are needed for a healthy relationship.
-I've also learned that my communication style merits calling out, since I have a particular approach that I've found perturbs some, while prompting others to offer kudos. My approach is this: I try to match the communication mode to the importance of the subject. To illustrate, let's say you're texting me with concerns about where we ate dinner last night. I will try to elevate the mode of communication to something real-time such as a phone call, video chat, or in-person discussion. I might even (gasp!) call you in response to your text.
In general, the more that feelings are involved or the stakes are high, the more I'll advocate to elevate the mode of communication (text < call < vid chat < in person). My reasoning is: the communication modes higher up the chain offer richer understanding since they include some or all of tone, pace, the opportunity to clarify, more words, pauses (and their absence), facial cues, and the accountability of a real-time conversation. This means fewer assumptions and more information, which I believe improves the odds of the desired twins of communication: (1) understanding and (2) being understood.
The downside is this approach requires hopping on a call, which some find less comfortable than texting, and can require a modicum of scheduling or driving to the partner, which texting doesn't. Know that for subjects like relationship status and where concerns are involved, I expect the conversation to be real-time, and I will engage using that mode where feasible.
Connect With Me
If you‚Äôd like to get to know me better or just have something to say to me after reading this, feel free to Facebook message or email me.
Share With Someone
Link to share easily: bit.ly/dateBrad
________________
[1] A hat tip to Gina, whose bit.ly/dategina provided much of the structure and ideas you see above (used w/permission). Thanks Gina!

Name: Julie M
ProfileText:
ÔªøHello Internet!


My name is Julie. I‚Äôm 39 years old (which honestly feels very old to type and not representative of how old I feel at all!). I moved to Sacramento a few years ago by way of Brooklyn and San Francisco before then. I have a 4 year old dog named Bailey (see pictures below). I work remotely for a startup in NYC where I am the Director of People Operations (like a more fun version of saying ‚ÄúHR.‚Äù) All of my immediate family lives here in Sac and I am really enjoying being close to them after years of living further away. This picture is of my sister (on the right) and I (in black on the left).  


I am very happy and have a full life with deep relationships with my family members, long time friends, and colleagues, all who enrich my life. My friends and family would describe me as smart, funny, warm, deeply empathetic, and cheerful. I am very independent and am not creating this doc because I desperately need a man. I am here because I‚Äôd like to find someone who will bring something to our relationship -- and I will do the same.


I am a democrat. I would like to date someone who shares similar political views. I don‚Äôt have children, and am not interested in having children, although I am more than fine dating someone who does have kids. I am a very proud auntie to several of my friend‚Äôs children. I‚Äôm godmother to my cousin‚Äôs son. 
  

I travel a fair amount for either work or fun. My most recent international travel has been: India, Switzerland, and Mexico. (Picture is me with my friends/coworkers at a wedding in Mexico)


For fun, I enjoy hanging out with my dog, going on walks in new areas, and taking her to training classes. She may be 4, but she is stubborn! I enjoy going to trivia nights, trying new restaurants, watching classic movies, long walks, exploring new places, exercise, baseball games, bowling, cooking/baking, etc.


Deal Breakers for me and/or you:
* I don‚Äôt smoke, and wouldn‚Äôt be compatible with a smoker.   
* I drink occasionally, but not very much. 
* I work what I call ‚ÄúLazy east coast hours‚Äù meaning I start work between 6 and 7 am. As a result, I don‚Äôt stay out late, and I'm in bed early. 
* I don‚Äôt drink coffee, but love the bliss tea at Temple. 
* I am not active or addicted to social media. I have an instagram that I have not posted on since circa 2019. I don‚Äôt have tiktok. I‚Äôm not influencing anything. 
* I spend most of my day working in front of the computer and don‚Äôt like to spend my time outside of work on my computer or phone. As a result, I am not the kind of person who texts back immediately. I get to it when I have time, unless of course it‚Äôs urgent.


What I‚Äôm looking for:
   * A man in a similar age range (probably 35-50) who‚Äôs looking to meet another person and really get to know her - ie, you‚Äôre dating with the intention of finding ‚Äúyour person.‚Äù  
   * A man who‚Äôs passionate/enthusiastic about life.
   * Someone who‚Äôs career driven
   * Doesn‚Äôt smoke
   * Not a heavy drinker
   * Not a big partier (aren‚Äôt those days behind us?)
   * Someone who cares about family
   * Low ego/humble
   * Kind
   * Patient


Sound like you? Email me: jlmccollo@gmail.com

Name: Ja
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate Me - Ja




Someone inspired me to write this.


It feels strange writing something like this for strangers to read, but it‚Äôs a bit better than a dating profile that lacks so much information and results in perhaps not the best decision making.


If you find any of this a tad interesting then please reach out and perhaps we can get to know each other in person.


This doc is a work in progress




About Me


  



Gender: Male
Location: Watford, UK
Year of birth: 1987
Height: 5ft 9
Ethnicity: East Asian
Sexual orientation: Straight - looking for a woman
Location: London, UK
Languages: English, Mandarin
Attachment style : Fairly secure, tendency to be anxious.
Love languages: Favourites are acts of service, physical touch, quality time. But to be fair, I respond well to all of them.


I was born in China and moved to the UK when I was little.
We moved around a few times in my childhood and I‚Äôd say it shaped me quite a lot. There are positives and negatives to this and I feel that slowly I‚Äôm experiencing more of the positives than I did as a child and young adult.
All of my education has been in the UK so I‚Äôm quite a mix of cultures, but I see that as an adult I‚Äôm probably more British (if I had to lean a particular way) than Chinese given my environment and social group. With that said, I always felt a bit of an outsider - quite introverted, very different home life compared to my peers at school, one life at home and a completely different life outside of home - things felt a bit disjointed.


Life situation:
* I work in marketing and recently went freelance (again) - it‚Äôs busy - I work from home
* I‚Äôm a homeowner (and recent cat owner - yes, she‚Äôs very cute, and yes she‚Äôs occasionally a menace)
* I can drive and have a car
* I can get into all of central London in less than an hour
* I don‚Äôt smoke or take drugs - I tend to be a minimalist when it comes to 
* I only drink socially and occasionally - recently I‚Äôve been not drinking at all due to a meditation programme I‚Äôm preparing for (March 2025)


  







What I‚Äôm like


What inspires me
* People who care about others
* People who work for something greater than themselves
* People who are willing to surrender to life and allow


I am not saying I aspire to be all of these things, but they certainly inspire me


What I enjoy
* One-on-one conversations with my friends, and the occasional stranger.
* Cooking and eating - especially if other people are involved.
* Going on hikes, cycling, camping, going up mountains, road trips, natural environments.
* I love the Scottish Highland, and Edinburgh (very happy childhood memories).
* I‚Äôve recently rehomed a cat called Mura - she‚Äôs cute and an occasional menace. So, now I‚Äôm a cat person in the making. I had a hamster as a kid but it didn‚Äôt really like me and I wasn‚Äôt too fond of him either so that doesn‚Äôt really count.  
* I enjoy conversations about the future, technology, life, what we‚Äôve learnt about ourselves, other people‚Äôs stories.        


  



My personality (at least my blind-spot ridden perspective of it)
   * Ambivert - quite happy in my own space in peace and quiet, but totally down for being sociable with the right crowd. I tend to be quiet rather than needing to be vocal by default.
   * I‚Äôm very close to a handful of friends. I feel blessed to have such friends and they are like family to me.
   * I don‚Äôt enjoy small talk most of the time but when it‚Äôs about getting to know someone new then it can be fun too to begin with.
   * I‚Äôm a dreamer. Perhaps I‚Äôm ADHD - I‚Äôm not sure. I daydream all the time (perhaps very compulsively) about everything. Business ideas, people and relationships, ways to improve the NHS, why my cat behaves the way she does, what a conversation meant several years ago, whether we can have a viable economy based on currency that has another dimension of value attached to it, about meditation and yoga practices, about the nature of birth and death, how people grow and develop, about why my circuit breaker tripped for several days but is now back up and working perfectly fine, if a curry sauce filled tofu ball would be good bit of food, ‚Ä¶
   * I‚Äôd say I‚Äôm quite spiritual but not in the usual sense of the word. I‚Äôm highly logical with an open mind. I don‚Äôt have beliefs. I‚Äôm purely in this life, with this body, with very limited perception of reality. But it is growing and I leave the door open.


  



Values
   * Open-mindedness - to me this means not being bought into anything. Staying open to being shown something new or contrary to current perspective.
   * Continuing to grow in awareness
   * Moving towards doing what‚Äôs more right and relevant for the world - this is not to say do not respect personal wants, but just recognising that personal desires tend to be formed by the world we reside in and they are highly transient - and it relates to the point above. With growing awareness I recognise that my desires are a consequence of my physiology, emotions, and memories - and as I become more conscious in my actions then the interactions of those elements also change. So, my desires change when my consciousness changes. Moving towards choice of desire from compulsive desires.
   * Rightness is debatable
   * Authenticity - I do feel that everyone is already authentic, there is nothing about a being that isn‚Äôt - your actions and thoughts are not someone else's. I mean in the sense that we move towards growing awareness and express ourselves by our choice rather than by our compulsions.




What I want in a relationship


To have a companion to travel through life with.


Someone to share with
   * Food - I enjoy eating together, tasting new dishes (especially desserts )
   * Maybe some hobbies and projects - but not a dealbreaker
   * A home
   * Ideas and thoughts
   * What else?


Someone to learn from and learn with.
   * Intellectual curiosity - talking about concepts, situations, the future, history and bouncing ideas feels important to me.
   * A drop of spiritual curiosity - some amount of thirst to know more of life, consciousness and what we/I don‚Äôt know.


Someone who really wants me.


Someone I really want to be with.


Hopefully, someone to have children with. So ideally aged between 25 and 35. But I‚Äôm not going to be strict on this - it‚Äôs just what seems to make sense given that desire.
But with that said, I‚Äôd rather live a happy life than have kids at great cost to wellbeing.


Physical, emotional, and sexual intimacy.


The utmost mutual trust that we‚Äôre in this together. Being on the same team.


Calling out bullshit and being able to step in when needed. Not letting undesirable things just happen without being addressed. Again, same team - doing this together.




Qualities that I find attractive in a partner


   * Feminine confidence
   * Gentle temperament but not meekness
   * Able to go with the flow as well as being adamant when needed
   * A curiosity for life's mysteries
   * Wittiness
   * Intellectual intelligence to an extent
   * Low maintenance and easy going nature - but still with a bit of fire
   * Straightforwardness
   * Adaptability (I may be projecting a bit here)
   * Groundedness




Some boundaries


Long distance relationship - it‚Äôs a no for me. A LTR doesn‚Äôt feel real to me and seems like a dream life not real life. I know it can work for many people, but I don‚Äôt feel this is the situation I‚Äôd thrive in.
Perhaps later on if there needs to be some distance due to short term work, looking after parents, etc then that‚Äôs fine - just doesn‚Äôt seem right to begin with.


I like communication to be straightforward with no game playing. Don‚Äôt make it harder than it needs to be. I truly feel there are much better ways to use our energy than playing around with each other.










What we could have together
   * A warm loving home and family where we nurture each other.
   * Deep mutual trust that we are here for each other.
   * Great intimacy - physically, emotionally, sexually, and any other way that comes to mind.
   * Financial security and freedom - we can work on this together. So that we can pursue things other than careers and money motivated endeavours - do things that are more alive.
   * Support each other in our pursuits. Even have some things that we pursue together.
   * Have kids and grow into wonderful guides for them as they grow.
   * Each of us puts effort into being the best for the other - then there will be no getting bored, things going stale, the flame dying out. Selfishly selfless route to endless passion and energy.
   * Share in the responsibilities of life and home. As equally as possible. Recognising that it doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean the physical actions are completely equal. But we do what‚Äôs needed.
   * A really fun time and fun life!




  







With all that said, that is my brain dump for now.


Let‚Äôs meet!


jyue87 [at] gmail [dot] com

Name: Jonathan
ProfileText:
ÔªøJonathan - Date me doc


I'm 36, a reformed Baptist who holds to the 1689 LBCF. I'm looking for a Christian lady who desires to be a wife, mother, and help build and beautify the house that I own for the glory of God. God has blessed me financially where I am effectively retired now and manage my investments. I'd love to find a lady who desires to be a wife and help raise a family. My goals as a future husband are to help lead, and love my wife as myself, help build a large family (Lord willing), and help my church in any way I can. I know the husband's duty is to love his wife as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her. 


At my church I volunteer with the Food Pantry ministry and the audio/tech booth. I attend Silicon Valley Reformed Baptist church in Sunnyvale, CA. You can check out our youtube channel! Also I would recommend checking out ‚ÄúThe Bible Bashed Podcast‚Äù as it has been greatly influential in my life. 


If a match seems like a possibility I'm eager to go out and meet you! I am not looking to relocate but focusing on preparing my home for marriage (which I own) as Christ is preparing a place for us in the future. Also I am very eager to involve pastoral counsel early on to help guide the man and woman to see if this would be a good fit for marriage.


My current interests are weightlifting, learning how to do handyman repairs around the house, and listening to Christian podcasts. 


Nice to meet you!


  
  
  

  
(Sun was in my eyes)

Obligatory Headshot
Hi there! I'm on the market, and if you're looking at this, then I guess you are too. This should help us navigate those awkward first steps.
I'm looking for someone to live and love with long-term while we both support each other's goals. I've never been married and while I'd be happy with a lifetime partner, I don't know that marriage itself is the right setup for me. That said, I have been in a 5+ year relationship. In the meantime, let's just be nice to each other and test our compatibility. We can see if there's an intersect in what we're looking for and do what seems right in the meantime.
My ideal partner has obsessions and can't help but share them. She has clear goals and a plan to achieve them, even if they're hard as hell. (I'm talking to you, ambitious women other guys are afraid of.) She takes care of herself now, knowing our bodies get harder to maintain as we age. Also, no kids, religion, or perpetuating animal suffering through food choices. She has her own obsessions and wants to make a positive mark on the world.
I take on challenging goals. I'm mostly through the manuscript of a nonfiction book on a technical topic. I've published in both academic journals and popular media. I've also grown two nonprofits from scratch. I set up the org and funding mechanism that helped a long-active male contraceptive to a Phase I human clinical trial. I also facilitated campaigns to get a better voting method implemented in two cities, which had never been used in government elections before. I've raised millions of dollars for causes I care about. I enjoy being active and have a ton of different hobbies.
Location-wise, I can live anywhere for my work and recently chose Philadelphia after referencing a simple heat table I put together factoring in cost of living, walkability, transit, and bikability. I actively do not like cars and choose not to own one. I do have a license and can drive though. I have to do this visiting Kentucky during the holidays.
Other randomness. I care about financial independence. I budget for charitable giving and give publicly. I also love science and am rather methodical at most things I try my hand at. If you‚Äôre as obsessed with learning, we‚Äôll probably get along great. Also, I try my best for clarity on all this, but if you're still nicking a particular box and things look otherwise good, I'd still be up for us talking and checking things out.

Name: Oscar
ProfileText:
ÔªøJanuary 2025
About me
I am 23, I live in Oxford, studied in my native Australia, and grew up mainly in India.[1] I feel moved by the plight of current people and non-human animals, but also find persuasive the basic longtermist argument that the future is big and important and changeable. So for now I am trying to help make the transition to AGI go well.
You can see some things about me on various places online, including the EA Forum, LinkedIn, Goodreads, Google Scholar, and my Substack subscriptions.
That is fairly cold and impersonal; it is perhaps more fun and interesting to get to know each other by talking. But for now, here are some less work-y things about me:
* I like to read, play board games and ~any sport, hike and camp, talk about philosophy and physics and photosynthesis and occasionally non-alliterating things.
* I am very honest and value open, frank, fairly direct communication with others. I tend to ask quite a few questions, mainly because I am curious to learn about other people‚Äôs experiences and ideas!
* I am not very artsy; beyond the occasional poem (e.g. here, here), and some elegant mathematising if that counts, my creative output is meagre.
* I have rather little familiarity with pop culture and I mostly do not regret this. But it means I wouldn‚Äôt be a very good conversationalist on such things.
Here are some photos of me doing things I like. And this is what my[2] face looks like:
  

About you
Apart from demographic things (I have only ever been attracted to women, this seems very unlikely to change; being a somewhat similar age/life stage is helpful) and unsurprising things (one‚Äôs partner being kind and clever and caring and calm and courageous is always nice) I would like to be with someone who is:
* Morally serious - the stakes are high; there is so much to protect; doing the right thing matters. I think I would struggle to deeply empathise with and respect someone who had a more blas√© attitude to improving the world. It seems less important what exactly you care about and want to work on.[3]
* Intellectually curious - talking about ideas is quite important to me, and it would be hard to spend lots of quality time with someone who isn‚Äôt interested in ideas. But what you study/studied, who your favourite philosophers are, what your favourite theorem is etc is less important.
Beyond that, of course, it would be nice if we enjoyed some of the same activities, but I feel like that is more malleable.
It would clearly be nice to live near each other, but I am open to exploring a relationship with someone who currently lives far away.[4]
I am open to ~any preference on whether to have kids, I have quite mixed thoughts.[5]
You can email me at oscardelaney0@gmail.com.
________________
[1] My parents were doing ‚Äòglobal health and development‚Äô work before it was cool in EA ;)
[2] Is my past self really ‚Äòme‚Äô? What is the relationship between ‚Äòme‚Äô and ‚Äòmy face‚Äô? Tricky questions!
[3] I care quite a bit about EA as a project, and somewhat about EA as a community. It might be helpful if you do too, but I think the ‚Äòmorally serious‚Äô frame of mind is the more important part.
[4] I quite like living in Oxford, but would be open to moving for the right (work or romantic!) opportunity.
[5] I like spending time with kids and would all else equal prefer to be a parent (and am generally pro-natalist!). But all else isn‚Äôt equal, e.g. if AGI comes this decade it could be a very tumultuous few years where I want to focus fairly hard on work without caring for young kids. But I don‚Äôt know.

Name: Tom Keith
ProfileText:
ÔªøEmail: tom.arrow42@gmail.com
Tom Keith


Me
Why am I single?  
* My work life (sea below) has taken me out of the country for significant periods. 
* I used to be quite insecure about expressing romantic attraction, although this has been largely worked through.
* My face is not very expressive, and I seem much colder than I actually am to a lot of people. I convey strong emotion much more with verbal explanation than any visual cue.
* For serious relationships, my standards are very high. 


Basic info
* 5‚Äô8‚Äù/173cm   
* Straight
* Ideally looking for a monogamous relationship, but open to polyamorous casual dating
* Want children in 5-15 years, but I don‚Äôt think this is a dealbreaker
* Muscular build, lean but not shredded
* Atheist
* 27 years old, British
* Non-smoker, rarely drink but not teetotal
* First class Chemistry degree
* Working week in Portsmouth, with travel abroad
* Weekends in Glasgow and London
* Vegan
* ¬£50k salary, own a flat in Glasgow with a small mortgage
* Highly extraverted
* Main love language is physical touch, followed by quality time


Hobbies and interests  
My two main hobbies are my fitness, which is extremely important to me, and Warhammer. Painting the miniatures and playing the game with friends is a major way I unwind. Here‚Äôs a few exercise achievements I am most proud of:

   * Can do 6-10 muscle ups as standard, with a PB of 12
   * Similar scores for one-arm press ups
   * 100-120kg bench press
   * Run a mile and a half (2.4km) in comfortably under 10 minutes


I have dabbled in a large number of other activities, with the following being my current side-quests:
   * Archery (specifically speed-shooting with a horsebow)
   * Vegan cooking
   * Hiking (especially Munro bagging)
   * Organising social events
   * Stand up comedy (but mainly while travelling)


Beyond this, I am generally open to giving other people‚Äôs interests a go, at least once. 


Work life
[Redacted] Feel free to enquire.
  

Character traits
   * Discipline, drive, and executive function
   * Very low in neuroticism and anxiety, with a stable mood (I‚Äôve got graphs lol)
   * Regrettably low in curiosity  
   * Direct style of communication
   * Hard to offend
   * Aside from a few skeletal anomalies that haven‚Äôt meaningfully limited me, I have excellent health (as do most of my family)
   * Probably too invested in some kind of general protagonist identity, and working on being warmer and more human
   * Filter out most sensory experience, can go months without noticing a thing in my environment if I don‚Äôt need to pay attention to it
      * Appreciate this is not the case for everyone and have experience maintaining a relationship with a partner that is very affected by sensory input


Daily routines
      * I am more of a morning person; staying up late into the night without good reason is not a thing for me
      * I reach full alertness and energy shortly after getting up
      * I rarely suffer from low energy, in any sense, and nap only infrequently
      * This is predicated on my daily rhythm giving me good sleep and nourishing food, I absolutely crash without these
      * My meals are very big, and I hardly snack. 
      * I abhor ‚Äúkilling time‚Äù at home, and prefer to spend time intentionally. This most frequently comes up in relationships around partners wanting to spend lots of time watching TV/film. If you want me to do this, it‚Äôs best to sell me on why that show in particular is worth a deliberate decision to watch it. Just putting something on as a low-effort way to spend an evening will not fly. 
      * Work out 3 days on, 1 day off
      * Each night I record what I did that day in a ‚ÄúMemory Book‚Äù and have every single day for 7 years. Be prepared to feature!  


Romance & the Bedroom  
         * Preference for leaning into dominant roles, although I am pretty vanilla at heart
         * Limited experience with kink but open to exploration, with communication
         * High libido and I actively want near-daily sex but desire to go for multiple rounds can be greatly hampered by not having eaten enough or physical tiredness
         * You‚Äôll generally get a lot more out of me by starting early in the evening, or earlier in the day with a coffee
         * *friends mocking me for going to the Roomba recharge station*
         * I have embraced using sex toys on partners, but don‚Äôt feel excited about them being used on me (this could be discussed further)
         * Thoroughly enjoy giving head and partners reaching orgasm


I‚Äôve had one relationship lasting a year, a handful of four month relationships and a fair number of short-term flings or one-off encounters. I‚Äôm in touch and on good terms with many of these people, and don‚Äôt hold grudges with any. None of these were ‚Äúbad break ups‚Äù, and I have never fought with a romantic partner. My longest relationship was polyamorous for the second half. I feel we made this work and it is something I could continue doing. That being said, it came with costs that at present I would prefer not to pay in a long-term relationship. If you‚Äôre poly and otherwise think we could be a match, please don‚Äôt rule it out on these grounds!


I like to take relationships quickly and am comfortable living together earlier than most, I think. As I grow close with people, I can become an absolute Snuggle Bear but this is dependent on chemistry. A friend with benefits, who I cherish but do not feel this chemistry with, instead describes me as a ‚ÄúRoomba‚Äù...


Fun facts  
         * Can do sin(x) functions in my head, and could teach you how
         * Made Richard Dawkins laugh
         * Estimated to eat 92.3kg of houmous per year
         * Exchanged typewritten letters with a romantic interest whose name I never knew through unsuspecting Berlin baristas
         * Once performed in a live theatrical production of ‚ÄúThe Nightman Cometh‚Äù
         * Appeared in the New York Times, and on a BBC documentary


You
Basic info
There are very few unequivocal green and red flags for me, and many different ways I can be attracted to a person. Most of my red flags are fairly common: jealous, controlling, unable to accept they are at fault, boring. The ones more specific to me are:
         * Actively religious or superstitious
         * Not vegan and unwilling to discuss my ethics on this with an open-mind
         * Significant lack of interest in their health, fitness, and longevity


These are nice-to-haves:  
         * Black hair
         * Tanned/dark skin
         * Large breasts 
         * Muscular/athletic figure
         * Confidence and assertiveness


While the lack of these are dealbreakers for long-term relationships:
         * Self-initiated passion projects, ideally nerdy ones
         * Clear and open communication styles 
         * Aged 20-33
  

Work life
I want to date people who impress me, and a big part of that will usually come from their career goals. Ambition is helpful, but at a minimum I want a partner to know who they are and what they are working towards. The minutiae of this are not so important to me and there‚Äôs very few professions that constitute red flags. Essentially, I want to be impressed by a woman‚Äôs grit. Tell me how hard you‚Äôve worked and what you can overcome! 


Finances  
I‚Äôd like to think I am generous with friends and partners, and recognise that there are (dwindling) expectations on a man to spend money on a woman. That being said, I am far more excited to date someone who sees being a homeowner as a signal of good financial security and executive function than someone trying to marry rich. I intend to donate too much money for that to ever pay off. With that said, I don‚Äôt have any expectations for a partner‚Äôs income or financial situation provided that they can take care of themselves. 


The Bedroom
I would like for a partner to be of a similarly high sex-drive and be committed to this remaining an exciting activity. Ideally, the middle of the afternoon, or an empty field in the summer, would be a perfectly acceptable opportunity to get it on. There‚Äôs not much more of a filter I want to apply here, the rest can be figured out with dating. 
  
  
  
  

If you feel like we could be match, feel free to reach out by email!

Name: malcolm handley
ProfileText:
ÔªøOverview


  



	

	I‚Äôm building a life of impact, intellectual curiosity, physical activity, and a growth orientation. I‚Äôd like a partner who values and shares these areas, if not the specifics in each area. I can seem hard on the outside, but I‚Äôm a romantic and I promise that there‚Äôs a warm, soft core.










  
Here‚Äôs how excited I can get about ideas! (Very old.)
	  

In a castle in Spain, after picking a padlock to get there.
	  

I accidentally got a cat during covid. I‚Äôm lucky to have a lot of friends who look after her when I‚Äôm traveling.
	  

Not my child. But isn‚Äôt she cute?
	

The basics
* Male, age 44, seeking female, age approximately 35 to late 40s, for a monogamous relationship akin to (or actually) marriage.
* I live in San Francisco. More below.
* I don‚Äôt need to have children. I‚Äôd be excited about it with the right person, in specific situations. See below.
* Email: m@redheron.com
* Facebook profile. I don‚Äôt post much, and less publicly, but you can see mutual friends at least. Twitter. I don‚Äôt post much there either. It‚Äôs a bit out of date, but you can also find me on OkCupid.
More detail
Impact
* I‚Äôm involved in nuclear fusion, because I believe that the world needs clean, cheap, abundant, safe energy in order to limit climate change and create abundance.
* I‚Äôm passionate about structural improvements to our governance systems. I‚Äôm also working on a software project (writeup) to help people vote faster, with more information.
* I spend a lot of my time on another software project -- a collaborative note taker, task manager, etc. (That sounds boring, but I promise that it‚Äôs not!)
Intellectual curiosity
* I love discussing things that we‚Äôve read or heard, or pondering how something works, or listening to/watching something together and trying to figure it out. I especially love finding people who are experts in some random field but are patient enough to let me question them about what they are doing, why it makes sense and how it works. I especially especially love tag-teaming this quizzing with a friend.
Physical activity
* I run, ski, back-country ski, snow camp, backpack and mountain bike. At the moment I‚Äôm working on running further. Have you thought about how far one can run in a day, and how much further it is than we can backpack?! Imagine setting up a base camp in a national park somewhere and then running all over the place for a few days. You could see so much!
* I‚Äôm totally excited to try your sports. These are just the ones that I‚Äôve gotten sucked into so far.
* I‚Äôd like to learn to dance. I‚Äôm pretty terrible at it, and cuban salsa did not go well, even after a year of trying. The next experiment is fusion (dance, not energy, in this case).
* I‚Äôve done a lot of urban exploration. I don‚Äôt do as much now, but I‚Äôve picked every lock in the Conservatory Flowers in Golden Gate Park and I still love climbing cranes.


Growth orientation
* I‚Äôm not in coaching or therapy at the moment, but I‚Äôve gotten a ton from coaching in the past.
* I‚Äôm all over the various growth books and recently read Good Inside and The Courage to be Disliked.
* I strive to improve my close relationships and bring my best self to them; and to take feedback gratefully.
* Don‚Äôt confuse this for woo. I‚Äôm a rational atheist who wants to take the good stuff from the touchy-feely hippies, but also keeps discovering that they have more good stuff than I thought. (Who knew that blindfolded contact improv could be so much fun?)
Sampling of things that I like talking about
* The world
   * What's the right way to address climate change? And population growth?
   * If you could change something about how American democracy works, what would it be? Is western democracy on a decline? How can we fix it? (I think that America may be on the verge of what I call the ‚ÄúNew American Consensus‚Äù, and with it an era of great accomplishments.)
* Tech
   * What would I do if I had good VR/AR hardware?
   * How can software be better? How can we build it better? What would a debugger designed for functional programming look like? (IMO: very different, and very awesome.)
   * How can we collaborate more effectively?
   * How will the world change when SpaceX gets Starship working?
* Other
   * How can I be kinder, warmer and gentler, but still help groups to get things done?
   * How can I get into somewhere I shouldn‚Äôt?
   * How can I travel with less gear?
Where I live
* I live in San Francisco.
* I‚Äôve been here for nearly 25 years and know a lot of wonderful people.
* I live in a community of 4 buildings, one big shared garden, 15 adults and 6 children (more planned or on the way!), 3 hot tubs and lots of cats. We each have our own units, so we don‚Äôt have to agree on how clean our kitchens, bathrooms, etc are. It‚Äôs co-livinging for grownups and it‚Äôs great. You might love it too. üòÄ
* I‚Äôm loath to leave SF permanently but I‚Äôm also really eager to find an amazing partner and am willing to look in many other places for her. Europe (especially Berlin) and New York tug at my heart. I recognize that I might get lured away from SF, but I‚Äôll also try to lure you here. Maybe we can travel a lot.
Children
* I used to be pretty strongly opposed to having children. I‚Äôd be married at least twice by now if it weren‚Äôt for that.
* I still don‚Äôt need to have children, but now I can now see a path where I‚Äôd be excited to have children: with a partner who is highly aligned on values and goals, and in a community like the one that I live in, with lots of social contact built in, so that parenting isn‚Äôt as isolating.
* The two biggest things that changed my mind about children are (1) seeing how different parenting is when done in community, and realizing that the future will be less awesome if a whole group of us opt out of having children.

Name: Emily
ProfileText:
ÔªøUpdated January 20, 2025  


.Emily‚Äôs Date- Me Doc ‚ô•.




.Me.


A curious do-gooder. 


.You.


Also a curious do-gooder. :)
.About Me.                
I‚Äôm 24 years old, a cis female, 5‚Äô3‚Äù, and 105 pounds. I try not to give weight to typologies, but INTJ and Enneagram 1 describe me well.


I‚Äôm an intense person who goes all in for the things I care about.
I naturally like to optimize, but lately have been evaluating this mindset.


I adore unconventional ideas (e.g. I sleep in a sleeping bag on the floor with no pillow) and highly value authenticity and open-mindedness. Deep relationships are most important to me.


.What I‚Äôm doing with my life.


I graduated college in May and am still figuring out my career. Since graduating, I‚Äôve helped Democratic campaigns in the US. I worry that if we don‚Äôt address facism in the US (if it‚Äôs not too late), it will be much harder to address all the existential crises we‚Äôre facing. I‚Äôll likely continue on the politics/campaign path for at least the next four years.


I love climbing and anything in nature (I thru-hiked the Appalachian Trail three years ago), reading nonfiction, journaling, philosophy (esp. Buddhism), minimalism, board games (I get weirdly competitive), and experimenting with life!
                                
.What I‚Äôm looking for.                                       


A life partner/husband who is my best friend - a relationship that feels secure, playful, and has shared interests (passes the traffic test). I‚Äôm monogamous and am not sure yet if I want kids. I‚Äôm currently based in Northern Virginia (but move depending on work) and am willing to relocate. Also open to new friends!


.Please reach out!.


Do you think we‚Äôd get along well? If yes, message me here. :)


Do you know someone I might get along well with? Please share this doc with them!
Bounty: I‚Äôll give $1,234 to the person who introduces me to my husband. But- What if you‚Äôre my husband?






                                                                                                        haha jk‚Ä¶ unless‚Ä¶?

Name: Grant Eckett
ProfileText:
ÔªøGrant
30yr old male from Basingstoke, England looking for a date
Intro
There‚Äôs only so many times you can keep swiping past women looking for ‚Äúgolden retriever energy‚Äù and a ‚Äútime and place‚Äù before you lose your sanity and realise a change in approach is needed, so let‚Äôs give this dating docs thing a try. I‚Äôll give you an overview then you can decide if you want to go further.  
Story so far
In terms of finding love my track record is‚Ä¶interesting. At time of writing I‚Äôm in my third year of dating and still very much learning how all this works but proud at how far I‚Äôve come.Whilst not smooth sailing I‚Äôve learnt a lot about myself and what I‚Äôm after (which I‚Äôll try to summarise a bit further down)
If you‚Äôve done the math so far you‚Äôve probably come to the conclusion I haven‚Äôt been in a relationship - and you‚Äôre right.It‚Äôs mainly been wheelspining in first dates with the occasional step into dates 2-4. Whilst not the most glamorous statement on here it does mean I come with no baggage (kids,crazy exes,etc.) so every cloud right?
What I‚Äôm after
Most of these docs usually end with this section but I‚Äôm going to pop it near the top so I don‚Äôt waste your time if none of these float your boat.I don‚Äôt have a ‚Äútype‚Äù but do have some boundaries/preferences:
* Kids - This is very much a don‚Äôt have and will not be pursuing.If you have any desire for parenthood now‚Äôs the time to close this doc and move on.Happy to go into why I‚Äôve chosen this path if asked.
* Distancing Strategies - By this I refer to ghosting/similar tactics.This is a strong no from me and if I get a whiff of this I will be out.
* Attachment style - So I sit on the anxious side of attachment theory and as such would ideally want a secure partner or at the very least an avoidant partner who acknowledges their attachment style and is willing to work towards developing secure tendencies as I am.
* Distance - Preference would be for prospective partners to sit in the range I‚Äôve used for dating apps in the past - within a 30km radius from Basingstoke.I‚Äôll leave this below so you can see if you fit in the bubble.
  

* Age - Again will keep this in line with my current dating app settings - 25 to 40 year olds.
As you can see I don‚Äôt have any crazy demands (I hope) written down here. Fundamentally I‚Äôm after a nice person I fancy - simple as.Title,possessions,etc. are not super important as in my eyes we lose it all in the end anyway.
It‚Äôs the journey/experiences that count.
About Me
Still interested? Well then let‚Äôs get into what I‚Äôm about.
Interests
* Fitness - I currently go to the gym 1-2 times a week with 2-3 running sessions around my work in the week. Running has been something I‚Äôve introduced into the mix tailend of 2024 and has been a fun challenge when it comes to running a 5k. My aim is to get a 5k consistently within 30 minutes in 2025 and potentially look at longer distance running in the future.
* Nature - I like to get out and about around the natural parts of my area. Accompanying me is my dog Daisy who has been a faithful companion and cheered me up in even the most difficult of times.Before you ask, yes you will get to meet her.
  



* Motorsport - One of my biggest passions. What kept me glued to the screen as a kid has turned into my most favorite thing ever and has led to me attending many car events, go-kart races, building my own simulator and working for a F1 team (albeit in their supercar division) - McLaren.
* Pursuit of Knowledge - I‚Äôm very much one of those people who will read/YouTube/Google something and - if it‚Äôs interesting enough - pursue it.This has led me into learning how to code,how to date/interact with others using cognitive theory and build a computer. If you‚Äôve got any cool things you‚Äôve learnt that you think might interest me it would be good to hear.
Best Qualities
* Open/Honest - I will always tell you how it is (good or bad), there will be no ambiguity around me. If you feel that‚Äôs not the case, then you just need to say and I‚Äôll do my best to address any concerns.
* Resilience - Having been through many hardships in my 20s and surviving them, I‚Äôve built up a decent resilience and drive to press on despite challenges.I feel this will serve me well in a relationship as there will be plenty of difficult discussions/issues to overcome.
* Growth Mindset - I‚Äôm very much of the opinion that I‚Äôm not anywhere near my peak and that there is more to come. If you're after someone who will continue to work hard, even deep into a relationship, I might be a good fit for you.
Life admin
Just so we can avoid the boring bits on the first date and get to the fun conversations, let‚Äôs get these life admin bits out the way:
* I have a stable job in Quality Engineering.Not a CEO or anything but the pay is decent and I can typically get a 4% raise every year.
* Understand the fundamentals of money and can budget expenses reliably while leaving funds for savings/retirement/enjoyment.
* Own my own car and can drive.
* Not on the property ladder currently and staying with my mum supporting her through a serious illness.
* Only a social drinker, no smoking or drugs.
More Photos
  

  



Want to find out more?
Thanks for reading my date doc. If you want to find out more and potentially go on a date send an email to grant.eckett@gmail.com with why you think you might be a good match and a photo so I know you are a real person. If you can suggest things you may be interested in for a first date then even better!
