Name: Michael Creger
ProfileText:
ÔªøI am where I want to be. Duluth. On the shore of a beautiful Great Lake, in a definitely Midwestern city with nooks and crannies that are anything but. A big small town where more people know your business than ought to. And more people care than the wider world could imagine. 


I'm a 55 yo journalist, writer, poet, designer, philosopher, gad-about, live music/art fan, father of a beaming 7 y.o. girl. 


Searching for a seriously nonserious woman. A laugher. A crier. A human. A seeker. A reader. A wordsmith. A lover. A passionate jokester. Many things. 


Frankly, I haven't been much in the dating world since divorce five years ago. No time, I say. An excuse. I can be selfish with my space, I think. But I'm feeling something again about finding the right connection, taking the time to do that.


I'm mike(dot)Creger(at)Gmail.com


Some writing/nonsense that may provide more clarity on my state of being:




In the past few weeks I've learned that people are becoming acutely selfish and rotten. Those teetering into this category seemingly fall into the pit more easily these days. Me, I follow the golden rule instilled by my mother.


But yeah, public behavior at festivals, driving, and just casually looking around. People are dying inside, and taking it out on others.
Don't die inside. Follow your heart and be gentle, even with those who deserve no gentility back.


Be raw, honest, relatable. Take nothing for granted, don't back down, but don't just make something a pissing match. That's like following the natural course of water. The easy way out.
Pound empathy on your stand. 


And be proud, sure of who you are, sure of how someone has you wrong. Correct their course with humanity, kindness.


It's lazy to fight. It's lazy to pick a fight. 


Know where your heart is, where you want to be. Go there.
__------------


The wind bellows its argument with the ceiling, the sea and unsprouted spring.
It wends through the alleyways and swirls the surviving leaves.
It relishes the irony it hoards in low pressure.
It doesn't know its strength or siren.


_----------
Your Artist: Wilco
Are you male or female: Either Way


Describe yourself: Outtasight


How do you feel about yourself: Misunderstood


Describe where you currently live: Sky Blue Sky


The first thing you think of when you wake up: She's A Jar


If you could go anywhere, where would you go: Impossible Germany


Your favorite form of transportation: Passenger Side


Your favorite color is: Ashes of American Flags


What's the weather like: What Light


If your life were a TV show, what would it be called: At Least That's What You Said


What is life to you: A Shot In The Arm


What is the best advice you have to give: I'm the Man Who Loves You


If you could change your name, what would it be: Kingpin


Your favorite food is: Spiders (Kidsmoke)


How I would like to die: Why Would You Wanna Live


My soul's present condition: On and On and On


The faults I can bear: The Art of Almost


--------
THE KNOCKOFF POEM


 


Somebody posted on Instagram or Facebook -- or was it Twitter?


 


This picture of a Nerf football.


Something funny was written -- a witticism about the spongy ball being a dog‚Äôs delight.


But I was fixed on that foam football,


Unlocking a surprising cache of memory.


 


I don‚Äôt think my childhood ever saw a real Nerf football.


Just a cheaper, if that‚Äôs possible, knockoff.


There was a pink plastic football


I remember.


A knockoff of a knockoff, a buying pattern that runs through my early family experience.


 


Fake Rubik‚Äôs cubes and triangles,


Loose and adorned with failing stickers,


eventually plocked apart by my too-curious brother.


 


We didn‚Äôt get Pong until Dad 


happened by a yard sale.


This was real Atari -- but so many years too late.


 


The Pong battles burned lines


in the screen of our portable black and white TV,


another knockoff,


until you couldn‚Äôt watch any shows ‚Äì via a knockoff antenna -- without more imagination than you wanted to exert.


My brother eventually took the TV apart as well.


 


Knockoffs. 


It was the age of brand names


and we were having none of it 


in our recession-pocked existence on the farm.


 


The air was real.


The vegetables.


The fruit.


The eggs.


The barn.


And the animals,


all named,


our own branding scheme,


I suppose.


We weren‚Äôt focus-group savvy about it.


More Captain Obvious.


A rust-colored horse called Cinnamon, 


her gray sister, Pepper,


the jet-black brother Midnight.


 


We named a cow Hamburger, 


bringing to mind my brother brightly chirping 


over the Salisbury steak I hated:


Who are we eating tonight?


 


All of this streaming


from a photo on my phone.


 


More than tackle football
during fifth-grade recess
with real Nerf football


 


I grimace, but not


from this trip


to a memory‚Äôs lane


of pre-teen products and uses.


I wince with a wont


for a time when I engaged


more wholly in my life.


Actually.


Not virtually


or electro-socially.


That pink football was lost


in the open cesspool 


in the front yard,


a sewage maw in the earth,


covered by boards,


some broken, with gaps forming.


And there went the ball.


 


That pit was filled in


when the new septic came on.


It became second base of our


kickball field, marked by a lid 


from a can of knockoff paint.


 


Home was the front steps.


First was a pine tree,


third a boxelder.


None of which remain today. 


 


Once you hit a certain age, probably 13, 


you are constantly told


to not look back.


Forge ahead.


Don‚Äôt rue.


As if simple acknowledgement


of a life lived


was some sign of malignant sorrow, 


or akin to sucking a finger for too long.


 


Should my memories


be buried under the sluice of time like that pink football?
It‚Äôs all been a setup, of course,


to the knockoff lives lived today.


Unengaged and not in any moment,


let alone ‚Äúthe‚Äù moment.


 


I‚Äôm going to stop feeling bad about my reminiscence.


I‚Äôve abstained long enough.


I relish this spongy reminder


of youthful engagement.


 


Physical proofs fading,


all I have left is memory:


prodded by a photo


found on my handheld,


soul-sucking device.


 


A Nerf football.


Also handheld.


But, so unexpectedly,


soul nourishing.

Name: Sam B
ProfileText:
ÔªøSam‚Äôs Date Me (or Be My Platonic Lifemate) Doc
Created Jan. 2025
  
  
  

  
  

  
  

Life is more vibrant when shared: Emotional reactions are heightened when another person is in the room. Experiences are richer when you see them through someone else‚Äôs eyes as well as your own. Ideas are enhanced when they volley between two brains. And we need companionship to feel safe and soothed. So I‚Äôm looking for someone(s), romantic or platonic, with whom I can share this brief and miraculous existence. 


I‚Äôm easily influenced by the mood and energy of those around me, so I‚Äôm looking for someone who brings out the person I want to be. If you are compassionate, curious, encouraging, extraverted (or at least prone to Doing Stuff), and enthusiastic, read on. 


Vision
In my ideal life, periods of fairly regimented, healthy routine are punctuated by wild adventures. 


During the week, and some weekend days, I anticipate following my morning routine (including meditation), going to work, going to the gym (I lift weights daily, even though I‚Äôm bad at it), and having a couple of remaining hours to engage in activities that are both self-improving and genuinely fun, as energy permits (at home, like reading, studying languages, or chatting, or out, like taking a dance class, seeing a play, or going for a hike). I‚Äôd love to share these activities with someone. I‚Äôm a fan of Cal Newport‚Äôs philosophy and techniques for creating structure that allows for productivity without pushing oneself. I would like my home (whether rented or owned) to be attractive, neat, and quiet; I care about aesthetics, and I‚Äôm easily distracted by clutter or unpredictable interruptions. I enjoy cohabiting, but I don‚Äôt want to be influenced by unhealthy habits like poor sleep or media addiction, so unless the cohabitant(s) is/are conscientious and wellness-oriented, I‚Äôd rather live alone. This routine is valuable to me not out of some kind of moralizing asceticism‚Äîand in fact, I don‚Äôt view it as ascetic‚Äîbut because it‚Äôs the structure and peace I need to do the kind of work that excites me while staying well and relaxed. 


But life is for the alive, my dear (as Mrs. Lovett would say), so weekends and vacations are for experiencing what the world has to offer. I easily feel delight and awe in the wacky things that man and nature have created, and I‚Äôm novelty-oriented, so I‚Äôm not all that particular about what I do for recreation. I am, however, especially interested in travel, as well as entertaining at home by hosting themed parties and game nights. Although during my daily life I prefer to be relatively frugal, I don‚Äôt mind spending money on the experiences I value (and on maintaining my well-being), whether that‚Äôs play tickets or Michelin starred tasting menus. 


Do you see yourself as compatible with at least one of these elements of my vision? I‚Äôm open to a cohabiting partner, an adventure buddy, or both. I‚Äôm game for romantic or platonic ‚Ä¶ but it would be really neat to fall in limerence. 


In the interests of transparency, I‚Äôll admit that my life currently doesn‚Äôt reflect this vision as well as I would like. Even though I look reasonably successful on paper (e.g., have lots of grants and publications, worked at a ‚Äúbig three‚Äù consulting firm, etc.), I‚Äôve struggled to find my groove since the beginning of the pandemic, which coincided with me finishing my postdoc and starting my ‚Äúreal grown-up job.‚Äù Health, relationships, and non-ideal housing have all been an impediment, and I‚Äôve been experimenting to find out what works better. Some major changes are in the works for the next six months, including moving and launching the career that aligns with my strengths and passion. It‚Äôs perhaps immature to believe that a romantic relationship can ‚Äúfix‚Äù a person, but I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs quite what I‚Äôm looking for; I am hoping, though, that an infusion of new and positive energy, and a supporter of my routines, will serve as a nudge in the right direction. 


About me
I would describe myself as resourceful, curious, irreverent, passionate, and idealistic. Superpowers: Generating ideas, perspective-taking, offering reassurance, designing solutions, evaluating the trustworthiness of research evidence (i.e., detecting BS). Weaknesses: Attentional control, trusting my decisions/trusting the process, managing energy, patience, singing. 


Stats
Location: Seattle, WA for ~two years starting mid-2025 (doing a second postdoc), with some flexibility to work from elsewhere at times; I am open to long-distance, including an arrangement where I fly to you for a month at a time and for long weekends, but be aware that I don‚Äôt like communicating via email or text
Education: PhD
Age: 37
Gender: AFAB, nonbinary-ish
Sexual orientation: Androphilic; open to cis men, trans men, masc-leaning nonbinary, and maybe even a butch lesbian or two (for romantic partners‚Äîopen to all genders for friendship!)
Relationship style: Prefer kitchen table poly
Kids: None and don‚Äôt want any; may be open to serving as a fourth or fifth ‚Äúparent‚Äù to a partner‚Äôs kids
Religion: Respectful atheist with Buddhist sympathies 
Politics: Pragmatic, favoring left-leaning goals but not necessarily left-leaning means; ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt-we-all-just-get-along‚Äù-ism; ‚ÄúThey-should-put-me-in-charge‚Äù-ism üôÉ
Substances: No alcohol, tobacco, or cannabis (though I don‚Äôt object if others use them wisely); rare psychedelics for therapeutic purposes 
Neurotype: Probably more allistic than average in the rationalist and EA communities, but more autistic than the general population; neuro-piquant, if you will


Beliefs and values
(I don‚Äôt expect you to share all of these beliefs; diversity of thought is useful! I‚Äôm just offering them as information about me.)
* The world would be saved if everyone practiced perspective-taking and compassion and everyone made decisions using cost-effectiveness analysis with the best available evidence as inputs. (In other words, all you need is love and science.)
* Physicalism is true, or at least, there‚Äôs no reason to believe otherwise; everything is made of matter and there is probably no parallel spirit world or soulstuff. Spiritual practices and rituals, however, can be worthwhile. 
* Capitalism has pros and cons. Markets are magical mechanisms, and I‚Äôm skeptical that there are other ways of allocating resources that would be comparably effective, but I‚Äôd really like to see markets (and governments) totally redesigned in a way that incentivizes wellbeing-maximization rather than promoting insecurity-generating competition, concentration of wealth, pointless and addictive consumption, etc. I haven‚Äôt formally studied econ or political science, so that‚Äôs kinda where my hopes end. I am curious about these topics, though. 
* Most forms of entertainment media and social media are bad for our brains and trick us into thinking they‚Äôre worthwhile, in an analogous process to that promoted by addictive substances. They‚Äôre too stimulating and too instantly-gratifying. This is true of other products as well, like processed foods. 
* Science rules, but it‚Äôs often performed suboptimally. Fixing this is my career mission‚Äîone that I‚Äôve thought about for years and have finally started to pursue. 
* Aside from physical pain/discomfort, insecurity (about status, lovability, etc.) is the core source of most suffering. If people felt ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù and psychologically safe, they‚Äôd be much less defensive, more able to accept others‚Äô perspectives, care for others, etc. In other words, feeling interpersonally secure is intrinsically as well as instrumentally good. 
* Emotion is good. Life should be interesting. I want to cry more and laugh more. 
* It‚Äôs fun to be critical, but it‚Äôs also fun to appreciate mediocre art and suspend disbelief.
* Probably some other stuff, but you‚Äôve already spent long enough reading my stream-of-consciousness manifesto, so let‚Äôs move on. 


Hobbies and interests
The items on this list range from ‚Äústuff I think about every day‚Äù to ‚Äústuff I do once a month‚Äù to ‚Äústuff I aspire to try.‚Äù 
* Metascience
* Psychology, economics, philosophy
* Effective Altruism (as a question about how to do the most good, not as a fixed set of ‚Äúapproved‚Äù cause areas; my favorite objective function is different from most EAs‚Äô)
* Travel
* Creative writing
* Reading
* Language learning (did French in school, learned some ASL a few years ago, now beginning Japanese)
* Designing party games
* Performing arts, but not live music (I get antsy sitting there when there‚Äôs no visual stimulation or plot)
* Thrift shopping
* Dancing (I‚Äôm told I‚Äôm a good dancer at weddings‚ÄîI just make it up as I go along)
* Baking and other one-off ‚Äúarts ‚Äòn‚Äô crafts‚Äù type activities
* Outdoor walks/hikes, with the caveat that I‚Äôm cold-sensitive
* Psychedelics
* Buddhism, meditation; curious about relational meditation practices
* Lotsa other stuff too‚Äîteach me about your hobbies! 


About you 
I‚Äôve already articulated much of what I want; here‚Äôs all of it in one place. Yes, I know these lists aren‚Äôt grammatically parallel. Forgive me. 


Qualities I‚Äôm seeking: 
* Compassionate, warm, and encouraging
* Curious and intellectually engaged
* Extraverted and/or active; ‚Äúyes and‚Äù attitude
* Communicative about own mental state
* Has own hobbies and interests
* Has a vision/direction for life (does not need to be a traditional career), preferably one that includes reducing the world‚Äôs suffering
* Enthusiastic about at least some portion of my proposed lifestyle, or already practices it


Qualities about which I care less than most people: 
* Height (short kings yes please ‚Ä¶ but also tall kings)
* Body type (I‚Äôve dated hefty bears and wispy dudes I could beat at arm wrestling)
* Age (27-57 should work)
* Race (no preference)
* Religion (you do you, given a reasonable level of skepticism/critical thinking; I love ritual)
* Sexual compatibility (I think it‚Äôs more strategic to optimize for other stuff ‚Äòcause I have no problem with you getting these needs met elsewhere if we‚Äôre not a fit)


Dealbreakers: 
* Cynicism
* Frequent or persistent low mood/low energy
* Meanness or disdain towards neurodivergent people, trans people, sex workers, or fat people ‚Ä¶ actually, let‚Äôs make that meanness or disdain towards anyone! 
* Dogmatic beliefs, especially political beliefs in the vein of ‚Äúthe ‚Äòother‚Äô is an unforgivable bad guy‚Äù
* For cohabitants
   * Preferring to keep the space cold
   * Clutter
   * Noise (e.g., practicing instruments audibly)
   * Most dogs
   * Poor sleep habits
   * Addiction, including behavioral addictions; however, being in recovery is a plus
   * Requiring a vegan-only kitchen (I‚Äôm pro-vegan, but I have been medically advised that it‚Äôs a bad idea for me, so I‚Äôm pescatarian at home)


Bonus qualities: 
* Can (and wants to) teach me new things, work on projects together, or study together
* Romaaaantic
* Decisive, dominant, and/or confident without being arrogant or judgmental
* Rich enough to help finance my scientific ventures and/or buy me presents (hey, a person can dream)
* Open to relocating, especially somewhere that doesn‚Äôt get too cold


Next steps
If you think we might be a match, email me at my first name dot my last name (which is Bernecker) at the Google internet mail. (I hope that‚Äôs obfuscated enough to fool robots while remaining intelligible to humans.) Please tell me what you‚Äôre seeking, highlight a few things in this doc that made you think we‚Äôd be a good fit, and mention any concerns about our compatibility.

Name: Libby
ProfileText:
ÔªøHello future lover boy, 


Tis I, Libby. Guess you heard, through one of those pesky grapevines, that I am looking for a beau. I am indeed looking for a romantic partner. Let‚Äôs keep this short and sweet‚Ä¶here are some things I‚Äôm looking for, and things I‚Äôve got to offer (back to dowry times I suppose!): 


Looking-for list (for your ease and my graphic design pleasure, i‚Äôve made this a tick box list): 


* Curious (do you think? A lot? Great!) 
* Comfortable with one self/brave (how do you feel about strangers? Being on your own? Sharing your emotions? Dancing in front of people?) 
* Funny (don‚Äôt worry about specifics, if you make your friends laugh you probably satisfy this)
* Principled (having values and sticking to them (roughly))
* Want children long-term, but not in the next ~3 years (all in favour of procreation say I)


Extra points if you 
* Speak another language 
* Enjoy/play team sports 
* Have a creative practice/enjoy the arts and have opinions about what you like  
* Wear a helmet when cycling 
* Try not to spend too much time on tech/enjoy spending a lot of time outside  
* Thoughtful consumer 




Latest deals offer list, i.e. what I bring to the table: 
* Funny (improv comedy level funny)
* Curious/Big thinker (academically in philosophy and linguistics, but enjoyed more widely too) 
* Playful 
* Creative (art, music, poetry, dance, theatre, you name it!) 
* Big de-digitaliser (gamifying low screen time >) 
* Community oriented 
* Somewhat spiritual, in that I enjoy spiritual adjacent activities like meditation, 5 rhythms, circling/authentic relating, etc 


Note: I‚Äôve kept this brief, mainly because I‚Äôm excited at the prospect of you discovering things about me in real life rather than via a word doc. 


Boring logistical stuff: 
22 years old, final year of undergrad degree at Uni of Ox, intention to stay in Oxford long term (probably) but interested in some periods of being elsewhere/maybe abroad, especially staying somewhere I can practice my french/other languages (german, spanish, open to more!), interested in polyamoury but more recently leaning towards a primary partner in a monogamish partnership. Happy to be swayed by my partner if they have strong desires, but would like to have a conversation customising what our style might look like. 


Here are some photos of me for your viewing pleasure ;0 




  

  

  
  
  

Big five scores: 
* Openness 98 
* Conscientiousness 71 
* Extraversion 85 (I would estimate this is slightly lower, because I absolutely love time on my own, but also love thoroughly love social contexts with the right people) 
* Agreeableness 60 
* Neuroticism 42


If you‚Äôre interested, email me at burnerfahrenheit@gmail.com

Name: Dave K
ProfileText:
ÔªøDave Kasten‚Äôs Date-me Doc
Hi, I‚Äôm Dave Kasten!  I‚Äôm mainly writing this date-me doc in search of a primary/anchor partner to build a life and have kids with, but if you‚Äôre awesome and think we might be a good fit in a secondary/casual partnership, I‚Äôd love to talk to you, too.


  
  



The basics[1]:
* Man
* 38
* Jewish (And I need my partner to respect that I am, but I don‚Äôt need them to be).  
   * I go to Shabbat services a couple times a month, and I host a Shabbat or other Jewish-holiday-related dinner at my home once a month-ish.  I don‚Äôt keep kosher and I use electricity on Shabbat. (I‚Äôd be willing to explore shomer shabbos / shomer kashrut if you‚Äôre Jewish and it‚Äôs meaningful for you that your partner be as well.)
* Ambiamorous.  Ideally looking for polyamorous relationships these days, but have been in big, important monogamous relationships too in my life.  Open to either.
* Never married, childless.
* Wants to be married, wants kids (Preferably biologically related to me, but mainly it‚Äôs about having a relationship with a kid/kids where they fundamentally see me as a dad).
* Recovering McKinsey consultant, works in AI policy.  Very solid financial health. 
* Lives in Washington, D.C., but would move for the right set of circumstances.
* Has Substack, will travel.


What I‚Äôm like:
* Extroverted, energetic, a great plus-one to a party where you don‚Äôt know anyone. An incredible wedding date for introverts; I‚Äôm your wingman.  On your typical Friday night cocktails, Saturday wedding, Sunday morning brunch story arc, I‚Äôll have fully-established inside jokes with 5 of your friends by the time we‚Äôre packing up the car to head to the airport on Sunday afternoon. 
* Friends, colleagues, and past partners generally tell me that they think that I‚Äôm one of the most optimistic people they‚Äôve ever met. (This usually surprises me, I seem to be unable to update on it.  Maybe what I see as my cynicism just helps me mourn the bad news earlier and privately and move past it faster?)
* I‚Äôm deeply intellectually curious; my friends once told me that the most common way I begin a conversation is, ‚ÄúSo, it turns out‚Äù and then me infodumping at them.  I also sometimes do this before bed.  I hope you consider this adorable.
* My best friend considers me the literal most-invested-in-their-friends person he‚Äôs ever met.  My wedding toast for him was 9 minutes long and the best thing I‚Äôve ever written.  (Video available upon request.)
* I love kids; I am writing this doc the morning after running around with all my friends‚Äô kids at our friend group‚Äôs holiday party for a few hours.[2] I‚Äôm also proud of my signature ‚Äúmaking moose antlers out of my hands‚Äù move that for some reason most toddlers think is the funniest thing they‚Äôve ever seen.
* I go to therapy; have sorted out a lot of my own bullshit, but still working on it.
* A good chef, but much more motivated to cook a big meal for a partner or friends, I tend to be pretty basic when cooking for myself.  
* Exceptional bartender and I love sharing cocktail nerdery with others.
* Enthusiastic but bad dancer; working on the latter part.
* Surprisingly good at putting together furniture and household repairs.
* Fan of Survivor (even though someone needs to take away Jeff Probst‚Äôs game theory textbook), Star Trek: Lower Decks, Person of Interest, The Good Place. The Truman Show may be one of the greatest movies ever; so is Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country. Spy Game is the best spy movie. 
* Some favorite books: Seeing Like A State by Jim Scott, The Diamond Age by Neal Stephenson, The Scholomance series by Naomi Novik, The Laundry Files spy novel series and Merchant Princes fantasy/revolutionary series by Charlie Stross, Bureaucracy by James Q. Wilson.
* I‚Äôm not wealthy by tech industry standards, but by any other industry‚Äôs standards my retirement accounts are doing well and I expect that will continue to be the case.


‚ÄúDo you have a flag?‚Äù ‚Äì Eddie Izzard:
* I was in one really big relationship for 13 years that ended about 2 years ago.  In some ways, you might think of some of my baggage as looking more like ‚Äúdivorced‚Äù than ‚Äúnever married.‚Äù
* I‚Äôm mostly estranged from my biological family due to their past bad behavior; my best friend‚Äôs family is sort of a second family to me.  I am really proud of the found family I have, but am very unlikely to have support from biological family when it comes to babysitting, etc. one day. 
* I had one bad anxiety/depressive episode in my life about 5 years ago; a combo of antidepressants, doing the work in therapy, and major life changes have made this much less of a part of my life.  I‚Äôm not ashamed of you knowing about the time my brain tried to kill me, but I think you should know there‚Äôs some hopefully-low-but-nonzero chance it could happen again.
* Infrequently have Midwestern guy hangups that make me slower to communicate emotions on embarrassing things than I‚Äôd like (though this is much less of a thing for me than a few years ago).


What I‚Äôm looking for in a primary partner:
* [Dies in embarrassment]
* [Okay, I‚Äôm back.]
* Is a woman or relatively femme-coded nonbinary.[3]
* Wants kids (bio or adopted), ideally wants marriage.
* Has traditions that matter to them (Jewish or otherwise).
* Romantic and relationship dynamics:
   * If monogamous, has a strong sex drive and is (ideally) a switch.  
   * If polyamorous, there‚Äôs more flexibility here but I‚Äôd still want to have some flavor of meaningfully-sexually-intimate relationship.
   * A truly asexual child-rearing partnership would be challenging for me unless casual nonsexual physical contact (like cuddling on the couch or spooning while sleeping in the same bed) was part of our dynamic. I think it‚Äôs an essential emotional carrier wave for me.
* Is curious about the world; has something they‚Äôre passionate about, whether or not it‚Äôs the same things I‚Äôm passionate about.
* Listens, asks questions, calls me out on my bullshit, but also fundamentally wants to find a way to be on the same team.
* Loves jokes, makes callbacks in conversation to earlier parts of the conversation, plays with words and ideas. 
* Someone with main character energy about them, someone who takes stands and stands up for themselves.
* Someone who actually tries to woo me and desires me, and who I feel the same about and treat the same way.  Someone who wants to build a shared life together that grows out of who we are now individually, but is bigger than that.[4]  


What I hope we‚Äôd be like together:
* Build a home that‚Äôs warm and joyful, where we give each other freedom and trust, and have the security of knowing we‚Äôre on the same team.
* Craft a life where we incorporate and create rituals and traditions that matter to us.  Mine are usually Jewish, yours don‚Äôt have to be.
* Carve out time explicitly for date nights and time together, plan ahead for when each of our careers and lives get busy, stay connected even when the demands of our commitments strain at us. 
* Fight fairly and kindly with each other when we have conflict (any relationship does). 
* Travel, at least once a year, to somewhere new.  Have at least 50% of our vacations involve lounging somewhere warm for a bit by the waterside.
* Share burdens fairly and equally (I grew up in a home where my dad was a stay-at-home parent for about half of my childhood, so being deeply committed to household tasks feels much more normative to me than for most straight men I know)
* Have a kid or two, raise them in a home that feels happy and safe, where they‚Äôre protected just enough that they can take risks and skin their knees and be daring, knowing that we‚Äôre there to catch them if they truly fall, but letting them stand on their own two feet and make their own choices and feel real freedom and agency. 
* Challah and dancing to goofy music in the kitchen, warm dinners, curling up on the couch listening to the rain fall.  The whole thing that makes it worth it to be alive.


________________


How to contact me:
Email: dave [dot] kasten [at] gmail [dot] com.  Thanks!
  





________________
[1] Yes, I am aware the sum total of these adds up to a bit of a cliche.  At least I don‚Äôt live in Berkeley üòÄ.
[2] The children decided that their glowsticks were magic wands that could make me become dead, alive, or a spooky giant monster, and flickered this state accordingly every 45 seconds or so.  I got good at comedic pratfall death scenes.
[3] I don‚Äôt love my way of describing this!  If you have better ways of describing what you think I‚Äôm saying here, let me know.  
[4] This might seem like a, ‚Äúduh‚Äù requirement but I‚Äôve had some bad and bruising experiences in DC with women who are basically just auditioning me for the job requisition of ‚ÄúJewish husband‚Äù and expect anyone given that job to twist themselves into a pretzel to fit into their hypothetical wife‚Äôs existing life as-is.

At a glance‚Ä¶
Last updated: 27th December 2024
Name
	Aaron Boddy (he/him)
	  	Age
	31
	Location
	Liverpool, UK
(But spend a lot of time in London)
	Interested in
	Women, aged ~27-37
	What I do
	Co-founder of an animal welfare NGO
	Get in touch
	Relationship setup
	I‚Äôm polyamorous, I have a transmasc husband (who I live with) and a cis girlfriend (who lives on a different continent).
	Looking for‚Ä¶
	‚Ä¶people to play games with, talk about ways to improve the world, and make each other laugh :)
More specifically, I‚Äôm looking for a partner based in the UK to spend weekends with‚Äîsomeone who I really vibe with, where we can support and inspire each other to grow.
	What does my life look like?
	I am very much a home-bod(d)y. 
I live in Liverpool with my nesting partner (it‚Äôs a 4-bed flat so we each have our own bedroom and home office). I love being at home surrounded by people I love and my things.
Though my work does require me to travel quite a lot (I‚Äôm very fortunate that I get to go to interesting places and meet interesting people), and as a result I‚Äôve started to enjoy being out of the house more and more.
	What could our life look like?
	A mix of cozy weekends and shared adventures. Whether we‚Äôre hanging out at home, playing games, or watching something fun, or heading out to explore new places, I imagine us having a relationship full of laughter, great conversations, and mutual support. We‚Äôd inspire each other to grow, share our passions, and make space for what truly matters to us, all while enjoying the everyday moments that make life special.
	Here‚Äôs a paragraph about me written by my husband: 
	I‚Äôve honestly never met anybody else like him. 
Pensive, methodical, and startlingly intelligent; he has a very unique approach to life which I really admire. 
He‚Äôs very quiet, gentle, and sensitive. He gets quite distressed by conflict, and he‚Äôs deeply passionate about the things he cares about. He‚Äôs incredibly kind, generous, and thoughtful, and he‚Äôs probably the most patient person I know. 
Oh, he‚Äôs also incredibly silly and mischievous (when he gets to know you).
	Here‚Äôs a paragraph about me written by my girlfriend:
	Pros: Aaron is extremely dependable and honest. I feel like I can tell him anything and he won‚Äôt judge me for it, but will also not jump to be agreeable with me (an autistic superpower!). Out of all my partners, he is the one I feel that I can share my deepest thoughts with. I know that if he says he will do something, he does. He‚Äôs pretty decent at physical directions, tech stuff, and organizational management, which is a huge + for me because I get to benefit off his help in these domains. 
Cons: He is more talkative with people that he has already met a couple times before and generally prefers for other people to initiate/lead conversations. If you are bringing him to a social event where he doesn‚Äôt know others well, then you should try not to leave him to his own devices. Aaron also hasn‚Äôt dated many people in his life and therefore may not have the smoothest way to rizz you up. He is also a little bit clumsy, but is currently on a workout plan so that might change in the future. And he is allergic to cats (apparently), but with enough advance planning, he can be around cats for an extended period of time.
Other considerations: I really value the impact-oriented life that he leads so the optimal UK girlfriend he gets should ideally actively support him in this way of life rather than be a distraction from it. I would be disappointed if he was derailed from the goal of reducing suffering as much as possible/practical in this world. 
	About Me
* Effective Altruism - I co-founded a charity called Shrimp Welfare Project (SWP) after going through the Charity Entrepreneurship Incubation Program. We focus on reducing the suffering of the billions of farmed shrimps. My work at SWP is probably the thing I‚Äôm proudest of in my life to date.
‚ÄúShrimp welfare‚Äù can sound odd at first, but the pitch is surprisingly simple: 
* 230 billion shrimps are alive on farms at any moment, more than any other animal.
* The evidence suggests they‚Äôre sentient and can suffer.
* They often suffer through routine practices such as having their eyes cut off (to induce spawning) and suffocating to death at the end of their lives.
Co-founding SWP was motivated by my deep desire to reduce suffering as much as possible, and it‚Äôs been a rewarding journey balancing pragmatism with ambitious goals. The work connects deeply with my values around compassion, effectiveness, and finding innovative solutions to neglected problems.
* Autistic (self-diagnosed) - In 2023 it was mentioned to me that I might be on the autism spectrum. The more I looked into this the more it seemed to ring true, so I typically identify as being autistic (though I haven‚Äôt gone through a formal diagnosis). 
One way in which this manifests is that I (currently) have an eating disorder called ARFID (avoidant/restrictive food intake disorder). It basically means I have a very limited diet of preferred foods, and the thought of eating other foods triggers a physiological fight-or-flight response.
* Polyamorous - I‚Äôm in a polyamorous relationship currently, so you might hear me in one sentence talk about my husband, and in another sentence talking about my girlfriend. I‚Äôm married to a non-binary trans-guy (who is also in a relationship with a trans-woman). And I also have a cis-girlfriend.
I consider myself to be straight (which is a little confusing as I‚Äôm married to a trans-guy). We dated for ~5 years before he came out as trans, and have found our romantic relationship still works well despite it no longer being sexual - which itself isn‚Äôt such a big deal when polyamorous. 
I think the definition of Relationship Anarchy appeals most to me, with all relationships just growing into whatever suits them best. That said, I find terms like "nesting partner" (for my husband) or "Comet" (for my girlfriend in America) helpful for explaining the dynamics.
Hobbies and Interests
* Making & Creating: Projects and activities I enjoy to try and mindfully unwind.
   * Animation: I love animated movies (my degree is in computer animation), particularly Pixar. I‚Äôm also writing a musical with my metamour about animation, which has been great fun.
   * Musical Instruments: I enjoy picking up piano, ukulele, or drums in phases‚Äîmainly for the fun of seeing quick progress. Right now, I‚Äôm in a piano phase, though I often cycle back to the others.
   * Construction Sets: Building LEGO (or Nanoblocks) is my go-to for unwinding. I have a desk setup in the living room to work on sets while watching TV with my nesting partner.
* Media: Like most people an avid consumer of media‚Ä¶ 
   * Reading: Generally non-fiction, my favourite book is Sapiens. I also love candid autobiographies like Strong Female Character, or I‚Äôm Glad my Mom Died. My Goodreads is here, if you‚Äôre curious.
   * Music: The Beatles are my favourite band, and I love vintage covers (e.g., Postmodern Jukebox).
   * Comedy: Game-changing shows such as Nanette, Inside, and Cold Lasagne Hate Myself 1999.
   * TV & Film: Shows like The Good Place, Fleabag, and movies like The Cornetto Trilogy. I also enjoy so-bad-it‚Äôs-good films and ambitious narratives from Charlie Kaufman or Richard Linklater.
   * Games: I love story-driven single-player games (The Last of Us series) and 100%-ing open-world games while listening to audiobooks. My favourite board game is Gloomhaven.
What I‚Äôm Looking For
* Relationship Style - I‚Äôm looking for a partner based in the UK to share romance and intimacy with. I deeply value my relationship with my nesting partner (we have a strong bond but not a sexual relationship) and my "Comet" girlfriend (though we only see each other every few months). So it feels strange to say as someone with two partners, but I sleep alone most nights, which surprisingly enough, is starting to feel quite lonely‚Ä¶ 
What I feel I‚Äôm missing is a local-ish girlfriend (while I‚Äôm based in Liverpool, my idea of "local" is pretty flexible and would include most UK cities - especially London, where I spend a lot of time anyway). 
I‚Äôd love a relationship that fits a more traditional rhythm: seeing each other regularly, spending weekends together, or staying with each other for longer stretches when it works for us.
* Good Vibes & Value Alignment - I‚Äôd love to connect with someone who feels like they just "get it." A partner who resonates with sides of me like effective altruism or animal welfare. Sharing a passion for doing good and meaningful work would make our connection even stronger.
* Love, Support & Growth - I‚Äôm seeking a relationship where we can genuinely care for and support one another. I want us to be partners in helping each other grow into our best selves, with plenty of encouragement and kindness along the way.
More Photos
  	  

Welcome to More Photos‚Ä¶

back when we first started dating in 2015

	  In India during our team‚Äôs annual ‚ÄúShrimposium‚Äù

Name: Kelechi Nwankwoala
ProfileText:
ÔªøShould you date Kelechi?        
  

What is this? 
If you didn‚Äôt land here from a Date Me directory, you might be wondering what this is and/or think this is weird (fair). Here‚Äôs a NYT Article that explains the idea. I just think of it as a custom dating profile that‚Äôs not tied to a specific app.


If you don‚Äôt think this is that strange, then you‚Äôre probably the kind of person I‚Äôm excited to talk to.
Statement of Purpose
What I value most in a romantic relationship is 1) intimacy ‚Äî Do I feel safe with you? Do we communicate well?‚Äî and 2) collaboration ‚Äî Do we have fun together? Do we work well together? Do we get energized by similar pursuits? I‚Äôm looking, in short, for a mix of a playmate, a confidante, and a collaborator. 


In a perfect world, my significant other and I would design our lives around compelling joint adventures. Maybe we spend one week painting a mural, another two weeks figuring out how to raise chickens, then two months fixing up a RV for a cross-country road trip. To me, a life well spent is one filled with creation and worthy pursuits. A life where your experiences teach you a lot about yourself and the world, and you leave some beautiful things behind you. If you know someone who has a similar view, please share this with them. If you are that person and you‚Äôd like to meet me, fill out this form or reach out directly at knwankwoala2@gmail.com.


Note: This doc is much longer than it needs to be. Don‚Äôt be threatened! Feel free to read as little or as much as you like, grabbing the parts that are most intriguing to you. No need to read everything before hitting me up. Dating is better with a little bit of mystery. 
Basics
I'm a sparsely tattooed cis-male, 25 years old, 5‚Äô9‚Äù, Nigerian-American, living just outside New York City. I am currently working on pivoting to software engineering from marketing analytics/research. Extraverted introvert NOT introverted extravert. I'm poly-oriented but currently unpartnered. If poly is a deal breaker for you, let‚Äôs talk about it. I'm open to having kids at some point, but I‚Äôm not looking to have any in the next years.. In the long term, I imagine myself living somewhere with easy access to nature and outdoor recreation. I‚Äôm not particularly tied to any place or region, though I am very fond of New York. I don‚Äôt smoke. I drink occasionally. I imagine I lived a past life as an octopus or a raven. 
About Me
Curious, Adventurous, Eclectic
My default orientation to most activities is I'm down if you're down. I tend to crave highly intense sensory experiences. Activities like sky-diving, skiing, and motorcycle riding really appeal to me, and I tend to feel most myself moving fast downhill. I'll do anything once, and I‚Äôm the kind of friend where if you do something silly, I probably will do something sillier to make you laugh. 


Here‚Äôs a short but non-exhaustive list of the kinds of things that sound fun to me but might be polarizing to others. 
      * Creating and maintaining an ant farm
      * Beekeeping
      * Learning falconry
      * Building your own log cabin in the woods
      * Living on a sailboat
      * Doing a triathlon
      * Owning ferrets
      * Getting my pilot‚Äôs license
      * Breaking the world record for the largest blanket fort
      * Murder mystery parties
      * Designing my own pants
      * Screen printing shirts
      * Learning to weld
      * Circling
      * Sensory deprivation tank
      * Climbing a mountain
Intellectual & Philosophical
My primary orientation to life is analytical. I desire to think clearly, and it‚Äôs important to me to be with someone who also values what I‚Äôd call ‚Äúintellectual hygiene‚Äù. I want to date someone who helps me to be a better thinker and a better truthseeker. Stress test my claims; point out when I'm getting sloppy and judge me for it. Keep me accountable. I know that all sounds fairly serious, but I‚Äôm hoping that means we can discuss ‚Äúbig‚Äù topics in a more generative and joyful way. You can, in principle, convince me of anything.
Growth-Minded
I have a healthy amount of ambition, but most of it is directed at self-improvement rather than status. I care less and less about winning a trophy and more about fostering new capabilities in myself, being able to create and do new things. My version of happiness, in short, is eudaimonia, continually striving to develop your own idiosyncratic excellence.


I don‚Äôt expect my partner to be exactly as ambitious, but I think a certain amount of restlessness will be needed. More will be appreciated. If striving disconcerts you, we may not be a good match. 
Playful, Whimsical, Enthusiastic 
I love, love games, of pretty much all kinds. I‚Äôm not good at them, but I love them. I think there‚Äôs something about the clearly defined rules and conditions my mind likes, especially when it comes to social games like Mafia. Chess and I are well-acquainted. I‚Äôm a big fan of improv. DnD is a core passion of mine. I‚Äôm competitive in games, meaning I won‚Äôt go easy on you, but I‚Äôm collaborative too. I think I‚Äôm really good at being deadly serious about silly things. I‚Äôm decidedly at my social best in a one on one conversation or an activity based hang. 
Quietly Romantic, Style-Conscious, Sensitive 
Unlike a lot of rat/EA-adjacent folks, I‚Äôm more word-cell than shape-rotater. My mental homebase has always been the verbal, and with that comes a kind of deep, gut-feeling appreciation for style. I think what it is is that my world-building and sense-creating muscles have grown (overly?) strong over a childhood of heavy reading. My feelings are quite sensitive to ideas, and so I‚Äôve become fascinated by how art manages to provoke those feelings.


You can always interest me in an in-depth discussion of a book, a movie, or a poem. I think it‚Äôs hot when people identify how they think the stylistic features of an art piece are or are not functioning. Some of my favorite books, The Art of Cruelty by Maggie Nelson, Touching Feeling by Eve Sedgwick, or Feel Free by Zadie Smith are just that, really detailed and thoughtful accounts of the human response to art. 


In terms of my own art practice, I write poetry from time to time and would like to eventually publish some essays and short stories. I draw at the level of a talented 13 year old. I‚Äôm not musical in any way, but I‚Äôm really into listening to it. I‚Äôll wax poetic on MF Doom as easily as Panic! At The Disco. Fashion-wise, I have often been told I have good style, but I guess that‚Äôs up for you to decide. 
Grounded, Cozy, Soft, Systematic
I know, I know. I‚Äôve talked a lot about striving and adventure, but to be honest, I‚Äôm also a big creature of comfort. A lot of my striving takes the form of personal projects, which I try to get  done in cozy environments ‚Äî my office, a cute coffee shop, a nice library. I really like the feeling of being in a room where everything has its place. I‚Äôm particularly partial to gothic, japandi, and rustic/log cabin interior design. I‚Äôm fond of Tudor houses. 


I love cuddling. One of my favorite things to do is to nap in a comfortable bed with someone else. Physical touch is definitely one of my biggest love languages. 
Miscellaneous Info 
Likes
* Perfectly ripe avocados
* Journaling in the morning with a cup of coffee by a medium-small body of water
* Adrienne Lenker lyrics
* Runner‚Äôs high
* When you surprise yourself using a word you just learned in a conversation
* Malapropisms
* Adventure Time
* Fauvism
* Brennan Lee Mulligan
* Tabletop role playing games
* Imagining the tenth dimension
* The poetry of Terence Hayes
* Bluets by Maggie Nelson
* Etymology
* Seeing a bird I've never seen before
* Poussin‚Äôs paintings
* Studying at research libraries like the State Library of New South Wales or The Reading Room at Brody
* Formal/Genre experiments
* This hotblack music video about good and evil
* Short stories
* The monologue at the end of Childish Gambino's Camp
* The Binding of Isaac (the game, not the biblical story)
* The films of Yorgos Lanthimos
* Indie websites
* On being the right size
* Micheal Cera
* Fiona Apple
* Rapping the entirety of an Earl Sweatshirt verse perfectly
* People Watching
* The look of shaved hair on a barbershop floor
* Tilda Swinton
* Self-referential lists 
Things you would think I'd like but I somehow don't
* Really big crowds
* Concerts/live-music events
* Zoos
* Star Trek
* Rock climbing (pretty neutral towards it honestly)
* Letterboxd
* Marvel Comics
* Basketball
Things you would think I don‚Äôt like but I really do
* Public speaking
* Carly Rae Jepsen
* Celine Dion
* The Sound of Music
* Disney movies
* McDonald‚Äôs Sausage EggMcMuffins 
Signs We Should Date
* You have a favorite philosopher
* You read Walden and thought wow I wish I could do something like that
* You have good, if unfounded, feelings about 70's era hippies
* You are currently reading a book 
* You love to discuss movies after you finish them
* You like board games
* Someone has accused you of having autism
My üö©
* I'm still really close with my best friend who happens to be my ex.
* I tend to be pretty independent & self-centered. I can occasionally come off as cold. I‚Äôm getting better at being more proactively community/other oriented. 
* I'm not very conscientious at all ‚Äî all of my executive functioning is hard won and I suspect they will disappoint you if you are naturally Type A
* My cat sleeps in the bed with me, which I objectively think is gross but I subjectively don't want it any other way.
* I can occasionally be pretty introverted. Hopefully you don't mind staying at home a couple weekends in a row? We‚Äôll do something big to make up for it. 
* I have a big family and they are pretty traditional and boisterous. Even I think they can be abrasive. They mean well, though. 
* I sleep a lot
* I‚Äôm not a great texter. Please call or email me!!
* I tend towards rugged minimalism. I‚Äôm a big saver. I hate spending on frivolous things. 
* I‚Äôm an atheist and more intolerant than I‚Äôd like to be towards sincere believers. 
* I read Infinite Jest and liked it.
* Big overthinker, intermittently in need of social reassurance 
* My humor tends to be bawdy and gross or absurdist and over-intellectual. I watched too much Adult Swim as a kid. 


Friend Reviews
‚ÄúKelechi is the perfect balance of intellectual, witty, comical, great sex and sincere.‚Äù ‚Äî My best friend/ex 


TBD
About You
TBD
A Day in Our Life
TBD
Call to Action
After reading all that, if you think we could be a good match (or you have a friend who might be), fill out my form, email me at knwankwoala2@gmail.com, walk up to me on the street and say ‚ÄúCome with me, Mr. President‚Äù, throw pebbles at my window, write me a poem, or send me a document like this of your own! (If you're not sure what to say, tell me about a favorite book or a thought that‚Äôs been on your mind.) If you‚Äôre uncertain, err on the side of getting in touch. I would say I don‚Äôt bite, but I do. ;)

About me
* pretty agreeable, harmony-seeking and trusting
* optimistic, excitable and enthusiastic 
   * I have a slight tendency to overshare and exaggerate and feel relatively little shame 
* I really appreciate wholesomeness and want to create more of it in my life (maybe something like this)
* I care a lot about long term physical and mental health and try optimizing my life for that. I aspire (and often succeed) to:

   * I can come off as a little shy and timid
* I suspect I have ADHD and am hoping to get diagnosed in January (mostly wanting access to the stimulants)


  
  
  



Hobbies
* reading romance/fantasy/romantasy, the occasional sci fi (authors like Brandon Sanderson, Andy Weir, Ali Hazelwood) 
* sewing, crafting, drawing (I like making pretty things that also serve a purpose/fix a problem)
* triathlon, bouldering, strength training, gymnastics, dancing
* making/listening to music, singing
* thinking about/working on programming or math puzzles 
* walking around and listening to a podcast or sitting around and reading blog posts
   * podcasts: clearer thinking, 80.000 hours, cognitive revolution, MLST, dwarkesh, lex, huberman
   * blogs: clearer thinking/spencer greenberg, ACX, don‚Äôt worry about the vase, less wrong
* I am sometimes overwhelmed and exhausted by choosing between all of the possible things to do and then I do bad things like watch youtube shorts or binge watch TV shows at 2x speed while playing spider solitaire


  
  



What I want to do with my life
* currently: studying cognitive science, math/machine learning, AI safety 
* eventually: do something within AI safety? Uncertain how far I can push myself in terms of skill‚Ä¶ But I want to explore my potential!
* effective altruism
   * apply my skills effectively to solve the world's most pressing problems (working on AI safety?)
   * I am pretty committed to giving 10% of my income to effective charities
* Ideally I want a big family (start having kids in the next 5 years, have up to 6 of them)
   * I have 4 younger siblings and a pretty great mother which made for an amazing childhood
   * reasons for having kids:
      * seems likely that I am very fit to be a mother/ the kind of person that would derive joy/meaning from the experience
      * it‚Äôs a fun experiment, I have a few ideas around ‚Äúoptimizing‚Äù childhood that I would like to test out
      * I just reeeeally want to
      * I am personally deeply grateful to my parents for having been born and expect to be able to provide a similar experience to my children
   * reasons against:
      * impending AI doom?
      * large resource investment (time, money) for relatively little positive impact on the world
      * having kids reduces quality of life maybe 


  
  



What I look for in a partner
* excited and knowledgeable about math/technical concepts 
* loves to learn
* open, transparent, direct
* kind and patient 
* into self optimization, ambitious
* health conscious (cares about sleep/ nutrition, active lifestyle)
* intelligent, analytical, rational
* open to having a lot of children (at least 4)


  
  
  



Why you should date me
You should date me because I‚Äôm kind, curious, funny and genuinely excited about building a meaningful life with someone. I care deeply about the people I‚Äôm close to and will always try to support and encourage them to be their best self. I want to work on myself and grow alongside a partner I can look up to. I‚Äôll bring warmth, honesty, and a lot of enthusiasm to our relationship, and I hope we can inspire each other to do our best.

Last edited 2024-12-09, best viewed on desktop


  
Hi! I‚Äôm Daniel Filan! Here are some basic things about me:
* Man
* 5‚Äô8‚Äù, ~170 lb
* Born March 1994
* Berkeley, CA
I‚Äôm looking for
* A woman
* ‚Ä¶ to (eventually) be in a committed relationship with
* ‚Ä¶ that ideally leads to having kids.
Interested? Email df@danielfilan.com, or reach out some other way (e.g. via twitter). Want to know more? Read on.
What I‚Äôm like
I work in the field of AI research‚Äîspecifically, research that aims to reduce the chance that AI takes over the world. At the moment I‚Äôm helping run a research internship program and helping manage the interns. I also make a podcast where I interview people in the field about their research.


At the moment, my main hobby is learning Latin. Other present and past hobbies include contra dancing, learning about the history of Christianity, and watching anime. I also try to do intense cardio exercise at least twice a week, and enjoy taking long walks (I recently walked 17 miles diagonally across San Francisco).


If I had to describe my general vibe, I would say that I‚Äôm academic-shaped. The thing I am best at is studying, and if I may flatter myself, I think I would make a good 60-year-old whose job was to be generally erudite and warm.
Testimonials
I‚Äôm bad at describing myself, so here are some friends‚Äô descriptions of me:


Asya Bergal (excerpts below, full testimonial here, bolding original):
Daniel is very (intentionally) funny, at least to me and a lot of people whose sense of humor isn‚Äôt too far from mine. IMO the best thing about Daniel is a mixture of being generative, funny, and low-ego that reliably makes me joyful (often laughing) and at   ease when I‚Äôm around him. I think he fosters this feeling to a really unusual extent among people I know, and I suspect the optimal long-term partner for Daniel will be someone who really likes that feeling and wants to live in it forever.
* [...] several individuals from different parts of my social network have unpromptedly expressed to me that they find Daniel very good to be around, including one who I think of as extremely judgmental and perceptive.


Eli Tyre:
Daniel Filan is among the top 10 highest integrity people that I know.


Q:
Daniel is interesting to talk to, he knows many things. I usually get a bit anxious around new people but did not feel that way when talking to Daniel - he seems nonjudgmental and is also occasionally funny :p


John Steidley:
Daniel is a fantastically passionate guy. He‚Äôs always interested in some new topic and learning everything about it. He‚Äôs funny. He‚Äôs cheerful. He‚Äôs a delight. It‚Äôs extremely rare to find him in a bad mood. 


Daniel stands up for what he believes in, but also admits his mistakes quickly and completely. He‚Äôs terrifically smart.
What I‚Äôm looking for
At a high level: intimate, reliable, and comfortable companionship that helps me grow in unexpected ways and can serve as a foundation for the rest of my life. But I think that‚Äôs pretty generic. So here are traits someone could have that I think predict I would get on well with them:
* Being analytical
* Being ambitious but also (at least somewhat) pro-social
* Being curious and open-minded
* Favouring bluntness and honesty, while trying to maintain tact
Compatibility
Here are some things about me that will maybe help you predict whether we‚Äôre compatible. They are ‚Äúthings about me that you may or may not want‚Äù, not things I‚Äôm asking of partners (except for the children + location entries).
* As mentioned above, I think I want kids. I‚Äôm not dead set on them, but they seem pretty cool, and in general I‚Äôve observed that my positive affect towards babies and children has grown a lot in the past 5 or so years.
* I live in the SF Bay Area. Moving for a relationship is not totally out of the question, but the bar for doing so is quite high.
* I‚Äôm asexual. I enjoy physical contact, but having sex doesn‚Äôt feel desirable or attractive to me.
   * I‚Äôm open to polyamorous relationship arrangements, but would want to be in a primary/committed role.
* I‚Äôm vegan, and disapprove of the consumption of meat, eggs, and dairy. I‚Äôm OK with being close with people who aren‚Äôt vegan, but I could imagine tension about how to raise any children, or if you think that non-human animal welfare obviously doesn‚Äôt matter.
* I don‚Äôt really drink alcohol or take other recreational intoxicants (which is to say: I do such things less than once a month, but not never).
* I am very politically libertarian.
* I‚Äôm active in the LessWrong and Effective Altruism communities, altho I would say I‚Äôm more of a LessWronger than an Effective Altruist.
* I sneeze extremely loudly‚Äîloud enough that I have one friend who is genuinely seriously bothered by it (but not so loud that I have more than one such friend (well, as far as I know)).
   * If you don‚Äôt have misophonia, I think this will probably not be a deal-breaker.
* I don‚Äôt believe in God. I‚Äôm interested in the phenomenon of religion, but don‚Äôt recommend practicing it.
 I am normal and can be trusted with babies.   More photos of me
  ________________
‚ÄòFun‚Äô facts about me
* I grew up in Australia. My accent is predominantly general American, but retains a few Australian characteristics (e.g. the way I say ‚Äúno‚Äù).
* The caption on the previous page, while funny, is literally true: I am extremely bad at purposely smiling in photos.
* I can, in my head, approximately calculate the factorials of large numbers, but it takes me an unimpressive amount of time.
   * You can too by memorizing Stirling‚Äôs approximation and a few base-ten logarithms.
* I wrote the sentence that Wiktionary uses to illustrate the use of the word ‚Äúscrutable‚Äù.
* I came up with what I believe is the worst unparalleled misalignment yet found‚Äîspecifically, it was used by the creator of the art form as an example of the epitome of un-funniness and torturedness.
   * It‚Äôs Los Angeles // newspaper comics.
* The reason I got around to actually writing this date me doc is that I told someone I would pay them $200 if I didn‚Äôt publish one by a certain date. The reason I did that is that I told the same person I would pay them $100 if, by a certain date, I didn‚Äôt arrange to make a deal to pay them >$100 if I didn‚Äôt publish a date-me doc by a     certain date.

ProfileText:

Hi, I‚Äôm Hussein üëã
I‚Äôm 38, 5‚Äô8‚Äù, bi, and I live in Boston, MA. I‚Äôm playful, reflective, and caring; I‚Äôm Uncle Hussein and godparent to two kids I love, I have an amazing cat, I do community work, etc; just a normal, stand-up guy with zero skeletons in the closet and absolutely no aspirations to start a personality cult or anything weird like that.
There are two things I‚Äôm working on right now that are very important to me:
Living in a city I love;
Finding a life partner.
For the first: I‚Äôve lived in Boston for 11 years. It‚Äôs been a good run, but I‚Äôve recently realized that living here doesn‚Äôt make me happy. I grew up in London and there‚Äôs something about living in a
very
big city that makes me feel energized and alive. I‚Äôm fortunate enough to be financially secure, so it‚Äôs time to make that happen.
So: right now my best plan is
moving back to London around June 2025
.
This means that finding a life partner is most likely going to happen one of two ways:
I'm willing to change my plans for the right person
. I
do
want to live in a big city, but as long as the energy is right, that could be any number of places. London and NYC are the obvious ones, but there might be others: Chicago? Paris? Tokyo?
I'm open to moving somewhere else for a few months to try it and see. At the time of writing (Dec '24), NYC is currently a candidate for this.
I realize that "embark on a relationship with somebody about to take a big life decision" is daunting, and I don't blame anyone who doesn't want to take that on.
On the other hand, maybe the location does line up... and if you think we might be compatible, why not give it a shot? üôÇ
You live in or around London; or you're London-curious and could imagine potentially making it home.
I will be visiting to figure out logistics a few times before I move, so there'll be opportunities to meet up then, and we can start getting to know each other meanwhile.
The sort of person I am
On bad days I think I‚Äôm a good person because I‚Äôm funny and clever.
On good days I think I‚Äôm a good person because I‚Äôm open-hearted, playful, and kind.
On the best days I don‚Äôt think about whether I‚Äôm a good person at all.
I recently combined a list of goals and the things I like to do, and they seemed to fall into four values: connection, curiosity, beauty, and vitality.
If you are sick I will make soup and bring it to you. It‚Äôs an important way I show love.
Some things I like to do:
Outdoorsy / light-active stuff: climbing, walking, fair-weather sailing, easy cycling (no lycra);
Growing food - I built raised beds in my garden, and love the fresh tomatoes I get from it;
DIY and making stuff - I‚Äôve made plenty of the things in my house, including furniture and drapery;
Cooking, restaurants, cocktails (though I rarely drink these days);
Any classical music concert featuring an angsty Russian Romantic composer;
Self-expression things: ecstatic dance, finally taking singing lessons.
I worked in tech for 15+ years and one thing it is easy to do is separate oneself from people unlike you. To work and live and play in communities of people very similar to you, or to have the ‚Äúdiversity‚Äù you experience look like skin color and sexuality and gender id but not wealth or class or education. It is deeply, vitally important to me to
not
do this, to stay connected to and in touch and aware of the way others live. We may be better off but we are not better. I will not separate myself from humanity.
My vice is hookah. If I had one at home I‚Äôd instantly die of lung cancer, so I don‚Äôt. But I keep finding that the best people I know are down to go to a hookah bar. Doesn‚Äôt have to be you, but it‚Äôs an easy way to get a ü§© face from me.
I want one of these. This one is someone else's, but I love her anyway.
The sort of future I want
I believe a life of weeping-with-happiness contentment is possible, and I want it.
[Update: since writing that, I have wept with happiness.]
I would like to co-create a life - location, partner, friends, community (which I see as another word for ‚Äúfamily‚Äù) - at a more sustainable pace, where exploration and flourishing is nurtured. I value making sure people are fed: I‚Äôve volunteered making meals for chronically sick people, and also helped run a mutual aid food drive for two years. I want to spend more of my time tackling food insecurity and I‚Äôve got Big Plans to do so.
I‚Äôd like to have kids, and be active in raising them. I think I‚Äôd make an amazing trophy husband, which is only a joke if you‚Äôre not rich. Meanwhile, I‚Äôve still got more travelling in me: more time in Japan, interior China, a return to Istanbul, and Iran are all on my bucket list. I seem to be converging on India from both directions.
Spirituality
I used to be allergic to the word until a friend pointed out ‚Äúdude, you have a spirit, it‚Äôs the thing that makes you you‚Äù, and then I was fine.
The condensed version of my spiritual biography: I grew up Muslim, but quit in my early twenties because I felt like I couldn‚Äôt do it well enough. I came close to falling down the New Atheism rabbithole, but dodged it; in my late twenties I began a quest for capital-M Meaning, which I finally found after lots of therapy and years of Zen practice.
Buddhism has been important to me for approaching a decade. Buddhist philosophy and psychology is very much a part of who I am, how I think, and how I like to relate to the world. An example: when I filed for US citizenship, I asked for a waiver to the Oath of Allegiance on the grounds of not wanting to support the military, even though being 38 means there‚Äôs basically no chance I‚Äôll get drafted.
It‚Äôs important to me that my partner has their own self-development practice - something that helps them be freer, kinder, and more open. It by no means has to be Buddhist flavoured.
Potential dealbreakers
I‚Äôm happy to talk about any of these if you‚Äôd like to know more.
I would like to have children (at least one), preferably biological.
I am open to a
very
secure relationship unfolding into something monogam
ish
, if it feels right. The thing I really care about is the ‚Äúvery secure relationship‚Äù part: I think a relationship with good grounding, and the right effort and intention, will become whatever it should.
I pair better with someone who also has good executive function skills. Being able to trust a partner to get things done makes me feel taken care of, and gives me a profound feeling of relief and safety.
I am politically far to the left. That said, I have largely disengaged with US politics and treat it solely as a spectacle. These days I am more of an anarchist, by which I mean I believe that community building and mutual aid is worthwhile and morally necessary.
If you think Israel‚Äôs occupation and treatment of Palestine is in any way conscionable or justifiable, I am not the person for you.
I‚Äôm an only child, and have minimal to no contact with both of my parents. My family is thus entirely chosen. If you‚Äôre close to yours, I would love to become part of it.
I have
a (really, really, really amazing) cat
. If you viscerally hate cats, or have overwhelming allergies, that‚Äôd make it hard.
I am vegetarian, with very occasional and intentional exceptions. I don‚Äôt mind whether you are or not. I do enjoy cooking, and will want to cook for you, so if you‚Äôll feel slighted by me not putting meat on your plate then‚Ä¶ eh, I dunno.
What next?
This is the end of the text-heavy part. Thank you for sticking around!
There are a few places you can go from here:
Look at
pictures of my cat
Look at
an assortment of pictures and videos from my life
If you‚Äôre interested, or have something to say, email me:
hello@thiswebsite
Thanks, and I hope you find what you‚Äôre looking for too. ‚ù§
[back to top]

GitHub Pages
and
Reverie

Name: Tara
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate me[1] ü¶ù


Versi√≥n en espa√±ol




Quick details & trivia
Age: 34
Location: Barcelona, Spain
Looking for: a relationship based on mutual compatibility and connection (with man or woman)
Personality type (Myers-Briggs): INFP-T
Zodiac sign: Virgo
Favorite dish: chicken curry
Favorite movie: Pocahontas
Favorite series: Sense8 & Game of Thrones
Best thing about me: I have empathy and care about others
Worst thing about me: I am always hesitant and scared of making mistakes so I end up not doing many things that I‚Äôd like to do

About me
Hello, (whoever is reading this)!üëã I am an introverted and shy girl trying to meet new people over here. I generally have a hard time starting off conversations, but I can be friendly and nice once I manage to get over the initial awkwardness. I appreciate quality time spent together, deep conversations and shared laughter, especially if they are over a cup of tea or good food. 
I decided to create this file because the idea of Date Me Docs seemed old-schoolish in a cute, nerdy way (in other words, quite appealing, especially in contrast to the shallowness of dating apps). Why not? Maybe the right person for me might be out there reading this doc right now. 
Here are some random facts you may want to know about me:
* I am a bit childish: I use colorful fineliners when I write in hand and add many emojis when I type; and I like doing stuff like watching animated movies, singing karaoke and wearing costumes on Carnival ü§™
* I am in the autism spectrum (feel free to ask if you want to know more).
* I have a driving license but it‚Äôs been years since I last drove a car.
* I struggle with time management, but I hate it when someone is late.
* I have moved 5 times over the last 6-7 years.
* I can say ‚ÄúI love you‚Äù in 18 different languages üòè
* I LOVE eating ramen and sushi (in case you don‚Äôt have any date ideas‚Ä¶ ü§≠)


Why no picture?
Two words: privacy concerns. I do not feel very keen on the idea of my picture being available online for anyone to see. However, I will be happy to share my picture with you privately if you reach me out. For now, I can broadly say that I am Caucasian, a brunette, small-sized (short and thin) and that I wear glasses. So I would look something (very approximately) like this avatar:
  



My hobbies
* Books. I love reading and immersing myself in a good story. I wouldn‚Äôt say that I stick to a particular genre, but I like historical fiction and fantasy most of all. Just let me know if you want any recommendations üòâ
* Languages. Apart from English, I can speak Catalan, Spanish and Russian. Now I am learning Turkish too and I also have some basic knowledge of Hindi and Italian. So if you speak any of these languages, we might as well have a language exchange üòâ
* Movies. Yes, I know, that‚Äôs typical, but who doesn‚Äôt love lying on the sofa with a blanket and watching a good (or not so good) movie? Btw, Disney/Pixar movies are among my favorites üòä
* Going to the theater, museums‚Ä¶ anything cultural.
*  Writing. I am not going to share my texts with anyone for now, but I can say I am working on a historical-romantic novel that might (or might not) be completed some day.
* Traveling. Yes, I know this is controversial and I myself have some mixed feelings about this one because of how everything nowadays seems to revolve around taking selfies and posting how cool you are on Instagram. However, I still like to explore different places and cultures, and it would be great if we could have that passion in common. Some countries on my bucket list: Laos, Cambodia, Morocco, Iceland, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Peru, Bolivia, Uzbekistan üòè


What I‚Äôm looking for
Essentially, I‚Äôm looking for someone I can have a mid-to-long-term, caring and nurturing relationship with. I am not interested in long-distance, open or polyamorous relationships (yup, I am a traditional girl), so we might not be well-suited for each other if you don‚Äôt live close to Barcelona or are looking for that kind of thing.
What I ask for in a partner:

1. You must be an honest, humble and wholesome person. Yes, that is a strict must, but I think it‚Äôs the bare minimum you can ask from a human being.
2. Having an open mind. While I have my own political views and values, and it would be great if we align on those, we will not always agree on everything, and that is perfectly fine as long as we respect each other‚Äôs views. Of course, I draw the line at homophobia, racism, fascism and any sort of bigotry or discrimination.
3. Being independent. And by that I mean that both you and I can make plans on our own (we do not have to always do everything together) and that you are able to make your own decisions and have your own thoughts besides what your friends, parents, etc. might tell you. Oh, and being able to do basic tasks like doing laundry, washing dishes or making a simple meal.
4. Having some sort of intellectual curiosity. I am generally a quiet person, but I do like to talk about things I‚Äôm interested in and to have deep conversations about life, society, geopolitics, psychology, etc. And if you have a particular hobby or interest or enjoy a specific activity, please do share it with me! I love learning new things üòä


What I value in a relationship
I strongly believe that you need to be (best) friends with the person you‚Äôre dating. While attraction is a necessary ingredient in a relationship, especially at the beginning, I would never consider dating someone I don‚Äôt trust or someone who is not genuinely interested in hearing how my day went. So‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs build that trust and that connection together, shall we?
If you feel like talking to me, you can drop me a line either on my email, Facebook or Telegram.
________________
[1] Only if you want, of course!
