Name: Sonia Albrecht
ProfileText:
Ôªø* Cis female, 5‚Äô8‚Äù, 37, living in Oakland, California, looking to date men or fairly masculine non-binary people. Most likely ambiamorous. I would equally love a life with kids or without kids. I never could have biokids, so there‚Äôs no rush. I prefer surrogacy over adopting from foster care. I‚Äôm an electronics engineering student. I‚Äôm passionate about earning to give, and hope to work on projects that make the world a better place. 
* I want to learn everything about everything from everyone. My biggest goal when I go to a party is to change my mind about something important, and people often say I‚Äôm unusually good at it, even for a rationalist/EA. The Effective Altruism movement means many different things to different EAs, but the most important thing it means to me is open-mindedness. I feel possibly my most alive when I‚Äôm having a conversation with someone whose beliefs I find deeply harmful, about those beliefs. Their wisdom illuminates so many flaws in my reasoning that I miss when I stay in my bubble. I have a preference for dating people so different from me that most people would consider these attributes dealbreakers, because it allows me to experience moments of adventure like this that I so cherish. I‚Äôve happily made huge sacrifices to live a life on the frontiers of human understanding. I‚Äôm looking for someone who also loves learning with all their heart.
* I spend a lot of my free time studying social science through a rationalist/EA lens, and  am looking for someone to geek out with about it. I do things like multiply my vote by maybe an order of magnitude by developing expertise in down-ballot elections, and get so excited about theories of malthusian economics and the evolution of morality that I start writing a novel to explore it. 
* I adore tabletop RPGs, where I particularly enjoy coming up with creative solutions to problems, practicing the art of writing, and watching my friend‚Äôs personalities shine. 
* I often attend authentic relating events; I would be especially thrilled to date someone else who sees each individual human being‚Äôs uniqueness as one of the most beautiful mysteries of the universe, and can‚Äôt wait to meet each other at the heart of that enigma.
* I‚Äôm very agentic; Through persistent hard work, I overcame tremendous disadvantages, vaulting from the American underclass to the upper class. I think there is a good probability my difficult life for someone in our community was worth it because it made me more compassionate, tough, grateful, open-minded, and insightful than I otherwise would have been.
* I‚Äôm a lovely intense synthesis of cold culture and deeply caring about people‚Äôs wellbeing, both near to me and far away.
* I am quite into BDSM, and am looking for someone who enjoys being sexually dominant.
  

Some things that sound like a great date to me:
* We attend a meeting together of a community that has very different values from us (Conservative religious? Neo-Nazi? Communist?) and process it afterwards over a cheap meal, ultimately discovering a new truth about humanity.
* We circle together, and discover fundamental parts of each other that we didn‚Äôt even know ourselves well enough to name.
* We take a walk where we come alive talking about moments of intense beauty we are witnessing. Sewers saving lives? Plump produce in a grocery store out of an ancestor‚Äôs vision of heaven? Oncoming traffic lights shining like stars?
* We find the things we disagree most strongly on and work to overcome our human frailty together until we each realize we are wrong in some way about one of our most deeply held beliefs.
* More civilized dates are also wonderful! I‚Äôm a big fan of dinner dates; I love adventure, and what could be more adventurous than a couple weirdos going wherever their curiosity takes them?
  

I have a deep passion for self-improvement. In addition to traditional rationalist techniques like reading about research on cognitive biases, I often do this through my Christianity. This is the kind of Christian I am: I believe God doesn‚Äôt care whether people are Christian or not, love dating non-Christians, and would be happy to raise my child(ren) non-Christian if it was important to my partner. My church is majority queer, I am unusually sex-forward even among rationalists, and otherwise violate all the common stereotypes I have encountered in our community about Christians. I‚Äôm Christian because these practices have proven more effective for me for becoming a better rationalist than the methods that work better for others. I want to eliminate every part of me that isn‚Äôt maximally truth seeking and replace it with that which is. I utilize the tools that maximize my efficiency in this endeavor. I‚Äôm looking for someone just as passionate about becoming a more moral version of themselves. 
  

What people close to me think:
‚ÄúSonia is a rare outlier in openness, both to new ideas and experiences. To me she‚Äôs tagged as both brave and thoughtful, and self-aware enough to hold onto her boundaries. Lots of charity and empathy along with high decoupling ability‚Äù - Damon
‚ÄúSonia is steadfastly positive, uplifting, and always sees the bright side of things when others might complain. She can have a conversation with seemingly anyone and have a great time.‚Äù       - Dmitriy
"I've found Sonia to be really thoughtful and kind. She seems to think deeply about issues and has a bunch of really original takes. She's also been very consistent about prioritizing global welfare." -Ozzie
  

  

If I interest you, please contact me at salbrecht314@gmail.com

Name: Arun
ProfileText:
Ôªø________________


üëã Hello, There!
Hey! I‚Äôm Arun‚Äîa curious, down-to-earth, and slightly adventurous person who loves a good story, whether it‚Äôs through anime, a great book, or a meaningful conversation. Born and raised in a [describe your cultural background if you‚Äôd like], I work in digital marketing and graphic design at New Horizon International School, where I manage social media and create engaging visuals.
If you‚Äôve ever wanted someone to bring both creativity and warmth to the table, well, here I am!
________________


üåü Who Am I?
* Professionally: I‚Äôm passionate about visual storytelling and connecting people through social media. I‚Äôm working on sharpening my skills with a digital marketing course soon‚Äîjust to make things even more interesting!
* Personally: My friends describe me as someone who balances humor with a sincere side, open-minded but family-oriented. In my free time, you‚Äôll likely catch me watching anime, experimenting in the kitchen, or reading up on new strategies and design trends. I‚Äôm also trying to brush up on Telugu!
* Fun Fact: My dream vacation involves exploring quiet places with lots of greenery, hidden cafes, and a beach nearby. And, oh‚ÄîI've recently developed a knack for making someone‚Äôs heart skip unintentionally. üí´
________________


üß° Things I Love
* Books & Shows: Currently hooked on Devilman Crybaby and exploring different anime series. I‚Äôm always up for book recommendations!
* Cooking: I love cooking up delicious meals‚Äîwithout sugar, though. My go-to dishes? Pancakes with tropical fruits like pineapple and mango (because I‚Äôm not a fan of dates or bananas).
* Family & Traditions: I come from a ‚Äúbrown family‚Äù where saying ‚ÄúI love you‚Äù isn‚Äôt the norm, but we show our care in countless small ways. I‚Äôve got a soft spot for people who cherish their loved ones and stay connected to their roots.
* Exploration & Learning: From career switches to language learning, I‚Äôm all about embracing new experiences and growing through them.
________________


üå± What I‚Äôm Looking For
I‚Äôm hoping to connect with someone who‚Äôs kind, curious, and has a great sense of humor. Someone who can laugh at life‚Äôs little quirks but knows how to dig deep into the meaningful things too. If you value growth, aren‚Äôt afraid to be yourself, and can appreciate a guy who sometimes gets sentimental, we might just be a good match!
Open to long-distance connections, but I‚Äôd like us to have a vision of how things could work in the future. Also, I‚Äôm all about mixing up the love languages to keep things balanced and exciting.
________________


üé≤ Fun Facts & Quirky Questions
* If I could have any animal as a pet, it would be‚Ä¶ an owl‚Äîwise and just a little mysterious.
* Guilty Pleasure Song: I may or may not secretly vibe to a few ‚Äò90s Bollywood classics. It‚Äôs all about the nostalgia!
* Random Skill: I can make event stories on Instagram that you can‚Äôt scroll past. Let‚Äôs just say, I‚Äôve mastered the art of the attention-grabbing caption.


Contact me on: arun1994nair@gmail.com

Name: Amaryllis
ProfileText:
ÔªøAbout me
* Software engineer at big tech company. Rust dev, with interest in LLM interpretability and AVX-512. I love `vpternlog` and `vgf2p8affineqb`.
* Location: Vancouver WA/Portland Oregon, but long term flexible, preferably west coast
* 27 years old, 5ft 9in/175cm, 135lb/60kg.
* Affiliations with which I probably have disagreements, but are likely still useful to understand me: Effective Altruism, LessWrong, Rationalist, SSC/ACX, Episcopalian flavored atheist
* Hobbies: reading, writing, cooking, wood working, photography, walking in the forest
* Media: Mushishi, Haibane Renmei, Shoujo Shuumatsu Ryokou, Madoka, To the Stars, Nichijou, Planecrash, Unsong, HPMoR
* Enjoys snuggles, long walks in the forest, and long intellectual discussions.


I grew up in a house with a few thousand books in a forest. My parents mostly home schooled me, and I read inordinate quantities of books growing up. Having spent the last ~decade of my life focused on career advancement and saving money, I am now in a position to turn my attention to the next few decades/remainder of my life.


I enjoy cooking, and will happily make you good food. While I am reluctant to be strictly vegan due to health concerns, I am happy to optimize in an animal suffering reducing direction.


I am interested in a long term monogom-ish relationship, but am poly compatible if needed. Given an interest in, and non-zero hope of, living to see the sun burn down, I am somewhat reluctant to commit to anything for the rest of my life, but for the right person, I would be happy to commit to stay together for the next 100 years.








Interested in raising children


Children are important. I think my parents did a good job of raising me, but I want to do even better. I strongly want to be a ~full time parent for at least the first ~decade of my children's life. While I am undecided on exact optimal schooling arrangement, I do feel strongly that pure public school is significantly sub-optimal.
Retroactive matchmaking reward (If you yourself are not interested in dating me, but know someone who you think would be a good fit for me):
I place significant value on a long term stable relationship. If I end up in a multi-year close romantic relationship primarily as a result of your intervention, I will pay you no less than $10,000. (Likely more, depending on details.)




About you
* Enjoys cuddling and long intellectual conversations
* Wants to make the world a better place
* Is OK listening to occasional info dumps about cool things I am learning
* Likes to infodump about the cool things you are learning
* Is interested in spending a significant part of the next few decades raising children together with me, and trying to make the world better in whatever small ways we can.


If you think you may be a good match, wish to introduce a potential match, or want to talk for some other reason, please feel free to contact me:
* email: am8ryllis@gmail.com
* Discord: @am8ryllis




________________


Endorsements (from https://manifold.love/Amaryllis )
WithODEConstraints:
Technically minded and can smile incredibly brightly when caught off guard by a genuine compliment. She has cute custom cat ears.
Izzy:
This is my girlfriend who I love very much! She is a very good listener, very non judgmental and open minded, and is overall a very unique and cool person.
Alyssa:
Has lots of cool projects-in-progress in lots of interesting domains, including but not limited to code-related ones, and pretty consistently happy to infodump about them. Cooks good food. Has read and watched lots of interesting books and anime, and fun to chat with about those. Good at rubber-ducking when pursuing projects of my own. In general, is both enjoyable and ~productive to interact with.


Additional information and pictures:
First date options:
* Go for a walk in a park together
* Visit my place and I cook you tasty food.
* Visit your place and you cook whatever food you like. (I will eat most anything.)
* Hike in the forest together
* Ride segways together around the local park
* Watch some mutually enjoyable film together.
* Probably a variety of other mutually enjoyable activities!
  
  

The cat ears are optional, but I am quite fond of goats.

Name: Wiggles!
ProfileText:
ÔªøRelationship Goals
Contact Info
More About Me  
  
________________
  
  
  



Relationship Goals
I‚Äôm Wiggles!, a curious adventurous outdoorsy energetic enthusiastic 37-year-old straight cis Bay Area woman who‚Äôs seeking a lifelong, child-free, monogam-ISH partnership[1] with a man who‚Äôs committed to growing, learning, laughing, exploring, and doing some good in the world together.


  

This is the only type of kid I want


Let‚Äôs co-create a union wherein we mutually challenge each other‚Äôs minds, see into each other‚Äôs souls, and worship at the altar of one another‚Äôs body. A connection wherein both parties are committed to growth and practicing the art of love on a daily basis.


I have periodically taken career breaks to globe-trot and spend time in awe-inspiring natural landscapes; and would love to continue to do so with my mate. This would require that you be in a similarly financially stable position as me.


If you give my brain a boner, the rest of my body can follow. Hit me up if you wanna skip the small talk[2] in favor of meaningful conversations on the trail, at the beach, or in bed.


Your character matters to me. Your height genuinely doesn‚Äôt.


Contact Me
If you‚Äôre thinking to yourself, ‚ÄúI bet the most direct way to get into her pants is by filling out a form,‚Äù then you‚Äôre damn right.


I could probably beat you at
Pun competitions
  



6 things I could never do without
1. Snuggles! Preferably with humans and doggos, but a highly affectionate cat will do in a pinch üôÇ


  
 
If I were a cephalopod, I'd be a cuddle-fish.


2. Feeling wonderment and smallness in gorgeous natural settings.


3. Vegan meals. A way to my heart and other parts is through my belly. (You don‚Äôt necessarily have to be vegan yourself, though.)


4. Laughing so hard it starts to hurt, and inducing said laughter in others.


  

My underground improv performance at BART Basel


5. The pursuit of self-improvement.


6. The type of intimate connection wherein one feels fully seen, valued, appreciated, held, and empowered to become the best version of themselves.


The first thing people notice about me
I‚Äôm a total nerd. And a total dork. And totally love it.
  

You can call me Babe-raham Lincoln


A day in our life
Note: While this is cribbed from my days right now, I'm very much interested in collaborating with my partner, and would love your input on what you'd like our life together to look like.


Waking up to you caressing my body. Time and space seem to disappear as our bodies entwine; there‚Äôs only us; our souls dancing together in the ether.


We have an ongoing competition between us of who can make the other laugh harder. I thought I'd already defeated you before we even started making breakfast, but by the end of the meal we‚Äôre clearly tied.


Hopping in the car to hit the trailhead. You start playing a lecture from one of The Great Courses, and I periodically pause the recording to discuss what we‚Äôre learning together.


Meeting up with our friends for a hike through a beautiful location. You‚Äôve brought gloves for everyone so we can pick up litter we spot along the trail. We take goofy pictures. The group conversations alternate between being silly/funny and profound/vulnerable/informative.


  



Joining our friends for an epic post-hike meal. Food always tastes better when shared and after your body has worked for it!


Heading home for a quick rinse/make out session in the shower before we split up to do our own thing for the evening.


I eventually head back into our bedroom for my nightly wind-down ritual of putting my phone to bed, silently reading, writing in my journal, meditating, brushing my teeth, and changing into cozy pajamas.


Eventually you wrap up whatever cool thing you were doing and crawl into bed as well, and we snuggle while exchanging gratitudes and setting intentions for the next day. As we drift off to sleep our limbs are once again interdigitated, and the world feels like a calm and serene and lovely place.


________________
[1] I could also be open to a polyamorous lifestyle, but am not looking to date poly men who already have primary partners.


[2] Let's instead talk about: relationship goals, commitments, how to better the world, passions, philosophies, lies we‚Äôve told, science, psychology, the quantified self, enlightenment, paradoxes, projects we could work on together, embarrassing stories, epiphanies, bucket list items, lessons learned from previous relationships and other experiences, patriarchy, your personal definition of "god", economics, culture, why you're optimistic about the future, hermeneutics, animal intelligence, history, escaping the rat race, traditions, the most impactful book you've ever read, role models, habits, the awe of the cosmos, the awe of humanity‚Äôs place within the cosmos, rituals, friendships, altered states, sexuality, what makes you want to jump out of bed in the morning and take on the day, consciousness, social cohesion, anything in my profile, anything in your profile, and whatever else fascinates us.

Date Blake
Welcome to my online dating profile, which I created for friends to set me up with their friends. It‚Äôs also open to you, random internet person. ‚Äú
dateblake.com
‚Äù redirects here.
What‚Äôs this about?
I‚Äôm looking for a relationship! Like, a serious relationship. A Big Relationship. While I met all my previous loves through organic/IRL activities, I‚Äôm open to connecting with someone online. Maybe that‚Äôs you! üò±üíò
Let‚Äôs go.
Table of contents
Why am I so weird?
What am I looking for?
What can I offer?
How would we actually get to know each other, Mister Nomad?
A few references, real and otherwise.
Okay, interesting‚Ä¶
My face in the Dolomites, Sept 2024
Why am I so weird?
Because weird is the only way to be! But perhaps you mean
desperate
, because I have my own dating page? I don‚Äôt see this as an act of desperation, rather an intentional experiment in service of
ONE OF LIFE‚ÄôS BIGGEST DECISIONS
.
Algorithms dictate enough of our lives already‚Äîlooking at you, Discover Weekly‚Äîand the apps are full of too many
Perfectly Nice Normal People
craving
Perfectly Nice Normal Lives
.
I‚Äôm weird in many ways. Ever since I was a child, I‚Äôve had an active imagination and voracious intellect. A few good books and
unconventional
mentors
radically influenced my young adult trajectory. I‚Äôve lived much of my life in community, in nature, on the road, and as a guest. (
This
is a fairly typical Blake-year.) I‚Äôm fueled by big projects, new horizons, and deep connections. Normal jobs, homes, and relationships aren‚Äôt exactly my thing. So here I am, seeking a partner-in-crime in my own weird way.
The links go to my
writing
, evidence of my
particular
brand
of
weirdness
.
Running on the Tahoe Rim Trail, 2023
What am I looking for?
I‚Äôll offer a few concrete details and then describe the spirit of the thing.
Details:
You‚Äôre a fit, strong, outdoorsy woman. You have pooped in the woods.
You have pooped in the woods!
You‚Äôre in a good financial position: bills don‚Äôt stress you out each month, giving you options in life, not just obligations. You have solo traveled abroad.
You have solo traveled abroad!
You‚Äôve found an interesting way to earn money doing something meaningful. Your work doesn‚Äôt dominate your life, and you enjoy
time wealth
. You‚Äôre a lover of ideas who reads books, listens to podcasts, and debates with friends. You may or may not want kids, or already have them. You‚Äôre not entangled with an ex. Your age probably begins with a ‚Äú3.‚Äù You‚Äôre ready for something real‚Äînot necessarily forever, but real.
Spirit:
Rarely have you felt like you ‚Äúfit in‚Äù anywhere in particular. It‚Äôs hard to stay settled, because you know how big the world is, and you want to experience it. Friendships matter deeply to you, as do the people you serve. You have a profound relationship with nature which cannot play second fiddle to city life for very long. You‚Äôre not looking for someone to complete you, as you are already complete. Your other, non-romantic relationships could genuinely sustain you. But you see romantic partnership as another great adventure, one you don‚Äôt want to miss. You have a long-standing orientation toward freedom, both for yourself and your partner. Freedom inclines you toward commitment.
With my brother in Buenos Aires, March 2024
What can I offer?
Great conversation, moral support, foot/back rubs, mountain adventure partnership, co-counseling in the style of ‚Äúwhy
not
attempt this seemingly crazy but delicious idea?‚Äù, creative collaboration, spontaneous dances, quiet evenings reading together on a couch, winters spent together in sunny places, petting cats on the street, plenty of time+space to do your own thing‚Äîand tacos, so many tacoooos! üåÆüåÆüåÆ
Maybe
a co-parent who seriously buys into the ‚Äútravel the world with kids‚Äù notion.
Maybe
a child-free partner who nonetheless enjoys hanging with friends‚Äô kids and taking them on amazing adventures. 100%: a trustworthy, high-stoke, sun-loving, cheery-optimistic California boy.
Mama always said, ‚Äúdate a boy who can dance.‚Äù Evidence:
1
/
2
How would we actually get to know each other, Mister Nomad?
Valid question! Wouldn‚Äôt it be nice if we lived in the same place and could casually meet like
NORMAL PEOPLE?
Alas, unlikely to happen. So here‚Äôs my next best idea.
First,
a
videochat
. No expectations! Let‚Äôs just assume we‚Äôll have a nice conversation and become friends, acquaintances, or two charming, oddly good-looking ships passing in the night. If we vibe, more videochats.
If vibes are
strong
, we craft
a mutually exciting plan to meet
. This could be me visiting you, you visiting me, or both of us meeting someplace new, for a few days to a few weeks. Did you ever read
The craziest OkCupid date ever
? It‚Äôs an inspiring (and admittedly extreme) blueprint for what‚Äôs possible. Even if it ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt work out,‚Äù we both have a fun story to tell our friends:
We ended our journey after eight countries, 3,500 miles and 21 days in the same clothes. Our romantic relationship intact, Jeff and I boarded the Heathrow return flight as closer friends than ever (despite the questionable state of our undergarments). Materially speaking I was as empty-handed as the day we started, but I actually carried a great deal back home across the Atlantic. Traveling with no luggage and no plans was much more than a minimalist lesson in living well with less. It was an intense, in-your-face invitation to the unknown. There‚Äôs a truly magnificent side to the unknown, but we aren‚Äôt taught how to welcome it, let alone explore the breadth of its possibilities.
After this point,
we are two adults who figure things out
.
I‚Äôm genuinely open to creating a life in many different parts of the world‚Äîas long as it‚Äôs not the same place all the time!
Cycling with friends on the Carretera Austral, 2024
A few references, real and otherwise.
Some years ago, I asked close friends to write
dating endorsements
, which are like job references but far more entertaining.¬† üëâüèΩ
Here‚Äôs what they said
üëàüèΩ
And here are some
fictional references from my exes
, which I wrote:
E1
: ‚ÄúBlake‚Äôs a lot of fun, and very enthusiastic. He can also fall in love awfully quickly. Maybe dial down the romanticism from a 10 to a 7?‚Äù
E2
: ‚ÄúIt was pretty easy to live with Blake. I was also flexibly self-employed, and it was nice to spend time together when others were working 9-to-5. He helped me with my art shows. It kinda sucked when he went away for multiple months on those teen trips. He‚Äôs got some sort of addiction to the mountains, like it‚Äôs some core part of his identity. He judged me for not being ‚Äòadventurous‚Äô enough. Get over yourself, man.‚Äù
E3
: ‚ÄúBlake and I fell for each other despite living on different continents. We loved going to dances together. In the beginning it was invigorating, but eventually I realized that he‚Äôs probably never, ever, going to settle down. I wanted to have a rather normal life in a single place, while he wanted to live in some magical land of infinite possibility, sunshine, and chocolate. I do appreciate the effort he put into establishing a friendship after we broke up. Dating Blake could be chaotic, but it was a meaningful, memorable kind of chaos.‚Äù
E4
: ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a great cycle touring partner. He‚Äôll cook for you and clean your kitchen afterwards. And it‚Äôs fun to work on creative projects together. Beyond that, I‚Äôm not sure what to say. He‚Äôs got a bit too much time on his hands.‚Äù
Another great lurking opportunity:
TikTok
!
Desolation Wilderness, California, 2021
Okay, interesting‚Ä¶
Where do we go from here?
You‚Äôre welcome to reach out directly (üìßyourstruly@blakeboles.com), but you‚Äôre also invited to
email my friend Julie
(üìß mcp.julie@gmail.com).
Julie and I have known each other for 20+ years. She‚Äôs a long-time adventure/travel buddy, former co-worker,
x
-life-crisis confidant, and all-around homie. She knows me well, and she‚Äôs super kind.
If you‚Äôre not sure if our brands of weird match, think of Julie as a
WEIRDNESS TRANSLATOR
who can grease the wheels and act as a sounding board for any questions you might have. She‚Äôs great with confidentiality. THANK YOU JULIE!
Bromiga Extraordinaire
Best of luck in your own dating journey!
üíò
(see also: Nick Gray‚Äôs
Tokyo Blind Date
, which is fantastic)

Name: Swante
ProfileText:
ÔªøLast updated: Oct 14, 2024


  

	  

	More pictures at the bottom


Key facts about me
* Age 31 (as of Oct 14, 2024)
* Male, cisgender, heterosexual, open to polyamory
* Based in Zurich (and not planning to move anytime soon)
* Stable job situation, working as mobile software engineer at Google
* Quite active in the Effective Altruism community:        
   * Donating 50% of my income
   * Doing AI Safety community building (at work)
*  Vegetarian (trying to become vegan), non-smoker, rarely drinking alcohol.
What am I looking for?
I value my independence a lot, and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd be happy in a traditional, committed, long-term relationship.
I do not want children, and I‚Äôm also not looking to get married or move in with a partner.


I think the kind of relationship that I would find most appealing is something more flexible, and would look more like this:
* We both have busy lives, and only see each other a couple times per year. (A bit more often in case we live close to each other.)
* We visit each other for (long) weekends, or go on some longer vacations together (e.g. 10 days in Japan, or going hiking in the alps for a week).
* We have occasional phone/video calls to stay in touch, but it‚Äôs also fine if we don‚Äôt hear from each other for a few weeks or months.
* We both can have other relationships.
* I guess the existing term Comet Relationship would describe my preferred relationship type best:
   * Comet: A long distance relationship where the partners only meet in person rarely but are happy to pick up their connection at those times and be less intensely in touch in between, like a comet passing close enough for the Earth to see every few years.




My ideal partner would be somebody who:
* communicates openly
* enjoys physical intimacy (including lots of cuddling)
* loves to travel and explore new places and activities
* has curiosity and a good sense of humor
* inspires me to grow and be the best version of myself
* maybe already has a (polyamorous) relationship, and is looking for a secondary partner
What do I offer?


* Direct communication style
* Kind, and emotionally stable
* I've been told I'm an excellent cuddler üòä
* I love deep and personal conversations. I was much more shy as a kid, but nowadays I‚Äôd be very open to share very intimate thoughts and feelings with somebody I like. I also have a list of questions to get to know somebody better. My current favorite is: "What has been on your mind recently?"
Some random facts about me
* I own a driver‚Äôs license, but haven‚Äôt driven a car since I got it in 2018.
* I love going hiking, and exploring new cities.
* I play board games quite regularly, e.g. Frosthaven, but also more social/leight-weight games like Avalon or Codenames.
* During my Masters degree, I did two exchange semesters in Eastern Finland. I loved the frozen lakes and going to the sauna at least once per week.
* I‚Äôve rated 1500+ films on IMDb. Here are my favorites.
Contact
If you‚Äôve read until here, and this sounds to you like we might be compatible, I‚Äôd love to get to hear from you! If you‚Äôre unsure, please lean towards reaching out!
You can email me or message me on Facebook. Please briefly share what you‚Äôre looking for, and also include some photos.
Additional photos

Name: Dan M
ProfileText:
ÔªøDan‚Äôs Date-Me Doc

Following Jesus is the most important thing in my life. Everything else is negotiable.


Until June I was CFO of a little charitable clinic. Nowadays I‚Äôm working on indie publishing my fourth sci-fi novel. My readership numbers might charitably be called modest, but I‚Äôm told one should not despise small beginnings. I‚Äôll work full-time on writing for the next 6 months, then re-evaluate.


I live in Atlanta, about 1 mile OTP.


I‚Äôm complementarian. That might be a deal breaker around here, though I‚Äôve always wanted folks with mental images of mousy complementarian women to meet my mother. She could totally drive a tent peg through an evil general‚Äôs skull, if the situation called for it.


Hobbies include Ultimate Frisbee (unathletically), CrossFit (unfitly), any and all game nights that I‚Äôm invited to, etc.  I have other dormant hobbies that shall rise again: improv comedy, ukulele, bridge (the card game).


I haven‚Äôt dated much. I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs a skill of mine.  I had a Hinge for a while and went on ~5 dates, but it‚Äôs just depressing.


Pictures below.


If your interest is piqued, send me a line (enough to convince me you read this and aren‚Äôt a robot) and a picture.  DansBurner07@gmail.com

Name: Kaden Sieracki
ProfileText:
Ôªø"I'm Kaden Sieracki, and I hail from The Woodlands, Texas. My two brothers, one older and one younger, keep things lively around the house. As for me, I'm a bit of a gentle giant at 6'8" and 300 pounds. I'm proud to represent Baylor on the offensive line. When I'm not on the gridiron, you can find me diving into the worlds of Transformers, Marvel, and Star Wars. And though my golf game might need a little work, I love hitting the links whenever I can. As for music, I've got a pretty eclectic taste. Lately, I've been jamming to a lot of grunge rock and country, but I also have a soft spot for those classic 2000s pop hits."
"I‚Äôm looking for a woman in her early 20s, ideally a bit taller than 5‚Äô7‚Äù. I‚Äôve always had a thing for freckles and brunettes, and I‚Äôm drawn to someone with a sharp wit who can keep up with my dry humor and oddball jokes. Music is a big part of my life, so I‚Äôd love to find someone who shares my tastes. While I might be a football fanatic, I‚Äôm totally cool with someone who doesn‚Äôt follow the game, as long as they can appreciate a good touchdown or a clutch field goal."
‚ÄúI really love living in the South and hope to stay here for a long time. I‚Äôd also love to start a family around the age of 29 or 30. That way, I‚Äôll still be young and active enough to play with my kids when they‚Äôre growing up. My dad had me when he was 40, and it was tough for him to keep up with me and my brothers. So, I‚Äôm hoping for a different experience.‚Äù 
"I'm looking for someone who can appreciate my weirdness and share in the joy of life's simple pleasures."
Self-Disclosure: 've been trying to be more honest about myself recently, providing details that go beyond the fundamentals. Talking about my passion of sci-fi, such as Transformers, Marvel, and Star Wars, as well as my problems on the golf course, helps people understand who I am. It's more than just listing statistics; it's about revealing the aspects of myself that make me unique, such as my strange music choice and my desire to have a family someday. By being more honest, I hope potential partners may look beyond what I do and gain insight into my life."
Self-Esteem: When I composed this document, I felt compelled to be true and honest with myself. I mostly discussed my talents and weaknesses. and about my unusual characteristics. I would say I am not afraid to disclose that I am a larger guy, that I play offensive line, and that I am content with my height and weight. I also discuss my strange and eccentric interests, as well as how I am seeking for someone who shares my dumb sense of humor. I think it's incredibly vital to have confidence in yourself. 
Self-Monitoring: I tried to be myself while still being aware of how I came across. I wanted to appear open and pleasant, so I kept my language light and conversational. I chatted about things I like, hoping to meet someone who shared my interests. I also listed topics that are significant to me, such as where I'm from and my goals for the future. I wanted to attract someone who was a good fit for me without feeling compelled to change who I am."

Name: Elliot
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate Elliot, why not?
I mean what‚Äôs the worst that could happen?!
  



Who the hell am I and what am I looking for?
I am an actor. (Photos on the next pages are from that.) Previously I have been a UX designer, a behavioural scientist, and, a long while ago, a software engineer. I am 40, I live in London, UK, I don‚Äôt want kids, and I‚Äôm looking for a long term relationship.


Hold on, this is important!
* I am shorter than you. (Yes, even you.) I‚Äôm 150cm.
* The reason for that is I have a curved spine, so my upper body also looks a little different.
* That‚Äôs not my cow! ->


You don‚Äôt need to know you‚Äôre OK with that at this stage. But you gotta be honest with yourself and think there‚Äôs a reasonable chance you could be. (Especially the cow thing.) Read on and contact me if you think there‚Äôs a chance.
	  

	More about me
I tend to look on the bright side, and make people laugh. Taking care of the people I love makes me happy. I‚Äôd really like to find someone of a similar disposition.


Aside from acting, I also sing in a couple of choirs (music is a big passion of mine), and volunteer as a cook in a community kitchen. I like cooking a lot, and may try to win your favour with baked goods.


I have a cat. His name is Zagreus.


  

	  

	  

	



What about you?
I am looking for someone who shares my romantic disposition. A person who wants to love, and be loved. I also value thoughtfulness, self awareness, and curiosity. I'm looking for someone with a similar desire to be happy, to be happy together.


Contact me
Again, note my appearance! It‚Äôs really worth being honest about that now; with, and for, both of us. You don‚Äôt need to know for sure, you just need to think it‚Äôs worthwhile meeting up to find out.


So, if you think you might value kindness and humour (which I have) over height (which I sold to a dwarfen comic in exchange for her humour), then get in touch.


You can email 
stubbornminion@gmail.com


Either send me your own dating doc or some similar info and photos in the email. I hope you‚Äôre the one!

Name: Carson McNeil
ProfileText:
Carson McNeil
Carson McNeil
Neuroscience, Machine Vision, and Mysticism
About
Science
Creative Content

Welcome
I also officiate weddings.
CV/Resume
LinkedIn
Substack
Carson McNeil is a Neuroscientist, Data Scientist, Consultant, and Researcher specializing in medical imaging, neuroscience, and machine learning applications. With a background in both computational neuroscience and software engineering, Carson has planned and executed on high-impact projects at Verily Life Sciences, Google, and the University of California, Berkeley. His work bridges cutting-edge machine vision and deep learning techniques with practical applications in health, such as the development of generative models for digital pathology. Carson's work has spanned basic research in the cognitive neuroscience of human vision, the neuroscience of Buddhist meditative states, and many practical applications of machine learning to diagnostic healthcare problems. His research is driven by a desire to improve human health, happiness, and flourishing, whether mental or physical. He believes in driving forward practical technologies while sharing and publishing relevant scientific findings with the world.
Carson has a long-running interest in Mysticism, and believes that there 
    is not such a difference between the tools we think of as "therapeutic",
    and millenia-old mystical traditions such as Buddhism and Daoism. A culture,
    such as ours, which is overly materialistic and has lost touch with the subjective,
    the natural, and the ritualistic, is at risk of collapsing under its own weight.
    Carson hopes that his teaching, writing, and research will help bridge this divide,
    and make esoteric mysticism more legible to the rationally-minded scientist.
We rarely hear the inner music, but we are all dancing to it nonetheless.
- Rumi
Please do reach out if you are interested in research collaboration, coaching, or consultation!
Research and Teaching
I have two Neuroscience degrees (Caltech BA 2013, UC Berkeley Masters 2019). I have also worked as a
        researcher and Data Scientist at Google Machine Intelligence, YouTube, and Verily Life Sciences. My research interests span medical imaging, neuroscience, machine intelligence, and Dharma science.
Google Scholar profile
LinkedIn profile
Research Tools
Autofluorescence Microscopy
While at Verily, I worked on the
Virtual Stainer
project. We used generative learning to predict histological stains from autofluorescence scans of unstained tissue. See
(McNeil et al., 2024)
, in Modern Pathology, and other publications.
Medical Image Embedding
I worked on a project to use Masked-Siamese Networks to embed colonscopy videos in a semi-supervised way. See
(Shor, McNeil et al., 2024)
Functional Neuroanatomy
While at Berkeley, I was in the
Gallant Lab
within the Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research org, working on fMRI research projects to model the human visual system.
Human Emotion
While at Google Machine Intelligence, I kicked off a collaboration between Google and Berkeley to study emotion in human faces using DNNs. 5 years later, this collaboration produced
(Cowen et al. 2021)
in Nature. I have an ongoing interest in emotion and mental health.
Drugs and the Brain
While at Berkeley, I taught the course
Drugs and the Brain
under
Prof. David Presti
. At Caltech, I taught a class of the same name under
Prof. Henry Lester
. Psychedelics, as a therepeutic, spiritual, and investigative tool remain of interest to me.
Creative Content
Scienctific work is creative work. But I have also produced a lot of more casual content.
Substack Essays
Medium Essays (will move to Substack)
YouTube Channel
YouTube Lectures
I have several long-form talks on psycho-spiritual frameworks on my
YouTube Channel
. These were given at a private event, and due to popular acclaim, I posted them online. Perhaps more on this theme will follow.
Essays
I write essays sometimes, which I post to my
Substack
. The topics range between philosophy, poetic, light research projects, and psychology. For example:
Polyamory doesn't Liberate; Monogamy doesn't Protect by Carson
Reflections and community quotes from a decade in the Bay Area dating landscape.
Read on Substack
Wedding Ritual Design for a Pluralistic Society by Carson
A recollection of, and guide to, hand-crafting a syncretic, modern, and personal wedding ceremony.
Read on Substack
Flirtations with Death by Carson
Necro-posting an old note from my Medium with some extra explication on the macabre.
Read on Substack
ADHD: Steroids, The Gym, and The Game  by Carson
The Game is changing, and this is twice as true on college campuses, where the amphetamine black market is booming ‚Ä¶ Given my own experience and that of friends, I was surprised to see the positive effects [of meditation] were so mild, until I saw the meditation protocols. ‚Ä¶ Would you go to the gym for 5 minutes a day and expect any sort of change?

Name: Richard Ngo
ProfileText:
ÔªøEDIT: as of late 2024, I‚Äôve found my life partner. We‚Äôre in a non-monogamous relationship, so you can still fill in the form below or reach out directly if you might be interested in a flirtation or fling. I‚Äôve left the rest of this doc unedited from the original.


I very much want a life partner who orients towards the world in a similar way as I do. I‚Äôm writing this document in the hope of finding her; please share it with women you think might be a good match. I‚Äôm male, 30, living in San Francisco, working in AI. Whether or not I have kids will depend on my partner (see section on that below). I‚Äôm open to going on dates with people who live elsewhere, but have trouble seeing myself living outside a major global city in the long term.


Here are five of my defining traits; I‚Äôd love to find a partner who shares them with me. If they resonate with you, fill in this form or reach out directly.


Growth
* I think of the world as full of opportunities waiting to be seized - which even if we can‚Äôt get to yet, we‚Äôll be able to tomorrow. I want to be with someone who sees themselves as a work in progress, like I am; and whose default attitude is "why not?"

For me, growth mindset is closely entangled with the idea of making the future of technology go well, which is the focus of most of my work.


Intellectualism
* It's most natural for me to relate to the world in an analytical, systematizing way. I'd love to have a partner who, like me, is strongly driven to understand what‚Äôs going on around them, to grasp the intellectual edifice humanity has been building, and to fill in the gaps themselves - not just in academic domains, but anywhere their curiosity leads them. For a picture of what this looks like in me, try reading my blog or my twitter.


I often get along particularly well with people who read a lot as children, like I did. 


Teamwork
* I want a relationship which is deeply cooperative: two people building something in collaboration, where strong communication is the default and we trust that we can handle problems together. Some examples of how I‚Äôve worked towards this in previous relationships:
   1. Scheduling an hour each week to raise issues and possible improvements.
   2. Taking a course on non-violent communication together.
   3. Doing circling together.


Rereading that list, it all sounds‚Ä¶ kinda serious? But the spirit I‚Äôm pointing towards is much less so: if we can laugh at all sorts of things (including ourselves) together, we‚Äôre most of the way towards being a good team. And for me, being a good team is the essence of romance - everything else is built on top of that.


Towardsness
* By ‚Äútowardsness‚Äù I mean being motivated by actively wanting to move towards desirable outcomes, rather than just away from undesirable outcomes. The latter typically comes from fear-based motivation (as I write about at length here). I think fear-based motivation is far more extensive than most people typically recognize, and that excitement-based motivation which actually focuses on moving towards goals is a kind of superpower.

I previously formulated this point as a desire for a partner with prosocial motivations. But I now tend to think that overcoming fear (in particular deeply-rooted fear) is the main bottleneck to that, and that almost everyone would have pretty prosocial motivations if they were more emotionally integrated. And so I‚Äôm not really looking for a partner who cares deeply about any specific thing; I‚Äôm looking for a partner with the capacity to care deeply at all.


Playfulness
   * I balance the more serious traits above with an irreverent attitude towards life. I like spontaneous adventures, I like starting dancefloors, and I like thinking of rules as made to be broken. People are often surprised by how playful I am in person - it doesn‚Äôt come through much in writing, where my intellectual side takes charge. (In this doc, my whimsical side keeps trying to slip things in, but my romantic side keeps overwriting them because it thinks finding a life partner is SERIOUS BUSINESS.)


The person I‚Äôm writing this for might not have all the traits I‚Äôve listed (or might not yet know that she does). But because we care about the same things on a deep level, I think she would want to have them eventually - just as the traits that she‚Äôs looking for are probably the ones I‚Äôm already aiming for. Maybe we can develop them together.


A note on children


My main priority is finding the right partner; how many kids I have will largely depend on her preferences. Some possibilities I could be happy with:
   1. A partner who wants to have 3+ kids and to be the main caregiver for them.
   2. A partner who wants to have 1-2 kids and split responsibilities fairly evenly (but also get help from nannies etc, which I'm fortunately in a financial position to be able to pay for).
   3. A partner who doesn't want kids because she (and I) find their work very meaningful and we want to prioritize that.


I realize these are pretty different. One way of reconciling them: I want to have life projects with my partner; kids are one possible life project but not the only one; and so it's hard to be concrete before knowing who I want to co-create these life projects with. I'm not apathetic about kids‚ÄîI think having kids is one of the most life-affirming things you can do. But I don‚Äôt want to rule out being swayed towards other life trajectories by the right person.


Some other things about me


My guess is that, for the people I‚Äôm looking for, the traits I‚Äôve talked about so far are likely to be the strongest signal that we should try going on a date. But here are some other facts about me that might help:
   * I‚Äôve spent most of my career at frontier AGI labs, working on a wide range of different topics. Now I do independent research on what I consider to be the most impactful and interesting research directions in the world (a mix of AI governance and theoretical AI alignment). For an accessible introduction to my thinking, try this podcast. I‚Äôm excited about my work, and it‚Äôs important to me.
   * I embrace life. I seize opportunities to dance, sing, travel, play practically any sport, read, socialize, and try new things. I‚Äôm energetic and adventurous.
   * I am fundamentally okay with myself, even as I strive to be better. I don‚Äôt easily get flustered, angry, or insecure. Growing up in New Zealand gave me an underlying relaxed optimism about the world (although it's now often expressed via a very Californian type of ambition).
   * I‚Äôm unfussy about many conventionally-valued traits like a partner‚Äôs level of formal education, career trajectory, finances, etc.


I think my weakest traits from a dating perspective are that:
   * I‚Äôm not very empathetic on a gut level. This sometimes surprises people, because I'm unusually good at understanding and engaging with my own and others' emotions. But on an instinctive level, when I‚Äôm not actively trying to be empathetic, I still tend to default to thinking abstractly rather than putting myself in other people's shoes.
   * I work a lot, driven in part by my belief that technological progress (and particularly progress in AI) is going to accelerate a lot over the coming decades, potentially making this the most important century. This may be disconcerting for some potential partners.
   * I‚Äôm short for a guy.


I‚Äôm still on good terms with all of the women I dated seriously during the past five years; here are reviews from two of them:


"Richard is great. 5 out of 5 stars. It didn't work out with us but the quality of friendship we have now speaks for itself. He is one of the smartest people I know. Discussing things with him is great. Sharp and constructive. He has great friends. Absurdly good at any sport. Downside: bit chaotic, no taste for good food üòâ"


‚ÄúRichard is weirdly good at being in a relationship; I can think of three or four concrete ways I'm emotionally healthier after having dated him. One notable omission from this doc is the flip side of him being less empathetic than average on a gut level, which is that it feels easy to express feelings to him and negotiate conflict because he can accept intense emotions without getting caught up in them. He's more whimsical than the doc would suggest, though not less serious. Moreover, he is an excellent kisser and throws very good parties.‚Äù


Here are some photos of me:
  
  





If you think we could be a good match (or you have a friend who might be), fill in my form, email me at richardcngo@gmail.com, tweet at me, tell a mutual friend to arrange a rendezvous, throw pebbles at my window, write me a song, or send me a document like this of your own! (If you're not sure what to say, tell me about a favorite book or song, or something you're looking forward to over the coming year.) If you‚Äôre uncertain, please do err on the side of getting in touch - writing is much lower-bandwidth for discovering compatibility than meeting in person, and the heavy-tailed outcomes here are skewed very positively!

Name: Joshua Oreman
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate Josh
Last updated August 2024. Feel free to share with friends, but please don‚Äôt reshare publicly.
  
              
33, male, straight-ish
If I weren‚Äôt a human I would be a golden retriever (confirmed independently by multiple friends!)


Location: I live in Boulder, CO. I visit the SF Bay several times per year and NYC/Boston a few, have dear friends on both coasts and enjoy excuses to travel in general. I‚Äôm happy to make connections with folks who live far away, but am unlikely to form an attachment relationship across long-term distance. I‚Äôm open to relocating for a life partner.


I‚Äôm seeking: Intentional romantic partnership that could grow into family-shaped life partnership; I‚Äôd like to reproduce in the next few years but I don‚Äôt feel rushed about it. (While I‚Äôm open to any connection that sparks mutual delight, I‚Äôll prioritize these over others.)


My deal: I‚Äôm generally easy-going and rarely have strong preferences; I like doing pretty much anything if it‚Äôs with my people. Acts of service are a big love language for me. I have a science and engineering background and have been very successful as a programmer. I‚Äôve had numerous people tell me within a few minutes of meeting me that I seem unusually kind or loving to them. I‚Äôm not the most physically graceful person, but that‚Äôs been improving of late as I‚Äôve invested more energy into partner dancing. I think I‚Äôm a good provider and a good stable ‚Äúrock‚Äù. I like puns, dogs, airplanes, and the outdoors, and can operate all of them with reasonable competency.


Relationship structure: I‚Äôve been polyamorous for my whole adult life, because I think being more fully able to engage with connections that might arise is worth some emotional and logistical overhead. At the same time, it‚Äôs important to me to be able to offer (and to feel) stability and safety in partnership, even when that conflicts with optionality. My preference is for a relationship that is strongly mutually prioritized but not romantically exclusive. I‚Äôm also open to monogamy if it welcomes emotional closeness and non-sexual touch outside the relationship. I currently have one long-term partner whose likely life path looks pretty different from mine; I think she will always be an important core friend for me, while the romantic aspect is more situational depending on how both of our lives evolve.


Interested?: There‚Äôs a lot more I could say, but it would be more fun to tell you in person! You can reach me using the handle under the photos on Twitter, Facebook, or gmail dot com.

Name: Anna Bago
ProfileText:
ÔªøTl;dr: Pan ENTP woman looking for people to nerd and build deep bonds with. 


  









  

  







                                                                                           Date me?
















First of all, thank god that this site exists. You all seem like lovely people! Also, your docs put mine to shame‚Ä¶ consider this a work in progress. 


A heads up: I‚Äôm currently quite busy and socially (over)saturated. If I was to invest time into building a relationship with someone (especially online), it would be with the hope of developing a deep poly relationship.
	

Who am I? 
Age: 22
Gender: Female
Location: Oslo, Norway
Monogamy?: God no
Want kids?: Probably not. Not in the near future at least.
Looking for: Women, NB folks, men, anyone in between or outside or whatever
What‚Äôs important for me?
* EA - I want to use my life to make the world better. Duh.
* Nerding
   * Philosophy, science, maths (eg cognitive science, epistemology, meta-ethics, AI, etc). I consider myself a philosopher at core, but kind of a ‚Äúnatural philosopher‚Äù, Sean Carroll-style
   * Some books that have had an effect on me. No attempt at completeness:
      * Reasons and Persons (I‚Äôve actually read it, I promise! Should‚Äôve skipped the first half though): Very clever about personal identity. I don‚Äôt think you have one of those!
      * Chalmers‚Äô The Conscious Mind: If you don‚Äôt believe in the hard problem - or worse, think that consciousness is an illusion - I am sitting at the edge of my seat to debate you.
      * Josh Green‚Äôs Moral Tribes: I‚Äôm very much of a valence utilitarian. I‚Äôll gesture towards this book while explaining away any conflicting intutitions you might have with moral psychology.
      * Dawkins blew my mind as a kid. Memes!!
      * It‚Äôs not a book, but I adore Scott Alexander‚Äôs writing. Who doesn‚Äôt though?
* Other people! I love sharing my life with others. It gives me energy, gives colour to my life and helps me grow. 
   * I‚Äôm really deeply interested in other people‚Äôs inner worlds. It's been this way ever since I realised as a kid that other people have inner worlds, and I don't have direct access to them. You could say it's one of my special interests. I want to understand how it feels to be like you! Shifts in my own internal landscape have made me realise (and really internalise) the mind-boggling diversity in people‚Äôs internal experience. And I probably haven‚Äôt seen half of it yet! This is one of the biggest reasons I‚Äôm looking for more people to love - I want to know people deeply, and be known deeply.
   * Not to brag, but I‚Äôm very empathetic. Perhaps to a fault. You can see how it would lead to this interest, right? And then it feeds back in a never ending connection-feedback-loop‚Ä¶
   * One of my big life projects is to build a community. Maybe you can become part of that?
* Sounds a bit vague, but‚Ä¶ Growing as a person? I feel like I‚Äôve lived many lives already. Started out in a small Hungarian town, working class family, difficult upbringing. Did well at school, moved out of the country alone. Building a life in Oslo now, studying maths, leading my local EA uni group and finding people to love. I‚Äôm used to a pretty high insight/year ratio. If I feel stagnant I get restless. 
* People have told me I am 
   * very mature
   * make them feel comfortable
* Singing, dancing (I‚Äôm not super coordinated but still enjoy it very much). I loove me a good psytrance rave every once in a while.
* I‚Äôve found myself quite spiritual (and also somewhat of a psychonaut). Meditation and the rest. But can they factor the number? 
* Spending time in nature. Ghawd isn‚Äôt it regulating! Sometimes I unironically hug trees. It just feels nice.
Downsides of dating me
* I‚Äôm prone to anxiety and overcommitting. Both of those have become a lot better over my adult life, but I‚Äôm still working on it. Is it just me or is uni actually way too much work?
* Not vegan for complicated personal reasons I‚Äôm happy to explain.
* Although an intellectual spark is very important for me, I‚Äôve had an emotionally taxing few months, and not at my intellectual peak at the moment. What I need first and foremost is an emotional connection with a high level of intellectual compatibiltiy.
* Currently I‚Äôm located in Oslo. Statistically I would guess you aren‚Äôt. I‚Äôm not averse to moving eventually and can even travel a bit, but my budget is at the 22yo-student-working-class-moved-countries-by-herself level, so realistically we would have to get to know each other online. 
What am I looking for?
Non-negotioable:
* Friends, romace, anything in between or outside. We‚Äôll figure it out:)
* Good communication is a must - I don‚Äôt expect you to be perfect, but I can‚Äôt be pulling the wagon all by myself. Had enough of those relationships already. Expect regular check-ins about how our relationship is going and how we would like to form it.
* Polyamory. No hierarcy.
* Intellectual connection. Playing around with ideas.
* No kids for the next few years. 80% sure I‚Äôll never want any. (I don‚Äôt mind if you have kids though!)
* I don‚Äôt care about your age. If you think you‚Äôre too old for me, you probably aren‚Äôt.
Preferable:
* I am very touchy-feely. Physical initmacy makes me happy, and it‚Äôs a great way for me to build attachment. Cuddles, hugs, kisses, holding hands - if you‚Äôre not a fan we‚Äôre probably not a great match.
* Softness and gentleness. Sensitivity and empathy.
* Located near-ish Oslo so we can actually meet! 
* Ultimately I‚Äôm looking for something long-term, living together or close to each other. I‚Äôm in no rush though, and can imagine many other mutually enriching setups.


No-nos
* Monogamy.
* People who are a bit too type-A. I‚Äôm not against ambition, I have plenty of it myself. But I want to get to know well-rounded people, with hobbies, experience in navigating interpersonal relationships, etc.


Contact me:
Write an email to 2002anna.anna2002[at]gmail.com. Write ‚ÄúDateMe‚Äù in the title. Send your own doc if you have one:)


Yes, I‚Äôm looking for someone to date, but if you just find me interesting as a friend and not as anything romantic I‚Äôm still happy if you reach out. Especially if you have experience with polyamory! Please do reach out, I would really appreciate some poly wisdom in my life.

Name: Rich
ProfileText:
ÔªøIntro:


Hi! My name is Rich, short for Ullrich, and I‚Äôm looking for someone to seriously date with the intention of marriage and family.  I‚Äôm committed to staying on the west side of LA for the next two years at least, but my location flexibility opens up a bit after that. Aside from my day job, I‚Äôm doing maintenance and renovations in exchange for greatly reduced rent, so I‚Äôm using the opportunity to pay down student loans and save up for a down payment on a home. As such, although I‚Äôm not cheap, I do prefer cooking and eating at home rather than going out frequently, I‚Äôm content without luxury vacations, and keep travel to mostly hiking adventures and road trips for now, and so on.  Basically, budgeting wisely with an eye toward the future, while still trying to have at least a little adventure. 

I don‚Äôt believe in astrology, but if it pleases you, I‚Äôm a Cancerian and a Water Pig. Which means, I guess, that I‚Äôm very loving but I‚Äôll be sad and stubborn if you hurt my feelings?  Sounds about right. I‚Äôm non-religious, something of a socialist, but have a nuanced enough outlook that I don‚Äôt totally fit into any of the typical containers. I‚Äôm an optimist most of the time, but not all of it.  I value kindness, humility, and serenity. If you're kind to your server, tip well, and clean up after yourself at a restaurant, if you always return your shopping cart, if you're considerate of others out in public, if you can appreciate the understated -- then you're my kind of person. Not that I eat out often. I‚Äôll take the stairs over the escalator or lift, and I‚Äôm happy to park a little further back and walk, rather than spending an age searching for a better spot. Fair warning though - I seldom can remember where I parked. I would really appreciate a partner who could provide strength against that particular weakness. 


 Oh, and here‚Äôs what I look like, all 5‚Äô10‚Äù of me. The first picture was taken in August of 2024, so these are recent:


  
  

  
  
  
  



Diet:


I have what may be considered an extreme and rigid diet. I only eat meat. Over six years Carnivore for Health - ask me about it! Besides the first year of pandemic, when I was drinking for something to do. Bad idea. I'm still paying for that, but it's further evidence that I'm on the right path now. I'm very passionate about holistic health through diet, and for the benefits to overall human health and to the environment from eating a ruminant-based diet. It's important to me and I don't expect my partner to be a carnivore too, but I won't be able to share dessert or have just one bite of this or that. In a relationship I would at least want someone into holistic diet, sustainability, and interested in a carb conscious lifestyle both for us and for any potential children. I realize that this will raise a lot of questions, but it‚Äôs not something I need to frequently talk about, so if you want to know more, I‚Äôve provided more detail about this at the end of this document.






continued vvv


Family:


I don‚Äôt have a relationship with my family. The silver lining here is that with me, you wouldn't have to worry about any in-laws in the picture. I'm happy with where I am and I've done a fair amount of self-work and therapy so I'm truly okay here - this information is for you. Since I have no ties to my family, I am open to taking my wife's last name when I get married again, provided it is her own name and not an ex husband's. And if she's not interested in that, perhaps she can help me pick out a new last name together. I am divorced (2005-2016, no kids), and moved to California to start over eight years ago. 

I grew up in a large Italian-American family, heavy emphasis on family, so it‚Äôs been a bit dissociating being so disconnected from mine, but it was a choice I made along with input from my therapist, and I‚Äôve been happy. Still, I‚Äôd be happy to become a part of my partner‚Äôs family, and in time, build our own.  




Goals/Background:


One of my other short term goals is to go back to school. I'm thankful that my job has been stable during these times, but I want to flesh out a path that's a little bit more meaningful. I currently only have an associate's degree. 


Once upon a time I was in a dual Bachelors-Masters program for Dietetics at Eastern Michigan University, and after I became a practicing dietitian I intended to start studying endocrinology. I've always been deeply moved and fascinated by the way what we consume affects our hormonal chemistry and in turn our metabolic health. I've taken more credits over the years than most people who do have master's degrees. But while I was in the middle of that dietetics program, my father passed away, I put a pause on school to deal with the fallout, and I wound up depressed, divorced, and moving to California to start over. 


My original plan was to finish school once I had my California residency, but I wound up with a decent career and just went with it, shifting my focus instead on trying to meet somebody to settle down and start a family with. But, a handful of relationships that didn't work out later, I find my career in a place where I'd really like to take the next step and move up so I'm thinking it's about time to finally get serious about going back to school. I always figured that I would finish education and career moves after I settled down with somebody. I realize it may not be the right priority, but it's the way my brain is wired. A lot of things in life just seem easier when you're connected with somebody special. 


At this juncture I need to actively start working on both. I'd love to meet my forever person while at the same time continuing to advance myself.


continued vvv


What I‚Äôm looking for

When it comes to a relationship I'm interested in finding someone who would like to share a carb conscious lifestyle, who likes occasional hikes, and shares passions in social justice, sustainability, kindness, and generally making choices that will help people. Maybe we can go clean a beach up early morning, then walk along it holding hands? 


I'm also very passionate - touch and quality time are my love languages - I want a slow burn before intimacy, but once we‚Äôre there, I like to make out slow and sensually, and go down on my partner frequently, and I'm big on cuddling and aftercare. I'm happy with your natural humanity and I don't care whether you shave or put on makeup. We can curl up and I'll play with your hair while we whisper silly things to each other. We can wake up in each other‚Äôs arms and kiss good morning. I think it's very sensual and erotic to be with someone who is comfortable enough to be a natural human being around me. 


Some combination of occasional hikes and nature walks, lazy nights watching a romcom or playing boardgames, cute walks through downtowns, playing with puppies, thrift shopping, cooking together and dancing in the kitchen, having deep conversations about the world around us, challenging each other to learn and grow, and sharing values of curiosity, kindness, compassion, and exploration.




Other quirks


I‚Äôm not much of a gamer, but after work sometimes I like to unwind by playing Minecraft for a little bit. I‚Äôm a very silly, happy go lucky person. One moment I can be serious and the next I can be doing a gollum impression or thinking up a ridiculous pun. While my music taste is varied and eclectic (the first CD I ever bought with my own money was Best of the Village People!) -  I often don‚Äôt put on music. I enjoy the quiet.  I‚Äôve had my puppy for six months now and she still hasn‚Äôt got a name‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve tried on many names, but nothing has stuck so far. I‚Äôm left-handed, a bit of a nerd, and I enjoy writing sonnets and other poetry.  For years I did an online writing roleplay pretending to be someone living in 15th century Europe, just writing stories with others from around the world.  I enjoy hikes, but I‚Äôm just as happy playing board games or curling up to watch a Ghibli flick.  I like romantic comedies, broadway musicals, Lord of the Rings, and I‚Äôd love to go to the opera with someone. 




Contact


If you‚Äôd like to get in touch, whether as a friend or potentially something more, please reach out! You can find me on instagram @xyphratl (tw: plenty of pictures of meat), or shoot an email to xyphratl@gmail.com . Let me know you found me here! 




More about my all-meat diet:


As promised, some more information for the morbidly curious:


I prefer cooking and eating at home over going out, and I'll happily cook for others, even dishes that I won't personally eat. I don't consider myself a picky eater because I like almost everything (except artichokes... I'm a bad Italian-American); I just choose not to eat it for health purposes. That said, I'm not difficult to go out with. I can find something at almost any restaurant, or happily have a sparkling water or cup of tea while others enjoy ramen or dessert. I'm definitely at least ketogenic for life, and possibly carnivore for life. 


I believe this is both optimal human nutrition, and beneficial to the environment at large. When a field of grains is harvested, countless birds, rodents, and other bugs and critters are killed. But from just one cow, you can eat for nearly an entire year. Ranches that practice regenerative ranching, such as White Oak Pastures, can actually have a carbon negative effect, reverse desertification, and be a tool to fight against climate change. And chances are, when you eat a steak, its source is fewer than 50 miles from where you're sitting. On the other hand, monocrop agriculture is terrible for the planet, creates runoff crises, extreme water use, depletes soil, and the food miles on processed grains and produce are astronomical. And besides, vegans fart more than cows do anyway. That's not just a quip. Studies show that vegans flatulate seven times more than someone on a standard American diet. And people on a carnivore diet do it seldomly altogether. 


My LDL cholesterol is "high" as you might expect. I'm okay with this. My triglycerides are extremely low and I still have what's considered a great ratio. Beyond this, I don't consider a high cholesterol to be a negative. Although I'm pro-vaccine, there is also room for natural human immunity. LDL cholesterol transports vitamins through the bloodstream and can also engulf pathogens and foreign substances much like a neutrophil. We've been pushing low cholesterol since the 1950s and metabolic disease has skyrocketed since... it's no wonder natural human immunity isn't as robust as it should be. Unless I meet my demise by some kind of violent or accidental end, I'm going to outlive all the people taking statins and eating low-fat diets. My cognitive function will also outlast the vast majority of theirs. 


For more information I invite you to check out The Cholesterol Code, or the work of Mary Enig on seed oils, or Sally Norton on oxalates, or Gary Taubes, Judy Cho, Nina Teicholz, doctors Jason Fung, Shawn Baker, Anthony Chaffee, Ken Berry, Lisa Wiedeman, Robert Kiltz, Paul Saladino... and more! With all of that being said, carnivore is my diet, but not my lifestyle or identity. It's important for my partner to know and understand where I am coming from and what I value, and I've written all of this because I understand that most people will have many questions, but it's not really something that I'll constantly be talking about.

Name: Pip Moss
ProfileText:
ÔªøPip Moss - Date Me Doc
* Age: 34
* Height: 5‚Äô6‚Äù
* Occupation: Solicitor 
* Location: London, UK.
* Looking for: Women, ideally long term relationship but open to starting and seeing where we get to. Not fussed on mechanics of relationship.


* Top priorities:


   * Significant Overlap of Values. We don‚Äôt have to agree on everything but I want to be able to wake up and spend a bit of every day helping you achieve your goals and feel good about that.


   * Intellectual Curiosity. I like knowing things, from trivia to social research, and I like people telling me things. I‚Äôll enjoy learning new things for the rest of my life and it would probably be good if you did too because I‚Äôll want to talk about them.


   * General Zest for Life: I like my calendar being fairly full of things to do, be they attending talks or trying a new type of exercise. I have main hobbies but am always up for trying something new. I‚Äôd really value someone pushing me in new directions.


   * Clear Communication. I‚Äôm a direct communicator and can only really be like that. I work hard to be direct, not abrasive, but I‚Äôm not great at reading between the lines. I‚Äôm very honest (but not tactless) and take honesty fairly seriously, which friends and family mostly really like.


   * Independence. I want a partner, and a partnership, rather than someone to completely merge lives with until we are practically one person. I want to do lots of things with you but wouldn‚Äôt expect you to curtail having a life and projects outside of ‚ÄòUs‚Äô and I‚Äôd want that balance for myself too.
	  



* Non-Negotiables:
   * I don‚Äôt want kids.


   * I can‚Äôt bear the smell of tobacco. Am not much better with cannabis though if you never smoked where we lived I could maybe manage.


* Slightly Negotiables:
   * I‚Äôm a pretty committed urbanite. I‚Äôve lived in London and Manchester, and might live in other cities in the future but really value living centrally and the lifestyle that allows.


   * I‚Äôm not religious or a believer in the supernatural, and while I don‚Äôt mind if you are I am unlikely to ever buy-in and share that beyond joining festivals to be supportive/share experiences.
	* My Main Hobbies: 


   * Bouldering, Running, Obstacle Course Running. Two years ago I tried bouldering and I‚Äôve fallen into a fitness lifestyle since then. I climb twice a week, run a similar amount, and am working towards the London Marathon in 2026. Allez!


   * Cooking. I cook from scratch almost everything I eat and like expanding my repertoire. Currently trying different mapo tofu and seitan recipes as I become ‚ÄòPesc-an‚Äô (Vegan, plus fish). Got a great vegan brownie recipe. Love cooking for friends and family, and would love to cook for a partner.


   * Cat lover. Currently sharing my house (as well as a lodger) with my cat Serral.


   * Random research online. From perusing Wikipedia (then double-checking it) to reading government reports, I like knowing more about the world. I‚Äôm the kind of person who will fact check myself online. I try to live an evidence-based life and want a data-driven world.


   * Visiting Museums/Galleries/Places of Interest/Classical Music Performances. No particular theme as to where, I just like seeing friends at somewhere more interesting than a coffee shop if we can. What else is life in London for? Most recent trip: Freemasons Hall. Beautiful but left me with more questions than answers!
   *    * Political Gambling. I‚Äôve been betting on elections since I was 20, with a good record. I sometimes write about it. But I‚Äôm an obsessive, not an addict. I even have the spreadsheets to prove it‚Ä¶


   * Board Games. Also another great way to spend time with friends. I‚Äôm not hyper-competitive but do tend to do a bit of pre-research and want to give a good account of myself. OK maybe I am competitive, but I‚Äôm a pretty good loser.
	* Values/Personality (This is not a checklist of things you have to be):


   * I value agency and intentionality, in myself and others. I fear too many people too much of the time make decisions passively, by default or the path of least resistance. I want to live deliberately. I get frustrated by adults not taking accountability for their lives and I want to be held accountable for mine.


   * Introverted but outgoing in a comfortable environment. I like a busy social life, just not so open to events with heavy drinking or loud music.


   * Organised. I believe in systems. I meal plan, I track my freezer contents in Excel, I check my net worth quarterly, I often instigate and co-ordinate social plans in my friendship groups. I even have a spreadsheet for when I last saw each of my friends so I don‚Äôt forget someone for too long (the name turns red after 90 days). They laughed, but then half of them asked me for the template.


   * High Decoupler. I don‚Äôt take disagreement personally and am happy to discuss almost anything in a dispassionate way. I try to be sensitive to other people‚Äôs discomfort, but I‚Äôm rarely unwilling to answer a personal question or consider an idea.


   * Environmentalist. I cycle most journeys if I‚Äôm not on the Tube and I don‚Äôt fly for leisure at the moment (though I‚Äôd be open to, especially if I found some effective offsets). I‚Äôm also a YIMBY and a New Urbanist. Don‚Äôt own a car, but can drive and would get one if it made sense for my life.


   * Effective Altruist. By which I mean I donate 8% of my income (and growing) to effective charities and generally buy-in to the concept.
	Some more photos of me:  






Making the most of the period Serral was light enough to hold up on one arm. I actually have a shirtless version of this from another day but that felt tacky to share unprompted.














  









Post-Parkrun photo with two friends who got me into running and whom I owe many thanks for that and much besides.












  















It turns out there is such a thing as vegan clotted cream. And it‚Äôs good!
