Name: e
ProfileText:
Ôªøhello, i‚Äôm e (not my real name but it is suitable as a pseudonym) from texas (probably). i am 27 going on 28. i love competing in niche games primarily but i also love film and write about it occasionally. traveling to see my friends all over the world is typically where my money goes. it used to go to archive fashion but i have grown satisfied with my wardrobe and dissatisfied with spending my money on products. i don't buy anything physical besides clothes, food, and hygiene products. i am an antinatalist. i am a non-denominational leftist. i am generally speaking quite happy in my day to day as there are many things i find fulfilling.


i am not posting photos of myself. this is not due to insecurity of my appearance (which i have learned to more or less live with) but because i don't value physical attraction in relationships and it's not something i care to maximize for myself. it also feels somewhat dishonest to work on my physical appearance when i have so much work to do on myself in other departments. i also want to limit pictures of myself on the internet to the best of my abilities, but i can of course send them directly if you interested.


likes and dislikes


likes:


competing (ask me about which games if you're interested)
watching films (my favorite director is jacques rivette)
wearing a nice outfit out
finding a good clothing deal
hanging out with friends
helping my friends when they need help
nice food
traveling to see friends
noise music, along with other kinds sometimes
learning
tutoring math
bouldering (even though i am bad at it)


dislikes:


dating (i prefer talking online)
flirting (i will not flirt with you; it's nothing personal)
dancing
sex work (i have no beef with sex workers of course and would not object to dating one)
bigotry
voting
machine washing clothing
driving 
doing poorly in tournaments
sports (i am interested in sports statistics however)
nostalgia as a concept
normie designer bags


i dislike biographies that try to sell the reader on the author; i find myself too insecure about my potential narcissistic traits to write about this. some people find me funny and intelligent, some people find me insufferable and dim; who knows what you will find me? i have nothing intrinsically positive to say about myself.


i am very online and most my humor comes from this. i make okay money (from a boring job - you can ask about it if you‚Äôd like) but not enough to support a partner, something i feel extremely guilty about. i would prefer a long distance relationship as that is what is most familiar to me, but i am open to other possibilities. i am monogamous. one "relationship" setup that i wouldn't mind is a strictly platonic marriage in which i provide access to living in the US and, in exchange, i gain access to my spouse's insurance which allows me to retire early. an ideal romantic relationship would involve myself and my partner lifting each other up and trying to bring out the best in each other, and i think it would be most advantageous if we had at least one or two things in common if that is the case.


as i mentioned earlier i don't find physical appearance important. i am also unconcerned with how much my partner makes, unless they are dependent upon me for survival which i don't know if i can guarantee that on my current income. you can contact me via discord at souljaboytellemdotcom if you'd like to talk - i am also open to just making new friends of course, if your primary takeaway is "this guy sounds insane but i would like to talk about film and clothing with him." in any case i hope you have a nice day and find what you are pursuing : ) .

Name: Maya
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate or be friends with me doc
So, tell me about yourself‚Ä¶
Sure. I‚Äôve broken this down into work & purpose, family & community, relationship leanings, joy, food, location, and what I look like. 
Work & purpose
I work as a user researcher and self defence instructor. My research mostly informs public service and policy but I research anything interesting e.g. DIY gene editing tools, bike paths, storm response systems (this is starting to sound like a pitch‚Ä¶)
 
I also run an Empowerment Self Defence charity. We offer survivors of violence and people at risk of abuse workshops to harness their own strength, practise nervous system regulation, and have fun and thrive while learning self defence skills.  
Family & community 
Family & community are priorities for me. I listed my work initiatives first because it‚Äôs where I‚Äôve put most of my energy in the past without quite realising I was doing it. Recently, I've resolved to intentionally cultivate community and create family, rather than assume this will all work out with minimal intervention on my part. I‚Äôd love to create a relationship with a community around it; a relationship that is in itself a family and that also generates more family in some form.  
Relationship leanings
I‚Äôm into monogamous relationships, ones that are co-located, and I‚Äôd love to be in a relationship that feels like a great team.  
Joy
This is a recent focus. I can‚Äôt think of a lot to say about it other than: why not make a point of generating and savouring it?
Food
Yes. Please. Ideally vegetables. Moderate drinker, more of a savourer than a guzzler. Sweet tooth problem (cake I can guzzle for some reason?) 
Location
UK, London, Hackney. 
Are you open to relocating?
I can imagine doing this under some circumstances, and definitely know how to. Yet after moving back and forth across 3 continents for lots of my adult life, I‚Äôm trying something newish (to me): staying in one place, becoming rooted. 


I also think I‚Äôve exceeded the threshold of how many long distance relationships are sensible to have in one lifetime, so best if a partner and I live in roughly the same place.
What are you looking for in a partner?
Qualities I deeply appreciate include: kindness, curiosity, a general sense of presence, attentiveness, introspective skills, interest in bodies, not just in how they look but in how they are, and how they connect, co-regulation (‚Üê which is more of a relational than individual attribute, but such a magic thing that I think worth mentioning.)


I‚Äôd like to be and to be with someone we‚Äôd all want on a team; someone resourced, with skills and perspective to bring to the mix, someone who values learning and growth, someone who has my back as I have theirs. 
What do you think a relationship even is?
I think of a relationship as a creation; something we cultivate intentionally, consciously, caringly; something we feel worthwhile to maintain and nurture even when that takes a little effort after the butterflies stop fluttering all the time. 


I‚Äôd love to create a relationship that changes and expands as we do; that forms a secure ground from which we can step out into the world, have rich experiences, change, grow, and bring those changes and that growth back to each other and watch them enrich our relationship. 


I also think of it as bowls of soup on the couch in winter, watching each other's bags at the train station so we don‚Äôt have to lug them to the toilet, arguing well, giggles, surprises, whispers, building community and creating some form of family incl. children, dogs, neighbours, friends, or a subset of these.
Can we be (‚Äòjust‚Äô) friends?
If we‚Äôre compatible as friends, yes please. I cherish friendship and have space and time for new friends. 
What do you and your world look like? 
Here are some photos. The most typical moments I don‚Äôt have photos of, so these ones below aren‚Äôt a representative sample. They‚Äôre all reasonably recent and relevant though.
  

  

I sit in a chair lots for work but like to move so I practise and sometimes teach chair yoga
 
  

I lived on a boat for a while, and started to find land weirdly rigid
	  

One of my favourite little friends and me


  

Lip syncing to Whitney Houston for a pandemic-era work zoom flash mob (sparkly shirt courtesy of downstairs neighbour)


  

One of my besties and me on a cold UK beach walk 
	  

This is an improv scene about a toothache 


  

A hackathon about improving outcomes for violence survivors with trauma-informed self defence 
	How can I get in touch?
Send me a line here :)

Name: Xavier Richards
ProfileText:
Skip to content
Home
Where is my Soulmate?
I am trying to find the girl who I am most similar to/is best for me. Maybe you are her, you know her, or you know someone who knows her.
Takes 2 minutes to read. Photographs are at the bottom.
I am somewhat of a reserved person, so to put myself out here, publicly, is not something I want to do. If you know a better way, let me know.
I am an only child of a single mother, who had me while still attending college.
A lot of my childhood was spent listening to classic rock and watching Nick at Nite sitcoms.
I lived a grunge rock teenage life: skateboarding, drugs, promiscuity, partying, and playing in a band.
Now, I‚Äôm a writer, working on my second book ‚ÄúThe Depth of Middleclass Sorrow: a comedy‚Äù. My first novella ‚ÄúTangled Shadows‚Äù is very important to me, and I hope it is significant to my future girlfriend too.
The best description of my personality is sincere, and analytic.
I try to always be as kind and considerate as possible, though I was not always this way (I used to be an obnoxious, terrible person). I am an extremely rational person, but I am also a very emotional, romantic, and adventurous person.
I have been called ‚Äúas funny as Eddie Murphy‚Äù.
For some time, I was a dedicated criminal. I had a crush on a woman who liked gangsters, so I ended up a felon (car theft), if she liked doctors: I would have a medical degree. I wanted to be a guerrilla soldier, but it is probably better that I was trying to rob jewelry stores, instead of making car bombs. Anyway, now, I maybe want to repair electrical appliances and be a postal/agricultural worker. I‚Äôve worked mostly in movie theaters and retail.
Ethno-culturally, I am: IrishAmerican-Catholic, from north of Chicago. Also, genetically, but not culturally, I am a quarter Mexican which is where I get my tan complexion from.
I spend most of my time thinking about: philosophy, science, religion, mysticism, politics,¬†culture, art, psychoanalysis, math,¬†history, sociology, anthropology, etc., and want someone with to have long, interesting discussions.
My main hobbies are biking, wall tennis, driving fast, writing, going to museums and concerts, playing cards, trivia, meditating, drinking, drugs, and sunbathing.
Random things I want to do: study history and vocabulary, lose 25 pounds/get in shape, work on craft/science/art projects, go to: Scotland, Mexico, Italy, Spain, learn a trade, learn some Welsh (I can speak some Spanish).
I used to look down on internet dating, because it was not the traditional way people met, but now: I see it as exceedingly more practical than traditional dating, and it can be romantic too.
Before I would just date the first woman I met who I was interested in, and they did not work out, so I believe we should all try to find our factual best romantic match (the person most similar to us). It is equally important who you dont date, as who you do date, as there is only 1 person most similar to yourself.
I have talked a lot about myself, but I am not an egocentric person. I will be at least equally interested, if not, mostly likely more interested in you (my future partner), than myself.
Beware: if you become my girlfriend, you will be the most important person to me: I will sincerely care for you, and I will want to spend most of my time with you.
I apologize for any typos or errors, I went to American public school.
To write, my email is:
xavierjayrichards@aol.com
If you want to know the movies, music, books, and T.V. shows I like, ask me, I have a long list: I took down to make it quicker to read.
P.S.
It is a 100% fact that there is a person who is most similar or compatible to you. It is like saying there must be a biggest rock somewhere, excuse the inelegant analogy, so to say the soulmate is real, but I prefer the term ‚Äútrue love‚Äù or ‚Äúbest romantic match‚Äù. Also, there is another idea I have: the worst romantic match: the person least compatible to you, also there is the second best romantic match, which is not the soulmate. So if you meet someone by randomness: there is a 1 in 8 billion chance, they are the person most similar to you.
I wish there was a website/app where you could search: Polish, middle child, heavy metal, and find all the people like you, but that has yet to exist. Please someone make it. For now dating apps are the same as meeting someone randomly on the sidewalk.
I should also say: I don‚Äôt want children, but I am open to possibly dating someone who has children. Like most people, I went through a phase of wanting to have children. Nor do I want pets, though I am good with animals, and had cats, a dog, and fish growing up: I don‚Äôt want the responsibility, and I don‚Äôt like the hair and waste of animals.
The woman most similar to myself 100% factually has to exist, she has: a name, birthday, hometown, and hair color. As I cannot just guess from thin air who she is, otherwise I would just go talk to her.
You can ask me anything, and I will try to be as honest as I can.
I did not say this anywhere: I was born in 1991.
Thank you, very much, for reading. Maybe I know your best romantic match.
Share if you would.
I hope everyone has happiness, choices, wisdom, good fortune, and finds their best romantic match, so on and such. And please always try to be as kind and considerate as possible.

Name: Jenn C
ProfileText:
ÔªøHi!!!


I'm Jenn.


  



I am:


* A giant infovore. I read so much internet longform. I read like 20 articles a day and skim a hundred more, when they come in through my lovingly curated RSS feed reader which has been my baby for over a decade. Once or twice a month I'll work through an actual book as well [1], but not as often as I‚Äôll paw through ao3 for longfic.
* The ACX/rationality meetups organizer for my area (I also moonlight as the EA meetups organizer occasionally, and on rare occasions I help out with meetups in other cities). It brings me joy to connect to lots of cool, like minded people, and to connect them to each other.
* Deeply interested in complex projects that take time and cleverness and skill ‚Äî cultivating long lasting friendships and communities, getting to truly know a city and putting roots down, developing deep expertise in a special interest topic, building out a personal knowledge system, supporting loved ones and watching them grow into increasingly better versions of themselves over the course of decades.


[1] highlights from a recent quarter; fairly representative
* Detransition Baby, Torrey Peters
* Engineering Play, Mizuko Ito
* Meditations on Violence, Rory Miller
* Troubled,  Rob Henderson
* Art in the After-Culture, Ben Davis
* The Complete Fairy Tales of Oscar Wilde, Oscar Wilde
* All Fours, Miranda July
* Middlemarch, George Eliot
________________
About Me
Basics
Gender: cis female
Age: 28
Sexuality: very gay [2]
Current location: Waterloo, Ontario
Job: Running a microceleb‚Äôs vanity think-tank (it‚Äôs a good think-tank, your honor.)
Kids: maybe [3]
Seeking: a long term monogamous/primary relationship [4]


[2] noting explicitly that I'm fine with dating transfem and NB people.
[3] My mom gets to take her cool adult children to brunch and exchange gossip and life tips with them, and I want that for me when I'm her age. Also, see bullet point about long complex projects ‚Äî that applies to raising kids as well. But those seem like not the best reasons to have a kid? ‚Üê But this also sounds like a bad reason to not have kids? But in addition I'm scared that it will go horribly wrong, which it can in many many ways (death or severe disability, I turn out to have an awful temperament for child rearing, kid just inexplicably ends up being a total asshole addicted to heroin). It‚Äôs a bit of a wash.
[4] I've been weakly intrigued by poly/open relationships for a pretty long time, but all of my past relationships have been monogamous. I can't guarantee that non-monog relationships will work for me in practice, but I'm open to trying it out for unusually compatible folks.
Potential Dealbreakers for Normal People
* Can't co-sleep more than half of the time, it wrecks my sleep quality :(
* Severe cat allergy ‚Äî either Mittens goes or I do
* Passenger princess (can't drive); need to live by at least one transit line
* Hard requirement for curtains open and bright overhead lights on during the daytime. Sorry gamers
* I donate 10% of my income to charity every year, this is extra non-negotiable
Additional Potential Dealbreakers for People In the Adjacency
* I love having lots of physical things, so a nomadic/minimalist lifestyle isn't going to cut it for me (though this definitely doesn‚Äôt rule out extended travel). I need a homebase with space for my PC setup and my  craft supplies and my bookshelves and ideally a worktable and my lumenators and framed art pieces on all of the walls... you get the idea.
* I‚Äôm kind of tired of the intellectual immune response towards social justice ideology; yeah it got excessive but I see the response as a devastating case of throwing out the baby with the bathwater. Like, I find much of pronatalism discourse intolerable because in many ways they're reinventing wheels that feminists have solidly established and were having sophisticated debates about by the late 70s, and this makes me want to turn into the jonker.
* I am only into a few board games and am kind of an art snob about video games, and for games in general I have zero competitiveness drive or desire to improve. The only games I want to git gud at are the infinite ones üòé


Read on if your deal has not been broken! For this doc I have chosen a strategy of highlighting my most polarizing traits upfront; I swear I also have straightforwardly good traits as well :P


________________
About You


* Not a guy
* Late 20s to early 30s
* Ideally, like, medium agency? I like people who have thought about what they want and are taking actions towards getting it, but I don't particularly want to date a workaholic or someone who doesn't have time for a rich, fulfilling personal life.
* Fun to chat with ‚Äî at least two of smart, observant, funny, and good at ~texting, but more is better :)
* This is a really good description of how I feel about the world, and I need it to also be what you feel, or at least for you to have a sense of the world that's compatible with it. Be surprised and dazzled and have your heart broken about the world with me.
* Meets generic ‚Äúgood partner‚Äù requirements
* Reasonably clean. We can't hang if you don't clean your bathroom or wash your sheets regularly
* Physically active. I don't derive much joy from exercise but I do it regularly, and I suspect that having a partner that does not exercise will make me much more likely to fall off, and that would, you know, shorten my lifespan by many years, and that seems bad
* Emotionally aware, communicates well, and is committed to improving the relationship over time through ongoing communication. I don‚Äôt need you to be an NVC master or anything like that, but I need you to make an honest effort, and for your honest effort to be not terrible.
________________
About Us


Recipe For Happiness Khaborovsk Or Anyplace
 Lawrence Ferlinghetti
One grand boulevard with trees
with one grand cafe in sun
with strong black coffee in very small cups.
One not necessarily very beautiful
man or woman who loves you.
One fine day.
this could be us!!!




I want a partner in crime! I want to be egged on to start cool scary projects and I want to egg you on as well. I want us to host a hundred splendid dinner parties and do the washing up together afterwards while we bask in the success and discuss what we can do better next time. I want to go with you to art museums all over the world and plagiarize the pieces that are particularly good for our living room wall (I‚Äôm starting to develop a system for that).


I want someone to go to the movies and late night snack runs with. I want someone beside me on the couch while we read our separate books or watch the next episode of a show together or plot our next big thing together in a google doc.


And, obviously, rushing the dating process would be the opposite of useful here, but I'm also excited about the big, slow things: to see what kind of doors open, what kind of projects we can take on, and how much we can change each other; year by year, decade by decade.


If this sort of thing sounds interesting to you, shoot me an email and let‚Äôs see if we click: hi at jenn dot site. 


________________
Appendix 1: Current Projects
Community Building
* I run weekly meetups for rationalists. I love designing meetups and I love running them and I love being surrounded by the kind of people who don't blink twice at having to do readings to show up to a meetup for discussing the readings. I want to keep poking at this group rationality thing, and in the meantime derive a regular dose of healthy intellectual stimulation.
* Occasionally I'll throw in a wildcard meetup ‚Äî we'll go see a theatre production or I'll run authentic relating games or I'll pull out some classic experiment for us to try to reproduce (we generally fail) or I'll make everyone put on blindfolds. I don't understand why more people aren't just absolutely delighted by the fact that they can throw incredibly weird parties purely for the sake of putting their friends in Situations. I try to take full advantage of this as much as I can.
* I'm interested in building up something that lasts, and something that helps out the folks in it emotionally and materially. It's fortunate that this basically starts happening by default if you regularly see the same goobers with enough frequency. But you can always push it further along strategically as well.
Skilling Up/Increasing Agency
* Careers-wise, I‚Äôm currently focused on gaining generalist experience around all things involved in creating and running an organization. One of these days I'll find a cause area I have comparative advantage in and like, found an org about it, but I don't expect it to be any time soon; I love my current job!
* I've been using LLMs a bunch, mostly because it's fun, partially because I think if jobs still exist in 20 years it'll be good to say that I have 20 years of experience with them, and partially because they're enabling me to do a lot more cool stuff and I'm curious to see how far I can push that. Like, I don't know how to code [5] but now I can make websites anyways! How cool is that :D
* I tinker with personal knowledge management systems to figure out what's the best way of retaining all the stuff that I read. In my teens to early 20s I used Evernote, but it's only ever gotten worse so I moved away in the late 2010s. I currently have a tiny gem of an obsidian vault, designed to roughly Matuschakian specifications, but I wonder if it would be better on the whole if I made a higher quantity of worse, lower effort notes.
Developing Aesthetics
* I visit a lot of modern art museums, and whenever I visit a new city that's what I make a beeline for. I love modern art museums ‚Äî most of the work in them is crap, but there will always be a few pieces that blow me out of the water, more than any classical art piece. Yves Klein, Meret Oppenheim, and Mark Tansey are some of my favourite artists.
* Tweaking my personal style! I'm trying to grow it in a slightly more masc and formal direction currently. I have Strong Opinions about some fashion bloggers. I am currently on the hunt for the perfect pair of loafers. I secured some weejuns, now I‚Äôm looking for some nice tailored button ups.
* Practicing decorative arts ‚Äî I do some cross stitch, embroidery, sashiko, sewing, and crochet. It's fun, I like customizing my belongings, and it's nice to be able to make tiny gifts for my friends on a whim.
* Dabbling a bit in digital art, just to create some rationality merch that I am actually willing to wear on my body. That's been going pretty okay, and it's great that Midjourney can generate me infinite reference photos.
* Trying to get into movies more. It's a neat art form. I‚Äôm especially into documentaries about very specific people or events that I wouldn‚Äôt otherwise know about unless I was in some sort of specific subculture, such as Crumb (1994) and Battle at Versailles (2016); if you have recs please send them my way!!!
Letting the soft animal of my body love what it loves
* Splurging on a big bag of jumbo cherries every week when it's in season
* Stopping frequently on bike trips when the clouds are dramatic, just to look my fill
* Reacquainting myself with the nu-metal bands that I loved in middle school. This is the good shit.
* Going through the IGF finalists every year and picking up the games that I think I might love.
* Cycling through a dozen casual hobbies unrepentantly
* A very specific genre of poetry that makes me feel fuzzy inside. This poem‚Äôs my favourite.
* Letting myself dance even though I have zero coordination and bodily awareness. I was once called ‚Äúthe wiggliest dancer at the rave‚Äù


[5] I have the tiniest bit of experience with HTML and CSS from playing Neopets a bunch in third grade, but literally nothing more than that
________________
Appendix 2: Additional Pictures of Me


  
  

Me and the gang rejecting a terrible message in an art museum; me in a cardigan I made


  

  
  

Most of my pics of myself are like these ones, taken after I've corralled my friends into taking a nice picture to celebrate and mark just being together. I'm not big on social media, but I figure the us-es of 2040 would appreciate these little tokens.


  
  

A few miscellaneous shots.


________________
Appendix 3: Testimonial


Jenn and I dated through university and remain good friends to this day. Sometimes I think about how I've changed and grown in that time, and many threads that I'm proud of trace right back to her. It was genuinely transformative to spend a few years experiencing Jenn's unique blend of compassion, intelligence, and will to point those things at making the world a better place.


Somehow she low-key pulled this on me even though we were just having an enjoyable time cuddling, playing various games into the wee hours of the morning, throwing interesting parties for our friends, slinging internet longform at each other, and just generally having a great time. I'm still not sure how she managed that one.


Also, we were young and dumb then, and she's even cooler now somehow.


Overall, 10/10, great person, would recommend deliberately spending a lot of time around.

Name: Dave
ProfileText:
ÔªøDave  
San Diego, California
davidabarak@gmail.com


I've been divorced since March, 2021, and I'm thankful that it was a drama-free event. My ex-wife is a good woman but we just drifted apart. I've done a lot of work on myself since then, and I have a good handle on the things I did wrong. If I get a second chance at love, I'll know how to make it work.


Because of the divorce and my retirement that followed soon after, I really began to examine my life. It turns out I'm not the center of the universe after all! Okay, I wasn't really that self-centered, but I did realize that my greatest rewards come from service to others, whether it's working to be a better partner and friend, volunteering, or just doing simple things that might make someone's day just a little nicer. Compassion, kindness, generosity, awareness, gratitude, honesty, humility and even that trait some guys don't understand - vulnerability.


Being open to life and living fearlessly are part of my new outlook. One example: I recently began bodyboarding ("boogey boarding"), and not long ago I had a magical experience - I was surrounded by dolphins as they fed, some as close as 10 feet away. One rose up out of the water to take a look at me. I was the closest human by quite a bit; everyone else was a couple of hundred feet away or more. That put a smile on my face and laughter in my heart for two full days. It felt like a personal gift from the universe. You can't experience life if you don't show up for it.  


There's a term I heard recently - ambivert. It describes someone who has the traits of both an extrovert and introvert. It seems to describe me, although I lean a little toward extroversion. I volunteer as a docent at a very popular local museum, so I get to be part tour guide, part educator and part entertainer. It's perfect for me, and I come away with a sense of joy.


I'm a glass half-full kind of guy. Sure, sometimes the level drops a little below the halfway mark - I'm human - but more often the glass is almost overflowing.


I'm not religious but I'm trying to find my way spiritually. (There's a story about how I came to finally acknowledge my spiritual side, something I kept suppressed for decades.)


I've got a pretty sharp sense of humor (or at least I think so), but I know how to rein it in so I don't offend people. I don't take myself too seriously. Sometimes I wake up laughing. But I don't overplay my sense of humor - I'm presentable in public and I won't embarrass you.


Although I don't have any pets, I love 'em - cats, dogs, birds, just about anything that has even the slightest personality.
  

I'm a natural-born romantic (I love surprising the one I love with little tokens and acts) and I respect a woman's boundaries.


Having someone special in my life is important to me, but not so important that I'd rush carelessly into it. Being in a romantic relationship isn't a one-way thing for me - I want to give at least as much as I get. After all, I'm not the center of the universe!






Factoids


* 64 years old as of the end of June of 2024
* 5' 6"
* Low to mid 160s in weight
* Retired (with a stable income)
* No children (but I get along great with them)
* Living solo
* Mostly vegan at home and vegetarian with friends and eating in restaurants, although I recently began incorporating fish into my diet when out to eat
* Non-smoker, light drinker, cannabis-friendly with the right people and in the right conditions (which amounts to maybe two or three times a year at most)
* Navy veteran (but I don't wear it on my sleeve)
* Liberal (surprising for a veteran, huh?)
* Past careers:
   * Photojournalist (also time as a columnist, editor and illustrator)
   * IT professional
* Lots of funny stories from a life of derring-do‚Ä¶ and derring-don't.


"To say of what is that it is not, or of what is not that it is, is false, while to say of what is that it is, and of what is not that it is not, is true."


* Aristotle
(I don't even want to try to figure out what that quote means. It's Greek to me.)

Name: John Wentworth
ProfileText:
ÔªøMeta: this doc is oriented toward a long term romantic relationship. I‚Äôm also open to more ‚Äúcasual‚Äù possibilities, but if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre after you should probably ignore this doc.


  



When I was 11 years old, as my 12th birthday was approaching, I noticed that the people younger than me tended to have grand ambitions - going to space or becoming president or, in my case, building a new continent. But the people older than me generally did not have such ambitions. Clearly something happened to nearly everyone as they got older, such that they gave up on their dreams and decided to get married, buy a house and have 2.5 kids instead. I was terrified that would happen to me.


So I swore very hard never to do that - never to embrace a life of mediocrity. And that basically worked.


I want a cure for aging. I want weekend trips to the moon. I want flying cars and an indestructible body and tiny genetically-engineered dragons. I want to understand minds, be able to build them and edit them and read off their internals. I want things well beyond humanity‚Äôs current bounds, and the focus of my life is pursuing those goals wherever they may lead.


What I also want - very badly - is a partner for that pursuit. And I do mean a partner - not a hanger-on, not an enthusiastic supporter, but someone with grand ambitions of their own and capabilities on par with my own or perhaps even greater. I want someone who can actually be a peer in pushing beyond humanity‚Äôs current abilities. Because that is what I need, in order to feel romantic love; nothing else seems to work.


‚Ä¶ and that‚Äôs it. There‚Äôs lots of little things I could say - I am sadly quite straight, I love dancing, etc, etc‚Ä¶ but I‚Äôve said the part which matters most and I don‚Äôt want to water it down further. If a partnership of pushing beyond humanity‚Äôs current abilities and making the world more to our tastes is something you want, you should get in touch and we can find out if we‚Äôre a good fit along other axes.


If you want to scope me out, I write a lot on LessWrong. A message on LessWrong is the most expedient way to get in touch if we don‚Äôt already have another channel; Facebook or the myriad of slack spaces also work if our social circles overlap already.

Name: Ben Schwab
ProfileText:
ÔªøBen Schwab‚Äôs Dating Document
Lat updated: August 14th 2024


  



























Who am I?
* I‚Äôm a 40 year old, pansexual, cis gendered male, nerd.
* I live in the Virginia suburbs of Washington DC.
* I‚Äôm independently wealthy with enough income from my investments to live a comfortable but not lavish life.
* I volunteer on a weekly basis to support the Northern Virginia community.
* I like interacting with people but I need time by myself to recover the energy loss from doing so.
* I play video games and read in my free time.
* I enjoy going to concerts, opera, theater, or sporting events when I have someone to share the experience with.
* I go to nerdy meetups at-least once a month.  They usually involve conversing on a wide variety of topics and sometimes playing board games.
* I‚Äôm a, mostly non-practicing, Buddhist.
* I have an undergraduate degree in physics.
* I‚Äôm an anaclitic thinker and tend to over think things.
* I enjoy conversations on philosophy, science, history, law, sociology, and many other topics.
* I am open minded and tolerant of opinions on which I disagree.
* I am teetotal.  I don‚Äôt drink, smoke, or do recreational drugs.  I‚Äôm okay with my partner drinking on occasion.




Who am I looking for?
* I am looking for a 27-57 year old of any gender.
* I would like to find a fellow nerd.
* I am looking for a long term partner and potentially a life partner.
* I value honesty, intelligence, independence, and humor in a romantic partner.
* I would appreciate someone who could challenge me.
* I have a preference for someone who is open minded.




What am I looking for in a relationship?
* I am looking for someone to spend time with and build a life with.
* I am okay with not having children.  I am willing to consider raising children.  I do not want to be the biological father of children but would consider adoption, fostering, making use of a sperm bank, or helping to raise someone else‚Äôs child.
* I am willing to try new things.
* I am looking for an intellectual and emotional connection.
* I am happy with a more relaxed relationship.




What type of relationship am I looking for?
* I‚Äôm happy with a monogamous relationship.  I‚Äôm open to considering a non-monogamous relationship but I would be looking for a primary partner in such a setup.
* I desire a relationship where we do things together but it is also okay if we do things apart.  This might be socializing without the other partner present or time for individual activities.
* Sex is not important for me in a relationship but it is desired.  I am willing to partner with someone who wants to wait to have sex and potentially never wants to have sex.  My preference is to have a physical relationship once we get to know each other well enough.




What can I provide in a relationship?
* I can provide emotional and social support to a partner.
* I am told that I am a good listener.  I try to always ask if someone wants me to just listen or if they want feedback when they want me to listen.
* I am someone who is not afraid to challenge his partner.
* I can promise to be available to provide emotional, intellectual, physical, or logistical assistance in dealing with life‚Äôs problems.
* I am rather domestic.  I enjoy cooking and cleaning.  I do not enjoy yard work.




Are there any potential roadblocks?
* I sometimes need some time for myself.
* I am a leftist and a Buddhist.  I am okay with dating someone who has a different political and/or religious ideology than me but these might be important for other people.
* I regularly attend mental health therapy.  My issues limit my ability to work and I apparently cannot work a full time job.  I have my mental health under control for the most part so I would not be needing much support here but my struggles are a part of who I am.
* Some people might find me lacking in ambition.  I am not looking for a prestigious career, or to make lots of money, or to be in charge of things.
* I find routines comfortable.  I have a weekly schedule where I have this for dinner this night, I go to the store this day, etc.  I can sometimes become attached to a comfortable routine.




How does one contact me and is there anything else?
* I check my e-mail, schwabbenjamin@gmail.com, at-least once a day and usually multiple times a day.
* I am not willing to relocate for a relationship that is just starting.  I am willing to relocate for a relationship that is well established and looks like it could last.
* I live on my own in a two bedroom condo that I own outright.  I am willing to upgrade my living situation if a relationship advances far enough.  I prefer to live in a condo or townhome as opposed to a single family house.
* I like animals though I currently don‚Äôt have any pets.

Name: Destiny
ProfileText:
ÔªøHow‚Äôs it going? I‚Äôm Destiny!
29 | female | 5‚Äô3‚Äù | Naples, FL (For Now)
________________


About Me


* I am a big-hearted nerd looking for a match who is kind, funny, and loves stories.  
* I am a published author of middle grade novels, audio dramas, and TTRPG content (writing is my main passion in case it‚Äôs not obvious). I‚Äôm also a lawyer, but I don‚Äôt practice currently.  
* I am on the asexual spectrum and looking for someone to form a connection with rather than jumping straight to physical intimacy. Taking it slow is important to me.  
* I‚Äôm a pescatarian (minus shellfish) but that‚Äôs more a taste thing, not a moral stance. 
* I am currently in Naples, Florida but don‚Äôt plan to be here indefinitely. Just waiting for the right opportunity to spur a move.
* I am very open to starting out long distance. Some of my closest friendships started online. 
* Jump down to the bottom of the doc for pictures.  


Dealbreakers
* Kids: I‚Äôm not interested in having kids, biological or adopted. 
* Age Range: I am looking for a guy who is in the 25-35 age range. 
* Conservative Politics: Although I‚Äôm not overly political in my day to day life, my values don‚Äôt align with conservative politics and it‚Äôs important to me that whoever I date shares my values. 
* Hardcore Atheism: I was raised Christian and still consider myself Christian (though in a much less legalistic and much more acceptance and love thy neighbor kind of way). Though I don‚Äôt need my partner to share my exact beliefs, I‚Äôd prefer someone who is baseline spiritual, even if agnostic.
* Smoking/Excessive Drinking: I don‚Äôt smoke or drink. Casual drinking is fine but I don‚Äôt like the smell of smoke.  
* Polyamory: I am 100% monogamous. 
* Cats: I don‚Äôt have anything against cats and in fact I like them a lot. I‚Äôm just allergic to them unfortunately :( 
Things I Love 
* TTRPGs: I am never playing as many TTRPGs as I‚Äôd like so, to supplement, I watch a bunch of actual plays. My current favorites are Dimension 20 (especially Fantasy High), Worlds Beyond Number, and NADDPOD. 
* Theme Parks: I grew up in Florida so I usually went to Orlando at least once a year and I‚Äôve kept the love of theme parks into adulthood. I love roller coasters (even though I can be a total baby about getting on them). The last one that really wowed me was Mako at SeaWorld. The airtime on the hills was amazing! 
* Escape Rooms: I am such a huge sucker for riddles and puzzles and there is not a secret tunnel in the world that I don‚Äôt want to fling myself into with reckless abandon. It‚Äôs the closest to a real-life point and click game that you can get and I love it. There‚Äôs one in Baton Rouge called 13th Gate Escape that I‚Äôve been dying to check out. I‚Äôve heard it‚Äôs like the Disney of escape rooms! 
* Musical Theater: I lived in NYC for three years and the best part (besides the subway which I miss so much) was Broadway proximity. Some of my favorite shows are She Loves Me, Little Shop of Horrors, Six, Legally Blonde, Phantom, Ride the Cyclone, Matilda, Nerdy Prudes Must Die, and Hamilton. It hasn‚Äôt been staged yet but I‚Äôm also really enjoying Epic as it releases! And the single best musical episode of a TV show hands down is Once More With Feeling from Buffy (though Subspace Rhapsody in ST: Strange New Worlds is the best one in a long while).  
* Travel: I love to travel but I don‚Äôt love solo travel so I haven‚Äôt gotten to do nearly as much as I‚Äôd like. I‚Äôve been to the UK and Spain while studying abroad and Australia for my bar trip. I‚Äôve also been to Jamaica (where my parents are from) and several other Caribbean islands. I‚Äôd really love to go back to Europe to hit some of the countries I missed and Japan is my current big ticket dream location. 
Five‚Ä¶
* Movies I Love: Enchanted, Shrek 2, Into the Spiderverse, Everything, Everywhere, All At Once, The Mummy
* TV Shows I Love: Pushing Daisies, The Bear, Community, Frasier, Star Trek (TNG, VOY, DS9, LD, SNW)
* Video Games I Love: Slay the Spire, Hades, Return to Monkey Island, Chicory, Tunic 
* Childhood Favorite Books: Ella Enchanted, Holes, The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe, The Lightning Thief, Dealing with Dragons
* Non D&D TTRPGs I Love: Kids on Bikes/Brooms, Dread, Tales from the Loop, Perils & Princesses, Mausritter 
Vibe Check Me
* My Goodreads: I tend to read a lot of middle grade both because I like it and because I write it. 
* An Actual Play I Guest GM‚Äôd: Watch me wrangle a group of princesses as they make (delightful) choices I never anticipated coming up when I wrote the module. 
* My itch.io Page: Check out some of my side projects. 
Think We Might Be a Good Match? 
* Feel free to shoot me an email at serendipitousfox37@gmail.com with some info about yourself and some pics.
* If you don‚Äôt think we‚Äôd be a good match but you know someone who you think might, absolutely feel free to forward them this profile.
* Also feel free to email me if you want to talk about Dimension 20. I always want to be talking about Dimension 20 :)




Pictures of Me


     




 
________________
    ________________

Name: S Lou
ProfileText:
ÔªøJust a girl looking for someone to do the big shop with.
 
I‚Äôm Lou, a 36 year old from sleepy suburbia casually looking for the Tom to my Barbara.
 
This could be us‚Ä¶
 
  

 The basics:
 
¬∑          I‚Äôm based on the Surrey/Hants/Berks border (near Guildford, Reading etc)
¬∑          Single, no kids
¬∑          Monogamous
¬∑          Social drinker, no smoking or drugs
¬∑          Liberal-leaning & atheist
¬∑          Dog owner (she‚Äôs a massive flirt.  You‚Äôll like her.)


  
 
  
 
A little context:
 
My last serious relationship lasted 11 years, and I‚Äôve spent the past couple of years since then enjoying some solo time, focusing on personal growth and rediscovering old passions, with a few flings here and there but with dating generally taking a backseat.   
   
I‚Äôm someone who has always been very independent and at this stage in my life I have the luxury of meeting all of my own material needs.  I‚Äôm not looking for a man to put a ring on my finger, to give me children, or to bump one another up the property ladder. 


What I‚Äôm looking for is much more elusive!  


I‚Äôm looking for a man I can call my home.  Someone to grow old with, to experience the euphoric highs of life with, and to soften the lows.  I‚Äôm someone who experiences the world with a degree of childlike wonder and awe, and I‚Äôm looking for someone with a similarly curious nature, who finds joy in the little things, has an optimistic and upbeat outlook, and an exceptional capacity for kindness, empathy and human connection.  We‚Äôll travel, share new experiences, surround ourselves with a network of dear mutual friends and build a peaceful, fulfilling life together. With a dog.  Or three. 


I consider myself an extroverted introvert, so whilst I‚Äôm a good conversationalist I like to balance social events with plenty of quiet time and prefer small groups/1-1 to big parties.  I‚Äôm equal-parts open book & intensely private, and I tend to be quite direct and unselfconscious, which has its pros and cons in dating.  I can be a bit of a pleasure-seeker and I believe it‚Äôs perfectly ok to outsource things outside of your skillset to others if you have the means to do it (ahem, cough, shall we get a gardener, cough?)  
 
A few things I love:
 
¬∑          Reading - I have a mountain of books piled up by my bed and I generally get through a couple a month.  I particularly enjoy fiction written by women about the female experience but I also love most novels set in the Middle East.  My favourite read of 2024 so far is ‚ÄúHer Side of the Story‚Äù by Alba de Cespedes, and my favourite book of all time is The Stray Cats of Homs by Eva Nour.  I‚Äôm also a member of a non-fiction book club and we cover everything from neuroscience to mental health, travel, social causes and psychology.  I love the idea of reading a book in tandem with a partner so we can discuss it together.


¬∑          Theatre ‚Äì I genuinely believe it‚Äôs the closest thing to real magic a person can experience.


¬∑          The water ‚Äì My happy place is on or in the water.  Swimming, surfing, kayaking‚Ä¶I can proudly say my Dryrobe gets used for its original purpose, and not just as an outdoor Oodie.  Once or twice a year I chuck the dog in the back of the car and drive to Devon or Cornwall for some vitamin sea.


¬∑          The arts ‚Äì This Spring I managed to get my hands on the new Fujifilm X100 and I‚Äôve had a huge amount of fun recreating an analogue aesthetic and generally being a brat trying to snap candid photos of friends and family after they‚Äôve just taken a massive mouthful of cake.  I‚Äôm interested in Brutalist and Bauhaus architecture, art, sculpture and contemporary poetry.


¬∑          The outdoors ‚Äì you won‚Äôt find me dragging you up Snowdon every weekend, but I‚Äôm definitely looking for a partner who shares my love of being outside.  I have a gorgeous sighthound, so long countryside walks are a big part of our day and a failsafe way to win her over.  More generally speaking, I love to eat al-fresco, cosy up in a pub garden under a blanket and discover new rambles on the AllTrails app. 


¬∑          Good food ‚Äì I want to know all the recommendations!  Where‚Äôs your favourite place for fresh pastries?  Or that local Nepalese gem that no one else knows about?  I bought my first pasta maker this year and now tortellini is my entire personality.
 
About you:
 
Let‚Äôs start with the non-negotiables.
 
¬∑          Aged 30-42
¬∑          Ideally based in the South East.  If in London, you should be happy to share time outside the city.
¬∑          Monogamous
¬∑          I don‚Äôt intend to have children so it‚Äôs important that you either don‚Äôt want them, or are indifferent to them.  It‚Äôs fine if you already have them, though!  I like kids, I just prefer not to have my own.
¬∑          No heavy-drinkers and no drug users
¬∑          Dog lover essential.  She‚Äôs part of the family and will be joining us on many of our adventures. No cats‚Ä¶sorry‚Ä¶
¬∑          You take pride in your ability to maintain your home and can cook.
 
The rest‚Ä¶
 
I‚Äôm a balanced person who tends to operate in lots of shades of grey.  I don‚Äôt tend to be attracted towards extremes and I generally prefer a more measured personality.  
 
I find myself leaning into people who are comfortable showing vulnerability.  Intelligent people with a calm aura, who enjoy thinking a question through before they answer it, and who are secure in their sense of self and what they have to offer the world.  My personal brand of humour is dry and silly as opposed to lots of ‚Äúbanter‚Äù or loud jokes, but there‚Äôs no accounting for chemistry, right?
 
You‚Äôre passionate about your interests, quietly confident, an excellent conversationalist and sociable, but a little clumsy with it‚Ä¶  If you‚Äôve ever said ‚Äúlove you, bye!‚Äù before hanging up on your boss and silently dying inside, I‚Äôll probably find that sexy. 
 
¬∑          You‚Äôre a successful professional (in any field) and financially secure.  I love a healthy-mix of wholesome low-key dates with the odd bougie restaurant and overpriced cocktail bar thrown in.  Ideally you‚Äôll be comfortable enough that you can join me for things like this.


¬∑          You‚Äôre not a workaholic.  It seems to be a badge of honour these days to be building the next Fortune 500 company with eleventy-billion side-hustles on the go, but I‚Äôm looking for someone who‚Äôs generous with their time and attention.  Ambition and drive are hot, but not at the expense of your personal relationships. 


¬∑          You enjoy a mix of city & country.  I live semi-rurally and my weekends are full of trips to the farm shop, National Trust days, market towns and walks by the river followed by a coffee or glass of red.  My perfect date is a day at RHS Wisley to see the Autumn colours changing followed by dinner somewhere with a view.


¬∑          You‚Äôre present in the moment and value real-world experiences.  You‚Äôre not addicted to social media or gaming. 


¬∑          You like to stay healthy and fit.


¬∑          You‚Äôre romantic and enjoy caring for others.  Thoughtful gestures, remembering things they said they liked and little acts of service come naturally to you.


¬∑          It matters to you that you‚Äôre a good son, brother, uncle, friend, neighbour etc.  You value community and your personal relationships are important.  You‚Äôre welcoming and inclusive of others.


¬∑          You‚Äôre always kind and gracious in an argument.  You‚Äôre open-minded, accepting of others‚Äô views, and happy to be challenged on your own.  You don‚Äôt think you know it all, you can admit when you‚Äôre wrong, and you‚Äôre open to compromise.  You are tolerant of those whose political or social views may differ from yours and can engage in debate while keeping things light and playful.


¬∑          You‚Äôre a supportive partner who would view the two of us as our own little family unit, with or without children.  You‚Äôre open to creating our own celebrations and traditions and are looking for someone to grow something exciting and meaningful with, making our own rules along the way.


¬∑          You have an adventurous streak and enjoy trying new activities and generally broadening your horizons.
 
The prospect of meeting someone special is exhilarating but the whole online dating thing leaves me cold, so I figure why not inject a little old-school romance into the equation?  If you think we could be a good match (or you know someone who might!), take a tip from Tom Hanks and let me know why at datemelou@yahoo.com.  Better yet, send me suggestions for potential dates and fun things you think we‚Äôd both enjoy, and don‚Äôt forget to include a photo!

üìÑ Basic Facts
Hey Aron here -  I am
* based in Berlin-Lichtenberg, Germany
* 32 years old
* hetero-cis
* in a poly-relationship
* born in Germany, but spend 50% of my life in english, so can fluently speak and think in english


  

üëÄ Stuff to know about me
Some miscellaneous stuff about me which hints at hobbies and values.


I am interested in learning stuff, eXamples:
* in lockdown I got a drumkit 
* and a microphone just to eXperiment with and
* started taking a few vocal lessons as well - just for good measure
* when I worked in a nightclub (long time ago) I got into the details of making cocktails and got myself stuff like Gin spices, started adding grapefruit peel and flame rosmarin for drinks at house parties
* I try to embody a scout mindset üîé
* I practice Taekwondo 2X/week and am aiming for the second black belt
* I also spend a bunch of time reading blogs, books, and listening to podcasts
* currently investigating the art of storytelling


I am pretty eXtroverted - I flourish in interesting conversations with lots of people
I like to host small themed events (costume-parties, idea-saloons, or conscious music sharing sessions).
        
I try to do Good 
I care about having a positive impact on the world. With art always asking myself ‚ÄúWhat are stories worth telling?‚Äù.  Also connected with the broader Effective Altruism community. I have found plenty of wonderful friends there.


I care about truth‚Ñ¢. Would love to eXplore how we think about the world through dialogue. 


As a result of learning + working it can happen that I sometimes spend days without leaving the house. But co-working with great people is also socializing, right? ^^
üîé What I am looking for
You?
  



eXploring more love. I think I have more to give.
I want someone to cuddle and love.
And to receive love and eXplore life together.
Create a shared protopia (prototype utopia).


One of my love languages is definitely touch. I enjoy giving (back-) massages. Learned how to do that professionally once and it has been a great life skill ever since. Friends can attest :p  
Just great moments of mutual relaXation. Good stuff.


[some more ideas around deal-breakers and potential mutual interests at the end of this doc]
üï∫Short Term
Being Hedon Buddies - yeah would be open to that
Always happy to go on a fun date with someone even if ‚Äònothing more‚Äô emerges from that
  



Poly:
When I created this doc in early 2023 I wrote ‚Äú"Polysecure" is on my (long) reading list. Would bring it to the top of my reading list for the right person :D‚Äù
Well that is funny! I guess I did find the right person and did end up reading that book (and many others). I have been in a poly-relationship lasting since Summer 2023. So going over a year and going well. üôÇ Feels very much new to me though.


  

My partner and I with 2 amazing friends


I asked my current partner to leave a note here. This is what they had to say on the fly:
 ‚Äú10/10 would date again‚Äù (they have edit access to this doc if they ever wanna change it :D)




üåû Long Term  




Hmm eXpectation setting: There is space in my life currently for up to 6 dates a month I guess. Like if I actually look at my calendar and my plans.
In the long term I would like to introduce you to my partner. I want us to be chill around each other. To be fair this would be the first time dating 2 people at the same time. So I would just be open to eXploring and communicating what works for us. So I don‚Äôt have clearly detailed plans for this yet. 


Below you can read what my romantic single self had to say in early 2023:


I want us to encourage each other to become better. Grow together[a]. Which could also just mean that most of the time we are both each other's comforting recharging resting place.


I am deeply inspired by this impressive elderly couple who wrote a free book[b][c] after ~50 years of marriage. They both work in nuclear proliferation and had to first 'create peace within their relationship before bringing it to the rest of the world'. Our relationship might not look at all like theirs and we don't have to work on the same problems but I would want both of us to contribute to the world in some way or another while our relationship will contain a great amount of laughter and kindness - so we can be a shining star for others üåü


Kids: I don‚Äôt feel like getting kids right now. On the other hand I would not be surprised that with the right person I could imagine starting a family in the neXt 3 - 10 years.
But I could also see that I can scratch that itch by becoming a teacher of some sorts (e.g. professor, mentor or being the funny uncle^^). I am currently not feeling like I am missing something and I can see myself never having kids and still living a flourishing happy fulfilled meaningful life. But I (naively) think having kids can be a beautiful thing.
This would be something I would love to think through and eXplore together after a while. Let's see what feels right.


To be honest I am eXcited about the neXt relationship (hence this doc). Each year I learn more about myself and forms of communications (and have become a better friend of mine as a result üòä). I can see how that knowledge would just help greatly in a relationship.  (Things I read about and/or where I participated in workshops: Non-Violent Communication, Double CruX, Street Epistemology, intrinsic values, CBT, mindfulness, ask vs guess vs tell culture, consent games, ‚Ä¶)


Location
I am living in Lichtenberg-Berlin. If you are in Berlin or around that would be cool!
But everything in Germany that is reachable via train could be nice.


Otherwise, I am in and around London at least once a year.
Could see myself making 1 week long trips in Europe for the right person given that I work remotely.


I am kinda eXcited about the idea of having lovely connections in different parts of the world. Places to come home to in a way. But I can definitely see how this might be in conflict for you/me to be the building block of a committed relationship.

üë®‚Äçüé®üë®‚Äçüî¨ What am I doing with my life
Am a researcher and team coordinator at a not-for-profit research org where I look into fun-stuff such as nuclear winters (but mostly support my brilliant colleagues). Currently, I have reduced my hours to eXplore more creative ways of adding value to the world.


I build art eXhibitions that deal with the future. Watch Facing Moloch on YouTube if you like! 
I also enjoy imagining what if we get it right. 


I am concerned about Global Catastrophic Risks and Existential Risks and devote a significant part of my work/life/art to contribute to these areas.


But I also wanna have fun in the meantime. Live fully / intentionally.
üìú Credentials
‚ÄúYou are the most optimistic doomy person I have met!‚Äù - random conference attendee in Prague


‚Äúwarm & kind person, great friend
reconciles being scientifically minded and being deeply artistic 
forward and systematic thinker who cares about flourishing of humanity 
Creative about grasping Zeitgeist and Ideengeschichte in art ‚Äú - close friend
‚ùìPotential deal breakers[d]
on leaving the house/city for nature
I guess I don‚Äôt go much into nature out of intrinsic motivation.
I love going to lakes for swimming.
Am happy to take a run through a park or go on a bike tour in the forestry greeny lake-rich outskirts of Berlin. But I only occasionally seek these kinds of activities on my own.
I wonder if I have that impression right now just because the last few months I have been recovering from a sports-injury .


(I have got passions for lifetimes to pursue just with internet access at home üòÖ)
So if you are seeking someone to retreat into the woods you have some convincing to do. But maybe you are the dryad to lure me into the forest ^^


Traveling
I don‚Äôt fly around as much (as some of my friends). I have some sort of deeper ingrained belief around responsible spending and carbon footprint and a cluster of 'something feels off'.
But I do make eXceptions for projects / work which I deem valuable. As a result I get to visit Europe's capital cities for conferences. In 2022 I was in Paris, Prague, and London (+ a couple of German cities). In 2023 I added Warsaw and Vienna to the list. Usually adding a few days around events/conferences to eXplore the city and visit museums or meet-up with people I normally only interact with online.
Generally, I prefer vacations which are reachable via train.


Diet
I am vegan around 98% of the time. 2% vegetarian are from eating at restaurants and families where there are no convenient vegan options. I would prefer for you to be vegetarian or vegan.
Also, potatoes are the best! Here have one and rejoice ü•î


Drugs
Caffeine in the form of coffee mostly. Occasionally, but increasingly rarer, a beer. You do you üôÇ  But taking drugs together is not a date idea I am interested in.
‚ûïBonus
You like nerding out about music (I like prog-metal music among many other genres)
I love discovering new music
I also enjoy sharing music, so if you are open to new stuff that would be cool. 
Would love to hear why you enjoy a certain style / artist / song. 


I find it inspiring when people are eXpressing themselves and are turning an emotion into art. Dancers, musicians, painters, poets. If we are getting together, chances are high that I will draw you (like one of the french girls). üòä


I admire it when people can think clearly, decouple concepts, eXplore ideas, and communicate well. Scientists, coders/programmers, writers. Let's update our models of what is actually going on. Does your map fit the territory? ü§î




If you want to get to know me - Awesome! Feel free to ping me:
Signal: aeXplorer.12000
Telegram: @globalcatstrophicrisk


Feel free to let me know if you missed something from this doc or think it could be improved somehow üôÇ
Here is my Admonymous link for anonymous feedback.


Thanks for reading all of this! Here is a poem as a token of gratitude:


  



ToDo
* insert songs and playlists I enjoy
* ???
* profit






[a]If I recall correctly the growth mindset has been debunked - but it is still something that feels intuitively good / right.
[b]"A New Map for Relationships - Creating True Love At Home & Peace On The Planet" https://anewmap.com/
[c]It is basically NVC + some funny anecdotes about geopolitics and the couple. But I just loved learning about them and how they both together want to do good in the world and thrive doing so.
[d]or deal-makers - depending on your preferences ^^

Q: Who are you?

I am Peruvian by birth, I am currently single. I have never been married. I do not have children. I have a Bachelor's degree in Network and Communications Engineering. I am finishing a Master's degree in Telecommunications Engineering.

Q: Can you tell me about your career?
I am an Electronics, Networks and Communications Engineer with specialization in LPI, ITIL, PMP, Cobit, ISO/IEC 27001, Marketing and Sales, Technical Support. Extensive experience in Supply Chain Management, Computing and Foreign Trade. High negotiation capacity with clients. Proactive. Experience in leading work teams for timely and efficient supply.
Currently, I am working on my own business for printing security supplies for checks and valued documents.


Q: What do you want in a partner?
I have a strong character, I am very affectionate with the person I want to be with. A woman who must trust me, a fighter and entrepreneur and start a family with children. 
I want someone who:
Holds the same values, beliefs, and goals as me.

Who is within the age range of 25 ‚Äì 40.
Is emotionally stable.
I will not date anyone who:
Claims to be bisexual or is into some other weird type of sexuality.
Already has children (sorry single moms) or wants to have children.

Is into poly relationships.
Exceptions:
I wouldn‚Äôt have a problem with someone who only drinks one glass of wine every once in a while, but I choose not to drink due to how it affects a person‚Äôs psychological and physical health.


I am looking for a native American woman to start a family with children living in Ohio (Cleveland) or Florida. My intention is to obtain my residency in the United States. I want to live in peace with my future wife. At the moment, I live with my parents.
A clarification: I do not take advantage of any woman to obtain residency, and not for money either.
I am a very hard-working and enterprising man. I do it for love and loyalty. And when I am with a woman, I fight to move forward.


Q: What else are you looking for?
When it comes to trust, respect, and commitment it‚Äôs a two way street for me.
I will be honest with you if you are honest with me.
I will be loving to you if you are loving to me.
I will praise you if you praise me.
I will be with you in the tough times if you‚Äôre with me in the tough times.


Q: Can you tell me about your interests?
Yes, I read technology books. My hobby is going to practical shooting and long-range shooting championships. I watch action movies, anime and a bit of drama to laugh.

The books of technology, cybersecurity.

Name: Jake Owen
ProfileText:
ÔªøJake Stiles Owen‚Äôs Date-Me Doc
  

  

Contact info:
Phone: 703-945-0660
Email: jakestiles@hotmail.com, jakestilesowen@gmail.com
Social media: https://www.instagram.com/jakestilesowen (I don‚Äôt use Facebook or X. I barely use Instagram.)
Basic info:
Dating status: Single (divorced in 2016), seeking dates and long-term relationship, open to short-term
Location: Orlando
Age: 32 (born in 1992)
Kids: Shared custody of my 10-year-old daughter; not interested in more children of my own
Core values: Honesty, openness, charity/love, organization
Politics: Liberal
Lifestyle: Physically active. I drink socially. I don‚Äôt smoke or do drugs.
Religion: None
Occupation: Data Analyst
Education: B.S. Statistics
Interests: 
Art (consuming): Broadway musicals, girlpop, open mics, reading, botanical gardens
Art (creation): Cooking, game design, piano
Physical: Biking, walking, hiking, pickleball, volunteering
Intellectual: Logic puzzles, Programming (Python), board games (especially chess and Scrabble)
Travel/adventure: NYC, skydiving, national parks, Cedar Point, New Orleans, Seattle
Misc: Fancy restaurants (love mocktails), people-watching (coffee shops, libraries, parks), tutoring
Linktree: https://linktr.ee/JakeStiles
What I‚Äôm looking for:
I‚Äôm seeking someone to care for and who cares for me. I‚Äôve been single since about July 2023, and I‚Äôm increasingly tired of it. I am a positive and happy guy, and I feel overfull with capacity for love and close relationships, but I currently lack an outlet. When I‚Äôm with my daughter, I‚Äôm able to care for her, and our relationship is great. But our inconsistent schedule together (1-4 days a week with variable hours on those days) leaves a lot of alone time. I cope by surrounding myself with strangers/acquaintances (at coffee shops, libraries, parks, social clubs/meetups, and bars) and friends, but I still feel lonely.
Who I‚Äôm looking for:
More important to me
Age: Prefer within -8 years or +5 years of my age.
Politics: Prefer liberal (If you‚Äôd seriously consider voting for Trump, we likely won‚Äôt get along well enough to date).
Children: Prefer none, but could consider being a step-parent especially if your situation is similar to mine (one older child, shared custody, and not full-time care). If you have two or more young children full-time, we likely wouldn‚Äôt make a great match.
Lifestyle: Prefer active, non-smoker, and not a heavy drinker.
Location: Prefer in/near Orlando. I won‚Äôt move from Orlando due to my daughter. 
Less important to me
Religion: Prefer areligious, however as long as you don‚Äôt seek to impose your religion on others, I‚Äôm not fussed.
Occupation/Education: Prefer employed and intelligent. If you plan to be fully financially dependent on your partner, then I suggest you look for someone with a higher income than me.
Monogamy/non-monogamy: Open to monogamy, polyamory, ENM, relationship anarchy, etc. I‚Äôve had differing thoughts and preferences on this over time, and I‚Äôm happy so long as there is honesty and an open dialogue about what we want.


What I‚Äôm like:
Enthusiastic:
* I respond to texts right away.
* I respect mutual enthusiasm: if you‚Äôre into something, I‚Äôm into it. If you‚Äôre meh, I‚Äôm out. 
* I like to express and receive love through quality time, words of affirmation, touch, and acts of service. Giving/receiving gifts doesn‚Äôt come as naturally to me.
* I like to joke, tease, and generally not take things seriously (unless they‚Äôre serious things).


Thoughtful and honest: 
* I think before I speak.
* I'm polite and non-pushy.
* I admit when I‚Äôm wrong and appreciate when others do the same.
* I‚Äôm positive and don‚Äôt focus on things I dislike.
* I argue calmly and quietly and love to have friendly debates about trivial things.


Obsessive:
* I keep my house clutter-free and love to simplify (aka throw things away).
* I love to organize my life, especially using Google Sheets and Google Docs (as I‚Äôm sure you can tell).
* I plan things in advance and arrive early almost everywhere that I go.
* I like to ‚Äúgo deep‚Äù on things. My favorite games are Hanabi and Slay the Spire, each of which I‚Äôve put hundreds of hours into.
* In relationships, I want to spend lots of time together.
* I‚Äôve been learning piano very slowly by self-teaching myself one song (and no others) for months.


Charitable:
* I like doing good deeds such as volunteering, picking up trash, listening patiently to someone who needs a friend, giving rides to/from the airport, helping people move.


Successful and happy:
* Besides being single (which I greatly dislike and causes me some mental distress), I have my life together. I‚Äôm a great father to my daughter, my finances are reasonably in order, I‚Äôm relatively healthy and active, and I excel at my job. 
Conclusion:
I trust this has provided more than enough information for you to decide if you‚Äôd like to go on a date. My contact info is at the start of this doc. Thanks for your time, and I look forward to meeting and learning about you!

Name: Brian Hodges
ProfileText:
ÔªøHi.  Thanks for reading my info.  My name is Brian.


I'm a 57-year old white male living in the Phoenix area.  I have a background in IT and a graduate degree. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô1‚Äù and about 210. I seek femme or androgynous-presenting people of any gender and prefer smart, engaged and self-aware types. I look for a connection & serious chemistry with someone before I can really get into a relationship.  It‚Äôs that tangible vibe that I can‚Äôt ignore and can‚Äôt make up.


I am nonbinary and genderfluid; some might say ‚Äògenderchaotic‚Äô.  This does not mean I cross dress.  I am just not interested in being a masculine male in attitude or look and it‚Äôs much easier to just go with what looks and feels good to me and often it‚Äôs black.  


I'm an INFJ-T so fairly loner-ish, a Sigma and 6w5 Enneatype.  I like my own company when I am not partnered but tend to focus on the person I'm with when that applies.  I prefer small groups where I can talk to interesting people and don't particularly care for big, noisy venues.  I'm extremely well-read and look for the same in a relationship - show me your library. One of the main aspects of my personality is an obsession with the esoteric, the metaphysical, the unusual and hidden.  This extends to physical and emotional intimacy.  I want a deep, visceral reaction when I look at my partner and vice versa.  We should know what the other is thinking across a crowded room with just a look and feel a need to be touching and affectionate no matter the circumstances.  QAF. Curiosity, exploration, openness, desire and heat - if you resonate with ‚ÄúTake Me to Church‚Äù by Hozier, that captures the feeling I have in mind.


When I'm not reading or pursuing these things I'm listening to podcasts, sometimes working on novels or nonfiction research projects or watching documentaries. I play videogames and spend time in Second Life.  I have done some virtual photography and found it very soothing and creative.  I like to hand-bind journals when I have time.  I enjoy target shooting but am not a hunter.


I'm looking for a smart woman of any gender, 40 and up, who knows herself but wants to dig deeper.  I like those who are mentally strong, who have survived some of the rough experiences life can provide and come back stronger.  I tend to be attracted to tomboys and transwomen who look good in jeans and a tank top and I'm wild for ink and piercings. I like curves, whether they are natural thickness or muscles.  If you speak multiple languages or ASL I'd love to learn, ditto with anything else you're good at and obsessed with. I seek someone similar who is focused on their spiritual development and the search for knowledge and understanding. I want to find someone who is in touch with all aspects of themselves and not put off by the shadow.  Physically I am often drawn to women with a high melanin content but I'm open to anyone with whom I connect.  I'm not a monotheist and I lean way left politically. I would do best with someone of like persuasion who is open-minded, tolerant, progressive and spiritually attuned.  Bonus points if you are into Star Wars, particularly those who run around with red lightsabers.


I'd really like to meet someone in the Phoenix area but I'm open to travel and potential relocation if the vibe is right.  I'd consider anything more or less in the Western US.  I'm a monogamous person though I would consider a closed throuple with the right pair.  I want to meet someone who first and foremost gets me just as I am, accepts me where I'm at and respects my wants and needs as I will surely do the same in return.  I'm housebroken, responsible, employed and live on my own.


If this resonates with you, send me your bat sign‚Ä¶  bhodges209@gmail.com.
