Name: Daryna
ProfileText:
ÔªøDaryna‚Äôs Date Me Doc


  



  

Background
Ukrainian, living in Germany since 2015. I moved here for studies (rationally) and due to my late childhood memories of calm, clean cities and sporty, smiling people (emotionally). I've also lived in China and the States, so I‚Äôm fairly used to fitting my life into two (largely overweight) suitcases. I was supposed to move to Stuttgart but stayed in Berlin (mainly because my paintings no longer fit into those two suitcases).
Languages: German, English, Russian. Any of them goes, but I feel less witty in German.
Location: Berlin, DE. I previously couldn‚Äôt imagine myself moving elsewhere, but now that has changed, and I would switch cities for new experiences and to shake things up.
How I see myself: Emotional, curious, creative, extremely stubborn.
How my close friends/family see me: ‚ÄòShe is kind, ambitious, self-reflective, and gives good advice. But beware of the girl, she‚Äôs an avid hoarder‚Äô (the ‚Äòavid hoarder‚Äô part was probably about the amount of art supplies I own, haha).
Who I am not: Never say never, but I‚Äôm not a party/club person. I feel comfortable around big numbers people at conferences and events at work but prefer smaller groups and dialogues in my private life. The quality of conversation matters to me. And the clubs nowadays don‚Äôt even play Britney Spears songs, so why would you want to go anyway, right?
LW/EA community: This is how I came across the concept of a date-me-doc but wouldn‚Äôt expect any other approach from the rationalists. My approach towards charity and rationalism grew naturally till I found out that it is in tune with a large community out there. I would like to engage with it more on a regular basis since I agree that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
Random facts: I was part of a girls' band in high school. I put salt on top of sweet foods (ice cream, chocolate, porridge, etc.). My guinea pig was a centenarian (by animal measures, 8 years = 144 years) and had a collection of hand-made dresses, made out of socks and rhinestones  üéÄ 


My everyday life
Work: I identify a lot through what I do, so my profession is worth a mention. I am an architect and an interior designer who is currently transitioning into the field of tattooing. I've been painting since I was little and previously used to sell my art. I paint with oils and digitally, also experimenting a lot with charcoal and ink.
Books: I usually read up to 5 books simultaneously, mostly sci-fi, dystopias, biographies, and non-fiction on society, economics, and psychology. I also love myths and fairytales of various nations. Currently, I'm relaxing my reading muscle and enjoying a fantasy book series from my childhood about a boy who was given ancient powers to rule Hell and his controversial journey to find Heaven.
Music: I really enjoy silence, to be honest. I am not much of a ‚Äòmusic playing in the background all day long‚Äô kind of person unless it's something repetitive like lo-fi. When I sit and listen to music, it‚Äôs usually some indie rock, hip-hop, classical, or jazz music. I am very unspoiled as far as the quality of the equipment, like sound systems or record players, goes, so feel free to teach me a thing or two about it.
Sports: Mostly yoga, pilates, and gym. I‚Äôve had a quite bad knee injury and have been taking it slow since then. I would love to try more group sports and hiking in the future.
Activities: Painting/sketching, photographing, singing. Redesigning my apartment for the 100th time, helping friends redesign their apartments for the 100th time, treasure hunting for new lampshades at thrift stores. Repotting my astonishingly fast-growing basil plants.
Where you can usually find me: Bookstores, vintage markets, parks, theaters, cinemas, somewhere in the streets (I walk a lot), or at home enjoying my afternoon beauty sleep.


Dating preferences
Love language: All of them matter, but I would pick Physical Touch and Acts of Service as my main ones. With Physical Touch being one of the things you can almost exclusively get in a romantic relationship, it is a very important feature for me. While Acts of Service show the invisible care, and I like their casual subtlety.
Style: Monogamous, long-term. Committed, honest, intimate, caring, romantic.
Looking for: A kind, reliable, emotionally mature, ambitious person with a strong set of values they stand by.
Kids: For me, the partner comes first, and children are negotiable. I am looking for a person with whom I could share this experience, but having kids is not the main goal of a relationship. I want someone I know I can safely rely on while bearing and raising a child, sharing this responsibility together.
Sidenotes: I don‚Äôt drink/smoke/take drugs, so would prefer a partner with no habitual substance abuse.




You made it to the end of this document! Feel free to contact me @silxxdar on Telegram or share this doc with anyone who you think would be a great match for me, thank you.

   * AI safety
* But I‚Äôd enjoy people explaining things they‚Äôre passionate about to me, pretty much anything. I find it very attractive when someone‚Äôs very nerdy about things
* I work really hard to improve myself, my health, and my life, taking one day at a time
* I meditate regularly, and am trying to learn more about Buddhist philosophy and Stoicism. I don‚Äôt practise any religion
* I go for walks daily, but my favourite kind of walks are nature walks, as well as culture walks in a foreign city on occasions. I also exercise regularly
* I have overcome so many life challenges including dropping out of high school because of my health, severe depression for decades (no longer the case, yay!), illegal dismissal from employers, coming to London from Japan all by myself, changing careers from a pastry chef to a software engineer, accepting long term illnesses etc
* I‚Äôm extremely agentic and get things done. Super responsible. Good at taking initiatives. Used to be type A, worked really hard to not be.
* I'm very independent and I can take care of myself, and love being on my own (and my beloved cat Toffin), but also love spending time with my partner
* I'm at my happiest when I'm around nature, and animals, reading/watching a film quietly, enjoying tasty food, wandering around a museum, or exploring a foreign place
* I'm very good at cooking and baking, as well as cleaning. It would be nice to cook together with my partner
* I have a good sense of humour, and am childlike
* I'm smart and would like my partner to be way (ideally one more big 'WAY') smarter than me and teach me anything
* Very cliche but I like watching films, listening to music, reading books‚Ä¶trying to get back into more creative hobbies like writing, drawing, singing, playing the ukulele, craft etc
* I used to love cycling, swimming, and dance aerobics, and I‚Äôm working to be able to do those again!
* I‚Äôm the kind of person who NEVER FAILS to pet a cat on the street, or always tries to rescue snails when they‚Äôre on the street
* I love enjoying nice food (just tasty, doesn‚Äôt have to be fancy. In fact, my favourite kind of food is free food) and it‚Äôs very important to me that I can share that enjoyment with my partner
* As you can see, I‚Äôm very autistic honest and transparent
* I'm reasonable and able to change my views based on evidence. I apologise for my actions if I made any mistake. I might argue to understand and reach an agreement if there's a relationship problem, but I don't fight.
* *Recently moved from Camden (central London) to Milton Keynes (30 min train from London Euston) where there‚Äôs more green and is quieter. I live alone in a house full of plants with Toffin, and there are a bunch of cows 10 minutes walk away which I‚Äôm making friends with :)
* I‚Äôd seriously consider being a housewife if you‚Äôd like that too. I‚Äôm just really good at house chores and I find it way too demanding to continue working full time with my health conditions


üå≥What I‚Äôm looking for:
* Companionship based on trust and deep friendship where we help each other grow and be a better version of ourselves, and be happy together. We respect each other's space and also enjoy each other's company. We feel truly safe and free to be ourselves.
* Although I loved living in a big city where a community of friends are walking distance away, and I also want to travel around the world, at this point in life (how many years have we got before the AGI?), I want to live in the countryside with a big, beautiful garden with a bunch of animals. I would like a partner who would want to share that quiet, peaceful life mindfully, enjoying each other‚Äôs company and tiny little things nature would grant us each day
* I don‚Äôt particularly see sex as an important factor in a relationship (although I do love physical touch). I just think there are other things more fun to do together than sex? If you think regular, frequent sex is essential in a relationship, I might not be your girl. Happy for you to change my mind about it though - it might be different in a truly loving relationship which sadly I‚Äôve never had
* Someone who understands my health limitation and is willing to support me when I need (it‚Äôs often more emotional support rather than a practical one although my mental health is well under control thanks to years of effort and resources gained)
* From my experience (I‚Äôm recently out of an 8 year relationship) someone with below characteristics will probably work well with me:
   * Very patient
   * Very stable (not much emotional fluctuations towards negative direction in particular)
   * Who is capable of loving someone deeply
   * Very smart and knowledgeable
   * Kind and caring
   * Practices mindfulness/meditation and has basic understanding of psychology and philosophy in general, as well as communication (NVC, IFS etc)
   * Has a great sense of humour
   * Still avoids covid, or is willing to avoid it for me (I certainly don‚Äôt need Long Covid on top of what I already have)
   * Willing to communicate and be honest and transparent




Thank you for reading! If you think you might get along with me, please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact me at chiakimizuta61@gmail.com or pass this to that weird friend of yours :) If you want a reference, my ex (who is now my best friend; we still have a great relationship, just no longer romantic. He moved to Berkeley so don‚Äôt fret) is happy to vouch for me.


Scroll down for more pictures! (neatly laying out the pictures on Google docs is clearly not my forte and I can live with that)

Name: (Kir)Sten
ProfileText:
Ôªø(Kir)Sten
Overview


Please note:


* Go to View -> Text Width if the formatting seems wonky on your monitor. 
* Desktop browser viewing is highly recommended.  This is not optimized for mobile!
  
	

  

	



QUICK STATS


Relationship status:  single


Pronouns:  they / she


Kinsey scale: 2


Attachment style: secure


Kids: None, and leaning towards not-in-the-future


Favorite color:  yellow


Meyers-Briggs:  INTP 

Big Five: 


  



HSP:  Yes, mildly

D&D alignment:  oscillating between chaotic good and true neutral


MTG alignment:  blue-dominant (red secondary)*


Height:  6'1" 

Born: 1989


Currently in:  San Francisco (though away ATM)


Born and raised:  a town in Ohio you‚Äôve likely not heard of


Willing to lead with a public bathroom mirror selfie:  yes


Tendency to overwrite:  You can be the judge of that.






* I don‚Äôt actively play MTG, but know enough about it and find the framework of the 5 playstyles.to be surprisingly useful.
	

Hello, thanks for checking this out!


According to a friend, my animal spirit is that of a parrot:  Excitable, curious, busy-minded, and colorful.


I'm pretty new to SF.  Right now, I'm prioritizing reskilling, making meaningful creative work of my own, and getting connected to people who share my values. There have been so many great conversations since arrival, and feel so grateful to be here.   


I am just as much looking for friends.  Feel free to reach out if there's stuff you resonate with on here, regardless of whether or not you'd want to date.  


üìú No LLMs were used in the making of this doc. üìú
	

Mind
  

Misc. Mental Info
Just some tidbits that might be relevant to anyone assessing my fit as a partner.  


* I‚Äôve generally preferred thinking about things over people.  It just feels easier and more fun/satisfying. But I‚Äôve been reading more about the latter lately to compensate for this, and have leveled up on people-attunement this past year especially, and have enjoyed the journey.


* I have a maximalism bias.  When presented with two options, I try to find a way to make both work simultaneously by default. Complexity can be beautiful in and of itself.  More is more!
   * This is not always a good thing, but it has served me well enough to be labeled as neutral. 
   * I do respect minimalism too, and wouldn‚Äôt mind it in a partner.  

   * Secure attachment style.  I thank my parents every day for this one. 


   * Highly dopaminergic compared to H&N.  I‚Äôm creatively ambitious and enjoy thinking about/planning for the future, sometimes to the expense of living in the present.  But I think I‚Äôm OK with that tradeoff.  


   * Neurodivergent to some extent. I have not sought a formal diagnosis because I wouldn‚Äôt do anything different with the info.  I‚Äôm comfortable with how my mind works, and trust it to steer me in leading a good life and achieve my goals.  
   * I get along well with neurotypical folks, but if your divergence is of an overlapping frequency to mine, then we have the potential to be super-compatible.


   * ‚ÄúAmbivert‚Äù is probably the best way to describe my social type. When I‚Äôve had a lot of one thing, I tend to want more of the other.  The amount of drain/recharge I get from social situations is also highly dependent on the individuals involved and other stimuli.  Speaking to people with shared lexicons, values, and interests tends to recharge me rather than burn me out.  But I do want to avoid following the path of least resistance into echo chambers, too.  SF is full of these. 

   * I was raised with a fixed mindset and zero sum thinking, but have consciously shifted out of them.  Sometimes remnants still show up, though.
	

  

^ This old art experiment was made by vectorizing regular slices of an MRI scan at each dimension and extruding them in 3D software.


Creative Identity
I'm an artist/designer who loves losing myself in my work, and often think in hypotheticals and alternate worlds.


A specific design language threads through all the mediums I work in.  It's an honest expression of who I am, revealed through the lens of what I find beautiful.  In a sense, we ARE our lenses.


Art is a beacon, something one casts up to say ‚Äúif you resonate with this somehow, we have a much greater than average chance of being friends.‚Äù Or, at the very least, have a great conversation.


Play is an important part of the process, and I hope that comes out in my work.  
	

  

^ Cosplaying as myself in front a 14-ft vinyl print of one of my artworks, installed at a festival in Southern CA
	

After contracting for companies for over a decade, I‚Äôve more seriously set my sights on making my own interactive experiences.  I'm slowly building an indie game (3 really, haha) and have dipped my toe into software when I need a tool that doesn‚Äôt exist.  


I say ‚Äúslowly‚Äù because, as of recently, I‚Äôve shifted focus away from growing my studio and back to learning some technical skills I‚Äôve wanted to have for a long time.  It‚Äôs an investment in manifesting my creative vision at much larger scales and with much more control, but at the cost of time and a steep/long learning curve. Time will tell if that gamble pays off.  
	

  

^ I recently had 3 works at a museum in Southern California, but I‚Äôm more in the entertainment industry than fine art. 




	Mind‚Äôs Eye
I‚Äôm a pretty visual thinker.


I have ideasthesia in addition to synesthesia, and perceive forms, spaces, and colors as drivers (or by-products?) of thought. 


Describing the different ‚Äúmodes‚Äù is always fun, and I look forward to getting into it if you‚Äôre curious.


I‚Äôm toying with the idea of making a video game about exploring someone‚Äôs mindscape.
It‚Äôs even a medium of expression in my sci fi world.


  

	  

^ An attempt to depict the form language for numberscapes. 
(Ask me about numberscapes.)


< I have a lot of little doodles like this, stepping stones for ideas.
	

	Aesthetics & Inspiration
Everything is aesthetic in some form, even the non-physical.  I‚Äôm deeply attuned to this frequency of being and understanding.


Beauty hits me very powerfully.  When I connect with something beautiful to me, I lose all sense of self for about a second.  These moments are fleeting, but spiritual in their pure transcendence.  I‚Äôm constantly scanning the world for beauty, and can find it frequently in small mundane details: chips of paint, lichen, the form of gravel‚Ä¶ or just great space relationships, like the shape of the negative space between two overlapping buildings.  

If we‚Äôre out walking, expect delays as I take pictures of stuff.
	Nature
The natural world is a huge source of inspiration, especially the microworld.  I like to look at life through a scale-free lens, generally imagining that small things are big, but sometimes the other way around.  It‚Äôs a rich source of novel inspiration.
I have a pretty bangin‚Äô mineral collection, and a digital microscope to help explore them!  I love imagining what it would be like to climb around on them if I were tiny. 


	

  

^ Lab-grown magnesium crystal, China - minerals that look plant-like are kind of the best thing ever.


  

^ Iridescent limonite/geothite, China - it‚Äôs super delicate.  It‚Äôs essentially just iron!
	  

^ Pagoda Calcite, China.  This one has a sublime distribution of large/medium/small shapes, and I love how it resembles toadstools.
	  

^ Plumbogummite on pyromorphite, China (One of my favorites, love weird coatings, and how it resembles rotting wood.  Minerals that look like plants are kind of the best thing ever.)
	  

^ Vanadinite on barite, Morocco.  I love how light and airy it feels.
	  

^ Chalcopyrite on ‚Äúfishscale‚Äù calcite, China (I love pretending I‚Äôm just a few mm tall, and imagining what it would be like to climb around on this.)
	  

^ Microscope shot of a tiny detail of a strange piece of chalcedony from India.  I used a technique called focus stacking to capture its depth without the blurriness.
	
Design
I really appreciate good design, whether it‚Äôs architecture or everyday manufactured objects. I often see the time and consideration that went into them, it boosts my sense of general gratitude.
      * This makes me some sort of materialistic, which is a neutral trait in my book as long as I‚Äôm mindful to distance it from status games.


I enjoy speculative projects (like academic architecture). 
Entertainment design is also such a cool field to me, as a participant and fan.  I‚Äôve spent a lot of time in the past collecting thousands of images of inspiring design for video games/animation/film to reflect on. Always happy to share my scifi/fantasy concept art wallpaper collection.
	Systems
I see beauty in systems, and communicating this is a primary artistic goal.  Especially when they‚Äôre self-regulating, or have cool emergent properties.  
I love procedurally generated art.  3D fractals have a powerful effect on me, especially.  I love the intersection between software and art.  If you just want to talk shop about modeling softw, generative AI, digital painting, or creative software in general, Hit.Me.Up.  
	Machine learning/AI
I‚Äôve been tinkering around with generative AI imagery for around 9 years, now.  When using it, I feel more like a scientist-adventurer, exploring a brand new world, a Library of Babel.  It‚Äôs so exciting to try stuff and plot out my own corner of latent space.  I‚Äôve been doing some public speaking and consulting with regards to how this tech can be hybridized with human creativity, and its impact on broader culture.  I have‚Ä¶ a lot of thoughts on this stuff.  It‚Äôs like jet fuel for conversations with other creative folks.


@09-13-2024_AI-Design-Talk_KZ.mp4

I‚Äôve also been learning more about the fundamentals of AI (LLMs and such), and the alignment problem.  The best way I can contribute to this one is through science fiction, sparking new thoughts and general awareness.  (Ask me about the world of Synthara.)
	

Science Fiction/World Building
I love science fiction, and consuming and/or creating it is a big plus in a partner!  It would be great to discover and think up new works together.
World building is a state of mind of sorts.  Thinking speculatively and tweaking parameters on the lived experience and imagining worlds in which that is the norm‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a good way to understand life in general, and just makes living more fun.  (See above on Synthara.)
	

Psychedelia
I have always felt very attuned to the visual elements of psychedelia, before I even knew what it was.  Recursion, symmetry, intricate geometric patterns, scintillating color, weird fractal hyperdimensional stuff, all feel deeply ingrained in my psyche.  One of my earliest memories was drawing a kind of geometric kaleidoscope on a magna doodle. 
	

  

^ My middle school art was very psychedelic.
	

So yeah, my art has nothing to do with psychedelic drugs, even though strangers sometimes ask me how many ¬µg of acid I took to make one of my art pieces. I have certainly experimented in this realm, but my mind responds differently than what would be considered artistically useful.  
(They‚Äôre very interesting though, and I respect the people who do use them for creative ends.  My ideal partner would share my view that they are a net positive for humanity.)  
	

  



My sense of aesthetics comes in part from seeking novel ways to merge and weave these different elements into something new.  I‚Äôve enjoyed probing latent space (gen AI) for ways to merge seemingly disparate elements, and have generated tens of thousands of works in the process.  But drawing is still the most efficient way to express precise and direct vision, and I don‚Äôt regret all the time spent learning to do it well.
	Collaboration
Creative collaboration is a big part of bonding for me.  

When I think of an ideal partnership, it would involve working on a shared project(s) of some kind.  Doesn‚Äôt have to be a successful commercial IP (although that would be awesome).  Really, it can be anything in which both people are able to express themselves honestly, and weave that into a harmony greater than the sum of its parts.  It‚Äôs a crystallization of the communication between both people.  As a bonus, such a thing can strengthen a relationship by acting as a safe place to test conflict resolution when creative differences arise.  


The brainstorming process is particularly special.  I like to call it ‚Äúsparking.‚Äù I have never regretted the time and energy spent on it, even when the majority of those conversations don‚Äôt lead anywhere tangible.  The positive feedback loops of enthusiasm while mutually branching into a possibility space is a beautiful thing in and of itself.
	Learning
I love learning, and devour audiobooks!  I listen to them while working (when the task at hand is text-minimal), while exercising, doing chores, and commuting. I just really enjoy the process of absorbing new stuff and updating my model of the world.   


I have been focusing mostly on general nonfiction on a broad range of topics, but historically I‚Äôve gone through a lot of science fiction.


Full disclosure:  My retention of specifics is not very good when I learn this way, but the main intention is to eliminate unknown unknowns.  I have a better sense of the world at large, and enough knowledge about many things to put in the appropriate keywords for a deeper dive should I ever want or need to.


Most of my text consumption comes in the form of:
      * Essays/blogs, usually rationalism-related somehow (I sub to ACX and LessWrong, but I am not hardcore.)
      * Asking LLMs things
      * Graphic novels
      * Art/making-of books
      * Technical guides


I also like watching EduTubers, too.  There‚Äôs some quality stuff out there.
	

‚Äî-----------------
Gender
First off, androgyny in others is really hot to me, both physical and mental/behavioral.  Especially if the person strives to master both modalities without seeing them as zero-sum.
	

  
  


I have a lot of thoughts on gender and my queerness thereof.  ‚ÄúAgender‚Äù feels like a decent word to describe how I feel.  


That said, I can do the gender thing and it's often enjoyable.  
Operating in Woman Mode is like taking a vacation. It's fun, even feeling extravagant. But over extended time, it can be draining and the comfort of home calls. The same can be said about Man Mode.


But gender isn't just a game, mask, or box.  It's a series of frameworks/lenses for interfacing with the world, and different situations call for different ones.  I ultimately strive for the best of both.  In my ideal existence, everywhere is home, and nobody wears masks.  If people are innately inclined towards one modality or another, education would help them find balance by mastering both.


FYI, the pronouns she/her don't distress me, and correcting them in social settings isn't generally worth the friction.  But they/them feels more accurate and is appreciated, and I will use them when given an explicit opportunity.  I used to have physical dysphoria, but have taken action to rectify it and now feel quite comfortable in my body.


I have a bit of a xenogender, too.  I‚Äôll just leave that there‚Ä¶
	‚Äî-----------------
Romance and Intimacy
As a partner, I will view you as a teammate and stretch myself to understand your viewpoint.  I will happily participate in mutual emotional support.  If I detect any kind of imbalance, I will communicate this with as much clarity as I can so we can easily course-correct.


I hope that as a unit, we push ourselves to be better as individuals, to fight the path of least resistance and keep each other on our toes.  To create and update a unified model of the world and share the cognitive load.  And that the hard path towards excellence will be made easier by lots of laughter, banter, and oxytocin.


  

^ The most romantic photo I have, and also the oldest one here.  Not really my vibe anymore, but what the heck.


FYI, I'm into romantic role reversal.  Expect a good deal of admiration and affection of a dominant nature. I like the dance between taking the initiative and being initiated on, especially when the switch points are unpredictable.  Specifically a dance where the lead-role inflection points happen with underlying chaotic rhythms that neither party can fully predict, but both know how to sense and roll with.


All that is a means to say that if I find you cute, you'll find yourself pinned to a wall sometimes. Hope you're OK with that.


Let‚Äôs avoid codependency. In practice, there will still be reasonably frequent contact. But knowing I have the space to detach if desired is important.   


I‚Äôm open to marriage and it seems like it would be a wonderful thing under the right circumstances, but it‚Äôs not a requirement for a fulfilling life.
	Exclusivity
Committed-yet-open relationships make the most sense to me intellectually.  I am not possessive of one‚Äôs affection and how they express it, although I would want some kind of minimum amount of quality time in a serious relationship.  (Love is not a zero sum game, but time is.)  It‚Äôs also worth noting that I am seeking a primary partner right now, and wouldn‚Äôt consider ENM until there was a mutually solid foundation to build from.


Put another way, it is in the relationship‚Äôs best interest if both (or more) people are as happy and satisfied as they can be, and the chance of one person being able to meet all the needs is not 100%.  Just communicate tightly, truthfully and explicitly, and we should be good.  But I‚Äôm OK with full exclusivity if it‚Äôs important to my partner, and everything lines up to support it.  
 
tl:dr: I see the benefits of either mono or poly relationships, and would be happy with either depending on the partner.
	Orientation
When lumping romance and intimacy together, I‚Äôd put myself on the straight side of pan.  (Kinsey scale 2.) 


I can see a timeline in which I end up in a long-term romantic relationship with a female-identified person, but I‚Äôd put the probability at ~<5%.  Part of it is simple demographics, and part is that I have found shared interests, attraction, and overall chemistry to be more difficult to align simultaneously with womanly people.  But this is ultimately case-by-case.  If you‚Äôre far on the feminine side of the spectrum, know that it‚Äôs still theoretically possible, and would make a cool story about how we overcame the odds.  
	Past
I don‚Äôt have many exes, but 100% of my relationships have ended amicably.  My last relationship of 4 years ended amicably in 2023.  I am still close friends with him, though he now lives pretty far away.  I expect him to play a role in my life for the foreseeable future.
	

‚Äî-----------------
Lifestyle/Work
I usually have location freedom unless summoned to a stint at a studio (rare, post-covid).  I did a lot of travel to different US cities selling my art at conventions, especially before April 2020, but I don‚Äôt consider myself to be especially well-traveled in terms of actually living in very different environments.  I‚Äôd like to open up more on this front.  I‚Äôve still been relatively nomadic lately (no permanent lease in SF yet), and know how to live out of a suitcase.


My default state is working a lot, although work and play can often intertwine in my field.  I‚Äôm currently on a soft sabbatical, meaning that I‚Äôve become a lot pickier about the work I take on, and dropped the convention sales circuit this year so that I can focus on my own vision, new skills, and recover from some burnout. I‚Äôm financially secure from living below my means for many years, and very happy to have time to take a step back and figure out how to navigate the rapidly changing creative industry.  I am optimistic about my long-term career situation because of the way I solve problems and see opportunities in general, but it‚Äôs especially hard to predict things right now.
	Adventure
I like being active!  Being active in nature is even better.
	  



Climbing is one of my favorite things to do, and has been all my life!  Trees, rock scrambling/light bouldering, top rope at climbing gyms‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm an acrophile.  I feel more comfortable from a vantage point and a trickle of adrenaline in my veins.  
	  

I really love hiking, and I do it less than I wish.  Nature is insanely dense with form/color/composition/system/everything-else inspiration.  


	

I also like dancing to EDM!  It‚Äôs uplifting, and really good exercise.  Dance floor unity is a wonderful thing when it happens.  Some genres I‚Äôm into: progressive psytrance, world psybass, breaks/glitch hop, and good ol‚Äô house if they keep it interesting.  If you know of any good rave scenes in SF along these lines, and you want a dance buddy, hit me up.  
	  

^ At Lightning in a Bottle a couple years ago.


I‚Äôve attended a fair number of underground arts/EDM festivals to install art, and also let loose and really push myself physically.  My step counter record is ~55,000 steps in a waking period (~45,000 in a 24-hour period).  There‚Äôs something about the hyperstimulation to all the senses in these places that‚Äôs comforting and energizing at the same time.  Ideal frequency of such events would be 2X/year.
	  

^ Obligatory Burning Man pic




	

Media
Music is awesome.  There‚Äôs a lot of music I like, especially electronic.  I love weird sound synthesis and layered production.  Also classical, and instrumental folk are good, too.  
I like animation and graphic novels for visual storytelling over live action film/TV.  But I don‚Äôt watch much passive media in general.  I‚Äôm more inclined if cuddling with someone though.


Games
I highly respect games as a medium, and have been slowly retooling towards producing them directly.  Good game design as a form of beauty for sure.  I spent too much time on them in the past...  These days, I spend much less time playing video games recreationally.  The two games I‚Äôve played lately are Deep Rock Galactic for chaotic fun with friends, and Cracktorio as therapy to get over perfectionism and learn a bit about devops along the way.  
	

  

^ The factory must grow.
	

I also enjoy tabletop RPGs, but they are also a big time investment, so I don‚Äôt anticipate anything beyond one-shots for a while.  I‚Äôd love to DM sometime though, for a campaign set in my sci-fi world.
	

‚Äî--------
Domesticity
I really like the idea coliving, and have a little experience with it already.  I‚Äôm currently working to participate/build a kind of chosen family.  If you‚Äôre reading this and think I‚Äôd be a good fit for a group you‚Äôre connected to, send me a message!  In the meantime, I‚Äôm planning to sublet from others until I have a better-formed long term plan.
	

  

^ I‚Äôve given some thought to this coliving thing.  Here‚Äôs a concept for what it could be like in the relatively-near future
	

As a domestic partner, I‚Äôm conscientious and reasonably neat, and find the process of cleaning to be rather enjoyable.  I do tend to drop clutter bombs when in a hurry to leave or when deep in a project, but don‚Äôt typically leave those out for long.  I‚Äôm capable of living in small spaces without going crazy. I cook, but am not super into it and my skills are pretty basic.  




	

‚Äî--------
Procreation
  



I'm leaning against having kids. I have optimized for different skills than what parenting demands, and think I can have a more positive impact/personally meaningful life if I really push the boundaries of my strengths rather than branching into that realm.  


That said, I do like kids and playing some kind of support role would be nice, perhaps as part of a chosen family in some form, or adoption if I change my mind much further down the line.  


Family history indicates that I still have plenty of time to make this decision, but I'm currently operating under the assumption that I will be going childfree when it comes to medium-term planning/goal-setting.  If my partner were to take a primary role in the childrearing and other factors lined up correctly, it would help sway me, but the chance of bio-kids is currently ~5% and adoption ~20%.


Family


I am pretty close to my nuclear family and spend more time with them relative to the average American, typically living with them for months out of the year.  It works, even though they are comically different from me in many ways.  
	

‚Äî--------
Physical Traits
Health
My overall health is good, and I expect to live a long life.  Conditions meeting the diagnosis threshold fall short of the dealbreaker threshold for reasonable romantic partners.  
      * I have an uncommon genetic mutation...  which makes leafy greens taste better.  I'll take it!


I'm reasonably active and eat nutrient-dense food.  I eat meat, but at a reduced consumption level with a focus on fish.


I love climbing gyms, but haven‚Äôt stuck with it since arriving in SF.  Running is a go-to for cardio.


Though my spindlyness means I tend to run cold.  
Shared body heat is heaven on earth.
I tend to steal the covers while unconscious.  
You have been warned.  
	

‚Äî--------
Height See what I did there
I love my height!  I find the benefits outweigh the disadvantages on a practical day-to-day basis.  I'm 1/16th stick insect, mother's side.


I have a preference for folks who are relatively close to my height in either direction.  It makes eye contact and hugs more direct, but I can bend on this. hah
	

  

^ (Source:  Gigacalculator)  (Another said 99.973.  I‚Äôm inclined to trust it more, but it didn‚Äôt have this pretty graphic.)




‚Äî--------
Fashion
I enjoy playing with fashion.  My style could often be described as ‚Äúadventurer-from-a-cyber-solarpunk-future.‚Äù


I like mixing styles/eras. Old-style cardigan + fractal-alien-spaceship-engine print lets GOOOOO!


Hats: Yes
Pendants: Yes
	

  





Politics and Religion
This doc is long enough as it is, lol.


.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.


OK fine, here are some tidbits.
      * I consider myself EA (or the classic ‚ÄúEA Adjacent‚Äù) and donate to organizations that align with it.
      * I worry a lot about AI making inequality even worse than it already is, and/or crystallizing it.  I don‚Äôt really know what to do about it..  
      * I‚Äôm relatively Longtermist.
      * On the left side of libertarian, if I had to choose a quadrant.  
      * Not into organized religion, but spiritual, or at least strive to be.  
	

Contact
If you made it to the end, thank you for the time and consideration.  And as a reminder, I‚Äôm also seeking friends or just one good conversation, so hit me up.


If you liked this profile, just contact me at: 
6kpqjfea@duck.com

Name: Sisi
ProfileText:
ÔªøSisi‚Äôs Dating Doc
Last major update: Jun 22, 2024
Quick intro
Name
	Sisi Cheng
	Pronouns
	She/her
	Age
	31 (1993)
	Location
	Oakland, CA
	What I do
	I‚Äôm an artist. I work as a software engineer.
	Personality bucket
	INTJ (architect)
	Interested in‚Ä¶
	Men, aged 28~35
	Looking for‚Ä¶
	Monogamish primary life partner
(more context in the section on ‚ÄúWhy I‚Äôm available‚Äù here)
	Kids?
	80% not interested in having children
	

  
  

  
  

What I‚Äôd love to do with my life‚Ä¶and you!
* I want to really know you, and for you to really know me.
   * I want us to finish each other‚Äôs sentences, to breathe in synchrony.
   * When we‚Äôre apart, I want to be occasionally reminded of you in all the little things I see around me.
   * I want to know what you like, so I can surprise you with little gifts of food when I go out shopping.
   * I want to find you your favorite tea, and for you to be able to make me the perfect cup.
* Let‚Äôs dine out!
   * I‚Äôm a foodie.
   * I don‚Äôt mind dining out alone, but it‚Äôs so much better with other people - you can have a conversation while waiting for the food; you can try more things from the menu; you can discuss how good (or not) it is compared to that other place.
   * Find me delicious food I haven‚Äôt tried before!
   * I‚Äôm happy to pay my share every time.
* Let‚Äôs travel!
   * I would love to vacation 2~5 times a year together.
   * I want to see buildings older than the USA. I want to take pictures of nature (accessible via half-day hikes) and paint them after. I want to learn the history of another continent. I want to marvel that people who speak different languages and eat different foods and believe in different afterlives can still have so much in common.
   * I can solo travel, but logistics are easier in a pair.
   * I‚Äôll get us great deals on plane tickets. I just need a hand getting my carryon into the overhead bin.
* Let‚Äôs talk about really cool things while cuddling!
   * I read more than 50 books a year. Let me give you the cliffnotes on the good ones!
   * I audit lecture series when I find interesting topics being taught by good professors. I‚Äôm currently enchanted by architecture, history, and behavioral biology. Do you want me to tell you my top 3 favorite man-made structures? Please please let me tell you about my top 3 favorite man-made structures!
   * Also tell me about things that you find cool. Let‚Äôs debate and discuss confusing questions. I like crying about things that are beautiful.
   * Let‚Äôs cuddle while doing all of the above.
* Come with me to craft fairs and vendor festivals!
   * Be my voice of reason and talk me out of buying all the cute things.
   * But please be patient when I spend 10 min talking to a fellow artist about the best markers and how expensive good gouache is.
* If you really gain my trust, I will show you my sketchbook.
   * Not the pretty one, but the ugly one with all the experiments and all the scribbling and the broken hands and things that didn‚Äôt quite work out.
   * If you can tell me why that pose looks off, I will give you a kiss.
* For a sense of my humor‚Ä¶
   * I drew a weekly comic strip for several years: https://www.instagram.com/workingasintendedcomic/
Important FYIs
* I‚Äôm looking for a long term monogamish primary partner.
   * I want to become each other‚Äôs favorite, most important friend. I will likely want to become nesting partners. I want to share our household, our interests, and our lives.
   * I‚Äôm open to having metamours if there‚Äôs enough commitment and investment in the relationship between you and me.
   * I‚Äôm not looking for a friend-with-benefits or one-night-stands.
   * I‚Äôm not lonely. I‚Äôm open to staying friends or just hanging out, if we don‚Äôt find a romantic spark. However, I have limited social energy and I already have existing friend groups. By necessity, I have to be very selective in whom I spend more time with as friends if there‚Äôs no significant chance to become primary partners.
* I‚Äôm not looking to have children.
   * I‚Äôm 80% sure about this. I think the ROI of kids is far too low for me. I would rather enjoy my time, energy, and money in other ways.
   * There‚Äôs a chance I could be persuaded otherwise, but there are some major hurdles we‚Äôll have to clear.
* My current partner will remain a part of my life.
   * More details about this in the section on ‚ÄúWhy I‚Äôm available‚Äù here.
   * You can read his review of me here.
* I‚Äôm very introverted.
   * Many friends don‚Äôt realize or even believe I‚Äôm introverted, because in many situations I can be highly energetic, bold, and the opposite of shy.
   * In reality, all human interactions drain my social battery, even those with a close partner (just to a much lesser extent). My battery runs out quite quickly and I need a lot of time to recharge.
   * When my social battery is low or dead, I‚Äôm that person petting the dog in the corner at parties. If I‚Äôm caught in this situation, I would value a partner who can be a social filter and take charge of the small talks. I will chime in when I can, or just observe if I cannot.
   * I‚Äôm also physically affected by strong stimuli. Bright flashing lights, big crowds, and loud noises have a good chance of giving me headaches if I‚Äôm not careful. I would love it if you reminded me to stay hydrated, or fished out a spare pair of earplugs when I‚Äôve forgotten mine.
* I value independence. A few flavors of this:
   * I‚Äôm financially independent and want you to be too.
   * I want a relationship where we‚Äôre our own persons who can thrive separately but choose to support each other to reach greater joy and achievements.
   * As an introvert, I prefer having space and time to retreat to by myself.
   * I likely will want to sleep by myself most of the time.
* I have a cat.
   * You want a picture of the cat, don‚Äôt you? You definitely earned it for making this far into this doc, so here you go: this is Omen, Biter of Legs, Chaser of Wire Toys, Overlord of the Bed, the Couch, and Everything - also the love of my life. She has roughly 40,000 nicknames.
* I identify as demisexual, and on the gray ace spectrum.
* I‚Äôm not religious.
   * I did not grow up in a religious environment, and no religion has adopted me.
   * I both came up with and then defeated Pascal‚Äôs Wager when I was 12.
   * However, I absolutely adore visiting cathedrals and basilicas (ask me what‚Äôs the difference!). Architectural marvels, all of them.
* I do not drink, smoke, or do drugs of any sort.
   * I‚Äôm in fact allergic to alcohol.
   * However, I‚Äôm perfectly capable of having fun while stone-cold sober at a bar with not-so-sober friends.
Why I‚Äôm available
I met my current partner in college. We‚Äôve been primary ~exclusive partners for 10 years, living together for the last 5 years. In recent years, it‚Äôs become more obvious that we want different kinds of relationships. Specifically, I‚Äôm looking for a more committed and higher-engagement relationship than he is willing to provide. Our hobbies and interests also did not converge, so we‚Äôre spending less time together than I‚Äôd like.


He will be shifting to a secondary role as I grow closer to a new partner and potentially more like a close friend in the longer term. However, he is family, and he‚Äôs not going anywhere anytime soon.


You can read his review of me here.
Reaching out
If you got this far, first of all, thank you for taking the time to read about me.


If you think we may be compatible, please fill out this form to get in touch.
https://forms.gle/Ywsjv9518mas9sHq9

Name: TJ
ProfileText:
ÔªøUpdated: 6/1/24 


  



Find me on Instagram for additional photos, or to communicate -  https://www.instagram.com/phxtj or email me tjguitar85 at gmail.com.


Hi there! 


My name is TJ and I'm a jack of all trades, master of none. I have a bachelor of arts in performing arts music, but I have never been compensated for anything remotely artistic in my entire life.  I have worked in the federal government for the last five years. In those five years, I‚Äôve been an airport security screener, a tax auditor and a project manager.  I currently live in South Orange County, California - I have previously lived in Arizona, Hawaii and various other parts of Southern California. I'm considering leaving California again within the next few years due to the cost of living - despite all of my family being here.


I'm 39 and I would consider an acceptable dating range to be someone in her late 20's to late 40's. I would only consider monogamy, and my deal breakers are smoked substances, recreational drug usage, and general meanness. I have never had a girlfriend though I‚Äôve lost track of the people I have met on OLD - I have been on OLD - off and on - since before swipe apps were a thing. I‚Äôm hoping this longer form word doc does a better job of actually marketing myself to someone who finds my flavor of weird adorable.


I go back and forth between wanting to chuck my career to pursue global nomadic life (with a partner) or just find a kind and interesting person to settle in one spot with. (Because maybe I should just be grateful for all the places I‚Äôve been able to travel to in the past?) Perhaps it will end up something in between.


I like going for scenic walks and being near, on, or in the water.


Part of me loves nothing more than a grand adventure. I‚Äôve been to the Great Barrier Reef in Australia, I rented an AirBNB restored trailer in somebody's yard for 28 nights (monthly discount!), explored Zion National Park and Bryce Canyon, and soaked in Iceland's Blue Lagoon (though the skies did not cooperate and I could not see the Aurora Borealis....)


That's not to say I don't enjoy life closer to home. Sometimes exploring the world looks like finding a new restaurant and trying something new on the menu. I also love going to classical music concerts, and enjoy being a spectator or participant in numerous sports.


I'm looking for a partner to share life's moments with, both large and small. My ideal relationship emphasizes quality time, mutual respect, affection, and straightforward communication.


I tend to prefer one on one and smaller group socializing over large group hangouts, but I can hang in the large ones on occasion.


I've been planning my own life for the past 20ish years. I'm more than ready to share the burden with someone else who wants to take it on. Even better if you‚Äôre the planner type because I tend to be pretty go with the flow - though clearly I‚Äôve planned everything for myself for a long time, so I am capable and willing to do some planning.   :) 


I do not have any kids, and I‚Äôve never had a burning desire to be a parent. For that reason, I don‚Äôt think that I would be compatible with someone who definitely wants kids. I look forward to a future where I can take advantage of last minute travel deals and don‚Äôt need to schedule my life around a structured work schedule.


I do not consider myself religious, but I was raised religiously Lutheran and I do in fact have some Ashkenazi Jewish in me according to a spit test of my DNA.
 
I‚Äôve been part of the FIRE community for a while, and I lean frugal - but I‚Äôm not rigid about that and I‚Äôm willing to compromise to some extent to avoid a perpetual single life. :D I can‚Äôt imagine ever needing to receive financial support from a romantic partner - and I‚Äôm definitely not looking for a ‚Äútraditional gender roles‚Äù scenario - I very much would like to give and receive an abundance of emotional support and physical affection.


I prefer warm temperatures and I am sensitive to the cold. For whatever reason, this seems to be the opposite of a lot of the people who I meet. I love going for walks by the ocean - the last time I went to Maui, I walked 7 miles every day on the boardwalks which proved that my sedentary life in gloomy coastal California is entirely a choice and not a physical limitation. I guess cold temperatures and cloudy skies do not inspire me to get my walking on. :D I have never lived somewhere with actual winter, but I'd certainly be willing to try it. One of my friends tells me I need to move to the East Coast to find the type of person who will appreciate me, but perhaps I just need to find someone from the east coast who has decided to make the trek to somewhere warmer. The heat didn‚Äôt really bother me in Phoenix until it got above 105 degrees.


At the end of the day, I'm looking for someone who does actively want a partner like I do - not one of those with the mindset of ‚Äúif it happens, it happens‚Äù - I don't want to build some full life for myself and then try to fit someone else into whatever little room might be left - I want to build an awesome life with someone else, together - I hope it‚Äôs you, because I‚Äôm pushing 40 and it would be great to meet you sooner rather than later.

ÔªøWelcome welcome welcome. The point of this doc is to give more details about me than I can stuff in my Hinge profile, inspired by the NYT article. Hope you enjoy the read.


  

(more pics below)


Basic life stuff: I‚Äôm 28, 5‚Äô11‚Äù, live in Fort Greene, Brooklyn. I work as a software engineer at Robinhood.


Personality: 
* Friends say I‚Äôm: easygoing, calm, thoughtful, their best friend
* Love fun thoughtful conversations- about politics/policy, science, life/vulnerability, books, whether dating docs are useful or weird
* Usually there‚Äôs something I‚Äôm very excited about. Often it‚Äôs some cooking project or a book/show I‚Äôm evangelizing. Right now (may 2024) houseplants and fermented foods, before that it was marathon training
* Medium introverted
* Strive for kindness, honesty, open/direct communication, integrity / efforts to live my values
* Vegan, for animal ethics reasons. note!! partner does not need to be vegan
* Less career-ambitious and more frugal (than most people i hang out with)
* Sleep early and wake up early (usually). I have a morning routine that I like to stick to.


Interests:
* Mindfulness meditation is a big part of my life. I sit most days, go to a meditation center maybe one evening per week, and do some multi-day retreat maybe once per year.
* Reading, fiction and nonfiction. I‚Äôm on goodreads
* Sports/exercise. I play in a rec soccer league (see pic), and run or lift most days
* Cooking, and especially hosting people for dinner. Usually indian, thai, mexican, or chinese.
* Games: I like most games. Especially soccer, chess, basketball, ping pong, trivia nights, taboo, banagrams, speed, dominion. I also like doing weird games / challenges with friends for the bit, like getting a drink in every NYC borough on July 4 with only public transit, or walking a marathon in Mexico City
* Effective altruism, especially earning to give
* Outdoorsy stuff: In SF (lived there until 2020) I was very outdoorsy. In NYC, less so, but want to get back into it.
* Things that aren‚Äôt a big part of my life: Visual art, international travel, music, going out, video games, social media


you
* are a woman, 24-32, live in New York City
* looking for a long-term relationship
* want kids eventually
* are kind, thoughtful, enjoy fun engaging conversation
* value open/direct communication, try to live your values


if your interest is piqued
Thank you for reading this far! If you got here from Hinge, just like me there (or like me back). If you got here some other way, you can email me at akshay.balwally96@gmail.com (kinda quaint no?). If you aren‚Äôt interested but know someone who would be, feel free to send them this link.


more pics!
  
  
  
  

(two shirtless pics! reader, you earned it)
