Name: Sean Langhi
ProfileText:
ÔªøAsterology


(Aster‚Äôs ‚ÄúDate Me‚Äù Doc)






seeking a cuddly, vivacious, earnest-as-heck autodidact/striver
to build a home with
and goof around with
and cherish & nurture for life
Behold, yours truly
  

Monochrome is in.
	  

They don't sell colors like this in the ‚ÄúMen's‚Äù section.
That's a damn shame.
	

  

Rocks call to me.  They must be climbed.
I may have been a goat in a past life.
	  

Why wear clothes?  üòâ
	

  

The far end of the fallen log hung suspended in the chasm.  By pumping your weight on it, you could make the whole thing bounce and spring like an enormous diving board.  Then, you'd feel like you were surfing in midair.  Great fun.


  

On a visit to Big Sur to see my dear friend Gary.  He and I go back to middle school.  His birth certificate says ‚ÄúDorian‚Äù.  One day, it was revealed to me by divine inspiration that Dorian's name is actually Gary Holcombe.  He felt confused at first, but he took to it pretty quickly.  Then, before long, he decided that my name is also actually Gary Holcombe.  We've been Gary and Gary ever since.


  

What percentage of my life do I spend consuming text?
	  

Proof that my Kinsey score is actually 2.
	

  

Am I exploiting the bridge study by showing you a pretty sunset?  Maybe.  Maybe I am.
Nonfiction is magic
The first thing you should know about me is that I read SO. many. books.
Do you read?  Eighty points of extra credit if you guzzle nonfiction too.  I want to hear from my fellow bookworms!  You can win my heart by talking to me about books.
Here's an old list of books I considered life-changing when I read them.
Here's a newer list of all the books I've finished in the last two years.  (The two lists don't overlap.)


One of my favorite subjects is ‚Äúapplied psychology‚Äù‚Äîrelationships, EQ, communication, motivation, parenting, and happiness.  I consider that genre one of the best tools for leveling up as a person.  What would the world look like if more people invested time in this?
(Someone who knows me well looked at this part and said: ‚ÄúYour special interest is relationships.‚Äù  Take that as you will.)


Some of my other favorite subjects are: business, sociology, economics, neuroscience, cooking, sexuality, cultural history, memoirs, and many more.  The secret manual for life is sitting right here in plain sight!  And it's free!  Libraries are a point discontinuity in capitalism‚Äîa 100% taxpayer-subsidized public good!  It's true what they say: teachers (including authors) can open a door, but it's up to each individual to walk through that door.


As you may have guessed, my ideal partner is a curious lifelong learner who finds joy and meaning in continuous personal growth.  I dream of bringing out the best in each other for decades and decades.
Help me stay on track to master cooking?  Write poems?  Play instruments?  Compose music?


What can I help you stay inspired to do?  I want to be a person's rock while they grow toward their dreams.  I want to surprise my future spouse with little gifts to support their projects and interests.  If part of that looks like evangelizing books to each other, I'll be thrilled.  üòâ
What I'm like as a partner
  

Ever since I saw this, I've been saying ‚Äúgeef‚Äù and ‚Äúbeef‚Äù in my head.
Sadly, the non-binary case has an awkward near-homophone.
Could we say they're a ‚Äútheef‚Äù of hearts?


* Super duper affectionate
   * Near-constant stream of verbal and physical strokes
   * Figuratively-never not touching you
   * Will use pet names more than your legal name
* Rotates through all five love languages
* Generous with shoulder rubs
* Practices and expects non-violent communication
   * This is a hard requirement
   * Git gud
* Wants to play games
   * As in Dominion with a capital ‚ÄúD‚Äù, not a lowercase ‚Äúd‚Äù
   * Please try as hard as you can to beat me
   * Please actually be able to beat me (or be willing to learn / find fulfillment in sharpening your game)
   * Sparring passionately in mind-sports is a profound form of intimacy & a peak human experience
      * Goodness gracious, I want an energetic rival/lover who gives me a run for my money
      * Remember that part in Atlas Shrugged where the young Dagny and Francisco are playing tennis?
         * DISCLAIMER: I placed as a finalist (top 1% worldwide) in the Ayn Rand Institute's Atlas Shrugged essay contest, and will happily talk to you about why Rand is crucially mistaken about the basic mechanics of human psychology but nonetheless raises some interesting points that are otherwise unheard in politics and must be redeemed by nuanced thought and application that Rand herself would likely reject unless she's cooled her jets a bit in the afterlife
         * If you found the above disclaimer unnecessary because you celebrate intellectual curiosity, critical inquiry, and literary cosmopolitanism, please message me already!
   * I can still love my partner even if we don't spar in games, but it would be really great if we did
* Wants to feed you‚Ä¶and be fed by you
* Excellent at playing unofficial therapist
   * Yay, reflective listening and emotional literacy
   * Have been told I‚Äôm about as effective as a well-liked real therapist
   * Would also support your seeing a real therapist
* Wants to build you up and emotionally co-regulate you and see you thrive
   * Your joy is my joy
   * Let's achieve some power-couple dreams together!
      * Build a dream house?  Start a business?  Raise a loving family?  Organize a conference?  Found an eco-village?  Go on a food tour of our ancestral homelands?  (Mine's Italy‚Äîjust saying.)  Compose a duet?  Revel naked under the full moon?
* Clothing optional when it's just us at home
   * The constant warm glow of intimacy from casual nudity with a partner is just‚Ä¶yes


A partner who racked up eight years with me (and is still my BFF) offered these suggestions to flesh out the list:


* ‚ÄúWonderful conversations.  Oh, my God.  So much depth.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúEndless memeing and inside jokes.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúSpeaking our own language we've formulated over the years.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúStealing your tea.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúGoing to Rationalist meetups and philosophy meetups.  And going dancing.‚Äù
   * I'm rather new to social dance, but I want to up my game
* ‚ÄúWalks in nature.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúLooking at sunsets.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúStaying physically active.‚Äù
   * Running, hiking, four-square
   * Organizing regular four-square games with a friend group!
* ‚ÄúGoing to li-ber-ries.‚Äù
   * [sic]
   * emphasis on the second syllable
* ‚ÄúBeing upset about temperature dysregulation.‚Äù
   * I run cold
   * Warmth is love
   * Please ensconce me in warmth
* ‚ÄúBeing distressed at noise.‚Äù
   * I never go anywhere without three different kinds of earplug in my left pocket
   * Where are my twice-exceptional babes at?
* ‚ÄúWanting to eat, but not wanting to go out to buy food.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúI'm just saying bullshit.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúBeing cute.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúStudying and working passionately.‚Äù
* ‚ÄúTalking to people.‚Äù
   * ‚ÄúYou're very social and outgoing, you know?‚Äù


She's great.


  

Oops, I meant: ‚ÄúRotates through all six love languages‚Äù.


  

Correct, but they forgot memes.
Basic info
* Age: 31 (est. 1993)
* Sex: male
* Kinsey score: 2
* Height: 6'1" (and a quarter)
* Pronouns: they/them
* Gender: ‚ÄúObjection!‚Äù
   * (say it in a Phoenix Wright voice)
* Born and raised in: Bay Area
* Currently in: Bay Area (formerly Seattle)
* Occupation: startup founder and software engineer
* Future location: wherever ‚Äúmy people‚Äù are‚Äîand especially where ‚Äúmy person‚Äù is
   * So, maybe Berkeley for the ACX readers, or SF for the entrepreneurs?  Or some other city?  I don't know yet, and I want to find out.  I have yet to discover a subculture that shares all, or even most, of my core values.  ACX readers come the closest, but on average, they're missing relational warmth and vibrant affect.  Did I mention I'm a shameless glutton for cuddling and feelings?
      * Update: I‚Äôve found an interesting match (somewhat, ish) with TPOT culture, and I‚Äôm trying out the Hayes Valley neighborhood in SF!
      * Update: TPOT culture lacks an intact contract of mutual care, and Hayes Valley ain‚Äôt it.  Next on my list: the Outer Sunset neighborhood in SF.  Perhaps, someday, I‚Äôll check out‚Ä¶New York??
   * Like most of my peers, I want to escape cars and atomization.
* Kids: leaning yes/maybe; it depends
   * I have dual concerns about this.
   * I believe humanely navigating the child-rearing years requires some combination of family/community support and financially planning for hired help.
   * I want to nurture others and support their development, without entirely forfeiting my own access to nurturance and development.  This is a major beef I have with the nuclear family model as we currently know it‚Äîthe two adults are isolated, overextended, and under-supported.  How might we solve this as a family?
* Monogamy/polyamory: let's talk
   * I‚Äôm looking for a stable home life and economic partnership, founded on an expectation of continuity and permanence, that hopefully doesn‚Äôt ban me from enjoying physical affection and intimacy in my friendships.
   * That means I would prefer some variant of ENM with the ideal reader of this doc (hey there, gorgeous!)‚Ä¶
   * ‚Ä¶but I would consider going monog if said partner needs it and is otherwise a bullseye match.
   * Poly with me is smooth sailing if you're on board.
      * I have eight years of experience with ENM.
      * I've fully or partially read several of the standard poly texts.  [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
      * Compersion comes naturally to me.  (Thank you, voyeurism kink?)  I can't remember a single time when I've felt romantically jealous of or threatened by a metamour.
   * Meeting the right life partner matters more to me than filtering for ENM seekers.
* I've survived much adversity in my life, and I've put tremendous effort toward post-traumatic growth.  My true peers are others with a rich history of character-building experiences.  [1, 2, 3]
* My attachment style is Earned Secure.
   * This tends to fail toward Disorganized or Anxious in the absence of reasonable emotional safety.
   * I do mean ‚Äúreasonable emotional safety‚Äù in a literal sense.  Treat me well and we're okay.
   * I have survived severely abusive relationships, and I know what to look out for.  [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7]
Calling all nuanced thinkers
‚ÄúThe ancient oracle said that I was the wisest of all the Greeks.
It is because I alone, of all the Greeks, know that I know nothing.‚Äù
‚ÄîSocrates


That's my favorite quote from Civilization V.  üòâ


Intellectual and emotional honesty take the cake in my value system.


Listening to diverse viewpoints, trying to empathize with others, sussing out the truth, sitting quietly with the finiteness of our knowledge, forming a responsible and carefully considered worldview, and holding skepticism toward our own biases are all deeply important to me.


I profoundly disagree with the existence of yard signs that show a pre-bundled collection of political slogans, even when I support each of the stated positions.


After I read Bowling Alone, I became a dues-paying member of Braver Angels and volunteered with BA as an event organizer and host.


My ideal partner would fit Paul Graham's description of an ‚Äúaccidental moderate‚Äù.  The more you wonder about and vibe with life experiences outside your own, the more I'd like to hear from you.


  

Thematically related.  Swiped from an Astral Codex Ten post about the regulatory
challenges facing bioengineered mouth flora that promise to eliminate cavities.

Ye olde ambitions
I want to net eight figures (or more) over my lifetime by being amazing at tech and startups with reasonably prosocial impact.  This has been a long throughline in my life.  I taught myself to code at age eight.  Then I skipped college and went straight to work at Google, at age twenty.  In the ten years since, I've been building my business acumen, inhaling technical knowledge, developing a grand unified theory of engineering productivity, and attempting startups intermittently.  None of them have taken off yet.


In the event of a wealth explosion: in addition to buying a lot of mosquito nets for charity, I'd like to create a beautiful, rejuvenating dwelling space that's quiet and green and close to a city and looks like something off Pinterest.  Maybe not just for me-and-mine‚Äîmaybe an eco-village?  A giant attic in which to keep brilliant neurodivergent artists and inventors?


Neurodivergent liberation, beginning with my own, is a much bigger theme for me than status games.  I get a bad feeling in my gut about win/lose status games (though I'm admittedly driven to seek others' admiration and fondness)‚Äîbut I like living authentically and healthfully, and nurturing the same in the people whose lives I touch.  To the extent that those goals require resource abundance and social capital, they tend to get folded into conversations about status.  That can lead to some inner confusion, since I do have both a functioning limbic brain and a conscience that's skeptical as hell of it.  However, I'm clear that what I fundamentally want is the freedom and power to reject toxic environments (physical, social, and professional) and to design a bespoke life suited to my and my loved ones' needs.  Wealth, to me, means being able to breathe, even if my needs require resource investment.


Even with a more ordinary amount of capital in hand, I'm still serious about nesting as a primary life project.  Home should be a delightful place.


As a young child, I wanted to be an ‚Äúinventor‚Äù.  I wanted to create contact lenses that would grant eyesight to the blind, and a dynamic converter that would project a cartoonish force field using energy absorbed from local sound waves.  I've tabled those particular projects, but their spirit lives in me still.  ü•ºüß™üßë‚Äçüî¨üîß


I feel curious about working with something more tangible than pixels and bytes.  Materials science sparks my imagination.  Could I create an eco-friendly material that beats plastic at its own game, at a lower price point?  Something that biodegrades into clean air, let's say?


I also feel curious about moving deeper into the business side of the world.  I've been encouraged to contact leading MBA schools and ask whether they'd consider me as a nontraditional applicant.  The idea keeps boomeranging back into my thoughts.


I hope I can still make something of these dreams without disappearing entirely into the pages of Baby Blues.  If it takes time, it takes time.  It would be lovely to land in the kind of relationship where we can plan across decades.


  

I assure you, fam, I am a highly qualified Superloser.
Some art I've made
I took these photographs.  I take a lot of photographs.




  





  





  





  





  



As any professional photographer will tell you, snapping photos is a perfect example of Superlosing.  You attempt a hundred shots in earnest to capture a single great one, and then you go home proud, with a camera roll full of 99% duds.  This is considered a good ratio.


When I was sixteen, I collaborated with my best friend to compose a progressive-metal instrumental track.  The piece was stylistically inspired by a band called ‚ÄúAnimals as Leaders‚Äù, which you should definitely check out.  We titled our track Amaranthine.


I write poems.
If I like you, I will write you a poem.
Bem's androgyny, y'all
  

The more I look at that mise-en-place, the more I wonder
what she plans to do with the ladle.  Defense, maybe?


Sandra Bem‚Äôs androgyny framework is the actual bee‚Äôs knees.  Here‚Äôs the rundown:


There are culturally tagged ‚Äúmasculine‚Äù and ‚Äúfeminine‚Äù modalities of thought, feeling, and behavior.
A fully developed human has mindfully cultivated both in themself through a combination of deliberate self-work and acquiring varied life experiences.
That human is the Avatar of shitty gender constructs, bending all the elements at once:
competence and warmth, yin and yang, nurturance and agency, assertiveness and receptivity‚Ä¶
According to Dr. Bem, they've risen to the rank of ‚Äúandrogynous‚Äù, the peak of human potential.


Dr. Bem came up with this idea and developed research tools to measure people on a two-axis system of ‚Äúfemininity‚Äù and ‚Äúmasculinity‚Äù, with the really cool people landing in the upper-right quadrant, high on both scales.  Those folks can display ‚Äúsituational appropriateness‚Äù across a wide variety of contexts, either by switching modes or by blending both modes at once.


Bem‚Äôs androgyny feels like a cousin to two of my other favorite ideas in philosophy, which are the golden mean (watching out for ‚Äútoo much‚Äù and ‚Äútoo little‚Äù in literally all things) and Hegelian dialectics (thesis/antithesis/synthesis).


So, am I masculine?  That‚Äôs a very solid ‚Äúyes-and‚Äù.


During the final minutes of an attempt at a sub-5:30 mile, I prayed to the departed ghost of my Marine grandfather for the strength to endure and exceed my body's limits‚Äîand I clocked in at 5:24, shaking, on the verge of heaving, but triumphant.  I'm excellent with technical systems.  I achieved the competitive rank of Onyx in Halo 5.  For projects that really matter (and some that don't), I plan carefully using numbers and spreadsheets.  I lift weights.  The old Teddy Roosevelt quote stirs my heart and lights a fire in me.  I like making my loved one feel safe and protected and provided-for (so long as I'm not over-parentified by my peer).


I‚Äôve also cried unabashedly at the songs in Steven Universe, which I purchased season-by-season in its entirety.  The lyrics of ‚ÄúLove Like You‚Äù‚Äîif you know, you know.  Visually, I'm obsessed with color.  I want to be aesthetically beautiful and to create beauty around me.  I'm captivated by sensations and will visibly surrender to joy when I look out over the hills, snuggle up under a soft blanket, or take the first bite of a good meal.  As I mentioned earlier, my special interest (other than deck-builders and approximately every subject in nonfiction) is relationships and feelings.  I'm a cat whisperer and absolutely melt for kitties, baby talk and all.  And I want someone to kiss me like this:


  

If you spend time on the parts of Reddit where this
sort of image gets posted, please send me a message.


I could be an appropriate partner for (among other sorts) a cishet AFAB who is herself holistically developed, and honors and craves the same breadth and depth in her male partner.  Historically, most of my partners have been bi+ and neurodivergent, so the gender thing took a back seat to a grounded notion of compatibility and like-mindedness.  In any case, if you like what you see, I would be glad to hear from you.  Just understand that policing my ‚Äúmasculinity‚Äù would be grounds to end the relationship.


All of this has bearing on family life!
Catch me teaching grit, agency, and excellence to my future kids, hopefully by modeling these myself.
Also catch me spoiling those kiddos with bottomless emotional attention, attunement, and co-regulation‚Äîwhich I expect to model just as much in my relationship with my spouse.


I greatly value some kind of bend toward Bem‚Äôs androgyny in others.
In AMABs, that usually looks like culturally conspicuous EQ and warmth (with their agency and excellence taken for granted by society).
In AFABs, it usually looks like culturally conspicuous agency and excellence (with their EQ and warmth taken for granted by society).


  

Can we please teach this to all preschoolers, regardless of sex?


One more hot take:


I‚Äôve developed a view that temperament and neurotype really are what gender is cracked up to be.  People empirically differ in their essential, embodied natures‚Äîmeaning blank slatism is false‚Äîbut the pink/blue bucket system is a stain on our culture.  Temperament and neurotype show uncountable natural variations, giving rise to ‚Äúendless forms most beautiful and strange‚Äù among individuals.  People are best bucketed by their contextually relevant distinctions (I call them ‚ÄúCoRDs‚Äù), which vary completely from one context to the next.  Reproductive sex class is almost never a CoRD, unless we're actually talking about intercourse or family planning!


The truth about a person‚Äôs talents, instincts, and proclivities dwells in that person, and the optimally developed version of that person is bespoke and exists independently of cultural archetypes.  I don't know, nor do I expect ever to know, what traits statistically correlate with reproductive sex class at a population level in a truly culture-fair society.  I do know that if you're dealing with (for example) a young Norah Vincent, who, as an AFAB child in the early 1970's, persisted doggedly in wearing jeans and climbing trees despite every imaginable social pressure to the contrary, then you love and embrace that lil‚Äô lesbian tomboy from the bottom of your heart.  And for goodness's sake, can we please make heroes rather than martyrs of our highly sensitive AMAB children?


What this means for parenting is: I‚Äôm going to let my kids show me what their natural talents and interests are, and then I‚Äôm going to nurture those without too much editorializing.  (Yes, rooting out bias and subtle influences is a hard problem, but still.)


  

The user selects negative-one genders, and the fortress bursts into flames.
Case study: BayHouseWarming
In 2021, as I was moving from Seattle back to the Bay Area, I tried founding a group house with 4‚Äì6 ambitious residents from among my friend group.  I affectionately called this project the Bay House.


My vision was to gather folks who would positively peer-pressure each other to achieve their dreams more proactively, in a warm and nurturing environment where we all enjoyed one another, shared meals, kept up with each other's lives, and did activities together.  (Looking back three years later, I recognize this as a variation of ‚Äúfamily‚Äù, which I now call one of my core values.)


I shot for the moon and landed in the treetops: I succeeded in establishing the house with a total of 3 residents, plus a fourth who visited for a time.


I took on sole responsibility for furnishing our new nest‚Äîeverything from budgeting to design to logistics.  When one housemate's parents came to see the place, they pulled me aside and said, ‚ÄúYou put all this together?  This is not some bachelor-pad setup.  This is a grown-up house,‚Äù nodding with a raised brow.  That's still one of my favorite compliments I've ever received.


I decided to plan and host a housewarming party, hoping to knit together different parts of my friend group and establish the house as a social venue.  Naturally, I named the party ‚ÄúBayHouseWarming‚Äù.


I still have the planning sheet in my personal archives:


  

Is this ‚Äúmasculine‚Äù or ‚Äúfeminine‚Äù?  You tell me.


The unchecked items got done in time; I just never went back to check the checkboxes.  By then, the list had served its purpose.


I also made this document to help track food prep.  It's an early example of what I now call [pun redacted]‚Äîmy personal survival tool for C.W.N. (cooking while neurodivergent).


Here's the rest of the story in photos:


  

The appetizers turned out delicious.
(The cans are all soft drinks, most with low sugar.
I'm a lifelong teetotaler; all my parties are dry.)


  

I make frequent efforts to share my love of hot sauce.


  

Ready for trouble.


  

Make it double.  (Or sextuple.)


  

Nametags, just as the sheet foretold!


  

The crew's all here.  The whiteboard mounted over the hearth was lots of fun‚Äî
every time a visitor came over, something new would appear on it.
We got poems, lewd drawings, people's hopes and dreams, more lewd drawings‚Ä¶


  

A chessboard is to some of my friends as a paper bag is to cats.


  

During the chess match, one of the spectators started
drawing the other guests on paper plates.  I have no
idea where the palette came from.


  

Main course: vegan chili and cornbread.
I'm a ‚Äúreducetarian‚Äù myself, and it's always easier to plan
meals for large groups by defaulting to a vegan menu.


  

It was the kind of dinner you'd want to eat outside.


  

This is why.  The view from the back deck that evening.


  

As intended, the party set the stage for many afternoons of four-square‚Ä¶


  

‚Ä¶with the good ol' crew‚Ä¶


  

‚Ä¶plus many evenings of Telestrations‚Ä¶


  

	  

	  

	‚Ä¶which got pretty wild.


Below is the Telestrations booklet responsible for those reactions.
William (far left above) saw only page 4, then drew page 5, and was VERY pleased with my guess on page 6.
  

	  

	  

	  

	  

	  

	

	  

	

	

Sex and other wonderful things
Is it bad form to talk about sex in a dating doc?


‚Ä¶No.


‚Ä¶Maybe?


Let's settle for a middle ground.  Here are some books I've read attentively:


* Magnificent Sex: Lessons from Extraordinary Lovers by Peggy J. Kleinplatz and A. Dana M√©nard
   * (HIGHLY recommend!)
* Come As You Are by Emily Nagoski
* She Comes First by Ian Kerner
* Rethinking Sex by Christine Emba


I'll save most of my steamy shares for a later time.  Here's just one for now:
I have a strong track record of creating a reverse orgasm gap in my relationships.


If you're my sweetie, I will learn all the ways you like to be touched, both in and out of bed.  üòò
I care a lot about this!  In a fully selfish sense, I come alive by making you come alive.  Nothing is better than a partner's joy.
Why I'm currently available
At 23, I met and fell in love with a very wonderful human, who is now working on her own dating doc, which will get a ringing endorsement from me.  [UPDATE: Here it is!]
That relationship continued for seven years.  We lived together for four of those years, and later moved apart.
Finally, we decided that we had irreconcilable differences and it wouldn't make sense for us to marry.
Now our plan is to seek life partnerships with other people, build a strong inter-family clan, and help raise each other's future kids.
This person is still my best friend.  I love her.  She's family to me.  We're all good.
Expect her to continue playing a role in my life!  If you're freaked out by this, turn back now.


‚Ä¶


Still here?  Excellent.


She's great fun to hang out with‚Äîsmart, sensitive, bubbly, hyperverbal, curious, emotionally intelligent, meme-savvy, plays board games, cooks delicious curries & pastas & pizzas & burgers, emits a constant stream of middle-school humor, laughs brightly and often‚Äîso if you feel excited to befriend a bonus additional human of this caliber, there could be cooking hangouts and board game nights and chore-swapping in our shared future.
How I'm searching
Using dateme.directory, I ran a database query for every F and NB doc worldwide.  (My data cutoff was 2024-04-14.)  Then I carefully read all 130 of them, skipping one.  That part took a total of 10 hours.  I built a spreadsheet as I went, recording my feelings about each doc on a dual 7-point scale‚Äîseparately measuring the strength of my positive response and the strength of my negative response.  Both scales work like this:


7‚Äîoverwhelmingly present
6‚Äîclearly present
5‚Äîweakly present
4‚Äîambivalent or unclear
3‚Äîweakly absent
2‚Äîclearly absent
1‚Äîoverwhelmingly absent


I recorded my data in normalized form so I could write relational queries.
Then I wrote a query to generate a bubble chart visualizing the frequencies of different score pairs:


  

When I look at the size of the 5/6, 6/6, and 7/6 bubbles,
a certain Taylor Swift song starts playing in my head.


I also wrote a query to grab the data records forming the lower-right portion of the chart (high positive scores, low negative scores) and sort them in a certain way.  That tells me which docs to revisit at length.


From there, intuition takes the wheel.


If you get an outreach message from me, know that a lot of forethought and appreciation went into it, and I've been spending lots of quality time with your writing!  üòä
Contact info
If anything in this doc has inspired you to say hello, pen a spicy response, ask me out on a date, or just be my pal, you're warmly invited to do either of the following:


* Text me at two zero six, two two five, seven zero four two
* Email me at: langhisc at [DELETE THIS] gmail [DELETE THIS] dot com


If you try one method and you don't get a response, please try the other.  As long as this doc is published and visible, I'll try to acknowledge every message I receive.


Thank you for making it this far!  Have a blessed rest of your existence, dear reader.  ‚ú®

Name: Kerry M
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate Kerry!
Hi, I‚Äôm Kerry!  



I am a lighthearted intellectual with dad energy, who likes to be serious and playful all at once. I appreciate thought-provoking conversations, folkways, and every kind of beauty.

My current projects:
* Seeking a monogamous marriage to start a family
* DIY upgrading my house and creating a beautiful yard and garden
* Trying to start a blog and generally publish more work
* Doing computational geometry and cloud backend software at a geology startup
* Running a rationalist meetup


What I‚Äôm like:
I‚Äôm extroverted and sociable, and I like making new friends and meeting new people. I like dinner parties and hosting events, and I‚Äôm constantly moving in and out of little jokey improv bits. My friends and I often get together for silly events and private game shows, and I wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way.


I get really into learning about subjects that catch my fancy. Some current examples include: How do Aristotle‚Äôs virtue ethics hold up in light of Darwinian evolution? Are there cool garden hacks to let me grow more plants in Colorado? Why do Karl Popper‚Äôs fans claim empiricism is wrong? What does societal collapse look like, and are we experiencing one? What will LLM-based agents look like, and how will they act? How is there a whole volume of Robin Hood ballads when I‚Äôve only ever heard the one with the peddler?


I really want to have a big family. I understand that in parenting, as in battle, no plan survives contact with the enemy, but I‚Äôm low-key thinking that five children sounds good.  I‚Äôm open to more, but we are not a good match if you want fewer than three kids. A dog would be nice, too


I love making music. I play saxophone in a chiptune band, and occasionally strum murder ballads or Americana songs on my guitar. I used to sing baritone in choirs in and out of school and am thinking about getting back to it.


I like to be outdoors and the wilder the better. Hiking and skiing and camping restore me to myself. Delight is U-shaped valleys, geologic strata, and cliff-nestled glacial lakes. Sometimes I will bring a recorder to the mountains and play songs for the forest creatures. I‚Äôm a big fan of backyard chilling around a fire pit, and of road tripping to national parks.


In between all that, I read many books, drink fancy cocktails, and play games with friends. I also write, though that‚Äôs new and should still perhaps be considered aspirational. I‚Äôm still figuring out how to (and how much to) rebalance my time away from ephemera (socializing, outdoors, learning, travel, experiences, weak relationships) into more durable things (published work, communities, strong relationships, traditions, a family, and maybe a startup)




Spicy stuff:
Politics:
Once a progressive, now I‚Äôd self-describe as a classical liberal informed by cultural evolution.  Center-right, if you insist on a 1-D coordinate, but I‚Äôm not attached to the label. I try (sometimes unsuccessfully) to avoid the culture war; I‚Äôd rather focus on living well, controlling the things I can, and connecting to my community.

Religion:
I spent the last decade as an atheist and was surprised this year to discover that God is real after all. So now I‚Äôm figuring out what it means to be a Christian again. I‚Äôm looking for someone who is, even if not a believer yourself, then willing to live in a way informed by Christian teaching. I‚Äôm still figuring out exactly what this means for me, feeling out denominations, and searching for the right community. I was raised Catholic and always loved the sacraments, the liturgy, and the high-church aesthetics, but there are some doctrinal issues that I‚Äôm not sure whether I‚Äôll be able to come to terms with.

Sex:
Open-minded and I like experimenting, but I also don‚Äôt need weird stuff to be satisfied.




A relationship with me:
- Monogamous marriage. I want to build a life with one other person, and make decisions as a unit of two.
- Touch is my primary love language. I am very physically affectionate, and I love to receive affection in turn. We shall exchange many kisses and enjoy many cuddles.
- Good communication. I try to be explicit and to over- rather than under-communicate. I am pretty good at picking up on weird emotions or social dynamics in the interest of improving/avoiding them for next time
- I am gender euphoric and I think leaning into gender roles is great. That said, I‚Äôve had to learn a lot of my gender performance explicitly, like an autist. I like being the leader in the subtle leader/follower thing that develops in heterosexual relationships. Ideally, you like being the follower here, and you‚Äôre willing to explicitly communicate about this stuff sometimes so we can grow better for each other over time.


Activities I like doing together:
- Visiting museums or galleries
- Walking and talking
- Outdoor adventures (hikes, campouts, ski weekends, scenic drives, etc)
- Exploring and refining ideas, or critiquing books/movies
- Hosting and attending barbecues and their winter counterpart, the dinner party
- Traveling to new places/cities/countries




What I‚Äôm looking for in a woman:
- Someone who loves learning, talking about ideas, and seeking out new ones
- Someone who is kind and fair-minded
- Someone who is family-oriented and ready for kids. IE, excited to be a mother, and intending to make raising a family the major ongoing project of our lives until the kids are grown. Certainly not alone! I intend to be actively involved too. But other things should be sidequests while the kids are at home.
- Someone who wants to live in a Christian-informed way, meaning regular(ish) church attendance, holidays, and taking scripture seriously-but-not-literally. (It‚Äôs okay with me if you believe God is literally real, as long as you‚Äôre okay with the possibility that I may never quite get there.)
- Someone who is politically tolerant. We don‚Äôt have to agree (though it would be nice), but it deeply bothers me when someone I‚Äôm close to casually and habitually treats political opponents as being uniformly stupid and/or evil.


Nice-to-have bonuses that definitely aren‚Äôt dealbreakers:
- Interest in being a housewife or stay-at-home-mom. I think this is a noble and worthy vocation, and I have the means to make it work.
- Interested in making music together
- Being actively outdoorsy and having a fondness for wilderness
- Being sweet and sassy




If you think we might be a good match, drop me a line at kerrydatemedoc@gmail.com, and let‚Äôs get to know each other! I live in Colorado but work remotely and travel frequently, so I‚Äôd like to come visit you if we hit it off. I‚Äôm aiming to start a family sooner rather than later, and am somewhat open to relocating for the right person.
________________
Here are some more photos of me. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô3‚Äù and I had long hair until this year, when I cut it off.

ProfileText:
ÔªøUpdated 5 July 2024
Pics


  
  

  
  



(All from 2022-2023)


Me
Vital stats
* 5‚Äô9‚Äù
* 34
* Oakland, CA
* LinkedIn, Facebook


What I‚Äôve been thinking about lately
Maybe this is kind of like having an async conversation with me, and is useful to see whether we vibe?


Some things I‚Äôve been thinking about:


1. That they made this "hang out with your friends BB-8 and Chewy" rather than straight-up cult indoctrination into the Jedi religion is unforgivable
2. ‚ÄúYou miss NaN of the shots you don‚Äôt take‚Äù. Wait no that‚Äôs not right, it‚Äôs not 0/0, it‚Äôs n/0 ‚Äì ‚ÄúYou miss Infinity of the shots you don‚Äôt take‚Äù. Wait that‚Äôs not right either, it‚Äôs actually just n/n, AKA 100%, AKA the conventional saying was right all along üòõ
3. How open should I be with various friends in various contexts? Where are the lines between sharing, exploring, over-sharing, holding things back in ways that create fun tension?
4. Well shit, now that we finished the climb, we‚Äôre on top of a fin of rock with cliffs on both sides ‚Äì how do we get down?
5. AI for epistemics is great and all, but what about AI for coordination and political stability?
6. Quintal voicings on piano! And the ‚Äúharmonic experimentation‚Äù sitting down at the piano that led me to ‚Äúdiscover‚Äù them
7. Textbook, you say that isometric mappings are linear, and you show that they preserve sums. But what about scalar multiples?!? How can you just not address that at all?!?
Stuff I‚Äôm into
Outdoors/exercise
I go backpacking in the Sierras a few times a year ‚Äì I‚Äôve recently gotten into hiking up from the east side, going off trail, and wandering around the basins, ~as described in this excellent book.


I go climbing in the gym and outside, often sport at Mount Saint Helena and occasionally trad in the Sierras.


I love mountain biking when I‚Äôm back home in Tucson, but I haven‚Äôt bought a bike yet in the Bay.


I also enjoy hiking, tennis, soccer, Spikeball, and weightlifting.


On most days I do one of the above.


Meditation etc.
I do concentration meditation most days, and I‚Äôm in a weekly circling/relatefulness group. I used to go on meditation retreats fairly often but recently I‚Äôve been going on noble silence solo backpacking trips in the Sierras, which have been excellent.
Music
I play jazz-adjacent piano. I rehearse with my band every week. Here we are playing one of my tunes, and here we are playing my arrangement of one of my favorite pop songs.


I also enjoy jamming with friends and singalongs.




What I‚Äôm trying to accomplish in the world
AI is rapidly getting smarter, and I expect it to have a huge impact on the course of world events in the coming years. My main professional goal is to make that impact as positive as possible. I‚Äôm pursuing that goal by working at Elicit, a startup that‚Äôs building an AI research assistant to do literature review. I hope that AI-assisted research can give everyone access to high quality evidence and reasoning, and help us work together to make wise decisions, agreements, contracts, and policies.


Relatedly, I‚Äôm an Effective Altruist:
1. I used to work on alleviating global poverty
2. I‚Äôm ~vegetarian
3. I‚Äôm into some weird subcultural stuff e.g. date-me docs üòõ


Us
What I‚Äôm looking for in a relationship
I‚Äôm looking for a very long-term, marriage or marriage-adjacent life partner


Kids?
In short: probably but flexible


I can imagine living a good and fulfilling life without kids with the right partner; I can also imagine living a good and fulfilling life with kids with the right partner. The latter feels more straightforward and easier to imagine.
Mono vs. poly?
In short: ~mono


I‚Äôve done both and both have worked for me. I lean towards ~monogamy but with flexibility so it‚Äôs not a disaster if after some years we go through a spot of not being attracted to each other. Strict monogamy also OK, poly OK with the right person. I am very non-jealous, FYI
Personal qualities
1. I‚Äôm very loyal, I stick with friends and partners. I try hard to make things work in relationships. I‚Äôd like you to be pretty loyal as well. On the flip side I hope we can both stay loyal to ourselves and only move forward with deepening a relationship if it‚Äôs the right thing for each of us
2. I‚Äôm pretty honest ‚Äì I‚Äôm ~never actively dishonest, and I‚Äôm more on the side of over-honesty and over-sharing than keeping things to myself. I need you to be pretty honest and ~never actively dishonest or deceptive. I‚Äôd be quite interested in an excruciatingly open/honest relationship, though I‚Äôm also happy with normal levels of openness and honesty
3. Relatedly, I‚Äôm quite interested in exploring my and other peoples‚Äô emotions/hearts/souls. I‚Äôm in the middle of my journey on this one. 5 years ago I was below average at feeling, understanding, and working with feelings. I think I‚Äôm now roughly average, I‚Äôd like to be extremely good
4. I‚Äôm pretty smart. I know about lots of different domains and I‚Äôm also pretty good at figuring stuff out. I‚Äôd like you to also be pretty smart
5. I‚Äôm extremely high-openness. Probably won‚Äôt work unless you‚Äôre also fairly high-openness.
6. I think I take in and interact with the world in my own weird, surprising, and beautiful way and I think I bring lots of joy to how I interact with myself, others, and the world. Looking for someone who does the same but in their own way
7. I‚Äôm trying to accomplish some stuff in the world. It‚Äôs not important to me that you are, exactly, but I tend to get along better with people who are


Reach out!
At datebenrachbach@gmail.com


Feel free to just send me a quick ping to take a look at your dating doc/dating profile :)

Name: Benedict Ide
ProfileText:
ÔªøHi! If you‚Äôre seeing this, odds are you‚Äôre a woman who is attracted to men and wants or is open to kids, and filtered according to those criteria on the Date Me Directory of dating docs! And if you did that, you‚Äôve probably noticed- 


-wow! There‚Äôs a lot of people! Large number of people! Lot of profiles to look at! That‚Äôs a lot of reading to do! Are you gonna read all that? Maybe not! Maybe you need to make a quick decision about whether to read any further! Let me help you out with some


BASIC BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
* 30 years old
* heterosexual(ish) man(ish) 
* flexible on mono/poly
* 5‚Äô11‚Äù (181cm), 190lb (86kg)
* wants one or more kids
* Rhode Island, USA, willing to travel
* software developer, WFH, most recent salary $115k/year
* atheist, ratsphere
* politically like, weird complicated center-left-lib utopian


Okay, cool. None of those things are dealbreakers? You want to know more? Cool. Very nice. Here‚Äôs another thing that might help you make some decisions:


HERE‚ÄôS WHAT I LOOK LIKE
  
  
  

  
  
  



The hair situation is less than ideal for me, as it impedes a certain wise wrestleman‚Äôs sacred commandment that you gotta have blue hair, but unfortunately the family genetics are merciless in that department. C‚Äôest la vie. I compensate by wearing blue everything else.


Anyway, one thing that‚Äôs important to me is- do you like that? Do you see that and think, ‚Äúoh, hey, that looks good, I am attracted to that, it would make me happy to smooch that‚Äù? Because, like, I dated an ace partner for a while and it turns out it does a number on one‚Äôs self-esteem to not have your partner think your body is attractive. 
If you do like that body, then- hey, thanks! That means a lot to me. Please continue reading this document, and maybe you will discover that it would be a good idea to interact with that body!


WHAT DOES THIS GUY MAINLY DO?


Well, I play a lot of video games.


If the fact that I mention this first is a red flag for you, you might wanna move on. I‚Äôm not, like, the guy addicted to grinding loot in some MMO, games don‚Äôt take over my life- but they are a good chunk of my cultural context. I have a lot to say about them, I grew up with them, they‚Äôre a major way I connect with people, and I make them as a hobby. It‚Äôs pretty important to me that my partner is someone I can talk to about the things that make me excited, and it‚Äôd be ideal if you are also interested in and excited about video games. I would ideally like to be able to make my partner happy by acting the way I normally act!


Of course, it‚Äôs not just video games with me. I have lots of other interests! Maybe too many. I also read webcomics and fanfic and play tabletop games and watch anime, that whole cluster of very-online interests. Sometimes I even watch movies or read books! Wild stuff. When I consume media I like to discuss it to death with people, and if you also like to discuss media to death then we might be a good fit!


Apart from consuming various sorts of media and working my day job, I‚Ä¶
* Make video games
* Draw things
* Write fiction
* Sort of do all three at once collaboratively (run RPGs)

You might notice a theme here wherein these are all just the production of the same things I spend the rest of my time consuming! It‚Äôs an endless cycle! Dare you date an ouroboros?


But that‚Äôs the main thing, isn‚Äôt it? Like, what are you in for if you attach your life to mine? Because creating is important to me, and I have limited capacity to compromise on it. The prime directive is to create until nothing is left to create, and the universe bursts with an overworked sigh. The number one thing I‚Äôm looking for is someone who can support that, and is happy to support that. If you‚Äôre also a creative, and we can feed on each other‚Äôs energy and reinforce each other- that‚Äôs the dream.


HOW ABOUT SEX AND RELATIONSHIP STUFF THOUGH


Oh jeez. Maybe you were curious about the heterosexual ‚Äúish‚Äù in the bio? Thing is, I definitely experience heterosexual attraction strongly, but the sex bits of human bodies seem kinda‚Ä¶ gross? The whole affair seems kinda unsanitary and unappealing. Crucially, though, I haven‚Äôt tried it, and I hear it feels great despite how it looks (also you need to do it to have kids), and I‚Äôm willing to take that on faith and figure out a way to have fun with it- so I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôd self-describe as sex-repulsed or asexual. You‚Äôre not dealing with a high sex drive but I am pretty much down for whatever.


With monogamy and polyamory- I sort of prefer poly, but not for the standard reasons. On the relationship side of things‚Ä¶ I have clear weaknesses as a partner. I‚Äôm bad at consoling and dealing with sadness, I get absorbed in ambitious projects and am jealous of my own time, so‚Ä¶ like, if I‚Äôm failing to support you in some way and you can get some backup support from someone else, great! And on the sex side of things, modern contraceptive technology exists and so I don‚Äôt really experience jealousy (so long as I‚Äôm not stuck raising someone else‚Äôs kid). However you need to meet your relationship needs, I‚Äôm happy for you. 


But, like‚Ä¶ if we really click, and we don‚Äôt feel like we need anyone else, our relationship issues are surmountable the old-fashioned way, and you‚Äôd prefer monogamy? I have no problem committing to that. Higher bar to clear, I guess? Like you should be really confident I‚Äôm capable of being the one guy you‚Äôve got.


WHAT‚ÄôS ON THE WISHLIST


Right, you! I‚Äôve been talking mainly about me because that‚Äôs the point of this, and because you are an anonymous reader I currently know nothing about, but here are some traits that I find attractive in a partner! If you have a lot of these and want to ask me out, you have good odds!


   * Plays games/reads comics/watches anime/etc- we come from the same planet
   * In particular, likes mysteries, comedy, and weird sci-fi- we come from the same town on the same planet
   * Knows me and empirically likes the things I actually produce- we come from the same neighborhood of the same town on the same planet
   * Thinks I am attractive
   * Is a generally happy person- easy to make smile and laugh (my favorite things to do to people)
   * Has a creative hobby of some sort- art or writing or music, a project to cheer on or help with
   * Looking for a long-term relationship involving marriage and kids
   * Smart in the brain
   * Clear communicator, or familiar with ratsphere communication norms- has read ‚ÄúA Human‚Äôs Guide to Words‚Äù, ideally
   * I‚Äôm not too fussed about appearances but know if you have red hair and/or freckles know that you will be rolling with advantage


If that seems good to you, you can contact me at benedictide@gmail.com!

Name: Anya
ProfileText:
ÔªøOnna Anya
Seeking Meaningful Connections
That are Beautifully Complex
  

  Prologue:  the ‚ÄúWhy‚Äù Behind It All
Sometimes, I think we forget how awesome we are--just us--on our own--no excuses or regrets in our unadulterated singularity of quasar magnificence. Recently, I have been thinking about life, about how now I am in my thirties, how life definitely has not turned out the way I thought it would, and how, as odd as it sounds, I am so glad it hasn't. 
I also have been thinking about how though I would like to meet my person, and be there for them when they wake up in the morning, having them be there to pull me into a hug which makes me not get up at 5:30 AM every morning.  I have been considering how I would like someone to share my life with, able to fall asleep next to them on the taxi ride home from the subway and know they will wake me up when we get there and for that person to have me to be there for them in a similar-yet-different way based on their own individual desires for a partner‚Äôs presence in their life.  However, I also realize that if these things do not ever happen and I never meet such a person, I will be alright with that too.
As a demisexual, if dating has taught me anything in my limited experience, it is that I would rather be alone, than alone in a relationship. I honestly still do not know what I want, because honestly, I feel it is not about wants, but about being there for people and vice versa.
  

(Pre-Covid Me @ Stowe, Vermont, Von Trapp Brewery)
Have I given up on meeting "The One?" The answer is no, I have not. I have occasionally wondered if he is lost in a desert riding a camel backwards in the wrong direction for the time it is taking to have him cross my path--or if I am??!! The other thing I have wondered is if he is lost in the Bermuda Triangle playing with magnets, or maybe if he has found his perfect elsewhere--it could happen, and if it did, more power to him.
Sometimes, I wonder if somewhere, "My Person" is wondering similarly as they mosey through desserts, play with magnets in the Triangle, or consider if I too have met "my perfect" elsewhere, (which I have not, though I have met some "not‚Äìso-perfect" in this journey), but I digress.
But I have indeed given up on "finding love" being seamless, easy, and clear. Love really is a journey as Ruell sings, and sometimes like Malec in Shadowhunters, you have to go to hell and back twice for the ones you love, and even then, there is no guarantee--only hope, and trust in the ones we love and live for and sometimes who we are lucky enough to live with.
So, despite things not working out sometimes, despite the unplanned for rude grenades and emotional suicide bombers we may meet on a date,  we can wear Mithril armor, like Frodo, and ward off the Ring Wraiths dressed up as ordinary humanoids. Nowadays, I also spend time just living life, riding motorbikes down roads at night to the swaying of lit Lunar New Year lanterns, feeling the cool air and enjoying the moon above me, going to the beach in the morning to see what it is like when the day is waking on the ocean, and being grateful for the present solitude, whether it remains forever, or is changed in a instant.
If I ever do meet "The One," how will I know it is him? Well, if a man is riding a camel backwards across the beach one morning I may just go up and ask him why it took him so long to cross the Sahara, but in all seriousness, I think it will be in the surety, in the kindness and care, in the quiet considerations, and in the fact that they like almost everything about me and I feel the same way about them--that they are my version of Puen, and I am their non-nagging equivalent of Talay from the Thai series, Vice Versa, and that it is not about if we can imagine the world without one another, but that we can ONLY imagine it with each other--in every universe. Is that cheesy and pie-in-the-sky? Perhaps, but I will wait for good dairy products and pastries until the cows (or camels as the case may be) come home.
So at the end of the day, I think the thing that matters is to trust our journeys and to realize that home and the road to it may be different than we expect. It may not be a picket fence yard in suburbia or an apartment in Manhattan. Home may end up being a treehouse in the jungle or a mountain villa in the Himalayas. Our home may be us and our partner with our kids, us alone in our comfy hobbit hole, like Bilbo, it could end up being us and our delightful roomies, or us and the kids the universe gave us in ways we never planned. But no matter how the road is or what home looks like, it is our road and our home, and that is what our heart beats through and to.
  

Introduction
As an online ESL teacher pursuing a business degree, I enjoy learning and expanding my skills. Quiet introvert (ISFJ) and demisexual/graysexual, I approach life with an analytical and linear mindset and am currently living between Taiwan and Thailand for studies/work.
In addition, I also dabble in Youtube content creation and podcasting and have 300+ subscribers to one of my channels on Youtube and have had 20,000+ listens to my podcasts.  I also write, having a Medium blog I post to regularly and several books that I have self-published on Amazon. 
Previously, I worked for the Dept. of Education, specializing in escalations, spent some time as a booking agent for actors for comic conventions, and about a decade as a interior design journalist.  During Covid, I started to pursue language learning and discovered in the process I love teaching ESL, so I gradually switched careers.
Though I took a large reduction in income in order to pursue my business degree at half-schedule while simultaneously traveling/living in Asia and teaching full-time, I am fiscally responsible, have no debt, all my college expenses covered through grants and scholarships, and I have enough remaining to provide myself with a comfortable lifestyle. Upon graduation next year, I plan on settling in Taiwan, my income will increase and work hours decrease, which will be a welcome change.  
I'm a laid-back, easy-going person who believes in personal growth and acceptance. I've got a quiet sense of humor and I'm always up for a good laugh, even in tough situations. I'm also empathetic, thoughtful, and aware of how my actions might impact others. I'm not afraid to try new things and love exploring different cultures. 
I am really good at being there for others who need help, and will always do whatever I can to help those I care about and even on occasion people I do not know well who I know are having difficulties. In my eyes, life is a gift, and we should use our time on this planet to make a positive difference in the lives of those around us. My personal motto is to be part of the solution, not the problem, and I strive to embody this philosophy in my daily interactions.  I value doing the right thing especially if there is nothing to gain, everything to lose, and no one may ever know, but still doing the right thing
I was raised Christian and also with Jewish traditions, and I celebrate both Christian and Jewish holidays and eat somewhat Kosher, but I do not attend church/synagogue. I also do not care what religious beliefs a partner holds as long as they are considerate of others and do not wish to adjust my own beliefs.
  

(Picture taken August 3, 2024)
Hobbies and Interests
I'm a sci-fi nerd with a serious love for Star Trek (Picard, Voyager, and Spock are my jams) and Stargate Atlantis (just tend to skip the pilot). John Shepherd is my spirit animal‚ÄîI mean, who doesn't love a witty, intergalactic space dad wrangling cranky scientists and adorable aliens?
My British drama obsession includes Sherlock, Call the Midwife, and Bleak House, especially when Martin Phipps is behind the music or Brendon Coyle is a supporting actor (Larkrise to Candleford or North and South)--his ability to bring depth and authenticity to his roles is unmatched.
When it comes to fantasy, Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit are my favorites.
For a good laugh, I can't resist The Big Bang Theory. Sheldon is my comedy hero, and I enjoy films and TV shows that explore self-discovery and living authentically, like The Secret Life of Walter Mitty, which truly is about the quintessence of life. ;)
  

(Staying chill during the pandemic)
When I need to relax, I turn to PG-rated BL Asian dramas, like Bad Buddy and Vice Versa. Demisexual characters, emotional attachments, and no annoying gender wars make these shows a breath of fresh air compared to other genres, with their thought-provoking portrayals of conflict resolution and emotional depth. I particularly relate to the demisexual characters, Pran and Talay, whose journeys I resonate with.
  

(Tamsui Fishermen‚Äôs Wharf‚ÄìDecember 2022 Walkabout @ one of my favorite places on earth)
I also love taking long walks (1-3 hours), preferably on the beach, near mountains, and sometimes in the rain, and I enjoy e-biking and motor scooters (I often will go for rides to explore different beaches along the coasts or for rides through the rubber tree jungles).  
In addition, I am learning Thai, Korean, and Mandarin, and I like to travel and explore‚Äìas long as tea shop stops are included. üôÇ
üëÄThe Fine Print‚ÄìLOLüëÄ
Because of a childhood head injury, I experience intermittent hearing loss in my left ear (neurological deafness) and a limited sense of smell. I also have some gaps in my early childhood memories. As a result, I abstain from alcohol as a precautionary measure. Despite these challenges, I remain intellectually sharp and academically successful (consistently make the Dean's List).
I am 5‚Äô 6‚Äù (167 cm) tall and tend to be reserved in public, especially with people I don't know well, partly due to my hearing difficulties. However, I become more open and comfortable as I develop trust and familiarity with others.
I have high-functioning autism, which makes me logical and analytical as well as spatially-oriented though I tend to have trouble detecting certain things, such as sarcasm.  I am very curious about things in general, and thought to be younger than I am because of my appearance and inquisitive nature.  Because of the HFA, I do appreciate when people say what they mean rather than being vague, and find that logical arguments sway me far more than emotional ones.
  

(At Driving School Learning how to drive a scooter in Thailand‚Äìgot my license in February 2024)
I do not have any remaining family as I lost both my parents by the time I was 30 and my younger sibling during the pandemic.  Though these losses were extremely difficult, I have many friends who have become like family through the years and I have maintained a very positive outlook on life.  
Though uncertain of having bio kids, I've always planned to start a family through adoption, regardless of bio children, envisioning a household with 2-3 children over the next decade-and-a-half.  I want to provide a home for children who otherwise might not have one.  I am also open to surrogacy if biological children are important to a partner and I cannot bear children.
Regarding dating and relationships, I have limited experience as I spent my youth and young adulthood taking care of relatives who were in poor health and helping to raise my younger sibling.  Because of my desire to be fully present for my family and also to not possibly burden a partner, I did not consider dating until I was in my early 30‚Äôs.  
As I've explored the dating world, I've found that some men's preferences and priorities don't always align with my own. Many have expressed a strong desire for biological children while preferring not to be involved in their care. Others have sought casual encounters or wished to marry quickly, while still others weren't interested in living abroad, all of which don't resonate with my personal goals and values.
I deeply respect everyone's right to pursue their own dreams and desires, but I've come to understand the importance of remaining true to myself and my vision for the future, particularly when it comes to building and creating meaningful relationships.
I value independence and self-reliance, and I strive not to inconvenience others. However, I understand that in a healthy relationship, partners should be able to rely on each other. I would need a patient partner who appreciates that, as trust grows, I will be able to depend on them more, even though I am capable of handling many things on my own. This balance of independence and reliance should make a relationship with me easier, rather than harder.
  

(Teacherly-Mode‚ÄìSummer 2023)
What I am Looking For
The main things I look for in a partner are mutual consideration, care, comradery, and a good sense of humor that is not mean toward others. Another factor for me is that the other party is not intent on changing me in the same way I am not intent on changing them, but that we like one another "as is" and that our main joy in a relationship is being present for one another on our journey through life and sharing the good things life brings--like mountain views and boba tea, for example. In essence, someone who shares my drive for personal growth, is willing to explore the world together, and is up for a bit of laughter and fun along the way.
I believe in building a strong foundation of trust, understanding, and friendship before discussing serious commitments such as sex, marriage, or living together romantically. Typically, it takes me 6-12 months to feel comfortable enough to explore these topics. However, I am open to the possibility of living with someone in a more platonic way initially, especially if they are from overseas and looking to relocate closer to me. 
I understand that a somewhat-platonic living situation with a partner for several months may seem odd, but with consideration that my partner may be coming from a distance, this situation would help us to spend more time together and grow our connection, while still respecting my need for emotional intimacy to develop at a slower pace.
I prefer a non-smoker as a partner, as I am allergic to both cigarette and marijuana smoke. Additionally, my cat allergy prevents me from having them indoors, though I am open to the idea of an outdoor cat as a pet.
I also have food allergies to spicy foods, pork, and seafood. While I am perfectly fine with my partner eating whatever they like, I understand if these restrictions may be a concern for some. If that is the case, it might be best not to reach out to me.
As a demisexual, it seems to me, what makes successful relationships work is a combination of extreme care--friendship as well as love + understanding and enjoying the silence as well as the noise with someone.
  

(Adopting a Serious Face. . .)
Moreover, I am LGBTQI+ friendly and enjoy watching inclusive dramas. It is important for me to be with someone who is accepting of these aspects of my personality and interests. If you are open-minded and comfortable with these preferences, I would be delighted to hear from you.
I am not good at flirting, but thoughtful gestures, surprising someone with their favorite snacks or going to a concert/art show I know they would like are things I would do. Also, suggesting we binge-watch a C-drama on martial arts together as I believe that a strong relationship can handle the commitment of watching a l-o-n-g series and appreciating the shared experience over time would be the closest I get to flirting.
Caveats: 
As mentioned, I have no preference on religious beliefs, ethnicity, or body type, etc. of a partner, but I do ask that anyone who messages me understand I am not changing my beliefs or body type to suit them anymore than I expect them to change their beliefs or body type--we are what we are.  I am currently working to be more healthy and to lose some weight, but this is for personal rather than for partner development.
As discussed, I live in Asia and though open to moving to a different Asian country than the one I am currently living in, I really do like Taiwan, and I have no plans to move to the USA or Europe or South America, and do not want someone messaging me back under the assumption I will move to these locations if a relationship progresses.
I value a monogamous relationship that prioritizes mutual respect, safety, and open communication. While I understand that everyone has their own preferences, I want to be transparent that I'm not interested in engaging in kinky activities, oral sex, or any sexual activities that may pose a risk to either partner's health and safety.
Furthermore, sharing NSFW content is not something I feel comfortable with, as it does not align with my personal preferences and values. I believe that transparency and clear communication are essential in any relationship, and I want to ensure that potential partners are aware of my boundaries before pursuing a connection, and wish you the best in finding a more compatible partner if you have different relationship goals.  
  

(Coming back from an adventure. . . Autumn 2024) 
As previously discussed. I'm planning on adopting children in the future, and while I'd be delighted if a partner wanted to co-parent with me, I also want to make it clear that this isn't a requirement or expectation. I'm fully prepared to undertake the adoption process and care for the children on my own, both emotionally and financially.
My hope is that by sharing this information upfront, potential partners can feel reassured that there's no pressure or obligation for them to take on any financial or legal responsibilities related to my future adopted children. While I'd love to have a partner who is supportive and involved in my family life, I understand and respect if that's not something they feel comfortable with or are ready for.
In order to address any potential concerns, I'd like to clarify that I have made arrangements to ensure that my family, including any future adopted children, will be cared for in the unlikely event of my passing. While I appreciate the thoughtfulness of a potential partner considering this aspect, I want to emphasize that I do not expect them to take on any legal or caregiving responsibilities for my children in any circumstances.
My intention in bringing up this topic is not to be blunt or macabre, but rather to provide transparency and alleviate any potential concerns. That said, if my desire to adopt is still an issue for someone, I kindly ask that they refrain from contacting me for a possible relationship, as this is a deeply important part of my life plan.
Lastly, I am an even-tempered person, and when I do find myself upset, which is rare, my preferred method of dealing with the situation is to take a step back, calmly identify the specific issues, and communicate them clearly without raising my voice.
While I'm open to disagreements and respectful discussions they may bring, one thing that truly bothers me is when someone tries to demand something from me. I believe in respecting others' autonomy and privacy, and I tend to keep my disagreements with people to myself unless directly asked or if they directly affect me, as I feel it's ultimately their business.
While I'm generally easy-going and accommodating, one thing that I hold firm to is my autonomy. I've found that some people can be surprised when they encounter resistance from me on this matter, as it may seem out of character. However, I believe that respecting each other's autonomy is crucial in any relationship, and I expect the same consideration that I extend to others.
I understand that not everyone shares this view, and I respect their right to live their lives as they choose. At the same time, I believe that a healthy relationship requires mutual respect, and this includes allowing each other the space and freedom to have our own beliefs and opinions.
That being said, I'm open to changing my mind when presented with a well-reasoned, non-threatening argument, especially if the other person approaches the discussion with patience, logic, and a respect for my autonomy.
Despite what these caveats may imply, I am a very calm and relaxed person, but also want to save others and myself time and confusion and feel these above caveats do that for both them and for me.
Ending Thoughts and Contact Information:
Thanks for reading this far and feel free to email if you want to get in touch concerning a possible relationship or even if you read this far and think we would make good friends.  
Regardless, thanks again for your time and consideration and best of luck on your journeys!
Email:  rosesoutofthesnow@gmail.com

Name: Diego
ProfileText:
ÔªøDiego G.




"Outdoorsy Adventurer Seeking Partner for Life's Journey
San Fransico / San Jose / Morgan Hill 
At 41, I've rekindled my love for the great outdoors ‚Äì whether it's casting a line into a serene ocean or pitching a tent under a starlit sky, count me in. After a 15-year relationship, I've spent the past year and three months rediscovering myself, diving into books, and embracing the peace of meditation. Sobriety has become a pillar of my personal growth journey, and I'm committed to living my best life. 100% 


Music pulses through my veins, and I thrive on the energy of live concerts and festivals. But beyond the beats, I'm searching for someone to share in life's highs and lows. Whether we're cracking up at a comedy show or cuddling up for a scare with a good horror flick, I believe in making every moment count.


If you're ready to embark on an adventure of a lifetime ‚Äì filled with laughter, love, and endless possibilities ‚Äì let's connect and see where the journey takes us.


I‚Äôm Looking for a caring, confident woman with a sense of humor. If you like the outdoors, traveling is always a plus. I‚Äôm more attracted to your personality and who you are as a woman. Looks fade away and go away, your attitude toward life makes you for you. 




I disable social media, I want to start meeting people with adventures, not viewing them through apps. 


Feel free to contact me at vt7846@gmail.com

Name: Karthik
ProfileText:
ÔªøAbout me


* 38 years old


* 5‚Äô8‚Äù (Don‚Äôt care about your height; I‚Äôve dated women who are taller than me barefoot and I‚Äôm not bothered by it. Obviously, it‚Äôs okay if you have a preference.) 


* Based in NYC (Currently on sabbatical in Argentina and working on some personal goals.)


* Agnostic/Spiritual 
Spirituality in the sense of my understanding of the world through what I know from science, experience, reflection, etc. Belief systems are also connected to language.

* Divorced; no kids
The divorce was in 2017. The marriage was practical and beneficial to both of us. But we were also in love - so not just a practical arrangement either. 


   * Don‚Äôt smoke (prefer that you don't, or you're trying to quit). Rarely drink (don‚Äôt mind if you do).


Photos


  

	  

	  

  

	







  

	



How I spend my time


For work (as defined in the conventional sense), I do machine learning in tech.

My background is actually in applied math, which I love. I enjoy using my quantitative skills at work. But I value things outside of work a lot, in terms of how I interact with and contribute to society.


I really value expression in life, whether it‚Äôs through the written word or through movement. Some of my interests:


   * Dance: It‚Äôs been a non-trivial part of my life for at least a decade now. I‚Äôve always been moved by music (although I didn‚Äôt have the chance to learn music/dance formally growing up). And being able to express music is what I love the most about dance.

   * Movement practice like yoga, fitness classes and aerial hoop (this is my latest obsession as of a year ago - I always try to have some things that are hard for me to keep me humble and motivated to grow, and some things where I can feel good about myself).

   * Written words: I love to read (when I can these days) and write creatively. Within fiction, I love any flavor of existentialism.


      * Tennis. Really any racquet sport: ping pong, badminton, pickleball (I gave in)

      * Cooking: I cook for myself and love what I make for myself more than any restaurant food.


         * Travel: I‚Äôve traveled a lot, both solo and with partners. There‚Äôs a wide variety of things that interest me: foreign cultures, nature, road trips.


         * Volunteering: a bunch of different things from children‚Äôs health and education to homelessness and food security. 
Relationship stuff
Things I value
(both in others and about myself)


         * Empathy: I just want to be around people who care about others. I‚Äôm empathetic and it‚Äôs so easy for me to care about my partner in long term relationships. It‚Äôs nice when we can look out for each other in our own ways and our strengths can be complementary. Two people thinking for both!


         * Authenticity/sincerity: I just like being myself and I appreciate people who can just share time with me and maybe we see through each other a bit during the time we interact. It‚Äôs what I enjoy in any kind of connection, even non-romantic ones.


         * Open-minded: I mean in the sense of questioning your own assumptions about life. I‚Äôm curious about the deep stuff in life and am very aware that all of my beliefs are also connected to my personal experience and that a new experience or a new rational argument has the potential to change that belief. I may have a high confidence about some of my beliefs based on what I‚Äôve experienced, but I‚Äôm always open to learning a different perspective even it that doesn‚Äôt make sense to me at that time.

         * Communication: I think it really goes both ways. This is the mental model that I want to keep in mind for myself:
            * As a speaker, I try to express my needs trying my best not to hurt my partner.
            * As a listener, I have to be ready to hear the hard stuff without taking it as a judgement about myself.
Both are hard and I know I‚Äôll fail a lot. But it‚Äôs a kindness practice the same way I work on exercising my body. In the end, everything is negotiable.
Dating style


If we decide we might be a match, I'd prefer to do a brief video chat or a quick coffee date sooner rather than messaging back and forth. I'm sure you're great, but until I know you, I like to prioritize my little free time for my hobbies and with my real life communities. I‚Äôm happy to answer anything specific that‚Äôs missing here before we connect further.
Relationship style
            * I prefer monogamy, but as I said about anything within a relationship, this also falls under something that‚Äôs negotiable.


            * Sex is an important part of the relationship but all the values I think are important for a relationship as a whole are the important aspects here as well: Communicating needs, trying to listen without judgement, etc. GGG as the kids say.

            * Intimacy: Physical touch, showing affection with touch and spending time together with non-sexual intimacy are also very important to me. I don‚Äôt need all of these to be important to you as well, but if it‚Äôs difficult for you to express through touch, I‚Äôd miss that non-verbal communication.
Kids
               * I don‚Äôt have any kids yet. 
               * I love kids and I‚Äôm good with kids. (I have volunteered, and still do, in programs with kids and also with kids/adults on the spectrum.)
               * I‚Äôm open to having kids.
               1. If my partner is sure about not wanting kids, it‚Äôd be far easier for me to choose that option.
               2. I think planning to have kids is a promise to the life that you decide to bring into the world. I think it‚Äôs a responsibility that you decide to take on as a couple very consciously when the relationship is in that place.
How to reach me?
Write to me 
               * if you think we might be a good match, or
               * if something about my profile resonated with you and you‚Äôd like to talk about it even if you don‚Äôt think we‚Äôre a good match.


Email: karthikeyan.rajendran@gmail.com
