Name: Ava
ProfileText:
ÔªøUpdated November 2024


Hello everyone!


I imagine you are here because you really want to find your person. If you want to check to see if you are physically attracted to me, before you read my essay, scroll past the words and you shall find a lot of recent photos. 


So much of what I have realized on this long journey to finding my person, is that perhaps I am not meant to have ‚Äúmy person‚Äù. Maybe this path is not meant for me. I feel more of a sense of peace about this now, versus a year ago, when I was doing a significant amount of grieving regarding being very single and childless, despite my best efforts to create that life for myself. 


Though I have surrendered to not forcing the river, so to speak, I have not resigned myself to perpetual spinsterhood, though it is actually a great life like this. I am still willing to show myself the best I can, and see if anyone out there resonates. I am learning and growing around how to be even more courageous in the process of doing this, and how to more effectively show you who I am. 


The growth process and the chance I may actually connect with someone who seems to be similar to me, keep me on this platform, despite not having much luck with it, since I joined in March 2024. 


‚Ä¶.


I will start by saying depth, authenticity, freedom, detail, precision, and embodiment are very important to me. If they are not important to you, this may be a way we are already mismatched. You may find me kind of off-putting or annoying if you want a one-page sheet that sums up who I am and what I want. 


I am not ever going to be a one-pager type of woman. 


Secondly, I would love it if you also related to life in this way. I want to know you seek a level of depth, thoroughness, and integrity in understanding yourself and how to express and embody who you are in the world, to the degree that I do, or more! 


I am a flawed human, with my own insecurities, just like we all are. I have ways I keep failing at certain goals. I am a work in progress. I am very aware of the work, every day. I have learned to have more fun with it all, in the past several years. I suppose I have been accused of being an over-thinker or a person who is too serious. I do reflect and consider many realities, throughout each day. I can also be very serious. But, I am also a playful, silly, fun person, too. I just don‚Äôt tend to immediately come off that way, in certain contexts. My conscientiousness or thoughtfulness can be written off as tedious, when I am just trying to show care and love for others. 


I do tend to be most playful when I am around people I feel comfortable with. I also tend to shine brightest, when I am working, out in nature, being spontaneous, dancing, enjoying a sensual sexual experience, eating my favorite foods, surfing, doing pole, on adventures, and traveling. I shine the brightest during solo travel, though I want to travel with a partner. I long for this.


I am a really complex person. I think I could spend a whole lifetime revealing who I am to someone. I put great effort into sharing who I am and want to be seen. I also expect the person wants to know all these parts of me, just the way I want to know all of them. I deeply desire to have the type of relationship where we delight in learning more and more about each other, and rest into a deeper and deeper knowing of the other‚Äôs spirit. 


You will find in me a deeply loyal and committed partner. Someone who wants to take the time to understand and connect with you. I will always push myself to overcome fear and shame, in order to not hide or protect myself, with you. I just need to see you are a safe person to do this with. I want to be met in this way by another. Let‚Äôs create a level of safety with each other that we have never encountered, anywhere, through mutually delving deep within and choosing to be accountable, self-loving, and available to each other, every day. 


I am also an extremely generous person. I want to give the people I love (friends and partners) everything I can. I am big on making and giving gifts. I am big on doting on people. I love creating an atmosphere of abundance together with people. I want us to be so open and fluid in our generosity with each other, that we love treating one another to things. I want to create that sort of atmosphere, where we treat each other like royalty. I want to have you know how deeply special and valued you are to me, just like I deeply long for being treated this way by you. I don‚Äôt remain connected to people anymore, who do not have this same aim in their close relationships. I want you to be my treasure, and I want to be your treasure, too. 


I would love us to create a life together based around travel and living in a way we choose. I don‚Äôt want us to settle in life. I want us to both be clear of what we want, and aim for that. I want us to support each other in developing our individual paths to the highest degree, and to live a fulfilling, authentic life. This may mean doing homeschool for our kids, or living in a very unique way together. This may mean developing an open relationship. This may mean eventually being Poly. This may mean us having periods of time where we are traveling without each other or living separately. I have a lot of flexibility in terms of how we can live our best lives that deeply honor who we are as individuals, all held within the love, trust, safety, and commitment we have with each other. I want a strong enough ‚ÄúWE‚Äù, so we can also keep supporting full freedom of the ‚ÄúI‚Äù, and vice versa. 


I am a dreamer, but I am also a pragmatist. Naturally, everything I envision with a life partner, is something I have built towards cultivating with them. As I am already living this way, myself. 


I realized at a pretty early age that if I didn‚Äôt get right with myself, I would not be very happy or successful in the world. 


So, I use every opportunity I can to grow and transform. I have done a ton of work on myself (and continue to do so) in order to be the most free, courageous, accountantable, autonomous and capable human I can be. 


I live nomadically. I have created a job where I have the freedom and the amount of time to travel and play around the world. I am working on becoming even more free and rich in time and resources. I am working on living my life only doing what I want to do, when I want to do it. It has required a lot of planning and failure, but I am getting there, more and more.


I am also living a life where I am doing the exact work I want to be doing. It feels deeply meaningful, and is very rewarding. So, I get the honor of having my work be a naturally authentic expression of who I am and how I want to be in the world. 


I have also done a lot of healing work on myself. I have gone to trauma therapy, learned all about and healed a ton of my trauma (still working on it), and I deeply understand my strengths and weaknesses. I have become an exquisite communicator precisely because of all the healing work I have done, and the opportunities I take to practice showing up better as a human, every day. My heart is open, most of the time, and when it is not, I do my best to understand why, to share openly about this, and to overcome my fear and shame. 


I have created a community of people around the world where we have a supportive relationship, who see me and know me deeply, who are not scared to call me out and help me see my blind spots. I do the same for them! This is exactly how I want it! 


I am currently working on a larger goal of moving to Italy. I will likely move there in April or May 2025. I do not plan to move back to the US. I am from Hawaii originally, and lived in Colorado and Northern California for a while, before moving to Mexico in 2017. I have been using Mexico as my home base ever since. Soon, Italy will be my home base as I travel around and explore more of this amazing planet. 


With or without you, my life will be great. I would prefer to do it with you. I would love to embark on the adventure of life partnership and family, done in a creative and unique way, that preserves and expresses the wildness in us.


Are you interested? Have you built a life that involves this level of courage, adventure, accountability, authenticity, growth, joy, and creativity? If so, reach out to me. I would love to connect with you.


Reach out via email: 


apommerenk@gmail.com

ÔªøWELCOME TO MY DATE DOC!
I made this mostly for fun and to meet new people, but if I happen to meet the right girl, I promise I will work to make you feel loved, appreciated, and happy. After all, isn't that what life is about?


I'll try to update this document with any potential changes.


Stats: 
Name: Kyron


Age: 23


Ethnicity: Black/African-American


Languages: English (fluent), Spanish (very beginner but I REALLY want to learn)


Height: 5‚Äô4


Personality: Somewhat shy, but Also somewhat confident. Smart, sarcastic, but caring and kind. Introvert.


Bio:
Hi! My name is Kyron! I'm currently in Peoria, Illinois, but my family lives in Chicago. I am also looking for work in Chicago at the moment as well.


I am a college graduate with a degree in Game Design (what a useful degree, I know). I have a fair amount of skills/hobbies: drawing, coding, skateboarding, and gaming to name a few.


I'm generally pretty kind, thoughtful and some consider me funny, but some are probably wrong. I try my hardest to be very caring, but I'm also introverted and can occasionally slow down a bit due to low social battery. Hopefully anyone that would be interested can understand.


What I'm Looking For:
I'm searching for a 21 - 24yo female (Cis), with an open mind and a kind heart! I'm quite left-leaning politically, so I'd want a girl to be the same, although I'm open to different perspectives, to a point. 


I am dating with intention, but I also prefer a slower style of relationship building so I can see if things can really work out.


Likes: 
* Skateboarding, drawing, coding, deep or political talks, cuddling, occasional silence, exploring, fun small dates (boba, coffee, libraries, bookstores, museums), music, video games, manga/anime (trying to get back into these)


Dislikes: 
* Overly loud people (occasionally this is fun, especially for a joke), unrealistic expectations, unclarity of intentions, hyper-aggression, bigotry, overly traditional roles, large parties or clubs


Dealbreakers (Absolutely Must NOT Have):
* Super religious, sorry.
* Right-leaning, or believe in racism, genocide, sexism, homophobia, Ect.
* Smoker of any kind or Heavy drinker.
* Aggressive, particularly enjoys fighting or arguing.
* Unreasonability/No communication.


Preferences (Nice to have, but not necessary):
* Belief in communication to solve problems.
* College education of some kind
* Ethnicity different to mine (I really like learning about other cultures/people)
* Knowing multiple languages
* Likes cuddling/physical affection
* Thinner-medium body types (No shame to bigger girls!)
* Somewhat athletic


Future Plans:
I generally go with the flow of life, but I do aim to work hard at being a software developer, preferably for video games. Things may be uncertain in the near future, but hopefully you will encourage me through it!


Other things that may be important to you:


I am all about transparency. So I will share some things about me that may be of importance.


* I have an ex that I am still good friends with. I don't have any romantic feelings towards them anymore, something broke in me after we broke up and I just couldn't go back.


* I do like sex, but I don‚Äôt think this should be the basis of a relationship, merely an element of it. That said, if you're into something you feel is embarrassing or strange such as kinks or fetishes, please share it with me! I'm very open in this regard and not judgemental!


* I do not like pressuring others into doing things. Please be upfront to me about what you want and what you don't. I want to have a functional and supportive relationship.


* Kids. I'm not sure if I want kids just yet‚Ä¶ But‚Ä¶ I am open to the idea. The main issue is that I want to be able to provide for a family. I don't think it's right to bring a kid here, just to have it struggle. Ultimately, if you really want kids, I'll probably give them to you, just don't make this decision carelessly.


* I've stated I'm introverted before. I think I should say that if I happen to randomly check out or dissociate, it's not me ignoring you, but rather I'm probably just a lil tired.


Contact:


Discord: kyron54 - primary messaging 
Email: bluekeshon79@gmail.com

ME IN A NUTSHELL: Emotionally aware, nerdy romantic with a relaxed attitude to life and work
Emotionally aware
I have been described as ‚Äúa real nerd, but with a lot of emotional intelligence‚Äù. For me, the first step towards emotional maturity is this: I don‚Äôt think wishes or preferences can be rationally justified at all. Communicating your wishes to someone means saying ‚Äúhey, it turns out I have this random wish. Who would have guessed? What are your random wishes?‚Äù. 


You can argue rationally that doing A is required/conducive to achieving B. But at the bottom there is an unjustifiable wish to do B, or an unjustifiable wish not to do B. Realizing this was fun for me: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need any justification for my preferences!‚Äù - I thought. ‚ÄúI can simply enjoy them!‚Äù. Incidentally: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need to bullshit anyone again about my preferences, I can simply tell them that I have them‚Äù.
Consequently, I never say something like ‚Äúdoing X is the right/wrong thing to do‚Äù, and similarly I don‚Äôt waste my time listening to people trying to convince me of that.


I want a relationship in which it is clear from the get-go that we are two people with a thousand random preferences (many of which we aren‚Äôt even conscious of) working together to build a common comfort zone in which nothing essential (i.e. nothing each of us (unjustifiably) feels is essential) is left unsatisfied for either partner. This depends on good communication skills, but, to a certain degree, also on a pre-existing compatibility of those preferences. Experiments are always welcome, but I am keen to stress-testing it as fast as possible to avoid wasting time.


I see a relationship as an arts and crafts project at which both partners work continuously, a project in which there are always some loose screws that can be adjusted . I like finding verbal formulations that work for both partners. Some of them are pretty common and obvious, e.g. instead of expecting the other to read one‚Äôs mind, saying things like ‚ÄúI would like A to happen‚Äù and ‚Äúit looks like you didn‚Äôt like B happening, did you?‚Äù and ‚ÄúI think you might like C to happen; would you?‚Äù. Some are less obvious, and dependent on the particular couple. Despite  ‚ÄúWould you mind doing D?‚Äù being the socially accepted polite way of proposing things, in some contexts it gives me the wrong feeling (for instance, that my partner needs my permission to act). So I prefer changing it to something like ‚ÄúI want to do D and I would prefer doing it with you. Are you game?‚Äù (or whatever my partner can see herself saying). If we are going to spend 40 years together, we are going to hear those small things thousands of times, so they better be not just ‚Äúok‚Äù, but perfectly attuned to us!
Nerdy
I spend most of my time reading and learning about mostly ‚Äúacademic topics‚Äù (I personally have no interest in other things which usually correlate with nerdiness, such as manga/anime, computer games, fan culture, superheroes, fantasy‚Ä¶ But I have no problem if my partner has.).


Unlike the prototypical rationalists, I seem to be congenitally skeptical of beliefs, also those with a pile of good evidence. I can‚Äôt force myself to assign probabilities to things. My answer to ‚ÄúWhat is the probability that the sun will rise tomorrow?‚Äù is ‚Äú100% if our model is correct, but who could discard the possibility that a  wizard has been moving the sun for eons and will stop tomorrow?‚Äù. I see nerdiness mostly as the skill of having interesting things to say (as in the British show QI), not as the skill of being sure of one‚Äôs beliefs.


I have a very broad field of interests and find it very difficult to focus on a very narrow thing. I see myself as someone who has a superficial knowledge of many fields and whose main pleasure in life is to have conversations with experts to learn more about each field. This is particularly true of ethnic groups and religions: one of my passions is knowing enough about each country, culture and religion to have an interesting conversation with any of their members. However, I am often disappointed when people know even less than me about their own culture/religion. (I could never understand arrogant nerds. When other don‚Äôt know much, I don‚Äôt feel superior, I feel bored/sad)
How is it possible, for instance, that me, a non-believer, knows more about a religion than a person who claims said religion is the key to eternal bliss? A real example from a couple of months ago:


Two women approach me to evangelize me. I ask them where they come from: Nigeria. I ask which of the five main Nigerian ethnic groups I know they belong to: Igbo. I ask them about the Biafra war, about the role of religion in Nigerian politics, about the harrowing Igbo tradition of Isiku: They don‚Äôt have much to say about any of those topics. They take me to their pastor. He tells me his church is Pentecostal and Reformed. I ask whether it is traditionally Calvinist, or Arminian. He has never heard of Arminianism (?), and tells me his church is from Ghana, not Armenia. I go home and pray that the Flying Spaghetti Monster has pity on his soul. 
List of topics I am currently passionate about
History
Geopolitics (though this word sounds today as if I am interested in conspiracy theories; not my case)
Linguistics
Classical Literature in French, Portuguese, German and Persian.
Almost everything that falls within the ‚ÄúHumanities‚Äù
Some Math and Natural Sciences.
In smaller quantities, also about everything else.
Romantic
I am happy alone, but a life spent maximizing my own happiness feels completely gray. The periods of my life which also included the maximization of the happiness of someone else were full of color, but -alas and alack!- never with someone I could really love. I am looking for crazy, passionate and everlasting love and for that I believe in showing my own craziness to you in a very sincere way, in seeing your own craziness without filters, and in checking if our crazinesses are compatible. I generally fail at pretending to be normal, so lately I simply skip that step.
Relaxed attitude to life and work
Because of my desire to learn, I value my free time above all, plus I also really dislike stress, so I see paid work only as a means to sustain my life.


I love teaching, though! I gladly teach things to an audience interested in learning them, and not in getting a grade on a paper.


I live a frugal life, not as a ‚Äúsacrifice‚Äù, but because I am not interested in most things that cost a lot of money.


(The only big expense I can think of is that mid-term I would ideally like to move to different countries in a slow-travel path to discover new cultures. Not a must, though: if a fantastic life with a fantastic partner is tied to a particular place, that‚Äôs great too!)
What I am looking for


Because of the secondary role of work in my life, my partner isn‚Äôt meant to just fill the short time between work and falling asleep; making cool things with my partner should be a big part of the coolness of my life. Regarding this I have been described as a "passion vampire", meaning I want a partner who is passionate about many things and I want to spend many hours listening to my partner being passionate (thus "feeding" from her).


I am, myself, full of passion for many things and I am more than willing to let my significant other feed from me. (Not at must, though! If you just won‚Äôt shut up all day about the things you‚Äôve read, I will have no other option than marrying you as quickly as possible!)


I am mostly thinking of classic academic fields as potential passions, and I tend to be more interested in the Humanities. But an intense enough passion can definitely change my mind!


In short: I am looking for an (intellectually) passionate woman.


As naive as it might sound, it has been my experience that if two (sane, nice) people spend time together, they develop chemistry; if they have a lot of hard conversations from the very beginning, they develop a strong emotional bonding; if they make jokes together, they develop a shared sense of humor, and if they have a lot of sex, they have good sex (especially give the strong emotional bonding). Consequently, I don't see any of these things as criteria to choose a partner. In the nice relationships I had, I was haunted by this question: "is there anything in this relationship which I couldn't have with any other (sane, nice) partner?", and the answer was unfortunately always "no''.


My criterion is that I am looking for a woman to admire. Admiring doesn't require perfection, but it requires a sense of uniqueness. Nothing puts me off more than a person describable in terms which apply to millions of people, e.g. "I like Harry Potter, the Little Prince, watching Netflix, listening to music, going to restaurants and traveling". None of these items (not even all of them together) are per se a problem, but an identity based around this is not what I am looking for. I use the toilet everyday, but I won‚Äôt try to woo you by saying I am an avid toilet user.


This sense of uniqueness comes, in my experience, only from passion.




COUPLE ACTIVITIES:


I am very happy doing my little nerdy projects on my own, but I have realized that doing big-scale nerdy projects (i.e. useless things like learning Sanskrit) alone is very disheartening. Other people find in an academic career the motivation to do this kind of thing, but it doesn‚Äôt work for me. So ideally I am looking for a woman who is interested in investing time in our private big-scale nerdy projects. I am quite open to the exact contents of our projects (and, actually, you proposing something would be ideal!), but here is a rough idea of what I have in mind right now (might change in a couple of weeks):


-reading a book separately and discussing it
-reading aloud to each other from a book, together in bed
-interpreting "Romeo and Juliet" (probably with genders swapped, to make it more interesting), then spending hours reading articles explaining the sexual innuendo
-learning Hittite or Akkadian
-learning prehistoric techniques to build tools from silex
-moving to (insert country: e.g. Mongolia)
More information about me:


I am looking for a partner based mostly on one criterion (intellectual passion), but you might have more of them, so here are some facts about me which might help you in your decision to reject me:


LOCATION: I have lived in several countries and would like to keep changing. Now I have lived in Germany for too long, so I am looking to move out as soon as possible. This means that I am flexible about where you live, but of course if you live nearby it would be great for the beginning.


FOOD: I don't have a sense of smell or taste. On most days, I eat Huel powder. I can eat normal food, and I ‚Äúenjoy‚Äù its texture and colors, but I don't want to spend much time cooking (I prefer using that time for other things). But I guess if you are simultaneously a genius and a foodie, I would still love to cook with you while we have amazing conversations. I eat healthy, close to no junk food, close to nothing with a lot of sugar, but don't mind breaking my healthy routine as often as I feel like it.


OTHER SUBSTANCES: I have no interest and almost no experience with coffee, tobacco, alcohol or any other interesting substance. You smoking next to me would be something I wouldn‚Äôt like that much (because I would have to inhale the smoke), but other than that I guess I am OK with you e.g. doing heroin next to me while I read. Going to jail might stop me from reading, though, so we might have to find a workable compromise.


PECULIAR WIRING: Through the years I realized that I lack several universal human experiences: I don‚Äôt have a sense of taste or smell, I can‚Äôt imagine things (aphantasia), I don‚Äôt really have preferences for my surroundings (or maybe rather: my interior design dream is living in a prison cell), and I have less than average appreciation for aesthetic stimuli (i.e. I really enjoy really good movies, but I don‚Äôt want to devote much time to enjoying really good movies).


Until recently I thought I was a weirdo. Not exactly a robot (who wouldn‚Äôt enjoy things), but some kind of (less be pretentious!) pure soul trapped in a body, since my main pleasures come from intellectual things like learning and having conversations, and emotional things like having in love and introspecting about whether I have really ever been in love.


But recently I realized that there are some purely sensorial things that I enjoy, so I am trying to find them all. The list is small for now: 1) Barefoot walking. I love it! I have been trying to walk barefoot as much as I can, but given my Spanish acculturation, I can only do it in Summer. This one is a bit of cheating, though, because it also gives me the pleasure of breaking social norms. 2) Hanging from walls. I have recently started doing bouldering, and I liked it from the beginning. But then I did one route in which one starts horizontal and kinda tries to become vertical while climbing. I realized that I love hanging horizontally from walls. If I could, I would install this route at my place so that I could hang every day.


HUMOR/SILLINESS: I share with Pierre Desproges the (I would say political) conviction that ¬´ on peut rire de tout, mais pas forc√©ment avec tout le monde ¬ª. I would love it if you are one of those with whom I can laugh about absolutely everything. Also related: I need daily doses of silliness.


CONTACT
Since this is a game of low numbers, I find it a pity that I only get the positive feedback. I would be eternally grateful if you read till here, didn‚Äôt like something, and told me. I‚Äôm just curious to know what kind of women read this.


If you are interested in me in a romantic or friendly way, or even if you just want to tell me that something I said made you smile, I will be more than glad to hear it! I have replied to every message till now, so don‚Äôt be shy!


lazy.romantic.nerd@gmail.com

Name: Blake
ProfileText:
ÔªøBlake, 28, feral, looking for a new home
I‚Äôm running a two for one deal, this is my cat Gibbs, he goes where I go.


  
  



A little bit about me
Life goes between jam packed and absolutely nothing, just the way i like it. I'm usually getting up to something most weekends like hiking, road tripping, or catching my brother's concerts. During the weekdays I like to read in peace, paint, or just chew through a video game. If I'm not planning anything, my friends up in frisco are doing something wild while I visit - ask me about the ‚Äúanything but clothes‚Äù party :P


Traveling is one of my loves. Last year I spent two weeks in New Orleans and then drove up the coast of Maine to visit Bangor, the city that inspired Stephen King‚Äôs IT. Language is one of the things that motivates my travels. I love hearing local slang, mannerisms, and the cadences people have when they interact with me. I was on a Bayou boat in Louisiana once, we were trudging along a gator filled strip of water called the ‚ÄúDead River‚Äù and the captain told us we needed to be careful traveling through here because roots will ‚ÄúBunny ear‚Äù (dent) the rotor. It‚Äôs so small but I love finding words that don‚Äôt leave a hundred mile radius.


Horror stories are a passion of mine, I love the themes, the visuals, the often goofy nature of it. Who doesn‚Äôt love getting a little tingle on their spine every now and again ;) it teaches us how to appreciate the happy stuff. It‚Äôs meditative for me, by looking at the fears in my core I can learn a little bit about myself. Why am i scared, how does that bleed into my day to day life, who else feels this way, and of course, how do I turn that into something I can express - giving me a deeper connection to those around me.


Stories like Berserk have always resonated with me. It‚Äôs a manga about trauma, violence, loss, awful shit - but it‚Äôs also about healing and how the connections we make help get us through life.


  
  
  



Career
I‚Äôm very passionate about my career in art - filmmaking, painting, sculpture, and the occasional bad poetry. Because of this my identity and career are pretty intertwined.


My day job is as a video producer for a film/TV microphone company. I generate the photo/video marketing and even some educational videos about the film audio industry. Been working there for a few years and it‚Äôs honestly been wonderful. Directing, editing, gaffing, camera, you name it and I can‚Äôt get enough of it. I‚Äôm happy to be using the skills i‚Äôve trained so long for, that‚Äôs not something every filmmaker in this city gets to say - I'm fortunate.


In the quiet hours of the night I work on my second career which is making miniature painting videos. It‚Äôs still in its infancy but it recently started integrating brand deals and the future is looking awesome. My goal is to document the journey and all the highs and lows it includes, hopefully people can see it and stay inspired in their own painting journey. I‚Äôve gotten some really touching messages and it seems to be resonating with people :)


PLUS, I stare at so many monitors at my job so having another project that‚Äôs analog is a good way to unwind but still practice something.


The benefit OR embarrassing part of being a content creator is that you can check out all this stuff before hand‚Ä¶I have heard my voice is quite nice so there's that ;P


Dating
A serious relationship is the goal! I‚Äôm monogamous and only really want to date monogamous. Of course, if you‚Äôre hunting for something in particular that I can‚Äôt give then i‚Äôm open to communication and support! Like, we're at a party and you wanna make out with someone, it's whatever.


I‚Äôve been in two long term relationships that left a lot to be desired. In the past i was too passive about what did and did not bother me. Since then i‚Äôve learned stuff doesn‚Äôt change unless you vocalize it, so expect good communication from me.


In all honesty, I want to date someone who has a good relationship with themselves and their goals. Passion for life, communication, and kindness are the most attractive traits in my book.


I look forward to meeting you and hearing about your life!


Insta @mr_flannel__

Hi there! I'm an adventurous spirit with deep roots in San Francisco, my home for over 30 years. A UC Berkeley alum with a Master's in Education, my life is a blend of intellectual curiosity and thrill-seeking hobbies.


Educational Journey:


- UC Berkeley Graduate
- Masters in Education


Interests:


- Outdoor Adventures: Passionate about bike racing, mountain biking, and exploring the city on my skateboard. Motorcycles are another love, offering a sense of freedom and excitement.

Name: Kim Korte
ProfileText:
ÔªøKim‚Äôs Date Me Doc
Hey! Trying something new with this Google Doc dating profile. If you resonate with what you read, let‚Äôs chat or meet up! psaniko@gmail.com or @akimbow on Telegram. If you know someone who you think might be a fit, feel free to send them this doc.
  

Basics
Man, straight
Monogamous
31 years old (1992)
Berlin, flexible
German and English
190cm tall  


Hobbies & Interests
Energy: I‚Äôd consider myself ambivert, i.e. I enjoy meeting new people and doing activities in large groups but also need a lot of down time (which can be with close friends). I had periods where I filled my week with salsa, bachata, acrobatics, HIIT, and scuba - and apnoe diving but also ones where I tinkered with a rocket layout for a week.


Touch: I greatly enjoy cuddling and massages (recently did 100h of learning Thai massage and am loving it). Physical touch is my primary love language by a mile.


Sports: I love being active and pushing my body. The past 7 years I‚Äôve enjoyed Crossfit and olympic weightlifting a lot. With friends I sometimes do AcroYoga or go hiking.


Charity: I discovered Effective Altruism 8 years ago and it‚Äôs become a big part of my life. Most of my friends consider themselves EAs and I enjoy engaging in big questions about our future. It has shaped my career and worldview and while working in IT and finance I was lucky to be able to donate large parts of my salary to charities and causes I believe in.


Veggie: I‚Äôve been vegan for 7 years and while I make occasional veggie exceptions it definitely plays into my dating preferences.


Books: Super into sci-fi and fantasy epics (Brandon Sanderson, Pierce Brown, Andy Weir, etc). I also enjoy non-fiction about history, psychology, economics, and the future.


Games: I almost exclusively play co-op games with friends (except Skyrim and Kerbal Space Program). Something about strategizing and adventuring with friends in vast worlds is super satisfying to me.
  
  



Dating preferences
I‚Äôm looking for the classic partner in crime. I‚Äôm done with short term dating around and would like to build a long lasting relationship. I want to live out my cheesy, romantic side while at the same time knowing I can rely on my partner in whatever life throws at us.


Style: For me that means a monogamous relationship but I‚Äôm not strictly opposed to opening it up if that‚Äôs what we both want. 


Location: I currently live in Berlin but I‚Äôm flexible w.r.t. moving in the future. I‚Äôve lived in Hong Kong and the Bay Area before.


Kids: I want kids and it‚Äôs a deal breaker if you can‚Äôt imagine this in your future. I‚Äôve felt ready to be a dad for the past three years. Being a parent to me means sharing the work of childcare equally. I love working but would have no issues being a stay-at-home dad either.


Other preferences: non-smoker, kind, curious, witty

	Myers-Briggs (yes I'm aware this is probably more akin to astrology than science, but some people find it indicative :))

	Big Five
	According to the scientific gold standard of "random internet test", I'm high for Openness to new experience and Agreeableness, and moderately high for Extraversion, Neuroticism, and Conscientiousness.


Some of these are very mixed, however ‚Äì I'm not prone to anxiety, but I do think quite a bit about the consequences of my actions. I take doing what I said seriously, and I‚Äôve owned literally all areas of my work life entirely alone for over 5 years, but I'm more inclined to be a little disorganized. 


Extraversion here is also covering the fact I am the classic "best one to one/very small groups, likes time to recharge" introvert. But at parties/conferences, I actively approach and talk to new people.


	Interesting link so even if you don‚Äôt like this profile, you get something out of it


	Every Noise at Once
	What I'm looking for
	I'd like to find a long-term partner, and that's my main goal and my main priority. I want something I can invest in over the long term.


I'm also happy with just about any other kind of connection, including new friends. 


As I live in Hastings, and most potential people live in London, I'd be happy to swap visits (I love showing Hastings to people) or meet halfway. 


	Kids
	Generally lean towards wanting them. Not a deal breaker.


	Things I like to do
	I like:
- Learning new things. I find so many things interesting it's hard to delimit it, but recurring themes are 
i) how and why do people do what they do? 
ii) how did things and people come to be the way they are?
iii) what will the future look like?


I also like taking an interest in things for the sake of it. Architecture, natural history, art, fossils etc etc. It doesn't have to be part of some grand narrative or project to understand the world. If I have a superpower, it‚Äôs knowing something about a lot of things.


Some books I‚Äôve liked: Superforecasting, Giovanni‚Äôs Room, Science Fictions, Permutation City, The Grapes of Wrath, Being Mortal, The Precipice, Flights, The Book of Trespass, Radical Markets, How Music Works, The Gift of Fear, Deep Work, How Pleasure Works, Moral Tribes, Moral Origins, A Short History of Nearly Everything, Why Have There Been No Great Women Artists?, The Routledge Companion to Ethics, Stories of Your Life and Others, The Poetry of Sex, Wild Nights, Shroom, Intuition Pumps & Other Tools for Thinking, Writings on an Ethical Life, Three Men in a Boat


Some podcasts I like: Astral Codex Ten, More or Less, Making Sense, Rationally Speaking (RIP), The Happiness Lab


(Listing any of these does not imply a particular level of concordance with the conclusions of their authors/hosts.)


- Hiking & wild camping. Every year I do one 1 week+ walk and I'll do numerous shorter self-guided walks with maps. I've got a knack for finding secret or little-visited places, even in the south-east of England. My longest so far was walking from Kosovo -> Montenegro -> Albania and back; I have a two week traverse of some islands in the Arctic Circle planned for 2024 [edit: done this! It was beautiful. And boggy], and another traverse of a mountain range in Spain. I take a lot of care to tailor what I do to my company, so don‚Äôt fear if these sound intense. I can be very happy doing a shorter amble through the countryside.


- Friends and family. This is one of the best things about my life. I‚Äôve developed a higher-than-average number of close friendships that I work actively to maintain, and I‚Äôve developed new close friendships right into my 30s. I have an exceptionally good & close relationship with my immediate family. My closest friends are all highly agreeable, intelligent and curious people.


- Running. Trying to get my half-marathon time down. It‚Äôs useful. You never know when you might need to run 20k to catch a bus.


- Gigs and live music. I see a bunch of local/UK bands as well occasionally seeing something truly international. My taste is super broad but rock, metal, and folk would be my core genres.


- Cooking. I make food from plants; I‚Äôve been mostly vegan for 6+ years. I have like 100+ ingredients, I enjoy trying things that take work to get the ingredients/recipes for (I‚Äôve translated a few). I like novelty.


- Learning French. I got my B1 certificate ages ago, currently in the push to get to B2 and I want to pass the exam by the end of 2025. I‚Äôm currently making every francophone I meet speak to me in French. So I‚Äôve got about 35% more misunderstandings happening in my life than usual right now, sacr√© bleu !


- Learning more about myself. I‚Äôm an analyst by trade. I collect data about myself every day, I journal, I try to improve and figure out my personal operating manual.


	EA and rationalism
	I've got a decent background in both worlds. I‚Äôve read a bunch of the core books, blogs and communities. I've been to multiple conferences and have a few friends in the space. My involvement peaked between 2015-2018 when I ran my local EA city group.


I think "EA adjacent" best covers where I am now. I appreciate it a lot if people are interested in some of the core things that motivate these movements, even if they're not directly involved in them.


On the other hand, if EA/rationalist framings are your exclusive way of really encountering and thinking through things, I may not be what you're looking for. I am more fox than hedgehog.


	About you
	I find all of the following really attractive:
- Curiosity. I mean a real ranging curiosity. The kind that stops you in your tracks, literally or figuratively. A sense that you really do just have to know more.
- Independence. You have your own projects going on. You like to do your own things.
- Playfulness. Silliness. The older I get the more value I put on this.
- Rigour (when needed). Following a line of argument is really hot?
- Intelligence.


I'm looking for someone roughly between 26-42, although I'd consider people outside of this if it really made sense.


	How to get in touch/ask questions etc
	Drop me a message! jacobREMOVETHISANTISPAMTEXTarthurfunnell@gmail.com
	More pictures!  
  



And shameless pic with a dog:

Name: Taren Stinebrickner-Kauffman
ProfileText:
ÔªøHi! 
  





I‚Äôm Taren.
  

Maybe you should date me?
  





Summary
42-year old straight-ish woman with kids, based in San Francisco, looking for a partner to build a fantastic life together.
Our love story
I envision our life filled with outdoor adventures, game nights with friends, and hours of conversation about anything from AI policy to the game theory of parenting to which Game of Thrones character we each are. We‚Äôll celebrate when my climate fiction novel comes out, when you get your dream job, and when the kids win their Lego robotics competitions. We‚Äôll learn and grow together and face hard times as a team. And through it all, we‚Äôll feel secure in each other's support -- a rock-solid foundation from which to live our values and make (not find!) our happiness.


If this resonates, read on üôÇ


Demographics


* Age: 42 (looking for someone +/-8-ish years)
* Gender: Female
* Location: I‚Äôm pretty tied to living in San Francisco at least half-time for the next ~14 years, til my kids are adults. Could live anywhere within ~3 hours the other half of the time.
* Sexuality: For the purposes of this document, I‚Äôm looking for a partner who is a cis or trans man, or is nonbinary with masculine-leaning energy. Hence, ‚Äústraight-ish‚Äù in the summary above, although I (also?) identify as queer. Sexuality is complicated! Happy to discuss more as we‚Äôre getting to know each other! üôÇ
* Monogamy? Am flexible on this (open to both monogamy and ethical non-monogamy). More details in the ‚ÄúAbout Us‚Äù section below.
* Current Kids:
   * I have 50% custody of my two children: Tuck, 6 years old, and Astra, 4 years old. We live in Potrero Hill.
   * More than fine if you have kids too!
  Taking the kids to see the elephant seals at A√±o Nuevo (2022)


* Future Kids: I have a good store of frozen eggs, and would consider having another kid if the right partner came along in the next few years.
More about me


* I've spent my career largely in progressive activism, fighting on urgent issues like climate change. I‚Äôve also spent a lot of time in effective altruist circles. Now I‚Äôm working to try to leverage generative AI to increase the impact of nonprofits and mission-driven for-profits.


  

Back when I was running the corporate accountability nonprofit I founded (and had long hair!) (2015)


* I‚Äôm a big ol‚Äô nerd. I‚Äôll solve that math puzzle or go down that Wikipedia rabbit hole with you ‚Äì and if we‚Äôre not careful, I‚Äôll start a book club or something in the process üòÖ
* I‚Äôm very active, and community is central to my life. I organize writers retreats and hikes, play in pickleball tournaments, host games nights, you name it.


  



Happy to help you get hooked on pickleball, too!


* My coparent and I intentionally designed a platonic coparenting arrangement from the start; we‚Äôve always had separate households, never were married or anything. I am currently in a secondary poly relationship, but finding a life partner is my priority ‚Äì I‚Äôm open to anything on the monogamy-polyamory spectrum.
What next?


Email me at datetaren@gmail.com if you‚Äôre interested! If you don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre the right fit for me, but you have an idea of someone else who might be, I‚Äôd love for you to pass this profile along to them!


Thanks so much for reading,
Taren


  





P.S. If you want to date a different Bay Area pickleball fanatic who cares about making the world a better place, check out my friend Julia‚Äôs date-me page as well!

Name: Ian
ProfileText:
ÔªøDear Potential Partner,
Welcome to the "Date Me Document" tailored just for you! My name is Ian Duncan, and I'm thrilled at the prospect of getting to know you better. Let's dive into what makes our potential connection special:
About Me:
I'm a 33-year-old, down-to-earth guy residing in the vibrant city of Tulsa, Oklahoma. By day, I delve into the complexities of the insurance industry, but my true passion lies in running a small media agency specializing in aerial photography and videography.  
Interests and Hobbies:
I'm a man of diverse interests and passions. From the thrill of board games and video games to the serenity of hiking and camping in the great outdoors, I relish every opportunity to stay active and connect with nature. I'm also an avid traveler, fascinated by new languages, cultures, and the intricacies of meteorology. Exploring new restaurants, whipping up Indian delicacies in the kitchen, and savoring a cup of coffee are among my favorite pastimes.
  

Personality Traits:
Known for my quick wit and terrible dad jokes, I bring a dose of humor and creativity to every interaction. As a kind and fun-loving individual, I value genuine connections and cherish moments of laughter and joy. Sarcasm is my second language, so finding someone who can keep up with banter and witty repartee is key.
What I'm Looking For:
In a potential partner, I seek someone who shares my zest for life and adventure. An independent and caring individual who can engage in meaningful conversations and appreciate the nuances of sarcasm and humor would be a perfect match. Cultural understanding is paramount to me, so someone who has lived abroad and possesses a global perspective would truly resonate with my values. I have traditionally dated and been in relationships with men who were not born in the United States, but that is by no means a requirement! Ideally, my future partner is around my age (28-35), takes care of themselves physically, is curious about the world and is looking for their ‚Äòpartner in crime.‚Äô
  

  







Final Thoughts:
While physical attraction is important, it's the compatibility of personalities and shared values that truly form the foundation of a lasting relationship. If you're someone who embodies these qualities and is ready for a journey filled with laughter, exploration, and genuine connection, then I believe we could create something truly special together. Please feel free to send an e-mail describing yourself along with a couple of pictures to datethetulsaguy@gmail.com.
I look forward to the possibility of discovering a meaningful connection with you. 
Warm regards,
Ian

Name: Dan!
ProfileText:
Ôªøhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CS7Tq3BnRBY


LET'S GOOOOO!! :D


Hi everybody, I'm Dan! :)
 
  



Quick Facts:


Pronouns: He/Him
Age: 26
Height: 6 Feet
Current Location: Boston
Long Distance now? Am I willing to move down the line?: Heck yeah! :)
Relationship Type: Polyamorous
Looking for: Women
Kids: Love the little munchkins, still on the fence!
Religion: Atheist!
Kink Curious?: (yeah :P)
Communities: Effective Altruism, let‚Äôs go! :D
About Me:


School


I'm a junior studying Philosophy with a certificate of Finance, a very active member of my college‚Äôs swing dance club, and a new recruit to its Effective Altruism Club! I was also an EMT and dispatcher for four years!


I decided to declare Philosophy as my major after taking Ethics and being lucky enough to have a wonderful professor, who engaged me in dialogue after dialogue and helped me as I did my very best to metabolize the material we were learning into trying to understand meta ethics. Super fortunate to have met him - and I'm lucky enough to be taking a class with him again right now, nooice!


  



Swing!! 


I LOVE swing and dancing in general, it's amazing that we have such a diverse and strong dance culture at my college! I'd love to share a couple of my dances with you if you're interested! :)


This one is super cute, it's from a couple of years ago when I started teaching lessons. The goofball with the pink wristbands is me :P


And my partner for this dance went from a second semester lessons student to lessons teacher with me for the past two years! Lessons is definitely her baby though, I love her enthusiasm! We're good friends now, much to her chagrin (we consider ourselves work wives who are only staying together for the kids) xD


https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BmMvRnNJqafDCBFvMiB4eOML4Us7YVBT/view?usp=sharing


This one is my choreographer debut! 


As soon as they announced Jack and Jills were happening, in my excitement I choreographed the entire thing within 24 hours. It then got improved tenfold by my friend (who was LITERALLY a professional ballerina before college but then decided to study NEUROSCIENCE, amazing!!) who made it so much cooler because she recommended that rather than doing three angels (the final aerial) we instead build up to it with a tower of doom then a tower of doom with split and THEN angel for the big one! Wicked smaht!


https://youtu.be/YGISRgNljIg?si=xR5f0bXL551H4VPS&t=193


And this one, ooo this one is good! 


Most of us were new to the club, as the club was rebuilding after COVID and so there was a competitive fervor amongst many couples who wanted to take home the gold and showcase their progress to the best of their ability! My friend and I were no exception to this drive, though we did go into it with a mindset that hey, we may crash and burn on stage and if so no worries, we'll continue practicing and record one for ourselves. Fortunately though, I don't think we crashed and burned at all! It's making me happy just thinking about it, take it away Happy Feet! :P


https://youtu.be/DZ6Xcybp8MA?si=PnCYkuZR_P_uxNJz&t=672


I gotta hold myself back from sharing all my dances with you, THEY'RE SO FUN! I love dance! 


(Oh yeah I was Shrek for the big performance a couple of years ago too xD: https://youtu.be/mLLwT3UA4xQ?feature=shared)
 


Effective Altruism!


I recently read a book called 80,000 Hours in which they go okay, we got about 80,000 hours in our careers, so how can we design our career to maximize the amount of social good we can provide the world? EA as a movement is super interesting to me and scratches all the right parts of my brain. It's all about empirically being ethical! So for example, which charities should we donate to (it turns out some charities are literally HUNDREDS of times more impactful than others!), why we should be concerned about existential threats and the well being of future generations, and how we can use our careers to make the most impact.


I'm excited to find out what my future is going to be! I know whichever shape it takes I'll be designing it with the goal of doing the most good I can. I'm going to be working with the EA club and applying what I learned from 80,000 Hours to experiment and discover and deduce what I'd be good at and enjoy. I think if it's possible I'd LOVE to make a living persuading as many people as possible to join EA and to persuade as many people in EA to give more and more to the good fight!


That's because I'm only one person, so I'll only ever be able to contribute so many valuable hours or make so much money to donate. But if I can persuade others? Then I could be responsible for a portion of their contributions and I can scale and scale and scale my contribution to helping make the world a better place second hand!


   


Plus, if I'm going to be persuasive the best way to do that I think is to establish a strong ethos, and to do that I gotta cultivate as much virtue as possible. So I'm talking reading up and internalizing as much social justice theory as I can! From feminism to anti racism to LGBTQIA+ advocacy, the more the merrier! I love reading and learning about systemic problems and how we can topple the problems that plague the world.


I'm currently reading the book The Case for Rage and talking to my professor (the same one that got me into Philosophy!) about it. We have a disagreement as to its utility, which I love, because it gives us an opportunity to think deeper about the topic. Plus dialogues I think are fun in themselves! I am a philosophy student after all! :P


EMS!


As a senior in high school I spent three days a week going to EMT school, graduated high school, then got hired by my city! I went through the academy, which was super fun - and stressful! xD Charlie squad forever! I worked on the ambulance responding to emergencies for a couple of years all throughout the city and trying out different shifts, and then I went up to dispatch where I was like a fish taking to water.


  

I LOVED dispatching! Answering 911 calls, giving folks medical advice over the phone, hanging out with the fleet and solving the ever changing puzzle of unit availability and response time optimization, plus getting to hang out in an office with a whole team of people. I ended up leaving EMS after about four years so I could go to college and start my adventure there! I loved EMS, and I go back and visit every year and bring pizza to the dispatch gang. It's always good seeing them, especially my buddy who‚Äôs now a supervisor! I like to think I earned my nickname "Bubbles" and wore it with pride :P


Hobbies!


Dance of course! 
I spend let's see... at least 13.5 hours a week dancing. I wish it was double that, but I'm grateful that I discovered this new passion and have had the privilege of making so many friends and happy memories!


Board games! 
There's a really great board game cafe near my college. I love going there and spending an evening playing games, trying to deploy good strategies, being competitive or cooperative, and figuring out the puzzle. Also chess specifically, though I haven't played in a little bit. I usually go through phases with chess where I'll play a lot and then none at all. I exclusively use the hippo opening for chess because I love the symmetry and defensive nature of the system. 


The hippo:
  



Also, a hippo:
  

 
xD
Prius chats!
One of my favorite things to do is definitely to spend a few hours in my little Prius Compact with a friend discussing anything and everything! 


I love developing my friendships and strengthening my bonds with others, plus, I like to do my best to actively listen and learn as much as I can about and from my friends. It's just a really nice ambience. I pull up next to their place so the chat can end anytime, put on classical music, comfortable temperature, we get to sit side by side facing the world together, and have the luxury of being able to switch up the activity at any time such as going and grabbing some food. This I mostly do with who is probably my closest friend, every Sunday after we hit up a local country bar for some line dancing.


I also like parties, oh speaking of which at my friend's cocktail parties sometimes the upstairs neighbors will be there with their daughter and I always chase her around the apartment as she tries to get away or sneak up on me and I go "rah!" xD I love kids and dogs and all animals and well, people, I love a lot of things! Lol


Ooo and horror movies! >:) 


Hereditary is a personal favorite!


  



And editing audio! I made this metal medley using Mick Gordon's music from the game DOOM:


https://drive.google.com/file/d/1L4pTOp6NMtm495q0rfhouD4muWAJK0e2/view?usp=sharing
 
  



I love all kinds of music from metal to jazz to kpop to rap!
Alright I think that'll do for a first impression xD 


Thank you so much for reading this little intro!


About You:


This is where you come in! :D 


  



Hit me up with your own little google doc or email, (bonus points for GIFs and Pics :P) I‚Äôd love to learn about you and see your energy! 


Are we kindred spirits, balancing opposites? Excited to find out! :)


Contact info: datemedansubmissions@gmail.com

Name: George
ProfileText:
ÔªøBit cautious about identification/digital footprint, but I am happy to send pictures and identifying details via email (dmdgeorge24@gmail.com) if you write a few words about yourself!
Hi, I‚Äôm George and I‚Äôm currently a mathematics PhD student in the UK. I‚Äôm a 22 years old man and have a sexuality that is a small perturbation from heterosexual. Mostly I am interested in women, and I would be looking for a monogamous relationship.
Interests
My foremost passion outside of mathematics is the exploration of consciousness using psychedelics. Psychedelics have been a part of my life since I was 19 and have played an absolutely inextricable part of my transition into adulthood ‚Äì they have helped me become more confident in my own skin, surrender some of my scepticism, develop a more robust theory of mind, analyse some long-standing life problems that were somewhat repressed, among other things. I have had very positive experiences with people who share an interest in psychedelics and I am currently involved in organising the psychedelic society at my university, so I wanted to note this first. Please, if you have had positive experience with psychedelics, feel free to get in touch!
A potential partner should be at minimum comfortable with me doing psychedelics occasionally and be non-judgemental on the topic. They are of course free to hold whatever opinions they like on drugs or their legal status. Ideally, I would be able to share psychedelic experiences with a partner as a way of dissolving all social barriers/masks and experiencing pure connection between the deepest levels of our consciousnesses. This is somewhat of a fantasy of mine, and does not have to be realised! On the topic of drugs, I have no strong opinions on non-prescription drug use provided it is sensible, responsible, controlled, and does not interfere with your (and by extension my) life in any serious way.
Less intellectually ‚Äì my previous interests have included lost media, urban exploration videos (particularly abandoned theme parks), various documentaries/docusoaps, video game history, etc.
Points about me
¬∑        6ft0, beard, long hair. Underweight. Good hygiene.  
¬∑        Unlikely to be considered a normal person in any sense of the word. I have been working to embrace this fact.
¬∑        I try to throw myself into every social situation I can, and I‚Äôm not afraid to branch out into unfamiliar territory or try something new if the opportunity presents itself.
¬∑        I‚Äôm not quiet really, but I‚Äôm a bit socially awkward. I sometimes struggle to start conversation but I have got used to carrying on conversation with practice. I struggle to read non-verbal communication (though I do try quite hard) so I prefer things to be verbal where possible. Very physically awkward and take a moment to get attuned to social situations.
¬∑        Often misunderstand speech entertainingly or take things literally. On the flipside I feel I am quite good at making quips.
¬∑        I am not religious, and this is unlikely to change. That said, I‚Äôm open to dating someone with religious/spiritual beliefs or beliefs like astrology provided they don‚Äôt introduce irreconcilable differences into the relationship.
¬∑        Big on physical intimacy and random hugs/cuddles.
¬∑        Want a good texter who can match my wall-of-text energy.
What I am looking for
Woman (or maybe fem NB - do still get in touch) between the age of 20 and about 30. Some flexibility on the upper end, (and I would perhaps date someone who is 19 and soon turning 20) but I am very conscious that we are likely to be in different stages of life. I‚Äôm looking for someone who lives in the UK or somewhere where there is prospect that we may move closer should the relationship get serious ‚Äì mainland Europe would be ok for this. I would be interested in having kids in the future, though not until I have a stable career and/or I‚Äôm in my late 20s or early 30s. I would ideally like a long-term relationship, but I will definitely not insist this as an expectation on any dynamic that develops.
Basically what I am looking for is a ‚Äúkindred spirit‚Äù, someone who gets me and someone who I get on a very fundamental level. High level of emotional mutual intelligibility. Someone who I can feel completely at ease around, and someone who I would trust with (almost) anything. I am not too concerned about superficial differences, e.g. minor ideological differences or disagreement. Common interests, sense of humour, taste in media is certainly a plus, but has proven to be far from a requirement.
I have a very strong requirement of clear communication. I want to be very clear with a partner when they have upset me, and I want them to do the same in return. I prefer for people to lay things out on the table as they are, and we can deal with them, rather than tension building over something the other partner may not have noticed. We need to be able to freely communicate our needs without any fear of upset. I prefer bluntness rather than having my feelings coddled.
Ambition and intellectual curiosity is important to me. It can be about anything, and it definitely doesn‚Äôt have to be something which is her job or is ‚Äúeconomically productive‚Äù. I love hearing about people‚Äôs interests, no matter how far they fall from my own (though I may not be able to ask very interesting questions!), and unique aspects of their life experience. If you can talk at length about this, then that‚Äôs a major plus. I love when people are unapologetically non-conforming.
I have no real preference on physical appearance. For me attraction is a ‚Äúyes‚Äù or ‚Äúno‚Äù, and I think most people are a ‚Äúyes‚Äù. I met my first partner having never seen a clear picture of their face before ‚Äì it may be difficult to believe but personality is the only real factor to me. A hard requirement is that a partner should have mental health that is being managed (I‚Äôm happy to support, but I don‚Äôt think I would be equipped to deal with someone currently in crisis) and should be looking after themselves.
BDSM
My relationships so far have all involved elements of BDSM. There is always an egalitarian underpinning, I would think of the D/S aspect as more of a ‚Äúshared performance‚Äù that can enter our interactions but ultimately does not determine what roles we take within the relationship. I am a switch, and whether I assume the D or S role is a function of how I get along with someone and the vanilla dynamic that develops between us. As both a D and S, I like strict regimentation, with well-defined punishment or reward systems and thorough negotiation.
I will say that this has just happened to be the case in all of my relationships thus far (I have always assumed the D role due to circumstance), BDSM does not have to be involved in any relationship of mine.
Contact
If you‚Äôve read this far, congratulations. Fire me an email on dmdgeorge24@gmail.com if you are interested or just want to chat. My main channel of communication is Discord, but I‚Äôm happy to use Whatsapp, Messenger, Signal etc.
