Name: Richard Nicholson
ProfileText:
Ôªø(Last updated: 14 February 2025)


(Reading guide: Click/tap on yellow words like these[a] if you don't see a right sidebar. I'm using gdoc comments to annotate with footnotes.)


Hello, and welcome to a time before Tinder and Match.com, where people got to know each other through a more in-depth process than one sentence, a bathroom selfie, and a pick-up line. Please allow me to introduce myself[b], and explain in excessive detail why you should date me.


To start, let‚Äôs get the boilerplate character sheet information out of the way. My name‚Äôs Richard Nicholson, I‚Äôm a Level 3 Human Programmer, male, age 30, straight and monogamous[c], wants kids (eventually). I live in Pacifica (tiny town just south of San Francisco) and I‚Äôm very used to hour-long drives[d] to get anywhere.


  
  

  
  
  
  
  

This is my family knot, the C√¶r Ni…£ol!
.[e]


So, who is this asshole anyways?


I am a creature of stories and games, but I mean both such concepts in frustratingly broad ways which become hard to express through sheer virtue of their vast scope.


Stories can mean obvious things like books, movies, anime, roleplaying games, and so forth, but it also means hearing about what happened to you at work today, or recounting that one time on vacation, listening to what you liked about a book (the story *of* the story is its own story), or the history of the evolution of ride ticketing models at Disneyland.


Games means all the obvious things like videogames, boardgames, roleplaying games, sports, and such, but it also means things like using clever wording to layer meaning into sentences, mutilating the spirit of a rule while sticking to the letter, stepping between all the cracks on the sidewalk, or answering the question of WW1 tanks versus hippos[f] by doing research on how much force they can each exert and survive. I love exploring ideas and taking them apart; I love presenting my twisted results to others and seeing what they do with them.


I am a huge dabbler. At any given time I‚Äôm doing 3-5 ‚Äúprojects‚Äù (if you can count reading a book series as a project) with a dozen others on the back burner half or wholly forgotten. Not counting regularly scheduled events like watch parties, hobby club meetings, and roleplaying sessions. I try to pack a lot of fun and variety into my life. Accordingly, my hobbies are a pretty good lens through which to understand me. Here‚Äôs a smattering of my favorites:


* Videogames (action, platforming, strategy, coop/team, logistics)
* Rock climbing[g] (it‚Äôs like a workout, but a puzzle game!)
* Books (fantasy/sci-fi, Lois McMaster Bujold, Brandon Sanderson, the Kingkiller Chronicles, and Phillip K. Dick especially)
* Convoluted philosophically-inclined bullshit (Umineko, K6BD, Homestuck, Evangelion)
* Sports (disc golf, minigolf, bowling, archery, curling, and wait there‚Äôs more!)
* Sharing experiences and passing thoughts (I love the intimacy of seeing your interests and encounters in real time. I love to share things I find.)
* Roleplaying games (various TTRPGs, e.g. D&D or Tenra Bansho Zero)
* Cuddling (just being together is nice, but touching is special and important)
* Board games (eurogame point salads, worker placement, action point limited, deckbuilder)
* Animals! Let‚Äôs go to the zoo or go on a hike and look at birds![h]
* Anime (Thunderbolt Fantasy, Violet Evergarden, FMA, Durarara)
* Writing and game design (I make my own stories and games, too!)
* kdrama (intrigue and mystery) (also does anyone know how to capitalize ‚ÄúK-Drama‚Äù and make it not look weird?)
* Wordplay and linguistics (I WILL look up the etymology of that weird word, and use it for a godawful pun three weeks later. Or maybe three seconds later.)
* SPREADSHEETS (there is nothing as exciting as well-formatted data! How do you rate this list?)
* Music (Anything with a strong melody really. Strong lyrics to sing along to in the car, and high-energy stuff for workouts)
* Nerdy documentaries on unnecessarily specific topics (like a 6-hour dissection[i] of a game about being a kid spending summer vacation in rural japan, and its thesis about childhood)


There‚Äôs a lot more, especially in terms of dabblings I don‚Äôt actively pursue (genetics, crafting, proper walking technique, celtic knot drawing... etc.), but this list is long enough as it is. Time to nonsequitur!


My sense of humor trends to postironic tastes, where something is both sarcastic (funny because it is false) and sardonic (funny because it is true) at the same time. The phrases that get reactions like ‚Äúokay, that‚Äôs technically correct but...‚Äù or ‚Äúthat is absolutely not how that works! ...but maybe it has a point‚Äù, and especially ‚Äúthat‚Äôs stupid but correct/useful/great‚Äù. My true masterpieces are the ones where I say something which is deeply but subtly wrong, and you nod in casual acceptance until, ‚Äú...wait a fucking second-!‚Äù Oh, I also enjoy silly and absurdist humor, too (like tone whiplash). You might have noticed that one already.


I love the process of self-improvement. I used to think I wanted to be the very best that no one ever was, but then I took a closer look at the leaderboards. The games I am good at and most enjoy, I am consistently in the top 10% of the global rankings, except when I am in the top 1%. I found it didn‚Äôt matter to me. I don‚Äôt want to be better than other people, I want to be better than me. I don‚Äôt care about being good, I care about being better. Improvement is itself the joy.


My Dating Philosophy


I've started trying to date without expectation[j]. Supposedly, as the ancient wisdom goes, if you live without expectation you are ready for anything. As the much less ancient but much more wise Mister Rogers said: ‚ÄúLove isn‚Äôt a state of perfect caring. It is an active noun like 'struggle.' ‚Äù The most important parts of love aren't found, they are built. Intimacy, trust, safety, chemistry; these things don't form in a day, or even a month. These are the sorts of things that come from having been together through thick and thin, that are made of time and shared experience more than anything else.


This has led me to a very ‚Äúfriends first" mindset. I don't want to focus on the future at the expense of the present. Those moments of connection in the present are what the future is built of and on. Worrying about what a lifetime together would look like makes no sense without first understanding what a week or month together looks like. I want to give that natural rhythm time to breathe and grow, to settle in to familiarity.


What I‚Äôm Looking for in a Partner


There are, depending I guess on how you count, about four things I‚Äôm really looking for in my future life partner. They‚Äôre not immediately actionable issues, usually requiring gradual building of intimacy; they‚Äôre more like my areas of long term interest and focus. I‚Äôm sure these aren‚Äôt the only things I want, but these are my dealbreaker values. They are, from most to least important, as follows:


The first is a mutual confidant. The kind of intimacy and trust that we can -- and more importantly, *do* -- share our secret thoughts with each other. Beyond being merely friends or close, I want our relationship to be a safe space. I want to represent safety and security to you, and I want to be able to find safety and security in you as well. I want you to be the dependable constant in my world that I can retreat to when life gets hard, and I yearn to provide that service as well.


The second is friendship and companionship. Shared activities and aimless conversations. Someone who I can regale with whatever weird articles or dumb memes I stumbled across online that day, someone who tells me about the drama their coworkers keep starting. Watching shows or playing games together, or going out to the park or whatnot. I have some preferences on activity choice, but I‚Äôm not picky here; what matters to me is that we have fun things to do together and we enjoy ourselves doing it.


The third is a focus on lifestyle compatibility. This isn‚Äôt exactly something I‚Äôm looking for in a partner, so much as a value I am observing. A huge part of relationships is the things that aren‚Äôt fun, or the things so mundane as to escape notice. Doing chores, standards of cleanliness, what temperature is the bedroom, do we share a bed and/or bedroom or do we sleep separately, how are objects stored and organized around the house, and hundreds of other minutiae. This is a big deal and it‚Äôs the make-or-break (especially break) of many (if not all) partnerships. I‚Äôm not going to try to litigate that out here, -- it needs to be a conversation -- but it‚Äôs worth preparing this idea in our minds.


Fourth and finally, kids. I don‚Äôt want kids right away, but I do want them some day. Probably one or two. I have a lot of natural inclinations both as a teacher and as a parent, and I want to channel them. Kids are great. Childrearing is another very complicated subject which, much like home lifestyle choices, tends to be assumed first and only considered once conflicts emerge. It‚Äôs definitely not a first date conversation, but it‚Äôs something that should be talked about before making a permanent commitment.


Of course, this is in many ways a description of a relationship, not a partner. That‚Äôs somewhat unavoidable, as the two concepts are deeply intertwined and, well, definitionally inseparable. But you were probably hoping for some more person-scale descriptions to see if you match them, yeah? So here's that nice bullet point list of melodramatically pretentious trait descriptions you ordered:


* Integrity. Both in terms of personal responsibility, and a pride in precision. To be specific when speaking and cut off misunderstandings and ambiguities[k] before they happen.
* Playfulness. This one is mostly literal and also one of the most important. It‚Äôs important to have fun, even when doing something serious. The desire to toy with things is one of the traits I find most attractive and full of depth for connection. A mischievous streak is a bonus.
* Conversation. I love to talk, at length. Sharing stories, investigating some random factoid, snide banter, and otherwise just experiencing the mind of another. This is a very important level of connection for me, and I find the ability to speak openly and honestly very precious.
* Honesty. Not in terms of not telling lies, but as a commitment to tell the truth. To be the one who speaks up when something is wrong, even when it is uncomfortable.
* Curiosity. I like people who try to learn and understand the world around them. To push past surface level comprehension and hunt for the details.
* Understanding and Growth. There are a lot of things people don‚Äôt know or are bad at. Not in terms of some mystical conspiracy, but just generally people aren‚Äôt perfect. It‚Äôs important to forgive people for being imperfect, and to show some grace. This is even more important in a relationship: There will be misunderstandings, there will be conflicts. In order to make anything lasting, both of us will need the maturity to talk about what is wrong and the flexibility to learn and change.
* Self. I want a partner with an inner fire. I want someone with the audacity to be herself and to shape the world to suit her needs.


Lifestyle; or, What I‚Äôm looking for in a relationship


Let‚Äôs talk more about lifestyle compatibility, as expressed through the metaphor of  Forgettable Wednesday[l]. It‚Äôs pretty fundamental to how I‚Äôm approaching relationships these days. To paraphrase, marriage is mostly made of life (not the magical reality-defying of dates), and life is mostly made of ordinary forgettable things. Boring things, frustrating things, and unimportant things. Trips to the grocery store, getting stuck in traffic, and sitting at home after a rough day at work when you‚Äôre too tired to do anything. An okay relationship can survive that stress. A great relationship makes those situations enjoyable, or at least lessens the burden. Ultimately, living with a partner means living with a partner, and that‚Äôs a lot of arguments about how messy the sink has gotten if you can‚Äôt come to a consensus on how to manage such things.


Of course, my lifestyle has existed in so many different forms, each unrecognizable to the others (yours probably has too); I‚Äôm a person and I change. My love of learning and growth and constant self-improvement can lead me to rather drastic and sometimes sudden changes to large portions of my life: I once went from watching 6+ hours of youtube daily to none, because I felt it was becoming a burden. I once went from only doing things online to attending distant events four days a week, and then a few months later dropped all of those events and started a new workout routine. There‚Äôs also a time when I had the same meal for breakfast for five years straight. It‚Äôs hard to guess what has longevity and will remain interesting or sufficient.


The human mind is capable of astonishing levels of self-modification; if you can show me a different way to live, I can incorporate (at least parts of) that into my own lifestyle, and I‚Äôll probably want to. Maybe being with a wonderful person will remove some of my hangups: Perhaps I won‚Äôt find certain things so difficult, or I‚Äôll find a hidden joy in something I had dismissed. Or perhaps you‚Äôll introduce me to something entirely new, and I‚Äôll make space to rebuild my life around it.


So with that in mind, what would living with me look like? What do I want out of that?


* I‚Äôve lived my whole life in the Bay Area. I don‚Äôt particularly comprehend the alternative[m], but there are places like Portland and Seattle where I might not notice the difference. I'm not tied to the specific location and I'm at a place in my life that I could move anywhere, but I'm not sure what living elsewhere would be like or if I'd enjoy it.
* Despite the plethora of things I like to do at home, I grew up outside. I don‚Äôt just mean the near-daily trips to the zoo, but my grandfather[n] would take me on hikes every week to go birdwatching. I‚Äôve been backpacking with the boy scouts and such, and I never want to give up proximity to nature... but also I‚Äôve become okay with ‚Äúwimp camping‚Äù full of modern conveniences, or not camping at all anymore. üòÖ
   * I am the kind of person who could comfortably not leave their house for several consecutive months[o], and also the kind of person who can go on a ten mile hike by accident. That‚Äôs not an exaggeration, I‚Äôve done that dozens of times.
* I love doing things together[p], even when I couldn‚Äôt manage them alone. Going to the movies by yourself just feels wrong, you know? There‚Äôs a bunch of things I like doing with others that I can‚Äôt bring myself to do by myself. Minigolf, bowling, movies, hikes... I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs also plenty of things I‚Äôve never thought of that I‚Äôd love getting dragged along to.
   * I value time spent together very highly, but we can‚Äôt spend all our time together. Not just from a practical standpoint (e.g. employment) but there‚Äôs no activity so good you never need a break from it. I don‚Äôt know what that balance will look like; I‚Äôm sure it will vary based on which interests we align on.
* The kitchen will be clean! To a like, 80% degree! Dishes can briefly soak in the sink in extreme cases, but they best be moving to the dishwasher within a day. Pots and pans do not sit dirty after a meal. If anything, I will clean them before I eat. Other parts of the house are whatever, but the kitchen is a place of industry and therefore it needs to retain baseline operational capacity. For the rest of the house, I‚Äôd much rather stay clean by not making a mess in the first place, and neat and organized can look nice, but as long as things don‚Äôt get cluttered I accept that any space that people actually live in will succumb to some level of chaos[q].
* I love trips to faraway places, but I‚Äôm perfectly content with 0 to 2 such trips per year. I hate the process of traveling, the anxiety of making sure I‚Äôve packed everything, and getting through an airport without anything weird happening (track record is startlingly bad). I love being there on the other side though!
   * There‚Äôs still a lot of places I‚Äôd love to visit someday. The waterfalls of Iceland, another trip to South Korea or Japan, Australian wildlife centers, Germany, maybe another stay in Patagonia or New Zealand just because they‚Äôre pretty...
   * Also, maybe having a partner with me will ease my hangups? If you turn out to be better at managing the parts I struggle with, perhaps I can enjoy the rest of it without reservation and will join you on monthly vacations. Who knows!
* I am not a pet person. I am especially not a rambunctious puppy person[r]. I love animals, but I find living with them exhausting. If I am going to put in that much work, I want things in return that they can‚Äôt give. Old dogs and certain cats are alright because they‚Äôre calmer and relatively self-sufficient, and terrarium pets are great because I can ignore them and they don‚Äôt mind. But if I‚Äôm gonna have a small energetic disaster living in my home, I would hope it is a human child. Those at least learn to talk.
* Cozy time is important. Talking about each other‚Äôs day, what we‚Äôve seen and read and done recently, plans for the immediate term future, and assorted random nonsense. Time to cuddle and simply be together. I value this one a lot, it‚Äôs probably the second most intimate thing I can imagine.


Things I‚Äôd like to know about you
~~ AKA ways to introduce yourself to me when you‚Äôve run out of ideas ~~


* What‚Äôs your trashy comfort fic? Do you read litRPGs, HP fanfic, edgy vampire teens? Romance novels or shoujyo manga, chuuni shounen, Deep Lore stuff? Also, B-movie horror or kung fu flicks qualify. What‚Äôs your fiction vice?
* What did you do this week that you don‚Äôt normally do? Nobody ever has a truly ‚Äúnormal‚Äù week where everything colors inside the lines of their regular schedule. So: Did you make progress on a project, or go on an adventure - maybe by accident?  What stood out to you, what did you find interesting about this week?
* What‚Äôs a super cool place or event you‚Äôve been to? It doesn‚Äôt necessarily have to be travel. A really neat museum, a friend‚Äôs unforgettable wedding, that one playground you wish you were small enough to go back to, or any sort of chaos so far out of the ordinary it defies categorization. What is a memory you cherish?
* Any thoughts you have on dating. As a process, as a commodity in the dating app world (and why you turned to dateme docs[s]), how it does or should function, the dysfunctions to avoid, past experiences that guide your present, or your current philosophy. I'm especially interested in things you dislike about dating and how you would change it, as I would love to incorporate those lessons. It‚Äôs always a fascinating topic to hear how different everyone‚Äôs perspectives and experiences are in this field!


Call me, maybe?


Thank you for reading this far! If you didn‚Äôt actually read this far and just skimmed to the bottom, thanks anyways for still being interested. If you want to date me, think we would be a good match, or just want to chat and go on some outings, send me a mail at elathrain@gmail.com. Tell me a little about why, and something about yourself!
[a]Congratulations! If you can read this, you now have access to the proper reading experience.
[b]I'm a man of wealth, and taste üéµ
[c]I remain open to discussing various degrees of open relationship and/or my partner being poly so long as I‚Äôm their primary partner, although personally I am monogamous by nature. (Besides, finding a first partner is hard enough! üòÇ)
[d]This seems to always horrify people that I drive this far. No really, it's fine.
[e]For those of the discerning eye: Why yes, I did in fact change the font to Times New Roman just for that name. The kerning on the lowercase gamma is *unforgivably _awful_* in Arial.
[f]My friends started asking some "who would win in a fight" questions that got really out of hand.
[g]I stick to indoor bouldering gyms. I like knowing there are mats if I fall even if I rarely need them. It lets me go all-out and push my limits safely.
[h]Weird how this point isn‚Äôt formatted the same huh? That‚Äôs gonna bug someone... Oh wait it‚Äôs me.
[i]For the curious: Action Button Reviews Boku no Natsuyasumi
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=779coR-XPTw
[j]This is harder than it sounds, and has proven more difficult than anticipated. Which might be my problem right there, that I had expectations for not having expectations üòè
[k]Except of course when messing around and ambiguity is the joke. Ambiguity is a great joke.
[l]https://waitbutwhy.com/2014/02/pick-life-partner-part-2.html
Although I prefer to change the term to "Ordinary Wednesday", because "Forgettable" makes it sound like it has no value, which is the opposite of the point we're trying to make.
[m]Sure I‚Äôve stayed briefly in the mountains and such, but actually living in the country doesn't seem real to me.
[n]After he retired he became the head of the bay area chapter of the Auduban Society! Dude is a walking library of birds. Ask him about a call and he can give you the bird's full name and description from the sound alone.
[o]It was after surgery in the summer of 2020, so not leaving my room was a responsible choice, not (just) a lazy one.
[p]For those who benefit from the 7 love styles framing: My most important styles are Activity, Physical (not a euphemism for sex), Emotional, and Intellectual. Although I'm pretty hesitant about touching strangers, so an early relationship requires a good bit of emotional and intellectual connection before physical (but I'm always down for activity).


For those still on the older 5 love languages model, we can say my top love language is quality time followed by physical touch and words of affirmation, but there's so many caveats that this doesn't mean much.


My main criticism of both models (other than being merely mediocre-communicative hyperflexible mythologies) is that they don't do a good job of distinguishing importance from frequency. I think touch and cuddling is something very core to my understanding of love and deserves a high rank of importance, -- maybe even the top spot -- but my actual ideal relationship is going to have a lot more activity, intellectual, and emotional connection (in that order).
[q]Even Marie Kondo conceded this point after her third child. Life creates chaos, and sometimes that chaos is better to manage than eliminate.
[r]I learned this by currently living in a house with a rambunctious puppy. Send help.
[s]Good choice, by the way!

Name: Kyle West
ProfileText:
ÔªøKyle West Date Me Doc
  

Hello all! I‚Äôm trying out this new approach to a dating profile in the hopes that it allows me to paint a fuller picture of who I am and what I‚Äôm hoping to find in a girlfriend and, God willing, a future spouse. I‚Äôll leave my contact info below; if you think we might be a good match, please feel free to reach out. Alternatively, if you are reading this and think I might be a good fit for someone you know, I would appreciate it if you passed the doc on!


A Bit About Me
I‚Äôm 32 and live in the greater DC area. In the past year I finished my Ph.D. in Ancient History and started a new job teaching Classics at my undergraduate alma mater, a small Christian liberal arts college. I love introducing my students to the fascinating other world that is ancient Greece and Rome (fair warning, I‚Äôm told I can overshare a bit when it comes to the details of my favorite subjects. üôÇ) Contributing to college students‚Äô growth and success at this crucial stage in their lives is a major component of what drives me. I also have a strong desire to publish books that will advance scholarship in my field. My dissertation looked at ways that Romans thought about disability and incorporated (or failed to incorporate) people with disabilities into their society.


I am a practicing Christian in the Lutheran Church Missouri Synod and, though not always perfectly, I try to make faith the bedrock of my life. I had a journey from a Baptist background in my childhood into the Lutheran tradition, and my commitment to that theology is important to me. However, it‚Äôs certainly something I am happy to discuss as I get to know someone. I hope you find theology a stimulating discussion topic on dates! My hope for a partner is that we could build a family, including kids, that centers itself on Christian worship. This would shape many of the rhythms of our home life, and it would also mean putting down deep roots in the local congregation. If I had to pick the most important thing I am looking for in a spouse, it would be someone who also finds this vision compelling.


One last thing I think it is important to be upfront about; my interest in studying disability is rooted in personal experience. I was born with cerebral palsy, a physical disability that impacts my mobility and motor coordination. I use a mobility scooter to travel longer distances outdoors, and a cane off-and-on when I walk. I do have to adapt to some unique challenges, but with hard work, support from the ones I love, and the grace of God, I have built a life that I‚Äôm very thankful for. One of the Biblical passages that holds the greatest meaning for me comes from John chapter nine. Jesus says about a man born blind that it was not because of ‚Äúthis man‚Äôs sin or his parents‚Äô, but that the works of God might be displayed in him.‚Äù


Mom and Dad
  





    


My Interests
* Classic literature
* Fantasy and sci-fi (These first two items together make for fairly eclectic tastes. I‚Äôm the sort of person who might simultaneously be reading a Star Wars Expanded Universe novel and Anna Karenina. üòõ
* Games (almost any genre and format, board, video, party, take your pick)
* Live theater (both attending and performing, especially Shakespeare)
* Travel (especially to historically significant locations, and especially in Europe)
* Movies and TV (Some favorites, It‚Äôs a Wonderful Life, The Lord of the Rings, The Wind Rises, ‚ÄúChuck,‚Äù ‚ÄúCommunity,‚Äù ‚ÄúStranger Things‚Äù)
* Dogs (specifically, wanting my own golden retriever since about the age of six is pretty much a core memory.)


My Strengths as a Partner
* Strong Sense of Loyalty and Duty: This one is very much a value inherited from my Dad. If we are committed to each other, I will stick by you. This is true when it comes to my friends, but I‚Äôm also confident it will be true towards my wife. And specifically in a marriage, I will strive to live by the knowledge that my calling is to lay down my life in service to you.
* Unflagging Romanticism: If our relationship takes off, I will write you poetry at some point. üôÇ
*  I Love Sharing What I Love: Basically, nothing makes me happy quite like helping others fall in love with things I think are awesome. My family pokes fun at me sometimes because of how much I like to watch people‚Äôs reactions when I introduce them to things. And I make it a point to show that same enthusiasm when people I care about are sharing their interests. If we have the chance to date, I hope I‚Äôll experience something new thanks to you!
* Intellectually Stimulating: If you value book smarts and good conversation, you could do worse. üôÇ


What I‚Äôm Looking For
* Someone who will help me grow in my faith.
* Values family; eager to have kids.
* An empathetic and kind orientation towards others; practices hospitality, such that together we‚Äôll be able to be a blessing to my students and our community.
* Intellectually Stimulating: My ideal romantic partner is also a partner in learning and conversation: we should help each other reach new heights intellectually as well as spiritually.


If you‚Äôve made it this far, thanks for giving my slightly long-winded thoughts your time. üôÇ My email is kyle.west@wheehaa.com. If, perhaps, you are intrigued, I look forward to hearing from you!

Name: William Wolf
ProfileText:
willium ‚Äî dating
‚Üê
Dating Profile
JAN 2024
Over the last couple years, I've gotten a lot more serious about finding a life partner. This piece is an exercise in outlining who I am, what I bring to a relationship, and what I'm looking for in a partner. I've often struggled to articulate these things effectively, so I've decided to sit down and write this, however cringey it may be. In large part, I'm writing this for myself, but I guess it might help to share it too.
If you think you're right for me (or have someone in mind),
please
reach out
.
About Me
My name is William Wolf
(
n√© Strimling
).
I'm 29 years old,
but I'm a bit of an old soul. I generally find that I relate more to people older than me. I'm on the cusp of Gen Z, but I'm definitely more of a Millenial at heart.
I am 5' 7" (~169cm) tall,
if height is important to you
. It's probably the thing I'm most self-conscious about and also my superpower, because I find that it causes people to underestimate me.
I have a large, blended family.
My parents are divorced, and each has a new partner. I have three siblings: one biological sister, a step-brother, and a step-sister. I'm the youngest. I have cousins I don't have much of a relationship with, and second-cousins once-removed who I see often. There are also many people I consider family who aren't related to me at all.
I grew up in Piedmont, CA
, which is just across the bay from San Francisco. Most of my family still lives around there.
I hate San Francisco because I love San Francisco
.
I went to the University of Washington
in Seattle, where I studied Computer Science. I didn't really like Seattle. The weather was too dreary, and I found the people standoffish. That said, I don't think there's anywhere in the world more beautiful than Seattle in the summertime.
I love to
travel
.
I always feel like I haven't done enough of it. New York City is home right now (and the best city), but San Francisco is the center of my world (both personally and professionally), and my heart is in Tel Aviv. Eventually, I'd like to live a life that allows for traveling frequently or even living across multiple places.
I'm a creative technologist.
I know that term sounds kind of bullshity, but it's the most descriptive way I've come up with of describing the work I do. Right now, I'm the founder of a venture-backed tech startup (my second one). In the past I've been a software engineer, a product designer, a product manager, a visual journalist, and a researcher. I'm most interested in the ways technology can help bring people closer together ‚Äî which was the basis for my current startup and my previous one. You can learn more about my professional career on
my website
.
I am Jewish,
and had a Bar Mitzvah, but am not very religious otherwise. However, I resonate a lot with Jewish values and find a lot of belonging in Jewish communities. So, I think of it as being an important part of my identity. I have also
lived in Israel
, and consider myself a Zionist.
I am socially progressive and fiscally moderate.
I think alignment on politics is important, so, briefly ‚Äî I believe love is love, you can identify however you want, and that a woman should be empowered to choose to end a pregnancy. I support social safety nets, universal health care, and regulation against anti-competitive business practices. I love America; it's not without its faults, but I love how it enables class mobility, supports entrepreneurship, and fosters unparalled diversity.
I'm an avid reader.
I enjoy reading everything from contemporary fiction, to German literature, to dense biographies, to research papers, to popsci, and everything in between. I used to read 50+ books a year, but now it's closer to one every other week.
I live an active life.
I exercise almost every day, usually for about an hour. I enjoy weightlifting for fitness and as a sort of meditative activity. For recovery, I've been getting into yoga. For cardio, I try to run or erg 2-3x a week. As trite as it sounds, I really like walking, and try to get in at least 15k steps per day. I also enjoy hiking and snowboarding, but don't get to do either nearly enough.
I try to eat well,
but don't follow a strict diet. At one point I followed a ketogenic diet, but I found that obsessing about carbs was itself unhealthy, and, more importantly, it made me unhappy. Being flexible about what I eat is one of my greatest joys ‚Äî I love trying new foods and cuisines without much consideration for ingredients. That said, I do my best to avoid processed and fast foods.
I don't smoke or do drugs.
I sometimes drink alcohol, but almost never to the point of being drunk. I have infrequently smoked weed in my life, but it's not something I'm into. I have tried psychadelics too, but again, it's not something that's important to me.
I'm fairly extroverted.
I prefer being around people and enjoy meeting strangers. I maintain a lot of friendships including childhood friends, college friends, work friends, and random people I met at parties, hostels, and coffee shops. I'm not really into "going out," for the most part. I find crowds overwhelming, and I vastly prefer sitting and having a conversation with someone. I love dancing, but mostly poorly at home, rather than at a club.
I take life pretty seriously.
I like to have fun and go on adventures, but I don't think anyone would describe me as care-free. I find what makes me happy is focusing on what gives me purpose (my work, helping people) and what gives me belonging (family, community). I love investing in relationships and projects. For most things I do in life ‚Äî I'm in it for the long-haul. I don't give up easily on people or on things I believe in. I do what I say I'll do, and I show up.
I'm ambitious, but not goal-oriented.
I love to build things, and I get most excited about projects that have the potential to effect change at-scale in some way. I also
try
to constantly challenge myself and compare myself only to who I was before, rather than to other people. I think it's nice to have goals, but either you don't reach them and feel an undeserved sense of failure, or do reach them and ask yourself "now what?" Instead, I try to focus on continuing to find ways to do what I love to do, so long as I'm able to provide for myself (and eventually, my family).
I pride myself on being
self-reliant
.
I don't want to ever depend on someone else for my happiness, safety, or sense of purpose.
I love drinking tea.
I got really into it during COVID, in lieu of baking sourdough bread. Now I collect tea, and enjoy the ceremony around it. I also love the vibe of sharing tea with friends and strangers ‚Äî I find it to be intimate in a way that alcohol and coffee are not. In my senior year of college, I even did a tea-related
social experiment
.
I practice monogamy.
As a rule, I don't really do 'casual' relationships, and the idea of seeing multiple at the same time gives me anxiety. I've been in two significant long-term relationships, each about 4 years long, and a few serious, shorter relationships. Ultimately, each relationship ended because we either grew apart or wanted different things.
As I've gotten more serious about dating, I've also become more picky. I still lead with my heart and don't care so much about your body or how you identify, but I do care about your values, habits, and goals.
In other words,
I care about what you care about
.
Personality
Enneagram
(
about
)
Big Five
(
about
)
MBTI
: EN(T/F)J (
about
)
About You
I want my partner to value family.
This starts with me and you, in addition to our respective families. That doesn't mean you need to have a great relationship with your family, but ideally you aspire to. I want kids, but I am open to adoption and fostering ‚Äî I believe every kid deserves a loving home, and if/when I have the means, I'd like to find a way to open mine to those who don't have one.
I want my partner to value community.
Hopefully you care as much as I do about being an active member of your community and society at large. It doesn't matter if that means volunteering in a soup kitchen, working at a summer camp, running for office, or something else entirely, as long as you like to be involved in our world.
I want my partner to believe in something.
You should be generally optimistic about the future. I find nihilism and pessimism exhausting. Ideally, our beliefs are mostly the same, but it's more important that you arrived at yours independently and respect my own. You should also care about politics and social issues, possibly to the point of activism ‚Äî I find this is a good proxy for people who care about society and their place in it.
I want my partner to contain multitudes.
I think it's important that no one belief or aspect of your identity should dominate your personality.
Per Walt Whitman
, I find the mark of maturity is the capacity to simultaneously hold a set of beliefs that are apparently contradictory.
I want my partner to value health and fitness.
This is a big part of my life, and it matters a lot to me that we both prioritize living a long, healthy life, for ourselves and as role models for future kids. To me, this looks like abstaining from smoking and addictive drugs, limiting alcohol consumption, and having a lifestyle oriented around being outside and moving your body.
I want my partner to be ambitious.
I actually prefer that it's not in the same way I am. It might be through your career ‚Äî maybe you're a doctor, lawyer, artist, or are trying to effect change in the world through a newsletter you write. I think it's even possible to be ambitious about family. All that matters is that you have a growth-mindset, and happen to the world, rather than letting the world happen to you.
I want my partner to be curious.
I love learning about new things, and I want to share that with my partner. Maybe you value continued education, or read the news every day, or fall down wikipedia rabbit holes regularly. It doesn't matter really how you're curious ‚Äî I just have a hard time relating to people who accept things at face value and don't ask "why?"
I want my partner be well read.
It could be pulp romance; I just think reading says something about your attention span, and demonstrates an interest in engaging with new stories or learning new things.
I want my partner to be Jewish,
but I'm open minded about this. I was not raised to be particularly religious, am not religious now, and don't believe in any conventional definition of God. I have also never adhered to
Halakha
. However,Judaism is important to me for three reasons:
I like the culture. I find the traditions very meaningful, and like that they've persisted over generations.
I found a sense of belonging in the Jewish community, especially in my twenties, and especially in Israel.
I find that this is a good (though imperfect) proxy for a set of ineffable values that matter to me in a partner.
I want my partner to be my partner.
While this may seem tautological, it's important to me that our relationship is a partnership where together we are greater than we are individually. We should contribute different things to the relationship, and support each other in our individual endeavors. We are a team ‚Äî my success is your success, and vice versa. Instead of allowing adversity or conflict to come between us, we approach everything that comes up as
us against the problem
.
About Us
I'm pretty open-minded about where life takes me long-term, so I hope you are too.
Pictures of Me

MY APPEARANCE AND PERSONALITY:

I might not be the most appealing, but I am really kind. I am often told to be nice and calm. I value loyalty and calmness. I like listening to people, but I get very involved if we share passions.

LIFESTYLE:

I don‚Äôt exercise at all, but I‚Äôm looking forward to improving on this. Overall, I am a pretty healthy person. 


WHAT I AM LOOKING FOR:

I am very open on relocating, but my conditions are:
* Not outside Europe
* In a Country that is knowingly open to LGBT people and has good laws for them
* In a city, but not too small
Despite being bisexual, I have a strong preference for cis men and that‚Äôs what I am looking for. I don‚Äôt really have any preferences if not for the fact that, like many girls, I‚Äôd like my partner to be taller than me. I know it‚Äôs hard, but we all have a preference, don‚Äôt we?
I am a bottom and I‚Äôd like to stay in that role. Also, I don‚Äôt like talking about sex too often, nor I am into sexting at all and you can probably forget about exchanging nudes.


YOU SHOULDN‚ÄôT TEXT ME IF:

* You‚Äôre a bottom (I don‚Äôt wanna top at all)
* You‚Äôre from anywhere outside of the EU and/or are considering moving far from the EU
* You‚Äôre very very very sure of having kids
* You like a very confident girl
* You wanna do things too fast
* You just want to talk about sex
* Our age gap is more than 5
* You‚Äôre not looking for something serious and lasting
* You wanna keep your relationship secret
* You wanna keep the relationship only online


YOU‚ÄôRE A PERFECT MATCH IF:
* You‚Äôre taller than me
* You share some of my passions
* All of the ‚ÄúPLEASE DON‚ÄôT TEXT ME IF‚Äù opposites lol

Name: Lisetts
ProfileText:
ÔªøLisette
Female, straight, dominican
(Picture taken Dec..2023)
  

Age: 40  (Nov.83)
Height: 5‚Äô10‚Äú
Location: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
Faith: Agnostic Atheist (raised catholic) 
Children: I don‚Äôt have any, and I‚Äôm open to the idea of having one if I find a partner/husband while I still can.
 A small green rectangle to divide sections of the document 

PERSONALITY
I‚Äôm not shy, but I do feel a bit anxious and awkward around people I don‚Äôt know well. I enjoy being home and just chilling, but I also like to hang out  and travel with friends.
 A small green rectangle to divide sections of the document 

HOBBIES
I am sort of an anxious person so I like to do activities that calm me and don‚Äôt stress me out.
For exercise, I do crossfit 5 days a week and have been practicing japanese ju jitsu for a few months.  I like doing crossfit. I started in 2016 but left during the pandemic and just got back to it a few months ago.
  

When I have time, I like DIYing around my house, trying to make my home more homey and pretty. 
I enjoy hanging out with friends, going out for drinks and/or dinner. I also like spending time at home, just cuddling with my cats, and maybe watching a movie/tv show/youtube  and/or looking up stuff online.
  

I love camping. I enjoy being really close to nature. I like the idea of figuring things out and trying to get by on few things. I‚Äôm not a ‚Äúsurvivalist‚Äù but I like the idea. I prefer camping on the mountains, maybe near a river, but camping on the beach is nice too (as long as it‚Äôs not too hot and there aren‚Äôt swarms of mosquitoes).
  

 A small green rectangle to divide sections of the document 

EDUCATION AND PROFESSION
I have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Advertising and Civil Engineering. I also have a master‚Äôs degree in Education. 
I worked as a teacher for around 10 years (which I loved and found it very fulfilling) but I‚Äôm currently working at my family‚Äôs business which is in construction, as an engineer (site supervisor).
  

 A small green rectangle to divide sections of the document 

WHAT I‚ÄôM LOOKING IN A PARTNER
I‚Äôd like to find someone who:
*  I find funny
*  has a good relationship with his family
* I find attractive
* is nice and empathetic 
* is smart
* is hardworking
* is financially stable
* is tall (I don‚Äôt really care about height that much, but I am very tall so it might be awkward for me to be with someone super short)


Anyways, that‚Äôs all I‚Äôve got for now as far as I can think of. You can reach me at shoplarimar@gmail.com

a date-me-doc, yay!
is this a date-me-doc?!
√ºh-hm.
(means 'yep' with a kind of 'insightful' undertone)
Here I come,
in case there is someone out there silly enough to be strong enough to be my man
üêª‚Äç‚ùÑÔ∏è
(apparently, this means polar bear in some dialects...)
Hallo, hallo. This is K speaking.
(I'll tell you my name later, of course. Even my shoe size. Just not sure how this 'going public with loads of seriously personal' works yet...)
I'd like to start with some controversies, if I may - they should tickle your interest buds, all being well.
And there you go, the first one has just
landed
, and even without intent!
I make up phrases in English sometimes, quite probably because it is my second language. But aren't your interest buds all the merrier now that they know they exist?!
For illustration
(
though, a non-linguistic one
):
photographic evidence of the moment when my nephew and I invented the 'simultaneous reverse swing selfie' 10 years ago.
(I've made the whole sorcery into a 12" video but this site wouldn't... so this is the end frame, as you can tell from the catharsis on our faces.)
alrighty then, on with the controversies...
I love hiking
but hate camping
these two loonies
I wasn't supposed to befriend because
I am allergic to dogs
but I've walked them for a friend with the greatest joy dozens of times
best sound and smell!
aaand I am allergic to dust üò©
I'm creative (in some ways)
and while you might not get the sense instantly, I'll have you know that I've just done an online test and it says it is one of my signature strengths, OK?!
time to get back to the allergies...
I love dogs, horses and cats are OK, too, but if you have any of these living in your house, we'd be in a pickle...
But hey, don't write me down as 'the allergy girl'! I might be lactose intolerant and vegetarian, too, but no hayfever can sweep me off my feet!
Jokes aside (hope you've been having the time of your life so far), I'm a heterosexual female, 178 cm tall and 60 kg, give or take, and an atheist. I turned 40 three months ago, which feels so recent, but if you think about it, that's one Q already... üò∂
I live in London normally (but presently unemployed so sticking it out in a cheaper place) but if a job offer took me to Copenhagen, Stockholm or Amsterdam by any chance, I wouldn't weep my eyes out. (I love bikes and definitely prefer cycling to public transport... but not just for the bike culture, of course!)
I work in project management in the creative industries but I've just completed a short course in environmental sustainability and oh my, there's just so much potential in so many areas of sustainable development! I firmly believe that if anything, technology and science will save humanity from exterminating this planet but there's so much everyone can do! I hope you agree with that and don't let climate despair get the better of you!
I hate waste in any of its forms (materials, time, money, energy....). I wish I had the skills of a chemical engineer to invent more ways to upcycle/recycle waste. Or the powers of a social psychologist to ignite a grassroots movement that would turn overconsumption into something society would end up frowning upon and would eventually lead to global behavioural change... (My folks call me naive at least once a fortnight so it's OK if you think I'm a bit too far into wishful thinking, don't worry.)
Lacking the skills of scientists, though, at least I have a skeleton idea of a dark comedy tv show (in terms of flavour, think of a layered cake of Boat Story, Back to Life, After Life, and, me, of course) that would stick it into the faces of local governments (and the main one) re how much more they could actually do (or try to do) to solve/ease a bunch of social and environmental issues at local levels. We'd be following the stumblings of a 40-something main character who is completely lost on the tracks of self-development (but sane, just kind of driftwood-ish a bit), and circumstances make him/her settle into a small town community, and we watch in awe how these stumblings sometimes turn into brilliant solutions to problems without the main character's slightest awareness of his/her role in them... anyway, I could go on but you'd need to sign an NDA. However, if you have any ties to Two Brothers Pictures or Harry Williams or Jack Williams (the two brothers) or their EAs or their PAs or their postman, get in touch this instant, of course! (Ricky Gervais' management agency I had tried already, the most junior of their junior staff bounced me off in a blink of an eye, albeit, politely üôÇ )
But yeah, if not changing the perception of the population about overconsumption and overproduction, there are still a billion things to try, right?! I did some decluttering a couple of months ago, took crates of items to a market with the intent of donating the proceeds to animal shelters. Luckily, I managed to sell a dozen items or so. Then winter came, the books got soaked right after unpacking one time so I took the whole thing online. I created a website, photographed hundreds of clothes, books, utensils, knick-knacks, and spent ages uploading and describing everything and getting word out on local social media... then 3 books and a cheesegrater got bought. But hey, the intent was there!
Dreaming of having a small abode right by a lake
This spot is my favourite so far but I'm happy to go for an old Scandinavian villa on sale for peanuts with you, to do up while I can swim a lot and make lots of hot beverages for us. Or a Mediterranean little house? With colder drinks?
Are you also scanning social media channels like cheappropertyeurope and such daily? (Ours will have solar panels and a heat pump and all the clever things, OK?)
I asked a friend to describe me as this seems to be a frequent advice re dating profiles... so this is from her (and I am all blushing while typing):
A clever introvert with such integrity but little confidence.
She values tranquility over fanfare but she is all in for adventures and creating memorable experiences.
Keeps lots of her ideas to herself despite being a creative person, possibly due to being afraid (that lack of confidence thing...).
Intelligent, great sense of humour, quick on the uptake but a bit sceptical first about new things. Sometimes it takes a bit of letting guards down but after that she is a truly loyal, trustworthy friend, by your side through thick and thin.
She is monogamous and would go for problem-solving without hesitation rather than throwing it all in way too soon. She expects honesty and loyalty in return as well: once trust is gone, it would be a rocky road winning it back.
The person who will fall for her (who will seriously want to make her happy) will get a most devoted wingman (woman), that's for sure. And the two of them will carry around laughing their heads off, probably. She is such fun when there's no need for walls.
There. Can you believe all that praise?!
Embarrassingly
lovely, isn't she? But she has known me since I was about 3 years old so... üò¨
And you know me a little by now, too, don"t you? - let's get pragmatic and avoid wasting each other's time (if that's the case) because wasting is so insanely stupid.
I guess this aversion to waste accounts for my thriftiness and indecisiveness. For me it takes longer to decide on a purchase or an action plan than for most people - and if you are the kind of clever guy I'm after, it might have already clicked for you that what I'm trying to do with the best intentions is just another form of wasting, i.e. wasting time under the illusion that I'm working out the optimal usage of resources.... üôÉ¬† how dumb, huh?! If you'd found me out, get in touch by all means. I could definitely welcome someone in my life who catches me out when I should be. And the best would be if you were patient and easy-going, too. Or just patient.
I don't seem to be attracted to men with long hair and I am not keen on facial hair, either (I have a theory that circa 98.7% of men sporting a beard or a moustache would look incomparably more handsome without them. There's such a tiny segment of the male population who might actually benefit from growing facial hair that I could almost elevate this theory into a general rule. But I won't, cause I respect the rights of those 1,214 men to attractiveness.).
I prefer not being taller, stronger, faster, fitter or heavier than my man.
I'm not planning on having kids so it would be great if you didn't have/want any, either.
I guess I am just writing this whole novella because I wonder if there's a chance after you have already lived half of your life to find someone who can add kindness and smiles to the remaining years while you want to add the same to theirs because you both understand how precious companionship actually is. Just looking for a team mate (whom I quite fancy), I reckon.
You don't need to be a dashing prince with wealth or have a great sense of style but as long as your sense of humour is ace and you like to fool around while also being aware that no relationship can get far without respect or honesty and that maintenance on it will most probably be needed along the way, too, we could be in for something.
Be old enough to know that you carry the responsibility for all you do and say but young enough to still want to venture out there and enjoy tomfoolery. (38-46 would cover that, you think?)
birthday present
loved it! (I mean, I didn't get the plane...)
good to become friends
with strangers who bring your food
didn't get this aircraft, either
but maaan, holding out your phone on a trike for a photo when there's absolutely nothing underneath is a thrill!
a full body shot
is probably also expected... Serious face was art director's doing. Location global fashion giant's choice.
Reach me via this email if any of the above resonates
seno.radsky@gmail.com

Name: Tanner
ProfileText:
ÔªøTanner‚Äôs Date Me Doc 
Read on, rock on, and let me know if you want to connect! I am looking for my fellow beautiful nerd!
Name & pronouns: Tanner, he/him
Age: 40 Height: 5'9" / 175cm
Living Location: Groningen, Netherlands; American born and raised in the United States
Studies: BSc in Psychology, MSc in Environmental Psychology
Orientation: Straight, looking for a woman aka spirit-animal level
Relationship type: Monogamous/ish (I‚Äôd like to establish an outstanding relationship with a partner prior to adding the complexity of a third party), I would like to raise kids with a partner and starting this process at the same time going on that particular adventure together, looking for the right partner to do life with.  

    
My life as a film logline: A romantic adventure about a guy (40) who worked in IT, tv/film, and finally finished 4 intense years of university (psychology), now seeking to find a forever partner in this beautiful wide world.
Hobbies: learning the mandolin, learning Dutch, lindy hop swing dancing, independent films, long-distance cycling trips, hiking, skiing, writing, personal development, scuba diving, community organizing, improv, reading, writing.
My personality traits using HEXACO, which has the most validity and reliability of such psychological assessments, is Openness 96%, Conscientious 98%, Extraversion 96%, Agreeableness 95%, Emotional Stability 97%, Honesty-Humility 96%; all of these percentiles are plotted relative to a normal distribution.
________________


Friends/Colleagues/People I Know
Hello beautiful people whom I already have the pleasure of knowing. If you are worried about ‚Äúruining the friendship,‚Äù I can promise with very high confidence that won‚Äôt happen. If you‚Äôre worried about looking foolish if you try and we do not click, I can also promise that I‚Äôll always have nothing but respect for people who show vulnerability to reveal who they really are.




  
  

About Me
I was born in a small town near the border of Utah but located in Colorado (US citizen, US passport). Losing myself in nature came natural to me as a child, exploring the thin air at the tops of mountains, the lush forest, and the arid badlands; losing myself in nature continues to be a lifelong love of mine. It took me some time to rediscover my bliss compass and how to use it, but once I learned (including via cognitive behavior therapy i.e., talk therapy), it opened me up. It took me on my own hero‚Äôs journey where I left the world of IT and my self-imposed invisible retaining wall, and opened myself up to vulnerability and intimacy with others. I explored storytelling and storymaking, working in Los Angeles in tv and film. I served, near the Aegean Sea, the needs of people fleeing war and hardship in refugee camps. Then I relocated to the Netherlands and returned to university dedicated to becoming a psychologist so that I could use that knowledge to help people in relation to our greatest societal challenges, earning a BSc in Psychology and MSc in Environmental Psychology. Along all these journeys I learned to be open, to try everything, to say yes, to embrace uncertainty (most of the time), and to be intimately attentive and responsive to my intuition.
In each stage of my journey, it became increasingly important that I understand the problems and sufferings of people and more-than-humans so that I can do what I excel at‚Ä¶bring very different people together and co-develop and bring about solutions to these consequential problems. I once heard a quote that ‚Äúone must save themselves before they can save the world.‚Äù
I‚Äôve always been a late bloomer (or felt like I was a late bloomer). Late to learn to tie my shoes; try alcohol; achieve the death of my ego; have the feeling of falling in love; going on the university journey, embracing the beauty of my own body; deciding I want a forever partner (note: I‚Äôve never been married); deciding I want to raise a family (note: I have no children). And as a luminous late bloomer, I am using this time to find my beautiful other.
I have a great amount of genuine curiosity about the world and about people. As such, I discover many incredible beautiful souls and I like nothing more than bringing all of these extraordinary humans together so they can also fall in love with each other. I am a natural bringer-together of people. Example, the JamesWebbSpaceTelescope group where we have dinner parties and discuss the beauties and properties of the universe while reviewing the latest awe-inspiring imagery coming from the telescope (of the cosmos), with attending explanations of the image content. Recently I kicked off a book club focused on The Artist Way (by Julia Cameron) where we share our thoughts, feelings, challenges, and difficulties together as we complete the workbook.
I am an empath, loving, affectionate, careful, and honest. I love to dance and most recently am taking lindy hop lessons. So long as I can be verbally and artistically expressive, I am full of glee, kicking off the covers in the morning and dancing my way through life :) I am a deep listener, present, communicative, and I‚Äôm told I give extraordinarily good hugs. I adore deep conversations and love the unfolding of all manner of topics, experiences, and reflections in creative-flow conversation.
It is important that I live congruently with my values; I‚Äôm going full vegan this year (2024) as it is important to me I do not cause harm to other creatures and that I live within the planetary boundaries. I now know too much about the reality of this moment so I am prompted to action. While I am a scientist I am also an artist and am spiritual. I am spiritual in the sense of feeling and reflecting on the fact that I am but one output of the universe, made of atoms that have their own lineage of existence; I explore, ponder, and rejoice regarding my own connection with the cosmos. 
  
  





How I Sing the Song of the Universe
I am involved with practical transformations of society to achieve an existence of humanity within the planetary boundaries (e.g., depart from neoliberal economics for thrivenomics?), equality, and justice for all, while also caretaking for the more-than-human creatures. In my profession and as a hobby, I build communities. Professionally, I co-run a non-profit non-extractive consultancy that conducts research, drafts scientific-literature-based interventions, and performs project management of transition projects, all regenerative, to achieve societies that thrive within the planetary boundaries. As mentioned earlier, I used to work in IT where I would bring all the stakeholders and team members together to achieve alignment in succeeding or failing at achieving our goal as a team. With my shiny new MSc in Environmental Psychology, I do something similar but in relation to helping to move our societies into the safe/thriving zone regarding social services and planetary resources i.e., the safe and just space of the Doughnut Economics model.
I also volunteer for causes that I see as virtuous, currently with Extinction Rebellion, Scientist Rebellion, Scientist4Future, and community organizer for local regenerative non-extractive food growing/consumption. Before that I volunteered with a community theater, political organizing, Make a Wish foundation, and refugee camp aid volunteer/emergency responder.
My core values are:
* generosity
* honesty/transparency
* empathy
* joy/bliss
* deep listening/presence
* interdependence 
* being in the moment
* Playfulness
Here are some visuals that are ever constant in my world:    


________________
  
  
  

  
  
  











The traits I am looking for in a partner:
I would love to find a special someone who is:
1. Kind to others, compassionate, empathetic, interdependent approach, authentic, curious, interested and motivated ‚Äì someone who ranks high on emotional intelligence and goes out of there way for meaningful exchange; let‚Äôs their curiosity lead them to investigate/research, pursues interests, is proactive bliss motivated rather than fear pushed.
2. Warm, joyful, silly, playful - someone who radiates warmth, love, and joy; who has a playful sense of humor and doesn't take themselves too seriously; who finds joy in connection and in making others feel good about themselves.
3. Impact driven ‚Äì take notice of societal issues and takes action to bend the needle of the moment  in the direction of the good and just; a person who acts congruent with their well-defined values; who does meaningful work congruent with those values, and that they feel good about their efforts (either professionally or as a volunteer or donor or as a side project).
I am quite active, flowing through life and trying out all the entrees. In sport (fencing, snowboarding, marathons, etc.), in art (improv, dancing, mandolin-learning, etc.), and I guess I‚Äôd call it ‚Äúexploring‚Äù (volunteering, long cycling trips, hiking, top rope climbing, scuba diving, etc.). Additionally, I spend a great share of my time with loved ones (friends, family, and I hope soon a partner); with romantic relationships I am quite physically affectionate (as a psychologist, I thought I‚Äôd mention that my attachment style is secure attachment). I think I would be well matched with another who correlates with a good deal of the above. I am looking for one also marriage-minded/forever partner and I am also keen to raise a family.
I‚Äôd love to create a partnership that is rooted in mutual consideration and support, is embedded in community regeneration, and is full of emotional and physical affection. 


Want to connect? 
I‚Äôd love to hear from you! Email me at datingtanner@proton.me. You definitely don't need to have your own date me doc, but it would probably be helpful to include a bit about     yourself, some photos, and what made you want to reach out! *The cat below isn‚Äôt mine ;)
________________
  
  



















________________


Bonus
Wow, you are thorough! In the merrymaking of being thorough and transparent, I should mention that I utilized a fair bit of formatting and some content from the following sources:
Date me. Daystar Eld. (2023, October 19). https://daystareld.com/blog/date-me/
Stephanie. (n.d.). Stephanie‚Äôs date me doc. Google Docs. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EBqqElL1ZOEQ2tI7bu5X_vNdlmmkt5eFJ4jzepMKecM/edit


If you are also interested in creating a Date Me page, then here are two resources to aid you in your journey. I wish you well.
https://dateme.directory/

The last debate question is, ‚ÄúWill you marry the one you love?‚ÄùPlease attach your answer to my email.
At a glance: 
* 24 years old
* 5‚Äô3‚Äô‚Äô(162cm),48KG
* Born & raised near Hainan and Guangdong(South of China)Im Chinese
* not religious
* Reasonably fit & athletic
* BS. in Nursing from Shandong University of Traditional Chinese Medicine
* Female
* I experienced a motorcycle accident as a child and I have a scar on my forehead
* No smoke, No AlcoholÔºå No drugs(When I drink, my face gets very red and my skin gets rashes. Im intolerant to alcohol, but I can drink occasionally)
* English, Cantonese, Mandarin (I am willing to learn any language. I studied French for a while, but I didn‚Äôt stick with it for too long)
* Love animals(cats&dogs or any animals except snakes&worms)
Core values:
* Humor, although I don‚Äôt understand the humor of different cultures
* friendly
* Kindness
* Open-mindedness
* generous
* optimistic(doubtÔºümaybe general..)


My Hobbies:
* Work till death(ü§£Sorry,but reality,Just kidding)
* Hiking
* Reading on Business and Finance/Medical ..(I rarely buy financial products, the stock market in China is too badü•≤)
* Watching some TV series
ÔºàFantasy themesÔºå such as Lord of the Rings, Vampires and Magic etc. 
Or comedy/ Korean romance TV series/ suspense and horror films
I don't follow Marvel heroes üòÖ)
* Fishing(when I was young, I used to like it)


My dream(Why I choose NursingÔºâÔºö
1. Maybe it‚Äôs influenced by my family. Some of my family members are doctors and nurses, so I also like these professions.
2. I hope that with my help my patients can recoverÔºàSometimes I feel sad, buz I have more opportunities to be exposed to negative emotions in the hospitalÔºâ
3. Travel the world !!!(Maybe the wrong choice I chose nursing,Less Time?)
4. Happy life with my loving  job & lover(Family~)
Its simple also hard‚Ä¶..
What I‚Äôm Looking For A Man who has(in no particular order)
A Man who advocates monogamyÔºå aged 23-30, wants kids.
1. Honesty and Transparency: A partner who values honesty and transparency is able to communicate openly and build mutual trust.
2. Loyalty and Reliability: Expect partners to be loyal and reliable, to fulfill his commitments, and to build a stable relationship.
3. Respect and understanding: Find a partner who respects me and understands my needs and feelings.
4. Communication Skills: Value a partner who has good communication skills and is able to listen and express his feelings.
5. Shared Values: Making sure me and my partner agree on important values and goals can help build a long-lasting relationship.
6. Emotionally mature: Looking for an emotionally mature partner who can handle problems rationally and never give up easily.
7. Self-awareness and growth: Prefer a partner with self-awareness and a willingness to grow together so that we can better face changes in life.
8. Responsibility: Expect partners to be responsible, responsible for his own actions, and willing to work toward common goals.
9. Supportiveness: Find a partner who can support your personal and professional growth and work together to achieve both of your dreams.
10. I want kids, maybe one or two, also depending on my future partner‚Äôs opinions.


I know these qualities are rare and hard to achieve, but I will try to keep my promise to love & care for each other.
I also have some expectations for the location, maybe the UK/Australia/USA (because of my career plan), if you have a better choice or advice, kindly feel free to contact me.


My personal experience (including relationship experience)
* Life experience
 I was born in Hainan Province, an island in the southest of China. I have lived with my maternal grandparents since I was a child. Later, I moved to several places to study in primary school, junior high school, and university. In fact, I am a person who likes stability, but I am also willing to accept new things and cultures.
Hainan‚ÜíGuangdong‚ÜíHainan‚ÜíShandong‚ÜíGuangdong(Shenzhen)
          (aged0-5)     (6-14?)    (15-18)   (19-23)       (2022Work as nurse till now)    


Every time I visit a new city, the only things that interest me are food and museums. I really like to eat a lot of delicious food with my lover or do things that interest both of us.  
* Future Plan
During the three years since the epidemic, China has had many strict epidemic prevention policies. I can‚Äôt go to many places. I‚Äôm under a lot of pressure after work, and I don‚Äôt have enough free time to go to far places, such as going abroad. Therefore, I decided to prepare my registration abroad to look for opportunities. I will not return to work in China for the next 20 years, or forever.


* Relationship experience


My first and only boyfriend till now who I met in college was a Muslim. I was hurt a lot in this relationship, and I reflected on how I should be myself and what kind of person I really am. I was emotionally unstable for a long time. I was going through a hard time and couldn't forgive the people who hurt me.I can't forgive the person who lie to me.


I know I have shortcomings and I try to improve them. My support system is limited. I have fewer friends. Many times I will rely on my partner to give me more emotional support. I will try to make more friends and learn to be happy alone.
Just keep no lies.
* Love& Sex idea
I think love means trusting each other, supporting each other, accompanying and growing together. I always ask myself or my future partner, why do you love me? I'm still searching till now.
I'm open-minded except for anal sex.


What I'm afraid ofÔºàI hate/ strange habitsÔºâ
* Darkness(I mean stay alone in the darkness.)
The side effects of watching too many zombie movies as a childüò¨.
* follow religion strictly. (Hell no, I like freedom more now because of the bad experience from my last relationship,I don‚Äôt reject religion, I just can‚Äôt abide by the rules too strictlyÔºâ
* Cheat on me (No lies pls)
* Taking pictures(No worries, I will upload my pictures soon..ÔºåONE MORE WEEK)
* I don't play any games, I just not good at them.
* I have been in platonic online dating for three years (failure case) and I will try to end the long-distance relationship, I will try to meet you.
* Sometimes I become talkative
* Don't ask me to write letters of recommendation when we are done, I haven't learned how to be a friend with ex yet.
 ‚Ä¶etc, I'm not sure
