Name: Sheena
ProfileText:
ÔªøSheena ‚Äì 42 ‚Äì F ‚Äì Bi ‚Äì Seattle, WA ‚Äì 5‚Äô4‚Äù ‚Äì Has a kid ‚Äì Non-smoker ‚Äì Non-drinker
INTRO PHOTOS & VIDEOS
  

Disneyland with my Baby Girl - Dec 23, 2024
  

















  June 10, 2024
  
 
2023 Thomas Dambo Troll Photos   
  

VIDEO LINKS
Video: Salsa Dancing in Fresno, CA - 11/4/2023


Video: Singing with my Favorite Karaoke Partner - 6/9/2010
WHO I AM (DEEPLY)


I‚Äôve got really good energy.  I am driven by love and a strong desire for deep connections.  In my life, I care the most about relationships and personal growth.  I‚Äôm authentic, easy-going and highly capable.  I‚Äôm a kind and happy person with a lot of love to give, but I just haven‚Äôt come across the right person for me yet.  Maybe I‚Äôll get lucky and this document will reach someone whose soul matches mine. üôÇ


In hopes of finding someone highly compatible to me, here are the things that most describe the essence of who I am from the inside out: 
 
I FEEL ‚Äì I am emotional and tactile, so I‚Äôm all about feeling.
 
EMOTIONS: I feel intensely, and I LOVE it.  I‚Äôm the kind of person that will certainly risk having my heart shattered in order to feel the depths of what love has to offer rather than to avoid emotional pain at all costs.  I am definitely NOT avoidant, and though I feel so much, I am extremely resilient.  There‚Äôs a confidence that comes from being able to trust in how you feel and not become so easily confused by your own conflicting emotions; to still be able to know where you truly stand despite being pulled in many different directions.  I am very emotionally intelligent and I‚Äôm looking for the same in a partner - this is the realm where I need to be matched with someone, first and foremost.
 
SENSORY: As a kid I was always pretty athletic, probably because I‚Äôm more of a tactile learner.  I‚Äôm hands-on and handy because of it.  For most things, even as a beginner I would do pretty well initially because of translatable skills.  Even if I‚Äôm not fully cognizant of a connection, I can rely on having good muscle memory.  I feel alive when I get to connect through my body.  I partner-dance.  Merely saying that I do it is a gross understatement.  When I dance with another, I access my deepest self ‚Äì lost in the emotion of the music and the energy exchange between two people willing to meet at the same place.  When I dance with others, I‚Äôm in another world.  


I CONNECT
 
I was the love child, so my initial purpose was to keep my parents connected, especially through long periods of separation (my dad was in the Navy and my parents immigrated here from the Philippines).  I was, hence, born to connect, and it‚Äôs a major component of who I am.  Clearly, I like to connect on the dance floor, but really, I‚Äôm open to connecting anywhere.  I‚Äôve never been a fan of small-talk; I much prefer a deeper connection.  I am open and vulnerable; unabashedly myself, because I‚Äôm not afraid to be seen.  Hell, I WANT to be seen.  I want to really know a person on a soul-level and vice versa.  I live for that level of connection; that degree of intimacy.  I‚Äôm an extrovert so shared experiences are what I enjoy most in life, and I long to bare and share my soul with someone I know that I can trust to be responsible with me because they already practice accountability.  This is another extremely important characteristic that I need to be matched in when it comes to partnership.
 
 
I DO
 
I‚Äôm a doer.  My primary love language is Acts of Service (followed by Quality Time and Physical Touch).  For me (and to me) actions do speak louder than words, though I‚Äôm not frivolous with my words ‚Äì I care about accuracy, so what I say and what I do are indeed in alignment.  As I mentioned before, I‚Äôm handy and that‚Äôs because I like to do things and enjoy learning to do things.  I have a problem-solving mind that supports my desire and ability to do the things.  I‚Äôm incredibly capable and very willing.  There‚Äôs almost nothing I won‚Äôt do for the people that I love, for I am an Enneagram Type Two ‚Äì The Helper.  I don‚Äôt half-ass; I give it everything I‚Äôve got. It‚Äôs the only way I know to ‚Äúdo‚Äù; it‚Äôs the only way I know to be.
 
 
I GROW
 
Personal growth has always been important to me.  I grow fast because I keep in-check the biggest obstacle to this ‚Äì myself.  I‚Äôm incredibly self-aware.  Because I‚Äôm very honest with myself and have a problem-solving mind, I‚Äôve been able to figure myself out all along the way.  It also helps that I‚Äôm a good listener and I consider; everything.  Even if I don‚Äôt agree with something, I still consider what might be useful nonetheless.  I‚Äôm open-minded and a bit unconventional at times.  I seek truth and meaning on my own terms.  Because I connect, I‚Äôm good at putting things together, and with my heart as my trusty compass, armed with emotional intelligence, I Learn, and because I learn, I Grow.
 
Sadly, this is the realm where I find that I keep running into incompatibility in relationships.  As I‚Äôve just written this last paragraph above, I‚Äôm now seeing how many of my natural skills and abilities come together to make personal growth almost seem easy for me.  At times I‚Äôve encountered feelings of jealousy, intimidation or competitiveness around this because understanding myself well enough to grow effectively has ultimately given me confidence in my own self-worth ‚Äì so those who don‚Äôt harbor as high of a level of self-worth within themselves tend to find some issue with me. 
 
It wasn‚Äôt until I turned 40 that I realized that the roots of my pattern of ending up partnered with people with low self-worth lay in my familial relationships ‚Äì primarily that of my father and my sister (so much for being a quick-learner! Lol!ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è).  I‚Äôve been conditioned, since I was young, to make accommodations for their inability or disinterest in growing when it comes to emotional intelligence; expected to ‚Äúbe the bigger person‚Äù and just accept that they love me, even though my feelings would never get a voice or consideration.  As a result, emotional invalidation is my biggest trigger, but now it‚Äôs also become a clear indicator to me that a person may be lacking in self-worth.
 
I‚Äôve been duped by partners who say they are just as interested in personal growth, but lack the self-awareness to fully achieve it (clearly another absolutely necessary characteristic for someone to be well-matched with me).  I guess, deep down, I must have been wanting to step up to this battle, time and time again, hoping that I may prevail for once; effect change and rewrite the ending to the story.  Now that I am armed with this deep understanding as to why I‚Äôve invited this energy into my life for so long, I‚Äôm finally ready to break the cycle and change the course of my relationship-fate.  I don‚Äôt need to fight this fight anymore.  If someone feels threatened in any way by my own sense of self-worth, I cannot trade any of my own in order to bolster theirs.  Though it is my nature to try to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù and I am more-than-willing to sacrifice in the name of love, I can‚Äôt fight someone else‚Äôs own personal battles for them.  
 
 
I‚ÄôM HERE
 
I am uncannily present.  It makes connection easy with me, and you can feel the difference when you dance with me or if you‚Äôve experienced deep friendship with me.  Relationships mean more to me than anything else in life, and because actions speak louder than words, I am astoundingly reliable.  Since I‚Äôm honest with myself, I‚Äôm also honest with others in what I can or can‚Äôt handle, and hence, have a pretty high success rate of showing up when I‚Äôm supposed to/needed.  I‚Äôm easy going and adaptable if things need to change on the fly.  I‚Äôm typically not attached to outcomes; just care to be there in any way I can.  I just really care.  When I serve my community, I feel alive and often seem to be in constant motion.  I definitely don‚Äôt sleep enough.  Because I‚Äôm extroverted, I find more within me when I have someone to be there for, and I‚Äôd rather be alive than asleep.  My soul is fully awake and I live in the now.  I don‚Äôt dwell on the past; I learn from it.  I don‚Äôt expend my energy worrying about the 'what ifs‚Äô of the future.  Instead, I try to make the now count as much as possible toward the future.  I am fully present and ready to engage.
 
 
I AM READY
 
I know what it means to be ready.  Since my very first serious relationship ended in 2005, I felt ‚Äúready‚Äù to have a kid.  Becoming a mother was, after all, the only thing I‚Äôve always known that I wanted in life, but even though I felt ready at the time, I kept waiting for the right person.  After 15 years of hoping that the right relationship would come along, I felt like I couldn‚Äôt wait any longer so I set out to do it myself.  I found a great donor and impregnated myself at the age of 37 via a diva cup and an inversion table (I told you I was unconventional).  I. Was. Ready; ready to feel my body throughout the changes over the next nine months and ready to feel every bit of what it takes to bring life into the world.  Perhaps because I was so ready and intentional about it, it worked on the first try and I got the baby girl I‚Äôd always wanted!  My wonderful daughter is now three years old.
 
I‚Äôm strong, emotionally and physically.  I‚Äôd like to say mentally, but I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôve really tested that (I‚Äôm a fan of Survivor, so it gives a different perspective on what being mentally strong looks like).  Because I‚Äôm hands-on, I want to stay strong for my daughter, so I go to the gym.  I want to keep myself ready to remain fully engaged in her growth and development.  She is at the heart of who I am and everything I do, but I still have more love to give.  After fulfilling my own dream and ensuring that I could have my child on my own terms, I am now even more ready for partnership.
 
I‚Äôm made for partnership.  I‚Äôm a team player and I am conscientious and intentional about working toward the longevity and sustainability of a relationship.  I have the good sense (and experience) to understand the ramifications of struggling in a partnership where you are ill-matched, and I now understand that even though on a soul level you can feel like someone is your person, it doesn‚Äôt work if you‚Äôre not both ready at the same time.  I need someone who‚Äôs ready to BE a partner; ready to be THE partner; AND ready for family life.  It‚Äôs the final criteria in the list of characteristics that I need to be matched in.  Without all four of these things, a partnership is not likely to work, for either of us.
 
I am ready for a true teammate; ready to talk about all the things: past relationships, individual journeys, deepest desires, bucket lists, family, adulting, parenting, keeping the flame alive, conflict resolution, the inevitable failing of health, etc.  I am ready to devote myself and plan for a future where we can support each other and grow together.  I‚Äôm ready to prioritize the family that we create whether we build it, meld it, or merely sustain what we have.  At the moment, having another child is still potentially viable for me if it‚Äôs in the stars, and that works for me regardless of whether I‚Äôm paired up with a man or a woman.  I am open to doing it all over again in a loving, supportive partnership.  Of course, there is an expiration date on the possibility for me to conceive again, but fortunately, not in regard to a relationship.  I waited 15 years to have my child and I‚Äôm willing to wait as long as it takes for the right person in partnership, if there is indeed a true match out there for me.
 
I have practiced being in relationship.  I have practiced living with others.  I have practiced being there.  I have practiced stepping up.  I have practiced nobility.  I have practiced giving.  I have practiced enduring.  I have practiced letting go.  I have practiced growing.  I have practiced resilience.   I have practiced humility.  I have practiced humanity.  I have practiced loving with all of my heart.  


I have practiced being the type of partner that I want to have.  Now I‚Äôm ready to welcome the right person into my daughter‚Äôs and my life.
 
I am ready to be met.




If who I am resonates with who you are, then let‚Äôs connect to see if we are well-matched and if there‚Äôs a spark.  If you‚Äôd like to first know more about me and start becoming acquainted, the best way to reach me is at sheeniebeenie@gmail.com.  If you found me through OKC and want to send me an intro, then please start it with ‚ÄúMy, oh, my‚Äù, although, because I don‚Äôt pay, the message may easily become lost in the ethers. 


Thanks for taking the time to learn about me.  Even if we‚Äôre not a match, I wish you the best of luck on your own Date Me Doc search.  And if you happen to know anyone in your circle that I may be a good fit for, please feel free to send them the link to this doc.  




With Gratitude,
Sheena
WHO I AM (ON THE SURFACE)


Body:  Naturally athletic build with a little more muscle when I can lift weights regularly; Pierced ears only; No tattoos; No perfume, just deodorant.  


Attire:  Generally I‚Äôm ‚ÄúSporty Spice‚Äù and you‚Äôll find me in leggings and a tank top.  I‚Äôll glam up for dancing and special events. I don‚Äôt typically wear much jewelry.  I like to dress the part for whatever role I‚Äôm in.  


Temperament:  Flexible/Adaptable; Cheerful; Optimistic; Expressive; a bit Shy with new people/situations; Serious; Extroverted;  Emotionally Intense


Diet:  Gluten-Free because of Hashimoto's Thyroiditis; Possible Super Taster - strongly averse to bitter tastes; Sweet Tooth; Carnivore; Not a huge fan of Seafood; It‚Äôs embarrassing how much of a spice wimp I am; I try to eat Organic and choose healthier options, but if left to my own devices, I may just survive off of cereal. 


Tendencies:  Night Owl (with poor sleep hygiene); Forthcoming; Responder (not an Initiator); Sporadic; Road Dog


Hobbies/Interests:  Partner Dancing, especially Bachata, Salsa & Kizomba; Puzzles (Jigsaw, Sudoku, Crossword); Climbing; Hiking; Pool; Rollerblading; Scuba Diving; Weight-Lifting; Cycling; Spades 


Occupation:  Office Manager for a Pharmacy Temp Agency since 2013


Family:  Divorced Immigrant Parents; ‚ÄúIrish-Twin‚Äù Brother; Estranged Sister; Long-Awaited, Intentionally-Created Daughter


Religion:  Spiritual


Personality Test Results:  
* Myers-Briggs = ESFP
* Enneagram #2 ‚ÄúHelper‚Äù
* OCEAN = 44% / 71% / 52% / 85% / 2% 






WHAT I‚ÄôM LOOKING FOR


* Highly Compatible Life Partner
* Family-Focused Prioritization
* As spelled out in ‚ÄúWho I Am‚Äù section, must be:
   * Emotionally Intelligent
   * Self-Aware
   * Accountable
   * Ready for Partnership
* What I am looking for in a partner
Astrological Natal Chart  


Pictures from Pre-Mom Days (all 2020)

Name: River
Location: NYC, San Francisco Bay Area, DC
ProfileText:
ÔªøBasics
* 39, AMAB, 5‚Äô10‚Äù, ~148 pounds
* Looking for a primary partner, female or nonbinary AFAB, 22-50yo


About Me
* Two years into a software engineering career
* Currently doing a nationwide job search while splitting my time between the DC and bay areas, open to moving to other cities
* Major life goal right now is financial independence - I want to have the option to not work for money and not worry about how I will pay for things
* My past relationships have been polyamorous, and I have a mild preference for continuing that pattern. I am currently single, so this is negotiable.
* Ideologically pro-natalist and interested in having kids myself
* Vegetarian non-smoker non-drinker Atheist
* Past lives:
   * Grew up in the Washington, DC area, and have always lived on the east coast ranging between New York and Charlottesville, VA
   * I used to be a full-time tutor. I got to go to all the houses and meet all the pets. The kids were nice too.
   * I used to be a free speech lawyer. Happy to talk constitutional law, but understand that nothing I say is ever legal advice.

32 | female | 5‚Äô5‚Äù | Atlanta, GA (location agnostic) | seeking camaraderie & companionship

The Essentials  
On a mission to build community with other open-minded, interesting individuals


Always asking questions, endlessly curious


Being resourceful and interdisciplinary, enjoy drawing from multiple domains to solve problems, embracing epistemic humility


Prioritize considerations of harm/care above other moral foundations like ingroup, authority, or sanctity  
Prefer people that are kind rather than nice. Nice is telling me what I want to hear; kind is telling me what I need to hear. The former prioritizes keeping the peace while the latter prioritizes growth and accountability.


More of a slow burner than a spark chaser. I like to establish a strong foundation of friendship and get to know someone well prior to anything else


Love to laugh. My sense of humor can be characterized as witty, punny, and/or eccentric

The Nice-to-Haves  
Intrigued by both the arts and sciences: Consilience is a personal life philosophy, along with Sagan‚Äôs ‚ÄúPale Blue Dot‚Äù


Growth mindset: Person in progress, perpetually in beta, like to learn by trial and error, constantly iterating

Cook most meals at home, albeit to manage disease symptoms and with a limited repertoire

Open to children and adoption, strong nurturing instincts

Healing from trauma related to medical gaslighting, neglect, & abuse


Predominantly secure attachment style but can display anxious traits, such as trouble advocating for myself and voicing needs and limitations during bouts of severe illness

I can say that I am really want to find this kind of true love we can read about in the books, when your family is your world and beloved is trying to be protective, supportive and kind for each other. Luckily, I grew up in that kind of happy family, so I understand what I'm trying to find.

Name: Ariane
ProfileText:
Ôªøf  


Hey, I‚Äôm Ariane, a 43-year-old singer-songwriter and author. Don‚Äôt get ideas, I‚Äôm not swimming in a bath of cash like Taylor Swift and JK Rowling, though watch this space.


I live in East London: breathtaking sights I have seen here include a man throwing up in a bin, and a grotty sofa which seems to have permanent residency, which I have dubbed the Sofa of Shame. I bet you can‚Äôt wait to visit my area. This isn‚Äôt a euphemism.


I‚Äôd like to date someone aged 35 to 55 who is kind, funny, honest, respectful, smart and communicative and doesn‚Äôt throw up in bins.


It would be great if you‚Äôre tolerant of grumpy teenagers, as my professionally sarcastic daughter turns 13 this year. She is currently majoring in eye rolls, sighs and slammed doors. She is also super-smart, hilarious and very sweet. I see her 50% of the time; the other 50% she‚Äôs with her dad and stepmum.


Things I enjoy: witty repartee, long conversations, jokes, reading the papers, reading fiction, self-development books, Apple Fitness+ and Apple products, tea in bed, walks, coffee shops, cinema, comedy gigs, interior design, meditation, hanging out with friends, and yoga (I have mastered the fine art of not farting during classes).


As you can see from the blurry photo below, taken today, I‚Äôm currently slightly plus-size (yes, this is a nice way of saying fatty boom boom) though my New Year‚Äôs resolution is to lose all the weight. In mitigation, I have a pretty face, which will look all sad if you don‚Äôt want to date me because I‚Äôm temporarily horizontally-challenged.


  



I‚Äôm 5‚Äô2‚Äù and mixed race (half-Persian, half-American). My daughter looks white, so I call her my Secret Asian. I‚Äôm a Londoner but also hold US citizenship, so I get to vote against Trump this year, which will be the best vote I ever cast. I‚Äôm monogamous. I‚Äôm also cis (she/her), an atheist, liberal, and an LGBT+ ally. I have several amazingly kind and funny close friends, both female and male, and an exciting, busy and fulfilling life. I‚Äôm just missing someone lovely to share it with.


I‚Äôm intelligent (Countdown champion and Brainteaser winner), amusing (if you don‚Äôt think so by now, there is no hope for me!), creative, ambitious, and this all feels like blowing my own trumpet (speaking of which, I play five instruments but that isn‚Äôt one of them). I have my own Wikipedia entry but still want to achieve much more, including a number 1 pop album under my artist name Ariane X. I‚Äôm signed to a tiny record label and am releasing my debut album Better in July 2024. I absolutely can‚Äôt wait as I‚Äôve wanted to be a pop star since I was 12 years old. Yes, I‚Äôve left it a bit late.


I tend to like people who are thoughtful, creative, kind, funny, interesting and interested in others, good listeners but also willing to open up. Communication is really important to me - ideally we‚Äôd text a lot, but I‚Äôll allow you breaks to go to the toilet. (This is a joke! Do not screenshot it and post it on Twitter with the red flag emoji.)


One of the nicest things about life is unexpected pleasant surprises, so if I intrigue you then do get in touch. I start my day by completing every single New York Times puzzle: maybe you‚Äôd like to do them with me? 


ariane.sherine@gmail.com / Twitter: @ArianeSherine

Name: Kay Day
ProfileText:
ÔªøAbout me üôÇ


Hi there, a little bit about me and what I‚Äôm looking for üôÇ; I‚Äôm an entrepreneur and have been creating and developing businesses for 15 years. I successfully exited one 3 years ago and took a break but I‚Äôm now working on a new exciting project in tech. 


I‚Äôve been single for 5 years and tbh I‚Äôve been ready to date and get to know someone for a while now but I value quality over quantity so I‚Äôm staying single until the right man comes along. 


I‚Äôm also a massive introvert so I‚Äôd rather stay at home than go on endless,meaningless dates. 


So, what do I value? My family, my health, honesty and being a great communicator. I‚Äôm looking for a man aged 40-55, although that‚Äôs not a deal breaker, I want to meet someone who‚Äôs smart, ambitious, also a dad, mature in life and love, and most importantly someone who can be my best friend as well. If you still watch Only Fools and Horses you get bonus points.


I go on hikes in Dorset, and workout 4-5 times a week so ideally want to meet someone who also takes care of their body and is active ‚ò∫Ô∏è


Key facts:


* 5‚Äô2
* Fluent English and learning Chinese 
* I‚Äôm looking for a life partner
* I am a nurturer 
* I have a 13 year old son at home, the other 3 have left home for higher education and work
* I can cook very well and I‚Äôm not a fussy eater
* Not religious 
* I love being by the sea 
* I enjoy watching documentaries on wild life and the Roman Empire 
* I‚Äôm the oldest of 3
* I‚Äôm based in Berkshire

Name: Scott
ProfileText:
ÔªøBasics
Gender: M
Age: 33
Looking to Date: F
Open to: Long term, short term, friends
Location: San Francisco (south beach)
Height: 6‚Äô
This Doc Created: Dec 30, 2023
Me


  
  
  
  



Date me doc that my ex made for me after we broke up about 1.5yr ago (she wants kids and I don‚Äôt)
Life
I grew up in Berkeley, Ca, and if you listen very carefully you can still hear the granola crunch. Until recently, I‚Äôve always lived in co-ops and group houses (5+ people), and really love most things about group living. I recently moved to my own place, but still value this sort of community and try to stay involved with group houses where I‚Äôve lived in the past.


I really like being active outdoors. In the past that‚Äôs involved a lot of cycling, especially mountain biking. These days I still bike almost everywhere I go, but tennis is my go-to physical activity.


I‚Äôm vegetarian and reduce my consumption of animal products where convenient: I don‚Äôt buy milk or eggs, but I don‚Äôt worry about products that contain them (particularly with dairy), and do eat some cheese.
Work
Currently, I work at an AI company because it seems like helping AI go well (or rather, helping it not go poorly) is potentially very impactful. I care a lot about my work because of this.


How I got here: I studied physics because it was interesting and I value humans understanding the world. In grad school I found out that doing good was so neglected that you could save a life for a few $k. I took a job with a highish ability to donate while figuring out what to do next. GPT-3/scaling-laws happened next, and I decided that‚Äôs what I could be most useful doing.
You (long term partner)
I‚Äôm a rather rational, analytical person and I think I‚Äôd like to find someone who is as well, but also someone who‚Äôs kind and cares about the welfare of others.
Us (long term partner)
In previous long-term relationships (most recently 6yr), I‚Äôve really enjoyed having someone to cook a quick meal with after work, then get outside with for a tennis match or bike ride, and finally cuddle up to half a movie, back rubs, or just reading and chatting. I‚Äôm pretty affectionate, and physical contact and emotional warmth are important to me.


Eventually it‚Äôd be amazing to face life as a team, optimizing jointly for what‚Äôs best for both of us. We‚Äôd support each-other‚Äôs growth where wanted and work together towards being the people each of us wants to be and living the lives each of us wants to live.
Kids
Short version: no kids

Long Version: I don‚Äôt want kids any time soon, and I‚Äôm more comfortable committing to not having kids than to having them. The rest of this decade is potentially a particularly important and crazy time for the world, and I‚Äôm not totally sure what my life or the world will look like afterwards. Depending on what the world looks like in ~2030 I‚Äôm potentially open to kids then.
(Non)-Monogamy
I‚Äôve been in various mono/open relationships in the past and am open to most relationship types as long as there‚Äôs clear and open communication about it. The important thing to me is finding the right person.
Contact
I‚Äôm <wampiter at gmail dot com> and facebook.com/wampiter

Name: Rocco
ProfileText:
ÔªøWhy Get Italian for Takeout When an Italian can Take You Out  
Hey, I‚Äôm Rocco. A 35 year old, cisgender, straight, male, with no kids, looking for a monogamous relationship with a woman. INFJ personality type. I currently reside on the Michigan/Wisconsin border in the US. My mother was 100% Italian ethnically, so I am Italian American, I graduated Valedictorian from a Finish American University, and I‚Äôm currently learning to speak Japanese. I‚Äôm open to relocating to meet a partners preferences, but I do own a three bedroom house with no mortgage, so that may be an enticing reason to stay.


I have an associates degree in graphic design and a bachelors degree in illustration. I do freelance art and design but the majority of my income is passive and comes from investments and dividends. I have no debt whatsoever, student loans are long ago paid off, I am financially self sufficient.


Huge fan of fine art, live theater, art museums, particularly impressionist and post impressionist art, love animation and comics, superhero movies, science fiction, dolphins, K Pop, EDM, Pop music, plushies, weight lifting, daily cardio, retro video games, and tabletop gaming (board games, card games, and RPG‚Äôs). I‚Äôm a certified Pokemon Professor for TPCi, meaning I judge and organize tournaments for the Pokemon TCG.


Career wise I worked for the Michigan Democratic Party off and on for a number of years. I lean left/progressive politically and liberal (in the American usage of the word) but am personally/socially conservative. Essentially I believe people should be able to lead whatever lives they wish but I am personally traditional. I do not smoke, drink, or use any drugs and am looking for a woman who is the same.


After working for the MDP, I also worked at what was the oldest continuously printed newspaper in Michigan. That unfortunately is no longer the case since print media is dying. After that stint my mother got extremely sick to the point she could no longer do basic necessities for herself and needed a full time caregiver. It was the most stressful and difficult job I can imagine someone doing, but I‚Äôm glad I was there for her.


I‚Äôm an ardent supporter of many progressive causes but my experiences have lead me to be a primarily a strong advocate for disability rights, animal rights, and environmental protections. Giving a voice to the most vulnerable is my philosophy.


2024 was a big year for me. I went to Toronto Comic Con, Orlando Florida for four days at Disney, one at Universal, and one day at Kennedy Space Center, I also bought tickets to go to Japan in spring of 2025. I‚Äôm going to be in Tokyo for two weeks, Osaka for a week, and Kyoto for a week, with day trips to Yokohama and Fukui. Looking for someone who loves travel and preferably nerdy things.


Right now I‚Äôm looking for a life partner. An equal who I can spend the rest of my life with. My mother passed away a little over two years ago. She was the last family I had left. I would prefer to start a family but I also like the idea of traveling the world a bit before that.


*   

How to get ahold of me:
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/rocco.bertucci?igsh=aG82a3NqYWNtN3Uw&utm_source=qr


e-mail: raber60@hotmail.com


Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/share/9BCsQBhRRkfqBEGW/?

Name: Puja Gandhi
Location: San Francisco Bay Area, Seattle, Boston, Western US
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate Me | Puja Gandhi (last updated 12/2023)


Hi There!
 
I‚Äôm looking for a life partner, and decided to make this longer-style profile as a means to better articulate who I am, what I‚Äôm looking for, and maybe I find my human along the way ü§û


  
   


TLDR: Fairly traditional, 37 y/o female (5‚Äô 2‚Äù) looking for someone who is kind, family-oriented, prioritizes being outdoors/being active, who strives for balance in life while also being somewhat ambitious. I was born and raised in the US and am a US citizen. 

You can find more photos of me and my highlight reel on my instagram (I‚Äôm an infrequent user)


Me


I‚Äôm a Texas Native currently ‚Äòliving‚Äô in Seattle, Wa. I say ‚Äòliving‚Äô because my mailing address and company I work for is based in Seattle, but I also live/work remotely from other locations. I‚Äôm a bit of a minimalist in the sense that I live out of a carry-on and checked bag for the most part and keep my other things (think ski gear/tents/sleeping bag/etc) in storage. I have been living in short term rentals post-pandemic and I like the flexibility and cost-savings this lifestyle provides (for now, not forever). 


As for education/career; I have a Master‚Äôs degree in Analytical Chemistry (proud PhD dropout), and I no longer do anything chemistry related ‚Äì I now work as a product/program manager for a remittance payments company. The work is meaningful to me and pays me enough to live a comfortable lifestyle that is flexible without an excessive amount of stress. I suppose you could say I ‚Äòdesigned‚Äô my career path to be this way (you can see about the unconventional path I took on my linkedin). I‚Äôd eventually love to have children, and I‚Äôd like to be a present/active mother, so I chose this career path to allow me more time to care for those close to me whom I love. 


Outside of work, I have so. many. hobbies. In the winters, I teach skiing at a local ski resort outside of Seattle. I don‚Äôt mean the ‚Äòcool‚Äô downhill skiing, but I‚Äôm talking about dorky Nordic, cross-country skiing. I love being outside, in nature, in the snow with friends and sharing my love of the outdoors with children. I also volunteer with Outdoors for all and teach skiing through that program as well. In the fairer seasons, you‚Äôll find me backpacking, hiking, and cycling. Prior to the pandemic, I purchased a Specialized Ruby Road bike, and have logged over 10K miles on it since then. I love road cycling, but would also love to dive into trying out a gravel-style bike as well!


I love being outdoors, but I can also chill. When I‚Äôm having a weekend indoors, you‚Äôll find me curled up with a cup of tea knitting sweaters, or taking on a design/woodworking project. One of my dreams is to have a woodworking shop, and to build a sauna in my backyard! 
Simple times spent cooking with friends/family, sharing new experiences with others, or enjoying a sunrise/sunset with others are what make me happiest. I have a website that I last updated in 2022 that can tell you a bit more if you‚Äôre curious. 


Who you are:


Someone who is excited about finding a monogamous long term relationship leading to marriage/kids. You are family-oriented. 


Someone who loves the outdoors and travel


You are intentional, sincere, and ready for a long term relationship


Are open to living in a place where being surrounded by nature and outdoor activity is accessible and part of daily life


You love to challenge yourself and try new things.




Dealbreakers


I‚Äôm a vegetarian and have a strong preference for folks who are plant-based. If you are a carnivore or eat meat daily, this won‚Äôt work. 


I‚Äôd really like to have biological children of my own with someone who wishes to be a present parent.  If having children isn‚Äôt your jam, this isn‚Äôt going to be a fit. 




Still intrigued/think this is a fit?


Send me a message at gandhi.pj@gmail.com, I‚Äôd love to connect!

SwirlsOfSound
Jun 3, 2022
39F, gay and gender non-conforming and in a monogamous relationship. Not interested in any romantic encounters. Looking for long-distance friendship in which we exchange long well-written e-mails in English and/or Russian about our subjective life experiences and how they relate to the world around us. My default mode in life is gawking, wide-eyed, at the insanity of the world around me and quietly muttering "What the actual bloody fuck?.." under my breath, and then trying to learn more about evolutionary biology to understand why on earth humans do these things they do. Poetry and logic both please. I want to connect with an actual human who is not hiding behind a wall of trite pleasantness and socially acceptable conversation topics. I want to talk about the meaning of life, existential dread, public policy, thermodynamics,  gyoza, your dog, shit we're going through rn and things like that. It doesn't always have to be profound; I will likely express a lot of banalities because sometimes banalities resonate. I love women, especially gay women, but you can be any age, gender and sexuality - if we click, we click. If we don't, at least we tried. I am weird and I don't click with a lot of people, so if we do click, it'll be a pleasant surprise.
About me: fairly intelligent and nerdy in the sense of being academically oriented but not into typical nerd culture. Also I know as close to zero pop culture as literally anyone I've ever met. I likely have some  annoying combo of ASD, ADHD, GAD, depression and who knows what else but none of it is formally diagnosed and I have accumulated a heap of coping mechanisms; none are too effective but combined they allow to live a life that appears mostly normal from the outside. This is just so you're not surprised at my being one odd bird; otoh, this is Scott's blog, so you likely won't be to begin with.

Name: Tejas Subramaniam
ProfileText:
ÔªøHi there! I‚Äôm Tejas. I‚Äôm not very familiar with ‚Äúdate-me‚Äù docs, and haven‚Äôt read too many of them, but I thought I‚Äôd write a brief one. I only recently decided to start looking for a relationship, and thought this was a reasonable place to start!


If you‚Äôd be potentially interested at all, please feel free to shoot me an email (you can reach me at tejassubramaniam@gmail.com) or contact me via Facebook Messenger. Feel free to tell me a bit about yourself, but even just expressing possible interest works!


About me


* I‚Äôm 22, and currently an undergraduate student at Stanford (studying economics). 
* For some simple demographics, I‚Äôm South Asian, male, and a lacto-vegetarian. I‚Äôm also bi and gray-ace/demisexual. Politically, I‚Äôm centrist, or slightly left-of-center. I‚Äôm an atheist. 
* I‚Äôm broadly an effective altruist. I‚Äôve been torn about this label before. I‚Äôm not too certain about my future plans; I think I will probably apply to masters programs, and then try to work at a research role at an EA org. I have fairly broad interests, so I could see myself working on animal welfare, AI policy/governance, or economic development. 
* I‚Äôm a bit introverted, although I‚Äôm working on being more social. In my spare time, I like reading nonfiction (and blog posts), playing chess online, and participating in competitive British Parliamentary debate (which is an activity I‚Äôve enjoyed a ton). 
* I‚Äôm very intellectually curious and eager to learn things: I love having long conversations with people about random things I can learn a ton about, including things I know very little about. 
* I‚Äôm very neat and organized (although I don‚Äôt expect that from a partner necessarily). I‚Äôm good at replying to texts and emails promptly. When I‚Äôm especially interested in a project, I can be quite hardworking, but otherwise my work ethic is poorer than I‚Äôd like (this is something I‚Äôm working on myself). I don‚Äôt have excellent emotional intelligence.


What I‚Äôm looking for


I‚Äôm looking for a long-term relationship, but would also love to go on a few dates. I‚Äôm open to dating people of any gender. I‚Äôd also be open to either monogamy or poly; I have no strong preference on this matter, and would be flexible according to my partner‚Äôs preferences. 


I‚Äôd especially value a partner who is interested in making the world a better place, interested in any one of economics/math/political science/statistics, nerdy, and loves long conversations about particular curiosities of theirs. Bonus points if we share hobbies (e.g., debate, playing online chess). I‚Äôd also love to share some of our values (either on our political views or on effective altruism ‚Äì not necessarily both!), but this is not a dealbreaker. 


Some of my preferences


* I have a low sex drive, and don‚Äôt experience a lot of sexual attraction. 
* I think it‚Äôs unlikely that I will want kids.
* I‚Äôm fairly comfortable with long-distance, and I‚Äôd be happy to meet/go on a date virtually. But I‚Äôd love to meet in-person too. 
* I‚Äôd want to date someone over 19 but under 30.

Name: Sindhu
ProfileText:
ÔªøSindhu‚Äôs Dating Bio
Last Updated: May 5, 2024 
Quick facts


* Name: Sindhu
* Age: 36
* Height: 5‚Äô3‚Äù
* Occupation: Software Engineer (Machine Learning) at Meta. 
* Location: London, UK. Inflexible for a year-ish, Can consider few European countries after that.
* Build: Used to be obese and have started taking health seriously recently (Moved from obese to overweight zone before setting this doc up). I plan on getting (and staying) in shape - mostly just to be healthy. Will almost certainly still be overweight if you are meeting me in the upcoming  few months, and dates will have to be worked around my gym schedule, fasting zones, and of course work. Sorry. Priorities!
	  

	* Looking for: Men/Women, and a long-term relationship. I‚Äôm monogamous. I would also want someone monogamous. 
* Disclaimer: Have a skin graft and an almost fully (but not fully) functioning limb. Has been a deal breaker in the past for a few dates and a couple of short-term relationships (No judgements. We all have our list for someone we want to see multiple times of the day). So getting it out of the way, in case it‚Äôs off-putting. It‚Äôs a fun tea-time story for me. It needn‚Äôt necessarily be so for you. Totally get it.
	

About me
Factoids
* Introverted and not great at initiating conversations. But happy to contribute to deep and/or interesting conversations of any format. 
   * Unbelievably bad at small talk (Not proud of this. Small talk also has its place and requires some skill)
* My attachment style is fairly secure. It used to be avoidant a few years ago.
* Beach and water-activities person. Love a good hike with great views. But between the beach and the mountain, long barefoot beach-walks anyday, anytime.
* Dry humour. Love witty responses and may duel you in a wit-athon.
* Kids are not one of my top priorities right now. But with an equal partner with decent parenting capabilities, I am open to having or adopting kids. 
* I am a private person and also a privacy nutcase. Reticent about sharing selfies or anything on social media, this bio, and my contact details, for starters. 
* In case you haven‚Äôt figured out from this list, I have no sense of order.
* Speak 5 languages (English, Tamil, Hindi, Kannada, Malayalam) and want to pick up more. Weirdly into linguistics and how they affect cultures and thoughts (or vice-versa) for some reason.
* Not religious. I was raised a Hindu and to some extent, have some old religious little habits which simply refuse to die. Won‚Äôt challenge or question your religious beliefs. Please don‚Äôt impose your views on this topic on me. 
* Sexuality: While I am sex-positive, I grew up in a regressive environment (My parents and immediate family are sweet, though conservative. It is really more of an India in the 2000s thing). So it will take me a while to open up about my own sex and sexuality. You do you! 
* INTP if it matters to you. But I strongly believe people are more nuanced than 16 different varieties. Same goes to zodiac (Aquarius) and other personality traits tests. Also people change. 
* My dominant inner voice is cynical about everything (including myself). But with years of practice, I have been somewhat successful in cultivating a second voice that gives everything the benefit of doubt. They both consistently fight, while I chill indecisively.
* Since a near-death experience ~10 years ago - which resulted in the skin graft mentioned in the disclaimer - I have been a strong believer of ‚Äúthe gut feeling‚Äù. 


NOTE: I wrote this entire doc assuming I am talking to my friends or acquaintances I‚Äôve warmed up to. The person you meet or talk to, the first few times, might very well be a dull dud. But I hope we warm up sooner.
Pics
Not much of a poser. Don‚Äôt photograph well either. But here goes


Maybe take a look at this first? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lPEoC6PNlWo        




  
 Mandatory Hey-I-socialize pic! 

Mandatory Hey-I-socialize pics. But I do so in spurts. 


  
  

                       Touristy pics for the sake of it        
  

Yes. Yes. I travel! 


Content Consumption Starter Kit
Skip this section if you have your own preferred conversation starters. (TLDR: Will watch anything with subtitles. Will listen to anything catchy. Can read anything that piques my interest. They all vary from time to time)
Movies & Shows
Will watch any genre and any language with subtitles. This is my go-to international movie list, and I will generally watch anything rated by Roger Ebert as 3+. If you have a recommendation of a similar movie critic who is alive, please share. Personal favourites from this list are Spirited Away, Nuovo Cinema Paradiso, Narayama Bushiko. 


I also have a lot of regional favourites that you probably haven‚Äôt heard about.
Music
In tandem with my movie taste, anything goes for music, as long as it strikes a chord. Generally love jazz, pop, and rap genres and indie music. I like to listen to western classical music when I am doing boring chores (Think documentation at work, or cleaning the house). Sucker for old songs (Chuck Berry, Beatles, ABBA, Ella Fitzgerald, Frank Sinatra, Carpenters, and so on). Love new ones equally. ‚ÄúBad Idea right‚Äù, ‚ÄúLevitating‚Äù, and ‚ÄúBeliever‚Äù have been in a loop for a while now. 


Indian music (both classical, and pop-culturish ones) is a staple part of my childhood and you may hear me pelting out those from time to time.


Cannot sing. Please don‚Äôt ask. May sing/hum absent-mindedly. Please feel free to ask me to shut up. Will not shut up only when I am singing shouting Bohemian Rhapsody. But I want to learn to play an instrument someday - preferably the violin. Haven‚Äôt made time for it yet.
Books
This one is limited by time. While not an exhaustive list, I read stuff about
* Neuroscience (By no means an expert)
* Linguistics
* Comics (Recent fad. But so far, liking it)
* My book list from the past. Not much has changed in terms of taste, except that I don‚Äôt have much time to read anymore. Carving some time out for the past 3 months or so. 
Why a dating bio?
For an embarrassingly large part of my adult life,  work has taken most or all my time. I have only recently (about a year) discovered the joy of setting boundaries at work, and having a personal life. I have a fairly decent social circle with a close group of friends and have been happy with my circle so far. I took a stab at dating apps for a few months, and found them a lot less fun and a lot more impersonal than they used to be. Hence this old-school bio.
About you
I think most of these - wherever applicable - are two way streets. I generally prefer that you fit into most of these categories, in no particular order:
1. Non-smoker (This one is non-negotiable)
2. Not loud and temperamental in frequent doses (I generally don‚Äôt like cacophony and prefer consistency and stability in all aspects of life including my partner's emotions)
3. Empathetic and open to diverse perspectives.
4. Age: 30-40 (more of a general preference. Not a must)
5. You are either witty or can convince me that wit and a good sense of humour are not necessary for a healthy, long-term relationship. 
6. Have an interest or curiosity in a range of things, and also have a broad interest or opinion on what I do for work. 
7. Must help me find my missing spectacles for the 17496th time without sulking. Ok! With a little bit of sulking, after the first 100 times! 


Beyond this, I think love and/or attraction are simply strong foundations to mutual-respect and trust. Long term relationships sustain on the latter, and hence a bit of self-esteem and integrity on both our parts can be good starters.  And as long as we enjoy each other‚Äôs company in the short term and can manage to be good friends in the long term (I think this is a foundation for a good committed relationship) anything goes.
Contact details
sindhu_pro@proton.me 


I have no idea why this took 5 pages long (excluding the pictures), but hopefully this isn‚Äôt too rosy or full of platitudes. That was certainly not the intention.

Hello everyone,

I want to connect with a man who shares the same values. I want to build a life, and an empire, with my best friend, who is driven, ambitious, kind, compassionate, caring, affectionate and self-aware.

If you are still reading, great. I‚Äôll tell you more about me and who I am looking for for a monogamous and loving relationship.


Sincerely,

Alice, AKA Lil‚Äô Miss Giggles


PS. I now live in Austin

________________
Summary of Alice
(And yes, to be clear, my name is not Leila.)
* 38 year old Taiwanese-Canadian real estate developer and Fractional COO (mainly tech, real estate and the latest - an influencer) who helps businesses scale and grow
* Currently living in Montreal, but happy to live anywhere.
* I‚Äôve lived in 8 countries across four continents in my adult life. All without a job or knowing anyone. I have a very curious mind and paired with a strong can-do attitude.

   * Values quality time (so someone who‚Äôs glued to their phone is a no for me, thank you)
   * Endless curiosity and can travel backpacking style, or luxury.
   * Strong character and is always looking to improve himself and motivates me to be the best version of myself.
   * Has a strong can-do attitude and understands that life isn‚Äôt always going to be smooth, but we can get through anything together.

Name: Michael
ProfileText:
ÔªøA bit about me: I'm 33 years old, 6'3", living in NYC (and a third-generation New Yorker). I work as an engineer at Meta on Reels and I love what I do! I'm kind, happy, curious, creative, and a major nerd. My aunt is certain that I'm "quite a catch."
A bit about who I'm looking for: I'm currently looking for a serious relationship with a woman who is at least not closed to the prospect of marriage and children at some point in their life (with the right person, of course). Ideally someone who can pivot seamlessly between silly and serious conversation, and who is a little weird but still normal enough to charm my parents.
I think I relate best to people who are some kind of engineer/scientist/nerd, but who also have a keen interest in the humanities and are generally well-rounded.
Fitness and health: I go on a short run most days and do some gym exercise around every other day. That said, I'm much more likely to want to talk about the podcast I was listening to while exercising than the exercise itself. I drink, but only if someone else at the table already ordered a drink. I don't smoke or use any drugs but I support decriminalization.
Religion: Although I'm generally very secular (and so is my family), my cultural heritage is Jewish and I consider it a part of my identity. I love my family's holiday traditions - including Jewish Christmas (the classic movie and Chinese food) - it's as real of a holiday as Christian Christmas!
Favorite day trip: Take the train to Pelham Bay Park and work up an appetite by walking to Johnny's Reef on City Island, then spend a few hours indulging in their incredibly reasonably priced seafood.
Favorite evening activity: Finding an unusual off-Broadway show and convincing my friends to go (half the fun is the post-show debrief to figure out what we just experienced).
Most surreal childhood memory: Eating at Mars 2112 - an immersive Mars-themed restaurant set up to look like it was carved out of red rock! It had everything - people in alien costumes, a spaceship ride, and above-average chicken fingers. It was emblematic of the kind of early 2000s decadence that we may never see again.
TV triumph that I most often think about: The series finale of Nathan for You.
TV disappointment that I most often think about: The series finale of Lost.
Top podcasts: Normal Gossip, Maintenance Phase, Criminal, You're Wrong About, 5-4, Serious Trouble.
If money were not a concern: When I first got into programming in high school it was because I wanted to make games, but it turns out that the game industry is horrible and abusive and pays terribly, so I'd much rather be ensconced in a cushy tech job‚Ä¶ anyway all of that is to say that if I didn't have to worry about money then I'd totally start my own game studio (that pays people well and is not abusive).
Relationship to games: I wish there was a word to describe someone who likes video games but whose life isn't spiraling out of control due to a video game addiction. In any case‚Ä¶ that's me! I love games, and I love in particular thinking about what makes them tick. I prefer a broad mix of games and usually don't stick with one for long. Some of my favorites are Baba is You, Breath of the Wild, Oxygen Not Included, Disco Elysium, Inscription, Tunic, and Kentucky Route Zero.
"He sounds great but is he a crypto/NFT guy?": Lol no.
"He sounds great but is he a fan of Joe Rogan or Andrew Tate or Elon Musk? Or is he some other kind of right-wing sicko?": Absolutely not!
Contacts: hello.there.msh@gmail.com

Name: Lawrence Chan
ProfileText:
ÔªøGod help me I‚Äôm making a date me doc  
About me
Hello! I‚Äôm Lawrence. Here you‚Äôll find some basics about me, what I‚Äôm looking for in a relationship, and some of my writing and photos.


Basics:
* I'm a 28-year-old straight cis man and 6‚Äô3‚Äù. 
* I live in Berkeley, CA, but I‚Äôm not super attached to the Bay Area and I like traveling.
* Looking for a long- or medium-term relationship, open to dating both trans and cis women. 
* I don‚Äôt know if I want kids. 
* I‚Äôm open to both polyamorous and monogamous relationships. 
What my friends say about me
‚ÄúLawrence is pretty emotionally mature and insightful in a bunch of ways, and is happy to talk about feelings. [..] I think he might be the best person I know for helping people get over lack of intellectual self-confidence and problems with being intimidated by technical content. [..] He holds himself to very high standards, in a way that can sometimes hurt him but is also often very positive ‚Äì he‚Äôs extremely receptive to feedback and is very non-defensive even when he‚Äôs upset. I think he‚Äôd be a good match for someone who wants their relationship to be a big source of growth and improvement, but also of security and unconditional affection.‚Äù 
‚Äì Beth Barnes


‚ÄúMan Lawrence, if you have romantic struggles, then there's no hope for the rest of us.‚Äù  
‚Äì Nat Kozak
More about me 
I often feel intense emotions. I sometimes stop while walking or driving to just take in the view and reflect on how good things are. I get excited about clever ideas and am deeply touched by acts of kindness. I feel on a deep level that most people are very good and are trying their best, and it makes me really sad when they fail or have a rough time. I feel very upset when people are unreasonable, and I often feel a strong desire to fix problems I see around me.


I have a pretty good memory. Both for dates and conversations, and for lots of random facts.


I‚Äôm eager to pick up my partner‚Äôs interests. In the past, I‚Äôve enjoyed ballroom dancing, traveling, hiking, cooking together, stargazing, and visiting museums and exhibits. I enjoy talking about machine learning, economics, history, psychology, and random animal facts.
  

I have a dog. His name is Benji, and he‚Äôs a good boy (not really, but he is a very adorable one). 


I care deeply about doing good. I want to make both the world around me and the world in general a better place. I‚Äôll stand up for what I think is right, and try to keep promises and be fair to people. (Also, sometimes I stay up all night to help others finish their projects and meet their deadlines.)
Who I tend to get along with
Sincerity and kindness: I like people who say true things, genuinely relate to others, and aren‚Äôt afraid to wear their heart on their sleeve. I like people who do nice things for others from the depths of their hearts. Also, I think it‚Äôs fine to take lots of time and be very gentle when you do it, but I think it‚Äôs very important to be able to face hard truths about yourself or the world.


Intellectual curiosity: I like having conversations with a partner where I feel like one or more of us are learning something, or I can share in their enthusiasm and knowledge about a subject. 


High standards: I like people who have high standards both for themselves and for the people around them. If you play video games all day, I hope you‚Äôre at least good at video games. üòõ
Possible sources of incompatibility
I can be quite negative. When I‚Äôm sad, I often feel like nothing is working; when I fail, I can be quite harsh with myself. I also tend to be lower valence in general, but I‚Äôm working on being gentler and happier. I sometimes express true but unkind opinions about others. 


I work a lot. I think it‚Äôs important to be working on productive things, so I tend to be a bit of a homebody by default and I‚Äôm not likely to spontaneously develop new hobbies. However, I think that spending time with my partner would definitely count as productive time and I‚Äôm happy to spend a lot of time with you!


I don‚Äôt drink or do drugs. I feel comfortable hanging out with people who drink, though I would feel uncomfortable about frequent heavy drinking. I‚Äôm also fine with psychedelics as long as you don‚Äôt take them in the presence of charismatic cult leaders. 


I am pretty attached to my dog. If you‚Äôre allergic to dogs, this will be a problem. Sorry. 
________________
Other Pictures
  
  
  

Contact Info
If you‚Äôre interested in chatting more or think we‚Äôre compatible, please email me at lawrencechan96@gmail.com. 
________________
Appendix
Some things I believe about dating docs and dating:
Dating docs aren‚Äôt (just) for finding dates. I think a significant fraction of the value of dating docs comes from the process of writing; another large fraction comes from communicating information with future partners that might not come up naturally in the first few dates. I‚Äôm also not super convinced that dating docs work well for finding new people to date, compared to e.g. asking people out in person. So this doc errs on the side of being more informative as opposed to promotional. 


Emotional and social intelligence are real and important. There are many skills in actually making relationships work, both in terms of knowing yourself and in terms of knowing how to relate to others. While I can be a fan of numbers and spreadsheets, it‚Äôs important to be in touch with who you are and what you want, and also who your partner is and what they want. Also, communication is important! 


Shared interests are significantly less important than shared values and shared desire to make a relationship work. I think dating apps and docs tend to focus too much on screening for shared interests or experiences, which I think can easily be developed over time. (In particular, I‚Äôm happy to pick up your interests! In the past I‚Äôve picked up the interests of previous partners.) On the other hand, deeply held values are probably unlikely to change, and I don‚Äôt think romantic relationships work without both parties wanting it to work and putting in the effort.


Most disagreements and issues can be worked through (given shared values and a desire to make the relationship work). I think I have a lot of growth mindset for relationships; I think that many common points of disagreement can be worked on. For example, I think that issues like division of labor (for chores) or different hobbies can generally be solved if both people are willing to try. As a corollary, I think that fights are really bad in romantic relationships; the whole point is to be on the same side, and work toward a mutual goal. Accordingly, I‚Äôve had very few fights in my past romantic relationships. 


Security is necessary for people to grow in relationships. I personally value relationships that push me to grow and do better, but I don‚Äôt think these relationships can be stable without a firm bedrock of security and mutual trust. After all, it‚Äôs pretty hard to be ambitious if you feel like a single misstep could cause your partner to leave you.


Relationships can be thought of as trade agreements, but you generally shouldn‚Äôt. Relationships are trade agreements (in the sense that every persistent interaction can be thought of as a trade agreement), and this frame can be somewhat helpful. For example, it highlights the fact that relationships should be a positive sum voluntary endeavor, and that both partners should try to provide things that are to their comparative advantage. However, I find that this framing can often cause people to take an adversarial stance toward their partners (i.e. a trade negotiation), or cause people to value tangible, concrete things about their partners over emotional support or vibes, and so don‚Äôt think that people should think about relationships this way by default. 


Additional writing samples:
I guess the largest repository my public writing is my LessWrong account: https://www.lesswrong.com/users/lawrencec

Name: Cristian Trout
Location: NYC, Portland, London, Seattle, Vancouver, Somerville, Central Europe, Boston, Cambridge, DC, MA
ProfileText:
ÔªøContestant #2718: Cristian Trout
________________
  
  
  

________________
  Basics:
* Male, straight
* 5‚Äô10‚Äù
* 28, looking for someone in the ~26-32 range.
* Seeking primary, long-term partner.
* Preference for monogamy mostly because I‚Äôm pretty certain in a polyamorous relationship my attention would be spread too thin for me. However, I‚Äôm not into possessive exclusivity (I don‚Äôt get jealous and feel slightly uncomfortable with people who easily get jealous).
* Aromantic (but happy to humor those who are into the romantic)
* Sorta demisexual? Behaviourally for sure: in the realm of relationships ‚ÄúI am slow-thinking and full of interior rules that act as brakes on my desires.‚Äù It takes me a while to warm up to people, but once I do I‚Äôm very loyal and cuddly.
* Mix of intro- and extroverted. Medium-sized social battery? I like meeting new people occasionally, and love hosting or hanging with friends. But after e.g. a fun weekend of full-time social exposure, I need a day or two of quiet to recup.
* Neither prioritizing nor avoiding having children in the future
* Currently in Boston/Oxford but pretty flexible: could move to basically any major city in US or EU. Preference for East Coast of US, France or UK.
* Fluent in English and French (would love it if you are too!)
* Current work: AI policy researcher, artist (screenwriting and videography).
* B.A. and M.A. in Philosophy
* Vegetarian when I‚Äôm ordering, flexitarian otherwise. (Would struggle to live as a vegan: cheese is a strong part of my identity. Could be swayed.)
* Not religious
* Non-smoker, glass of wine on occasions
Character:
Some sort of cross between French bourgeois, Midwestern son, and ironic Jew. An imposter among all except those who are equally culturally confused. Trained in philosophy, self-taught in everything else. Serious on the outside, goofy on the inside.


Finds the unambitious, parochial life to be humble and beautiful. Finds the world too broken, and himself too privileged or hubristic to accept such a life for myself. Grinds and hustles against the hustle and grindset culture. Fascinated with engineering, tinkering, science, but is not a techno-optimist. Finds that small is beautiful.


Sometimes has ‚Äúone thought too many,‚Äù a character flaw. Speaks mind when probably shouldn‚Äôt more often than keeps quiet when probably should speak up. Can be quite direct at times ‚Äì avoids sugar-coating things. Sets high expectations for self and others. Sometimes struggles to admit when wrong, but eventually does.


Looking to share the ride with a life-long friend accomplice! Always striving to live more virtuously :)


NB: Friends fear this dating profile is ‚Äúa bit too much.‚Äù To which I respond: ‚Äúbut that‚Äôs very like me!‚Äù
Seeking:
* A co-conspirator. I wish to build beautiful things with my partner, at work and at home. I wish to be involved in my partner‚Äôs career, and vice versa. I wish our talents and temperaments to complement each other so as to make us a dynamic duo, a force for good :) I‚Äôm currently trying hard to help ‚Äúmake AI go well.‚Äù
* Someone who challenges me. Someone well-studied in their craft or a rigorous thinker. An interest in philosophy, economics, or art are pluses! (Trading in truisms and half-baked things quickly bores me.) But also‚Ä¶
* Someone who knows how and when to shove all that braininess to the side and run down a sand dune, pull a silly pose, bask in the moonlight, or cozy up with a warm cuppa.
* Someone who knows Europe and or America: I‚Äôm culturally confused enough as it is, and would rather not become more so... (Ideally looking for someone who understands what that‚Äôs like, since it‚Äôs a key aspect of my identity). I don‚Äôt brag my privilege of being well-traveled, and I dislike what I call ‚Äúcultural tourism‚Äù (treating culture like so many colors to embellish one‚Äôs instagram feed; taking cultural diversity for granted; failing to care for, own up to, partake in, and embody one‚Äôs own culture).


Some things I love:
* Cooking for/with friends, hosting dinner parties, board game nights!
* Tinkering: DIY repair, optics, dance, music. Not good at any of these, love experimenting anyway :)
* Hiking, being in nature
* Reading a poem or watching a great film and then doing a deep dive discussion with others! Off-the-cuff sampling of works I love:
   * Rashomon
   * Parasite
   * Lawrence of Arabia
   * East of Eden
   * Le Petit Prince
   * Lord of the Flies
   * Brave New World
   * The Cosmicomics
   * (poems by Robert Frost)
   * Calvin and Hobbes
   * Outer Wilds
* Watching some classic Looney Toons or an old comedy (typically Jerry Lewis or Danny Kaye) with my family ‚ù§
* Playing some silly couch multi-player games with friends or family (Nintendo boy here!) (‚à©^o^)‚äÉ‚îÅ‚òÜ
How to proceed:
If you think you‚Äôd like to meet, or chat with, feel free to reach out at ctroutcsi@gmail.com, or here on messenger, or text me at seven eight one, five one eight, eight nine nine six! (I think messenger or text are more reliable, since emails will sometimes go to spam‚Ä¶) If you‚Äôd like to learn more about my work/hobbies, feel free to visit www.ctrout.art.


I know it can be intimidating to reach out, but of course I made this doc to meet new people, so don‚Äôt be shy :)


More Photos      
Did we mention hubris?
