Name: David
ProfileText:
ÔªøDavid‚Äôs Dating profile
  
  
  
  
  

Summary
I am a disaster.


I‚Äôm an assistant professor working on Bayesian social and formal epistemology, the philosophy of AI, and the foundations of physics. Somehow I have ended up with two PhDs, one in particle physics, and one in the philosophy of science. I am something of a polymath. My Erd≈ës number is less than or equal to four.






I am kind, thoughtful and curious. I am excited by, and open to new ideas. I strongly value openness and honesty. I am shy, introverted and almost certainly terribly socially awkward. I am a neurodivergent trainwreck. I am often found at the epicentre of a whirling void of chaos, but this is just by coincidence. Imagine a confused and profusely apologetic teacher running in late to teach their class, and dropping their books everywhere.


I am vegan, somewhere on the (highly heterodox) left politically, feminist, and very loosely adjacent to (or aligned with?) effective altruism and rationalism.


I am (very) British. Sorry about that.


It is very important to realise that I am definitely not ‚Äúfun‚Äù. Don't even *think* about trying to take me on an ‚Äúadventure‚Äù.
Interests
My interests are rather eclectic. I particularly enjoy discovering new, elegant and holistic ideas that simplify and unify a great many threads: this applies not just in physics, but in every field of human knowledge. A selective summary of some things I often think about might include:


* Physics ‚Äì especially quantum field theory and particle physics. 
* Philosophy ‚Äì my specialisms are in formal and social epistemology and the philosophy of science, but let‚Äôs face it, every area of philosophy is almost definitionally interesting.
* Rationality and Bayesianism.
* Cognitive science and artificial intelligence ‚Äì obviously.
* Why isn‚Äôt my code compiling?
* Politics/economics/sociology. 
* History.
* Music and music theory.


Again, please let me stress this list is non-exhaustive. I am generally very fascinated by other topics as well.


I wonder at the nature of time, space and the cosmos. I marvel at the mysteries of human history and the patterns exhibited in human societies, minds, biological structures and other complex systems, deconstructing and analysing the various media of human culture. I am particularly fascinated by the problems of epistemology, and other areas of philosophy. How should we interpret quantum field theories? Is it possible that the Universe is deterministic? What does it mean for A to cause B, and does that imply a direction in time? What makes time so different from the dimensions of space? When are two scientific theories equivalent? Is scientific knowledge cumulative? How can we justify the use of Occam's razor in induction? How important is the "look elsewhere effect"? Why does anything exist at all? How strong is the anthropic principle? Is a high level of artificial intelligence imminent and what are its implications for society and the economy? Should we aspire to have a society without work? Is it OK to have incommensurable moral values? How culturally contingent is the modern, Western ideal of liberty? Is it possible to improve human happiness or are we stuck on a hedonic treadmill? Also, how can we save the political left in Western Europe in a time of globalisation, secular stagnation, and a resurgent China? Is the Eurozone doomed? How can we save the Labour party from itself? A question possibly more intractable than anything else posed here! When I am out and about, I often think about urban design, public spaces, and architecture too. Or I mull over post-Soviet hauntology. I particularly enjoy discovering new, elegant and holistic ideas that simplify and unify a great many threads: this applies not just in physics, but in every field of human knowledge. There are, I think, few forms of happiness greater than the satisfaction that arises from the creative application of thought to a problem and discovering a brilliant solution. I love being introduced to new ideas, so if you think you know something that would interest me, please do share it!
Personality
* INTJ-T or INTP-T depending on the test (I treat Myers‚ÄìBriggs as a convenient summarising tool rather than a highly credible scientific model). 
* Presumably Ravenclaw (obviously a much more objective model).
* Neutral Good alignment.


You might have noticed I‚Äôm quite eccentric. I generally have a very high willingness to deviate from social norms, and I‚Äôm usually unphased by weirdness in other people. In some ways, I might take this too far: I instinctively veer away from groupthink, tribalism or veneration/idolization, in a way that probably can make me seem disagreeable. I seem unusually disinclined to naturally align my opinions or attitudes towards those of other people around me.


I sprinkle a lot of what I say with very subtle and dry humour, which very few people understand or notice. From this, you should probably conclude that I'm actually not very funny.


I am very open to new ideas, and generally curious. I am very much a high-decoupling thinker, although I see the value of being able to think in a low-decoupling way too. I do enjoy exploring ideas in a way that can sometimes come across as unintentionally controversial or provocative. I can comfortably suppress this, but I think I get on best with people who also enjoy thinking in this way.


I am kind, patient and good at listening. I am generally very forgiving of mistakes, and tend not to hold grudges against others.  I highly value kindness and magnanimity in other people. I don‚Äôt tend to take differences of opinions personally, and I am very open to criticism. I don‚Äôt tend to get angry easily.


I strongly value openness and honesty, and I get on best with people who also share these values. I like to build relationships on intimacy and trust.


I can dislike people who are very loud, arrogant or domineering. I am generally very sensitive to power-balances between people. I have a streak of culturally puritanical moralism. I like integrity, authenticity, and the calm search for enlightenment. I dislike extravagance, gaudiness, and unjustified grandiosity.


I like my life to be zen. I do not tend to get on well with high-drama people. I am a good demonstration of Karl Friston‚Äôs Free Energy principle because I try to avoid surprises, both good and bad.


I am usually very polite and obliging to the needs of other people. But I mostly prefer it if people are willing to openly assert their needs and desires. I strongly adhere to ‚Äúask culture‚Äù. However, occasionally I can overthink things, in a way to ensure I do not inadvertently pressure or harm other people. 


I am very ambitious and motivated. People tend to perceive me as something of a workaholic; however, this is only the case with work I passionately enjoy, or am very stressed about. I am a terrible procrastinator at everything else, especially anything involving admin. I can be very strong-willed on certain things; unfortunately motivating myself to do things I find tedious is not one of them. Some people find that I can be very stubborn; like some non-Newtonian fluids, my rigidity can increase under pressure.
Psychology
Sometimes I feel like the fated star-child, but then the camera dolly-zooms, and in a dizzying gestalt shift I realise that I am actually a barely-functional human being. It bemuses me that some people find this profile intimidating, because in truth I am usually a chaotic mess, stumbling from one fiasco to another.


Clearly, I am ‚Äúneurodivergent‚Äù. I think I am autistic (self-diagnosed), I have ADHD (sort-of diagnosed) and I am dyspraxic (actually diagnosed!). The possibility that I might have ADHD only occurred a few years ago (I had a complete misconception of what this was); since then I have been taking vyvanse/elvanse (lisdexamfetamine), which has improved my life incredibly. The only comparable experience I can think of is when I first put on glasses. 


As a result of all this, I am mostly a scatter-brained, highly forgetful disaster. I am naturally fairly incompetent at most basic day-to-day tasks. I do my best, but my best is usually pretty terrible.


Anyway, I probably haven‚Äôt mentioned this yet, but I am also highly forgetful.


In terms of many types of social interactions, I am pretty spectacularly awkward. I am usually better one-on-one than in groups, but I generally prefer large groups to small groups (more opportunities to hide). I am very introverted, by which I mean I tend to find social interaction very exhausting. This decreases when I grow more comfortable with someone, but usually it is still somewhat tiring. However, I actually really love exploring getting to know interesting people, and I generally do enjoy and value social interaction. I‚Äôm just able to do much less of it than some people, and need a lot of time to myself.


For whatever reason, I think I am actually very good at intuitively understanding and emotionally reading people. This is something that I have never found difficult. However, there are probably some social conventions that I miss or don‚Äôt understand. That being said, I don‚Äôt think my understanding is all that bad: there are some advantages to viewing things as an outsider, a sort of alien anthropologist. (But of course, I might not know what I don‚Äôt know!)


I have high levels of anxiety overall. This is very much lower than it used to be, but is probably higher than average. I had OCD as a teenager, and still have some mild OCD tendencies (yes, I am mildly triggered by the poor alignment of the images at the top of this profile). In the past, I have experienced some mental health problems including depression. In recent years, I‚Äôve been remarkably happy and mentally healthy.


Over the last seven or eight years, I have felt increasingly more alive, and reinvigorated. A lot of my mental health problems have become less severe in one way or another. I have gradually been learning to fall back in love with myself. This has been an extremely romantic process.
Physicality
Physically speaking, you could describe me as an organic, self-organising, irreversible, dynamic, non-linear, open, dissipative system, far from thermal equilibrium.


That‚Äôs not what you were looking for? Fine, fine, if you really insist, here are some more ‚Äúsalient‚Äù features. I am:


* 34 years old
* Anatomically male
* British (obviously)
* Average height (around 175cm, or 5 feet, 9 inches tall)
* Average weight (with a bmi around 23 at the time of writing)
* Presumably not unfit (I am a fast walker, and I run 6 days a week)
* In no way "in shape", unless the shape you have in mind is some sort of blobitectural abomination (perhaps a G√∂mb√∂c?)
* Physically healthy (except for very mild asthma)
* White/caucasian.


I have:
* Green-brown eyes
* Disaster hair
* Glasses due to being short-sighted.


You can probably infer my approximate appearance from the pictures, some of which were even taken within the last decade.


Relationship Things
I am genuinely (yes, genuinely) open to forming many kinds of new connections, or just seeing how things evolve. That could include forming friendships, relationships, or other things. However, I would prefer to meet people without strong expectations or assumptions about a relationship escalator.


I quite like the polyamory model, and my prior experience with it has generally been successful.  I would be open to various relationship models ranging from monogamy to relationship anarchy, with the right person or people. I see pros and cons of different models. Overall, this is something I am more pragmatic about than ideological, and in general I am fairly flexible. One partner said (perhaps accurately) that I was too much of a relationship anarchist to ever identify as one.


N.B. I do have some ongoing entanglements, so I may not be compatible with very strict forms of monogamy. I am open to looser forms of monogamy.


However, regardless of the particular model, I try to form relationships on as rational a basis as possible, allowing a particular arrangement to develop naturally between individuals. I very much tend to view each friendship/relationship on its own terms, which means that they often don't fit easily into socially-established categories. Genuine communication is essential. Again, I take openness and honesty as very fundamental prerequisites for being able to interact with other people in the most positive possible way.


I tend to dislike ‚Äúnew relationship energy‚Äù, and don‚Äôt experience this as strongly as some people seem to. I experience very little immediate attraction to people, rather this grows gradually as a relationship develops and we build a connection. I can be quite romantic and value intimacy very highly once I become close to someone. However, for me, I find that romantic feelings are mutually, consciously cultivated; I never really ‚Äúfall‚Äù for people spontaneously. I like relationships to evolve slowly, and grow stronger over time. 


I find physical intimacy to be an important and valuable feature of relationships. That does not have to be sexual (I have had successful and happy relationships with asexual people). I find sexual activity to be a highly unique experience with every person; it is something I prefer to take slowly and gradually evolve. 


The gender of a partner is not an important component in degree of attraction towards them. In that sense, I am happy to identify as ‚Äúbisexual‚Äù or ‚Äúpansexual‚Äù or ‚Äúqueer‚Äù, whichever is most conducive to good vibes or whatever.


I dislike uneven power dynamics.


When my relationships, career, finances, social setting etc are all in good shape, I would certainly consider having children with a suitable partner or partners. 
Ideologies and Identities
I am generally fairly anti-tribalist, and don‚Äôt easily fully align with any groups. I tend to adopt far too many heretical views. Nonetheless, I‚Äôll do my best to situate myself within the broad ideological contours of the contemporary moment.


I find politics interesting, and appreciate the importance of both policy and realpolitik. Overall, I broadly lie on the pluralist, progressive left, although this varies quite considerably, depending on contexts and issues. Economically, I sit somewhere between radical social democracy and market-oriented democratic socialism. Constitutionally and socially, I am very much a liberal, or perhaps more accurately I increasingly identify with classical civic republicanism. However, my views on particular policies and parties can be surprising; I instinctively avoid tribalism and political dogma, and try to borrow widely from a range of ideas. I am generally cautious of overarching grand narratives or overly simple ideological frameworks. I have some sympathy towards radical aims, but try to be pragmatic in my views on how to achieve them. I think democracy, liberty, equality, and constitutionalism are all good ideas, and many of the most interesting questions are about the best way to reconcile them.


In terms of political parties, I currently most closely align with the soft left of the Labour party in the U.K., though I‚Äôm rather hard to classify. Apparently (contrary to my claims in the previous section) I have some repressed masochistic inclinations because I‚Äôm still a Labour party member.


I am very much a feminist, mostly influenced by some ad hoc mixture of radical and intersectional ideas.


I am a culture wars irenicist, in that I think the culture war itself is bad and harmful. However, I am exasperated by both sides of these battles. Overall, my views are idiosyncratically radically progressive, but in some ways also quite culturally conservative.


I am very much a philosopher in every sense of the word (although please be very careful, because I am mildly allergic to metaphysics). Insofar as I have a philosophical project, it draws from the traditions of logical empiricism, subjective Bayesianism and Skyrmsian naturalism. And of course, I am very dedicated to physics (although our facebook relationship status is currently set to ‚Äúit's complicated‚Äù). I still lean towards some sort of hidden variables approach to quantum mechanics (in spite of my scientific anti-realism). I do see the appeal of an Everettian interpretation, but I have some deep, unresolved doubts.


Ethically, I have some sympathies with a utilitarian stance, but I may not be purely utilitarian. Decision theoretically, my views are not very settled, although I am not a naive causal decision theorist. Worryingly, I am not fully decided about whether that pushes me towards a sophisticated evidential decision theory, or some form of timeless decision theory. Either way, that means that my practical ethics looks a lot more deontological in practice than some utilitarians: I will cooperate in a twin prisoner‚Äôs dilemma!


I am ontologically atheist, tropologically spiritual and theologically noncognitivist.


I broadly align with the fundamentals of the rationalist, post-rationalist and effective altruist approaches. They are fonts of absolutely incredible ideas. That being said, I harbour quite severe doubts about the epistemic and social health of the movements themselves. 


Lists of Things
(The purpose of these lists is to give a flavour. They're not intended to be exhaustive!)
Literature
Contemporary:
Margaret Atwood; Hilary Mantel; Kazuo Ishiguro; Jorge Luis Borges; Ian McEwan; Haruki Murakami; Umberto Eco; Graham Greene; John le Carr√©.
Classical:
Fyodor Dostoyevsky; George Eliot; Thomas Hardy; Jane Austen.
Multigenerational civilizational fantasy and science fiction epics:
The Hainish Cycle; the Foundation series; A Canticle for Leibowitz; the Dune Series; A Song of Ice and Fire.


For a long time, ADHD made me a very slow reader. It wasn‚Äôt that I didn‚Äôt enjoy reading, but that I found it overly-exciting, and my mind would keep wandering off, stimulated by the ideas. In recent years, medication, audio books, and better mastery of my symptoms have helped a great deal, and I‚Äôve started consuming a lot more. But this means there are many gaps that I would like to fill.
Nonfiction
Godel, Escher, Bach; The Selfish Gene; Thinking Fast and Slow; Capital in the 21st Century; Seeing Like a State; Mathematical Games by Martin Gardner; Physics textbooks by David Griffiths, James Binney or James Blundel.
Music
Classical
Mozart; Beethoven; Bach; Sibelius; Jan√°ƒçek; Tchaikovsky; Bruckner; Mahler; Wagner (yes); Howells; Mendelssohn; Schubert; Prokofiev; Rachmaninov; Rimsky-Korsakov; Dvorak; Khachaturian; Byrd; Tallis; P√§rt; Poulenc; Pergolesi.
Symphonic/Power/Folk Metal
Nightwish; Turisas; Sabaton; Blind Guardian; Helion Prime; Dragonforce.
Miscellanea
A lot of jazz and related genres: Dave Brubeck, Miles Davis. Sometimes I become temporarily fascinated by other particular genres of music: classical Hindustani ragas, maqam, klezmer, isochronic tones, etc.


I used to play clarinet, violin and trumpet, and I did choral singing for a while. To my eternal shame, I haven‚Äôt kept up with these. But music remains extremely important to me, somewhere close to my soul.
Video Games
I play Age of Empires II online regularly with a group of friends (Elo ~ 1400 #humblebrag). Other games I enjoy or have enjoyed include:


Europa Universalis, Crusader Kings, Victoria; the Civilization Series; Cities Skylines; Rimworld; Factorio; Open TTD; Disco Elysium; Pentiment; the Baldur‚Äôs Gate series; Planescape Torment; Monkey Island; Grim Fandango; Chrono Trigger.


I tend to go through long periods of not playing any games. But when my mental reserves run to zero, sometimes some part of my brain rebels, and I become fixated on a game for a little while, before I recover.
Films
I don‚Äôt watch many. Some that I enjoy include: 


American Beauty; anything by Hayao Miyazaki/Studio Ghibli; Pan's Labyrinth; Schindler's List.
Broadcast media
I don‚Äôt consume very much broadcast media.


Carl Sagan's Cosmos; documentaries by Adam Curtis; Bryan Magee's wonderful interviews; most things on BBC Radio 4.
Youtube Channels
3Blue1Brown; PBS Spacetime; Kurzgesagt; CGP Grey; Maiorianus; Voices of the Past.
Blogs
Azimuth; Astral Codex Ten; A Collection of Unmitigated Pedantry; Stumbling and Mumbling; Mainly Macro; Noapinion; Shtetl-Optimized; whatever Wolfram is doing; Chartbook; Age of Invention; Scientific Discovery.
Food
I am almost entirely vegan and strictly vegetarian. Beyond that, I am fairly flexible. Some of my favourite foods include:


* Chocolate.
A Perfect Day
In the golden light of the dawn, I head to the gymnasium, its tall, firm Corinthian columns silhouetted against the morning sun. I debate with the other great philosophers as we watch the naked male youths wrestle in the palaestra. Their lithe forms glisten with perspiration, as they dance in tandem, mind and body in exquisite harmony. With the day's exertion done, I wander back to my oikos, where I am hosting a symposium, with all the foremost intelligentsia of the polis. We discuss the great unsolved mysteries of life, the Universe and everything, tiring away the sun with our talk. Finally, with our rhytons drained, the guests wander out into the evening's lengthening shadows. I fall into the smooth, strong curves of my beloved Antinous, resting my head against his slender ‚Äî yet exquisitely toned ‚Äî chest, and drift into the embrace of the still midnight... sorry, what were you asking again?
Contact Details
So you‚Äôve read everything up to here (well OK maybe not everything‚Ä¶). And you want to get in touch? Are you sure about that?


* ‚ÄúYes, now give me the contact details!‚Äù


If you would like to be friends or date, or something related, you can email me at:
dafidius [AT] gmail.com.


I like receiving messages from people. (Even if I don‚Äôt reply, I genuinely promise that I almost certainly enjoyed receiving your message! I have never received a response to this profile that I didn‚Äôt enjoy reading.) I‚Äôm very shy so you should probably message me first. But if you really don‚Äôt know what to write, you could just send a link to your own dating profile, thereby putting the onus on me.


You can find my manifold.love profile here.
You can also find my OKCupid profile here.
All my dating profiles (including this catastrophe of a date-me page) should be regarded as being ‚Äúunder construction‚Äù.


If you wish, you can add me as a friend on facebook here, although I don‚Äôt use the site very actively.


Finally, if you really want, you can see my academic website here. However, if possible, try not to send dating messages to my academic email addresses! [Warning: very out of date. I really need to update it, but I hate doing so.]


* ‚ÄúObviously I don‚Äôt want to message you! Someone like you.‚Äù


You might want to investigate these lists of dating profiles, which have a relatively high density of people I find interesting.


* ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to date or even be friends, but I really need you to read my 30,000 page THEORY OF EVERYTHING, explaining why Einstein Was Wrong and the Physics Establishment are suppressing my revolutionary ideas!‚Äù

The best way to get my attention is to email that to my special email address here. And I promise to get back to you just as soon as I‚Äôve finished reading your theory‚Ä¶


* ‚ÄúActually, I don‚Äôt want to contact you at all‚Ä¶‚Äù

Probably a good decision! You have gained 200 XP.

Name: Jay Geis
ProfileText:
ÔªøJay Geis
The Golden Knight
Email: jjgoldenknight@gmail.com
Twitter: @JayGeisGold
Steam: https://steamcommunity.com/id/ReturnoftheKnight/
My creed: Nobility, Heroism, Preeminence.


Most people don't have the attention span for a book, so I'll try to keep this comparatively brief; to further assist, paragraphs are organized in order of importance (most important at top). My personality is best described as energetic, enthusiastic, rational, daring, and brave (exactly what you imagine when you think of the word ‚ÄúKNIGHT‚Äù). Mom describes me as ‚Äúlively and loud‚Äù, and I appreciate someone who is very direct with me. I am a straight white male, 31 years old, with a thin build, and I'm attracted to natural beauty and inner strength, someone who's smart, cute, and tough. Don't lather your body with paints or inks or perfumes or piercings, stay away from smoking and drugs, show me a steadfast determination, and through that you'll have a solid first impression. Fortune favors the bold; be bold.


I have a reputation for a fighting spirit, with steely resilience against obstacles and an attitude that's quick to ask, "What do you expect me to DO about it". My primary interests involve martial arts, hunting, and video games that involve intense violence, meaning my fighting spirit can also be taken more literally; in the correct context, I do enjoy a fight. All themes say I am, figuratively, an absolute hawk, and I very much want someone who compliments that with natural synergy. This means that, so long as I'm by your side, you'll never have to worry about a dark creepy alleyway ever again (unless you specifically enjoy that sort of situation, in which case I'll accommodate you every step of the way).


What's important to me is finding a female partner and equal, not a pet. I do mean that both figuratively (i.e. not submissive or dominant, also not passive) and literally (i.e. I don't like cats, dogs, those kinds of pets). And I need someone who's able and willing to continue my biological legacy, so until genetic engineering becomes real, there's only one way to do that: old-fashioned penis-in-vagina sex. Between that and my hypersexual libido with sexual activity (including masturbation) measured on a daily scale, there's no getting around it: no sex, no partner. There's more to an intimate relationship than sex, but it is an essential element for me. Similarly, the most effective way to show you love me is by touch: hugging, rubbing, cuddling, tickling, and obviously sex are the most notable examples.


Personality compatibility is the difference between playmates and partners! I'd be satisfied having simple playmates for casual sex, but I still crave more; I want and need a truly intimate bond. If we end up being able to strike up compelling and thought-provoking conversation more times than not, that's absolutely a good sign. If it can be helped, don't respond with a couple words or a single sentence, try aiming for a paragraph or two. Give me something that'll make me think! And give me something that shows YOU are thinking! Good conversation is like Tennis: there's back-and-forth, each next reply building off the last answer. Ironic since I'm not a fan of the ball sports, but that's beside the point.


As far as what I fantasize about you as a person, I'm absolutely not picky about your body type or build (skinny, plump, average, Amazonian, or built like a mattress, none of that matters to me), and I'm not even very picky about the skin color (though white is preferred; I am white and do want white kids, but if it can't be helped, then it can't be helped; any legacy's better than nothing). In pure fantasy limited only by imagination, I'm attracted to masochism; I'm a known sadist who enjoys acute physical pain upon a cute female (i.e. biting, stinging, scratching, mild burning sensations, the list covers almost all magnitudes). I don't blame you if that scares you off, but if you get excited from the idea of playacting "Brave Wilderness: GIRL EDITION", there will be many racy adventures begging for us to explore!


In a perfect world, I wouldn‚Äôt necessarily mind being a stepdad, just make sure the kid wouldn‚Äôt mind having a half-brother or half-sister. That said, right now I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôm yet in a position to settle with a family as I‚Äôm still living like a teenager and I‚Äôm stuck so long as the work-life balance is pending. 


I think that's enough to get started. There's more to say, but I've been told it's best to leave some mystery left for you to find out. In short, I romanticize the ideal of ‚Äútwo halves to a whole‚Äù, like I‚Äôm seeking my other half. Let me know what you think, because the only wrong answer is [no answer].

Name: Antonia
ProfileText:
ÔªøAntonia‚Äôs Date Me Doc
  
  

Hi there! 


Read below for vibe-descriptions about myself and the relationship I‚Äôm looking for. 




Photos: 2023 (left & right)








Basics
* Woman, straight, born 1995.
* I live in Berlin. Other places I‚Äôve been living in >3 months: Hong Kong, London.
* Available in English and German (native German but prefer English for dating).
* 173 cm tall. Athletic build.
* Finishing my Master‚Äôs in Social Sciences and always busy with side projects/jobs.
* Pretty neurotypical.
* Looking for a committed primary / monogam-ish relationship with a man between 27-36 y/o.


  
  





Photos: 2023 (left & right)
________________
Photos: 2023 (left), 2024 (middle), 2024 (right)      


Hobbies, Interests, and details


* Community: Having a good community is super important to me and I invest significant time and energy into caring for my network of friends. I like to be proactive in organising and participating in social events, like to experiment with co-living, and learn about other ways to deepen relationships. Wholesome relationships deeply inspire me to become a better person and more engaged with life. 
* Doing Good: I care about the world and aspire to be altruistic and work towards reducing suffering. The EA philosophy resonates with me and I‚Äôve been involved in the community for some years, socially and via volunteering in various roles. Currently I‚Äôm figuring out what‚Äôs the best way for me to align my career with these values. 
* Veganism: I‚Äôve been vegan for >11 years and it‚Äôs somewhat important to me that people that I date pursue a cruelty-free lifestyle.
* Movement: I‚Äôve been physically active my whole life and I do something almost every day. Currently I do cycling (for transportation), yoga, olympic weightlifting, and crossfit regularly and do all sorts of other stuff occasionally (inline skating, powerlifting, calisthenics, trampoline, bouldering, dancing, tennis, snowboarding, skiing, obstacle mud races, ‚Ä¶). I‚Äôm fascinated by learning new movements and sports and am always interested to try new things. 
* Meditation: I‚Äôve been meditating daily for some years now and it‚Äôs become quite ‚Äúserious‚Äù in the sense that it‚Äôs not something I do instrumentally for any mental health, productivity, or whatever reasons but because the gravity of being alive is such a huge and fascinating thing to investigate that I have no choice but to look at it. It‚Äôs changing me for the better in a conventional sense as well. Besides meditation I also occasionally explore my mind through other means, like dancing, heat/cold exposure and so on. 


* Other activities I enjoy: Long conversations, clubs/rave, costume parties, building events/art, Burner culture, spending passive time with friends, meeting people to explore relating techniques/ meditation/ movement/ whatever (‚Äúworkshop culture‚Äù), consuming content for entertainment, knowledge, and learning (books, audio), going for walks (more rarely: hiking), playing video games, drawing.
* I‚Äôm politically left (on the European spectrum), liberal, and a feminist. Intellectually I‚Äôm somewhat post-rationalist. I‚Äôm compatible with both rationalists and hippies. 
* I drink and smoke very rarely (both ~2-4 times a year). Other substances are more interesting to me (e.g. psychedelics). I‚Äôm interested in drugs and read lots about it (history, current research, illegalisation and liberalisation, chemistry, etc.). I like intentional use and doing proper integration. 
  
  

  Photos: All 2024






Dating preferences


* Style: I‚Äôm looking for a nesting partner/life companion type relationship where the relationship between us is a clear priority. 
Could be either monogamous or a committed primary open relationship where there could be side romances but no relationships that would cause regular negotiation between us (i.e. it should be obvious that it‚Äôs us going on holiday together, attending friends‚Äô weddings together, building a life together etc.)
* Kids: I think I want kids eventually, not in the next 5 years but more likely after that (meaning it‚Äôs a deal breaker if you‚Äôre sure you don‚Äôt want kids). I want to share  childcare equally with my partner, so I strongly prefer someone who is aware and willing to make the relationship and lifestyle adjustments that come with raising children. Ideally, you‚Äôre excited about the prospect of being amazing co-parents one day. 
* Location: I‚Äôm not into long-distance relationships so you have to live in Berlin or adjacent accessible regions. Once in a relationship, I can imagine moving elsewhere together, with a preference for European capitals.
* Other preferences: Taller than me (this is actually quite important), non-smoker, no pets (negotiable), physically fit, kind, witty, self-aware, caring, wholesome, value-driven, somewhat eccentric, calm energy, curious.
* What we could do together: 
   * Exchange physical affection (this is important to me)
   * Exercise
   * Have deep conversations  
   * Problem-solve
   * Work on a creative project together
   * Meditate and share insights
   * Dance to loud bass-heavy music
   * Listen to podcasts or books, or even read to each other
   * Explore food - cooking or eating out
   * Host/attend events and parties
   * Travel
   * Go to burning man
   * Psychonauting
   * Appreciate art 
   * Relax and regenerate
   * Generally I like to be supportive, affectionate, and nurturing. I‚Äôll probably remember your appointments, support you in life logistics and your larger goals, and think about your problems. I appreciate it when you are interested in and supportive towards my goals, if you‚Äôre curious to meet my friends and family, and work to understand each others‚Äô worlds (that said, I obviously still appreciate certain individual boundaries and things in life that we do separately). 




Contact 
Reach me at @antoniabr on Telegram, antonia.82 on Signal, or email me at laremgruscht@live.de. 

Would be great if you include your own doc and/or some basic info about yourself plus some photos/links to socials :)

Name: Shir
Location: San Francisco Bay Area, NYC, Portland, NY, Flexible, Austin, North America
ProfileText:
ÔªøShir‚Äôs Date Me Doc
Last updated: April 2024
  

FYI: I found my person a while ago and am not on the dating market any more, but I‚Äôm always happy to make more Jewish friends in NYC :) Reach out if that‚Äôs you! I‚Äôve left the doc below mostly unedited regardless. It remains a good description of who I am and should give you plenty of info to decide if you‚Äôd like to say hi.


Hello and welcome! I'm Shir (‚Äúsheer‚Äù).


I‚Äôve compiled this doc for any folks who might be interested in going out, or are just curious to know more about who I am. I‚Äôm in the process of searching for a long-term (hopefully lifetime) relationship, and want to be upfront about who I am and what I‚Äôm looking for. That said, I‚Äôm open to all types of connections, so even if we‚Äôre not totally aligned, please reach out if you like what you read. Chances are I‚Äôd still be delighted to meet you. üôÇ
Who I Am


I'm 28 and currently living in Manhattan. My pronouns are they/them, with an occasional he/him. I‚Äôm pansexual, nonbinary transmasculine, and somewhere on the open relationship spectrum. I'm Jewish and, as OkCupid would say, it's important.


I'm a smart, introspective, affectionate, and adventurous person who goes out of my way every day to make my loved ones feel cared for and supported. I'm comfortable with hard conversations, interpersonal honesty, and admitting when I'm wrong. I make tech money but don‚Äôt spend excessively; I‚Äôm just as happy cooking basic meals at home as I am eating out. I'm adventurous, and will push both myself and you to do new things. And, I have some pretty awesome friends and a great worldwide community I'd love to introduce you to.


Some of my favorite things to do are go on long bike rides (50-100 miles), plan and attend events, and travel the world. I used to run the world‚Äôs largest My Little Pony convention, which attracted 10,000 people to Baltimore every year. I play lots of instruments, including upright bass in a band that does klezmer-style covers of video game music. I love learning new languages, especially when I travel to a country, and as a result, speak basic Mandarin, Spanish, and Arabic. I also speak pretty decent Hebrew. I refuse to learn French.


  

Pic from a trip to the Oregon Coast with friends (I‚Äôm on the right)


I‚Äôm a wandering spirit (cough I have ADHD cough), and have moved around some. I‚Äôve lived in Boston, Israel, Chicago, Seattle, Portland, and am now in NYC, most likely for the long run. I‚Äôve also tried out a couple different tech careers: developer, consultant, and product manager. I‚Äôm unlikely to want to stay in one place or do any one thing for long. I hope to find a partner who doesn‚Äôt consider that a bad thing, and would like to join me on these adventures.


  

Pic taken after a 70 mile solo ride followed by a food truck stop with friends.


I‚Äôm super social and enjoy spending a lot of time around others. In my book, the best evenings are the ones spent in good conversation with old friends, or at a house party meeting a bunch of new ones. I especially love connecting with other queer/trans Jews, but I get along with all sorts.


I think relationships work best when they have time to develop naturally. I‚Äôd love to be friends first for a couple months so we can get to know each other before we decide if we want to try dating.
Who You Are


You're a smart, caring, and adventurous Jew located in a city somewhere in the world. You‚Äôre in search of a long-term relationship with the expectation of marriage and probably kids.


You're somewhere on the open relationship spectrum. At the very least, you‚Äôre comfortable with the idea of your partner sleeping with someone else, and have a basic understanding of how one communicates about it. If you‚Äôre currently dating multiple people or poly-curious, you don‚Äôt envision yourself doing that forever.


You want to travel. You want to eventually settle down somewhere amazing and build a long-term local community. You want to keep exploring after you‚Äôve settled down.


You love to both talk and listen. You think about things deeply. You enjoy wordplay. You‚Äôre intelligent and enjoy teaching others about your passions. You have big goals for your future, even if you don‚Äôt consider yourself ‚Äúambitious‚Äù. You‚Äôre in touch with your feelings but not obsessed with them. You‚Äôre not a particularly anxious person; little things don‚Äôt stress you out.


Being Jewish is important to you. You understand that Judaism does not imply being particularly religious, spiritual, or believing in god. You want to build a Jewish home, be involved in a Jewish community, and raise your kids Jewish; in the way that ‚ÄúJewish‚Äù means to you. You approach the topic of Israel/Palestine with compassion and nuance and would rather discuss your thoughts in person than online. You‚Äôre fundamentally comfortable with Judaism, even if you‚Äôre not involved in a community right now.


You have a job. You have a dick. You're not a dick. If you like biking, that's a huge plus. I know you're out there and I'm manifesting you. Let‚Äôs meet up.


Reach out to me: hello@shirgoldberg.com.
Lifestyle


If you‚Äôre still reading and curious about whether we might be compatible, here‚Äôs some more info about how I live my life to see if it aligns with your preferences.


As mentioned above, I‚Äôm somewhere on the open relationship spectrum. I deeply value sexual and emotional freedom in my relationship, but I expect to have one and only one partner who I place above all else, plus a variety of close relationships with friends and lovers. Think more ‚Äúgay monogamy‚Äù, less ‚Äúhierarchical poly‚Äù. I‚Äôm currently in a relationship with my one (üíï) and not looking to seriously date anyone else, but I treasure the many other types of connections I have with folks. Happy to talk more about this in person!


I have celiac and need to eat gluten-free. Having a partner who understands my dietary needs and is happy to accommodate them is super important to me. If you research restaurants and find places I can safely eat, I‚Äôll love you forever. I eat everything aside from gluten and enjoy meat, dairy, sugar, and salt very much. (Especially bacon.)


I prefer going out and being around people to staying inside, and arrange my life accordingly. I often panic about social plans ahead of time, but I know I have fun once I go, so I rarely flake. I'm an extrovert who happens to also be rather socially anxious (contradiction #1?). I'm the planner in my friend group, which I find both stressful and energizing (contradiction #2?). I'm a lazy control freak (contradiction #3?). So I enjoy being the one to arrange all the details and make things go perfectly, but also find it somewhat tiring. I'd love to eventually share planner responsibilities with a similarly oriented partner.


I like alcohol ‚Äúthe normal amount‚Äù. I like weed much less than ‚Äúthe normal amount‚Äù. (No issues if you like it, it‚Äôs just a bad drug for me.) I enjoy psychedelics, primarily as introspective tools.


I like sex somewhere between ‚Äúthe normal amount‚Äù and ‚Äúa lot more than the normal amount‚Äù. üôÇ


I hate mornings but I‚Äôm trying to adjust my schedule to get up just a little bit earlier. I‚Äôm typically in bed by 12-1 AM and up by 8-9 AM. I care a lot about getting good sleep and enough of it. 


I only want to live in a city. I‚Äôm not limiting myself to any specific country or geographical region, but I refuse to live anywhere that would require me to own a car. I also hope to live somewhere with a large and diverse Jewish community, but can compromise on that part.


I keep my screen entertainment light and am not interested in a lifestyle that hinges on watching TV or playing video games most nights. I find it hard to turn my brain off for long enough to enjoy those things and usually feel meh afterwards when I do. I‚Äôm down for occasional content consumption with a partner who‚Äôs excited about it, but it doesn‚Äôt come naturally to me. I read books as my primary form of media entertainment‚Äîfun stuff like romance novels or psychological fiction. I‚Äôm allergic to reading non-fiction books, but long reads on the internet don‚Äôt count so my Substack subscriptions are out of control. Forwarding you newsletters I think you‚Äôll enjoy is my love language. Ask me what I‚Äôm reading, I‚Äôll always have a strong opinion on it.


I was raised Orthodox Jewish (yeshivish) and at age 18 went OTD, aka took a long and complete break from religion. I will never go back to being frum, but I‚Äôve learned over the years that I am inescapably and extremely Jewish, and that I‚Äôm so much happier when I embrace that identity instead of running from it. I spend a lot of time in Jewish communities, participating in Jewish activities, thinking about Judaism, and talking about it with others. Though I‚Äôm not observant (except in small doses), I prefer hanging out in communities that balance an Orthodox-esque approach to halacha with an acceptance of queer and trans people. Egal spaces tend to be a pretty good fit, but I‚Äôm still exploring what I want from Judaism these days and how that squares with my OTD identity and religious baggage.


I‚Äôm a Scorpio sun, Pisces moon, and Leo rising (let‚Äôs be Co-star friends!). I‚Äôm split between a 7 and 4 on the Enneagram (which tracks perfectly with the Scorpio sun and Leo rising - IYKYK). I think Meyers-Briggs is more ridiculous than horoscopes and don‚Äôt care to know my type (okay okay fine. it‚Äôs usually ENFJ with an occasional ENFP).


Dang, you‚Äôre still reading? Thanks for entertaining my doc for this long. And seriously! Feel free to say hi if you think we‚Äôd vibe üôÇ

Name: Omair
Location: Seattle, WA, Western US, North America
ProfileText:
ÔªøOmair‚Äôs Dating Doc
  
  
  
  
  
  
________________

Short version
Hi! I‚Äôm Omair ‚Äì pronounced mostly like it‚Äôs spelt, but there‚Äôs maybe a hint of nominative determinism in pointing out it‚Äôs like ‚Äúohm-air‚Äù since my background is in power/electrical engineering. I‚Äôm 27 years old, live in Seattle, work at a company I co-founded that works in validating electronics for space radiation. I‚Äôm looking for a probably monogamous relationship with a woman in the 24-30 y/o range.
Long version
Personality Traits
* Curious
   * Curiosity is very important to me. I‚Äôm interested in many things and I like to try and understand how everything around me works. It‚Äôs especially important for me to try and understand things from the simplest building blocks. You don‚Äôt have to be interested in what interests me, but I hope you‚Äôre deeply curious about everything that interests you!
* Ambitious
   * I feel like this is most true in my work, but shows up in other places. I am pretty driven to try and grow and make a successful company. I find it really fun to try to solve problems and compete in a competitive space, and kinda like the stress. I think in school this trait manifested itself in my immersion in student clubs
   * Sometimes I set weird goals for myself and try hard to accomplish them. One example is with athletic pursuits like ‚Äúeveresting‚Äù from my previous house, or trying to climb Washington‚Äôs bulger list 
* Reserved
   * Lean introverted and not crazy social, but I can somewhat turn it on in some scenes where I‚Äôm more comfortable. I don‚Äôt seek out regular bustling events, but I do occasionally go with friends and enjoy myself.  
* Independent
   * I want to spend regular quality time with my partner, but I‚Äôll still want to spend a bit of time alone
* Altruistic
   * Let‚Äôs just be good people


Standard dating stuff
* Religion
   * I am atheist, but am open to someone who is lightly religious or holds certain spiritual ideals. Probably won‚Äôt match well with someone who is very religious.
* Kids
   * Certainly not interested in the next 5 years, but more open to it down the road. I slightly lean against it right now, but really not sure how I‚Äôll feel about it in the future
* Identity/preferences
   * I identify as a cis male interested in a woman seeking a monogamous or primary partner. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm interested in a fully polyamorous relationship. I would be happy in a fully monogamous relationship, or with a primary partner who wanted some side romances
* Education
   * Undergraduate degree in mechanical engineering. Was a battery engineer at a few tech companies before moving to the radiation/space effects world.
* ‚ÄúVices‚Äù
   * Drink almost none day to day, but will occasionally drink socially
   * Experimental with drugs for cognitive stimulation (caffeine/nicotine type), but honestly kinda scared so I‚Äôm wary
      * didn‚Äôt even start drinking coffee regularly until 27 üôÉ
   * Not into other drugs, but open to someone who is into certain other drugs
   * I don‚Äôt smoke
* Physical
   * 6‚Äô tall
      * 6‚Äô4‚Äù wingspan+disproportionately long legs, which isn‚Äôt important in any way besides being kinda neat I guess
   * ~145lbs
   * I do almost no strength training besides indoor climbing ~weekly (aspirations to increase this), but do a fair bit of aerobic activity mostly outside
Hobbies and Interests
* Reading
   * Day to day I read a fair bit online. Mostly things like substacks, opinions, and some tech/world news. Sometimes even just wikipedia rabbit holes. I especially like reading books when traveling (which I do a fair bit for work). I feel like I‚Äôve done a really bad job at reading fiction as I‚Äôve gotten older, but I do like sci-fi. 
* Outdoor adventures
   * I ski, run, bike, and climb. I really enjoy my time in the mountains and it‚Äôs an important part of my life. That said, I think my friends assume this is a much bigger part of my life than I feel. I think this is maybe because I do more ‚Äúintense‚Äù things than average. In reality, I like to do big day trips in the mountains just to enjoy the time far from my house in the city, lost in thought in a pretty place
   * All this to say, it‚Äôs important that my partner is happy with me disappearing for 1-2 days in the mountains occasionally, but doesn‚Äôt need to share these hobbies.
* Riddles/puzzles/crosswords
   * Enjoy them more than I am good at them
* Making food
   * I used to very much not do this. Then, I lost a bet and had to make dinner for my house everyday for a month. I tried to do a different cuisine for as many of the days as possible. Now I like to dabble with cooking and baking 
   * Proof:
  
  

  
  

qed?
* New things!
   * I may not share your hobbies, but I‚Äôm happy to try (and possibly suck at) them
Interested?
Not convinced by dating docs yet, but they seem to be the best online method. I feel like these docs are still kinda weird and awkward, but they seem to be moving in a direction I like over match.com type apps. Standard disclaimer about how (online? all?) dating is scary and err towards messaging if you think we might get along. Get in touch by text at

Name: Watson Ladd
ProfileText:
ÔªøWhy should I date Watson?            


General info
Hi, I‚Äôm Watson. I‚Äôve lived  in Emeryville California and environs for a decade but I come from New Jersey.  I studied math at Chicago (class of 2013) and at Berkeley (graduated 2018).


More specific info
Looking for a long term nesting partner of any gender. I am a poly, kinky, switch, bisexual cis man open to having or adopting children.


When asked to give three words about me my long-term partner said ‚Äúeffusive, kind, gentle‚Äù. 


Spend a day with Watson


Currently I work from home. My work life balance is good. In the evenings I like to practice my ukulele, ride my bike, or watch a classic film at the Roxie.


I‚Äôve had the good fortune to have gone sailing with my father a bunch of times: including across the Pacific. I like to hike everything from evening walks in Claremont Canyon to multi day traverses of mountain ranges. I enjoy skiing at Kirkwood.


I sometimes go to science fiction conventions where I sing and play the ukulele, and sometimes perform my own songs or do covers of classic filk songs (Filk is the folk music of science fiction fandom)


I read really fast because I‚Äôm autistic and hyperlexic. I like to discuss literature and films and spend too much time on the Internet. I also play a lot of board games and DM my own D&D campaign.
Who you are
You are open-minded and supportive, creative, and caring. You are willing to take the time to get on the same wavelength, and you enjoy beautiful places, art, music, literature and terrible puns.
Why shouldn‚Äôt I date Watson?
Religion, sex, and politics
Religion: I‚Äôm Jewish and it‚Äôs very important to me. I go to a synagogue on many Friday nights, and aspire to learn to read Torah and Aramaic to study Talmud. I don‚Äôt keep Shabbat, or kosher, and I am willing to touch people of other genders. I am mostly a cultural Jew but I do like to be active in my local Jewish community.


Sex: I am bisexual, poly, kinky, and switchy, 20/80 top/bottom. I love rope and impact play. I would love to expand my skill set and am open to going to events and classes together.

Politics: I‚Äôm a right Heglian now, after a misspent youth pursuing Trotskyism in the form of Postonian Freudo-Marxism. A far cry from the logical atomism someone said I radiated early in my college career. I vote democratic and am involved in local YIMBY (yes in my backyard) activism.
Mental health
I am more motivated to do things when my friends or partners are involved. I have a lot of inertia towards projects or plans that only involve myself. Nevertheless when I have the energy I‚Äôll happily go out and plot adventures for a whole group of friends.


I can react strongly, especially when things are going wrong, as well as find it hard to ask for help and sometimes beat myself up.. The best way to snap me out of it is to be kind to me and offer a hug.
Physical health
I have a rare genetic disorder that makes small bumps on my face and scalp. If you zoom in on the photos you can see them. They are harmless and easily treated. I am also very tall (6‚Äô 4‚Äù) but am fairly agile and I enjoy weight lifting and biking. I am happy to reach things on high shelves.
Other relationships
I have a long distance partner I‚Äôm emotionally close to and visit several times a year for a week or so at a time. She also visits me. I date two other people at irregular intervals and have been for a long time.
Location
I live in paradise (Northern California) , and see no reason to change it.
How to find Watson
My email is watsonbladd@gmail.com, or text me at 201-213-9379, FB messenger or Signal work better than email: my inbox is often crowded.

If I don‚Äôt respond, please text again. I want to hear from you.

Name: Gina Stuessy
ProfileText:
ÔªøGina Stuessy‚Äôs Dating Profile
Last updated: July 2024 / minorly Jan 2025
About Me
Basics
I‚Äôm a straight woman, poly, living in Berkeley, California with my 16-yr-old cat and a (human) housemate.
I‚Äôm mostly looking for a primary partner, but would start any relationship out casually/see if we get along as friends. I don‚Äôt want to have kids‚Äîopen to trying out being with someone who already has them, though. Not interested in dating people outside of the SF Bay Area, i.e. starting to get to know each other only virtually.
I work in operations and finance, currently (and for 9 years) at Animal Charity Evaluators. Was previously a software and applications engineer.
  
  
  
     
These are from Nov 2020 (sea lions!), May 2022, June 2022 (climbing), Oct 2022 (staff retreat in D.C.), and June 2023 (trip to Mendocino, CA), in that order. There are more pictures on Facebook.
More Details
People close to me have recognized that I‚Äôm especially: (i) curious‚Äîabout people and ideas, ‚Äúgearsy thinking‚Äù, one called it, (ii) literal, (iii) trustworthy‚ÄîI generally do what I say I will, and (iv) caring. So if you‚Äôre a very private person or need me to get all your complex metaphors, it probs won‚Äôt work out. Myers-Briggs (but from almost a decade ago): ISTJ
What‚Äôs most important to me; unlikely to change:
* Involvement in effective altruism (since 2013)
* Involvement in animal advocacy (since 2011)
* Getting outside quite frequently
* Staying relatively healthy, e.g. through regular exercise, decent diet, and taking mental health seriously
* Seeing friends and family
* Cryonics
* Non-religious
* Making lists :)
Some current hobbies and interests:
* Climbing indoors and outdoors, hiking, tennis
* Singing
* Variety of social events: games, parties, small gatherings, hosting themed dinners
* Travel, especially to a new country once or twice a year
* Podcasts, articles, books on psychology, economics, critical thinking, rationality
What I Want in Relationships
I‚Äôm mostly looking for a long-term primary partner, but would start any relationship out casually/see if we get along as friends. I‚Äôm also open to shorter-term and/or less serious dating.[1] I‚Äôll describe what I‚Äôd like for each type of relationship in the sections below.
Primary Partner
This is what I‚Äôd like to be heading toward eventually, though some pieces (like values alignment) are more likely to be there from the start.
Values alignment: I‚Äôd like a long-term partnership where we are quite aligned on values like effective altruism, and where we‚Äôre both working on something that is expected to be pretty high-impact.
Love, support/growth: We would support each other emotionally, and also actively encourage and support each other in reaching our goals to become happier, stronger, better people living in alignment with our values. We would have a lot of love and care for each other, and show our love physically, through words, and by spending time together (and maybe other ways!). We‚Äôd celebrate each others‚Äô joys and be there to support each other during tough times.
Communication: We would be honest, open, and have meta discussions about our relationship and ways we can improve it. Giving and receiving feedback can be stressful, but we would learn how best to communicate critical feedback in ways that lessens or eliminates the hurt the other person feels (which could be specific to the person).
Commitment, security: In a serious relationship, we‚Äôre both really willing to put in work to keep the relationship good, or to work through a set back, whether it be about the relationship or one of our own struggles. We would share what we need from each other in order to feel secure in our relationship. Even little things (like appreciating time spent together) can make a big difference.
In tune, emotionally aware: We would stay updated on what is going on in each other‚Äôs lives, e.g. so that we can proactively support each other. We would notice and be able to read each other‚Äôs emotions to an increasing extent, and respond appropriately.
Logistics: I‚Äôd like to live together with a primary partner, and I currently like living in the SF Bay Area. I don‚Äôt want kids. I‚Äôd really like it if we didn‚Äôt have meat or eggs in our place.[2] 
Some preferred activities:
* Cuddle ~daily
* Exercise together weekly or more
* Travel together (especially places where we can see wildlife)
* Try out new activities together
* Discuss interesting things we‚Äôve read/learned
* Work on an intellectually-stimulating project together
* Do stuff with friends together
Likes in a partner:
* Has at least some experience with long-term relationships (my two longest: over fifteen years and about four years)
* Working on something you believe is really important for improving the world
* Vegan
* 27‚Äì48 years old (though this isn‚Äôt a strict range)
* Has some interests/activities in common
* Attempts to live relatively healthy
üö©Red flags for primary partners üö©:
* Smoking cigarettes
* Strong belief in pseudoscience things like astrology and healing from crystals
* Wanting to keep gun(s) at our place (if we lived together)
* Often being easily agitated or aggressive
Shorter-term and/or Less Serious Dating
I‚Äôm also open to less serious dating, and don‚Äôt need as much alignment with people I date less seriously. Just communicate about what sort(s) of relationships you want, if you know :) 
Connect With Me
If you‚Äôd like to get to know me better or just have something to say to me after reading this, feel free to Facebook message me or text/WhatsApp/Signal at +1 608-446-2243.
Share With Someone
Link to share easily: bit.ly/dategina 
________________
[1] Also, what I want may change! I could meet someone great who has in mind a different type of relationship, and I might be open to exploring that with them. I‚Äôve learned from past partners and my own experience that people often don‚Äôt know exactly what they want.
[2] With the exception of cat food, until I can buy cell-cultured meat for her.

ÔªøHi, I am Jess üòÅ


Glad you found your way to my date-me.doc. Sit back, relax, and let me take you on this journey that is me! 


The basics: 
Age: 36
Height: 5‚Äô3‚Äù
Location: Manhattan, NYC
Build: Fit leaning Curvy (I am a Latina üôÇ)
Hair: Red-ish
Eyes: Green
Education: BA in International Relations, Masters in International Business
Job: Senior Program Manager at a famous tech company
Looking for: a monogamous relationship with a (straight or heteroflexible) men
Relationship stats: Never married, looking for a serious long-term relationship (hopefully marriage)
Kids: None. I don‚Äôt want any, however, it will not be a deal breaker if you have them - as long as you are a good dad!


Oh, hey, here is a quick visual!
  



Are you still with me? Great! Let‚Äôs get into more details!




The things you will ask me on a first date:
I was born and raised in Brazil and left in 2010 to get my master's degree. Since then I have lived in 4 countries, traveled to 60, and have been in New York City since 2016. 


As you can probably tell, I travel a lot - mostly for fun. I am fascinated by history and always want to learn more and different things, that is why I try to avoid repeating destinations. I am a proud owner of three driver's licenses, two citizenships, and one permanent residency card - you will need your own TSA-Pre, Global Entry and Clear to join me!


But don‚Äôt worry, I own my apartment so I don‚Äôt plan to pick up and leave the city anytime soon (my friends made me pinky promise, so you know it is serious). 


Here is what I like doing for fun: pilates, going to Broadway shows, museums, concerts, trying new restaurants and bars, drinking Champagne (I am a certified expert) and going out to dance. I also need some downtime, where I mostly spend my time reading books (romances) and TV shows (mostly heartwarming/fun stuff).


I am very career driven and I want a partner that understands and supports that. It is important to me that you are passionate and ambitious about something that matters to you. I am also a woman, Latina and immigrant, so I am very liberal and a feminist, and you will have to be too. 


I am alcohol friendly and I am ok with any other pastimes (420, Cigars etc) - if you do them only once in a while. On a somewhat related topic, I like my men like I like my ice cream - not vanilla. üòâ


Now a word from my sponsors (aka my friends who I asked to write this): 


From C (knows me for 10 years): My first impression of Jessica was that she is very confident, ambitious, and bad-ass and while all of those things are very true, she‚Äôs also one of the most loyal, kind, empathetic and thoughtful people I know. If she loves you, she loves you at your best and your worst, she boosts you up when you f*ck up - and helps you see through the clouds when you feel gloomy. She will give to you, so make sure you do the same for her. Bonus points if you have a doggo she can dote on too. 


From K (knows me for 7 years): Thank you C, I wholeheartedly second everything you said! <3 Jess also brings an incredible sense of adventure and sparkle to everything she does. Whether it‚Äôs a night in or a grand holiday, she is always fully engaged in the present - learning the traditional custom here, exploring a developing interest there, or giving you her full attention when you need a shoulder. She has the most incredible heart for service and truly cares about making those around her feel seen, cared for, and valued. This woman is a rare find. Trust me gents, she is the one!     


What I‚Äôm looking for in a partner (yay - that might be you!)
You are consistent, respectful and reliable. You are happy on your own and are looking for a partner that will add to your life. You want a serious relationship and potentially see yourself getting married. You have a good job with career progression, have disposable income for 2+ international trips a year, and live by yourself. You want someone to plan your vacations for you so you just show up with your passport and credit cards to the airport. You live in NYC, or are willing to relocate here. 


How do I get in contact with you?
I would love for you to reach out to me via this form. I promise to get back to you! 


And here are some more pictures!!!

Introduction
My name is Paul, a single man looking to find a girlfriend. While there are many dating apps to choose from, I feel like using this page to find potential dating partners would help to circumvent the algorithms that may one day turn into a real life Skynet or Ultron. The contents of this site are meant to be available for the public, and all visitors are encouraged to pass this site onto others through appropriate channels.
Facts About Me
I was born in Northern California in 1980, though I look like I am much younger.
I am a single heterosexual cisgender man who has never been married.
I have no children, but would like to have them.
I am an atheist.
My nationality is American, ethnicity is Thai, and race is Asian.
I relocated to New York City in 2007 in order to gain new and interesting experiences.
I earned a BA degree from UC Davis and an MBA degree from Baruch College.
I have a career in software engineering.
I have no dietary restrictions and am usually willing to try new foods as long as they are reasonably safe to eat.
I do not smoke, and will occasionally drink alcohol with others.
I am 5 feet 10 inches tall (or 1.778 meters).
Funner Facts About Me
I have never had a pet of my own, but I do like cats because of their more independent nature.
Regarding bubble tea, I tend to choose the low or no sugar options in order to better appreciate the flavors of the other ingredients.
While I enjoy blockbuster action movies, I also enjoy movies that can meaningfully highlight and discuss important historical events or issues, especially if done using a less common perspective.
I have only played Cards Against Humanity once and won, which technically gives me a 100% win rate.
I once shook President Bill Clinton‚Äôs hand, which helped to give a slightly more real feel to him instead of Clinton being just another prominent person on television.
What I Offer for a Dating Partner
A good balance between going out, staying in, and individual time.
A willingness to explore new things like food, art, concerts, and other such activities.
The opportunity to cultivate a positive relationship that can serve as an example for others to follow.
Respect for one‚Äôs ability to take ownership of their life and decisions.
The opportunity to ‚Äúhave it all‚Äù with regards to a career and having children.
Reliability and trustworthiness, as friends have noticed in their relationships with me.
What I Am Looking For
The following are various traits and qualities that can help to describe what I am looking for in a dating partner:
Monogamous, and currently single woman
Never married before, but willing to get married to the right man
Have no children, but desires to have at least two children with the right husband
Either reside in the Greater New York City area or be willing to relocate here within a reasonable amount of time
Go Out On A Date
If you would like to consider going out on a date with me, feel free to provide some basic information
here
.
Additionally, the materials presented here are meant to be available to the public. If you feel that communicating this site to others would be of benefit to the recipients, feel free to share it using any appropriate means.

ÔªøDate Me Doc                                                                         Last edited: 2023-09-17




Hey, I‚Äôm Ross Mazur!
Welcome to the doc - feel free to skim the bold and read deeper as fit. Photos are at the bottom.


Quick Stats
* Male
* 31 years old (Taurus)
* 6‚Äô-0‚Äù tall
* Grew up in central NJ ‚Üí 4 yr in Upstate NY ‚Üí 2 yr in IA ‚Üí 3 yr in WA ‚Üí 3 yr in CO ‚Üí WA
* Work in Mukilteo (30 min N of Seattle)
* Vegetarian for >10 yrs  - considering broadening my horizons
* Raised Jewish, don‚Äôt currently associate with or practice religion
* Liberal but also free-thinking and respect folks with other ideologies
* Open to kids


In short, I‚Äôm looking for
A female monogamous life partner, who lives in, or frequents the Seattle area.


________________
About You
This isn‚Äôt so much about me as it is you :) 
Below are some ideas, not criteria.


You feel a responsibility to make the world a better place socially or environmentally. Whether that be through application of business to tackle a problem, or are in policy, or at a non-profit, or through volunteerism, or are in the process of developing a plan to do so (I get that some folks want financial independence before dedicating themselves to the cause). This motivation is a key driver for you, and something that you consider often.


You are self-aware and are comfortable talking about your feelings and communicating generally. Down to shoot me straight and provide feedback before something becomes a problem.


You like to cuddle. You are OK without significant PDA.


You are active and think about health. You feel similarly that outdoor time and exercise are mentally grounding, and do these reguarly. You like to eat your veggies, and sometimes like to eat your wheaties (high-energy foods).


You know what makes you happy, and pursue that. You can take genuine interest in a wide range of topics.


You are a free-thinker, and have the ability to pull personal biases to the side to logically assess a perspective or situation.


________________
About Me
The world is a beautiful place, and I want to learn how every aspect of it works.


Since middle school, I have been passionate about addressing environmental and ecological problems. My perspective on these problems and means of addressing them has evolved significantly over the past 15+ years.


I spend a lot of time in motion outside, it is meditative / grounding / calming. Also like to push myself physically.


I do enjoy planning, but often have analysis paralysis, so can be an inefficient decision maker. That said, I love tackling small challenges. For example: We‚Äôre about to have 20 people show up for this event in 2 hours but don‚Äôt any theme-relevant decorations, hors d'oeuvres, or any chairs for them to sit in.


Wear a bunch of hats at work - on paper am a program manager, but also a process engineer, construction PM, life-cycle assessment practitioner, manufacturing facility maintenance manager, site safety lead, and financial planner. Master of none. Sometimes struggle with work-life balance.


For many years I had legit hobbies: involvement the world of traditional teas, gardening and CSAs, permaculture, fruit tree and orchard management, gleaning, foraging and fruit exploring, but slowed these the past few years. I am in the process of re-exploring these and new ones, particularly with a service component.


Benefits of dating me
* Emotionally available
* Honest and upfront
* Love to cook and clean
* Will take interest in your hobbies
* Have a lot of love to give
* Like doing gross chores - happy to pull goop out of strainer, roto-root scuzz out of sink drain, and clean the toilet.
* Will catch your spiders and bring them outside
* Will bring snacks
* I will tear it up on the dance floor with you


What you‚Äôll be putting up with
* Someone who gets ants in their pants and needs to go outside or on a walk/bike/jog
* Often overly logical - some things in life just don‚Äôt benefit from having logic applied to them
* Good at thinking one step ahead - bad at thinking 2+ steps ahead
* I‚Äôm better at giving than receiving
* I eat a lot
* Although I love cleaning, I tend to wait until there will be physical accomplishment from doing a cleaning activity
* I may go too hard on the dancefloor
________________
Photos
  

I love toasting - it‚Äôs a great challenge to concisely say something moving
