Name: Ben Weinstein-Raun
ProfileText:
ÔªøBen Weinstein-Raun‚Äôs Dating Doc
(Last update: October 2024)
  
  
  
  

(Photos are in chronological order: the last is the most recent, taken in October 2024)
Hi! I‚Äôm Ben. I‚Äôm kind-of leisurely seeking a life partner.
Basic Stats
Age
	32
	Height
	5‚Äô11‚Äù
	Weight
	250lbs
	Location
	Berkeley
	Relationship type
	Solo poly, but in the long run probably want something closer to monogamy
	Gender
	Cis man (tbh if ‚Äúhacker‚Äù were a gender I‚Äôd probably be that instead)
	Sexual Orientation
	About 90% straight; dominant. Have some kinks, and like exploring, but not a kink-essentialist. I am actively into / not-threatened-by intelligence and competence in partners. If I have a ‚Äútype‚Äù, it‚Äôs probably slightly androgynous women.
	Basic personality / identity facts
	Non-dogmatic, open, kind, problem-solving-oriented and ~75th percentile neurotic. I think humanity is massively underprepared for AI, and am working on that.
	Links
	https://www.benwr.net
https://facebook.com/benwr
https://twitter.com/benwr
https://benwr.posthaven.net
https://forms.gle/kVk74rqzfMh4Q2SM6 (use ^this form^ to contact me if you don‚Äôt want to use facebook or twitter)
	All other details (sex stuff, test scores, personality typing systems)
	Available on request (seriously; especially wrt sex stuff, I‚Äôm happy to share, just not in this doc)
	

What I‚Äôm looking for
Right now, I‚Äôm fairly happy with my ~stereotypical bachelor-y life, but am feeling pretty ready to settle down if I can find the right person. I live in a rationalist group house with a bunch of cool people. I have one current partner; eventually, I hope to find myself in an extremely trusting / loving / comfortable romantic relationship, but I‚Äôm not in a huge hurry. My imagination paints this relationship as monogamous, but I‚Äôm not fundamentally opposed to polyamory in the long run (and in the short run I probably don‚Äôt want to jump straight into a monogamous partnership). I‚Äôd like to have kids, but probably not for at least 18 months.
Some personality traits are very important to me in a partner: compassion, open-mindedness, and general wholesomeness are almost prerequisites for me to want to date someone. It‚Äôs a huge bonus if you also want to talk about random intellectual bullshit.
About me
I often actively seek honest feedback from people, so I have a pretty good selection that you can peruse if you want. See Appendices A and B. My basic augmented summary:
* I like making things, and I‚Äôm good at it
* I‚Äôm like 99th+ percentile principled, kind, thoughtful, and sincere
* I apologize too much, and focus too much on not-imposing on others, rather than on e.g. doing fun things. Relatedly, I am kind of persnickety, especially about where I spend social effort.
* I‚Äôm a good teacher, and love nerding out about things. Sometimes I can go a bit overboard.
I‚Äôd also add:
* Since early 2022, when I was hospitalized for an infection, my health has been vaguely (but very annoyingly) bad. I‚Äôve gained a lot of weight, had serious problems with my digestion, and have been tired all the time.
   * Around the same time, I was diagnosed with depression (possibly related to the fatigue).
   * This has been sporadically improving since about June 2023. I seem to have much more energy, and my digestive issues are now intermittent rather than constant.
* I am very into good coffee shops.
I currently don‚Äôt do illegal drugs, but not because I‚Äôm opposed to them; I hope to resume very occasionally using psychedelics in about two years. See Appendix C for details about this.
Career-wise, I‚Äôm focused on trying to ensure that humanity survives at least a few more decades. My background is in computer science and engineering, and I worked on self-driving cars and lab automation for genomics, before switching to trying to address risks to humanity from artificial intelligence, starting in 2017. Since then I‚Äôve done lots of things; some AI-related and some aimed at biological risks. Right now I‚Äôm working at Palisade Research, on demonstrations of AI failures, and also as acting director of AI Impacts.
Some random bragging
I‚Äôm really good at writing code. I used to do it competitively in college. I also designed and wrote big chunks of the software that's running the Cruise self driving cars.
In 2020 I solved an open problem in distributed systems (related to how one would write a piece of software like Roam or Workflowy as a "conflict-free replicated datatype"). I haven't published it because writing up the proof would be more trouble than it's worth, but I did get confirmation from the leading guy in the subfield that my solution works.
In May 2023, in a fit of frustration, I invented the ‚Äúwhiskey cleanse‚Äù, which seems to have successfully solved my year-long serious digestive issues, which my doctor had been unable to solve.
I‚Äôm pretty good at sex. Of the six partners I‚Äôve had, two have said that I was their best partner to date (both from pools of 7-10 partners). One kink (sorta) that I will mention, is that I really like being especially competent, and ensuring that my partner is having a great time. I definitely don‚Äôt want to promise that we‚Äôd have great sex, since I haven‚Äôt really subjected this to any selection pressure before, and the kind of people who date me are, by definition, the kind of people who date weird nerds (who might in turn be unusually bad at sex). But I think my track record is pretty good, at least.
Appendix A: Anonymous feedback
Some anonymous feedback I‚Äôve received in the last few years, via this feedback form:
* I appreciate the sense of togetherness I feel when around you. It's like you're holding a certain kind of space for the world to just be as it is, and not to have to act according to a social script or put up a facade.On the flip side, I think you apologize too much. There are ways an apology can serve as a kind of shield that hides the acknowledgement of what happened. When you apologize I often feel most alone around you, like you've retreated into your shell.I'm glad you are who you are.
* I think you underestimate how much people like you and how much they value your company.
* Ben WR#... Engineering Type Pok√©monBens can be found in the area surrounding the San Francisco Bay.Strengths: * I really admire your dedication to your principles. You are dedicated even by the standard of effective altruists, which is impressive. There are ways in which you could be more dedicated, but this is still one of my favorite things about you. * I like the way you go about thinking about "engineering" type problems. You aren't afraid of the complexity the way I sometimes am, and are are even curious about it. * You are great at being a socratic duck.Weaknesses: * It seems like you've developed some scars after a rough time getting up to speed at MIRI. Adding more speculation to the already speculative armchair psychoanalysis, these scars hold you back from diving into to your work to the extent you did at Cruise. It's plausible that now's a good time to renew your attempts to resolve these scars.
* great guy.
* You are often an effective teacher with a good amount of patience.
Appendix B: Anonymized feedback from people who know me especially well
I ran a birthday ‚Äúdooms & destinies‚Äù conversation on chathamroom.com (a web site I made) for my 31st birthday, in late November 2022. I invited the 15 people who know me best (apart from my family), including 2 ex-partners and 1 current partner, to contribute any thoughts or advice they had for me (without revealing which of the 15 said what). Here are most of the things they said (leaving out some that don‚Äôt make sense without more context):
* You are easy for me to feel warmly toward, and to care about, and to expect care from, and to expect to have be able to care about other people. I think this is really great. It seems kinda rare among my friends, or among Berkeley people.
* You are an attentive and sincere and intelligent conversation partner, and talking to you is in a nice way like talking to myself, more than for most people. It's probably important that you are reasonable and I trust your judgment a lot. And also that I think you rarely misunderstand me. It feels like we can talk with a lot of precision.
* You don't work with imperfection well. It seems like you need to fix imperfections that somehow shouldn't bother you‚Ä¶ [On the other hand,] You don't pretend that things are perfect when they're not. You don't accept things are good when they don't seem so to you. You believe in concrete paths forward to better things that you, personally, could start on today
* You seem to want to trade or commensurate in an unusual way when it comes to human relationships. Like, "I don't want to do X when talking to people. But it seems like I should be able to do Y instead [in conversation or elsewhere in life] and still get Z??". I don't know if this possible, but it seems like it's not working for most Z
* You are kind. It seems like your kindness goes first to the rejected and ashamed. You are not a fair-weather friend.
   * +1. I also appreciate this about you.
   * Yes, I would never worry that Ben would not want to hang out with me/care for me because I 'became less cool' or was depressed or something, he feels very dependable and loyal.
*  you are good at making things! This is great.
   * Relatedly, you are good at imagining the world in ways that it is not, and thinking them through, and good to talk to re this.
* you have a kind of trust in your own ability to do things that I admire, and that I wish more people had. This is probably related to the person who said "you are good at making things!". In me it sits as a kind of self-trust, and I admire it and see it as a source of strength and grounding.
   * +1 because I think this actually rubbed off on me some when we were working on something together and it's been a net positive in other parts of my life.
   *   Yes I like this a lot about Ben. And in particular I think you do this in a way that doesn't make other people feel inferior/inadequate, you're being competent very much for yourself rather than performatively
   *   I also find it both adorable and inspirational how much you are excited and nerdy about making and solving and building things
* I think you tend to over-identify with things? With certain groups of people and identities but also with specific behaviors and struggles in a way that can be self-fulfillling
* You decline a lot of invitations, but ask that you still be invited to the next thing, because you are actually interested but something is going on. This only works for so long. Ive seen people stop inviting you despite the requests because it gets old. As a destiny, which you do actually show up, you are a lot of fun to be around.
   * my sense is that you get a lot out of being with other people (i.e. are not fundamentally a loner type person, at least in ways) but are often relatively alone because specific opportunities are bad in ways. But you then don't often cause social things yourself that would be good. My guess is that doing so is costly and not immediately worth it, but I wonder if it would lead to a better overall part of the landscape if you got an affordance for it.
* I think Ben is very broadly likable. I don't recall hearing of a person saying they have negative sentiment toward him in general, and people often seem to have positive sentiment.
   *   Yes, I think Ben is broadly regarded as a sweetheart and very nice to have around
* I appreciate how much integrity you have
* You're very generous with your time and efforts - I really appreciate times you've e.g. helped drive me to places, helped me solve technical problems, etc
* You have too many preferences and/or pay too much attention to small preferences; on the margin, I think you should prioritize 'being ok with a wider range of things; learning to ignore annoyances or appreciate different kinds of things' over 'changing things to suit your preferences'. I can try to think of examples if that's unclear as it is.
* You are a great teacher. I think this is a related to other destinies of groundedness about your competence, intrinsic interest in doing things, patience and gentleness and attentiveness with other people. You are very good at explaining things, sharing interest and excitement about them, not making the recipient feel dumb for not knowing stuff already, making it feel easy to ask questions, providing positive reinforcement for sharing confusion and questions, making people feel like a good student. It seems like you also enjoy teaching. I think this is an asset in life in general even if you don't make it an explicit part of your career, but I think you could consider trying to take advantage of this even more.
* You score the highest of almost anyone I know on some kind of social attentiveness to imposition/inconvenience/asking things of people. This makes you very considerate and sweet, but I think it can also cause unnecessary suffering for you and others. I do think the underlying trait is definitely an asset, but you can probably shape it into something that involves less negative affect‚Ä¶ almost all of your apologizing is for things where there isn't anything in particular I would have wanted you to do differently). I don't think this is hugely important - I see this overall thing as an endearing trait that's part of what makes you such a sweetheart, but seems like it causes you a bit more pain than is necessary.


Appendix C: Why I temporarily don‚Äôt do drugs
I want life insurance, in order to sign up for cryonics. I refused to lie on the application, despite my insurance agent‚Äôs preference that I do so. I learned that if you‚Äôve done any illegal drugs other than marijuana in the last five years, and are stupid/stubborn enough to tell them so on the application, they just will not insure you no matter what. So I‚Äôm now about three years through a five-year drug-free period.
I‚Äôve written a bit about my approach to honesty, which results in my unwillingness to lie to the insurance company.

Name: Ryan McGuine
ProfileText:
ÔªøRyan‚Äôs Dating Profile!


Dating profile? What‚Äôs up with this- why not just use the apps? 


I noticed lots of people I follow on Twitter were making these. Yes, I know it‚Äôs a bit awkward to read (imagine how awkward it was to write!), but let‚Äôs lean into that! I think it seems like an interesting way to share more information than is typically permitted by dating apps. 


Twitter user @chanamessinger has started a twitter thread with a number of examples, and @FerrisHueller wrote about the merits of similar documents.
tl;dr
  
  
  



Ryan McGuine


Age: 28
Gender: Male
Location: Currently Kansas City, MO
Monogamy?: Yes 
Wants kids?: Eventually, but in no hurry
Looking for: Eventually something long-term, but also cool with casual dates, wedding invites & generally eager to be surprised!
About you
Not ‚Äúrequirements‚Äù, but any of these is a very strong plus for me!




Personal & professional ambition: You place importance on constantly improving your professional life, as well as mental & physical health. 


Pragmatic competence: You can take on practical tasks and you‚Äôre good with logistics.


Intellectual spark: You‚Äôre sharp, intellectually lively, and curious. Big points for any regular habit of consuming books or audiobooks, blogs, podcasts, YouTube videos, etc.


Comfortable being uncomfortable: You are ok feeling uncomfortable for a period of time ‚Äì including but not limited to spending long stretches outdoors, or visiting countries very different than America.
About me
  
  

I am a mechanical engineer at an infrastructure construction company based in Kansas City, and I write essays about topics related to sustainability and global development on my blog, Sustaining Capabilities. While I sometimes stay in reading or working, I generally prefer doing things out of the house in my freetime. Examples include visiting with friends, being active outside, trying new restaurants, or attending live music and sporting events.  I will sample nearly all music and movie types- I enjoy consuming content with a reasonable amount of mass or critical acclaim, and trying to at least appreciate what others love about it.


I have done a reasonable amount of international travel and camping, but have fallen out of routine on them lately. I‚Äôd like to do more of each in the near future. I used to consume a lot of nonfiction explainer podcasts and YouTube videos, trying to ‚Äúunderstand‚Äù the larger world around us, but have gradually become more interested in fiction, as well as learning about psychology, relationships, and leadership. Along those lines, I aspire to develop a regular habit of meditation, and generally be more introspective.


I‚Äôm not in a hurry to start a family immediately, but have become gradually more certain that it is something I want to do. At the moment, I am focusing on my trajectory (career, social life, and being active), so that I do not feel like I missed out on anything, and that I have a financial base solid enough to simultaneously continue saving for retirement, continue living a decent life, and save for college funds when I‚Äôm ready for children.
What next?
If this sounds intriguing: fill out this form to go on a date some time, or send me a Twitter DM!


Just reach out, or get a mutual friend to introduce us! My threshold for first dates is fairly low- I'd rather test the chemistry quickly than spend lots of time texting.


I want a partner in the long term, but no pressure! If we hit it off but not romantically, I'm glad to be friends as well.
Want to make a similar profile? 


Go for it! Dropbox Paper is decent for this because the formatting is nice, but you can use Google Slides, Google Docs, or anything else you like.


If you‚Äôre on twitter, you can write a single tweet, or a tweet thread! Alternatively, just quietly link this from your twitter profile. 


You don‚Äôt have to post this publicly- just have your friends send it to people they think might be compatible.

Name: Isabel Hasse
ProfileText:
ÔªøI am 24 years old, cis female, 5‚Äô6‚Äù and 145 pounds.


I am looking for a relationship with deep emotional intimacy, lots of time spent together, and a view to living together and spending years in a committed relationship. I am open to such a relationship having romantic and/or sexual elements; however, I don‚Äôt really experience sexual and romantic attraction, at least in the way it has been described to me by others. I do find some people more physically attractive than others and am more open to having romantic or sexual relationships with those people, but sex and romance are optional for me and I don‚Äôt experience anything like crushes or a sex drive. Relatedly, I have pretty restrictive boundaries around sexual activities in particular and typically want to do them infrequently. I‚Äôm not going to give more details on my preferences here just to avoid a TMI situation, but if this might be a deal breaker for you feel free to ask me about it whenever you feel comfortable doing so.


Given my ace/aro spectrum status, and the fact that I experience next to no romantic jealousy, I would be happy for my partner to have other romantic and sexual relationships. 


Activities I would enjoy doing with you include dancing, singing, cuddling, improv comedy, deep conversations on philosophy and psychology, watching crime dramas and sitcoms (My favorites are Community and Better Call Saul), going for nature walks, going camping, going to the beach, traveling in India or Europe, and trying new and unusual things.


I have taken the Giving What We Can pledge and I currently help organize the local Portland EA and rationality group which I founded back in 2015. I am currently unemployed but would like to work in animal welfare in some capacity once my mental health and motivation improve.


I suffer from mild anxiety, low motivation (and occasionally other depressive symptoms for months at a time), and addictive tendencies (I am currently trying to get clean from kratom but am struggling and have repeatedly relapsed). I am on the autism spectrum (have you noticed?). I am extroverted, agreeable, and tend to have very low-conflict relationships. I have only ever been in one long term relationship which was very fulfilling and ended agreeably due to mental health issues on the part of my partner.


I enjoy having conversations on politics and philosophy. My politics are fairly centrist with some left-wing and some right-wing opinions on individual issues. I am very open to having relationships with people that have very different political opinions to me. My moral philosophy is something like moral anti-realist utilitarianism with an acknowledgement that my true values (as revealed by my actions) are many and my moral intuitions will never fully conform to an internally consistent system.


I am not particularly interested in marriage as I see a lifetime commitment as being unrealistic. I would however be open to having children together a little ways down the line, especially if you can support me taking 5+ years off of work to care for them. If we did have children I would want to make a strong commitment to staying together as long as doing so would be better for the children than splitting up, and if marriage is important to you as a symbol of that commitment I would be open to it. I am also open to not having children.


I am open to starting with a long distance relationship while I‚Äôm in Portland and would consider moving to nearly any large city, assuming I am able to work remotely (bay area would be preferable if I can‚Äôt). I would greatly prefer one with an active EA community, but would consider a place without one for the right person. I would enjoy living alone with my partner or in a group house with likeminded people.


I think I would benefit a lot from being in a relationship with someone more conscientious than me who could encourage me to develop a greater sense of responsibility and work ethic. I like to be pushed a bit towards greater commitment to my long term goals, as long as the encouragement is positive and not shame-based.


I am open to a relationship with someone of any gender, up to 45 years old but prefer someone closer to my age (24). 


Contact me on facebook if you‚Äôre interested.

Name: Marcos Abraao
ProfileText:
ÔªøFeb 5, 2024 12:30‚ÄØPM
Hi,


As I write this, I am listening Western Klassical Music Appreciation Project (weaklap) on Twitch. The piece currently playing is Jean-Philippe Rameau - Suite in A minor/major. I don't enjoy the Baroque period too much, I feel that I am more Classical and Romantic. Modern is good but it goes too crazy sometimes. I've been learning a lot about the different eras of classical music through this project, you can check it out and notice that it is a tool for naive listeners. Thus, no, I am not a musician but I had a deep appreciation for classical music. I'm 40 years old and I'm comfortable in my own skin. 


My native language is Portuguese, Brazilian portuguese. I started learning French on Duolingo for fun (387 days streak) however, Je ne parle pas fran√ßais. I can understand Spanish but not talk. I am not a very talkative person.
I actively participate in social dances including Zouk and Forro (my culture) and more recently in Contact Improvisation and Comtemporary dance. I am interested in Microfuzion but haven't tried yet. Connecting with my own or another body is a delightful experience for me. Dance is transformative. However, no, I am not a professional dancer.


I spent a significant amount of my time developing computational approaches to analyse biological data. More specifically, studying the relatioships of epigenetic modifications and psychedelics. The goal is to discover novel plasticity mechanisms and understand how they coordinate the overall large-scale neural plasticity. Oftentimes it is challenging but also fun.


I am very curious and moved by an existential disquiet. 












  
  

	  
  

	  

  

	



I live in El Cerrito, CA.
The best way to reach me out is by texting me at Instagram @marcos_abraao_art or Facebook

42 F seeking M, Seattle area, no children and not planning on any, but okay if you have older kids. Open to poly but prefer to meet a fellow undistracted single person.
My ideal situation would be a long-term relationship or permanent partnership, but not necessarily living together (I'm a bit of an ambivert and enjoy living alone in my condo, but love visiting others and having people over).  Living together isn't off the table, though!
A perfect weekend night for me is rounding up a bunch of friends to go out to a great restaurant (I'm an omnivore foodie who loves to share dishes, it'd be nice if you were, too), and then seeing a great movie at the theater (and I am highly skilled at ferreting out the latter; I like to snobbishly say that my favorite genre is "quality.").  Or maybe doing those things in reverse order so we can discuss the movie after!
On that subject, the most recent movie I watched was a second viewing of Everything Everywhere All at Once, which is one of the best movies I've seen in the last ten years and sublime as a repeat experience.
I'm not especially outdoorsy and actively anti-woodsy, but I loved the crew rowing class I took last year and it'd be cool to get back into it (I am currently contenting myself with my WaterRower and occassionally delivering evil monologs straight to camera (and it would be neat if you get that reference.).).
Much more information, photos, and a couple of highly-themed metaphor and pun-filled personal ads can be found on my Fetlife profile, username "TheStoryGirl."  Direct email is christinathestorygirl at gmail dot com.

Name: Nancy
ProfileText:
ÔªøAs of Feb 2024‚Äì Thank you for stopping by, but I‚Äôm currently dating someone! I‚Äôve dropped this doc in multiple places, so this seems the easiest way to update all interested visitors. Best of luck to you!


Hi, I‚Äôm Nancy. 32/F/NYC (but remote friendly)
  
  



One of my lifelong goals is to become more of myself every single year. It is the most meaningful act of creation (rather than discovery) I can do, and I want to do it at an intensity that I‚Äôm slightly embarrassed of the person I was the year before. I try hard to create my own sense of consciousness rather than inherit it, so oftentimes I oscillate between existential angst and actively white-knuckling figuring‚Äî often with a bleeding heart. I question the status quo, search for greater meaning, and try to discover alternative ways of being.


The more deeply I‚Äôm connected with myself, the more I can truly connect with others, without my projections, expectations, and dependencies. I‚Äôm looking for a partner similar committed to self-awareness, with the eventual goal of healthy interdependency. That takes seeing each other for who we are, and creating space for both of those people and iterations of those selves.


General attitude


"Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.‚Äù‚Äî Ana√Øs Nin
* My default replies are: ‚Äúwhy not‚Äù ‚Äúyes, and‚Äù "can we!!!"
* Variety is the spice of life
* Courage the Cowardly Dog is my spirit animal
* ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll figure it out‚Äù/good enough 
  
  
       




Non-professional Resume
* Frequent solo traveler
* Intl digital nomad for three years
* Sabbatical was backpacking thru South America for 6 months
* Fundraiser for grassroots nonprofit for working class Asian Americans
* Built a community of Asian American progressive women to pass a NYC Resolution with City Council
* Multi-day hiking treks in Chilean Patagonia, Peruvian Andes, and throughout Mallorca
* Lived in a co-living community
* 2 Half Marathons
* Burner
* Have guided 6 friends into therapy/helped them find their therapist
* Have extracted myself from an enmeshed familial dynamic and have healthier relationship with parents (WIP)
* Take pride in often being mistaken as my friends‚Äô partners (public acknowledgement that depth of intimacy is not reserved for romantic relationships!)
* Can karaoke sober for hours  


I don‚Äôt expect you to have a similar history‚Äî in fact, it would be great if we could introduce each other to new interests! Hope you are interested in exploring some of these though because it would be fun to continue onward deepening these interests together.




On Relationships


I value and invest a lot in my friendships, they are the grounding forces in my life that enable me to go far and wide in the world alone. My friendships abroad simultaneously make the world smaller and expand my horizons. We heal and grow in the spaces between us. I love people, caring for them, learning about them, being close to them, advocating for more adult sleepovers, extended living with one another, building lives in community.


I define love as a verb, a practice that you commit to, daily fidelity over grand proofs of love, demonstrations of care, prioritization of each other. What that looks like is an extension of oneself to nurture another‚Äôs mind, body, spiritual growth. As James Baldwin said, loving anybody and being loved by anybody is a tremendous danger, a tremendous responsibility.


That being said, being committed to each other also means being committed to growth, individually and as a team. It could mean that our lives will be a little unconventional, or the distance between us ebbs and flows, or that we'll have chapters of navigating trying times. Hope you're up for lots of intentional check-ins, and being really accountable to yourself for ourselves.


Loving someone requires seeing people for who they are, outside of their relationship to you, and letting them be who they are. You can feel connected and invest in someone, but it doesn‚Äôt mean feeling entitled to control them or making them your personal projects. I‚Äôm looking for a kind of love/life that‚Äôs triangular: an orientation beyond our love for each other, towards external elements in life ‚Äî which is to say, life itself.




A few tweets of mine
   * https://twitter.com/nanseaful/status/1637917957329133568
   * https://twitter.com/nanseaful/status/1633708623024074757
   * https://twitter.com/nanseaful/status/1654829322807521282


Things I like
* Good food & cooking & sharing food esp desserts
* Live music
* Dancing harddddd
* Learning at workshops, panels, author talks, book festivals, immersive theater, scavenger hunts, escape rooms
* Hosting powerpoint parties, death parties, murder mystery parties, food tours
* Commitment, follow through, trust
* Deep conversations & probing questions




Things I‚Äôm trying to get better at
* Meditation
* Patience with myself and life
* Yielding control
* Consistency
* Resting
* Forgiving others
* Tennis
* Surfing
* Writing


People things have said about me
* High agency character
* Energizer bunny
* Impressive rate of follow-through
* Community builder
* Very creative thinker
* Kindest listener 
* ‚ÄúBeing loved by you feels like the warmth of the sun on both sides‚Äù
* ‚ÄúYou taught me what friendship is‚Äù
Why I will contribute to our arguments
* I am a litte impatient (overbearing)
* I am intense (tiring)
* I am insatiable (unfocused & restless)
* I overthink (anxious)
* I bruise easily (see forgiving bullet)
* I run late a lot (annoying)
* I get lost a lot (annoying)
* I lose things a lot (annoying & expensive)
* I can be notoriously inattentive (see last three bullet points)
* I sleep too little and late (worrisome)
Ways I like to be relation with my partner
* Our relationship is our priority
* Not necessarily similarity, but compatibility
* Lots of physical affection
* Info dumping
* Conspiring to take fun very seriously
* Creating our own world of joy > pleasure, soul > gold, creative work > business, meandering > perfection; impractical, local, small > capitalism, soft tenderness > control; going together > going far
Dealbreakers
* Apolitical people - the choice to be ‚Äúapolitical‚Äù is usually just an endorsement of the status quo and the unexamined life. Also, I am the proud daughter of Vietnamese immigrants, so know that conversations about race relations (in the world, between us) will come up in the meta, value-driven way, but also the personal lived ways (cultural traditions & how we spend time with my family & create our own). My closest friends are LGBTQ. Our performed gender roles will affect what we expect from and how we relate to each other. We also live on this same overheated Earth lol.
* Neoliberalism - bro it just doesn‚Äôt work like that
* Prefer petless partners, but this is negotiable




What I‚Äôd like to know about you
Reach out to me responding to one of these questions:
* What‚Äôs the last thing you learned about yourself?
* What‚Äôs a lesson you keep having to learn, and why?






If you‚Äôre interested, write to me at nancyjnguyen@gmail.com.

Name: Sohit
ProfileText:
ÔªøHello,  Thanks for visiting this page. I‚Äôm Sohit and I‚Äôd love to tell you a few things about me!
 
  
   
^ me with my cat on the left. Me in London on the right. 


Basics:
* I live in Princeton, NJ with my cat, Bella. You will find me in NYC every weekend.
* I am 6‚Äô3‚Äù. I am 26 years old.
* I‚Äôm currently pursuing my PhD in Computational Biology at Princeton University.
   * I work on simulating proteins to understand their behavior better, especially for drug-docking and enhancing drug efficacy.
* I‚Äôm a straight guy and I‚Äôm attracted to women.
* Kindness and care will melt my heart. I believe in respect and consideration for everyone around me. I also have a strong respect for knowledge and books.
* My love language is bear hugs, cooking for people, and writing postcards.


Hobbies: 
* I love theater. I was in my school theater club for 10 years. While I no longer perform, I love seeing creative theater and regularly go to shows in NYC.
* I love to read non-fiction, creative stories, professional development, and personal development books. 
* I also love writing:
   * My blog is here: https://medium.com/@sohitmiglani/ 
* Traveling to learn about the world and all kinds of people! I‚Äôve been to 32 countries so far and hoping to keep the momentum going.
* Biking, Knitting, and Arts and Crafts
* I like to have open spaces to show my creativity and I always try to find art events.
Personal Traits:
* I am a very low maintenance person and very calm. I am a good listener. I have worked a lot on myself, especially this past year, and learned to handle my anxious brain.
* I try my best to be kind to the people around me and be inclusive of everyone.
* I am a bit goofy and love playing around. 
* I love hosting people and cooking for them / hosting a game night.
* I‚Äôm somewhat introverted so I usually spend at least 1 day a week to recharge and drink a lot of chai. 


  
   


I‚Äôm hoping you:        
* Are silly/ goofy and somewhat weird in a good way.
* Are career-driven and you have a positive outlook on life, and see us as a couple who will support each other in the positive and not-so-positive times.
* Believe in mental health and therapy. (deal breaker)
* Don‚Äôt do drugs (deal breaker). Drinking is fine. 
* Love hugs (because bear hugs are <3 )


If I sound like someone you‚Äôd like to talk to, you can email me at sohitmiglani@gmail.com .

Name: John
ProfileText:
ÔªøLet‚Äôs go on a date!
Hi, I‚Äôm John! Email me at johnrwoolley0@gmail.com
General Me stuff
I‚Äôm a textbook nerd in a lot of ways: I like sci-fi, video games and programming, and I sometimes get fixated on niche topics like the history of earth‚Äôs climate or Sumerian civilisation. I am always excited by the complexity of the world, and driven to understand whatever I can of it. I love the rush that comes from figuring out something complicated. If you‚Äôre into something I‚Äôll enjoy learning about it from you!
I get a lot out of creating things. It scratches a deep itch in my soul to make a piece of software, a story, a work presentation, or even a Minecraft build.
I am quite independent-minded and happy spending time by myself (only child thing?). I‚Äôm a ‚Äòsmall group of close friends‚Äô person. I sometimes have to persuade myself to go and meet new people, but I generally enjoy it when I do, and I‚Äôm able to find something in common with whoever I meet.
Last year I signed the Giving What We Can pledge to give 10% of my income to charity over my lifetime, and I get a lot of satisfaction and well-being from helping to solve the world‚Äôs problems in whatever small way I can. I‚Äôve been meditating daily for a few years and it‚Äôs been hugely influential on my life/ethical philosophy, as well as helping with my tendency to overthink and get anxious.      
  








________________

Shorter points
* I‚Äôm 30 and I live in Manchester, UK. My degree was in mathematics and physics.
* I‚Äôm a software engineer. I‚Äôm currently on a machine learning project (I promise to shut up about it if that bores you!).
* I like reading books of all kinds (I read slowly but I get there!). I‚Äôve also written two (bad) sci-fi novels and I‚Äôm trying to finish my third.
* I exercise most days, though I‚Äôm not a particularly sporty or outdoorsy person.
* I used to play electronic keyboard a lot, I occasionally still do.
* I‚Äôm generally organised and tidy, with both physical possessions and general life admin.
* I almost never do alcohol/drugs (except caffeine; I drink unreasonable amounts of tea).
* I‚Äôm open to either a mono or poly relationship.
* I haven‚Äôt thought a lot about having children but I believe I could be happy with or without them.
You
I‚Äôm looking for someone to have a long-term relationship with, maybe marriage, kids etc. I don‚Äôt have a lot of dating experience, so I am generally open-minded about the whole thing. That said, I am attracted to femininity in its many forms (sorry gents, I‚Äôm straight as they come). If you‚Äôre aged 25-35, and living (at least partly!) in the UK, let‚Äôs chat!
Bonus points if you live near to Manchester, have an intellectual curiosity, and would be up to playing video or board games together.
Trivia
* My best ever reddit post is a cool fact I learned about prehistoric humans. Other highlights include one of my minecraft builds and this thread I started just before Russia invaded Ukraine.
* I‚Äôm a bit of a picky eater (I lived off huel for a while) but I do occasionally like making shortbread or cheesecake to share with people.
* I‚Äôve been collecting houseplants recently. Three and a half out of four are still alive, which I consider a great success!


Email me at: johnrwoolley0@gmail.com

Name: Guy
ProfileText:
What kind of person am I looking for?
Hi there, I'm Guy.
Here's the TLDR:
I'm 33, male, based in Brighton, UK for now. Straight, and looking for a long-term relationship with someone I like enough to build a family with.
Other things you may want to know (no judgment, we all like what we like):
I'm 6' 0", middle eastern, somewhere between average and dad bod.
What kind of person am I looking for?
Caring and kind
Comfortable being themselves
Curious. I love talking about ideas and surround myself with similar people.
Near Brighton / London
What kind of person am I?
My friends (if you can believe them) would tell you that I'm
Smart, and like thinking things through for myself
Caring
A bit quirky
The kind of person you want as a tripsitter
For the most part, I'm average. You wouldn't notice me walking down the street (unless it's summer and I'm enjoying a barefoot day).
I love to learn, and I love puzzles. The latter grew into teaching myself programming as a kid and participating in programming competitions. I've also had a long-lasting interest in science and philosophy and enjoy conversations where I get to learn something new about them.
I taught maths for a while and loved it. I'm now studying again to start a career in software development.
I am spiritual, but not religious. I believe spirituality is simply the skill of stepping back from things to get a better and more holistic view on them. I would also characterize spirituality as balance, or having a low (mental) center of gravity. I don't follow any specific tradition, but once in a while I will come across a text from some
writer
,
poet
,
philosopher
,
thinker
, or
ancient figure

Name: Lauren
ProfileText:
ÔªøBasic stats:
Age: 32
Height: 5‚Äô 5‚Äù
Location: London (but I‚Äôm American).  Theoretically open to a LDR, and geographically mobile, but the barrier to not-Home Counties is higher.
Looking for: LTR, and yes, marriage.  Also monogamous af.  Sorry.


I absolutely do not want kids, ever.
Sexuality: Bisexual, but lean strongly towards men.
Contact: lagilbert@gmail.com


  
  
  
  
  

What I Want


Honestly, the primary trait I want in a partner is intellectual curiosity.  I really don‚Äôt care what you look like as long as you‚Äôre interesting.  At work, I think about humans trying to maximize health and income, but I think I maximize on learning things.  I might be an information monster.  I just really, really love to learn stuff, and I really want a partner who shares this with me.  And I am looking for a partner - preferably for the rest of our lives.


(Also, I never shut up about the things I am thinking about, so if you don‚Äôt want to hear about everything from neutrinos to genocide scholarship, you aren‚Äôt going to like me very much.)


Logistics note: I‚Äôm immunocompromised.  This means I still mask indoors; I don‚Äôt eat or drink indoors, and I try to avoid indoor crowds.  I like to think that this affects my life pretty minimally; I just eat outdoors, and I‚Äôm happy to wear a mask.  But I do still take precautions, and likely always will; if this bothers you, we are not a fit.
About Me


My day job is as a research fellow for Open Philanthropy, on the global health and well-being side of the organization.  I research anything and everything that might cost-effectively improve people‚Äôs lives, largely in the developing world.  I really care about this; I largely agree with Max Roser that ‚Äúthe world is awful, the world is much better, the world could (and should) be much better‚Äù.


In my copious spare time, I‚Äôm a QI elf[1] (yes, really) and an analyst for Geoquant.  In my further spare time, I am a Tarbell fellow and do some public facing writing on global development (see this essay in Works in Progress).  I am not not a workaholic, but you don‚Äôt need to be; I care that my partner is passionate about something but not particularly if that something is a job, a hobby, or a dream.


Otherwise (as per my website bio), I am being bullied by my cat, Lyra.  She is half my heart, and also very fluffy, so if you are allergic to cats, probably give us a miss.


  





Some more bio stuff: Words are very important to me; I write a lot, am Extremely Online (basically exclusively on Twitter) and I feel like writing is an important part of the base case of Lauren.  I can‚Äôt not write.


Despite this, my background is in STEM.  From ages 9-27, all I could imagine was being a physicist; I have a BS in physics from Caltech and did half a PhD in neutrino astrophysics at UCSD.  I then ran away and did another half a PhD in political science (really, applied microeconomics but in a poli sci department).  I interned at Open Phil and then just stayed.


I am not not an effective altruist; I don‚Äôt identify as an one - for reasons I can elaborate on - but I spend a lot of social time around effective altruists and will probably take the Giving What We Can pledge in the future.  That being said, I am an AI risk skeptic, and not open to dating rationalists.


I care very deeply about politics, and I don‚Äôt think I could date someone I substantially disagreed with about politics.  I‚Äôm a YIMBY progressive, a feminist, and I think about policy like an economist.  I vote in every election - even the primaries, even down ballot.  Also, trans rights are human rights.  (I can‚Äôt vote in the UK, but would be a Labour voter.)


I love to travel, ideally off the beaten track.  It is important to me that I share this with a partner.  One of my favorite places I‚Äôve ever been is Georgia (the country) and Uzbekistan is probably next on my list.  Since I‚Äôm permanently remote, I occasionally work from random places (Greece and Mexico in the last year).  I also go to SF once a quarter and am back and forth to the States on a semi-regular basis.


Music is also very important to me.  I love pop music, and I will not listen to takes that pop music is dumb and simple.  My favorite artists are Taylor Swift (I will see the Eras tour at least four times), Carly Rae Jepsen, and MUNA.
tldr:


Given all this, I feel like the pros of dating me are pretty obvious.  I am always interesting; I am very smart and very funny.  (Indeed, one of the first pieces of feedback I got from a friend on this doc was that it doesn‚Äôt show how funny I am!)  I am strong and independent, but also try to be kind and take care of the people I love.


The cons are also obvious: I do not try very hard to be conventionally attractive; I will show up to things with wet hair and I don‚Äôt wear makeup; the immunocompromised thing is mildly annoying; I am blunt and sharp and I am not going to parent you.  I‚Äôm kind of A Lot and I have no intention of changing that.


I am basically seeking a partner that makes me feel like the Run Away With Me music video.  If this is intriguing to you, we could maybe turn the world to gold?
________________
[1] For the Americans: I write @qikipedia on Twitter a couple days a week.

Name: Jacob (Jisk) Kopczynski
ProfileText:
ÔªøI‚Äôm Jacob ‚ÄòJisk‚Äô Kopczynski, one of many programmers in Oakland
My Face
  

  
  

I don‚Äôt like photographs much, so this sampling spreads across several years. The top-left is the most recent, at LessOnline. My hair gets rave reviews for reasons I don‚Äôt fully understand.
Basics
Kids: No        Hookups: No             Monogamy: No        Relationship Anarchy: No
Age: 33, mostly uninterested in dating below 25.
Orientation: Straight, to a first approximation         Kink: An obligate dom, as far as I know
Contact info: ja.kopczynski ~at~ gmail .dot. com, Discord @_jisk
Relationship Goals
I‚Äôm not currently seeking a specific thing. I would appreciate having a primary relationship. I would appreciate having a couple more secondary relationships. (Maybe even both of those.) I would appreciate a quasi-primary long-distance relationship where we spend a few weeks a year in the same place and are effectively primaries then and secondaries the other months. In general terms, I‚Äôm a little under-saturated in close relationships and would like to fix that.
Values
Epistemic Rationality - I‚Äôm a pretty committed epistemic rationalist. Believe true things, even if they aren‚Äôt useful; say true things, even if they aren‚Äôt comfortable. I don‚Äôt pick fights about this much anymore, but it‚Äôs there and it‚Äôs not going away. I‚Äôm particularly harsh about self-deception. Beware telling yourself lies, because you‚Äôll forget they‚Äôre lies.
Effective Altruism - I‚Äôm an EA in the sense that I signed the Giving What We Can pledge and roughly agree with the EA movement about what charities count as effective. I‚Äôm not an EA in the sense that I don‚Äôt try to maximize the good done - I delegate all the optimization to the big foundations and don‚Äôt worry about it.
AI Singularity - I don‚Äôt expect my retirement fund to be worth the bits it‚Äôs printed on. I mean, I have one, but still. We get doom or utopia; there‚Äôs no middle ground. This doesn‚Äôt come up much day-to-day, but it‚Äôs there.
Hobbies
Games! - I have a floor-to-ceiling cabinet of board games and don‚Äôt play nearly enough. I have a list. Twilight Imperium is on the shelf twice, but I also love much lighter games like Tokaido, Tsuro, and King of Tokyo. I also enjoy many video games, D&D and derivatives (I prefer 3.5/Pathfinder), and making my own tabletop games.
Worldbuilding - Whether it‚Äôs creating my own D&D setting to run campaigns in or taking a video game or CYOA prompt and running with it to flesh out the world around it and write stories in it, I really like worldbuilding. It‚Äôs much more fun with an audience, and collaboration has been fun.
Writing - It‚Äôs fun! And, surprisingly, uses very different creative muscles from programming, despite still being sitting at a screen hitting a keyboard. I have written a fair amount of glowfic, and a lesser quantity of standard-variety fanfic. I also have some porn but I‚Äôm not willing to link that to my name in a publicly-readable document. 
Meetup Hosting - I host a LessWrong meetup in my (big) living room every week, rotating through topics. It‚Äôs meant to be a place where new members of the community can meet established ones, and a generally structured social hangout for our many awkward nerds. Want to meet me without going on a date? Ask, or take a look on Discord here.
Fire Arts - I don‚Äôt do this nearly often enough, and don‚Äôt have any pictures, but I do fire spinning. My preferred prop is a pair of clubs, and I can do most things poi can do with them. I strongly recommend it - it‚Äôs a good workout, and also everyone looks hot with fire in their hands.
Ritual Design - I don‚Äôt do this as much recently, since I no longer think there will be enough generations of the rationalist community to need ritual to stay value-aligned, but I‚Äôm interested in the cautious, well-considered use of ritual. And the misuse of it. It‚Äôs powerful but dangerous.
Hates
Woo/Spirituality - It‚Äôs like religion but without the social benefits that made it worthwhile for most people for centuries.
Circling/Authentic Relating/Nonviolent Communication - This is toxic coercive bullshit in sheep‚Äôs clothing and I do not trust it within 500 feet of my brain. It‚Äôs like someone decided the problem with social status was that it wasn‚Äôt pervasive enough and was too easy to see coming.
Anticapitalists - I cannot stand people who blame the world‚Äôs problems on ‚Äòcapitalism‚Äô, talk about ‚Äòlate-stage capitalism‚Äô (there‚Äôs no such thing and that‚Äôs quite obvious) or ‚Äòdegrowth‚Äô (probably the most evil economic philosophy extant), shit on Amazon, or generally ignore the way that capitalism has pulled the world out of poverty in a way nothing else came close to addressing. It‚Äôs a berserk button.
Date Ideas
I‚Äôve enjoyed
* cuddling and reading stories aloud
* watching shows together and riffing/heckling
* wandering the streets and talking
* playing games together - competitive or cooperative, board or video, puzzles, whatever
And expect I‚Äôd enjoy
* going somewhere tall and enjoying the view
* beta reading each other's porn
* learning to dance together




________________


Appendix: Detailed Explanations
Kids
I do not want kids for myself. This wouldn‚Äôt necessarily be prohibitive if my partner really wanted them, but IME I only like about half of kids, even the kids of parents I like. This seems prohibitive. Does not rule out me dating someone with existing kids if they‚Äôre not planning to get more, if I get along with the existing kids, but it‚Äôs basically prohibitive on the ‚Äòhaving more‚Äô front.
Monogamy/Polyamory
I‚Äôm in a long-duration secondary relationship I don‚Äôt want to break.
I practice hierarchical polyamory.
Many sources such as More Than Two will tell you this is a red flag, but this is incorrect. Hierarchical relationships set an absolute minimum amount of communication about the health and status of the relationship.
Also, considering the record of drama in the relationships of the authors of MTT, which produced multiple accusations of abuse, does not inspire confidence that their relationship advice is good. Also, all dramabombs I have been witness to in poly circles derived from refusal to label relationships or violation of the clear boundaries of hierarchical relationships. I consider this evidence that hierarchical poly is in fact a green flag; relationship anarchy and other nonhierarchical styles are the red flags.
Effective Altruism
I‚Äôm not out to do the most good I can. I‚Äôm out to be a good person by my own lights, according to a non-deceptive and particularly non-self-deceptive definition of good person. I thought about it for a while, decided EA was probably right, joined a meatspace community with a lot of EAs, still thought it seemed right, and took the GWWC pledge as a concrete commitment when I had a job and could clearly afford it. My last annual donations were an ad-hoc mix of GiveDirectly, GiveWell, the EA Funds Long-Term Future Fund, and MIRI. Past years have also included CFAR but they lost my trust due to woo and Circling.
Straight*
I‚Äôve dated transmasculine people but I lost interest as they got more masculine. I have not recently noticed any interest in anyone but cis women. Sorry.
Kink
When I say ‚Äòas far as I know‚Äô, I mostly mean ‚Äòlast I checked‚Äô, which was‚Ä¶ like four years ago for most purposes. I spent a couple years asexual due to medical side effects (worth it), and that only faded this year.
Historically, I‚Äôve been interested in mild sadism, hypnokink, low-grade forced exhibitionism, and improvised bondage. I like rope bondage in theory, but getting real practice in is difficult without an accessible ‚Äòdemo sub‚Äô so I suck at it. I like the idea of ‚Äòferal‚Äô-ish fights for control, but it may turn out I hate that if I lose.

Hey there, I‚Äôm Brian, a 44 year old native of Austin TX!  The dating apps felt too much like a psychological-social-torture-experiment (that I was actually paying for), so it was time for something new! 
Here I am‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..laid bare‚Ä¶..during doom metal goat yoga!
  

Who am I?
¬∑         Grew up on a ranch in Austin, studied computer networking, worked as Server Support and IT Security expert and then retired from it at all 33!

Personality (Psychetest.com) evaluations score me as The Chameleon and ‚ÄúMiddle of the Roader‚Äù and it‚Äôs damn accurate.  Email me for a copy of my results üòä:
Chameleons can adapt to almost any social situation, whether they're among a throng of partygoers or in reflective solitude. Known to be fairly friendly and gregarious people, Chameleons aren't hard to like or connect with; they're good conversationalists, good listeners, and great company. Although they're more than happy to join a boisterous get-together, they do enjoy some quiet time on their own as well. They're approachable and relatively unreserved individuals whose presence is neither obtrusive nor inconspicuous.
Middle-of-the-Roaders enjoy a good mixture of spontaneity and predictability, although too much drudge work will bore them after a while. Just when people think they have this somewhat conventional type pegged, the Middle-of-the-Roaders' underlying free spirit will occasionally burst forth in a desire to steer off-course and try something new and exciting. These are the type of people who will generally fly under the radar, but they can sometimes surprise others with what they are capable of accomplishing when they are able to buckle down and focus. This may be particularly evident when they are working on a project that they are passionate about.  Middle-of-the-Roaders are reasonably emotionally stable, so no matter how much stress they are under, they will somehow manage to set things at even keel...eventually.
  
   
Things I‚Äôm into..
-Gardening / Horticulture üåµüå±
-Cooking (I like to cook and make salsas with veggies from my garden. Lots of Indian food too)
-Sculpting (‚Ä¶and can make silicon molds, an plastic/wax/metal castings)

-Travel (Been to 11 countries, 4 continents, and counting)
    

 -Boardgamesüé≤  (developing a card game now)

Very into metal ü§òüèª but I listen to alt rock, EDM, house, etc. From Tori Amos to Pink Floyd to Behemoth and Rotting Christ. No country please.  Here‚Äôs a rare glimpse of my glitter mohawk at ACL.  The ACL producers made me ‚ÄúNaruto run‚Äù back and forth in front of the huge ACL sign in Zilker for their promo video!

-Late evening snuggles on the couch
-Tea  (I love coffee but recently found out it doesn‚Äôt love me üôÅ)

Strengths‚Ä¶
¬∑         Empathetic and socially intelligent.  I‚Äôve put in the introspective self-help work.
¬∑         Very self-sufficient:  I repair/upgrade things around the house, I am the IT support staff, car mechanic, stock broker, (almost) a vet tech, gardener, professional cleaner.  I wear a lot of hats and can converse about almost anything.
¬∑         Healthy‚Ä¶never get sick (never got Covid somehow)‚Ä¶.everyone thinks I‚Äôm mid to early 30‚Äôs!  haha. üëç Was a vegetarian for 12 years.
¬∑         Very flexible schedule, and a good amount of free time since I get passive income.
¬∑         I have my proverbial ‚Äúshit together‚Äù‚Ä¶.but do any of us really? üòä
¬∑         I‚Äôm not into ‚Äúsportsballs‚Äù but don‚Äôt care if you are.
¬∑         I have crypto but have no desire to talk about it. LOL
¬∑         Yep those last two are definitely considered Strengths when you compare me to ‚Äúthe average male‚Äù
 
My stats‚Ä¶
5‚Äô9‚Äù  - Yes that‚Äôs my real height‚Ä¶not 5‚Äô8‚Äù, and not 6‚Äô14‚Äù üòâ
165 lbs
Neutered‚úÇÔ∏è and Vaxxd üíâ
100% STI and disease free, and keeping it that way.  GGG  üòÅ
Agnostic, plus I vote Left 96.3% of the time
Nearsighted as fuck‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.like -4.50‚Ä¶.
IQ 139‚Ä¶..yes‚Ä¶.6 points shy of genius.  üôÅ
I have three clubbed feet   Kidding
‚ôåü¶Å -Leo if that matters
I have a ‚Äútwo-pack‚Äù of abs, not a six-pack.  Sorry. Yes, I‚Äôm serious. But I‚Äôm in shape!
Tattoos on left side of torso, and a full sleeve on my right arm.  They‚Äôre all nerdy; ask me about them.
üçÜ ‚Äì just email me LOL.  Definitely not bragging posting this on an open document‚Ä¶.


Lifestyle/Situationship/ ‚ÄúRealTalk‚Äù:
Hear me out.  LOL.  Stay with me now!  I‚Äôm 44 years old and if you got this far in life without ‚Äúbaggage‚Äù or ‚Äúexperience‚Äù then you‚Äôre in a totally different 1% group than the rest of the world. ü§£ü§£ü§£
Categorically I am a monogamist person at heart, but I have also learned so much by being open/poly.  Ultimately I‚Äôm poly-friendly and could make it work with the right person, but ‚Äúmonogamish‚Äù is definitely the direction I‚Äôm facing now.
Married for 23 years (yep we were young) but became open/poly/whatever five years ago. Functionally we are separated, as she has a primary girlfriend she is exclusive with; we have separate bedrooms, and we live independent lives while co-parenting two older daughters. Both are high schoolers, and one is about to go to college. The kids always come first, but they are not little, nor high maintenance. üòä And I am DEFINITELY not looking for someone to raise my daughters.  Working on getting a second home, but it‚Äôll be a minute with this economy and the state of housing. She is kind and supportive of me while I have had other partners the last five years.  There are no fireworks, ‚Äúred flags,‚Äù or ugly dynamics at all between us.  She is gay.  I support her.  It‚Äôs called love.   But she has her person now and I need my person too‚Ä¶and she‚Äôs definitely out there. 



What I‚Äôm not into‚Ä¶‚Ä¶a.k.a. ‚Äúdealbreakers‚Äù
¬∑         Insecure-Anxious Attachment types, or ‚Äúface hugger‚Äù types
¬∑         If you‚Äôre reeeeeeeally into crystals‚Ä¶.probably not gonna go great. I can talk aliens and metaphysics or whatever‚Ä¶.but if I smell tin-foil hat conspiracies‚Ä¶.i‚Äôm out.  LOL
¬∑         High emotionally oscillating people.  Yes ‚Äì emotions are important and so very human, but my batteries drain faster around those that display a myriad of daily feelings.
¬∑         Trumpers‚Ä¶conspiracy theorists‚Ä¶strong religion/faith/belief systems. Nope.
¬∑         Aloof and ‚Äúcatch me if you can‚Äù types.  This is a profound lack of social intelligence to me.


What you‚Äôre not going to get from me‚Ä¶.
¬∑         Marriage. I want to be together for the rest of our lives, but I see little reason to re-marry, comingle finances, pay for a wedding, and ride the ‚Äúrelationship escalator‚Äù up midway through our lives.  Let‚Äôs leave the ‚Äúserial monogamy‚Äù to the boomer gen.
¬∑         Children.  I have no issue if you have kids, but I will be making no more‚Ä¶
¬∑         Phone calls.  LOL.  I‚Äôll take a call but they‚Äôre not my favorite‚Ä¶  
¬∑         Night-owl/party-animal behavior.  Don‚Äôt let the fun photos fool you too much‚Ä¶.I‚Äôm a bit of a homebody, but I can burn it down once in a while.  It‚Äôs not my primary method of operation, however. Definitely a morning person.  üòä
¬∑         Cohabitation.  This one is tricky but I‚Äôm not at all looking to merge our lives together and move in.  I reeeeally like my space and environment the way it is.  Hopefully you like yours the same. Can we spend a great deal of time at each other‚Äôs houses? Yes! But a full time move-in? Nope, sorry.


Qualities I‚Äôm looking for in a partner:
¬∑         has several of the same interests as me!
¬∑         appreciates and respects space so I can reset and center myself.  I not only value downtime, but I also absolutely require it.
¬∑         wants to travel
¬∑         is self-aware and understand boundaries
¬∑         has clear communication abilities (talking and communicating are two different things)
¬∑         can apologize when they fuck up
Ultimately, I‚Äôm looking for someone to enjoy quality time, laughter, concerts, travel, games, and all-around happiness with.  Someone that‚Äôs ok with the mundane, the ‚Äúregular‚Äù walks of life at times. Let‚Äôs be the best of friends forever‚Ä¶..or at least as far as we can push it. 
 
How to connect with me‚Ä¶.
If you or someone you know feels like I‚Äôm crazy matcheable, send me an email.  Yes it‚Äôs my spare junk email, but hey, I‚Äôm an ex-IT Security guy and I need to protect myself online, just like you. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Once we‚Äôre that far, we can share social media so we are better acquainted.  Oh and pleeeease ask anything you want answers to.  Assume nothing, question everything; I promise to not get offended!  foreverjunk99@gmail.com

Name: Jeremy S
ProfileText:
ÔªøNice to meet you! I am a 38 year-old man living in middle Tennessee and looking for a monogamous relationship with a woman. Like most folks, I‚Äôd love to find someone nearby but I am not opposed to long-distance either with the intention of joining forces one day. I‚Äôm not interested in having kids and while I‚Äôm an atheist, I don‚Äôt mind it if you have other religious views.


I‚Äôm a thinly-built white guy who tends to straddle the line between introversion and extravert; I do normally score an INFJ on the Myers-Briggs personality test and am comfortable with labeling myself an ‚ÄúAdvocate.‚Äù That speaks to my nature of always wanting to be helpful and try to improve things for those around me and afar via art, work, or just being a friend.


  
    
        Getting fancy! üôÇ                                         Standard-issue Jeremy
  

I found my current part-time role in marketing during the pandemic and enjoy what I do - especially since it is a non-profit. I have been in marketing for over a decade and found the scripting, planning, and development of campaigns very interesting. However, I recently got the itch to focus more of my time in the arts so I also spend half my time in my studio drawing, crafting the next big Halloween costume, or writing. I‚Äôm thankful I can support my financial goals through work and still find the means to get into my passion projects. I‚Äôm moving slowly into the publication space - children‚Äôs books and comics - and couldn‚Äôt be more excited about it!


  
  

Otters - pencil drawing                                              Fancy Octopus costume
















  

Aside from art-making, I am big into running as my main form of exercise. Hiking or walks through new areas are great and I am considering bird-watching in the future. I‚Äôm a competitive person so board games and some casual video gaming are high on the list of ways to bond with other folks while also keeping the mind sharp. The Frist is among my favorite places to visit and sketch. I wouldn‚Äôt mind some more traveling in the future, especially with a special someone by my side.


  

The Parthenon - another great place to visit in Nashville; this is one of my favorite drawings in my portfolio


  

If you are an ambitious and/or creative person, I bet we‚Äôll get along well! I really admire those who set out and actually make an attempt at accomplishing their dreams, regardless of the outcome. My ideal match also values staying healthy, honesty, integrity, and patience.


I‚Äôm at a stage in life where I wouldn‚Äôt mind finding my life-long partner though I feel there is still time to let things unfold naturally. Part of the fun in dating is getting to know someone so if I seem like a potential good fit for you, send me an email at heyitsmrj2@gmail.com and use ‚ÄúDate Me‚Äù in your subject line. 


I hope you have a wonderful day and wish you the best,
Jeremy

Name: Charles
ProfileText:
ÔªøLast Endorsed: 10 September, 2024
Key Stats
* Name: Charles R.-W.
* Gender: Male
* Age: 25
* Height: 5‚Äô 9‚Äù
* Pictures: at the bottom so those who want to read unbiased by looks may do so
* Education: BSc Mechanical Engineering, MSc Applied Physics, MSc Sustainable Energy Technology
* Current Job: Operations Director at family bakery
* Kids: Have none, do not want
* Current Location: New Jersey, USA (near Philadelphia)
* Religion: Atheist


What I am looking for in a putative romantic partner
Some concrete specs - to be a good fit, you should:
* Be female
* Be interested in a long-term monogamous romantic relationship, eventually with sexual intimacy
* Not want children (ever)
* Be roughly within the age-bracket of 20-30
* Be located in the Philadelphia area, or open to a long-distance relationship, at least for the short-term; longer-term, who knows :‚Äô)  I don‚Äôt substantially disprefer long-distance relationships.


Desirable characteristics:
* You have a good idea of who you want to be - I like to say that my favorite thing about myself is that, of all the people in the world, I‚Äôm the most like the person I want to be
* Intellectually interesting - whether that be by having a great breadth or depth of knowledge, argumentative skill, or a love of learning.  Anyone with interests as broad as those I list below and of a vaguely similar-ish flavor is welcome.


Relationship Dynamics:
* I value friendship a lot, and think that a romantic relationship can‚Äôt but be built on friendship.  At the same time, I‚Äôm uncomfortable having to guess if a relationship is platonic or not - on such guesses, I have a miserable Brier score of >0.5. I think intimacy is best cultivated intentionally and with care, so unless/until otherwise explicitly stated, I‚Äôll assume anyone contacting me with reference to this doc is at least tentatively interested in a romantic relationship.
* To my estimation, I think any relationship is like a tree - it has to be planted in a soil of at least minimal suitability, but after that, it grows based on how you care for it.
________________


‚Äî--------------------------------------------Further Information about me‚Äî--------------------------------------


My interests
* Math, Physics, CS: These are the core of my intellectual life; I would prefer a potential partner to be familiar enough with math that we can use mathematical analogies comfortably in conversation.  I thank god every day that I know about eigenvectors.
* History: I mostly read narrative histories (of the ‚Äòone damn thing after another variety‚Äô), especially about the Roman Republic, the Byzantine Empire, post-Renaissance Europe, and Qing to modern China.  Lately, I've been trying a different approach, aiming to get a more in-depth understanding of the Versailles treaty and 1919 specifically.
* Debate: I‚Äôve spent a few years as a pretty active member (and eventually president) of my university debate team.  I love the sport, but haven‚Äôt been able to stay involved post graduation.  I‚Äôve inherited a residual passion, though, for analytical philosophy and sytstematic argumentation as a tool for learning.
* Language Learning (the useless kind): I spent half a year teaching myself to read and write Latin.  I can read Caesar, and am working on the Aeneid - this is an achievement I‚Äôm super proud of!  I translated the pilot episode of Evangelion into Latin as an engagement present for a friend.  I would love to practice speaking it if I can manage to talk someone into learning it ;)  Similarly, I‚Äôm more recently learning Ancient Greek with similar aims.  I did eventually stop resisting the pull of my heart and learn toki pona (a kinda silly but super fun microlanguage); after Greek, I fantasize about doing Esperanto but maybe I‚Äôll develop the self-control to stop myself by then haha.
* Chinese (not as useless, plus way harder, so gets its own entry!): I‚Äôm studying Chinese now, with the aim of reading Lu Xun and eventually some more modern literature.  I can read vocab-annotated editions of some real Chinese books, so I‚Äôm on my way!  I can read pretty well but my listening/speaking abilities are way way lower for now.  As above, the ability to practice with a potential partner (either as a native speaker or fellow learner) would be super fun!
* Rationality-EA Memeplex: I enjoy reading and taking inspiration from everything in this corner of the world, but try to keep some distance to leave room for the cultivation of other interests.
* Exercise/Health - I really like exercising!  I haven‚Äôt missed a day in ~ 5 years.  I‚Äôm planning to run in the Montreal Marathon, and then in a few months to run the OG Marathon in Greece (from the battle site at Marathon!)!
        
Other pertinent information
* Right now I work as the ‚ÄòOperations Director‚Äô at my family‚Äôs bakery, mostly to get some real-world experience after spending a long time in school.  I‚Äôm fairly-seriously considering a PhD in physics, but am pretty sure I want to move on to something more technical and aligned with my abilities.
* I am gluten-free (due to Celiac disease).  More generally, I find my energy depends on my diet much more than most  - I basically always cook for myself, and don‚Äôt put more energy into cooking than necessary for a healthy-if-bland outcome, but cooking with a partner could well be fun and I‚Äôm open to it!
* In the past I was pretty (clinically) depressed (mostly because of the Celiac disease mentioned above), but this has improved a lot over the past 5 years as I‚Äôve taken charge of my health extremely seriously; this is relevant in that it shaped me a lot, not because I anticipate being depressed again; I‚Äôm doing consistently very good now and definitely expect that to remain the case!  I have a residual passion for pharmacology and neuroscience to boot!
* I do not ever drink alcohol (by choice)
* I exercise daily - typically running in the morning, and tai qi in the evening
* In demeanor, I‚Äôm a superposition of ‚Äútrying to be like Cicero‚Äù and ‚Äúmaking fun of someone trying to be like Cicero‚Äù - not easily categorized as ‚Äòserious‚Äô or ‚Äòsilly‚Äô, but a delight nonetheless, I‚Äôm sure.
* I‚Äôve never been on a date or romantically involved before - I‚Äôm pretty sure this is because I don‚Äôt understand how dating is supposed to work and not because I‚Äôm generally awful, but hey, caveat emptor I guess :‚Äô)


Contact
If you‚Äôre interested, you can contact me by email: [Given name] [Two Initials of family name, no hyphen] at protonmail dot com


‚Äî-----------------------------------------------------Pictures below‚Äî------------------------------------------------
I promise I can make other facial expressions, just not for pictures :‚Äô)
________________
  

A photo of me casting a die as the plane flies over the rubicon river (‚Äòthe die is cast‚Äô)




  

Similarly, 3D printed elephants coming with me across the alps - so that I can truthfully say ‚ÄúI have led war elephants across the alps‚Äù :::::::::::)))))))))))




  

Trying to cultivate my Caesarian facial expressions




  

Managing a game of diplomacy (the thermos is coffee and yes I drink that much every day :D)




  
  
  
  

Miscellaneous ones that I think look fun/funny, but the resolution is too trash to make them any clearer lol sorry.

Name: Rico
Location: WI, Flexible, North Carolina, North America, Chicago, TX
ProfileText:
ÔªøHello!  My name is Rico.  I‚Äôm now 29.  I‚Äôm 6‚Äô0‚Äù, and I‚Äôm also autistic.  However, there‚Äôs more to me than meets the eye.  I currently live in the greater Green Bay, WI area.  (Go, Pack Go!)


I‚Äôm heteroromantic and on the asexual spectrum.  Specifically, I‚Äôm cupiosexual (Someone who doesn‚Äôt experience sexual attraction but still desires a sexual relationship).  That said, I believe sex doesn‚Äôt make or break a relationship, and I would be open to dating someone who doesn‚Äôt want sex.  I‚Äôm also a Christian, and my faith is very important to me.  I would prefer to date someone who shares my faith, but it‚Äôs not required.


I graduated from Northeast Wisconsin Technical College in 2017 from the Digital Media Technology program.  I am still searching for a job in my area, preferably in a video production type of role.  I‚Äôm a very creative person.  I run a few YouTube channels and a podcast, and I recently wrote a feature-length screenplay.  I‚Äôm a musician as well.  I write my own songs and recently started a music project with an internet friend.  I‚Äôm also very computer-savvy, having created a few Hackintoshes in the past.  I‚Äôm not really a coder or developer, but I wouldn‚Äôt mind learning one day.  I‚Äôm very much someone who likes to continue to learn new things.


Topics of interest include:
* Autism/Neurodivergent Rights
* Theoretical physics
* Lost media
* Copyright law (reform/abolition)
* Anything Disney
* Music, especially:
   * Owl City
   * Coldplay
   * Twenty One Pilots
   * Imogen Heap
   * Taylor Swift
   * Sophia Fracassi
   * Victoria Duffield
   * Anything Pop/Top 40
   * (I‚Äôll listen to nearly anything)
* TV Shows, especially:
   * Doctor Who
   * House of Anubis
   * Thomas the Tank Engine
   * Castle
   * General Hospital
   * Ghostwriter (1992 PBS show and Apple TV+ Reboot)
* Theatre
* Writing


My love languages are quality time, words of affirmation, and physical touch.  In terms of what I look for in a partner, I‚Äôd like someone I can form a genuine connection with who can take me on their next adventure.  I would like to try to get out of my small bubble and see what else is out there.  I also wouldn‚Äôt mind working on a creative project together with my significant other.  My ideal partner currently doesn‚Äôt have kids, but I would be open to starting a family one day.  I‚Äôm monogamous and would prefer to date someone close to me, but I am open to long-distance relationships.


I‚Äôm sorry if this is all over the place; I generally suck at bios.  If I sound interesting to you and you want to get in touch, please email me at ricojrobbins@gmail.com.  Remember that you don‚Äôt have to check every box I laid out.  I hope to hear from you soon!  I‚Äôll leave you with a few pictures of me:
  
   
  



  

^^  Me doing a show on my college radio station


  

^^ Me with a friend I did a YouTube reaction video series with


  

  

^^ Me meeting two Internet friends from Orlando, FL
  

  

^^ Me meeting pop artist Daya at a concert
  

  

^^ Me at play rehearsal for 12 Angry Jurors
  

  

^^ My Halloween costume from 2024‚Ä¶ Ask me about the character it‚Äôs based on!

Name: Amy
ProfileText:
ÔªøMy dad just sent me this news article about dating docs basically implying I should try it, and I‚Äôve tried every other dating app known to man already so why not.


I‚Äôm Amy, I‚Äôm 28, I‚Äôm a visual artist and currently a producer at a design studio in LA. I love los angeles and have always wanted to live here; spent all my summers in california growing up so I associate the air here with vacation and family :) Kind of feel like I‚Äôm living out my dream here even though I‚Äôm not a famous singer or actress üòÇ


Fun facts about me‚Ä¶ I have grapheme-color SYNESTHESIA and I have recently fallen in love with ice skating and it‚Äôs taken over my life outside of work. I live alone and seriously contemplating getting a cat. I‚Äôm half korean and spent a big chunk living in seoul for the first 6-ish years of my life so I can still kind of speak korean well enough.


Been in 2 serious relationships before and probably most interested in monogamous relationships though if someone were poly I would still consider dating them as well, and I‚Äôm open to dating both men and women although I don‚Äôt actually have experience dating women (yetüò≠)


I‚Äôm quite independent, neurotic, thoughtful, image-conscious, and in the process of transitioning from pessimist to optimist (it takes work!) 


I believe dating is largely a numbers game but I have this new thing I‚Äôm trying instead of short coffee dates where the first date is a strict 5 minute video call (timer and all!) to facilitate meeting more people conveniently and with less time commitment. If you‚Äôre down lmk!
