Name: Julia Silbergeld
ProfileText:
ÔªøJulia‚Äôs date-me  
tl;dr 
HI! I‚Äôm Julia. I made this doc because I‚Äôm looking for a fun and joyful partnership filled with travel, adventures big and small, deep conversations, and community. I want to build a (monogamous) relationship filled with intention. I want to be a team, be each other‚Äôs sounding board about ideas that thrill us, be a source of comfort on hard days, and to laugh (a lot!) together. (Friends often comment on how much I laugh.)
We‚Äôll hike in the redwoods, lose our voices at a 90‚Äôs sing-along with friends, and go on a quest to find the best ice cream in Sonoma. juliaheartsthebay@gmail.com 
Some basics
Age: 40 (looking for someone in their mid-30s to mid-40s)
Gender: Female                Location: Oakland                Sexuality: I identify as straight                Monogamy?: Yes, please! 
Height: I‚Äôm tall! (5‚Äô9‚Äù) and usually date people 5‚Äô8-6‚Äô2‚Äù but open outside that range!
Wants kids: 90% no (climate change), but I love kids and have lots of kids in my life and am OK if you have kids already.
The 10% is open to it with the right person and circumstances.  
  
  
  

About you Not everything below is necessary, but if some resonate we‚Äôre likely compatible! 


You feel a responsibility to help others or make the world a better place, and likely do that through your work. This could mean you‚Äôre a teacher, a policy wonk, a nonprofit worker, a doctor, or a therapist. It‚Äôs unlikely that you‚Äôre an engineer working in big tech or selling things. This is a central part of how you operate in the world. 


You are self-aware and are comfortable talking about your feelings and communicating generally. You have really deep friendships (even if it‚Äôs a small number) and connections, and you are looking to build a relationship with someone and are excited about the collaboration that takes. You may have been through therapy or in other ways have worked on yourself. 


You enjoy physical affection. You like to snuggle on the couch and give each other shoulder rubs. This isn‚Äôt a lot of PDA when we‚Äôre with friends and it‚Äôs OK if you need alone time.


You are active and think about health. You like to get outside and move in some way or play a sport for fun. You might also like to indulge sometimes, but it doesn‚Äôt look like ordering in Domino‚Äôs every week.


You have your own life and you go after happiness. You know what makes you happy and you‚Äôve built that into your life. You have a strong sense of agency and in moments that you‚Äôve been unhappy (in a toxic job, etc), you‚Äôve changed it. You have a strong sense of gratitude for the things that do bring you joy.
About me
  

  
  
  

I feel a strong moral obligation to help other people. I visited a number of developing countries when I was young and it really shaped me, especially my understanding of wealth and privilege. I have worked in politics, at environmental organizations, with sustainable farmers, in journalism, and in progressive advocacy organizations. It‚Äôs a central theme in my professional life and a big part of my identity. I work for a startup that builds nonprofit fundraising technology. 


I have good work-life balance and boundaries‚Ä¶ and I love having fun! I don‚Äôt work crazy hours, have a very active social life, and spend time on hobbies. I love game nights, fun ways to connect with community, and opportunities to live life to its fullest.


Friends are very important to me. I‚Äôm often central to organizing social things in my groups of friends, whether it‚Äôs bringing a friend who is having a tough week a meal or organizing a 2 week remote working house in Mexico.


I‚Äôm active - I play pickleball several times per week, hike, walk with friends, and swim. I like to be outside and in the trees. I had some serious injuries in the last few years (broke my ankle, injured my spine) and recovering from them made me very grateful for the ability to be active and pain-free, but also put a high priority on health and being strong.
  

  
  
  



I like adventures. I get excited about a lot of things - whether it‚Äôs a road trip to Montana, hiking the W in Patagonia with 10 friends, or checking out new breweries in the Bay Area. I have worked remotely for 6 years and often visit friends or family or beautiful places - I love to life hack to make the most of things. I spent a year of the pandemic living for a month in different places with 10 friends ‚Äì we got to explore, cook dinner together, have funny competitions, and play games. 


I love food - hosting dinner parties, going to fun restaurants, and sharing food. I‚Äôm a planner, and would welcome a partner who is also a planner, or who complements that with spontaneity.


Other things that might be notable: 
* I‚Äôm very positive and feel a lot of agency to find happiness. This doesn‚Äôt mean life is always easy or that I don‚Äôt get down, but I actively work to change things when I‚Äôm unhappy or something is missing in my life (hence this document?).
* I‚Äôm a clear communicator and am comfortable being vulnerable. There‚Äôs basically no such thing as ‚Äòoversharing‚Äô with me. 
* I‚Äôm an Enneagram 2 (Helper, don‚Äôt care whether you know what this means!)
* My top strength in Strengthsfinder is responsibility (also don‚Äôt care if you know what this means!), which manifest in my being caring and generous and often taking on labor when I see a need or opportunity. 
* I often process things out loud, and I‚Äôm an open book. 
* I pride myself on my independence, but the last few years have honed my ability to ask for help.
* I‚Äôm someone who sees the silver lining in most situations.
About ‚Äúus‚Äù
My vision for a relationship ‚Ä¶ 
* I have a pretty strong belief that relationships don‚Äôt just happen and aren‚Äôt just about finding the right match, they take active work. The relationships I most admire in friends have often included couples counseling and working through tough periods in a way that resulted in being closer and stronger as a couple. I like having regular relationship check-ins, talking through what is and isn‚Äôt working for each of us, and brainstorming how we can better support each other.
* I care deeply about respecting my partner and what they do and how they exist in the world, and want that in return.
* My top love languages are physical touch and acts of service. My best relationships have included mutually taking care of each other and wanting to do things to make the other happy. One ex and I did fun ‚Äúsurprise trips‚Äù for each other regularly. 
* Sharing labor is very important to me ‚Äì this can look a lot of ways, but it hasn‚Äôt worked for me in relationships when I feel like I‚Äôm doing a lot more of the relationship work (bringing up hard conversations) or the actual work (household work, planning, etc). As a result, it has meant a lot to me when a partner takes things on that I haven‚Äôt thought about yet or I didn‚Äôt ask them to do. Just because I can do it all on my own doesn‚Äôt mean I want to.


What next?
How to reach out: email juliaheartsthebay@gmail.com. I like directness - feel free to dive in to explore potential dealbreakers or suggest a date. 


(Some people wanted more info‚Ä¶ if you want more, this is for you!)


Leaning into the ‚Äúthere‚Äôs no such thing as oversharing,‚Äù here are some reflections on past relationships:


Why did some of my last relationships not work out? 
* We didn‚Äôt want the same lifestyle (he wanted #vanlife)
* We didn‚Äôt want to live in the same place (I wanted to be in California)
* Our politics (and underlying values) were too different 
* We had different approaches to relationships ‚Äì they felt like it should just work or not work, and I wanted to be on an ongoing journey together to make it work
* We had different communication styles and preferences ‚Äì I would rather talk and hear about what‚Äôs not working so we can solve it together and understand each other better, but they found that to be stressful


What might be things my exes say about me? 


Some good stuff: 
* I‚Äôm very caring and thoughtful and generous
* I laugh a lot and love to have fun and I feel excitement and awe at small and big things alike
* I bring up the hard things and am willing to do the work, whether it‚Äôs together or work I need to do on my end
* I have great friends!! 
* I am great at logistics and making things happen


Some bad stuff: 
* I have a full life and time with friends is a priority (for an ex who wanted to spend most nights together, this was tough)
* It‚Äôs hard for me to feel deeply connected to people who don‚Äôt care about and prioritize making the world better; people I‚Äôve dated who were, say, a data scientist at an e-commerce company, found this to be really dogmatic. 
* I‚Äôm not hesitant to bring up things that aren‚Äôt working for me; especially when I‚Äôve dated people who don‚Äôt feel as comfortable doing this, what I have brought up weighed on them or it felt like to them that I couldn‚Äôt be happy in the relationship.
* I‚Äôm better at giving than receiving - in my best relationships we‚Äôve both given a lot and enjoyed that, but I‚Äôve also had relationships where they‚Äôve felt like it‚Äôs a burden. One ex said ‚Äúcan‚Äôt you just do fewer things for me, so I don‚Äôt feel like I have to do things for you?‚Äù BUT I also am working on being better at asking for help and receiving it. 


Looking for someone who read all of this and is curious, felt that some of this resonated with them, has questions‚Ä¶ reach out! Looking forward to connecting with you.


Inspired by other friends‚Äô profiles‚Ä¶ thank you. Also, if you want to date a different Bay Area pickleball fanatic who cares about making the world a better place, check out Taren's date-me page as well! She‚Äôs a great friend and an inspiring changemaker, and I want her to find her person too!

ProfileText:
ÔªøCory Hinkle
Brookville, Indiana 47012
Twitter: @coryclauz, IG- caboose2233
My Date Me Doc


About Myself
Hey there!  My name is Cory Hinkle and I am 26 and am based in Brookville, IN.  I am 5‚Äô8‚Äù and am a Christian.  I‚Äôve worked in non profit retail at Goodwill for 3 1/2 years and counting.  I enjoy my job, coworkers and the donors I get to help out every day.  Some qualities I believe describe myself are family-oriented, hard working, honest, shy, introverted nerd with a big heart for the people he cares about.  I am looking for a serious, monogamous relationship with a female around the 23-29 age range, preferably Christian.  I‚Äôm open to having kids in the long-term, but not interested currently as I help raise my niece already.  She means the world to me and fills that role at the moment.  
Hobbies/Interests
* Church
* Video games
* Walking 
                  * Archery
                  * Hanging with Family and Friends
                  * WWE & AEW
                  * Shopping, Swimming, Bowling
                  * Alternative Rock




Honest Fact about myself:
I just want to be open with whoever reads this and is interested in getting to know me.  I'm usually shy and keep to myself. People that are close to me have always said that I‚Äôm quiet at first, but can talk your head off once I warm up to you and get to know you better.  I‚Äôm looking for a girl who isn‚Äôt afraid of being her honest self with me and is looking for the same in her partner.  I'd love to spend time together getting to know one another and small things like sharing how each other's days went.  I like who I am and God‚Äôs blessed me beyond what I could ever write down in this document.
Conclusion
I hope if you are interested in getting to know one another better, you can dm me at my Twitter handle @coryclauz, or caboose2233 on my Instagram.  I am open to traveling around the Southeastern Indiana and Southwestern Ohio area if you are close and want to meet and go on a date together if we hit it off.  I am open to going to church together, walking, gaming together or whatever idea you have that sounds like fun.  I hope you have a great day either way if you took the time to read all of this!  Thank you!

Name: Semin
ProfileText:
ÔªøHow to Date me  
Stats
Age: 42 (I have that Asian gene that makes me look 10 years younger).
Ethnicity: Asian 
Height:  160cm
Location: Currently based in Incheon/Seoul, South Korea, open to long-distance or relocating.
Job: Currently I am working as a consultant in the field of international development.
Poly: Mostly monogamous but open to poly under the condition of well-defined terms and understanding
Sexuality: Straight
Religion: Agnostic, I like the concept of Buddhism and its practicality. 
Want kids?: Yes (more info. below) 
Wants to be stay-at-home-parent?: Possible. Always up for negotiation 
Personability type: MBTI: ENTP/ENFP/ENTJ (I am multilingual and multi-personified)
What I‚Äôm looking for: Primarily a long term committed partner to build a life together (although open to short term things)
Where to find me online: seminshim on IG
Where I am coming from
* Matters of the heart/passion: My first love was architecture. I loved it. I loved reading it, looking at it, learning about it, drawing it, imagining it, and bringing it to life. But, I was worn down by the sexist culture (at least in the architecture industry in South Korea 20 years ago) and no sight of work-life-balance). So, I decided that even if I loved it, I wouldn‚Äôt marry it. I generally believe in the power of how humans have settled and constructed cities on the planet. I am a feminist who seeks to address the various injustices occurring in my home country, South Korea. While I may not possess extensive knowledge of feminism, I possess a keen sense of injustice and am passionate about gender equality. 
* Matters of work: I have been involved in the field of international development for over a decade. I pursued a master‚Äôs degree in urban development with a focus on developing countries. Throughout my career, I have worked for international organizations, including the United Nations. Currently, I am based in South Korea, working as a consultant for governments and NGOs. I value the experiences I have gained from living and working in three different continents and seven countries - Cameroon, Senegal, Chad, Paraguay, Germany, Italy, and Belgium. Thanks to these experiences and my love of language, I am fluent in English, French, and Spanish, in addition to my mother tongue, Korean, and I understand German and speak very expressive Italian hand-gestures. 
* Matters of human connections: "Lacan on Love" by Bruce Fink was insightful in that it helped me understand and rationalize my own attachment style. I have also been persuaded by Dr. Helen Fisher's work on human mating and relationships. Alain de Botton's books, including ‚ÄúOn Love‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Course of Love,‚Äù have helped me see what is actually going on when I fall in love, enter a relationship, and fall out of love. And his NYT piece, titled "Why You Will Marry the Wrong Person," was a chance to reevaluate my own perspectives on love and its complexities (as much as 500 Days of Summer did). Of course, I get excited, feeling jittery, and more deeply connected to one person than  another, but I do value skills to love, and believe we can all grow those skills. 
* Matters of living: For over a decade, I‚Äôve been part of an online support group. We‚Äôre a fabulous foursome, sharing our aspirations, goals, areas for improvement, and achievements. We support each other, find the best ways to reach our objectives, and celebrate progress. Thanks to these amazing individuals scattered around the world, I‚Äôve become a better version of myself - a more productive, positive, and a better functioning adult. 
* Matters of marriage, having a family and all that jazz: When I was 21 years old, I decided not to procreate, due to my aversion to too much emphasis on nuclear families in South Korea. I was also concerned about global overpopulation. But, the events of 2020, particularly the pandemic, prompted a shift in my perspective. I now desire marriage or a long-term commitment and a family. To ensure this works harmoniously with my concerns about climate change, I endeavoured  to work on addressing climate change - currently working on a decarbonization project for port cities, and I had my eggs frozen. 
* Matters of perspectives: I'm a growth-mindset person. My life's mission is to adapt to a goal-oriented society while savouring the process and, if possible, becoming a force for change. I thrive on challenges that push me to learn and grow. Maintaining both physical and mental health is important to me, so I try to avoid excess while still retaining a childlike sense of wonder and fun. I am open to exploring polyamorous relationships as they provide opportunities for self-discovery, understanding the other partner better, and exploring possibilities beyond societal norms. We will definitely talk about intentions, the inevitable presence of jealousy, self-doubt, self-worth, entitlement, as well as the importance of kindness and compassion among all individuals involved in such relationships.
* Random things about me: In my 20s, I wanted to switch my career to become a journalist after leaving the architecture industry I mentioned above. Before making a decision, I went on a backpacking trip across China, Tibet, Nepal, India, and Thailand for two months to see if I was cut out for it. During my time in Nepal, I shared a trekking path with a WFP staffer, with whom I shared the ritual of having warmed rum and honey under the starry sky of Poon Hill, nourishing our tired legs and souls.I wrongly romanticised this experience, which subsequently laid the foundation for my journey into the field of international development. Additionally, I am in possession of the first printed edition of Joan Didion's "Play It as It Lays," which is currently being auctioned at a price of $1,000.
Who might be a good fit
Some words that jump to mind
* Open-minded to new experiences 
* Know how to cherish the moment and life in general 
* Intelligent
* Love reading and discussing it
* Kind and compassionate 
* Patient 
* Enjoy dancing; no need to be good at it.  
* Maybe a bit weird (to zig to my zag)


What can I offer as a date/partner/friend/brainstormer? 


What next? 


If any of this sounds good, reach out! Email: semin.shim at gmail dot com

Name: Varun
ProfileText:
ÔªøVarun


  

	  

	  

	

(yep, you gotta be into the natural Vin Diesel bald look)




TL;DR


33 / 5‚Äô 7‚Äù / Straight Male / üìç Sacramento, California, USA / US Citizen / Indian raised in Oman


Twitter profile




You


1. Have big goals (not primarily monetary or selfish) in life and work hard towards them.

2. Care about people who are less privileged or community/society.

3. ‚Üë If you do, you are probably kind and humble too.

4. [ Nice to have ] Vegetarian, vegan, or concerned about reducing meat intake.






Me


   1. My life‚Äôs purpose revolves around helping reduce inequalities in society, and primarily help the poor / needy. Always trying to discover the most effective ways to do it.

   2. Well educated (technical + managerial masters from reputed school) and intellectually curious and always pushing myself. Not like a bodybuilder or marathoner who is self-centered, though.

   3. ISFJ-A (whatever that means). Low ego. Humble, kind, empathetic. Non-violent communicator. Solid listener. Bill Maher-esque political views. Honest and clear. Romantic, caring. Cleanliness is important to me.

   4. Very calm and stable; I have seen ups and downs so I don‚Äôt let success or failure get in my head. You‚Äôd never see me talking down to someone. Very responsible and reliable. Very hype and bs-free; in tune with reality.

   5. Constantly cracking jokes and making puns! Never a dull moment around me. Generally pretty happy! I can be really fun around the right people.

   6. Mostly vegan. I‚Äôll eat dairy if that chocolate cake is just too tempting or we are outside. I also don‚Äôt consume alcohol or have any vices. Physically fit.

   7. I enjoy frugality as getting deals others can‚Äôt get never gets boring! I don‚Äôt do fancy dining. Generally very content.

   8. Not centered on wealth-maximization for self. But I do spend energy on having things I need to be content. Financially stable; I can take an early retirement if I need.

   9. Career: I work for an educational technology tool nonprofit. I also did some writing on the side. I am also on a little sabbatical and am building a small house for the parents. I intend to transition into helping the homeless or refugees.




Reaching me


You can reach me on social media (Facebook or Twitter, sorry no IG) or email me at varunarora.mct@gmail.com. We can instantly share digits and move to text or WhatsApp.


Hey, so I am looking for friends too! So if you think we would get along, please do message!

Name: Colleen
ProfileText:
ÔªøColleen‚Äôs Date Me Docü§ì
  
  
  
                                       
Pix ‚Äì All pictures are within the last two years except the one with His Holiness, which was an event I produced. Wonder Woman is a perpetual Halloween costume; I even have the boots! The Biomarkers pic is a screengrab from Function Health, as of Dec 2024.


Well, hi there. 
You know what they say about the definition of insanity? So here I am, trying something new. After mixed results on dating apps, I read the article about ‚ÄúDate Me Docs‚Äù in the NYTimes and thought, sounds crazy enough to work. I like the bespoke, unstructured format, and thought it would resonate with ‚Äúmy kind of guy‚Äù.   Believing it‚Äôs true that ‚Äì 
                   ‚Äúfortune favors the brave,‚Äù
here I am, baring my soul to the interwebs.
I was born in 1963 (see the pic on my biological age ‚Äì 48.4 as of 2024;) ‚Äì  I‚Äôm 5‚Äô9‚Äù. I seem younger and (even) taller, or so they say.  While I split my time between Louisville and Chicago, I am 100% free to roam (thanks to a remote job, an itinerant nature, and a flight attendant daughter).  I grew up in New Jersey and have lived in Atlanta, Chicago, LA, and NC. I‚Äôm a certified city mouse and enjoy day trips to quieter locales. Hobbies and passions include home renovation/DIY, healthy vegetarian cooking (farmer‚Äôs market to table), stand-up comedy, live/outdoor music, and personal development.  I‚Äôm not religious, but like Annie Savoy in Bull Durham, I‚Äôve dabbled w/many spiritual traditions including Buddhism (I consider myself ‚ÄúBuddhish‚Äù), meditation, radical gratitude, personal development and standing barefoot outside during a full moon (have you heard about earthing?).  I‚Äôm warm, affectionate, physical, and come from a loud, close, funny family.
You‚Äôre amazing because you‚Äôre:
* Open-minded (must be if you‚Äôre still reading!) You‚Äôre curious and enthusiastic, and have lots of interests and passions you‚Äôre excited to share. You read, listen to podcasts, etc. to expand your worldview.
* Kind and able to put yourself in others‚Äô shoes.
* Tall (yes, I know everyone says that but I‚Äôm 5‚Äô9‚Äù so I call dibs!)
* Smart, well-informed, well-read, nerdy, and/or into the NYTimes spelling bee or crossword (or will help me with the Qs about sports and astronauts). Smart+ verbal = sexy!
* Masculine, warm/affectionate/passionate, and bring the zaza zu. Comfortable discussing sex and expressing wants/needs.
* Open to trying, doing, eating, and experiencing new things.
* In possession of power tools or excited to use mine.  DIY together = sexy! Ask me about my tiny house;)
* Health-conscious (diet/exercise/wellness) or at least willing to humor me in my latest ‚Äúprogram‚Äù. Some of my current interests include Wim Hof, the microbiome, telomeres, and the fact that Alzheimer‚Äôs may, in fact, be avoidable. There isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúmind/body connection‚Äù; it‚Äôs all one!
* On good terms with your kids/family/ex and kind to everyone, regardless of their usefulness to you;)
* In possession of TSA Precheck, know where your car title is, and are, in short, a grown-up.
* Able to laugh at yourself, apologize and accept apologies, and keep things in perspective. Humor, gratitude and forgiveness are superpowers, and you‚Äôre all about them.
* Willing to do your ‚Äúwork‚Äù and know your strengths and weaknesses. Open to exploring personal development and having a shared vision for an exceptional life. My current passion is ‚ÄúQuarterly Quests‚Äù ‚Äì  a way to break down Annual Plans into bite-sized chunks.
* Clear about what you‚Äôre looking for in a relationship and ready to take the plunge.
* Ready and longing for a yummy, close, fun, bonded partnership where we root for each other, laugh a lot, are compatible in outlook, values, and energy level, and turn to each other often and say, I‚Äôm so glad you finally found me!
You should NOT date me if you:
* Ever even considered voting for Trump or are an anti-vaxxer or otherwise anti-science.
* Are a smoker, a heavy drinker, or have a ZZ Top beard.
* Watch lots of TV or are addicted to anything other than chocolate or Home Depot.
* Into ENM, NSA, FSA or any other acronym that I google and think ‚ÄúEWWWWW!‚Äù  Reminds me of an old joke, the punchline of which is: Too many thank-you notesüòÇ
You should date me because:
* Basically, I strive to be the type of person I seek. I‚Äôve ‚Äúdone my work.‚Äù  I‚Äôm not looking for a clone, just someone w/complementary values, life goals, and quirks!
* I‚Äôm sensual, playful, and tactile and ‚Äúphysical touch‚Äù is definitely a big love language for me.
* I‚Äôm a loyal, devoted friend and girlfriend.  
* I‚Äôm the most resourceful, ‚Äúout there‚Äù person I know.  I take risks and am willing to work to bring what I want to fruition. (Case in point: this doc) .  My mom calls me ‚ÄúQueen of the Pivot.‚Äù 
* I‚Äôm an ENTJ (Myers-Briggs) and an 8 (Enneagram) which means I git‚Äòer done and cultivate great relationships in the process. I‚Äôd be interested to know your types and how we would complement each other.  I‚Äôm an event producer by trade, and see life as a big, creative, wvent!
* I have fun just about anywhere, will try just about anything not involving firearms or livestock, and can find common ground and a deep, intriguing line of questions for anyone.  (Dream job: Colbert‚Äôs guest host, or the host of the ‚ÄúDiary of a CEO‚Äù podcast.)
* I eat and cook healthy, yummy, adventurous food, and love to cook for my man.
* No drama, Obama.  I can have the crucial convos, and there‚Äôs never any flying crockery.
I‚Äôm long divorced and have had a couple of LTRs since.  My kids are grown and off the payroll but still really close.  Ditto my 80-something Mom, who is my model for aging enthusiastically.
I‚Äôm vegetarian (but not about converting you), and focused on maximizing healthspan vs. lifespan. 
Interest piqued? drop me a line at colleencooperlou@gmail.com.  
Thanks for reading.  May all beings be at peace, and may all pots find their lids.

Name: Dan L
ProfileText:
ÔªøDan   
Linger
San Francisco
Banker
27 Years Old


Hit me up!
	1-847-691-1042 (text please)
	Facebook
	Instagram
	



Overview
The day after my 27th birthday, coming back from a wedding, after having rewatched How I Met Your Mother, I read this article and felt lovesick enough to write a damned biography and persuasive essay to find my counterpart with lady-bits.
Goals
What I‚Äôm looking for, in short, is someone who makes me feel special and who I can make feel special. I‚Äôve done enough work on myself as a person that I‚Äôm looking for someone that can help me grow and I can help grow as well. Big believer in chemistry; it either works or it doesn‚Äôt work. That being said, I‚Äôm a slow-burn and an acquired taste.
Here are some things that drive chemistry for me:
* Genuine interest in life and learning more (no one-word answers or feigning disinterest to seem cool)
* Emotional intelligence. Being able to communicate your thoughts and identify your strengths/shortcomings is hot.
* Similar life views and interests, but different enough that we‚Äôre not the same person. Hard to quantify or summarize, but we‚Äôll both know.


* Enneagram
	Type 8
	Myers Briggs
	INTP
	Quick need to knows
* Male, straight, monogamous.
* 5‚Äô9, ~160ish lbs and fairly athletic. Frequent runner/biker.
* Very Liberal policy-wise, but have my limits. 
* Raised non-denominational christian, personally non-religious
* Drink 3-5 times a month, generally only there‚Äôs an impetus (party, nice dinner,  happy hour, etc.)
* Occasional weed usage. Never have tried anything harder, but could be talked into experimentation.
* Private Banker. I work with HNW/UHNW persons on their unique banking needs, outside of what you‚Äôd be able to get from an app or a bank branch. Lots of VC/Tech adjacent people.
* MA in Financial Economics from University of St Andrews (Scotland). Also a CFA Charterholder.
* Kids? I‚Äôm mostly on the ‚Äúno‚Äù boat but who knows who or what might change me.
Life Story (the first date drivel)
1. Born and raised in the Chicago Suburbs. Winnetka, if you need to know. If i had to give myself a typecast it would be ‚Äúthe uncool kid that hung out with the cool kids because they all thought he was genuinely fun‚Äù
2. I went to University of St Andrews in Scotland. I studied economics, was a rower (and coach), and generally had a great time being slightly immature but also trying to be sophisticated.
3. I came back to Chicago after graduating, and sold my soul to a bank. I dove in way too deep and became way too much of a recluse while COVID raged. 
4. I needed a change and used my bargaining power to find myself a role out in San Francisco. I moved out at the end of 2021 and have been trying to find myself again.
I have two great parents (both work in finance too, I know we suck), an older brother who is outshining me by having a fiance + a dog + a house in Chicago, and always grew up with Golden Retrievers and Corgis (cool ones).
My Flaunts
1. Not a ‚Äòdude‚Äô
   1. I do yoga occasionally
   2. Love candles
   3. Great at giving opinions on women‚Äôs outfits
2. Wide range of skills and knowledge
Drives manual, knowledge of historical events, wide ranging vocabulary, pretty impressive cardio ability.
3. Intellectual prowess
1. 33 ACT (top 1%)
2. Passed CFA program without any re-takes
3. Went to the #1 university in the UK and got a 2:1 degree
4. I‚Äôm hilarious both sober and drunk if you get on my level of goofiness
5. Maturity
   1. Emotional Intelligence
   2. Great conversationalist with middle aged people
   3. Able to rationalize my own and other‚Äôs actions
6. Passionate and generous lover
My secret is eye contact and lots of skin contact. Also, it‚Äôs good size and it‚Äôs got a curve ;)
My Faults
7. I‚Äôm an emotional work in progress
Yeah, I have a therapist (shoutout to Linda). At least I admit it!
8. Trouble keeping my thoughts and opinions to myself
My boss and coworkers love this trait.
9. I can be a cheapskate
Time to confess I have some socks with holes and buy the cheap paper towels (but not toilet paper. I always have good toilet paper).
10. Trouble admitting when I need help
Again, shoutout to Linda
11. I need to treat myself better
   1. Skincare routine needs work
   2. Don‚Äôt get all my fruits/vegetables everyday
   3. I occasionally wear socks with holes in them
12. I‚Äôm a stereotype on paper
Works in finance, lives in the marina, drives a BMW. I make up for this in other ways (see flaunts).


_____________________________________________________________________________________

Name: Weiwen
ProfileText:
ÔªøNice to meet you, stranger!
Board game and outdoor-loving geek seeks partner




I‚Äôm Weiwen. I live in Vancouver, Canada. But I can move for the right guy, as I‚Äôm 36 and recently retired.


I spend a big chunk of my week creating educational content for my YouTube channel. Why? I enjoy helping others.
Beyond that, I‚Äôm part of three running clubs. I‚Äôve also climbed Mount Kinabalu, and hope to conquer Mount Kilimanjaro someday! 


Of course, I don‚Äôt photosynthesize outdoors continuously. I mean, I spend time indoors as well. There‚Äôs nothing better than plumbing the depths of my brain at board games nights and trivia nights. And if I need some me-time, you can bet that I‚Äôll be reading a book! 


Intrigued? Connect with me on LinkedIn.

ProfileText:
ÔªøTamera‚Äôs dating doc
Still endorsed as of Sep 21, 2023 (I‚Äôll try to update at least every two weeks ensure freshness)


  
  
  

  
  
  
  

In brief
Hello! My name is Tamera, pronounced like ‚Äúcamera‚Äù (üì∑) but with a T at the start. I‚Äôm a 28-year-old woman (she / her pronouns) who works as an AI alignment researcher and lives in Berkeley, CA. I‚Äôm looking for a man, aged ~24-34, who lives in the Bay Area and is looking for a primary, monogam-ish, or monogamous partner.
About me
Personality
Talking about one‚Äôs own personality is always kind of a strange thing to do, but despite that I‚Äôll try to give you some flavor for what I‚Äôm like!


* Curious - I think the world is very strange and interesting, and I like to try to figure out what‚Äôs going on. I see interesting questions everywhere and I am rarely satisfied with surface-level answers. Although I love to figure things out, I‚Äôm relatively less interested in knowing things, except insofar as they‚Äôre instrumentally useful to figuring things out (my favorite thing).
* Silly - I like to laugh, joke, and communicate through humor. I get along best with people who like to banter and lean into the absurd.
* Caring - I care deeply for the people around me, and I love to find ways to make their lives better. I enjoy being cared for in return!
* Quick - I like to think on my feet and have high-bandwidth conversations. I like to be put in unfamiliar environments and figure things out on the fly.
* Weird - Sometimes it takes my friends a long time to figure this out about me (since I‚Äôm doing a great job of coming off like a normal person!) but I think the way I approach the world is at core very different from many people. This can be hard to articulate exactly so I suggest that you keep a eye out to try to catch a glimpse of what I mean here.


Other adjectives that might be used to describe me include enthusiastic, extroverted, analytical, opinionated, novelty-seeking, and joyful.
Community and culture
I‚Äôm very much a part of the EA / rationalist culture and most of my friends would identify similarly. I live in a group house with a bunch of people in this community, and it is quite central in my life. It‚Äôs great if you‚Äôre a part of this world too, but also totally fine if you aren‚Äôt!
Activities I enjoy
Generally an ideal weekday evening for me involves a good conversation with a few friends, or some kind of chill communal activity like a game or film.


I also enjoy a constantly-rotating selection of hobbies. Some examples include:
* Hiking / camping / backpacking
* Many different crafts, including woodworking, bookbinding, and making my own backpacking gear
* Plein air watercolor
* Crosswords and other word games
* Playing ukulele (although I am not very good at it)
* Social dance, mostly contra but I‚Äôm getting into west coast swing
* Cooking (I used to do this a lot more)
* Silly little home improvement and home automation projects
* All sorts of trips and adventures with friends


Many weekend evenings you can find me at some Bay Area house party chatting with a bunch of other AI weirdos like myself. 
Romance-specific details


* Relationship style - I‚Äôve only ever been in monogamous partnerships, and I have been very happy with that in the past. I‚Äôve never had a serious polyamorous relationship; I‚Äôm in the midst of exploring the idea now. I think the ideal for me is probably a deeply loving primary partnership with the freedom for other little flings and romances on the side.
* Kids? - I‚Äôm something like 60/40 against. I really like children but I‚Äôm not wild about babies, and pregnancy truly freaks me out. I could be down but it‚Äôd have to be under the right circumstances. I can honestly see it going either way!
* Religion - I‚Äôm not religious but I was raised Jewish. In my own calculus this doesn‚Äôt matter much, but maybe to you it does!
The logistics


I know it can be scary to reach out, but I wrote this dating doc because I want to find someone! So I‚Äôd encourage you not to filter yourself out if you think there‚Äôs a chance we could be a good match. (I am also likely being contacted much less often than you might think!)


Also, before we proceed, I‚Äôd like you to be aware that it usually takes me a while to warm up to someone. I often don‚Äôt feel comfortable with someone until I‚Äôve seen them in a number of different contexts and known them for a few weeks at least. If I‚Äôm not all-in at first blush, don‚Äôt worry, I might just need some time. In the interim I‚Äôm likely to casually invite you to various parties and events so I can observe you in the wild so we can get to know each other without too much relationship-escalation pressure. :)


The best way to reach out is by texting me at: (‚Ä™six two eight) three three three - four seven two seven. Please send me some info about yourself, and we can find a time for a call or casual date. I look forward to hearing from you!

Name: Robert Nusbaum
ProfileText:
ÔªøThese laundry-list profiles are, in my view, totally beside the point and do not necessarily make for a lasting and fulfilling relationship. What I think does, and what I‚Äôd like, is someone who‚Äôd like to begin by just entering into a conversation, without a checklist of match-up criteria, just to see what might happen. I‚Äôm interested in the person‚Äôs mind, how their mind works, what they have to say, what interests them and above all what they say or don‚Äôt say in the moment. The thing below is an example of what I had to say at a particular moment, an hour or so ago on August 18, 2023, on a morning when... Which would then segue into whatever was going on in my life and/or mind at that moment that I felt like writing about. I‚Äôd like someone else to do the same, and then just maybe there might be a basis for something ‚Äì indefinable because whatever it is, will evolve and be created by how we interact, the extent to which we trust each other and sense that each other‚Äôs well being is important to us. I know this sounds kind of namby-pamby and vague, but talking about which composers I like or which books I read or what I do in my leisure time and my various careers: would that really tell anyone what they need to know? I suppose you could begin by asking yourself, What do I need to know about this person who‚Äôs posted this bizarre, possibly unreadable, probably self indulgent, surely stonewalling, and far too long poor excuse for a profile? I mean: what do I need to know in order to have a conversation with him? Or should I just take the plunge and begin talking to him and see what happens?


Response to someone else‚Äôs profile: 


I liked your profile, as profiles go. Meaning I could never write one like that, and I've been thinking a lot about what I could write, and when I have a moment and am in deep enough despair (just kidding, sort of), I might actually write and post one. But I don't really believe in them. I think people should just do what they would normally do if they met at a party or bar or wherever: Just begin talking and see what happens, which is what I hereby invite you to do. Via email at first, and then if it seems right/appropriate and the like, we can talk via a screen or you can board a plane and take a vacation in Budapest, where I live in a mega leafy neighborhood, magnificent view of the whole city from the terrace, beautiful walks and an interesting building (long story).


I am of course kidding about the vacation in Budapest, but, well, you know, you never know. And again, in my experience writing into a vacuum as I am now doing (okay, your photos, which are lovely, and the profile, which I liked) doesn't hold a candle to actual communication. One thing we could try is emailing in real time, as opposed to using a chat platform. Or we could do google meet without the screen, which I find distracting, so it would be a free phone call. Or anything else you'd like to suggest. I do have other suggestions, but I've already said enough, probably too much, being brief isn't exactly my strong point.
And as you can see there's very little profile-ish here, about my external life, because as I said, I think people should just write or say whatever they feel like writing/saying as in real life. And I really do invite you to do the same, without worrying about the impression it makes or anything like that. I've actually thought about starting a dating app which, like google docs albeit with a various differences, would encourage and enable people looking for a partner to do just that: just talk to each other, but within a particular structure that I'll elaborate on some other time, if we do end up talking to each other which I hope we do. If you have questions, you can ask, but here's what really interests me about anyone I meet, regardless of gender: how their mind works, what they think about, how interested they are in communicating, I mean passionately interested, and in communicating outside the envelope, if you see what I mean. Okay you don't: I mean just trying forms of communication other than the usual getting to know you sort of thing, to which I admit I'm kind of allergic. For example: sitting in silence (could be done on google meet as well, with or without a screen) and then just saying a few words now and then, but allowing the silence to dominate. That can be very powerful. Or deciding to free associate on any word, concept, name, really could be anything, and deciding on that would in and of itself make for an interesting dialogue. Or asking each other questions, but responding with only one or two words, or with a sound, or with silence (you'd say: silence, and then not answer). All this in the interest of getting beyond and underneath the superficial level of things, which when lived in the States, drove me A. crazy and B. into relative social isolation, apart from contacts through work and a relationship now and then, and that is a very long story for another time, or perhaps for never.
So I hope to hear from you. I do of course have a smartphone (just got it, didn't have one before two days ago), and the landline number is below.
Iphone: +36305676368. It's not on all the time because the battery isn't in great shape, so if you want to call, call the landline (+ 36 1 395 8751) and just tell me to switch it on and I will.

Name: Kadi
ProfileText:
ÔªøIntro
Well hi there. Looks like you've stumbled into my "date-me doc." Welcome, please pull up a chair and get comfy while you peruse my ramblings. 

Basics (get your checklist ready)
Age: 39
Height: 5‚Äô4‚Äù
Location: Manhattan, NYC
Build: Curvy/Athletic
Hair: Auburn with blue/green on the back half of my head. It‚Äôs a cool girl ‚Äúmullet‚Äù
Eyes: Green
Education: BA in Creative Writing/Poetry, minor in Film Studies
Job: Pricing and Yield management, SiriusXM/Pandora Media (left AND right brained!)
Relationship stats: Never married, looking for monogamous marriage/partnership
Kids: No (human) children, but want.
Autobiographical Ramblings (oh, god, you want to know more??)
I am a born and bred New Yorker. Yes, we exist. Yes, I know how to drive (current Kadi model comes with a bonus car accessory!). Yes, I regularly get out of the city because I know the world is broader than 5 boroughs. I plan on staying in the city since my family and friends are here, and I own my apartment.


I share my apartment with a tiny furry dictator who throws tantrums when he's not getting enough attention, but is somehow cute enough that I haven't returned him to the shelter. His name is Captain Ignatius, or Iggy if you're a friend (you probably are; he's a belly rub whore).


I have been an athlete most of my life (softball, swimming and water polo) and still remain active (kickboxing, gym, rec softball in the park). I love getting lost in a great book or TV show, I geek out on history (NYC history in particular) and 35mm photography. I've traveled some but want to see a lot more of the world, and I'm passionate about human rights of all kinds (LGBTQ, Women's, Black Lives Matter) and animal rights. It is important that my partner understands and supports these as well. I volunteer weekly. I went to a private school in NYC (and hate myself a little bit for having just typed that), and a small liberal arts college upstate. My mother's family is Jewish, but I view that as my culture and not my religion. I‚Äôm an atheist. I don't care if you have religion in your life as long as you don't try to convert me or impose it on our life together. 


I drink and am 420 friendly. I do not smoke cigarettes or cigars and will not date someone who does. I am fairly liberal, so conservatives need not apply. I think common sense is not so common anymore, particularly when it comes to political dogma. I am also always open to thoughtful conversations and debates on most things, so an exact alignment of all my specific values is not a necessity. Respect and morality, however, are.


My friends would describe me as sarcastic, funny, ‚Äústupid smart‚Äù[1], loyal, inquisitive, able to name most actors and at least two TV shows/movies they've been in, and "the reason I have a beauty product addiction."[2] And, my personal favorite: ‚ÄúI'm trying to figure out a way to say "loud and opinionated" in a way that doesn't sound like an insult‚Äù[3]
What I‚Äôm looking for (hey, that could be you!)
What I am looking for is a partner in the truest sense of the word. A man with whom I can share my life (and who shares his with me), have a child, see the world, and do all the things. I don't have a laundry list of qualifications, but someone who is settled enough in his life that he's ready to be serious and settle down is important. Non-smoker, non-conservative, not very religious. Able to keep up with my random thoughts, preferably sharing some interests, and willing to also let the furry dictator into your life (we‚Äôre a package deal). 
I would prefer a man who‚Äôs at least 5‚Äô8‚Äù, between 30 and 45, who is based in the NYC area (5 boroughs ideally)
Still here? 
You can reach me at DateKadi@gmail.com, and please include either your own doc or basic details (age, height, where you live, some photos (or social handles)) and what drew you to reach out. I don‚Äôt have the ability to answer every email, but I do my best. My socials are locked, and I don‚Äôt add randos, sorry! 


Photos!

  





Oh, you want pictures of ME?? Keep scrolling! 
  
          
  
         
________________
[1] Best friend #1
[2] Best friend #1
[3] Best friend #2

What I appreciate in a partner:

Name: Swami
Contact: Form and contact info in dating doc
ProfileText:
ÔªøSwami‚Äôs Dating Doc
  
  
  



  
  
  
  
  
  



  
  

  
  
  



  





TL;DR: I'm a 29-year-old male based in Pittsburgh, currently pursuing a PhD in AI/Robotics. I describe myself as deeply curious about the world with a drive to make a positive impact. I'm seeking a long-term relationship with a woman who shares a similar curiosity and drive. Open to long-distance dating and periodic travel. Please connect me with any women you feel might be a good match. Thank you!
Hey! This is Swami‚Äôs dating document. It was inspired from numerous other docs here. If anyone recognizes the format or specific phrases, please consider it a nod to your originality! I mean, they do say that imitation is the best form of flattery, right? üòõ Whenever I've borrowed a line directly with minimal modifications, I've made a note of it in brackets. Also, pardon me for making the doc incredibly long (and serious?). I‚Äôve tried to arrange things with sub-headings/headings to help you navigate it. I hope it helps. And happy to receive feedback on how I could improve this doc! Over time, I‚Äôll probably also try to make it shorter and more fun to read üôÉ. 
Contents
* Personality
* Interests
* Career and Passions
* Work in progress
* Dating Preferences
* Other imp stuff - kids/relationship style etc
* Possible cons or sources of incompatibility 
* How to Connect with Me
Personality
This section could feel like a drag to read. So I would recommend skimming/reading the headings first and then deciding whether to read the corresponding descriptions.
Family and Friends - A Sense of Duty and Affection: Stereotypically Indian in this respect. 
Teamwork and Partnership: I thrive under collaborative settings, both in professional and personal settings. However, until a few years back I didn‚Äôt appreciate the value of collaborative exploration in personal settings. Covid thankfully changed that by forcing me into a 1.5 year long coliving experiment with my then wonderful housemates and making me realize the value of deep personal relationships. Ever since I‚Äôve tried to keep the spirit alive. I have as a result built some of my closest friendships and had immense personal growth along dimensions I had mostly considered pointless until then!
Conventionally sociable with unconventional interests and aspirations : While my youthful 'weirdness' defined my unique interests, maturity has woven this individuality into a tapestry of approachable and meaningful connections. I thrive on the balance between maintaining my quirks and fostering genuine interactions, embodying a blend of individuality and sociability that defines me.
A Compassionate World View: That doesn't necessarily mean I‚Äôm unusually empathetic, or unusually self-sacrificing. But there‚Äôs an underlying attitude of valuing things outside of oneself that makes prosocial behavior feel less like an imposition and more like a facet of one‚Äôs own desires or personality. To care in this sense is to want to sculpt a better version of the world into existence. (partial copy)
Emotional range : While my external emotional display is adept at adapting to those around me, internally, my personal emotional spectrum can be more nuanced. I seldom feel sadness or anger or depression, and even my moments of genuine joy and excitement come in subtler shades ‚Äî maybe my time with robots is rubbing off on me üòâ! Although that describes my natural state, in environments where I feel at ease, I can consciously dial up the vibrancy of my emotions, embracing a more exuberant demeanor. In contrast, unfamiliar situations demand so much cognitive bandwidth that modulating my internal emotional response becomes challenging. 
Curiosity+learning : Stereotypical PhD student/researcher. When a topic piques my interest, it's easy for me to get lost in a book or get lost in deep explorations, diving into their intricate details. I relish sharing and discussing these explorations with friends, family, and colleagues. 
Thrive on conversations: Related to the above point, I learn and think best through conversations. This is how I A/B test my ideas/thoughts, filter confirmation biases and generate new ideas! And I like to talk about/discuss almost anything under the sun, especially when it‚Äôs new territory or something I haven‚Äôt thought enough about already!
People pleaser : Standard stuff - Have a hard time saying no or confronting people. 
Insecurities/Personal challenges: 
* Although I love to talk about my interests/explorations, I have a constant insecurity that the listener is getting bored. Partly stems from the fact that the average person does indeed get bored lol. The only way to improve is to get better at using feedback.
* My work is a significant part of my identity. I frequently have ‚Äòmidlife‚Äô crises about the social utility of my work. I am in a constant tug-of-war with myself over how to trade-off between more socially meaningful things vs intellectually interesting pursuits.
* Navigating Social Dynamics: Deciding how to best allocate my time among friends, family, and professional obligations is an ongoing challenge. The difficulty in saying no or prioritizing one over the other often leads to existential quandaries.
* And then the standard things - fear of rejection, failure, judgment etc. 
Other personality quirks : 
* I often have strong opinions but they are also pretty weakly held (i.e I love to change my mind). I pride myself on being open-minded, but I'll admit, I sometimes wrestle with confirmation biases. Conversations have been my best tool to tackle them. I‚Äôve gotten better at it over time, but it‚Äôs always a work in progress.
* I love gossip! But I‚Äôm not great at keeping secrets üôä. While I strive to be a vault for serious secrets, the fun ones might just slip out in a playful conversation. Yet, my friends still find me a worthy confidante. Go figure! üòâ
* Instinctively I‚Äôm a minimalist and like to keep my footprint low. I typically don‚Äôt buy things unless it feels necessary. It‚Äôs not some strong ideological commitment. Just something I picked up during my childhood. 
* I consume very healthy food, largely thanks to my taste buds not caring about taste very much.. Haha.
* I love summer! Winter not so much. Yet I‚Äôve spent 6+ years in Pittsburgh üòÖ. 
* Lastly, I love to make fun of myself (as you might notice from this document) as well as the people around me. Given that I do plenty of dumb things, folks typically find sufficient material to make fun of me.. Haha.
There are likely many more of these, but I will spare you the rest. I believe that should provide you with a general sense of the tedium you might be getting yourself into! üòõ
Interests
* Learning/Intellectual Curiosity : I'm quite curious about the world and enjoy exploring topics that help me understand it better. This can range from the finer points of economics and the dynamic landscape of geopolitics, to the evolving landscape of startups or the intricacies of historical and sociological phenomena. Lately, I've been delving into the following :
   * Economics : Good Economics for Hard Times, Slouching towards Utopia
   * The power of networks : MegaNets, The power law
   * Impact of AI on society : The coming wave
   * Religious history : A little history of Religion, God Human Animal Machine.
   * Self Improvement : Atomic Habits, Stolen Focus
   * General History : Hard Core History podcast, Age of revolutions, End times, The dawn of everything
   * Geopolitics : The avoidable war, The end of the world Is just the beginning
* Hanging out with friends and chatting : In fact that‚Äôs one of the reasons I love academia. We spend most of the day chatting and fooling around, even (especially?) during work hours üòÇ. (and then finally get some work done at night when no one‚Äôs around.. This dating doc was a casualty of some of those late-night sessions)
* Physical Activities: My go-to sources for weekly exercise are running, biking, and gymming, preferably with friends.
Things I‚Äôm curious about and want to explore
* Book Clubs/Curius App  (social reading/bookmark tool) - Was introduced to the Curius app while going through someone else‚Äôs dating doc and have since been using it. Social reading/bookmarking sounds amazing. I definitely want to start using it more! More broadly, I‚Äôd love to turn my reading/ listening into a social activity using Curius or by reading jointly with groups of friends.
* Blog writing : I‚Äôve also been meaning to convert a lot of my thoughts into blogs both for personal reference and to disseminate a lot of the thoughts out to the world. But I‚Äôve just been procrastinating on that. Would love to have a partner in crime for this! Here‚Äôs a list of topics I‚Äôve been thinking/reading about : Blogs Topic List
Career & Passions
I‚Äôm a PhD student at CMU working at the intersection of optimization and deep learning with applications in Robotics. I started working on it mostly out of intellectual curiosity and felt proud of it, assuming that it will pave the way towards a more productive and prosperous future. However, the recent rapid advancements in the field have spurred some introspection. I now feel there‚Äôs a reasonable risk of unfettered progress also leading to societal instability and chaos. Hence, I have been reconsidering my research directions and trying to pivot towards specific applications that have potential to create new markets and industries that complement, rather than just displace, human labor. This has led me to exciting domains like space robotics, human robot coordination etc. 
Outside the realm of academia, I'm driven by the urge to adapt our societal structures in anticipation of rapid technological shifts. I have several thoughts on evolving our socioeconomic systems, and designing modern institutions and communities fit for the AI/digital age. I already spend a significant amount of time thinking about them, but I'm keen on exploring these more deeply/working on them soon, perhaps post-PhD. If our paths align or if you're curious about such dialogues (or fancy a spirited chat on UBI vs. micro-credits and how tech could help scale them. I personally prefer the latter), let's discuss! haha
Work in progress
* Crafting my own path : I have had a tendency since the very beginning to be ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù. Defy the local mainstream. Until a few years back, the ‚Äòdefiant‚Äô paths I chose also had reasonably clear trails that I could follow. However, my more recent ‚Äòdefiant‚Äô interests are far less explored and lack clear trails. Currently I‚Äôm trying to figure out a reasonable path forward. 
* Improving conversational skills : While I‚Äôve improved a lot in making conversations, there‚Äôs still a long way to go. Eg I‚Äôm still bad at (a) Pausing and appreciating other people‚Äôs arguments (b) Simultaneously reasoning about the arguments in the current discussion and steering the broader direction of the discussion at a meta level (b) conversing with multiple people at once (c) communicating effectively under stress (d) messaging convos, etc. (in summary, bad at multithreading)
* Emotional range - As touched upon in the personality section, my internal emotional range is a bit muted. I‚Äôm working on enriching it, especially on the positive spectrum.
* Becoming more digital native - I‚Äôm a millennial who‚Äôs a bit wary of having a strong digital social presence (I know, we‚Äôre a rare breed, but we do exist üòõ). But I‚Äôm trying to shake it. Blog writing/Cirius usage would probably help. 
* Prioritization skills - (a) get better at saying No to things (b) stop doom scrolling and reading arbitrary things. (c) make strict schedules and stick to it.
What am I looking for in a partner?
I‚Äôm listing some of the qualities that I absolutely love in people. But none of these obviously are requirements.  
* Curiosity + intellectual excitement : There‚Äôs nothing I enjoy more in life than trying to learn and understand new things with someone!
* Deeply cares about the world and wants to make it better : I have a deep sense of appreciation and respect for people who genuinely care about the world!
* Unconventional/weird : I have a huge admiration for people defying the mainstream and venturing into the unknown (especially for social good reasons). 
* And then there‚Äôs the usual stuff like vibe match etc. which we‚Äôll figure out over time.
Other important stuff:
* Location: I‚Äôm a PhD student at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, PA, and I expect to graduate mid 2025ish. 
   * I could possibly travel to another city periodically given my PhD doesn‚Äôt have a strong place constraint.
   * And I would be more than happy to date long-distance!
* Relationship style: Monogamous.
* Kids: I love children and would like to have (or adopt) kids. In particular, I‚Äôm excited to have children with someone. It goes back to the notion of teamwork and shared deep connection that parenting facilitates. In fact, I‚Äôm hoping we also develop tools in the process that make parenting more communal for everyone. I think kids are the best source of entertainment and meaning adults get and I want to share it with everyone! Likewise, I think kids learn a lot from interacting with a diverse set of adults! So it is a win-win for everyone!
   * That being said, our mutual understanding and discussions will play a pivotal role in shaping this decision (even of having kids)! If you prefer other ways we could get a shared sense of meaning and connection, I would definitely be open to that possibility as well! 
Possible ‚Äòcons‚Äô or sources of incompatibility (beyond what you might have already inferred from above):
* Balancing Time: I‚Äôm generally bad at prioritizing and balancing my time. I let whatever gets my attention drive my priorities. It does work well in certain cases when I carefully tune my environment so that my attention is consumed by people/activities I care about. But sometimes it can get difficult when I need to redirect my focus since changing the environment isn‚Äôt easy. I can also sometimes overcommit to too many things, which occasionally itself causes a juggle in balancing my time. 
* Relationship Experience: I've never tried dating before!! For a long time, I didn‚Äôt know what I wanted from a relationship and thought I could get most things I cared about through friendships. My opinions there changed a few years back. But then covid happened and then life happenedüòÇ. Also, I don‚Äôt like the format that most dating apps offer, and the leap from friendship to romance has always felt daunting. So, I think dating docs really were a saving grace for me both in terms of timing and style! I don‚Äôt think I had any chance of dating someone without it (maybe I still don‚Äôt, we‚Äôll see üòÇ ).  
Update : Dating doc was a partial success üòõ . Now, I can say I have dated people!
* Not an activities person: Whether in a small cafe or on a long trip, it's the engaging conversations that I cherish the most, rather than the activities themselves. So I usually prefer activities that are in the service of conversations/chats!
* Dietary Habits: I identify as a "fuzzy vegan" (some friends prefer to call me "fake-vegan" instead üòâ). While I prefer being vegan, there are occasions where I indulge in milk or egg-based products for social/my own convenience.
   * I would be happy to date someone who isn‚Äôt vegan/vegetarian though, we would just have some extra cooking to do :) (copied)
   * Lifestyle Choices: I avoid alcohol, smoking, and drugs. However, I'd very much enjoy a partner who enjoys a drink now and then.
   * Family Dynamics: My dad deals with minor mental health issues which occasionally influence our family dynamics. Thanks to effective medication, such instances are mostly under control now. We've also learned to support and uplift each other effectively through these times. I mention this for the sake of transparency and believe it shouldn't be a cause for concern.
   * Taste in Music/Dance/Art: I have a somewhat narrow taste in music! And my dancing skills are completely hopeless! My sense of aesthetics and art is better but not great by any means unfortunately! üòÖ
   * MOST IMPORTANTLY : I EAT A LOT üòÇ.  Dining out with me might turn into a patience test for my company!!! 
What could we do together?
   * Mutual Learning: My top pick! Let‚Äôs immerse ourselves in new subjects, teach each other, or delve into engaging books or podcasts. The exchange of ideas is the thrill!
   * Social Gatherings: Spending time with our respective friends is a great way to blend our worlds and share experiences.
   * walks/runs/biking/hikes: Go on walks/runs/biking/hikes and talk or just look at some good ol‚Äô trees‚Ä¶ üå≤(copied)
   * Collaborative Projects: Some examples from the ‚Äòinterests‚Äô section above include writing blogs together or perhaps starting a podcast! I would also absolutely love to work on a project or try out a new area together.
   * Day-to-Day Delights: The magic is often in the mundane. Activities like cooking or exercising become special when done together!
If you think we might be compatible or just have some comments, please reach out!
   * Thanks for making it all the way to the end of my document! I already admire your attention span and curiosity! Please leave me a message in this google form if you want to stay in touch or have any comments or suggestions for me! If you think we‚Äôre compatible and are interested in dating, please fill out this google form to let me know üôÇ. And if you don‚Äôt like the format of a google form, feel free to mention that in the comments form and we can try to arrange a call instead!

Name: Kyleigh
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate Me ;) 
Hi! I‚Äôm Kyleigh, a 30-year-old woman in Southern California. I‚Äôm looking for a long term partner. 
I recently came across the concept of a Date Me Doc, and I was intrigued. So, let‚Äôs find out what happens when I tell the universe exactly what I want. ‚ú®
DIRECTORY
‚ÜíGet to know me
‚ÜíWhat I‚Äôm looking for
‚ÜíWant to date me? 


________________


Get to know me
* Corporate by day, I‚Äôm a senior manager of external communications for a Fortune 100 company. I take pride in being a leader of people and developing my team and our culture, while enhancing my brand‚Äôs reputation through storytelling (in a nutshell). Work keeps me fairly busy during the week. 
* In my spare time, I practice yoga, hang out with my rescue pup, Tayla, practice self-care and mindfulness, spend time with close friends, enjoy the outdoors, and the occasional trash tv binge. Note: I do not consider myself to be a chronically online person ‚Äì in fact, I make conscious effort to spend less time behind screens.
* I‚Äôve been single for nearly two years, and it‚Äôs been ages since I‚Äôve had a serious long term relationship. I‚Äôve dated here and there, but I‚Äôm not interested in wasting time with anyone I don‚Äôt feel a genuine connection with. I‚Äôm quite independent, and I spend a decent amount of time alone, which I don‚Äôt usually mind. I go to therapy regularly, and I‚Äôm continually working to make my anxious attachment style more secure. I‚Äôm ready for a conscious relationship with someone who isn‚Äôt afraid to do the work.


‚Üí Things I‚Äôm Into
* Camping, road trips, national parks, mountains and other lowkey outdoorsy shit.
* Growth, self-development and manifestation. 
* A good book with nothing to do and nowhere to be.
* Warm baths/showers by candlelight.
* Dogs and animals in general. I rescued a 50-pound super mutt, and she‚Äôs my bestie/adventure buddy.
* My cozy apartment/safe haven. I like creating comfortable, warm spaces and taking care of my home. 
* All things cheese, charcuterie and wine. I won‚Äôt say no to being wined and dined. 
* Crystals, incense, journaling, moon rituals. 


‚Üí My Strengths
* My empathy ‚Äì I have a huge heart, and I can be a sensitive girlie. It‚Äôs a superpower and a curse.
* My open-mindedness and ability to see multiple/opposing points of view.
* I‚Äôve built a great life for myself. I‚Äôm self-sufficient and fairly successful. I‚Äôm enjoying this phase of life I‚Äôm in, but I also have a growth mindset and am always evolving.


‚Üí My Dreams
* Quit my job and make a living off of my hobbies (just not sure which ones yet).
* Travel and see as much of the world (and eat as many different foods) as I can.
* Find a partner to grow through life with.


‚Üí Some Basics
* Height: 5‚Äô8‚Äù
* Sexuality: Bi+ (past LTRs with men, but attracted to men and women)
* Diet: Omnivore foodie
* Drinking: Sometimes, mostly wine or cocktails with friends
* Smoking: Never, and I don‚Äôt date people who smoke cigarettes
* Drugs: Weed occasionally in the evenings to unwind 
* Zodiac: ‚òÄÔ∏èGemini üåô Pisces  ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Cancer 
* Tats: A few small ones ;)


‚Üí Lifestyle + Views
* Kids: I‚Äôm open to having kids (not a dealbreaker either way), but no time soon and the circumstances would need to be just right.
* Religion: Not religious, but I consider myself ‚Äúspiritual‚Äù in my own unique relationship with higher power.
* Political views: I enjoy having open-minded conversations with thoughtful people, but I don‚Äôt consider myself political. I think the bipartisan system is a distraction, and I don‚Äôt really identify with a party. 
* Causes I care about: Women‚Äôs/reproductive rights. LGBTQ+ rights. Living a somewhat environmentally conscious lifestyle. Animal welfare/adopt don‚Äôt shop. 
* Activity: As previously mentioned, I‚Äôm a bit of a yogi. My physical activity hasn‚Äôt been much lately beyond yoga and long walks with my dog due to a long-term strain/injury, but I recently got back into circuit training. I also enjoy hiking and kickboxing (though I‚Äôm v new to the latter).
* Relationship Type: Monogamous; I don‚Äôt like sharing.
* Marriage: Yes, as in the conscious practice between two people who co-create life together. I don‚Äôt really envision a big white wedding. More of an intimate destination wedding or mountain elopement type. 
* I am NOT a morning person by nature. I usually wake around 7 a.m. and sleep around 11 p.m.


‚Üí My Intrinsic Values (according to clearthinking.org)
* Agency/freedom ‚Äì that I can make choices for myself
* Learning/knowing ‚Äì that I continually learn new things
* Virtue/embodiment ‚Äì  that I maintain my humility and gratitude
* Pleasure/experiences ‚Äì that I experience pleasure and my life is full of exciting things


‚ÜíPhotos


  
  

  

  
  



________________




What I‚Äôm Looking For
* Energy ‚Äì I want that deep, soul-level connection with someone funny, warm and joyful. I also need someone who wants to put energy in and shows up.
* Ambition, goals and growth mindset.
* Someone good, kind and open-minded with quiet confidence and strong boundaries. 
* Emotional intelligence/awareness and someone who can speak my love languages.
* Genuine curiosity for me and my world, deep/close connections with loved ones and a conscious self-care practice that includes mind, body and soul. 


‚Üí The kinda relationship I want
* Communication is healthy, open and abundant; my love languages are words of affirmation and quality time/quality conversation. 
* I‚Äôm a highly sexual person, (from what I gather, more so than than the average woman) and I need someone who matches my level of desire/drive.
* We respect each other‚Äôs individuality, and together, we co-create a thriving life and challenge each other to be better versions of ourselves.


________________




Wanna date me?
If this piques your interest ‚Äì or you know someone who it might ‚Äì I‚Äôd love to hear from you. Get in touch right here.

ÔªøRavi Roshan
Email: roshanraviraj [at] gmail [dot] com
Descriptors: 27M, 6‚Äô, straight
You can also email me if you wanna connect & make life happier :)




  
           


  
            
In brief
Hello! My name is Ravi. I‚Äôm a 27-year-old man who works as an Analyst. I‚Äôm looking for a woman, who is honest & loving and is looking for a primary partner.




About me
Personality
Talking about one‚Äôs own personality is always kind of a strange thing to do, but despite that I‚Äôll try to give you some flavor for what I‚Äôm like!


* Curious - I think the world is very strange and interesting, and I like to try to figure out what‚Äôs going on. I see interesting questions everywhere and I am rarely satisfied with surface-level answers.
* Silly - I like to laugh, joke, and communicate through humor. I get along best with people who can lean into the absurd.
* Caring - I care deeply for the people around me, and I love to find ways to make their lives better. I enjoy being cared for in return!
* Quick - I like to think on my feet and have high-bandwidth conversations. I like to be put in unfamiliar environments and figure things out on the fly.
* Weird - Sometimes it takes my friends a long time to figure this out about me (since I‚Äôm doing a great job of coming off like a normal person!) but I think the way I approach the world is at core very different from many people. This can be hard to articulate exactly so I suggest that you keep an eye out to try to catch a glimpse of what I mean here.


Other adjectives that might be used to describe me include enthusiastic, extroverted, analytical, opinionated, traveller, and jolly.




Activities I enjoy

Generally involves a good conversation with a few friends, or some activity like a game or film.


I also enjoy a constantly-rotating selection of hobbies. Some examples include:
* Hiking / camping / backpacking
* Many different crafts, including woodworking, and making my own backpacking gear
* Playing Guitar(although I am not very good at it)
* All sorts of trips and adventures with friends
* Photography & cinematography is what I crave for 


Romance-specific details


* Relationship style - I‚Äôve only ever been in monogamous partnerships, and I have been very happy with that in the past. I‚Äôve never tried polyamory, and I‚Äôm not opposed to the concept, but I‚Äôd definitely need some hand-holding if I were to try it.
* Kids? - I really like children but I‚Äôm not wild about babies. I could be down but it‚Äôd have to be under the right circumstances. I can honestly see it going either way!








The best way to reach out is by mailing me at: roshanraviraj@gmail.com , OR, 
Instagram: @roshanstrikes and we can find a time for a call or casual date. I look forward to hearing from you!

Name: Nate Strum
ProfileText:
ÔªøHi, I‚Äôm Nate! I‚Äôm 23, straight, and male. I‚Äôm excited about finding an in-person community of people similarly enthusiastic about intellectual exploration. I love talking, hanging out in groups, and coordinating outings. Favorite activities include meeting friends at the park to invent random games involving tennis balls and frisbees, LAN parties, and foraging for wild foods. I just finished school, and I‚Äôm very location-agnostic. I‚Äôll likely prioritize learning instead of full time work for the next year or two, although I‚Äôm open to reconsidering in order to date someone in an expensive area. Longevity is on my mind a lot, and I‚Äôll probably end up in the field or earning to give to it. I‚Äôm currently unsure about having kids. However, I definitely want rationalism and my weird little culture to spread. 


I was brought up as an atheist and ancap, though I‚Äôm pretty agnostic about political philosophy now. Metaethics is a different story: I scrapped the remnants of deontology that I inherited, and I‚Äôm now a staunch non-cognitivist. However, I still feel an aversion to coercion. Separating children from their mothers and preventing them from spending most of their day playing outside and otherwise doing whatever they find interesting seems pretty horrific to me. I‚Äôm very inclined toward unschooling and aristocratic tutoring. 


I‚Äôm open to polyamory and experimental relationship structures. I‚Äôm not a jealous person anyway, but I‚Äôm interested in seeing how novel situations affect me emotionally. I think about the evolution of emotions a lot, though that‚Äôs one of the many areas where I get caught in analysis loops and should be more empirical! On that note, I‚Äôm open to all sorts of lifestyle experiments. I‚Äôm big on Crocker‚Äôs rules, but I‚Äôve become very interested in discussing emotions in recent years. I‚Äôm prone to existential melancholy and can be a bit dramatic, but I‚Äôm not proud of it, and I‚Äôm getting better at staying in a good mood consistently. I like snuggling. I haven‚Äôt been big on gift-giving or unsolicited acts of service in the past, but I want to improve if that‚Äôs your thing!  


Besides cold, dry air-induced asthma and mild pet allergies, I‚Äôm healthy as a horse. I‚Äôm neurotypical but get along well with certain brands of autists. I love outdoor activities and playing sports, though you don‚Äôt have to.


You can contact me at natestrum@rocketmail.com
