ProfileText:
ÔªøüëãWelcome to my date-me-doc!
  

Quick! 
Pose in a sophisticated way and pretend you did not giggle about jokes the last 10 minutes. ü§î




üìÑ Basic Facts
üëÄ Stuff to know about me
üîé What I am looking for
üï∫Short Term
Poly:
üåû Long Term
üåû Location
üëØüíë Date Ideas
üë®‚Äçüé®üë®‚Äçüî¨ What am I doing with my life
üìú Credentials
‚ùìPotential deal breakers
‚ûïBonus


üìÑ Basic Facts
Hey Aron here -  I am
* based in Berlin-Lichtenberg, Germany
* 32 years old
* hetero-cis
* in a poly-relationship
* born in Germany, but spend 50% of my life in english, so can fluently speak and think in english


  

üëÄ Stuff to know about me
Some miscellaneous stuff about me which hints at hobbies and values.


I am interested in learning stuff, eXamples:
* in lockdown I got a drumkit 
* and a microphone just to eXperiment with and
* started taking a few vocal lessons as well - just for good measure
* when I worked in a nightclub (long time ago) I got into the details of making cocktails and got myself stuff like Gin spices, started adding grapefruit peel and flame rosmarin for drinks at house parties
* I try to embody a scout mindset üîé
* I practice Taekwondo 2X/week and am aiming for the second black belt
* I also spend a bunch of time reading blogs, books, and listening to podcasts
* currently investigating the art of storytelling


I am pretty eXtroverted - I flourish in interesting conversations with lots of people
I like to host small themed events (costume-parties, idea-saloons, or conscious music sharing sessions).
        
I try to do Good 
I care about having a positive impact on the world. With art always asking myself ‚ÄúWhat are stories worth telling?‚Äù.  Also connected with the broader Effective Altruism community. I have found plenty of wonderful friends there.


I care about truth‚Ñ¢. Would love to eXplore how we think about the world through dialogue. 


As a result of learning + working it can happen that I sometimes spend days without leaving the house. But co-working with great people is also socializing, right? ^^
üîé What I am looking for
You?
  



eXploring more love. I think I have more to give.
I want someone to cuddle and love.
And to receive love and eXplore life together.
Create a shared protopia (prototype utopia).


One of my love languages is definitely touch. I enjoy giving (back-) massages. Learned how to do that professionally once and it has been a great life skill ever since. Friends can attest :p  
Just great moments of mutual relaXation. Good stuff.


[some more ideas around deal-breakers and potential mutual interests at the end of this doc]
üï∫Short Term
Being Hedon Buddies - yeah would be open to that
Always happy to go on a fun date with someone even if ‚Äònothing more‚Äô emerges from that
  



Poly:
When I created this doc in early 2023 I wrote ‚Äú"Polysecure" is on my (long) reading list. Would bring it to the top of my reading list for the right person :D‚Äù
Well that is funny! I guess I did find the right person and did end up reading that book (and many others). I have been in a poly-relationship lasting since Summer 2023. So going over a year and going well. üôÇ Feels very much new to me though.


  

My partner and I with 2 amazing friends


I asked my current partner to leave a note here. This is what they had to say on the fly:
 ‚Äú10/10 would date again‚Äù (they have edit access to this doc if they ever wanna change it :D)




üåû Long Term  




Hmm eXpectation setting: There is space in my life currently for up to 6 dates a month I guess. Like if I actually look at my calendar and my plans.
In the long term I would like to introduce you to my partner. I want us to be chill around each other. To be fair this would be the first time dating 2 people at the same time. So I would just be open to eXploring and communicating what works for us. So I don‚Äôt have clearly detailed plans for this yet. 


Below you can read what my romantic single self had to say in early 2023:


I want us to encourage each other to become better. Grow together[a]. Which could also just mean that most of the time we are both each other's comforting recharging resting place.


I am deeply inspired by this impressive elderly couple who wrote a free book[b][c] after ~50 years of marriage. They both work in nuclear proliferation and had to first 'create peace within their relationship before bringing it to the rest of the world'. Our relationship might not look at all like theirs and we don't have to work on the same problems but I would want both of us to contribute to the world in some way or another while our relationship will contain a great amount of laughter and kindness - so we can be a shining star for others üåü


Kids: I don‚Äôt feel like getting kids right now. On the other hand I would not be surprised that with the right person I could imagine starting a family in the neXt 3 - 10 years.
But I could also see that I can scratch that itch by becoming a teacher of some sorts (e.g. professor, mentor or being the funny uncle^^). I am currently not feeling like I am missing something and I can see myself never having kids and still living a flourishing happy fulfilled meaningful life. But I (naively) think having kids can be a beautiful thing.
This would be something I would love to think through and eXplore together after a while. Let's see what feels right.


To be honest I am eXcited about the neXt relationship (hence this doc). Each year I learn more about myself and forms of communications (and have become a better friend of mine as a result üòä). I can see how that knowledge would just help greatly in a relationship.  (Things I read about and/or where I participated in workshops: Non-Violent Communication, Double CruX, Street Epistemology, intrinsic values, CBT, mindfulness, ask vs guess vs tell culture, consent games, ‚Ä¶)


Location
I am living in Lichtenberg-Berlin. If you are in Berlin or around that would be cool!
But everything in Germany that is reachable via train could be nice.


Otherwise, I am in and around London at least once a year.
Could see myself making 1 week long trips in Europe for the right person given that I work remotely.


I am kinda eXcited about the idea of having lovely connections in different parts of the world. Places to come home to in a way. But I can definitely see how this might be in conflict for you/me to be the building block of a committed relationship. 
üëØüíë Date Ideas
‚ÄúFor picnic and picnic related dates, press 1
For creative and drawing activities related dates, press 2
For ‚Ä¶.‚Äù
  



  
  
  

Left: bike that seats 2 for shared picnic tripü•®‚òï, 
center: #cruisinüõπ, 
right: fun with body paint, probably better for third, fourth or n-th date üòÖ
üë®‚Äçüé®üë®‚Äçüî¨ What am I doing with my life
Am a researcher and team coordinator at a not-for-profit research org where I look into fun-stuff such as nuclear winters (but mostly support my brilliant colleagues). Currently, I have reduced my hours to eXplore more creative ways of adding value to the world.


I build art eXhibitions that deal with the future. Watch Facing Moloch on YouTube if you like! 
I also enjoy imagining what if we get it right. 


I am concerned about Global Catastrophic Risks and Existential Risks and devote a significant part of my work/life/art to contribute to these areas.


But I also wanna have fun in the meantime. Live fully / intentionally.
üìú Credentials
‚ÄúYou are the most optimistic doomy person I have met!‚Äù - random conference attendee in Prague


‚Äúwarm & kind person, great friend
reconciles being scientifically minded and being deeply artistic 
forward and systematic thinker who cares about flourishing of humanity 
Creative about grasping Zeitgeist and Ideengeschichte in art ‚Äú - close friend
‚ùìPotential deal breakers[d]
on leaving the house/city for nature
I guess I don‚Äôt go much into nature out of intrinsic motivation.
I love going to lakes for swimming.
Am happy to take a run through a park or go on a bike tour in the forestry greeny lake-rich outskirts of Berlin. But I only occasionally seek these kinds of activities on my own.
I wonder if I have that impression right now just because the last few months I have been recovering from a sports-injury .


(I have got passions for lifetimes to pursue just with internet access at home üòÖ)
So if you are seeking someone to retreat into the woods you have some convincing to do. But maybe you are the dryad to lure me into the forest ^^


Traveling
I don‚Äôt fly around as much (as some of my friends). I have some sort of deeper ingrained belief around responsible spending and carbon footprint and a cluster of 'something feels off'.
But I do make eXceptions for projects / work which I deem valuable. As a result I get to visit Europe's capital cities for conferences. In 2022 I was in Paris, Prague, and London (+ a couple of German cities). In 2023 I added Warsaw and Vienna to the list. Usually adding a few days around events/conferences to eXplore the city and visit museums or meet-up with people I normally only interact with online.
Generally, I prefer vacations which are reachable via train.


Diet
I am vegan around 98% of the time. 2% vegetarian are from eating at restaurants and families where there are no convenient vegan options. I would prefer for you to be vegetarian or vegan.
Also, potatoes are the best! Here have one and rejoice ü•î


Drugs
Caffeine in the form of coffee mostly. Occasionally, but increasingly rarer, a beer. You do you üôÇ  But taking drugs together is not a date idea I am interested in.
‚ûïBonus
You like nerding out about music (I like prog-metal music among many other genres)
I love discovering new music
I also enjoy sharing music, so if you are open to new stuff that would be cool. 
Would love to hear why you enjoy a certain style / artist / song. 


I find it inspiring when people are eXpressing themselves and are turning an emotion into art. Dancers, musicians, painters, poets. If we are getting together, chances are high that I will draw you (like one of the french girls). üòä


I admire it when people can think clearly, decouple concepts, eXplore ideas, and communicate well. Scientists, coders/programmers, writers. Let's update our models of what is actually going on. Does your map fit the territory? ü§î




If you want to get to know me - Awesome! Feel free to ping me:
Signal: aeXplorer.12000
Telegram: @globalcatstrophicrisk


Feel free to let me know if you missed something from this doc or think it could be improved somehow üôÇ
Here is my Admonymous link for anonymous feedback.


Thanks for reading all of this! Here is a poem as a token of gratitude:


  



ToDo
* insert songs and playlists I enjoy
* ???
* profit






[a]If I recall correctly the growth mindset has been debunked - but it is still something that feels intuitively good / right.
[b]"A New Map for Relationships - Creating True Love At Home & Peace On The Planet" https://anewmap.com/
[c]It is basically NVC + some funny anecdotes about geopolitics and the couple. But I just loved learning about them and how they both together want to do good in the world and thrive doing so.
[d]or deal-makers - depending on your preferences ^^

ÔªøJulian Deep Dive
(Last updated Feb 2025)
‚ÄúI love you & love being your friend for so many reasons & highest among them is that by feeling, thinking & talking with you I can begin to refuse that which does not serve me. You ask questions and share ideas but, beautifully, all of the movement and growth and opening is me, my own. Things are so shockingly possible and I‚Äôm so grateful to be realizing that with the help of your beautiful example and brilliant thinking-with. All my love. üîÜ‚Äù 
-T, a dear friend & confidant 


  

Bringing ‚Äúnow do a fun one‚Äù to weddings everywhere. 


Online dating profiles can be limited and imprecise, so I jotted down a bunch of personal information that should make this process easier. I‚Äôve also enabled commenting access on this doc in case you‚Äôd like to discuss any areas directly. 


If you find this sort of writeup weird or off-putting, that‚Äôs okay ‚Äì I wish you luck in your search! But if you appreciate that it saves us time and avoids potential future confusion/sadness, read on! 


(The topics written below are unlikely to change, but I am open to huge flexibility within their lines and to clarification when unclear or indeterminate. If any specific questions come to mind, please ask them :) 


‚ÄúOne summer, Julian skillfully navigated his way to a caribou roast at a cabin mere miles from the arctic circle. I was his plus one and will be telling this story until the end of time. Not for our journey in a rental car to this small Alaskan bush town with no cell service, not for the epic love story of the lovely couple who hosted us, but in awe of how my friend Julian‚Äôs generosity, authenticity, and curiosity in others lead to the moment where we stopped in the road, locked eyes with a caribou, and realized how magnificent the world is.‚Äù 
-Emily, a dear friend. [Editor‚Äôs note: I believe it was actually a moose.]  


  

Why do I call him ‚ÄúTiny‚Äù? Because he‚Äôs my newt! 
At a glance: 
* 31 years old
* 6‚Äô0‚Äù
* Born & raised near San Francisco, CA
* Culturally Jewish but not religious
* Reasonably fit & athletic
* B.A. in Philosophy from Yale 
* Autistic & nonbinary (and does relationships sapphically) 


Core values:
* Curiosity, creativity, and open-mindedness (which include adventure, exploration, and experience)
* Humor & fun
* Honesty 
* Kindness and helpfulness (not to be confused with niceness)




‚ÄúJulian is a very cool and unique person and I can confirm they are not like Amber Heard or anything traumatic/yikesy/holy-shit-what-was-that-esque and are safe to date. No weird surprises or court cases with this one! 10/10, (would not date again though of course because we were wrong for each other, but figuring that out was easy breezy lemon treesy, plus I have since met the person I‚Äôm going to marry and do recommend that experience and think everyone should try it, 5 stars, and I enthusiastically hope Julian finds their life partner too, as they are a mega dope human and they deserve a happy ending, goddamnit!)‚Äù
-Jane, a former partner who is lovely and kind and who clearly wrote this while following the Amber Heard / Johnny Depp trial 


‚ÄúJulian makes life more fun. He is also impressively good at most things. The sex is also enjoyable. He also has a lot of feelings and they are very big. Just thought you might want to know that too.‚Äù
- Nikki, who has asked to be referred to as ‚Äúthe love of my life and one who got away‚Ä¶ wait, I‚Äôm still here!‚Äù


  

Current Funcle seeking promotion to Fun Parent. 


What I‚Äôm Looking For (in no particular order)
1. A primary life partner. I would like to commit to putting a single relationship above all others. I would like my partner to be fundamentally interested in doing the same with me.
2. Openness to exploration and creativity. This interest is both cultural (eg I spent the first 4 months of 2023 traveling through Australia and Asia, and 3 months recently in Europe) and social (I love meeting new people). I thrive more than most people when I feel free; I suffer more than most people when I feel trapped. To that end, I‚Äôm interested in forming a relationship that is fundamentally tailored to our individual needs (rather than one that fits some standard archetype). 
3. If I have kids, I would like to spend much of my time focused on them. I have thusfar built a life that would enable me to follow this passion, and I would like a partnership that enables me to do the same. 
   1. I. Love. Kids. I like acting like a kid, I like playing with kids, I like being around kids. I like the feeling of holding a child; it‚Äôs more absorbing than any other feeling in the world. (Note: While I‚Äôm not in a rush (as finding the right partner is more important than speed), I would enjoy having kids soon :) 
4. I enjoy caring and giving. I love the feeling of really, truly, deeply caring about someone ‚Äì I‚Äôve experienced it once romantically before and I would like to again, both with my partner and with my children. I would also like my partner to have a similar/parallel emotional experience about me. 
5. I want a partner who I experience as kind and generous and accepting. I have many uncommon traits that I would like to be appreciated/valued/loved. These traits include: 
   1. Autism ‚Äì medically diagnosed; had a big impact on my childhood; these days many people I meet wouldn‚Äôt even guess but it‚Äôs still meaningful
   2. Transness (which includes taking estrogen (more on this below). 
   3. Being a wandering soul ‚Äì I‚Äôve lived in a van for 5 years, changing city a few times per year. 
      1. Re this traveling topic, I would like to find a partner who either A) also enjoys living in new places, or B) joins on some adventures while otherwise living in a place that I find sufficiently satisfying that they can serve as a ‚Äúhome base‚Äù as I explore. (I love NYC. I lived in Manhattan for 6 months of 2022 and 6 months of 2023. I would enjoy being a ‚Äúsuper snowbird‚Äù.) 


‚ÄúI was still relatively new to stand up [comedy], and took encouragement to my heart. Julian offered to come and then take me out to steak dinner after a show, and Julian, a man of his words, followed through. After the show we walked around the corner to where his van was parked, where he then proceeded to cook me a steak himself on a campfire burner, handed me a plastic fork and paper plate, and said that he‚Äôd give me a knife but his dog Smidgen had licked all of them. It was one of the best steaks I‚Äôve ever had.‚Äù 
* Matan, a kid from the youth group I used to mentor. [Editor‚Äôs note: I believe some of Matan‚Äôs details to be apocryphal but left the story unedited to let the love shine through.]


  

Traits I have that I find attractive (attempting to be accurate and clear rather than show humility)
* Intelligence and a unique perspective
   * Most people who talk with me find me one of the most interesting conversationalists they know.
   * I have been told that I am very much myself. If you like my perspective on the world, you're likely to love it because it's so amplified. 


* Humor
   * I enjoy jokes, teasing, and funny art. My favorite painting is a portrait of a pig. I couldn‚Äôt stop laughing. The piece recently moved to Pennsylvania and I‚Äôd love to see it again.
   * If I tease you or riff with you, it‚Äôs intended affectionately. People have different styles (and New Yorkers are often very literal). If you have a different style, no worries ‚Äì I enjoy open communication here. 


* Intensity, competitiveness and drive
   * I‚Äôm a competitive person. I‚Äôm generally very skilled at card games, board games, and sports. I‚Äôve also applied this strategic skill to succeed in many areas of my professional and social life.
   * I find properly-placed aggression and intensity to be incredibly sexy. I‚Äôve received the feedback that I‚Äôm particularly skilled in bed; this is not mere happenstance.


* Direct communication & a high degree of honesty
   * I rarely lie ‚Äì certainly much less than nearly everyone. I‚Äôm also much more precise with my words than nearly everyone.
   * In a comfortable container, I can be both logically precise and profoundly emotionally vulnerable. If this tickles your fancy, we‚Äôre going to have a good time.


* A high amount of self-knowledge and the ability to self-malleate when needed.
   * I‚Äôve intentionally changed some significant parts of myself. I can do this with a speed that often surprises others. I only do this when it aligns with my values (eg when I find a trait of mine is preventing me from achieving something that I care about more). I like that this ability allows me to grow quickly. 


‚ÄúWhen I first met Julian, I had never heckled a single person in my life, especially not with a megaphone. There I was, a virgin burner swept away in the dust and heat, when he scooped me into his presence. Within minutes, with Julians help, I was screaming ‚Äòhey you with the weird hat, come get some quesadillas!‚Äô‚Äù 
-Geoff, a friend who I met at Burning Man 


  
  

My friends sometimes draw me :) 
Questions you may have
1. Are you interested in marriage?
   1. Short answer: yes. Longer answer: I am interested in a primary, committed, preferred-above-all-others life partnership for which the formal contract of marriage fits well. I‚Äôm in no rush, however, and am only interested in getting married once. 


2. How many kids? 
   1. I would enjoy having a large family (4+ kids). I am also open to having the standard american size (2-3). 
   2. I have previously frozen my sperm and would enjoy having biological children. I am not wedded to this preference but it is a relatively strong one. 


3. You‚Äôre taking estrogen? Why? Are you planning on ‚Äútransitioning‚Äù?  
   1. I began exploring my gender in September 2021 and it dramatically increased my life satisfaction so I started taking estrogen in May 2022. Since then, I have stopped and restarted estrogen on 3 occasions to see whether it is a preferable way of existing for me. It is. By a lot. 
   2. I don‚Äôt know where this exploration will end up. My current expectation is that it will take me to the femme side of nonbinary. There‚Äôs also a chance I will go all the way to transfemale. 
      1. I‚Äôm learning as I go, realizing an increasingly clear vision of my ideal self, and I‚Äôd like to have a partner who enjoys and values this sort of self-exploration. 
   3. I have previously dated people who preferred the masculine elements of me and disliked the feminine. This is not a recipe for a thriving relationship. As Daniel Sloss puts it, I‚Äôm looking for someone who loves all of me. (If you‚Äôre a straight woman looking for a man, look elsewhere!)


4. What gender(s) do you date?
   1. In general, I find myself attracted to androgynous- or feminine-presenting people. The most accurate one-word description of my sexuality is ‚Äúlesbian‚Äù. 
   2. Queer women are a great fit! 10/10, no notes :) 
   3. Nonbinary people are also great! (I have less experience dating nonbinary folks than queer women but it‚Äôs possible that‚Äôs more due to historical pool size around me than actual personal preference.)
   4. Regarding other genders: 
      1. Despite gay men frequently finding me attractive (presumably because they see me as queer and a man), this has not historically been a good combination (presumably because they‚Äôre wrong about the latter). 
      2. I‚Äôve never dated a straight man. I doubt it would work, but maybe? 
      3. Straight women have not historically fit well with me, presumably for gender-based reasons. Also, I have found they tend to exhibit these straight-rom-com-esque traits, all of which I dislike: 
         1. An implicit preference for emotional uncertainty instead of direct communication
         2. Expectations of/desire for chasing and being chased, persuasion and being persuaded, and manipulation to fit a mold instead of respect for individual flourishing. 
         3. A lack of creativity/queering/outside-the-box thinking. (As a friend put it, ‚Äústrict heterosexuality is a failure in imagination‚Äù.)
         4. Passivity rather than self-reflecting on their preferences and realizing those desires. (As one straight female friend recently realized at age 36: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve spent my whole dating life standing on a street corner waiting for suitors to appear‚Äù.) 
   5. Many of my habits and preferences (eg around conflict resolution) simply align better with queer culture. This may simply be due to the fact that queer culture is more experimental and closer to the forefront of relationship dynamics, or it may indicate a fundamental queerness in myself.


5. Are you monogamous or non-monogamous? 
   1. I have dated in monogamous relationships and I have dated in open relationships. I have a slight preference toward open (partially because I don‚Äôt like the feeling of trapped-ness), but it is not core to my being. 
      1. The most successful relationships I have embodied previously are ones  similar to the structure practiced by most of my gay male friends: one stable primary partnership with large leeway (nearly complete permission?) for external relationships, with the common knowledge understanding that those external relationships will have no detrimental impact on the partnership. 


6. You live in a van?! Are you‚Ä¶ well‚Ä¶ poor?  
   1. No. 


7. This doc is intense! Are you always this intense? 
   1. Many of my friends would describe me as lighthearted and fun. (One friend says I‚Äôm the funniest person he knows üòá.) That said, when the situation calls for it, I can be very, very intense. Since this doc is a braindump of important topics, it‚Äôs designed to be clear rather than beat around the bush, so I guess it‚Äôs intense ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. 
   2. If you‚Äôre curious what I‚Äôm like in real life, let‚Äôs grab coffee or a videochat to see if we enjoy talking. In dating as in most areas, if we agree on the general vision of where we‚Äôre going (which is what this doc aims to do), I‚Äôm not super fussed about the details/timeline and am happy to move at whatever day-to-day pace feels comfortable. 


8. Why did you write this doc?
   1. I want to ensure I know what I want.
   2. I want to ensure you know what I want. 
   3. I want to save time and avoid unnecessary emotional turmoil for both me and others.
   4. I bet it‚Äôs a damn good filter.


9. Anything else I should know? 
   1. That's probably enough for now. If you want to read all of the friend testimonials, you can find them here üòÇ


‚ÄúJulian invited me to my first burn event. One night, a casual game of foosball evolved into Julian schooling opponents in game while educating them in philosophy, like watching a TED talk if the speaker was presenting from a stolen Miata during a high-speed pursuit by both local and federal authorities. The moment drew a crowd instantly. Julian just shits art wherever he goes. I've never met someone more serious about fun.‚Äù 
-AJ, a dear friend 


  

Me & my seester, the day she graduated from business school üòª




‚ÄúYou should have a little reward at the end for anyone who finishes reading this. Like a ‚Äòhey, congratulations, have a cookie‚Äô but a metaphorical cookie.‚Äù 
-my friend Micha≈Ç


Hey, congratulations, have a cookie: üç™

Name: Tyrone-Jay Barugh
ProfileText:
ÔªøKNOW SOMEONE WITH WHOM I‚ÄôD BE A GREAT MATCH?
  



Contact details:
* tyronebarugh+dating@gmail.com
* Twitter DM to @barughtyrone


What I am looking for:
I am looking for a relationship with a woman between 25ish and 35ish who:
* is high-energy, agentic, altruistic, humorous, passionate, and smart;
* wants two (or more) children, the first in the next 2-3 years;
This doesn‚Äôt mean I would expect my partner to be the primary caregiver. I‚Äôd happily take on - or share - that role, especially if my partner‚Äôs career was a big focus at that time.
* has a secure or anxious attachment style;
I think the attachment style concept is probably only directionally correct, and wouldn‚Äôt superficially rule someone out on the basis of some avoidant traits. Equally, I think that something approximating the ‚Äúanxious-avoidant trap‚Äù is a pretty likely failure mode for my romantic relationships and I‚Äôm fairly keen to avoid that.
   * wants a monogamous relationship; and
   * ideally wants to live most of the time in New Zealand or Australia (although I am flexible on location, and regular visits to New Zealand could also work!)


Here is a bit more about me:
   * I‚Äôm a 29 year old cisgender man. For our present purposes, I‚Äôm basically straight (I think I‚Äôm mostly heteroromantic but bisexual).
   * I‚Äôm from Wellington, New Zealand, and am about to return (mid January) after spending half of 2022 living nomadically.
   * I am a lawyer, but might not practice law indefinitely. I‚Äôm motivated by the principles of ‚Äòeffective altruism‚Äô (a social movement that encourages using reason, evidence, and an ‚Äòexpected value‚Äô mindset to do the most social good we can).
   * Until recently, this mainly caused me to secularly tithe 10% of my income to effective charities (I‚Äôve taken the ‚ÄòGiving What We Can‚Äô pledge), although more recently I‚Äôve also joined the increasing number of effective altruists making changes to their career plans to increase their impact. Right now, I‚Äôm trying to ensure that effective altruism organisations spot and manage legal risks that could limit their impact.
   * As a partner, I‚Äôm very dedicated and put lots of effort into the relationship. A flipside of this is that I can be quite emotionally needy - while I take responsibility for my emotional wellbeing, I expect to rely on my partner a lot for reassurance and to feel safe. I think I‚Äôd be a good fit for someone who wants a really close, serious partner - and a bad fit for someone who wants an element of casualness long-term.
   * Running hurts my knees, but I love cycling. I‚Äôm really into skiing, and never grew out of going ten pin bowling. Day hikes are great, although I really like going on a multi-day hike with someone close and having a chance to have long form, meandering conversations over a few days. I‚Äôve recently bought a VR headset, and playing fitness games like ‚ÄòBeat Saber‚Äô increased how active I am on rainy days a lot.
   * A major hobby of mine is ‚Äòlaw as performance art:
   *  I garnered the support of multiple legal academics in my bid to become the sole legal seller of cow‚Äôs milk in Wellington, New Zealand in reliance on a long forgotten law from 1919.
https://www.rnz.co.nz/national/programmes/thepanel/audio/2018836032/the-pre-panel-with-scott-campbell-and-sarah-sparks 
   * My ‚Äúcredentials and‚Ä¶ enthusiasm to practise in the field of Pitcairn Law‚Äù were described as ‚Äúimpressive‚Äù by the Chief Justice of Pitcairn Island, who proceeded to decline my bid to be enrolled as a Pitcairn Island lawyer.
   * I successfully fought to be naked in my passport photo.
   * I like informative podcasts and videos. I like to know a little bit about everything, and would really value a partner who shares a curiosity about nearly everything. An exception to this is stuff that requires strong spatial awareness - e.g. learning how machinery works. I really struggle with this, and don‚Äôt find it very interesting.
   * I am trying to think more quantitatively and more clearly - I am interested in the ‚Äòrationality‚Äô project popularised in places like Lesswrong, but think ‚Äúaspiring rationalist‚Äù would be a fairer label than ‚Äúrationalist‚Äù.. 
   * I‚Äôm perpetually confused by my personality, but the formulation a psychologist gave is that most things can be explained by the value I put on my close relationships - and also, I suspect, the universality with which I project that onto other people. I have a deep well of feelings in this regard. I bawled at age 11 watching the romantic comedy ‚Äú50 First Dates‚Äù, and I‚Äôve been unable to bring myself to watch the movie ‚ÄúLion‚Äù (about an Indian boy adopted into an Australian family who goes to find his birth family and culture) because the trailer made me too sad. 
   * People usually think I‚Äôm jovial, or even flippant - I was described by another lawyer once as ‚Äúvexatious‚Äù, but that was more a function of his need to touch grass than my personality. In contrast to that external presentation, I quickly dial that down when someone needs support, or when there is serious work to be done.
   * Big 5 personality test results:
   * 96 on extraversion
   * 96 on openness to experience
   * 87 on agreeableness
   * 85 on neuroticism (trying strategies to reduce this)
   * 64 on conscientiousness (ADHD diagnosis, although I think fairly well managed)
   * I am concerned about animal welfare and factory farming. May go vegetarian or vegan in the future, but currently instead choose to offset my moral harms by donating to highly effective farmed animal welfare charities.
   * I have well controlled eczema. The way I keep this controlled, however, is semi unpleasant. I cover my entire body in emulsifying ointment before bed, which means I can be a bit sticky right afterwards. I wear long pyjamas, but nice linen will still get ruined pretty quick. My partner will inevitably be exposed to second-hand moisturiser. I do expect this to improve in the future; my dermatologist says that biologic drugs are available now and improve things heaps, but I don‚Äôt meet the current funding criteria for them in New Zealand. Once this becomes widely available, I‚Äôll be less sticky - and, crucially, I‚Äôll be able to surf and swim as much as I like!
   * I was previously obese (around 125-130kg), and am now overweight (98kg). My weight has been trending down fairly consistently, and I expect that it will plateau around 90kg.
   * I‚Äôve got pretty powerful legs, probably from carrying around a big load for a while. (I love hiking now, because it‚Äôs like I‚Äôve lost more than an entire hiking pack‚Äôs worth of effort.) I have heterochromia in one eye, which I reckon looks pretty cool. And an extra vertebra!




Photos:


  

	I use this photo for Linkedin, for work Slack channels, and as social proof that I can be serious in professional contexts if I really have to.
	  

	This is one version of the good life - blue skies, a freshly stained deck, and a flourishing veggie garden in my suburban NZ backyard. I‚Äôm not necessarily wedded to this version of the good life, and would love to know how my weekends might be different with you.
	  

	I don‚Äôt take many photos, so haven‚Äôt got a snap of my favourite suit. But a colleague did, and included it in my farewell card from my old job.
	  

	I like diving, skiing, cycling, and hiking.
	  

	Fair warning - my hair might end up like this again some day!
	  
  

	I love any opportunity to poke fun at the silly implications of things I sincerely believe. This year‚Äôs halloween costume was ‚Äòrats on heroin‚Äô, one implication of my belief that we should reduce suffering.

Name: Nathan Young
ProfileText:
ÔªøDating me
I guess I‚Äôll do it myself
* I am agentic. I make my life how I want it to be
* I am social. I have 50-100 friends, more than almost anyone I know. I like people, parties and conversation
* I am earnest, trying to make the world better
* I am well-described by ADHD, I am distracted, but I‚Äôm trying to improve
Stats
Age: 30. Yeah my hair greyed early.
Height: 6‚Äô4‚Äù (1.94m).
Location: London, very happy to travel in the UK, long-distance is okay
Job: I run a web development team of 3.
Poly?: Yes, but my main focus is having a primary partner and I‚Äôd try being monogamous for the right person[1]
Sexuality: Straightish
Wants kids?: Yes
Wants to be stay-at-home-parent?: A genuine possibility 
What I‚Äôm looking for: Primarily a long term partner to have kids with (although open to short term things)
Where to find me online: Twitter - for my sins
Photos
            


Distinctive things
Grey hair
Yes. It‚Äôs grey. It has been since I was 13. I like to see this as a feature - you can experience the social opprobrium of dating an older man, without me being tied down by things like a house or a sports car.
Charisma
I don‚Äôt know how one writes about this in a way that doesn‚Äôt come across as obnoxious. People say I‚Äôm charismatic.


I‚Äôve hosted like 20 dinners.
I did a rap on a train once.
I started a project that got on wikipedia
Blunt
I‚Äôm working on this, but I am blunt and spiky at times. Accuracy is very important to me and I‚Äôm frank about money, sex, ambition, feelings. Some people really dislike this.
Loquacious
I love to have conversations. I text. A lot. I will definitely call you back first. I may be cycling at the time[2].  Hopefully you‚Äôll find this touching rather than annoying. But if you don‚Äôt like being bothered.. 


I dated someone once who could spend the whole evening in silence. Reader, I did not marry her.


Things I like to talk about:
* Nothing. I like shit chat. I like blanket statements, pillow talk and complicated wordplay. I like to take dad jokes and push them father. My aim is not to be very funny on average, but to be very funny on aggregate.    
* Feelings. I like to process how I have felt. About conversations and plans. I want to hear how you feel and what you want. I want to know you and be known by you. My sense is that fact is more interesting than fiction and that humans are more interesting when they are less mysterious. I know few people I don‚Äôt like and with almost everyone I can find something fascinating.
* Everything. I like talking about policy, effective altruism, forecasting. How to run the country, how to run the dishwasher, how to run away from this strange man who won‚Äôt stop talking. It‚Äôs all good stuff
* You. If we were to date I would want to make you more like you want to be. I‚Äôm pretty intense but if that‚Äôs your thing then I want to be on your time. I want to help you in your job, your art, your mental health, your relationships with friends and if you want, lovers. 


I struggle to stay focused on one thing. If you want that. I‚Äôm not for you.
Friends and relationships 
I used to be an evangelical Christian and in the last few years have got really into effective altruism and forecasting. It‚Äôs quite a switcheroo and I have a wide range of friends with a variety of worldviews as a result. I love community - I think and talk about rationalism, EA, neoliberalism, whatever tv show I‚Äôm watching.


In general, I have lots of friends and move in a wide circle of people - I‚Äôm often going to parties or visiting Durham for a week etc. etc. I‚Äôd love for you to come with me but if that‚Äôs not what you want then if it‚Äôs a good match in other ways, I imagine we can figure something out


My default would be monogamish/an open relationship but I‚Äôm open to discussing. I want to have a life partner but be able to connect with others occasionally. Integrity is really important to me and I have had trouble in the past with guilt around being flirtatious. I don‚Äôt want that. I‚Äôll be honest and I‚Äôm willing to be flexible, but I also want to be kind to myself. 
Who might be a good fit
Some words that jump to mind
* Curious
* Playful
* Honest
* Intelligent
* Kind
* Patient
For balance
I am very biased[3]. Some of my exes had a great time dating me, a couple did not. If you know any of my female friends, feel free to ask them for the details. I don‚Äôt want to paint an overly rosy account.
What next?
If any of this sounds good, reach out!


Or share with a friend. I think I make clear the kind of person who would be a good fit and those who wouldn‚Äôt.


DM me on twitter or email me at nathanpmyoung@gmail.com 


If something I could change turned you off, I‚Äôd appreciate anonymous feedback at https://www.admonymous.co/nathanpmyoung 


If you want a song that feels like dating me: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yc3Jo65Lct4 


________________
[1] I am also, not like all the other girls. I have a NSFW blog, which you can ask for by messaging me including the word gubernatorial or like, figuring out how to find it 
[2] This is probably the most stupid thing I do
[3] Based?

Name: Kevin Wheeler
ProfileText:
ÔªøKevin Wheeler‚Äôs Dating Doc
  









































  





































  





























































  



  



I need to edit this doc to add weaknesses of mine. Will do at some point.


I find grace and being kind to those who are hard to be kind to beautiful, although sometimes I do get down and honestly just dislike people and think some people will never change, and all that stuff and blah blah blah. Nuance/disclaimers aside, I'm looking for someone who is primarily just a person of love in this crazy world. I am not a fan of a tendency towards outrage, mockery, and being offended all the time. I‚Äôm generally more interested in exploring the gray areas + pros and cons of all sides than I am in aggressively choosing a side. I am not very prone to anger and can talk about almost anything without taking it personally. I think I‚Äôm fairly good at taking criticism, especially if it‚Äôs done with care/love, but have room to improve too. Hopefully if I can find someone like me, communication will be lightweight and relatively easy and free, and we will be able to talk about just about anything.


I am interested in all sorts of things, including the big existential question "what _are_ we?", the brain, consciousness, etc. I am agnostic and fascinated by it all. The absurdity of this existence gets me. The fact that we just find ourselves alive one day in this insane world / story we are living in with no memory of how we got here or what's going on in a giant universe with no sure signs of anyone else being around is a freaking trip. I can see things from a scientific and rational perspective, and I am also a very loving person with a sense of wonder about the nature of reality, etc. The exponential growth of technology and this perhaps incredibly pivotal sliver of time we are born in is also crazy and fascinating.


I am interested in spirituality / if there is any sort of bigger, cosmic force out there / some sort of bigger reason why things will turn out okay, but I don‚Äôt spend much time on it. It‚Äôs hard to know exactly how that would fit together with all sorts of animals living short lives of seemingly excruciating suffering, and just all of the pain in the world in general, etc, but I enjoy having the hope and wonder anyways.


Despite this semi intense bio, I am a bit of a goof and am very easygoing. 


I am always willing to change my point of view and admit when I realize I am wrong.


I enjoy all sorts of things. Apart from just connecting with others whether it be from deep conversations or watching something heartfelt together, I think a couple of things I should mention specifically are physical activity and physical touch + sexuality. Someday, I would like to learn how to hang glide if I live somewhere where this is possible. Snowboarding, longboarding downhill, and all sorts of of other fast paced athletic things sounds awesome as well üôÇ Maybe I can do that thing where you snowboard with a deployed parachute someday üòÅ

I would like a partner where we can strive to be our best selves together, help the most people / do the most good, capture the most life and experiences, and hopefully and motivate each other on a sacred journey to be as impactful as we can be. I generally like to spend most of my time being productive, and love having a mission. I hope we are on the same page here and it won't bother you too much if I‚Äôm on my laptop a lot multitasking on a project or something while we watch TV, or you are reading, or whatever.


I find the end of this video starting at 43:30 to be very powerful, and I hope it resonates with you in some way or another: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4kBoLVvoqVY&t=43m30s


I like humor about things being awful or something I can't quite pinpoint, lol. I'm certainly okay with dark humor as long as it's not malicious. Here's one: https://www.reddit.com/r/funny/s/9BvFjVRTqQ


Stoof:
- Born May 15th, 1990).


- 5‚Äù8, 165 Lbs, but this is subject to change:
- I have run or biked basically every day for the last 7 years. Have been weightlifting for 6 months as of April 2024 and am in it for the long haul.


- I plan on moving away from the city I‚Äôm living in someday, which is Lubbock, Texas. I‚Äôm open to meeting people who live far away from me right now and someday moving to be closer to each other. My son‚Äôs mom will have to be a part of any decision as to where me and my son will move, however, but she is on board with getting out of our current city. Asheville, North Carolina is a town we both think could be cool.


- I ideally would not like to have more kids, but could perhaps someday.


- I have a preference for a monogamish relationship / open relationship that tends to be mostly monogamous in practice where we are still "each other's person" (not ownership. Deep love)


- I would still be very happy with monogamy if we had a very strong focus on purpose in life and helping others.


- I‚Äôm not sure I would want full on poly / a group relationship. Dating separately could probably be okay, but it might be nice to live in some sort of non poly community if so, so that I didn‚Äôt have to just be alone at the house when my partner(s?) wasn‚Äôt around. I‚Äôm not sure how much this is actually appealing to me though. Then again, I don‚Äôt want to place hard rules on each other and want to allow each other to be free as much as possible, so I would be okay with not having things be like mandated by rule that other relationships need to be limited to some small scope.


I had been doing property management. Was going to try getting into software development and using my CS degree, but found it hard to find a job in this market, and honestly, I have some mild ADHD and would struggle with a job like that unless I was able to take a nap during mid day and have a couple of hours where my brain feels exhausted and I don't get much cognitive work done. If I‚Äôm able to nap though, I‚Äôm normally great for the rest of the day. I used to be Christian and have a lot different views. I actually thought not worrying about money was a virtue, lol. I wish I worried about it more. Nevertheless, I‚Äôm well on my way towards financial freedom with my investments. This is lame, but some day I have an inheritance coming. Probably another reason I was never worried about money apart from just wanting to strive to help others and do something with myself. Right now though, I‚Äôm just getting my commercial driver's license and am going to be doing local delivery truck driving. Not very glamorous, but I love driving and this will give me energy for the rest of life. If software developers are in demand when my son is slightly older and takes less time, I‚Äôll get a remote software developer job where I can take a nap and work a schedule that works for me. I am working on a stock trading thing as a software side project.

If you are a very type A person, we probably wouldn't be a great fit. I'm pretty laid back.


My son's mom doesn't want to be together because I‚Äôm not Christian. She wants me to ‚Äúfind Jesus so we can get married‚Äù. She thinks highly of me and we coparent and work together great for our son. I have hesitations about being together with her that I won't get into here. This always sucks and obviously isn't great vibes to talk about. I‚Äôd be happy to talk about it not over text though.


Honestly I‚Äôve had some moments in life that have really brought my shortcomings to the surface. Situations I wish I would have handled better. I‚Äôm certainly a normal person with my own struggles, downsides, etc. When circumstances are bleak, I am subject to depression. Having had an honestly difficult young child had been a huge test of patience at times, and there have been extremely challenging moments, and then there are absolutely beautiful moments at other times. At least it has helped me to further develop my patience. My son is getting older now, and really sweet moments are on the rise, and challenging moments are on the decline.


I have only one child ‚Äì A  son who turned 4 years old on September 17th, 2023. I assume this will be seen as a downside by most potential partners.


I am extremely understanding of shortcoming due to weakness, sadness, etc. Less so of aggression, or just poor overall character. I like to differentiate between being a good/bad person and being a functional/high performing person. 


Fairly low on neuroticism - probably the most scientifically established, objective thing that leads towards good relationships.


Fairly high on agreeableness, which has some downsides and I have to make sure I don‚Äôt let people take advantage of me, because it‚Äôs really hard for me to just say ‚Äúnot my problem‚Äù when people are in a bad situation, but this trait is supposed to make for good relationships.


Contact & misc:


You can message me on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/kevin.wheeler or email me at kevinwheeler90@gmail.com


You can find my OkCupid profile here: https://www.okcupid.com/profile/16703780554927230141
If you have any feedback for me, perhaps about how this document could be better, please feel free to send it.

ProfileText:

Testimonial by my dear friend Gavriel
‚Äã
What I most admire about Quinn is how much he cares and how much he‚Äôs willing to put action into his caring. He genuinely wants to be there for other people. I‚Äôve seen him show so much openness to emotional connection in times when even other resilient and emotionally mature people would have been inclined to take a step back from their existing relationships. I‚Äôve never seen stonewalling or apathy from him. Quinn always cares, and is excited to show that he cares. If you have the same love languages as Quinn, he‚Äôll be able to make you feel super special. Being there for other people and caring doesn‚Äôt just mean caring about his friends or partners‚Äîhe also shows up for communities. At a party, he‚Äôs either the host or the guy you assume is the host because he introduces a new burst of energy to each room he‚Äôs in.
Quinn also has a super strong sense of self; he won‚Äôt passively fall into trends. I‚Äôve never heard him be insincere or mocking. When so much media and so many conversations contain at least a little bit, and sometimes a lot, of mockery, Quinn has a refreshingly firm focus on topics where he can be completely sincere. Basically, it feels like the idiom ‚Äúbig-hearted‚Äù was invented to describe Quinn.
Traits to make me swoon
‚Äã
Sincerity
Analyticalness
Conviction
Compassion
Ambition
Introspectiveness
Irony is poison. I admire anyone who's above average in earnestness.
Type of guy

OkCupid used to be pretty great, right? Back in 2012 or so? Instead of swiping you could
search

meant something

send people messages
(ok maybe that part wasn‚Äôt so great for everybody).
Then
something(s) happened
and online dating stopped working.
One of those ‚Äúsomethings‚Äù was that we got older. Older and somewhat jaded, in my case. And if not exactly less attractive, then at least more of an acquired taste.
Also there was the rise of the Tinder Clones (of which OKC is now one of the worst). Also Instagram filters and Snapchat lenses. Also, you know, a pandemic.
And so here we are a decade later writing bespoke ‚ÄúDate Me‚Äù docs, God help us. Somebody please,
please
fix this.
@okcupid
could do the dating world an enormous favor by simply bringing back their original interface circa 2012 (and leaving it be).

Name: Agnieszka
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate or befriend me?
As described in The Guardian and The New York Times
Feel free (encouraged even!) to share!


About me
36-year-old female living in London (but might move to the Cotswolds next year). A mix of creativity, spirituality, and grounded practicality, I‚Äôm seeking someone who values meaningful connections and shares my values of ethical living and personal growth
* A mix of introverted and extraverted tendencies, I enjoy a balance of socialising and quiet time. I prefer small gatherings or one-on-one conversations over large group discussions
* Vegetarian, I eat 95% vegan, with the occasional vegetarian meal/snack when abroad/visiting
* Somewhat frugal, partly wanting to save money (and perhaps retire early), partly because I value simplicity
* I care about my impact on the world and moral implications of my actions
* My main love language is physical touch and I‚Äôm curious about exploring Tantra more


Things I do/like
* Go to self-developmental/spiritual workshops/events and embodiment practices like Moving Connections/Contact Improvisation or occasionally ecstatic dance. 
* Organise and facilitate meditation groups and retreats
* Learn about psychology and understanding human nature
* Hike in nature; I also walk a lot around the city, everything within an hour I‚Äôd call easily walkable üôÇ
* I like animals and enjoy pet sitting which I do as a side hustle (my main job is data analyst)
* I used to travel quite a bit pre-pandemic, however these days I value more building community where I live
* Draw, craft and/or paint portraits of my friend‚Äôs pets üôÇ
* Read books, both fiction and non-fiction


Things I don‚Äôt often do
* I‚Äôm not much of a foodie - I batch cook and don‚Äôt mind eating the same thing for number of days; I usually prefer to spend my time, money and energy on other things
* Sporty things - I enjoy gentle activities like hiking, cycling, and swimming, but I‚Äôm more focused on the experience rather than athletic achievement
* I rarely drink alcohol and don‚Äôt watch streaming services much


Life ideas:
* I would like to have 1-3 kids, ideally starting within the next 2.5 years
* I‚Äôd prefer to move out of London to a more nature-connected or communal environment to raise a family


What I‚Äôm looking for
* Someone emotionally available and responsible, who values transparency, open communication, and believes that love is both a feeling and a choice
* Spiritual yet grounded and rational
* Playful/compatible sense of humour
* I appreciate partner who is mindful of my ethical choices and would be open not to eat meat and fishes in front of me; I feel the need to disengage emotionally in these situations and I wouldn't want to be disengaged emotionally around my partner
* Open to having child(ren) within the next 2.5 years


A few caveats
* It might take me some time to get used to someone and build trust. It is important to me that a relationship starts from the place of friendship and respect
* I‚Äôm primarily seeking a long-term connection, but if we get along really well I might be open to short-term too
* Similarly, while I‚Äôm primarily looking for monogamy, I‚Äôm open to exploring ethical non-monogamy with the right person - someone experienced and responsible in navigating such dynamics
* I‚Äôd rather meet in person to see how we get on than keep texting - but please do share why you think we might be compatible
What next?
If this resonates, I‚Äôd love to hear from you (perhaps by email at jekot.agnieszka@gmail.com)

Name: Meredith
ProfileText:
ÔªøAs of early 2024, I‚Äôm currently in a stable committed relationship and am not looking for a new partner.     


Hi! I‚Äôm Meredith. 


About me:
* I‚Äôm a 34, straight, monogamous woman living in Oakland
* I drink socially; I don‚Äôt smoke; I don‚Äôt do drugs.
* I‚Äôm somewhere between 5ft 6in and 5ft 7in tall.
* Descriptive words: bubbly, passionate, smart, kind, fun, confident, friendly
* I want biological kids. Note that I‚Äôm a carrier for cystic fibrosis, so bonus points if you know you‚Äôre not a carrier. 
* I‚Äôm comfortably liberal, particularly in the classical sense of that word. I often find I‚Äôm arguing the conservative position in the Bay Area, and the liberal position elsewhere. I read Matt Iglesaias, Astral Codex Ten, the NYT (sorry Scott), and The Dispatch. I also listen to approximately one bajillion podcasts. 
* Enneagram 2
* Meyers-Briggs ENFJ 
* According to my unprofessional self-assessment of the Big Five: I‚Äôm high in conscientiousness and agreeableness; and moderate in openness and extraversion. I‚Äôm probably also moderate in neuroticism (I tend to run anxious, but have it well managed at the moment.)
* A deeply committed Christian only looking to date other Christians. (Wish me luck!)


Hobbies: I love reading, and probably read a book a week on a wide range of topics from sci-fi/fantasy to pop science to women‚Äôs literature. I enjoy cooking and good food, and like to make delicious healthy meals on the weekends to have leftovers all week. I try to stay active, and enjoy hikes / the outdoors; morning jogs; and Zumba or Yoga classes. I‚Äôve been teaching myself how to play the guitar (fingerpicking style) for a bit over two years. I still identify as a beginner, but I am having a great time and have made a lot of progress. I bought a condo last year, and practicing hospitality is an important part of my life. I enjoy trying new things and special events; for example, I just signed up for a glass flameworking class at the Crucible, and regularly go to Broadway musicals at the Orpheum with a grad school friend. I got scuba certified earlier this year, and love being underwater; I‚Äôd like to plan my next trip to go diving! 


I try to give back as an expression of gratitude. I tithe and also give on top of that, as I like the ideas of effective altruism (although a lot of effective altruists would probably disagree with my priorities as they‚Äôre biased by my faith). In addition to money, I try to also be generous with my time; I make space for volunteering both in and outside of my church. For me, gratitude is the appropriate response for the privileges I have received in life (spiritually, monetarily, personally); and the manifestation of gratitude is generosity. I believe, and experience, that a life lived generously leads to joy. I seek out joy in my day-to-day decisions and circumstances! 


Professionally: I got my PhD in Chemistry at Berkeley, and now work as a project manager at Genentech. I love my job, as it‚Äôs a great combination of helping people work together better and learning more about how biology works ‚Äì and developing the next generation of medicines to help patients. I‚Äôm currently working on how I can grow in supporting community-owned solutions to challenges (rather than pushing through a solution that works best for me), and that is a satisfying self-improvement endeavor. My career is very important to me, although I‚Äôm typically the kind of person who leaves work at work. I believe in work-life balance.


Theology: I am Protestant, reformed, egalitarian, mostly conservative/orthodox in my views (of note, including around issues of sexuality). My favorite theologian is NT Wright; I also respect Tim Keller and CS Lewis. I enjoy debating theology, and don‚Äôt need to have complete theological alignment with a partner; but I do need mutual respect, and openness to female leadership in the church (because I‚Äôm open to a call to be an elder, etc, in my future; and I don‚Äôt want to get in a place of needing to choose between my spouse and a call from God). Outside of that practical matter, I remind myself that we‚Äôre saved by Christ, and not the correctness of our theology. Various prayer practices and time spent in Scripture are an important part of my faith. I believe that faith should be put into action through both holiness and service. 


You: I‚Äôm looking for a smart, attractive, fun, Christian man who is confident enough to stand up for what he believes; humble enough to change his mind; and comfortable in his own masculinity. The ideal man for me would be self-aware, compassionate, and striving to be more like Christ. I want a partner in life ‚Äì the kind of person who makes me better, and who is better because of his relationship with me; and the kind of person who is a great friend, present for the big and small moments of life. Mutual attraction and physical affection are also important to me. 


Send me a note if you‚Äôd like to connect!




  

  

Top: Diving in the Maldives
Bottom: Me with my sister in a hot air balloon

Name: Graham Bessellieu
ProfileText:
Home

Graham Bessellieu's
Dating Profile
Thanks for stopping by! This site is the result of wanting to take a much more raw, direct and public approach to seeking a life partner. If anything here resonates with you, feel free to
reach out
. :-)
Key
Age: 33
Sex: Male
Location: Currently Ewing, NJ but my work is remote and am open to travel/relocation.
Body: 5ft 10in. 140lbs. Working to improve gym habits.
Monogamy: I'm interested in romantic commitment to one person, as I feel this leads to greater depth/growth/profundity. (This is not a unilateral critique of poly, just a personal preference.)
Children: None, currently. Family is not a requirement, a strong and meaningful relationship is the most important, but I think it would mean a lot to me. I'm open to either adoption or biological kids. I subscribe to the philosophy of t
aking children seriously
and believe in cultivating an environment of love, care, play, learning and creativity. <3
Joy, Creativity & Progress!
I believe it's incredibly important, given our limited time on this earth, to follow what genuinely sparks joy, instead of limiting or self-coercing into a more narrow path of least resistance. To embrace one's passions, interests and what's fun (in the Richard Feynman sense). I find inspiration in David Deutsch's notion of
optimism
: that all goals are either impossible (due to laws of physics) or achievable given the right knowledge. And therefore that every moment is an opportunity for learning and growth, even amidst failure and setback. That creativity is our greatest, most precious asset and the bedrock to an infinite potential for progress.
And so, I'm looking for partner to make progress with! To cultivate a life long relationship to be deeply proud of and moved by.
///
Philosophy/Values
My core interests are philosophy, science & technology, and the arts.
I value philosophy, science and technology generally as I find them one of the best tools for guiding and refining our thinking, promoting the growth of knowledge, and shaping cultural progress.
The arts, however, are closest to my heart. I believe they have an immense potential for promoting joy, connection, reflection, novelty, fun, empathy and expression.
While the others are primarily laymen/outsider interests that I am not an expert in, I do have an art school background (BFA).
I live for finding and cultivating beauty, celebrating the joy and precious idiosyncrasy of others, reducing suffering, improving flourishing and leaving an impact wholly true and distinct to yourself.
To know my work, whether it be humanitarian or artistic: a portrait, a piece of writing, a film, song, or game could live on for others to cherish is a beautiful and precious opportunity.
Work/Projects
I currently work as a freelance video editor and creative professional. I try and align to clients that match my values and ideals.
Outside of freelance, I have a passion project developing an all-ages adventure game fable (as a tribute to
Miyazaki
and what I view as the immense artistic potential the medium holds.) Given the complexity of this project, however, this is something I imagine working on gradually throughout my life.
I also have a YouTube
channel
where I occasionally develop video essays.
My studio practice is important to me. I believe one's life is an art work and of developing a body of work you're proud of. :-)
Relationship Style
I'm seeking a thoughtful, creative relationship where we can bounce ideas off each other, have compelling conversations, share, critique and support each other's work. To collaborate, challenge each other, develop and strengthen shared values and make progress together!
Let's make art, music, write and play games together. :D
I've come to realize I have a much more romantic orientation overall, built on love and shared values. Sexuality, passion and intimacy is nice, but genuine care and connection is far more important.
I'm a big fan of sincerity and transparency and dislike small talk and sarcasm. I believe in commitment to sharing each other's problem situation out of love and respect.
Gender/Aesthetics
I tend to think people are complex and can't be put in stereotypical boxes. There are characteristics of both masculinity and femininity that I respect and find worth cultivating. I tend to dress in a more masculine fashion, though I also want to start building a more vibrant and fun fashion sense.
I am attracted to a more feminine aesthetic, have only dated women to this date and am primarily sexually attracted to women. That said, I am open to dating other sexes. More-so than anything, genuine connection and shared values seem to be a key factor for attraction greater than sexuality. In this sense, you could call me a romantic.
Ethics
I went vegan after watching the documentary "Earthlings" and Peter Singer lectures, and now work on a vegan ethics podcast called "
Sentientist Conversations
" which focus is:
evidence, reason and compassion for all sentience
.
I'm not opposed to dating a non-vegan, as I myself was one and I recognize it is quite a novel movement historically speaking and not a cultural norm, but it is important to me and I do believe it represents moral progress.
Influences
I have a soft spot for the beauty of
Art Nouveau
, the fun of
adventure games
, the rich imagination of
Studio Ghibli
, and the bold unwavering optimism of
Star Trek: The Next Generation
. ;-)

Name: Robert Mushkatblat
ProfileText:
Ôªø@rmushkatblat / Robert Mushkatblat
Email: bobert.mushky@gmail.com
  
  
  



Very Short Summary
Child of Soviet Jewish immigrants, software guy, calm.  70% predictable from archetypes.
A Little Less Short
Occupation: lesswrong.com
Orientation: Straight / Monogamous
Traits poorly predicted by archetypes:
* I show up to things on time, don‚Äôt miss appointments, and file personal taxes well before the deadline.
* I appreciate fine dining and tea (as artforms, not merely as hedonism, though that‚Äôs good too).
* I drink infrequently (maybe 5 times in the last year?).
* I dance (international latin ballroom).
Personality: Most comfortable in groups of 2 - 6, care a lot about those things that I focus on (ethics and aesthetics both); have sometimes been called a snob (affectionately).  Not a huge fan of super loud events, though I like the occasional prog metal concert.  I like to share my joy in food with friends & partners, and figure out what they like well enough to remove the need for them to exert any sort of mental effort on making decisions in that domain if they want.  (Food is not the only thing, just a good example of how I relate to people.)


What I‚Äôm Looking For
Personality:
Despite my archetype (high-decoupling nerd male software engineer), most of my closest friendships rest more on personality fit and mutual openness + support, rather than shared careers, interests, or hobbies (excepting rationalism).  Which is to say I spend some time talking about software or x-risk with friends when off the clock, but not most of it.  I probably would not have predicted those particular friendships ahead of time.


In retrospect, important components have been:
* Ability and willingness to discriminate between factual disagreements and values differences.  See: high-decoupling.
* At the same time, not being strongly focused on contentious but intractable domains, like mainstream politics
* Having an even temper.  Many other personality traits have been highly variable; e.g. I have quite a bit of practice supporting people through bouts of imposter syndrome.
* Actually deeply giving a shit about something.  I‚Äôm not sure if this is causal but it sure has been a common thread.  That something is not always something I personally care about a ton, but it‚Äôs generally intelligible to me.  Examples: the flourishing of the local community one grew up in, exploring the limits of communication styles & bandwidth for another‚Ä¶


Socialization:
I like small things more than big things.  My tolerance for size increases when I know more of the people.  Quieter is better than louder.  Unstructured is better than structured - I‚Äôm not big on board games or movie nights (üò¨) but do like spontaneously-occurring pockets of discussion.  These are derived from how I‚Äôve felt across many different events, activities, and relationships, and exceptions certainly exist.  Of course, the kind of relationship I expect to be healthy anticipates occasions where we meet halfway and and those were we fly solo, depending on context.


I am basically happy to pack my calendar full of socialization, obligations permitting - I‚Äôve yet to run into situations where I was turning down opportunities to socialize because I‚Äôd had enough rather than because I didn‚Äôt have the time, or because I didn‚Äôt expect to enjoy myself doing that particular thing.  However, I wouldn‚Äôt feel particularly bereft if I spent a week at home, if I was doing something useful with that time.


Children:
At least one, and would want to see how the first one goes before deciding on more.  Pessimistic about traditional education, mostly due to personal experience, and would pretty strongly prefer defaulting to homeschooling or thoughtful co-op arrangements.  Ultimately, though, would want to defer to whatever actually worked best for the kid, as the person with the most introspective access relevant to the situation.


Maintenance:
I take care of myself reasonably well and happily outsource other things (e.g. house cleaning).  I do have aesthetic preferences about my living spaces but put a pretty heavy penalty on things that add significant overhead in terms of time and attention.  I find doing tasks in this category much easier with another person than doing them alone, but don‚Äôt want to over-promise.
Interesting things I‚Äôve done (or have happened to me):
* I wrote the first long-form HP/f!TMR[a][b] fanfic (it‚Äôs not actually great, but it is completed)
* Got as far as ‚Äúfinished MVP and launched‚Äù with a startup while working full-time
* Have been stung by jellyfish three (3) times and lived to tell the tale
* No longer keep track of how many times someone has said "this is the best thing I've ever tasted" or similar after taking them somewhere new
* Speak mother tongue near fluently (—Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π)
* Flexible enough to do things too disturbing impressive to be written down


Hobbies (and how to get to know me):
* Ballroom dance (international latin ballroom, could use a partner)
* Choir
* Tea (currently exploring aged whites)
* Run LA rat meetup (I continue to be semi-active in the Discord server)
* Food (my FTC profile, for my writing in a totally different social context)
* Glowfic
* Used to spend time helping people get better jobs (mostly software)[c]
[a]love you for saying this / admitting that you write fanfic <3
[b]<3  it was a big part of my life!
[c]how's this working out now?

Date Me
[Hello! I‚Äôm leaving this page up for posterity and those curious about things like this, but am removing it from my site‚Äôs header as I am now in a relationship with someone.
(And yes, they‚Äôre someone who filled the form out üôÇ )
Good luck to everyone else out there looking for love!]
(I have
testimonials
now!)
January 1st marked the start of my
newest season
, Romance. Overall my life is pretty fantastic, but I‚Äôm still looking for a long-term relationship, preferably on my way to marriage and at least one bio-kid within the next couple years. So I picked this season to really commit to that goal in every way I could think of, which includes things like just, you know, openly saying¬† to everyone who might find me interesting ‚ÄúHey, I‚Äôm single and looking to date‚Äù and seeing what happens.
So if you‚Äôre here, maybe you‚Äôre interested in me based on my writing, or passions for rationality and psychology and fiction. If so, great! Those are things I enjoy talking about, so we‚Äôd probably get along well.
The quickest way to my heart, however, would be if you‚Äôre into some combination of rationality, video games, or writing. I say that because I‚Äôve always been a very ‚Äúactivities oriented‚Äù boyfriend.¬† I enjoy cuddling together with a pair of books or watching a show, but everyone I‚Äôve fallen in love with was through either playing games together, or co-writing/RP, or debating intellectual or philosophical topics.¬† If the idea of spending hours doing those things makes you happy, then there‚Äôs a good chance we‚Äôll be able to make each other happier together than we would be apart.
The other thing that matters a lot to me is personal development. I feel deeply driven to constantly learn, grow, and improve myself in every way I can.¬† That‚Äôs not to say I‚Äôm ‚ÄúType A,‚Äù since there are plenty of days where I just chill and have fun, and girlfriends have said they find me relaxing to be around. But if I notice something isn‚Äôt working for me or those I care about, I want to improve it, and I‚Äôm pretty agentic in doing so.
All of which is to say, I want someone who wants to be that way too, and puts the effort in to learn how, both by improving epistemics and on the instrumental level of active problem solving. Someone who will be happy to help me improve more than I could on my own, and is looking for someone to do the same for them.
If you think that describes you, feel free to
fill out this form
and we‚Äôll see what happens!
If you already know me and are worried about ‚Äúruining the friendship,‚Äù I can promise with very high confidence that won‚Äôt happen. If you‚Äôre worried about looking foolish if you try and fail, I can also promise that I‚Äôll always have nothing but respect for people who show vulnerability to reveal who they really are.
I am doing this, after all ^_o
(Also, I‚Äôm willing to relocate for romance if things work out well. Meanwhile we can get to know each other online, and since I work remotely, I‚Äôm happy to do short or long visits to spend time together if we hit it off!)
If you have found a spelling error, please, notify me by selecting that text and pressing
Ctrl+Enter
. Thank you!
Walk with me a spell.

:
We were featured in the
New York Times
for our dating bounty story. Check out my
AMA
on the topic.
Carrie
won the $1,500 dating bounty for causing me to meet
Carissa
by sharing my dating profile on zir Facebook wall. Ze donated the bounty to the
Foresight Institute
. We've been together since April 5th, 2022.
Check out
our story on YouTube
. And follow Carissa on
Facebook
or
Instagram
for frequent updates on us ‚ò∫Ô∏è.
I'm very grateful for my friends
Alton
and Toli for adding this dating bounty to my initial parenting bounty! Check out
Toli's own dating profile/bounty
! (And let us know if that causes you to date üòÑ)
And let me know if you have a bounty of your own so I can help you, and add it here if you want üôÇ
Other relevant writings
:

Sperm donor profile
Bounty
Bounty: 3,500 USD
I'm offering 2,000 USD
for someone I end up consensually being a legal parent with who you‚Äôve
    introduced me to and who wasn‚Äôt already a prospect. If someone reached out to me as a result of you sharing my
    profile on social media, that counts too. Paid only for my first child.
My good friend
Alton
offered an additional
      1,000
      USD
to support me ‚ù§Ô∏è ‚Äì ze said:
I'll add $1000 to the bounty for the referral of someone who is with you and brings you a lot of joy for 18+

      because I love celebrating love. I'd want to have the option to have a 2 hour call with you both at that time
      window

My friend
