Here's
Toli's own bountified dating profile
(with a much larger bounty ^_^).
A few more notes:
Introductions can be done through
any channel
.
I can stop taking new submissions for this bounty at any time (but, obviously, not retroactively).
The money is to incentivize you to take the time to read my profile and recommend me to friends, and to
      generally reward superconnectors which I think tend to be undervalued. The money is just a bonus on top of the
      gratitude^_^
Video interview about my dating profile
General
While I‚Äôm open to other types of relationships, this profile is written with the goal of finding someone/people to
    raise children with. I'm 32 years old (born in October 1990).
I invite you to be yourself. I encourage you to not avoid doing anything you want to do in relation to me just
    "because it's weird".
Feel free to use
Reciprocity
to see if we
    match, or just reach out to me
    directly.
There‚Äôs some information I like to have about prospects early on that might be easier to do in a survey format, or
    at least just so you know some specific explicit questions I generally have, you can see my
Date me survey
. Feel free to be very explicit and to the point with
    me (or not). You can send me your own questions.
Looks
Here are some more pictures:
https://photos.app.goo.gl/kLW4zMfwi7otDN4T7
.
I measure 188 cm (6'2)
and weigh 87.1 kg (192 lbs).
Relationship structure and attraction
I‚Äôm open to various structures, although I prefer if most of the relationship energy goes towards the family.
I‚Äôm panromantic. I‚Äôm generally much more sexually attracted towards females. Romantic and sexual attraction is a
        plus.
Relationship
I would like a partner with whom I can connect deeply
, know each other very well and develop
        great models of each other, share about what's going on in our lives, and be open about our internal
        experiences. Provide support in each other's goals and aspirations, have each other's back, and deeply trust
        each other, and care about each other. Giving each other's affection.
Be a team working together
. Defaulting to assuming any issues that might arise isn't being done
        maliciously, and being comfortable bringing them up and collaboratively working on them. Being resilient, and
        working hard to address any potential issues. Trying hard to not split / live separately while raising children.
        Ideally being open to being lifelong partners, and if distance (emotional, physical, etc.) became wanted, still
        remain there for each other.
Spending time together
. In terms of spending time together, I might lean towards spending a bit
        less time together than the median couple. I like spending time with a partner by working on common projects,
        talking about our day, cuddling, messing around, sharing meals, and doing exercise / sports. I
        don‚Äôt like to go out regularly, but maybe it‚Äôs because I just haven‚Äôt found the right activities.
About me
Reviews
. I‚Äôve had
some reviews
which I think
        are relevant here. I also had a very public relationship with
Carissa
, so checking our posts could give you some peak
        into what being with me is like.
Values
. I‚Äôm a very principled person. Honesty is very important for me. In terms of moral
        philosophy, I‚Äôm leaning towards deontological-threshold negative preference-weighted life utilitarianism.
Communication style
.
I lean ask/tell culture. I‚Äôm rather
          good at guess culture
, and like using it sometimes, but it‚Äôs important to me that my partner is able to
        make their needs known explicitly if I fail at reading them, and be okay with me doing the same. I want someone
        that is open to receiving feedback ‚Äî I personally love feedback. I strongly dislike ‚Äúdeny culture‚Äù ‚Äî where
        someone says something that I need to deny, instead of asking me. I‚Äôm leaning more towards
cold culture
.
Fun
. I like adventures and challenges. Not that I do those a lot, but I love them when I do.
        Illustrative examples: I find it exhilarating to sleep naked in a cold forest, and I love doing DIY Impractical
        Jokers (
this one
          about dating profile
üòÖ), exploring abandoned buildings, and doing food fights^^ I
        generally like going
        out of my comfort zone and trying new things. I like roleplaying. I like creating things.
Vibe
. I'm often told I have a calming effect. I can inhabit other vibes, but I often inhabit
        that one.
Habits
. I don‚Äôt drink alcohol. I don‚Äôt smoke. I don‚Äôt take any drugs.
Knowledge
(outside profession). I‚Äôve read a fair amount about topics related to economics,
        moral philosophy, futurism, effective altruism, LessWrong, rationality, and transhumanism.
Conflict resolution
.
Here are some
          strategies I like to use
.
Videos
. Here are recent videos of me:
discussion with Malcolm
,
circling
,
more circling
,
authentic relating games
(biased sample
        based on what
        tends to be streamed).
OkCupid Questions
. I‚Äôve answered many
OkCupid questions
‚Äî most of them are
        very old and a lot aren‚Äôt up-to-date, but you can still check them out.
More
. To know more about me, I invite you to go the traditional route ‚Äì ie. stalking me; wait,
        no, I mean 1 on 1 interactions :P. You can easily stalk me though; I notably have a lot on Facebook and on my
        website (
https://matiroy.com
) ‚Äì feel free to send a friend request. You can
        answer
this survey
to let me know other information you would like me to include on this profile.
Location
I have a medium preference to work towards a US citizenship (ie. I‚Äôm Canadian).
I would prefer to live in Central or North America longterm, but short-term I'm more flexible.
I'm totally okay with meeting remotely. I can also easily travel around, and will be travelling in the US
        starting in April.
Children
Genetic code and surrogate parents
I would like to have children using embryo/gamete selection. Can I pitch you the idea? It'll be a fun conversation if nothing else^_^
I‚Äôm fertile: I‚Äôve done a
semen analysis and
          donated sperm leading to 3 live births
.
I‚Äôm also open to using surrogates ‚Äî I think it could actually be valuable to have 2 (or more) children at a time.
Number
I want at least 2-4 children
, but my desire for the number of children scales almost linearly
        with wealth, so I would like it if having 6+ children was on the table.
Upbringing
I would like to share responsibilities ~equally related to taking care of our children (money, time, etc.).
I would like to have an au pair, nanny, and/or live-in maid, unless we‚Äôre more than 2 parents / adults raising
        our children.
I have a predisposition towards liking giving a lot of autonomy / independence / responsibilities to children.
I think it makes sense to give children the option to homeschool if/when they seem sufficiently
        autonomous and if/when we have the capacity to support that. I can also see traditional schooling, boarding
        schools, and other options being more valuable depending on our situation. I care about providing the tools for
        our children to be successful.
Just like I record all my life,
I would like to record all the life of our children
, at least
        in some ways at least until they can make their own decision (because I think this might be important for
identity
          preservation
, as well as useful for
other reasons
).
I would like to
          sign up our children for
cryonics
.
I would like our children to learn English as a first language.
I might speak to them in French
        so they also know French.
I don‚Äôt mind whether you or our children eat animal products, at least until they can make their own choices
        (I‚Äôm just mentionning that in case you know I have an
bivalvegan diet
and you were wondering).
Finances
You can see my
resume
for information on my career.
I often think in terms of ROI when I spend money. I like saving a lot because of the
power of
          compounding investments
.
Personality I‚Äôm interested in
(Which also corresponds to my personality.)
Main traits I generally like (sort of in order):
Honest
Values living
Truth-seeking; self-reflective
Productive
Emotionally stable; regulate their anger
Mentally healthy, low addiction
Intelligent
Longtermist
Transparent
Caring
Prosocial
Confident

Name: David
ProfileText:
ÔªøDate me?  


* Hello.
* I am David.
* Date me?


If anything you read here resonates with you or makes you think maybe we should go on a date, message me! There‚Äôs a lot of potential upside and very little downside.


If you want to make one of these yourself, here is a template.
	Vital statistics
1. I‚Äôm 30 and male.
2. Mainly gynephilic, with some exceptions.
3. I live in London and am pretty settled here.
4. Poly (what's that?) with one partner (Amber) who I live with (her other boyfriend also lives here).
5. Until recently I worked as a software developer; now I‚Äôm running a conference on effective altruism
6. I‚Äôd like to have children.
What I am like
* Cuddly, warm, affectionate
* I have a very calm disposition, low anxiety, low neuroticism, sometimes even a flat affect if tired.
* Sometimes people can‚Äôt tell if I‚Äôm joking.
* Quite laughy.
* I don‚Äôt think of myself as especially intro- or extroverted. I have been known to start chatting to strangers. I don‚Äôt do well at massive parties where I know nobody (will bail and go home).
* Often distracted by linguistic curios. (There was a period in my late teens/early twenties when I was distracted by the subject for 3 years.)
Things I like
1. Music. I studied the clarinet here for two years before deciding it wasn‚Äôt the life for me. Here is some music I‚Äôve written. I‚Äôm working on a new one at the moment. I‚Äôm very lucky to have access to a piano at home, it increases my quality of life by a lot. I also sing in choirs and like going to small gigs (often folk).
2. I recently started going bouldering and I think it‚Äôs my new favourite thing.
3. Writing silly poems.
4. I‚Äôm quite into effective altruism and thinking about ways to increase the impact I have on the world (mainly by donating money, and by volunteering my time as a software developer).
5. Creative writing. Here is a post I‚Äôm particularly proud of.
6. I really, really like hugs.
7. Improv games.
8. Reading, particularly science fiction.
9. Camping/hiking/the outdoors.
10. Currently neglected hobbies: dancing, playing board games, drawing.
What (I hope) you are like
If multiple of the below describe you, we should definitely at least chat. Each of them is a strong plus. But these are not essential, strict criteria. Far from it. They're clues. The most important thing is that we like each other and get on well.


You, my ideal person, are probably:
* relatively nerdy,
* like making jokes,
* like to be physically affectionate,
* like playing with ideas,
* hold your opinions lightly,
* are motivated to help others
* and seek new experiences,
* are curious,
* and put in an unusual amount of effort to believe true things (‚Äògood epistemics‚Äô). 
* In terms of gender presentation, you probably are relatively mixed or neutral. I‚Äôm most often attracted to women at the masculine end of the spectrum. Trans folk welcome.
* You enjoy creating things in some way, whether in writing, artistically, or something else.
* There needs to be an intellectual spark. For example, you enjoy talking about abstract ideas, gaining insight about the world, speculating, metacognition, building analogies, and delving into your confusion.
Forwardly Asked Questions
Why make a ‚Äòdate me‚Äô page? What even is a ‚Äòdate me‚Äô page? Where is your sense of propriety?
* Dating sites are really bad at selecting for the kind of person I might want to date. But ‚Äòreal life‚Äô is relatively good at this. I hope that by making this page I make it easier for people I meet in real life to know that I‚Äôm open to going on dates, find out about what that might be like, and reach out. This is my way to let people feel empowered to make a move even if it might not work out. I am way too timid about these things myself precisely because I don‚Äôt know if telling a friend I like-like them would damage our friendship. It would be tragic to miss out on a great thing because we were both too timid. So this is me giving you permission, and promising not to let it change our friendship.
* Also, all the cool kids are doing it.
What are you looking for in your romantic life?
* Love. It‚Äôs one of the greatest joys in life and makes the world beautiful.
* While I‚Äôm interested in exploring relationships at any level of casualness, I‚Äôm most actively seeking something long term, ultimately to be one of the foundations of my life. Ideally, we would eventually live together.
* At the same time, I don't want to fuse with another person; we'd have our own lives, pastimes, interests, and friends/partners.
* I‚Äôm not interested in indefinitely-long-distance things.
Where do you see yourself in the future?
* I‚Äôd like to be part of a bustling community of friends who throw parties and regularly cook for each other at each other‚Äôs houses and live near each other or together. Hopefully with some casual music-making involved. Willing to move to make this happen. The model could be setting up a group house, or cooperating to live strategically close to our friends.
* Somewhat related to building a community, I‚Äôd probably like to start a family. A family is just a tiny, very close-knit community. (Aside: why do people always talk about wanting to start families, but never talk about wanting to finish one?)
* Noticing the passage of time and my desire to start a family is what triggered making this post. I‚Äôm also open to the idea of co-parenting with someone without a romantic relationship. We would need to be close friends, of course, to make it a stable partnership. I‚Äôm not convinced there is a huge chasm between romance and platonic relationships, as opposed to a spectrum.
What face do I have?
This one (next page). 






  



I consider this to be a smile - others may say what they wish




Photo credit: Sally Mears
We were amused by the gate standing by itself    
What is it like dating me?
It‚Äôs hard for me to say from the inside, obviously, but some things you can expect are:
* Attentiveness
* Sincerity
* Cuddles <3
* With serious partners, I like to set aside regular time to talk about how the relationship is going, problem-solve any things that are bugging us, and brainstorm ways we can make the relationship even better than it already is. It really enhances relationships in my experience. Recommended!
* Conflict management:
   * I don't appreciate people with a quick temper.
   * I will want to debrief until we get to the bottom of what‚Äôs going on, and make sure we both feel heard.
   * I‚Äôm somewhat conflict-avoidant (I seem to not really have a shouty mode), but these days I think I‚Äôm quite good at verbalizing when I‚Äôm annoyed or angry.
* They noticed my communication skills at work:  
What are your thoughts on sex?
   * For me, while I love it, sex is not an essential part of a relationship (especially when one has the possibility of multiple partners, such that something not provided by partner A can be provided by B).
   * That said, I want to be desired, and might not be happy unless you seem somewhat into me physically.
   * I enjoy the process of discovering what we like, and using words quite a lot to guide each other/ask for things. 
   * I won't say much about frequency as it varies by person, and over time.
   * I'm not kinky, but to the extent that I am, I'm more subby than dommy.
Things that might be dealbreakers for you
   * I‚Äôm quite messy. If you‚Äôre neat, we might need to create Inventive Solutions like not living together, hiring a cleaner, or not dating. I pull my weight around the house where agreements are struck, but have low standards by inclination.
   * I‚Äôm not very physically fit. If you want a toned body, I can‚Äôt provide that. I am trying to live healthily and maintain my current weight (78kg, 5‚Äô7‚Äù) but I am not and will never be thin.
Values
My most important values are:
   * Actively try to make the world a better place. Take the well-being of others very seriously, and be willing to take significant personal action to that end. I‚Äôve taken the Giving What We Can pledge to donate 10% of my income to effective charities.
   * Desire to believe true things and let go of cherished but false beliefs. Try to avoid over- (and under-) confidence, deliberately seek out opposing points of view, be open to strange ideas. (‚ÄòGood epistemics‚Äô.)
   * Integrity: be honest and trustworthy.


I would love it if we could bond over some of these values.


Some other, less important values are atheism and veg(eteri)anism. These are only important to me in a partner insofar as I treat them as signs of general factors already mentioned: of taking unfamiliar ideas and others‚Äô welfare seriously. You might embody those in other ways, in which case that's fine.
Aesthetics
Clothes
I wear them, but I object to dress codes. I like dungarees. I get almost all my t-shirts from boodle at this point.
Music
   * Musicians who I‚Äôve seen live more than once: Louis Cole/Knower, Daisy Chute, Amanda Palmer.
   * None of those are classical, but classical music (especially of the Romantic era) is the foundation of my taste since my teens, with folk and jazz and alt-pop layered on top. That comes out more in what music I play than what music I consume.
   * All my Spotify likes to 13/11/21, sorted alphanumerically for your pleasure
Humour
Some people really get my humour; other people don‚Äôt. The high variance life. But that means when people gel with my sense of humour, they really gel! I‚Äôve had multiple people say to me words to the following effect:  
TODO: Get Holly‚Äôs comment framed and put it in pride of place in my room
So I‚Äôm going to keep on with the current humour style. My humour is silly, sometimes dry/deadpan, and quite wordplay-heavy with a good pinch of syntactic ambiguity thrown in too.
Food
Food is nice; I‚Äôll eat it, but it‚Äôs not one of my main interests. I spend most of my time being a vegan, for animal abuse reasons, making exceptions when it doesn‚Äôt seem worth the expense (e.g. I‚Äôm not paying 25p for a cafe to use oat milk instead of cow‚Äôs milk). You don‚Äôt need to be vegan or vegetarian, as mentioned.
I‚Äôve got to the end of the document. What now?
If you‚Äôve read this far, we probably have a decent chance of hitting it off, so message me! If not, feel free to share it with someone you think might be interested.


If you found this page via OKCupid, it's a good idea to email me as I check that a lot more often.


If you‚Äôre nervous about being direct and we‚Äôre Facebook friends, you can use this site to indicate interest, and if it‚Äôs mutual we‚Äôll both be notified. But ideally you‚Äôll bite the bullet and reach out!


Or if you are less enthusiastic or just want to take a more cautious/experimental approach, maybe just invite me to more things, try to be my friend, and see if we get on in that context!


Could I have written this better? Let me know!
Footnotes
Poly?
   * Poly.
   * This means that, by mutual agreement, any of my partners can date anyone.
   * This doesn‚Äôt mean you are expected to date anyone I happen to date. It‚Äôs just me. I don‚Äôt expect my friends to be friends with each other unless they want to be; this is like that.
   * In practice I have one partner, who I‚Äôve been dating since late 2018.
   * Here is a good poly FAQ.
‚ÄúA shouty mode‚Äù?
Not knowing how to be angry by shouting was the reason I gave as a child for not wanting to become a teacher. That was pretty accurate, I was a terrible teacher, unable to control the class.

Name: Shaked
ProfileText:
Shaked‚Äôs Dating Profile | shakeddown

Shaked‚Äôs Dating Profile
September 16, 2021
shakeddown
3 Comments
General self-description
Moderately nerdy guy (age 30) who writes stories, translates songs, and overshares cat pictures. Currently living in New York City but leaning against settling down here permanently, and likes the idea of living somewhere family-friendly (that isn‚Äôt a suburb).
Details
By nerdy, I mean that I tend to get into phases where I get weirdly excited about things. To take a few random recent examples: Which countries have the best and most cost-effective transit systems[1], and urbanism and city planning
more generally
[2]. Computability theory[3], or
alternate computation models
, like what its implications would look like for a world that had regular time travel. Acrobatics.
The history of clothes making[4]. Making homemade liquor.
Building this took a surprisingly long time
Cats[5]. Elaborate improvised constructs.
Also, glacier climbing
What a world would look like if time travel was possible but constrained by computability limits, except that cats could effectively get around them by having weak preferences, and the whole thing ran on a hybrid Miyazaki/Moomins/FF7 aesthetic. And so on.
By family-oriented, I mean, well ‚Äì I like happy families. And I like kids, and really want kids, and like the kind of family/tribal structures where people of different ages actually interact.
I am slightly trad in some ways, by which I mean something like enjoying some traditions and traditional attitudes but not actually being particularly religious. So I like Friday night family dinners (with the candles and the nice tablecloth[6]), and I like casual gender norms (In that, say, I prefer the sound of ‚Äúmy wife‚Äù to ‚Äúmy spouse‚Äù), but don‚Äôt do regular prayers or really keep kosher (except I don‚Äôt eat pork).
For stories ‚Äì I wrote
this one about first contact
, or
this one about bike lanes
. For song translations, I mostly do Israeli folk songs (like
this one
, or
this one
).
Life/Relationship Goals
Most of all, I want a family. I want a good happy partnership relationship, and I want a bunch of kids. There‚Äôs probably practical constraints on how many kids I could practically have or handle, but in principle, I‚Äôm a fan of the idea of having lots of kids. I think I would be a good dad.
I currently live in New York and work doing vague finance and programming stuff. I like it here for now, but I wouldn‚Äôt want to settle down permanently, or raise kids here. Where I want to end up is a hard question ‚Äì for having kids, I‚Äôd want to be somewhere clean and pedestrian-friendly, where the kids can walk safely by themselves to get around or play outside or whatnot. Sometimes I think about going back to Israel, but there are other places that meet those conditions. (Financially, I do have more than enough to support a family, including if I was married to someone who wanted to be a homemaker or work nonprofit or whatever, or to take a few years off for that matter).
My ideal relationship involves sharing random ideas that get us excited off each other, cooking or going on hikes together, randomly messaging each other cat pictures, developing a pool of shared references and frames that becomes a little like a shared language, spiderman kisses (that is, where one or both of the people doing the kissing are hanging upside-down), and eventually raising a bunch of kids together.
Also, occasional backpacking trips where we wind up cooking improvised pancakes in random abandoned cabins.
You
?
[7]
If the above part sounds appealing, you should try to contact me! You can email me (
shaked.koplewitz@gmail.com
, preferred), find me on facebook, whatever.
See? Very welcoming
I like the idea of social proof ‚Äì if we know people in common, you can talk to me through them, or talk to them about whether they think we‚Äôd work.
Properties common in people I have good relationships with:
Getting delighted by things. Probably the biggest single factor, although it can be hard to describe. If you‚Äôre the sort of person who would build the food pyramid I mentioned above, or give names to random wildlife, or stop to look in random windows because you‚Äôre curious what the people inside live like, or like to think about the logistics of feeding a continent of sentient hamsters, we are likely to get along and you should give me a call.
Compatible life goals. This one is pretty obvious, I guess.
Ability to resolve conflicts. I‚Äôm not always great at immediately noticing when something is bothering someone, but I
do
listen when people talk to me about things. It helps a lot in a relationship, if you‚Äôre someone who can bring up things that bother you, and we can talk it through and solve it.
Having initiative, and dreams, and like to do things.They don‚Äôt have to be shared interests ‚Äì I just like people who have interests they get excited about.
Finally, if you do want to contact me but aren‚Äôt sure how, ideas for conversation starters
What would the world look like if it had time-travelling cats?
If you had the choice to be turned into a group of hamsters, how many hamsters would it take for you to prefer being the group of hamsters to being human?
What‚Äôs something you deeply care about, or something that would make your life or your neighborhood or the world better?
If you could be in any sort of place imaginable right now, where would you be?
Any random thing you‚Äôve been thinking about lately
Just ‚ÄúHi‚Äù is also good!
External references (things I get excited about that I didn‚Äôt make)
[1]
https://transitcosts.com/
[2]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YaJf01RPphU
[3]
https://www.math.ias.edu/avi/book
[4]
https://acoup.blog/2021/03/05/collections-clothing-how-did-they-make-it-part-i-high-fiber/
[5] In order: Harvey and Olivia (top left), Uriel (napping) and Larry and Rosie (my ex step-pets, which is a delightful palindrome).
[6]
https://thezvi.wordpress.com/2017/10/07/bring-back-the-sabbath/
[7] Okay this one was probably a stretch.

Name: Kathy Garcia
ProfileText:
ÔªøHello! My name is Kathy Garcia and I am looking for a primary partner and co-parent. I don't yet have children but very much want to in the near future. 

It is not required (though definitely an option) that this person also biologically father these children. For legal convenience related to co-parenting I do probably want us to be legally married, but I'd want our relationship to be open/polyamorous.

I want this person to be my primary collaborator on the project of being a human in the world, as well as the project of child-rearing. I want to be open about everything with them and have them do the same with me, and help each other to solve our problems, large and small. 


I am open to any gender, race, body type, etc.
About me
Basics  
31 years old, 5'8", 130-150 lb. Ethnic background is 25% Mexican, 75% mixed Western European.

AFAB, genderfluid, they/them, pansexual, polyamorous, demisexual, autistic, ADHD, secular, rationalist, submissive. Happy to talk more about what any of these mean to me.

I am based in Oakland, CA and would like to stay here for at least another year or two but don't feel tied to it in the long term. 

I graduated from Caltech in 2015 with a B.S. in Computation and Neural Systems. After that I bounced around a few healthcare-related startups, then spent 6 years at Benchling building software for biotech, pharma, and academic biology labs, and am now a Platform Software Engineer at METR.

Profiles: OkCupid, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, GitHub
Pros


* Kindness/Compassion. I care very deeply about people, both as a class and as individuals. If we have a long-term relationship I will come to care very deeply about you.
* Loyalty. I will be fiercely dedicated to making our relationship work and to any agreements we make as part of our relationship contract.
* Openness to Experience. One of my friends once said that of everyone he knew, I was the one who would most literally "try anything once". I really love novelty and will probably be down to try anything with you that you'd like to get me into. This includes sex and kink, but also hobbies and other activities.
* General intelligence. Hard evidence for this: I graduated from Caltech and have been successful in my career as a Software Engineer. I have also had my IQ tested a couple of times and scored about 140.
* Practical Skills. I have a variety of these, which seems relatively rare in the communities I find myself in. I can also pick up new ones fairly quickly. I am not an expert in any of them but good enough to do a respectable job. Here are a few of them:
   * Cooking
   * Sewing
   * Soldering
   * Furniture assembly
   * Home maintenance/repair
   * First Aid and basic medicine
* Financial stability. I am an early member of a successful tech startup. I am trying to avoid lifestyle creep, but I generally expect that I and my immediate family will be materially comfortable for a long time. If you also have significant income I will expect you to contribute some to the child-rearing project, but I'm open to partners who are low-income as well. 
* Knowledgeable about child-rearing. I have known my entire life that I wanted to be a parent and have read quite a bit about how to care for babies and children. That being said, I have minimal practical childcare experience.
* Comfortable with scary, gross, or dark things. I can deal with insects, spiders, traumatic injury, bodily fluids, most emergency situations, and death in a calm, clinical, and effective manner. There are also very few topics that are taboo to talk about. It would be great if this was also true of you.
* Good relationship with my parents. This is some evidence of my ability to maintain relationships long-term. (EDIT: My mother has passed away since time of writing. I still have a good relationship with my father and his new wife!)
* Cute and cuddly. I think I'm decently conventionally attractive, but what I really mean here is that I enjoy leaning into cutesiness, especially in tone of voice and turns of phrase. Partners tend to find me adorable, though of course there's huge selection bias there. I also love cuddling.
* Paperwork. I actually like doing paperwork and will be happy to manage yours and any that arises for the children.
* Style. Someone once told me that I have "an irreverent style that is highly marketable." It was the strangest compliment I've ever received but I don't think it's inaccurate. People often seem delighted by my sense of humor and turns of phrase.


Cons
* Chronic pain. I have occipital neuralgia, which causes a really distracting form of pain in my head, neck, and shoulders. I also have some lower back pain. It's rarely debilitating, but there are times I need to stop doing a physical activity before it's done, and there are times I need to just lie in bed for a few hours. I am in the process of getting treatment for this and have some hope that it will not be a problem in the long term, but this is far from guaranteed.
* Mild emotional instability. I will sometimes get very upset and want you to spend time and effort and attention on comforting me. It's not that I take actions I don't endorse or that I turn into "someone else" in these states, just, if you're not comfortable with comforting me when I cry we probably aren't a good match. 
* Executive dysfunction/akrasia. I go through phases where it becomes very difficult for me to get anything done. This responds very well to social pressure though, so if you just tell me "hey go do the thing" I will probably go do it. In fact, if you're willing to do a lot of this for me that would be especially great.
* Mild addictive personality. Every once in a while I find something that really gives me dopamine and get too into it. So far none of these addictions have had major impact on my life and all have resolved on their own after a while, and I am careful to keep it that way. But it's likely I'll continue to have phases where I spend all of my free time and perhaps a bit too much money on one specific activity, and occasionally overindulge on food or alcohol. I actually am pretty okay with this and would not want you to stop me unless it was having a negative impact on you, me or the children.
* Abandonment issues. I am pretty afraid and insecure about the idea that someone will leave me in a time of need. I will likely need regular reassurance that you still like me and are committed to our relationship. If you have an avoidant attachment style or are not comfortable reassuring me, we likely are not a good match.
* Other mental health issues. I have been diagnosed with depression, anxiety, ADHD, and autism. I take Adderall 5 days a week. In particular - until some time in 2014 I considered myself very mentally healthy and happy. Then I went through a rough breakup, graduated college and was thrust into adulthood, Trump got elected, and my internal experience got worse and worse. I am past the peak of this now and am optimistic about future improvement, but it seems likely that I'll have at least some phases of high anxiety and/or depression for the rest of my life. 
* Messiness. I am fairly messy and disorganized. I'm willing to work on this but it seems unlikely it'll ever stop being a problem, since it's been true my whole life and is likely related to my ADHD. If this bothers you a lot we probably aren't a good fit. If you're willing to clean up for me that would be amazing. In the future when I settle down, I will probably just hire someone(s) to clean up after me.
* Lack of physical fitness. I'm not very strong and don't have very much stamina. I can get shit done when necessary but will likely need help lifting very heavy objects and might decline things like long hikes or strenuous sexual positions.  I am willing to work on this and would love it if you motivated me to get regular exercise.
* Bad at scheduling and punctuality. If we set a date there's a high likelihood that I'll be 5-15 minutes late, and a nontrivial likelihood that I'll forget about it entirely. Again this is something I'm willing to work on but also have been trying to improve my whole life and seen only minimal progress. If something is *really* important, I do generally manage to make it, though.
* Body hair. My body hair is thick and dark. I have had laser hair removal on my legs which thinned it out but did not get rid of enough of it for my legs to not look hairy. I don't remove any of it regularly and I don't think I'll start, because I don't have bandwidth for another regular hygiene activity, so if this bothers you we probably aren't a good match.
* Sexual hangups. This one needs to be broken down into a few bullet points:
   * Demisexuality. I'm demisexual, which to me means that I never feel attracted to anyone I don't know, but when I know someone and relate to them well I almost always feel some attraction to them. It will probably be a while before I feel that way about you.
   * Low sex drive. In general even once I do feel attraction I still have a pretty low sex drive most of the time. When I'm not actively in a relationship I can go many months without sex and it does not bother me at all. All of my past long-term relationships have fallen into the following pattern: At the beginning of the relationship, I'm excited about having sex multiple times a day and we do. Once the NRE (new relationship energy) wears off I'm a lot less interested in sex and my partner starts pressuring me about it. The pressure makes me want it even less and we enter a vicious cycle. I am not sure whether the cycle is started by me losing interest or by them beginning to pressure me.
   * Pain during sex. I'm pretty sure my genitals are more sensitive to pain than average. It's easy for someone to accidentally cause pain while trying to cause pleasure. I'm not sure if this has medical cause, I've been examined a few times and been told there's nothing obviously wrong.
   * Anxiety around giving feedback. I've had a lot of experiences where I tried giving feedback (including that someone was hurting me) and had my partner not care, not be able to figure out how to do better, or turn the interaction into me doing emotional labor for them because they felt bad about not being good enough. This has trained my brain that giving feedback will be useless or worse, and so I often just don't, including gritting my teeth through painful sex that I'm not enjoying. I will likely need a lot of encouragement and understanding around this, at least at first.


Neutrals


* Very Direct. Probably most neurotypical people perceive me as too blunt. I don't enjoy having to pepper in niceties in order to get my point across, and will only do it when I have bandwidth to spare. Of course other people find this refreshing.
* Extroverted. I process things through socializing, and go to medium-to-large social events often. I would love it if you accompanied me to these events, and if you don't want to go to them at all ever, we may not be a good match.
* Strong preference for Tell Culture. 80% of the time, you will have a better model of your own thoughts and preferences than I do, and I will have a better model of mine. Therefore I don't want to spend a lot of effort on guessing what you want or what's going through your head. That being said, there is the other 20% of the time, and it certainly is very nice when people are able to make correct guesses. I'm definitely interested in forming good models of my partners and sometimes surprising them with things they didn't know they wanted. But I don't want that to be the primary dynamic of the relationship.
* Pets. I like cats a lot and am okay with small dogs. Large dogs scare me a bit and I would not want to live with one. I'm probably neutral-to-positive on most other pets.
* Hobbies. Here are some of mine, it would be cool if you share some of them and we can do them together.
   * Board games
   * Puzzle hunts
   * Crossword puzzles
   * Makeup and Skincare
   * Alternative Fashion
   * Alternative Music (especially pop punk and power metal)
   * Cosplay
   * Star Trek (DS9 > TNG > VOY > SNW > PIC > PRO > DIS > ENT. Have not seen much of TOS, TAS, or Lower Decks. The Kelvin Timeline movies are terrible.)
   * Travel
   * Burner culture (as in Burning Man)
   * Counterculture in general
* Very Online. I spend almost all of my time on the Internet and am never without my phone. I'm deep into meme culture, especially on TikTok. 
* Army Brat. My father was in the Army when I was growing up and we moved every few years. I have moved a total of 14 times in my life, not counting moving between rooms in college. I have lived all over the country as well as in Germany for 5 years. I speak German - I was once fluent but am now a little rusty.
* Gender. Around 80% of the time I am not thinking about gender and trying to apply it to myself feels jarring, so I don't think I have one. Around 15% of the time, especially during penetrative sex, I feel quite feminine. The remaining 5% of the time I feel fairly masculine. I don't expect to be treated differently in these modes, but I do want to be referred to with they/them pronouns. That being said, I am happy with my AFAB body and don't plan to use hormones or gender affirming surgery to alter it.
* Submissive and Kinky. I respond very well to someone else taking the lead or giving instructions in bed and I enjoy many forms of sensation play, bondage, impact play, and pain play. I don't consider myself a masochist as I don't get pleasure from pain in and of itself, but as a sign of submission or exploration of my limits it can be very fun. I am up for kinky play much more often than I am up for genital-focused sex.
Child-rearing plans


I want to have at least one biological child (maybe two, but I want to wait and see how I feel about having a second after I have one. I am also open to the idea of adopting the second one.) I want to carry and birth this child myself, ideally via vaginal birth. I see this as one of the big fundamental human experiences and would like to have it.


If you want to biologically father the child, you of course need to produce viable sperm, but I will also want both of us to submit to genetic counseling. You need to not carry the genes for any serious genetic disorders nor have family history of any serious heritable conditions. I am not sure yet if I'd also want to do embryo selection, and this may depend on our genetic compatibility.


If you don't want to biologically father the child, I will likely get sperm from a sperm bank, and you can have some input on what qualities we are looking for in a donor. I'm also open to conceiving a child via sex with a friend or other partner who is interested in being the biological father, but I don't have any candidates right now.

My actual ideal situation for child-rearing would be living with a group of like-minded people who are all communally raising children, and who may be in a connected polycule. But finding such an arrangement and keeping it stable is difficult, so I am open to other arrangements (including something fairly close to the "nuclear family", although I would still hope to keep more outside connections and partners than is typical in that situation).

It is important to me that the two of us share the parenting labor fairly equitably, and that you involve yourself in the child's life. I am not sure what I want to do about childcare if we both work - I may take a sabbatical, or we may hire a nanny. 


In parenting, my top priority will be the child's current and future subjective well-being, as opposed to their intelligence, earning potential, impact, or any other specific outcome. Of course there will be times when I guide them toward those things as well, but it will never take priority over trying to raise a happy, healthy individual. It is important to me that you do the same. 


People keep telling me that I should include something about my schooling preferences here, but I am open to a variety of options, as long as they seem like they will serve the children well. I probably lean toward private schooling or homeschooling, and would be against religious schooling.


I don't want to gender the children until they tell us what gender they identify as, and it is important to me that you are willing to do this as well.


Dealbreakers


In addition to those implied above, here are a few more things that would be dealbreakers for me:


* You don't have solid conflict resolution skills, and arguments will continually end poorly.
* Your politics are right-wing in the sense of privileging markets or other existing social orders over human flourishing, autonomy, and well-being.
* Your opinions, political and otherwise, do not change based on evidence.
* You do not treat me as an equal.
* You are not ready, willing, and able to spend a significant amount of time, effort, and attention on our relationship and on child-rearing.
* You lie often.
* There are many common tasks and situations that you can't handle without help.






If you got through all of this and think you might be interested in a connection, please contact me at yandereko@gmail.com. I look forward to talking to you!

Name: Rachel Clifton
ProfileText:
ÔªøThis document is a social experiment. 
It‚Äôs also *an* experiment, period. 
I want to see what happens when I explicitly ask for what I want. 
I look forward to finding out. 
________________




Context: I‚Äôm creating a world where no one has to be ashamed of their desire for love. 

So, ya know, I figured I‚Äôd eat my own dog food. ;) Also, I see Date Me docs getting a lot of flack on Twitter & I‚Äôm curious about playing with the concept in a new way. 


TABLE OF CONTENTS

‚Üí Key ideological principles
‚Üí What‚Äôs most important to me
‚Üí About me
‚Üí Other puzzle pieces 
‚Üí How to connect with me 
________________




Key ideological principles.

My number one aim in relational contexts is to be able to love in a way that makes the OP feel free. 

This isn‚Äôt just about the kinds of relationships I want to have with intimate partners. This is the attitude with which I endeavour to consciously (co-)create ALL my relationships in EVERY context. 

Substance is less important than essence; that is, there are many ways to love & be loved. 

I am truly, deeply open-minded. I live open-heartedly & I love deeply. It‚Äôs who I am & want to be! 

I choose to live & love in this way because I have a lot of love to give & I love sharing it with people. 

I love love. I am in love with Love. I am in love with life itself. 


That will always come above any person.

Feel me. 


‚Üí If you don't read anything else, read this 
‚Üí On a man I dated (& loved instantly!) 
‚Üí The poetry of my soul 
‚Üí How I came to be who I am [becoming] 


________________




The common denominator. 

What every man I‚Äôve ever felt deep, instantaneous (magnetic) attraction to has in common: 

They felt safe to me. 


‚ÄúA safe man and a non-threatening man are two different men.‚Äù - Dany Rae Arras


Some fundamentals: I date men. I want to date men. I‚Äôm not interested in talking about potential outcomes (or any kind of vision for our long-term future together) without us getting to know each other over a period of time AND meeting & getting to know one another IRL. 

________________





Other puzzle pieces. 

The men I find irresistible have these things in common: 

‚Üí 6ft++ (please don‚Äôt lie about your height; it‚Äôs in no one‚Äôs interests long term‚Ä¶ seriously) 
‚Üí age 25-40 (age is not necessarily a deal-breaker, but I prefer to date within this bracket)
‚Üí very attractive (eyes, jawline, physical presence & form)
‚Üí voice that‚Äôs soothing yet erotic to listen to 
‚Üí smell good
‚Üí good oral hygiene

Name: Brian Tomasik
ProfileText:
My dating profile
Home
‚Ä¢
Writings
My dating profile
By Brian Tomasik
First published:
2020 Sep 20
. Last nontrivial update:
2023 Aug 24
.
Update
As of fall 2023, after having this profile up for nearly three years, I think I probably don't want a relationship after all, though maybe this will change again some day. :)
The main issue is that relationships take up a fair amount of time, often more than you expect they will. I already feel stressed by the number of tasks I have to do and the finite energy I have for completing them. A relationship adds more items to my todo list, and even though most of the time spent on a relationship is fun, it's an additional firehose of responsibility that I can't just turn off when I'm too busy. Solo hobbies are better in this regard because I can do as much or as little of them as I choose at any given time.
I never want to have children or pets because I don't want the responsibility of being the primary caretaker for another creature. Likewise, I plausibly don't want the responsibility of being the primary caretaker for another adult human. I like helping people from time to time, but being the main source of companionship and emotional support for another person can begin to feel burdensome‚Äîunless that other person is extremely introverted and self-sufficient.
I'm keeping this page up as an archive. Feel welcome to still write to me if you want to, such as because you think you might be an excellent match or because you think a long-term relationship could require minimal time in most future scenarios. (I'm not really interested in short-term relationships.)
Below is the original dating profile.
‚ùÑ
‚ùÑ
‚ùÑ
This is a dating profile for myself. It's written partly out of academic interest, as an autobiographical portrait of my current life, and partly with the goal of possibly finding a life partner. I have so many preferences about my lifestyle that the number of people for whom I would be a suitable romantic partner is extremely small. Nonetheless, if you happen to find what I wrote appealing, feel free to
contact me
about this topic. (If you're shy about revealing your identity, you could write to me using a pseudonymous email account.)
Summary
Text fields on dating websites for describing oneself and one's relationship preferences are almost always too short. This page allows me to expand on what I'm looking for if I pursue a romantic relationship.
I'm open to either an in-person or indefinite long-distance relationship. In theory I would prefer an in-person relationship, but I'm very picky about my lifestyle, so in practice an indefinite long-distance relationship may be more feasible.
Whether the relationship is in-person or long-distance, here are some criteria to help quickly figure out if we might be compatible. I would look for
a woman (cisgender) (straight or bisexual or other orientations are fine)
located anywhere in the world
within roughly ~10 years of my own age (as of 2022, I'm 35 years old)
(ideally, though not a hard requirement) either vegan or the only animal products consumed on a regular basis are dairy and beef
interested in animal welfare, reducing suffering, s-risks, effective altruism, philosophy, science/technology, and/or related topics
a long-term relationship, ideally one that might last forever (although given that divorce rates are high, there's a good chance it wouldn't last forever)
low time commitment (spending only 2-4 hours per week together in the long run on average; it would be higher during some weeks and lower in other weeks). (In the case of an in-person relationship, we might be physically in the same room for slightly more than 2-4 hours per week due to needing to coordinate practical things, put away groceries, or do other tasks together around the house. That said, I prefer to do most household chores by myself to avoid being distracted.)
In the case of an in-person relationship, these are some additional things I would look for:
no kids ever (unless they don't live with us)
(ideally, though not a hard requirement) no pets
no smoking or illegal drugs
being mindful not to accidentally crush bugs around the house, and euthanizing any bugs that we do kill
not doing outdoor activities together
not traveling together
rarely going to events/parties together
minimal noise and minimal interruptions
I prefer to stay at my current house, so an in-person relationship would involve the other person being willing to eventually move to a rural part of New York State. (It would be fine if it took 5-10 years or more before we could live together.)
In an indefinite long-distance relationship, it's fine if you already have kids and don't want more (or at least don't want more kids fathered by me). I just wouldn't want the noise and complexity of having kids in my own house.
I'm open to either monogamy or polyamory depending on the circumstances. I would probably prefer monogamy in an ideal world, but in practice, polyamory might be more realistic given that I don't want to spend a lot of time on a relationship.
Because I'm introverted and have so many uncommon lifestyle preferences, I don't mind if I remain single forever. Sometimes I think I might even prefer staying single.
To see my answers on other compatibility questions, visit
my OkCupid profile
.
Contents
Update
Summary
Why a detailed dating profile?
Long-distance vs in-person relationships

My lifestyle
Values

Appearance

Being sugar-hungry and sugar-full
